Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí kā Lí ê tō-lō͘ tsí-sī guá; guá beh tsiàu Lí ê tsin-lí lâi kiâⁿ; hō͘ guá īng tsuan-it ê sim kìng-uì Lí ê miâ.
English: Teach me your way, Yahweh. I will walk in your truth. Make my heart undivided to fear your name.

Tailo: Lín tiong-kan siáⁿ lâng khíng àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ tse? Siáⁿ lâng khíng tsù-ì thiaⁿ, āu-lâi koh tsun-thàn i?
English: Who is there among you who will give ear to this? who will listen and hear for the time to come?

Tailo: Lí ê tsiàⁿ tshiú nā ín-khí lí huān tsuē, tio̍h kā i tsām hiat-ka̍k. Lîng-khó sit-khì ki-thé ê tsi̍t-pō͘-hūn, pí kui sing-khu hó-hó hiat lo̍h tē-ga̍k khah hó.
English: If your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off, and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

Tailo: Hit nn̄g-ê sîn-jiah in nā lóng m̄-sìn, mā m̄-thiaⁿ lí ê uē, lí tio̍h tuì hô-.ni̍h iúⁿ tsuí, tò tī ta tē, lí tuì hô-.ni̍h só͘ iúⁿ ê tsuí ē tī ta tē piàn-tsò hueh.
English: It will happen, if they will not believe even these two signs, neither listen to your voice, that you shall take of the water of the river, and pour it on the dry land. The water which you take out of the river will become blood on the dry land.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Iâ-kop, I-su-la-el, in-uī lí sī Guá ê lô͘-po̍k, tio̍h ē kì-tit tsiah-ê tāi-tsì; I-su-la-el, lí sī Guá ê lô͘-po̍k, Guá tsō-tsiū lí, it-tīng bô bē kì-tit lí.
English: Remember these things, Jacob, and Israel; for you are my servant: I have formed you; you are my servant: Israel, you shall not be forgotten by me.

Tailo: Iâ-kop kóng, Lí tio̍h tuì guá tsiù-tsuā. Iô-sé-huh tsiū tuì i tsiù-tsuā. Tsiū án-ne, I-su-la-el tī tshn̂g thâu kìng-pài Siōng-tè.
English: He said, Swear to me, and he swore to him. Israel bowed himself on the bed's head.

Tailo: Tē-tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài tsi̍t ē pûn kó͘-tshue, thinn-tíng ū ki̍k tuā ê siann teh kóng, Sè-kan ê kok tsiâⁿ-tsò lán ê Siōng-tè kah I ê Ki-tok ê kok-tō͘. I beh tsò ông kàu bān-sè-tāi bô tsīn.
English: The seventh angel sounded, and great voices in heaven followed, saying, The kingdom of the world has become the Kingdom of our Lord, and of his Christ. He will reign forever and ever!

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su, tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ, suah gāng-.khì, suî-sî tsáu-uá-lâi kā I tshíng-an.
English: Immediately all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him greeted him.

Tailo: tsè-si tsiū tio̍h īng lí só͘ kó͘ ê kè-tsînn kā i tshui-sǹg kàu hí-nî, hit ji̍t i tio̍h the̍h-tshut lí só͘ kó͘ ê kè-tsînn lâi tsò sìng, kui hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: then the priest shall reckon to him the worth of your valuation up to the Year of Jubilee; and he shall give your valuation on that day, as a holy thing to Yahweh.

Tailo: Huē-tsiòng khuàⁿ-tio̍h A-lông í-king sí, tsiū uī A-lông thî-khàu saⁿ-tsa̍p kang; I-su-la-el tsuân ke mā lóng án-ne.
English: When all the congregation saw that Aaron was dead, they wept for Aaron thirty days, even all the house of Israel.

Tailo: In-uī guá bat kóng, Lí ê tsû-ài ē siū kiàn-li̍p kàu íng-uán; Lí ê sìn-si̍t ē kian-kò͘ tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: I indeed declare, Love stands firm forever. You established the heavens. Your faithfulness is in them.

Tailo: I só͘ king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê kun-tuī, tsóng-kiōng ū gō͘-bān sì-tshing sì-pah miâ.
English: His division, and those who were numbered of it, were fifty-four thousand four hundred.

Tailo: Tseh-kî suah liáu-āu, in beh tńg-.khì ê sî, gín-á I-é-su iáu lâu tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm; I ê pē-bú m̄-tsai.
English: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. Joseph and his mother didn't know it,

Tailo: I kā i kóng, In-uī guá tuì E-tsu-le-el lâng Na-bot kóng, ' Lí kā lí ê phû-tô hn̂g hō͘ guá, guá īng gîn hō͘ lí, á-.sī lí nā ài, guá tsiū īng phû-tô hn̂g uāⁿ hō͘ lí. ' I kóng, ' Guá ê phû-tô hn̂g, guá m̄ hō͘ lí. '
English: He said to her, Because I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite, and said to him, Give me your vineyard for money; or else, if it please you, I will give you another vineyard for it: and he answered, I will not give you my vineyard.

Tailo: Guán só͘ khua-kháu ê to̍h-sī, guán ê liông-sim tsìng-bîng guán tī sè-kan teh sing-ua̍h lóng sī tsiàu Siōng-tè ê sìng-kiat kah sîng-si̍t; m̄-sī uá-khò lâng ê tì-huī, sī uá-khò Siōng-tè ê un-tián; guán tuì-thāi lín koh khah sī án-ne.
English: For our boasting is this: the testimony of our conscience, that in holiness and sincerity of God, not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God we behaved ourselves in the world, and more abundantly toward you.

Tailo: Lín kám m̄-tsai lán lóng ū niá siū sé-lé lâi kah Ki-tok I-é-su kiat-ha̍p, to̍h-sī niá siū sé-lé lâi kah I tsò-hué sí?
English: Or don't you know that all we who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?

Tailo: Guá uī-tio̍h guá ê Siōng-tè ê tiān, í-king tsīn khuì-la̍t, tsún-pī kim tsò kim-khì, tsún-pī gîn tsò gîn-khì, tâng tsò tâng-khì, thih tsò thih-khì, tshâ tsò tshâ-khì, koh ū âng bé-ló kah thang siuⁿ ê pó-tsio̍h, kng-tsio̍h, tshái-sik ê tsio̍h, í-ki̍p ta̍k tsióng ê pó-tsio̍h kah tāi-lí-tsio̍h ki̍k tsē.
English: Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for the things of gold, and the silver for the things of silver, and the brass for the things of brass, the iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, stones for inlaid work, and of various colors, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.

Tailo: Nn̄g-ê ki-lō͘-ping kuân-kuân thí-khui si̍t, īng in ê si̍t tsa̍h si-un-só͘, in ê bīn sio-tuì; ki-lō͘-ping ê bīn àⁿ si-un-só͘.
English: The cherubim spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy seat with their wings, with their faces toward one another. The faces of the cherubim were toward the mercy seat.

Tailo: Guá tshin-ài ê Lū-ka i-sing kah Tê-má beh kā lín tshíng-an.
English: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas greet you.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú khuàⁿ-kò͘ uân-tsuân ê lâng ê ji̍t-tsí; in ê sán-gia̍p ē íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: Yahweh knows the days of the perfect. Their inheritance shall be forever.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Thiⁿ-pē ài guá tsò ê tsin tsē hó sū, guá lóng ū tsò hō͘ lín khuànn. Lín sī uī-tio̍h tó tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì, beh īng tsio̍h-thâu kā guá tìm?
English: Jesus answered them, I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of those works do you stone me?

Tailo: Tsiū-sī tī guá huān-lān ê sî, guá ê tshuì-tûn só͘ kóng ê, guá ê tshuì só͘ hē ê guān.
English: which my lips promised, And my mouth spoke, when I was in distress.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tshú iûⁿ-káng-á tsi̍t tsiah, hiàn tsò pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè kah iû tsi̍t lô-kik, lóng iô tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng tsò iô-tsè.
English: The priest shall take one of the male lambs, and offer him for a trespass offering, with the log of oil, and wave them for a wave offering before Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí tsò lâng kong-gī, kám ē hō͘ Tsuân-lîng-.ê huann-hí? Lí só͘ kiâⁿ uân-siān, kám ē hō͘ I tit-tio̍h lī-ik?
English: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that you are righteous? Or does it benefit him, that you make your ways perfect?

Tailo: Guān îng-iāu kui tī lán ê Siōng-tè, lán ê Thiⁿ-pē, tāi-tāi bô tsīn. A-men!
English: Now to our God and Father be the glory forever and ever! Amen.

Tailo: In-uī lín tsò sìng-kiat ê jîn-bîn, kui tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè. Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè tuì tē-tsiūⁿ bān-bîn tiong kíng-suán lí, ti̍k-pia̍t tsò I ka-kī ê tsú-bîn.
English: For you are a holy people to Yahweh your God: Yahweh your God has chosen you to be a people for his own possession, above all peoples who are on the face of the earth.

Tailo: I tsiū tuā-siaⁿ kóng, Tsìng hū-jîn-lâng ê tiong-kan lí tit-tio̍h hok-khì, lí só͘ huâi-īn ê thai-jî mā tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: She called out with a loud voice, and said, Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú beh kàng tuā tsai-hō lâi phah lí ê jîn-bîn kah lí ê kiáⁿ-jî, lí ê bó͘, í-ki̍p lí it-tshè só͘-ū ê.
English: behold, Yahweh will strike with a great plague your people, and your children, and your wives, and all your substance;

Tailo: Án-ne kóng-khí-.lâi, in-uī tsit-má ê îng-kng pí í-tsîng ê koh khah tuā, tì-sú kuè-khì hiah-ni̍h tuā ê îng-kng suah siau-sit-.khì.
English: For most assuredly that which has been made glorious has not been made glorious in this respect, by reason of the glory that surpasses.

Tailo: ài in uī-tio̍h tsit-ê pì-bi̍t ê tāi-tsì, khì kî-kiû thinn-tíng ê Siōng-tè liân-bín, bián-tit Ta-ni-el kah i ê tâng-phuāⁿ, í-ki̍p Ba-bú-lông kî-tha tì-huī ê lâng tsò-hué bia̍t-bông.
English: that they would desire mercies of the God of heaven concerning this secret; that Daniel and his companions should not perish with the rest of the wise men of Babylon.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k A-sa-hel ê kiáⁿ Io-ná-than, Tik-bah ê kiáⁿ Ia-ha-tse-iah huán-tuì tsit-ê tāi-tsì, koh ū Me-siu-lám kah Lē-bī lâng Sia-be-thài tsàn-sîng in.
English: Only Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahzeiah the son of Tikvah stood up against this matter: and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí í-king khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, kiû Lí m̄-thang tiām-tiām! Tsú ah, kiû Lí m̄-thang lī-khui guá!
English: You have seen it, Yahweh. Don't keep silent. Lord, don't be far from me.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ kah lim-tsia̍h bô kuan-hē, sī kah Sìng Sîn só͘ siúⁿ-sù ê kong-gī, hô-pîng í-ki̍p hí-lo̍k ū kuan-hē.
English: for the Kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.

Tailo: Tsóng-tok kā in kóng, M̄-thang tsia̍h tsì-sìng ê mi̍h, thìng-hāu ū o͘-lîng kah thô͘-bîng ê tsè-si khí-.lâi.
English: The governor said to them, that they should not eat of the most holy things, until there stood up a priest with Urim and Thummim.

Tailo: Lâng ē-tàng jím-siū jio̍k-thé ê pēⁿ-thiànn; sim-sîn siū-siong, siáⁿ lâng jím-siū ē-tiâu?
English: A man's spirit will sustain him in sickness, But a crushed spirit, who can bear?

Tailo: Ba-siah kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, bâi-tsòng tī Til-tsah. I ê kiáⁿ E-la̍h suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Baasha slept with his fathers, and was buried in Tirzah; and Elah his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Hái tiong ê tsuí ē tuān-tsua̍t, hô tsuí ē siau-sit ta-.khì.
English: As the waters fail from the sea, And the river wastes and dries up,

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, A-bu-la-hàm gia̍h thâu khuànn hn̄g-hn̄g hit-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place far off.

Tailo: Guá pān I-su-la-el ê tsuē-kò ê ji̍t-tsí, mā beh pān Be-thel ê tsè-tuâⁿ; tuâⁿ-kak ē siū tshò-tn̄g, tuī-lo̍h tē.
English: For in the day that I visit the transgressions of Israel on him, I will also visit the altars of Bethel; And the horns of the altar will be cut off, And fall to the ground.

Tailo: Í-guā iáu ū sing-lí lâng kah kheh-siong só͘ tuà-.lâi ê, koh ū A-la-puh lia̍t ông kah kok lāi ê siú-líng, lóng tuà kim, gîn lâi hō͘ Só͘-lô-móng.
English: besides that which the traders and merchants brought: and all the kings of Arabia and the governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì guá kóng, ' Lí khí-.lâi, kuáⁿ-kín tuì tsia lo̍h-.khì, in-uī lí ê jîn-bîn, lí tuì Ai-gi̍p tshuā tshut-.lâi ê, í-king pāi-huāi ka-kī, in khuài-khuài phian-uai guá só͘ bīng-līng ê lō͘, in-uī in uī ka-kī tsù tsi̍t sian ngó͘-siōng. '
English: Yahweh said to me, Arise, get you down quickly from hence; for your people whom you have brought forth out of Egypt have corrupted themselves; they have quickly turned aside out of the way which I commanded them; they have made them a molten image.

Tailo: Hit-ê bong-tio̍h ē-sin lâu-lâng ê lâng ê sing-khu ê, tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ, ka-kī tī tsuí-.ni̍h sé, bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: He who touches the body of him who has the discharge shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá ê uē kám m̄-sī tshin-tshiūnn hué, koh tshin-tshiūnn ē phah-phuà tsio̍h-puâⁿ ê tuā thuî?
English: Isn't my word like fire? says Yahweh; and like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê sù-tsiá lâi kā i kóng, In tuà ông hiah-ê kiáⁿ ê thâu-khak lâi. E-hú kóng, Kā in thia̍p tsò nn̄g tui, hē tī siâⁿ-mn̂g-kháu, ti̍t-kàu bîn-á tsá-khí.
English: There came a messenger, and told him, saying, They have brought the heads of the king's sons. He said, Lay you them in two heaps at the entrance of the gate until the morning.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá tī àu-náu, siū-khì, tuā thòng-hūn ê tiong-kan, īng tshun-tshut ê tshiú kah tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú-kut, tshin-sin kā lín kong-kik;
English: I myself will fight against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tshù lāi hiah-ê lāu lâng khí-.lâi, lâi-kàu i ê sin piⁿ, beh hû i tuì thô͘-kha khí-.lâi, tsóng-.sī, i m̄-khíng, mā bô beh kah in tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: The elders of his house arose, and stood beside him, to raise him up from the earth: but he would not, neither did he eat bread with them.

Tailo: Guá tsiū ē tsin kín kā in ê siû-ti̍k tsè-ap; ua̍t-tńg guá ê tshiú lâi kong-kik in ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: I would soon subdue their enemies, And turn my hand against their adversaries.

Tailo: I bē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h kang-hô, lâu bi̍t kah ling ê khe.
English: He shall not look at the rivers, The flowing streams of honey and butter.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì A-lông kóng, Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tuì lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h, lí tsiah hō͘ in hām-lo̍h tāng tsuē!
English: Moses said to Aaron, What did these people do to you, that you have brought a great sin on them?

Tailo: Koh niû i ê pâng, i ê thiāu, i ê mn̂g-lông, lāi-bīn sì-kho͘-uî lóng ū thang, i ê tn̂g gō͘-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p gō͘ tiú.
English: the lodges of it, the posts of it, and the arches of it: and there were windows therein round about; the length was fifty cubits, and the breadth twenty-five cubits.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí íng-uán pha-hng, lí tsiah-ê siâⁿ it-tīng bô lâng tuà, lín tsiū it-tīng ē tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: I will make you a perpetual desolation, and your cities shall not be inhabited; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín khiā-teh kî-tó ê sî, nā siūⁿ-tio̍h ū lâng tik-tsuē lí siáⁿ-mi̍h, tio̍h kā i sià-bián, lín ê Thiⁿ-pē mā ē sià-bián lín ê kuè-sit.
English: Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone; so that your Father, who is in heaven, may also forgive you your transgressions.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí tio̍h kā Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t kóng, bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Guá tuì iûⁿ-tiâu tiong, lí teh tshī ê iûⁿ-kûn tiong, kíng lí lâi tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng ê kun-ông.
English: Now therefore thus shall you tell my servant David, Thus says Yahweh of Armies, I took you from the sheep pen, from following the sheep, that you should be prince over my people, over Israel;

Tailo: I īng hué-hu tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h, i ê sim hun-bê, hō͘ i phian-siâ, i bē-tàng ka-kī kiù, mā bē-tàng kóng, Guá ê tsiàⁿ tshiú lāi kám m̄-sī ū pe̍h-tsha̍t?
English: He feeds on ashes; a deceived heart has turned him aside; and he can't deliver his soul, nor say, Is there not a lie in my right hand?

Tailo: Tī I-é-su ê thâu-khak tíng-bīn ū tsuē-tsōng ê pâi-á siá kóng, Tsit-ê sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông.
English: An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

Tailo: Kàu Siōng-tè teh beh tshe I ê sìng Kiáⁿ ji̍p sè-kan ê sî, kóng, Siōng-tè só͘-ū ê thiⁿ-sài lóng tio̍h kìng-pài I. ( tsù, SPh 97:7 LXX )
English: Again, when he brings in the firstborn into the world he says, Let all the angels of God worship him.

Tailo: Thǹg khì i kaⁿ lāi só͘ tshīng ê saⁿ, tsi̍t-sì-lâng kah Ba-bú-lông ông tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: and changed his prison garments. Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life:

Tailo: I ê kin khînn tī tsio̍h-tui, thàu kàu tsio̍h-thâu ê só͘-tsāi.
English: His roots are wrapped around the rock pile, He sees the place of stones.

Tailo: Lín í-tsîng tī tsiah-ê io̍k-bōng tiong teh sing-ua̍h ê sî, kiâⁿ-ta̍h mā siū tsiah-ê io̍k-bōng tsi-phuè.
English: You also once walked in those, when you lived in them;

Tailo: In tī i ê bīn-tsîng huí-huāi hiah-ê Ba-al ê tuâⁿ, i tshò-tn̄g tuâⁿ tíng kuân-kuân ê ji̍t-thâu siōng, koh phah-tshuì hiah-ê A-si-lah kah tiau-khik ê siōng, í-ki̍p tsù ê ngó͘-siōng, kā i tuî tsò hún, iā tī bat tsè-sū i ê lâng ê bōng,
English: They broke down the altars of the Baals in his presence; and the incense altars that were on high above them he hewed down; and the Asherim, and the engraved images, and the molten images, he broke in pieces, and made dust of them, and strewed it on the graves of those who had sacrificed to them.

Tailo: Tī kuí-nā ji̍t tiong-kan, koh-ua̍h ê I-é-su hián-hiān hō͘ hiah-ê bat tuì Ga-lí-la-iah síng kah I tsò-hué tsiūⁿ Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê lâng khuànn-kìnn. Taⁿ tsiah-ê lâng ū tuì bîn-tsiòng tsò I-é-su ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn.
English: and he was seen for many days by those who came up with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are his witnesses to the people.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ū khé-sī hiah-ê sian-ti, hō͘ in tsai in ê ho̍k-sāi m̄-sī uī-tio̍h ka-kī, sī uī-tio̍h lín. Tsiah-ê sìn-sit tsit-má í-king uá-khò tuì thiⁿ tshe lâi ê Sìng Sîn, thong-kuè hok-im ê sù-tsiá thuân hō͘ lín; tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liân thiⁿ-sài mā pik-tshiat teh thìng-hāu ài beh tsai.
English: To them it was revealed, that not to themselves, but to you, did they minister these things, which now have been announced to you through those who preached the Good News to you by the Holy Spirit sent out from heaven; which things angels desire to look into.

Tailo: In-uī lín ta̍k lâng lóng kuáⁿ-kín teh tsia̍h ka-kī tuà-.lâi ê mi̍h, kiat-kó ū lâng pak-tó͘ iau, ū lâng tsiú-tsuì.
English: For in your eating each one takes his own supper first. One is hungry, and another is drunken.

Tailo: Sa-mu-el kóng, Tsá-tsîng lí suî-jiân ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò bî-sè, kám m̄-sī siū siat-li̍p tsò I-su-la-el tsi-tso̍k ê thâu? Siōng-tsú īng iû kā lí buah, hō͘ lí tsò ông lâi tī-lí I-su-la-el.
English: Samuel said, Though you were little in your own sight, weren't you made the head of the tribes of Israel? Yahweh anointed you king over Israel;

Tailo: Guá ai-kiò kiû pang-tsān ê sî, I hō͘ guá ê kî-tó bē-tàng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Yes, when I cry, and call for help, he shuts out my prayer.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Iô-há-neh khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tsiū kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Siōng-tè ê iûⁿ-ko, I beh lâi siau-tû sè-kan ê tsuē.
English: The next day, he saw Jesus coming to him, and said, Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

Tailo: I án-ne kóng, Tē-sì tsiah siù ē tsò tē-tsiūⁿ ê tē-sì kok, i kah só͘-ū ê kok bô kāng, koh ē thun-kā tsuân tē, ē thún-ta̍h, kā i thiah-tshuì.
English: Thus he said, The fourth animal shall be a fourth kingdom on earth, which shall be diverse from all the kingdoms, and shall devour the whole earth, and shall tread it down, and break it in pieces.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì I-su-la-el lâng siu tsit-ê sio̍k-huê ê gîn-á lâi tsò huē-bō͘ ê lō͘-īng, thang tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng uī I-su-la-el lâng tsò kì-liām, lâi sio̍k-huê lín ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: You shall take the atonement money from the children of Israel, and shall appoint it for the service of the tent of meeting; that it may be a memorial for the children of Israel before Yahweh, to make atonement for your souls.

Tailo: Hit sî, tshiū-nâ lāi ê tshiū-ba̍k ē tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng tshut huann-hí ê siann, in-uī I lâi beh sím-phuàⁿ tsuân tē.
English: Then shall the trees of the wood sing for joy before Yahweh; For he comes to judge the earth.

Tailo: Tsí-ū I-é-su m̄-bián kā tsè-si ê tsit kau hō͘ pa̍t lâng, in-uī I íng-uán ua̍h-.leh.
English: But he, because he lives forever, has his priesthood unchangeable.

Tailo: Guá — Siōng-tsú beh tsò in ê Siōng-tè, Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ē tī in ê tiong-kan tsò siú-líng. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: I, Yahweh, will be their God, and my servant David prince among them; I, Yahweh, have spoken it.

Tailo: Nep-kat-ne-tsal só͘ lia̍h ê jîn-sò͘, kì tī ē-té: Tī tē-tshit nî lia̍h Iô-tah lâng saⁿ-tshing khòng jī-tsa̍p saⁿ lâng.
English: This is the people whom Nebuchadnezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year three thousand twenty-three Jews;

Tailo: Só͘-í, tuà tī kî-tiong ê jîn-bîn khuì-la̍t tsin tsió, kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ kiàn-siàu. In tshin-tshiūnn khòng-iá ê tsháu, tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tshài, tshin-tshiūnn tshù tíng ê tsháu, tshin-tshiūnn tshân-.ni̍h bē tuā tsâng ê tiū-á.
English: Therefore their inhabitants had little power. They were dismayed and confounded. They were like the grass of the field, and like the green herb, like the grass on the housetops, and like a field before its crop has grown.

Tailo: Guá lo̍h-khì hu̍t-thô hn̂g, beh khuànn suaⁿ-kok tiong tsheⁿ-tshuì ê si̍t-bu̍t, beh khuànn phû-tô huat íⁿ á-buē, sia̍h-liû khui hue á-buē.
English: I went down into the nut tree grove, To see the green plants of the valley, To see whether the vine budded, And the pomegranates were in flower.

Tailo: Kā gia̍h kó͘-tshue ê tē-la̍k-ê thiⁿ-sài kóng, Lí tio̍h kā pa̍k tī Iu-hu-la-té tuā hô hit sì-ê thiⁿ-sài tháu-pàng tshut-.lâi.
English: saying to the sixth angel who had one trumpet, Free the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates!

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Ta-bi̍t ông kóng, Siōng-tsú in-uī Siōng-tsú ê kuī, sù-hok tī O-biat-e-tóm ê ke kah kiàn-nā sio̍k tī i ê. Ta-bi̍t tsiū khì, huann-hí kng Siōng-tsú ê kuī tuì O-biat-e-tóm ê tshù, lâi-kàu Ta-bi̍t ê siâⁿ.
English: It was told king David, saying, Yahweh has blessed the house of Obed-Edom, and all that pertains to him, because of the ark of God. David went and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed-Edom into the city of David with joy.

Tailo: Tsè-si ji̍p-khì Siōng-tsú tiān ê lāi-bīn beh kā i sé tshing-khì, kā Siōng-tsú tiān lāi só͘-ū ê ù-uè tuà tshut-khì kàu Siōng-tsú tiān ê īⁿ, Lē-bī lâng kā i tsiap-.lâi, tuà-khì guā-bīn lâi-kàu Kit-lông khe.
English: The priests went in to the inner part of the house of Yahweh, to cleanse it, and brought out all the uncleanness that they found in the temple of Yahweh into the court of the house of Yahweh. The Levites took it, to carry it out abroad to the brook Kidron.

Tailo: Hō͘ tsa-bó͘ lâng lim hit-ê tsuí liáu-āu, i nā bô tshing-khì tik-tsuē i ê tiōng-hu, tsit-ê tì-sú tsiù-tsó͘ ê tsuí beh ji̍p-khì i ê lāi-bīn, tsiâⁿ-tsò khó͘, i ê pak-tó͘ tsiū ē kó͘-tiòng, tuā-thuí tsiū ē nuā, hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū ē tī i ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan tsiâⁿ-tsò tsiù-tsó͘ ê uē-pèⁿ.
English: When he has made her drink the water, then it shall happen, if she is defiled, and has committed a trespass against her husband, that the water that causes the curse will enter into her and become bitter, and her body will swell, and her thigh will fall away: and the woman will be a curse among her people.

Tailo: Lâm-pak sī Lí só͘ tshòng-tsō; Tha-bool suaⁿ kah Hel-móng suaⁿ lóng in-uī Lí ê miâ lâi huann-hí.
English: The north and the south, you have created them. Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name.

Tailo: Lē-bī lâng E-siu-ah, Kat-mi-el, Ba-nî, Ha-siap-niah, Se-le-biah, Ho͘-te-iah, Si-ba-niah, Pe-tha-hiah, kóng, Lín tio̍h khiā khí-lâi o-ló Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè, tuì íng-uán kàu íng-uán. Siōng-tsú ah, Lí îng-kng ê miâ sī ing-kai o-ló ê, iâⁿ-kuè it-tshè ê tshing-ho͘ kah o-ló.
English: Then the Levites, Jeshua, and Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah, said, Stand up and bless Yahweh your God from everlasting to everlasting; and blessed be your glorious name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise.

Tailo: Guá ài pò lín tsai, lán ê hiann-tī Tî-mó͘-theh í-king tshut kaⁿ. I nā khah kín lâi, guá ē kiò i kah guá tsò-hué khì lín hia.
English: Know that our brother Timothy has been freed, with whom, if he comes shortly, I will see you.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī Mô͘-se tī I-su-la-el lâng tshut Ai-gi̍p liáu-āu, só͘ thuân hō͘ in ê tsìng-kì, lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘.
English: these are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which Moses spoke to the children of Israel, when they came forth out of Egypt,

Tailo: Kàu bué, hit-ê hū-jîn-lâng mā sí.
English: After them all, the woman died.

Tailo: Huâ-láu tiàu lín ê sî, nā mn̄g lín kóng, ' Lín tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h thâu-lō͘? '
English: It will happen, when Pharaoh summons you, and will say, What is your occupation?'

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lāu-pē thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê ji̍t, bô ín-tsún i, i só͘ hē hiah-ê guān kah ka-kī iok-sok hiah-ê iok, tsiū lóng bô sîng-li̍p; Siōng-tsú mā ē sià-bián i, in-uī i ê lāu-pē bô ín-tsún.
English: But if her father disallow her in the day that he hears, none of her vows, or of her bonds with which she has bound her soul, shall stand: and Yahweh will forgive her, because her father disallowed her.

Tailo: Lí nā thiaⁿ-tio̍h tī sng-tsâi tshiū bué ū kha-pō͘ siaⁿ, tsiū tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín tsìn-hîng, in-uī hit sî Siōng-tsú í-king tuì lín ê thâu-tsîng tshut-.khì, kong-kik Hui-lī-sū lâng ê kun-tuī.
English: It shall be, when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, that then you shall bestir yourself; for then is Yahweh gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.

Tailo: In-uī guá kah guá ê tsong-tso̍k siū tshut-bē, ē siū tsâu-bia̍t, kā guán thâi-sí, hō͘ guán sí-bông. Siat-sú bē guán tsò lô͘-po̍k, tsò lú-pī, suî-jiân tuì-ti̍k bē-tàng pó͘ ông ê sún-sit, guá mā ē tiām-tiām.
English: for we are sold, I and my people, to be destroyed, to be slain, and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondservants and bondmaids, I had held my peace, although the adversary could not have compensated for the king's damage.

Tailo: Hit khu tshân kah hit lāi-bīn ê hia̍t, sī tuì Hiat lâng bé-.lâi ê.
English: the field and the cave that is therein, which was purchased from the children of Heth.

Tailo: m̄-sī khì hiah-ê kóng-uē tshim-ò, giân-gí oh-tit thiaⁿ ê tsin tsē kok, in ê uē lí bē liáu-kái, thiaⁿ m̄-bat.
English: not to many peoples of a strange speech and of a hard language, whose words you can not understand. Surely, if I sent you to them, they would listen to you.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā A-lông kóng, Lí khì khòng-iá gîng-tsiap Mô͘-se. I tsiū khì, tī Siōng-tsú ê suaⁿ tú-tio̍h Mô͘-se, tsiū kā i tsim.
English: Yahweh said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. He went, and met him on God's mountain, and kissed him.

Tailo: Tī E-tha-ním gue̍h, to̍h-sī tshit-.gue̍h ê tseh-kî, I-su-la-el lâng lóng tsū-tsi̍p lâi-kàu Só͘-lô-móng ông hia.
English: All the men of Israel assembled themselves to king Solomon at the feast, in the month Ethanim, which is the seventh month.

Tailo: In gîm tsi̍t siú sin ê si, kóng, Lí ū tsu-keh the̍h hit kńg tsheh, thiah-khui i ê hong-ìn, in-uī Lí ū siū sat-hāi, īng Lí ê hueh tuì kok tso̍k-kûn, kok tsióng gí-giân, kok bîn-tso̍k, kok kok sio̍k-huê lâng lâi kui Siōng-tè.
English: They sang a new song, saying, You are worthy to take the book, And to open its seals: For you were killed, And bought us for God with your blood, Out of every tribe, language, people, and nation,

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tiong-kan tsin tsē lâng su-hā teh gī-lūn I-é-su ê tāi-tsì, ū lâng kóng, I sī hó lâng. Mā ū lâng kóng, M̄-sī, I sī teh siàn-tōng kûn-tsiòng.
English: There was much murmuring among the multitudes concerning him. Some said, He is a good man. Others said, Not so, but he leads the multitude astray.

Tailo: Kóng, ' Guá beh tsiūⁿ-khì kàu tsng-thâu ê tē, kàu tiām-tiām an-jiân sing-ua̍h ê jîn-bîn hia, in só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi lóng bô siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, mā bô mn̂g, bô tshuàⁿ ;
English: and you shall say, I will go up to the land of unwalled villages; I will go to those who are at rest, who dwell securely, all of them dwelling without walls, and having neither bars nor gates;

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hō͘ luán-jio̍k ê tshiú ióng-tsòng, hō͘ bô la̍t ê kha-thâu-u tsū-tsāi.
English: Strengthen the weak hands, And make firm the feeble knees.

Tailo: I-é-su kóng án-ne sī teh tsí Ka-lio̍k lâng Sí-mòng ê kiáⁿ Iô-tah, i sī tsa̍p-jī sù-tô͘ ê tsi̍t-ê, teh beh tshut-bē I-é-su.
English: Now he spoke of Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, for it was he who would betray him, being one of the twelve.

Tailo: Lí kóng, guá ê tō-lí sûn-tsuân, guá tī lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tshing-khì.
English: For you say, My doctrine is pure, I am clean in your eyes.'

Tailo: I-é-su tī Lē-bī ê tshù tsia̍h pn̄g, ū tsin tsē thiu-suè ê lâng í-ki̍p tsuē-jîn kah I-é-su tsham I ê bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué tsia̍h pn̄g; in-uī ū tsin tsē lâng teh kin-tuè I-é-su.
English: It happened, that he was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many, and they followed him.

Tailo: Í-sak tuì in kóng, Lín kì-jiân uàn-hūn guá, kiò guá lī-khui lín, taⁿ sī án-tsuáⁿ ē lâi guá tsia?
English: Isaac said to them, Why have you come to me, since you hate me, and have sent me away from you?

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h tuì tsit-ê tē kóng: Lí sī bē-tàng tshing-khì ê tē, tī tuā siū-khì ê ji̍t, mā bô lo̍h hō͘ tī lí hia.
English: Son of man, tell her, You are a land that is not cleansed, nor rained on in the day of indignation.

Tailo: Liâm tī guá ê ki bô kiat kué-tsí ê, I tsiū kā i tsián-tû; ū kiat kué-tsí ê ki, I tsiū kā i siu-tsián, hō͘ i kiat koh khah tsē kué-tsí.
English: Every branch in me that doesn't bear fruit, he takes away. Every branch that bears fruit, he prunes, that it may bear more fruit.

Tailo: Siōng-tè tsiū tuì guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, tio̍h tsia̍h lí só͘ tit-tio̍h ê; tio̍h tsia̍h hit kńg tsheh, mā tio̍h khì tuì I-su-la-el ê jîn-bîn kóng-uē.
English: He said to me, Son of man, eat that which you find; eat this scroll, and go, speak to the house of Israel.

Tailo: I tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsiū luân-ài in, suî-sî tshe sù-tsiá khì Kal-tí-ah hia kìnn in.
English: As soon as she saw them she doted on them, and sent messengers to them into Chaldea.

Tailo: Īng un-jiû lâi kíng-kài hiah-ê huán-tuì tsiá, kiám-tshái Siōng-tè ē hō͘ in hué-kái, thang lâi bat tsin-lí.
English: in gentleness correcting those who oppose him: perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth,

Tailo: Gi-lia̍t lâng tī E-hu-laim lâng ê thâu-tsîng pé-siú Iol-tàn hô ê tō͘-kháu, E-hu-laim tô-tsáu ê lâng nā kóng, Tshiánn hō͘ guán kuè-.khì. Gi-lia̍t lâng tsiū mn̄g i kóng, Lí sī E-hu-laim lâng á m̄-sī?
English: The Gileadites took the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites. It was so, that when any of the fugitives of Ephraim said, Let me go over, the men of Gilead said to him, Are you an Ephraimite? If he said, No;

Tailo: jî-tshiánn koh kā Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, iù-mī, í-ki̍p iû kah bi̍t, sī Guá só͘ īng lâi iúⁿ-tshī lí ê, lí tsiū kā i pâi tī in ê bīn-tsîng, lâi tsò phang-bī, lí si̍t-tsāi ū án-ne tsò. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: My bread also which I gave you, fine flour, and oil, and honey, with which I fed you, you did even set it before them for a sweet savor; and thus it was, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī Tsú ê bīn-tsîng khiam-pi, I tsiū ē kā lín ko-sing.
English: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn nn̄g lâng tsò-hué khùn tsiū ē sio-lō; nā ka-kī tsi̍t-ê lâng khùn, ná ē sio lè?
English: Again, if two lie together, then they have warmth; but how can one keep warm alone?

Tailo: Hit khuán lâng pàng-sak tsìng-ti̍t ê lō͘, kiânn tī o͘-àm ê tō-lō͘.
English: Who forsake the paths of uprightness, To walk in the ways of darkness;

Tailo: Guá ê a-hiaⁿ Io-ná-than, guá uī lí siong-sim! Guá hui-siông kah-ì lí! Lí ê thiàⁿ guá tsin kî-biāu, iâⁿ-kuè tsa-bó͘ lâng ê thiàⁿ.
English: I am distressed for you, my brother Jonathan: Very pleasant have you been to me: Your love to me was wonderful, Passing the love of women.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ huann-hí kah iáu-koh m̄-káⁿ siong-sìn, iáu-teh bo̍k-bîng kî-biāu ê sî, I-é-su kā in kóng, Lín tsia ū siáⁿ-mi̍h thang tsia̍h bô?
English: While they still didn't believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them, Do you have anything here to eat?

Tailo: I koh hō͘ lí kah lí só͘-ū ê hiann-tī — Lē-bī ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsò-hué tshin-kīn I, lín kám lia̍h tse tsò sió-khuá? Lín kám iáu-koh iau-kiû tsè-si ê tsit?
English: and that he has brought you near, and all your brothers the sons of Levi with you? and seek you the priesthood also?

Tailo: Nó͘-ah seⁿ saⁿ-ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī Sé-mh, Hâm, Iá-hia̍t.
English: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá ê tuì-ti̍k tsin ua̍h-tāng koh ióng-bíng, bô-iân bô-kò͘ uàn-hūn guá ê lâng ke-thinn ná tsē.
English: But my enemies are vigorous and many. Those who hate me without reason are numerous.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tī i ê tíng-bīn thia̍p tsi̍t tuā-tui ê tsio̍h, kàu tī kin-á-ji̍t. Tsiū án-ne, Siōng-tsú siu-huê I ê tuā siū-khì. Só͘-í, hit só͘-tsāi miâ kiò-tsò A-kol ê suaⁿ-kok, kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: They raised over him a great heap of stones, to this day; and Yahweh turned from the fierceness of his anger. Therefore the name of that place was called The valley of Achor to this day.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú kuan-hē A-siul ông, kóng, ' I it-tīng bē kàu tsit-ê siâⁿ, mā bē tī tsia siā tsìnn, bē-tàng giâ tîn-pâi lâi-kàu siâⁿ tsîng, mā bē khí thô͘-tui lâi kong-kik i.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come to this city, nor shoot an arrow there, neither shall he come before it with shield, nor cast up a mound against it.

Tailo: Tī hia, Siōng-tsú ē hián-bîng ui-giâm kah lán tông-tsāi. I ē tshin-tshiūⁿ kang-hô khui-khuah ê tē; hit tiong-kan it-tīng bô ū kò tsiúⁿ ê tsûn óng-lâi, mā bô ū ui-hong ê tsûn king-kuè.
English: But there Yahweh will be with us in majesty, A place of broad rivers and streams, In which no galley with oars will go, Neither will any gallant ship pass by there.

Tailo: nn̄g tsiah gû-káng, gō͘ tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò siā-un-tsè. Tsiah-ê sī E-nân ê kiáⁿ A-hi-la̍h ê lé-mi̍h.
English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahira the son of Enan.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, I-sá-iah kóng liáu tsin tio̍h, i ī-giân lín tsiah-ê ké-hó ê lâng án-ne kóng, ' Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn īng tshuì-tûn tsun-kìng guá, in ê sim khiok lī-khui guá tsin hn̄g.
English: He answered them, Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honors me with their lips, But their heart is far from me.

Tailo: Lín khuàⁿ-tio̍h A-bu-la-hàm, Í-sak, Iâ-kop kah tsìng sian-ti tī Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ lāi-bīn, ka-kī khiok hông kuáⁿ tshut-.khì guā-bīn. Hit sî, lín ē tī hia thî-khàu, kā-gê tshiat-khí.
English: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets, in the Kingdom of God, and yourselves being thrown outside.

Tailo: īⁿ ê pò͘-uî kah īⁿ ê mn̂g-lî, ( īⁿ to̍h-sī uî huē-bō͘ kah tuâⁿ ê ) , í-ki̍p it-tshè só͘ īng ê soh.
English: and the hangings of the court, and the screen for the door of the court, which is by the tabernacle, and around the altar, and its cords for all of its service.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū tsiàu i ê tì-huī khǹg kûn-tsiòng, in tsiū tsám Bik-lih ê kiáⁿ Sí-bah ê thâu-khak, hiat hō͘ Io-ap. I tsiū pûn sàu-kak, kûn-tsiòng tsiū lī-khui siâⁿ sì-suàⁿ-.khì, ta̍k lâng tńg-khì i ê pò͘-pênn. Io-ap tńg-khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm, lâi-kàu ông hia.
English: Then the woman went to all the people in her wisdom. They cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and threw it out to Joab. He blew the trumpet, and they were dispersed from the city, every man to his tent. Joab returned to Jerusalem to the king.

Tailo: Al-ta-siá-su-ta ông tē-tshit nî, I-su-la-el lâng ê tsè-si kah Lē-bī lâng, tshiùⁿ kua ê, kò͘-mn̂g ê kah Na-thi-in, kok ū kuí-nā-ê lâng lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm.
English: There went up some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinim, to Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.

Tailo: tsiū uī-tio̍h i tsún-pī tsi̍t king tuā pâng-king; tsá-tsîng tī hit king siu-tsông sò͘-tsè, jú-hiuⁿ, khì-kū kah tsiàu lē kiong-kip Lē-bī lâng, tshiùⁿ kua ê, kò͘-mn̂g ê, ngó͘-kok, sin tsiú kah iû ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it, í-ki̍p kui hō͘ tsè-si kí-tsè ê mi̍h.
English: had prepared for him a great chamber, where before they laid the meal offerings, the frankincense, and the vessels, and the tithes of the grain, the new wine, and the oil, which were given by commandment to the Levites, and the singers, and the porters; and the wave offerings for the priests.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsáu-tshuē Siōng-tsú, tsiū ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā, khióng-kiaⁿ I tshin-tshiūnn hué huat-tshut tī Iô-sé-huh ê ke, sio tī Be-thel, bô lâng phah-hua.
English: Seek Yahweh, and you will live; Lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, And it devour, and there be no one to quench it in Bethel.

Tailo: I tshuā guá kàu Siōng-tsú ê tiān ǹg pak ê mn̂g-kháu. Lí khuàⁿ, tī hia ū tsa-bó͘ lâng tsē-.leh, uī-tio̍h Tam-mù-tsuh sîn ( Tsù, Ba-bú-lông ê sîn-bîng. ) thî-khàu.
English: Then he brought me to the door of the gate of Yahweh's house which was toward the north; and see, there sat the women weeping for Tammuz.

Tailo: Mā uī-tio̍h gû-káng, iûⁿ-káng kah iûⁿ-á, suà hiàn i ê sò͘-tsè, i ê kuàn-tiān, lóng tsiàu in ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu hit-ê lē;
English: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim ông kah i ê tsìng ióng-sū, kuì-tso̍k thiaⁿ-tio̍h i ê uē, ông tsiū siūⁿ beh hō͘ i sí. U-lī-a thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū kiaⁿ, tsáu-khì Ai-gi̍p.
English: and when Jehoiakim the king, with all his mighty men, and all the princes, heard his words, the king sought to put him to death; but when Uriah heard it, he was afraid, and fled, and went into Egypt:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng thîng tī Si-nái suaⁿ, hûn jia suaⁿ la̍k ji̍t; tē-tshit ji̍t I tuì hûn tiong kiò Mô͘-se.
English: The glory of Yahweh settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days. The seventh day he called to Moses out of the midst of the cloud.

Tailo: I ē khiā-.leh, uá-khò Siōng-tsú ê kuân-lîng kah i ê Siōng-tè ui-giâm ê miâ, lâi tshī i ê iûⁿ-kûn. In ē an-jiân sing-ua̍h; i ē tsò tuā, kàu tē ê ki̍k-thâu.
English: He shall stand, and shall shepherd in the strength of Yahweh, In the majesty of the name of Yahweh his God: And they will live, for then he will be great to the ends of the earth.

Tailo: Ông nā tsiàu sîng-si̍t phuàⁿ-tuàn sàn-tshiah lâng, i ê tsō-uī tsiū ē íng-uán kian-kò͘.
English: The king who fairly judges the poor, His throne shall be established forever.

Tailo: Lí ê khing-á kah lí tshiau mī ê khì-kū, lóng ē siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading trough.

Tailo: Tsai-hāi bē lîm-kàu lí, un-i̍k mā bē uá-kīn lí ê pò͘-pênn.
English: No evil shall happen to you, Neither shall any plague come near your dwelling.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k thang thau-thau-á thó͘-khuì, m̄-thang tshut siaⁿ, m̄-thang pān-lí song-sū, thâu-khak iû-guân tio̍h pau thâu-kin, kha iû-guân tio̍h tshīng ê, m̄-thang am lí ê tshuì-tûn, mā m̄-thang tsia̍h tiàu-song ê piáⁿ.
English: Sigh, but not aloud, make no mourning for the dead; bind your headdress on you, and put your shoes on your feet, and don't cover your lips, and don't eat men's bread.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī hō͘ in tshiúⁿ-.khì, E-lī nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ — Ho-hu-nî kah Hui-ne-hah mā sí.
English: The ark of God was taken; and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were slain.

Tailo: Lín kah guán tāi-ke kiat-tshin, lín thang kā lín ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ hō͘ guán, lín mā thang tshuā guán ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Make marriages with us. Give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves.

Tailo: In-uī in lóng ài hō͘ guán kiaⁿ, ì-sù sī beh hō͘ guán ê tshiú ē sng-nńg, tì-sú kang-sū tsò bē tsiânn. Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kian-kò͘ guá ê tshiú!
English: For they all would have made us afraid, saying, Their hands shall be weakened from the work, that it not be done. But now, God, strengthen you my hands.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kā tsiah-ê uē tuì Sàu-lô kóng suah, Sàu-lô kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ Ta-bi̍t, tse sī lí ê siann? Sàu-lô tsiū tshut siaⁿ thî-khàu,
English: It came to pass, when David had made an end of speaking these words to Saul, that Saul said, Is this your voice, my son David? Saul lifted up his voice, and wept.

Tailo: Lí nā m̄-tsún in lī-khui, lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh hō͘ tshân-kap-á phah-pháiⁿ lí ê kíng lāi.
English: If you refuse to let them go, behold, I will plague all your borders with frogs:

Tailo: Tsì-kuân-.ê pun gia̍p hō͘ lia̍t pang, hun-khui sè-kan lâng ê sî, tsiū tiāⁿ-tio̍h jîn-bîn ê kài-hān, tsiàu I-su-la-el lâng ê sò͘-gia̍h.
English: When the Most High gave to the nations their inheritance, When he separated the children of men, He set the bounds of the peoples According to the number of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Sio̍k Ko-hat ê, ū Àm-lâm tso̍k ê ke, I-tsu-hal tso̍k ê ke, He-bú-lông tso̍k ê ke, U-tsi-el tso̍k ê ke, tsiah-ê lóng sī Ko-hat tso̍k ê ke.
English: Of Kohath was the family of the Amramites, and the family of the Izharites, and the family of the Hebronites, and the family of the Uzzielites: these are the families of the Kohathites.

Tailo: Ai-gi̍p, I tī lí ê tiong-kan kiânn sîn-jiah kî-sū, lâi tuì-hù Huâ-láu kah i ê jîn-sîn.
English: Who sent signs and wonders into the midst of you, Egypt, On Pharaoh, and on all his servants;

Tailo: Ū lâng ka-kī tsng-tsò hó-gia̍h, kî-si̍t bô puàⁿ-hāng; ū lâng ka-kī tsng-tsò sàn-tshiah, kî-si̍t ū tsin tsē tsâi-bu̍t.
English: There are some who pretend to be rich, yet have nothing. There are some who pretend to be poor, yet have great wealth.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Ná-mān kóng, Nā m̄ siu, kiû lí kā nn̄g tsiah lô só͘ ē-tàng tsài ê thô͘ hō͘ lí ê lô͘-po̍k, in-uī tuì taⁿ í-āu, lí ê lô͘-po̍k bô koh īng sio-tsè á-.sī pa̍t tsióng ê tsè hō͘ pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, tsí ū beh hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: Naaman said, If not, yet, please let there be given to your servant two mules' burden of earth; for your servant will henceforth offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice to other gods, but to Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā A-lông kah i ê kiáⁿ í-ki̍p saⁿ-khò͘, buah in ê iû kah sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng, nn̄g tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsi̍t khing bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, lóng tuà-.lâi.
English: Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and the bull of the sin offering, and the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread;

Tailo: Hit-ê kài tuì Tap-pú-ah ǹg sai, kàu Ka-ná hô, thàng-kàu hái uî-tsí. Tse to̍h-sī E-hu-laim lâng ê tsi-tso̍k, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p.
English: From Tappuah the border went along westward to the brook of Kanah; and the goings out of it were at the sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Ephraim according to their families;

Tailo: Tsit nn̄g-uī sù-tô͘ tsiū tiàm hia tsin kú, uá-khò Tsú hó-tánn suan-káng hok-im. Tsú siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ū lîng-li̍k kiânn sîn-jiah kî-sū, lâi kiàn-tsìng in só͘ thuân un-tián ê tō-lí.
English: Therefore they stayed there a long time, speaking boldly in the Lord, who testified to the word of his grace, granting signs and wonders to be done by their hands.

Tailo: An-hioh-ji̍t hit kang, tī lín ta̍k king tshù lāi lóng m̄-thang khí hué.
English: You shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations on the Sabbath day.'

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng koh kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, Siōng-tsú tsiū kā in kau tī Mí-tiân ê tshiú tiong, king-kuè tshit nî.
English: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: and Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.

Tailo: In thiaⁿ-liáu tsiū tâng-sim tshut siaⁿ tuì Siōng-tè kî-tó kóng, Tshòng-tsō thiⁿ, tē, hái kah kî-tiong bān-mi̍h ê Tsú-tsáiⁿ ah,
English: When they heard it, they lifted up their voice to God with one accord, and said, O Lord, you are God, who made the heaven, the earth, the sea, and all that is in them;

Tailo: Tńg-kàu tshù tsiū kiò tshù-piⁿ ê pîng-iú lâi, kā in kóng, Lâi kah guá tàu huann-hí, in-uī guá tshuē-tio̍h phah-m̄-kiàn ê hit tsiah iûⁿ. '
English: When he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!'

Tailo: Lín mā m̄-thang tshut huē-bō͘ ê mn̂g, khióng-kiaⁿ lín ē sí, in-uī Siōng-tsú ê iû buah tī lín ê sing-khu. In tsiū tsiàu Mô͘-se ê uē lâi kiâⁿ.
English: You shall not go out from the door of the Tent of Meeting, lest you die; for the anointing oil of Yahweh is on you. They did according to the word of Moses.

Tailo: In í-king īng Mol-té-kái ê pún tso̍k kā Ha-mán kóng; Ha-mán lia̍h-tsò hē tshiú hāi Mol-té-kái tsi̍t-ê lâng sī sió-khuá tāi-tsì, tsiū kè-bô͘ beh bia̍t A-ha-sui-ló͘ tsuân kok ê Iô-tah lâng, to̍h-sī Mol-té-kái ê pún tso̍k.
English: But he scorned the thought of laying hands on Mordecai alone; for they had made known to him the people of Mordecai: therefore Haman sought to destroy all the Jews who were throughout the whole kingdom of Ahasuerus, even the people of Mordecai.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú ah, tse Lí iáu khuàⁿ-tsò sī sió-khuá, Lí koh kóng-khí Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê ke ē kàu tī kú-tn̂g. Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú ah, tse sī jîn-kan ê lē.
English: This was yet a small thing in your eyes, Lord Yahweh; but you have spoken also of your servant's house for a great while to come; and this too after the manner of men, Lord Yahweh!

Tailo: Sio̍k Tse-bú-lông tsi-tso̍k ê ū tsi̍t-bān nn̄g-tshing, sio̍k Iô-sé-huh tsi-tso̍k ê ū tsi̍t-bān nn̄g-tshing, sio̍k Biān-iá-mín tsi-tso̍k ê ū tsi̍t-bān nn̄g-tshing.
English: Of the tribe of Zebulun twelve thousand, Of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand, Of the tribe of Benjamin were sealed twelve thousand.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kóng, Thinn tíng ê kiong-tshong tio̍h ū huat kng ê thé, lâi hun-pia̍t mê-ji̍t, mā thang tsò tiāu-thâu, sù-kuì, ji̍t, nî,
English: God said, Let there be lights in the expanse of sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years;

Tailo: tuā-thuí tshīng tâng-kûn, king-kah-thâu phāinn tâng ê kik;
English: He had brass shin armor on his legs, and a javelin of brass between his shoulders.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú tuà lín tshut Ai-gi̍p, thuat-lī tsù-thih ê lô͘, beh tsò I ka-kī sán-gia̍p ê tsú-bîn, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t ê khuán-sit.
English: But Yahweh has taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be to him a people of inheritance, as at this day.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tī lō͘-.ni̍h, tī kheh-tiàm, Siōng-tsú tú-tio̍h i, beh hō͘ i sí.
English: It happened on the way at a lodging place, that Yahweh met him and wanted to kill him.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-kng, Io-siú-ah tsá-tsá-khí-.lâi, tsè-si mā kng Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī.
English: Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsit-ê sī tsun-thàn I ê tsí-hui sì-kè kiânn tńg-se̍h; tī sè-kài ê tē-bīn, kiânn I it-tshè só͘ kā in huan-hù ê;
English: It is turned round about by his guidance, That they may do whatever he commands them On the surface of the habitable world,

Tailo: In suan-pò͘ kìm-tsia̍h, hō͘ Na-bot tsē tī jîn-bîn tiong-kan ê kuân uī.
English: They proclaimed a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people.

Tailo: Bô liông-sim, bô siú iok, bô tshin-tsîng, bô liân-bín.
English: without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, unforgiving, unmerciful;

Tailo: I-é-su tuì lu̍t-huat kàu-su kah Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng kóng, An-hioh-ji̍t i-pēⁿ thang á m̄-thang?
English: Jesus, answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?

Tailo: Āu-lâi, I-sá-iah mā hó-tánn thè Siōng-tè kóng, bô tshuē guá ê, guá hō͘ in tshuē-.tio̍h; bô tui kiû guá ê, guá tuì in hián-hiān. ( Tsù, ISI 65:1 )
English: Isaiah is very bold, and says, I was found by those who didn't seek me. I was revealed to those who didn't ask for me.

Tailo: E-lí-siah lâi-kàu-uī, ji̍p-khì tshù lāi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h gín-á í-king sí, hē tī i ê bîn-tshn̂g.
English: When Elisha was come into the house, behold, the child was dead, and laid on his bed.

Tailo: In pak pîng ê kài, sī tuì Iol-tàn hô khí; i ê kài it-ti̍t khì-kàu I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ piⁿ-á ê pak pîng, koh-tsài khì, puâⁿ-kuè suaⁿ, ǹg sai pîng khì, ti̍t-ti̍t kàu Bia̍t-a-biân ê khòng-iá.
English: Their border on the north quarter was from the Jordan; and the border went up to the side of Jericho on the north, and went up through the hill country westward; and the goings out of it were at the wilderness of Beth Aven.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín hō͘ hiàn-sin-tsiá lim tsiú, huan-hù sian-ti kóng: M̄-thang kóng sian-ti uē.
English: But you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, And commanded the prophets, saying, Don't prophesy!'

Tailo: Kā Só͘-lô-móng kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ, guá sim-lāi pún-lâi ū siūⁿ beh uī Siōng-tsú — guá ê Siōng-tè ê miâ khí tiān,
English: David said to Solomon his son, As for me, it was in my heart to build a house to the name of Yahweh my God.

Tailo: Sa-má-lī-a ê jîn-bîn ē in-uī Bia̍t-a-biân ê kim-gû kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ; in-uī hiah-ê jîn-bîn ē uī-tio̍h i iu-būn, tsè-si ē uī-tio̍h i ê îng-kng sí-.khì, mā ē phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: The inhabitants of Samaria will be in terror for the calves of Beth Aven; For its people will mourn over it, Along with its priests who rejoiced over it, For its glory, because it has departed from it.

Tailo: lín ê lâm-hong tio̍h tuì Tsîn ê khòng-iá iân E-tóm ê pian-kài, lín ê lâm-kài tio̍h tuì Iâm-hái tang pîng ê ki̍k-thâu.
English: then your south quarter shall be from the wilderness of Zin along by the side of Edom, and your south border shall be from the end of the Salt Sea eastward;

Tailo: In-uī Tsú tī tē-tsiūⁿ beh tsin kín koh thiat-té lâi tsip-hîng sím-phuàⁿ. ( Tsù, ISI 10:22-23 LXX )
English: For He will finish the work and cut it short in righteousness, Because the LORD will make a short work upon the earth.

Tailo: In ē tshin-tshiūⁿ bó-sai teh háu, mā tshin-tshiūnn sè-tsiah sai teh háu. In ē hm̄-hm̄ háu lâi la̍k in só͘ kā ê mi̍h, thua kàu ún-tàng ê só͘-tsāi, bô lâng ē lâi kái-kiù.
English: Their roaring will be like a lioness. They will roar like young lions. Yes, they shall roar, And seize their prey and carry it off, And there will be no one to deliver.

Tailo: Tsit-ê kài tio̍h tuì Sī-huan lo̍h-khì kàu A-iân tang pîng ê Lip-la̍h, koh lo̍h-khì kàu Kin-né-lo̍t ô͘ ê tang pîng.
English: and the border shall go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain; and the border shall go down, and shall reach to the side of the sea of Chinnereth eastward;

Tailo: Iâ-kop tshut-huat, lâi-kàu tang-hong ê lâng ê tē.
English: Then Jacob went on his journey, and came to the land of the children of the east.

Tailo: Bô lâng tshiúⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā, sī guá ka-kī tsū-guān pàng-sak. Guá ū kuân thang pàng-sak, mā ū kuân thang koh tit-tio̍h. Tse sī guá tuì Thiⁿ-pē niá-siū ê bīng-līng.
English: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down by myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. I received this commandment from my Father.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ìn Io-siú-ah kóng, Guán beh ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú — guán ê Siōng-tè, tsun-thàn I ê uē.
English: The people said to Joshua, Yahweh our God will we serve, and to his voice will we listen.

Tailo: Taⁿ Siōng-tsú īng pe̍h-tsha̍t ê sîn-bîng ji̍p-khì tī lí tsiah-ê sian-ti ê tshuì. Siōng-tsú kóng-tio̍h lí ê sî, kóng lí ū tsai-hō à.
English: Now therefore, behold, Yahweh has put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these your prophets; and Yahweh has spoken evil concerning you.

Tailo: Phû-tô-hn̂g kué-tsí m̄-thang bán liáu-liáu, mā m̄-thang khioh phû-tô só͘ lak ê kué-tsí, tio̍h lâu hō͘ sàn-tshiah lâng kah tshut-guā lâng. Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: You shall not glean your vineyard, neither shall you gather the fallen grapes of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and for the foreigner. I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Le-ah ê lú-pī Jil-pah kā Iâ-kop seⁿ kiáⁿ.
English: Zilpah, Leah's handmaid, bore Jacob a son.

Tailo: Guán thong-kuè Ki-tok, tuì Siōng-tè ū tsit khuán ê khak-sìn tsiah ē án-ne kóng.
English: Such confidence we have through Christ toward God;

Tailo: Tē-saⁿ ji̍t, tī Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê Ka-ná ū hun-iàn, I-é-su ê lāu-bú ū tsham-ka.
English: The third day, there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee. Jesus' mother was there.

Tailo: Huâ-láu tuì i ê jîn-sîn kóng, Lán kám ē tshuē-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê tshin-tshiūnn i tsit khuán ê lâng, ū Siōng-tè ê lîng tī i ê lāi-bīn?
English: Pharaoh said to his servants, Can we find such a one as this, a man in whom is the Spirit of God?

Tailo: àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ tì-huī, tsuan-sim lâi kiû tshong-bîng;
English: So as to turn your ear to wisdom, And apply your heart to understanding;

Tailo: Ông án-ne kóng, ' Lín m̄-thang hō͘ Hi-tse-kia phiàn-.khì, in-uī i bē-tàng kiù lín thuat-lī ông ê tshiú. '
English: Thus says the king, Don't let Hezekiah deceive you; for he will not be able to deliver you out of his hand:

Tailo: I tsiū kóng, Guá sī A-bu-la-hàm ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: He said, I am Abraham's servant.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, gī lâng ē huaⁿ-hí, in tī Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng ē khuài-lo̍k, in mā ē sî-siông huaⁿ-huaⁿ hí-hí.
English: But let the righteous be glad. Let them rejoice before God. Yes, let them rejoice with gladness.

Tailo: Só͘-í, kok-uī hiann-tī tsí-muē, án-ne lín ing-kai tsai, sià tsuē ê tō-lí sī tuì tsit uī I-é-su thuân hō͘ lín.
English: Be it known to you therefore, brothers , that through this man is proclaimed to you remission of sins,

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng ta̍k nî só͘ tit-tio̍h ê kim, kiōng la̍k-pah la̍k-tsa̍p-la̍k tha-lan-t.
English: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred sixty-six talents of gold,

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ sì-bīn ê hong tuì thiⁿ ê sì-bīn tshue-.lâi, lîm-kàu Ê-lám lâng, kā in kuáⁿ-suàⁿ khì tī sì-hng. Ê-lám siū kuáⁿ-suàⁿ ê lâng bô tsi̍t kok bô kàu.
English: On Elam will I bring the four winds from the four quarters of the sky, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation where the outcasts of Elam shall not come.

Tailo: Khióng-kiaⁿ lín tiong-kan, tsa-po͘ lâng á-.sī tsa-bó͘ lâng, á-.sī ka-tso̍k, á-.sī tsi-tso̍k, in ê sim kin-á-ji̍t phian-siâ Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè, khì ho̍k-sāi hiah-ê kok ê sîn-bîng, koh khióng-kiaⁿ lín tiong-kan ū pháiⁿ kin seⁿ-tshut to̍k-tsháu kah in-tîn.
English: lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turns away this day from Yahweh our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations; lest there should be among you a root that bears gall and wormwood;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Tng hit ji̍t, tī hî mn̂g ē ū pi-ai ê siann, tuì tē-jī-ê só͘-tsāi ē ū tuā-siaⁿ huah, tuì tsiah-ê suaⁿ ē ū tuā pang-hām ê siann.
English: In that day, says Yahweh, there will be the noise of a cry from the fish gate, a wailing from the second quarter, and a great crashing from the hills.

Tailo: Hiah-ê siūⁿ beh huat-tsâi ê lâng, ē hām-lo̍h tī bê-hi̍k kah lô-bāng, í-ki̍p tsin tsē gû-gōng iú-hāi ê su-io̍k, hō͘ lâng tîm-lûn, tì-sú pāi-huāi kah bia̍t-bông.
English: But those who are determined to be rich fall into a temptation and a snare and many foolish and harmful lusts, such as drown men in ruin and destruction.

Tailo: Taⁿ khang-hi à, khang-khang à, pha-hng à, sim sit táⁿ, kha-thâu-u sio kha̍p, io lóng thàng-thiàⁿ, bīn lóng piàn sik.
English: She is empty, void, and waste. The heart melts, the knees knock together, their bodies and faces have grown pale.

Tailo: Nā ū tshut-guā lâng kià-kha tī lín tiong-kan, ài siú Siōng-tsú ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh, i tio̍h tsiàu Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘ lâi kiâⁿ; tshut-guā lâng kah pún-tē-lâng tio̍h tsiàu kāng tsi̍t-ê lu̍t-lē lâi kiâⁿ.
English: If a foreigner lives among you, and desires to keep the Passover to Yahweh; according to the statute of the Passover, and according to its ordinance, so shall he do. You shall have one statute, both for the foreigner, and for him who is born in the land.'

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k I-é-su ìn kóng, Lí tio̍h lâi tuè guá, tshut-tsāi hiah-ê lîng-sìng sí-.khì ê lâng khì bâi-tsòng in ka-kī ê sí-lâng.
English: But Jesus said to him, Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead.

Tailo: King-tián án-ne kóng, kin-á-ji̍t lín nā thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê siann, tsiū m̄-thang ngē lín ê sim, tshin-tshiūnn lín ê tsó͘-sian puē-gi̍k ê sî. ( tsù, SPh 95:7-8 )
English: while it is said, Today if you will hear his voice, Don't harden your hearts, as in the rebellion.

Tailo: Hit sî, lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsiū ū îng-kng; lí ê sim tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, koh tuā khui-khuah, in-uī tuā hái hong-sīng ê tsâi-bu̍t ē tò tńg-lâi kui lí, lia̍t kok ê tsâi-pó mā ē lâi kui lí.
English: Then you shall see and be radiant, and your heart shall thrill and be enlarged; because the abundance of the sea shall be turned to you, the wealth of the nations shall come to you.

Tailo: Khì kàu hia, tio̍h tshuē Nim-sī ê sun, Iô-sa-huat ê kiáⁿ E-hú, ji̍p-.khì, hō͘ i tuì i ê hiann-tī tiong khí-.lâi, tshuā i ji̍p-khì lāi-pâng,
English: When you come there, look out there Jehu the son of Jehoshaphat the son of Nimshi, and go in, and make him arise up from among his brothers, and carry him to an inner chamber.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ Só͘-lô-móng, lí tio̍h jīn-bat lí ê pē ê Siōng-tè, īng sîng-si̍t ê sim lâi huann-hí ho̍k-sāi I; in-uī Siōng-tsú kàm-tshat kûn-tsiòng ê sim, tsai só͘-ū ê sim-su liām-thâu. Lí nā tshuē I, I ē hō͘ lí tú-.tio̍h; lí nā pàng-sak I, I ē íng-uán kī-tsua̍t lí.
English: You, Solomon my son, know the God of your father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind; for Yahweh searches all hearts, and understands all the imaginations of the thoughts: if you seek him, he will be found of you; but if you forsake him, he will cast you off forever.

Tailo: Nā tsiàu i khuànn, tshng í-king thîng-tsí, hit tiong-kan nā huat o͘ ê mn̂g, tshng kì-jiân hó, hit-ê lâng sī tshing-khì, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tuàn-tīng i tsò tshing-khì.
English: But if in his eyes the itch is arrested, and black hair has grown in it; the itch is healed, he is clean. The priest shall pronounce him clean.

Tailo: A-ha-tsiah tuì Sa-má-lī-a ê lâu-tíng ê lân-kan pua̍h lo̍h-.lâi, tì pēⁿ; tsiū tshe sù-tsiá kā in kóng, Lín khì mn̄g Ik-lóng ê sîn-bîng Ba-al-tse-but, guá tsit-ê pēⁿ ē hó á-bē?
English: Ahaziah fell down through the lattice in his upper chamber that was in Samaria, and was sick: and he sent messengers, and said to them, Go, inquire of Baalzebub, the god of Ekron, whether I shall recover of this sickness.

Tailo: Siūⁿ beh pó-tsuân ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā, só͘-ū sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē pó-tsuân i ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.

Tailo: Gi-bóng lâng tsiū tshe lâng khì Gil-gal ê iâⁿ kìnn Io-siú-ah, kóng, Lí m̄-thang kiu tshiú m̄-khuàⁿ lí ê lô͘-po̍k, kiû lí kuáⁿ-kín lâi tsia kā guán tsín-kiù, pang-tsān guán, in-uī tuà suaⁿ-tē A-mô͘-lī lâng hiah-ê ông, lóng tsū-tsi̍p lâi beh kong-kik guán.
English: The men of Gibeon sent to Joshua to the camp to Gilgal, saying, Don't slack your hand from your servants; come up to us quickly, and save us, and help us: for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the hill country are gathered together against us.

Tailo: Lín kóng, ' Bô ah, guán beh khiâ bé lâi tsáu. ' Só͘-í, lín teh beh tsáu, koh kóng, ' Guán beh khiâ hit-ê tsin gâu tsáu ê tsing-seⁿ', só͘-í, jiok lín-.ê mā ē tsin gâu tsáu.
English: but you said, No, for we will flee on horses; therefore you will flee; and, We will ride on the swift; therefore those who pursue you will be swift.

Tailo: A-má-tsiah kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kám bô lóng kì tī Iô-tah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k? Tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ū lâng kiat-tóng beh hāi A-má-tsiah.
English: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Tailo: A-bi-ga-il tsiū kuáⁿ-kín kā nn̄g pah tè piáⁿ, nn̄g phuê-tē ê tsiú, gō͘ tsiah tsún-pī hó ê iûⁿ, gō͘ sè-a hang ê ngó͘-kok, tsi̍t pah pha ê phû-tô kuaⁿ, nn̄g pah tè ê bû-hua-kó piáⁿ, hō͘ kuí-nā tsiah lî-á phāinn.
English: Then Abigail made haste, and took two hundred loaves, and two bottles of wine, and five sheep ready dressed, and five measures of parched grain, and one hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and laid them on donkeys.

Tailo: In tsi̍t-lō͘ hō͘-sàng Páu-lô kàu A-thé-nè. Páu-lô kā in huan-hù kiò Se-la̍h kah Tî-mó͘-theh kuáⁿ-kín lâi kah i huē-ha̍p. Jiân-āu hiah-ê lâng tsiū tńg-.khì.
English: But those who escorted Paul brought him as far as Athens. Receiving a commandment to Silas and Timothy that they should come to him very quickly, they departed.

Tailo: Sì-gue̍h tshe-káu, siâⁿ lāi ki-hng tsin siong-tiōng, tì-sú hit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn lóng bô bí-niûⁿ.
English: In the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was sore in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.

Tailo: Tī lín tiong-kan ū huí-pòng lâng kah beh hō͘ lâng lâu hueh ê; tī lín tiong-kan ū tī suaⁿ tíng tsia̍h tsè-mi̍h, tī lín tiong-kan ū kiânn kan-îm.
English: Slanderous men have been in you to shed blood; and in you they have eaten on the mountains: in the midst of you they have committed lewdness.

Tailo: In-uī ông-kiong ē hong-huì, lāu-jia̍t ê siâⁿ ē líng-tsīng; suaⁿ-thâu kah tsiú-keⁿ lâu ē íng-uán tsò suaⁿ-tōng, tsò iá-lî huann-hí ê só͘-tsāi, tsò kui tīn tsing-seⁿ ê tsháu-tiûⁿ;
English: For the palace will be forsaken. The populous city will be deserted. The hill and the watchtower will be for dens forever, A delight for wild donkeys, A pasture of flocks;

Tailo: Sian-ti nā ū bāng-kìnn thang kóng-khí i ê bāng; tit-tio̍h Guá ê uē ê, tio̍h īng sîng-si̍t thuân Guá ê uē. Tsho͘-khng kah be̍h-á ná ē pí-.tit? Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: The prophet who has a dream, let him tell a dream; and he who has my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the straw to the wheat? says Yahweh.

Tailo: Kiám-tshái in ē tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng khiam-pi kî-tó, in ē huê-thâu, ta̍k lâng lī-khui i ê pháiⁿ lō͘, in-uī Siōng-tsú tuì tsiah-ê jîn-bîn só͘ kóng beh huat-tshut ê siū-khì, hit-ê siū-khì tsin tuā.
English: It may be they will present their supplication before Yahweh, and will return everyone from his evil way; for great is the anger and the wrath that Yahweh has pronounced against this people.

Tailo: U-tsi-iah kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, tuì-thâu kàu-bué, A-mô͘-su ê kiáⁿ I-sá-iah sian-ti lóng ū kì-lio̍k lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, did Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, write.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng ê Iâ-nê í-ki̍p Iâm-bù kah Mô͘-se tuì-ti̍k, tsit-má tsiah-ê lâng mā án-ne teh kah tsin-lí tuì-ti̍k. In ê sim-tsì í-king pāi-huāi, tī sìn-gióng siōng bô huat-tō͘ koh siū khó-giām.
English: Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so do these also oppose the truth; men corrupted in mind, reprobate concerning the faith.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè m̄-nā siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín ti̍k-pia̍t ê un-tián thang sìn-khò Ki-tok, mā hō͘ lín uī-tio̍h Ki-tok lâi siū khó͘,
English: Because it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ, not only to believe in him, but also to suffer on his behalf,

Tailo: Nā i só͘ thau ê, kiám-tshái gû á-.sī lî, iûⁿ, iáu ua̍h tī i ê tshiú tiong, tsiū tio̍h puê tîng-puē.
English: If the stolen property is found in his hand alive, whether it is ox, donkey, or sheep, he shall pay double.

Tailo: I tshīng ê hit niá tn̂g-phàu bak kah tsuân-sī hueh. I ê miâ kiò-tsò Siōng-tè ê tō .
English: He is clothed in a garment sprinkled with blood. His name is called The Word of God.

Tailo: Sì-bīn ê khiat-á, tn̂g tsa̍p-sì tiú, khuah tsa̍p-sì tiú; sì-kho͘-uî ê iân-piⁿ ū puàⁿ tiú, i ê té-tsō sì-kho͘-uî tsi̍t tiú. I ê kiā-tsàn ǹg tang.
English: The ledge shall be fourteen cubits long by fourteen broad in the four sides of it; and the border about it shall be half a cubit; and the bottom of it shall be a cubit round about; and the steps of it shall look toward the east.

Tailo: Mā thiaⁿ-tio̍h hiah-ê khí-lâi kong-kik guá ê lâng só͘ kóng ê, í-ki̍p kui ji̍t só͘ siat beh hāi guá ê kè-bô͘.
English: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

Tailo: Lē-bī lâng Mat-ta-thí-iah sī Khó-la̍h tso̍k Sia-lúm ê tuā-kiáⁿ, i ê tsik-jīm sī kuán-lí puânn lāi só͘ piak ê mi̍h.
English: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the office of trust over the things that were baked in pans.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t tsia̍h-mi̍h bē hō͘ lán khah tsiap-kīn Siōng-tè; bô tsia̍h bô sún-sit, tsia̍h mā bô siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik.
English: But food will not commend us to God. For neither, if we don't eat, are we the worse; nor, if we eat, are we the better.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, Siōng-tè ê thiⁿ-sài mā ē uī-tio̍h tsuē-jîn tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê lâng hué-kái lâi huann-hí.
English: Even so, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner repenting.

Tailo: Le-má-liah ê kiáⁿ Pe-kah tī Iô-tah, tsò tsi̍t ji̍t thâi-sí tsa̍p-jī bān lâng, lóng sī ióng-sū, in-uī in lī-khui Siōng-tsú — in tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè.
English: For Pekah the son of Remaliah killed in Judah one hundred twenty thousand in one day, all of them valiant men; because they had forsaken Yahweh, the God of their fathers.

Tailo: Lē-bī lâng ê tiong-kan, A-hi-iah kuán-lí Siōng-tsú tiān ê kim-khò͘ kah sìng-mi̍h ê kim-khò͘.
English: Of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated things.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h siú An-hioh-ji̍t, in-uī tse sī lín ê sìng-ji̍t, kiàn-nā huān-tio̍h tsit ji̍t ê lâng, tio̍h hō͘ i sí; só͘-ū tī tsit ji̍t tsò-kang ê, tio̍h tuì jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan kā i tsián-tû.
English: You shall keep the Sabbath therefore; for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it shall surely be put to death; for whoever does any work therein, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

Tailo: Guān I kì-liām lí it-tshè só͘ hiàn ê, tsiap-la̍p lí ê sio-tsè. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Remember all your offerings, And accept your burnt sacrifice. Selah.

Tailo: ( SBK 15:1-11 ) Siōng-tsú tī Si-nái suaⁿ huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh said to Moses in Mount Sinai,

Tailo: Tsí-ū i tsi̍t lâng ū kah guá tâng-sim, koh tsin-tsiàⁿ kuan-sim lín ê tāi-tsì.
English: For I have no one else like-minded, who will truly care about you.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Siōng-tsú án-ne kiù I-su-la-el lâng thuat-lī Ai-gi̍p lâng ê tshiú, I-su-la-el lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ai-gi̍p lâng ê sin-si tī hái piⁿ.
English: Thus Yahweh saved Israel that day out of the hand of the Egyptians; and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the seashore.

Tailo: Ông phài i só͘ uá-khò tshiú hit-ê kun-tiúⁿ kuán-lí siâⁿ mn̂g, jîn-bîn tī siâⁿ mn̂g thún-ta̍h, i tsiū sí-.khì, tsiàu Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ kóng ê, to̍h-sī ông lo̍h-lâi kìnn i ê sî só͘ kóng ê.
English: The king appointed the captain on whose hand he leaned to have the charge of the gate: and the people trod on him in the gate, and he died as the man of God had said, who spoke when the king came down to him.

Tailo: Lâng nā bô tsiap-la̍p lín, lín lī-khui in ê siâⁿ ê sî, tio̍h kā lín kha-.ni̍h ê thô͘-sua hún puāⁿ-tiāu, lâi kā in kíng-kò.
English: As many as don't receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.

Tailo: Lín ê tsîⁿ-tsâi í-king pāi-huāi, lín ê saⁿ-khò͘ mā hō͘ tsiù-thâng tsiù phuà-khì.
English: Your riches are corrupted and your garments are moth-eaten.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah.
English: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, after that the king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty to them;

Tailo: Muí pak tiùⁿ tn̂g saⁿ-tsa̍p tiú, khuah sì tiú; tsa̍p-it pak tiùⁿ lóng sī sio-siâng ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain. The eleven curtains had one measure.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h i hó phuà-pēⁿ ê lâng, hō͘ sí-lâng koh-ua̍h, hō͘ thái-ko ê lâng tshing-khì, kuáⁿ kuí. Lín pe̍h-pe̍h tit-tio̍h, mā tio̍h pe̍h-pe̍h hō͘ lâng.
English: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers , and cast out demons. Freely you received, so freely give.

Tailo: In khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsio̍h-thâu í-king tuì bōng-kháu kō-khui.
English: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Iô-tah tsi-tso̍k Hu-ul ê sun, U-lī ê kiáⁿ Be-tsa-lel, Guá í-king tsí miâ lâi kā i kíng-tiàu.
English: Behold, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah:

Tailo: Tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn siat-li̍p Io-lâm ê suah-bué kiánn A-ha-tsiah suà-tsiap i tsò ông, in-uī tuè A-la-puh lâng kàu iâⁿ ê kun-tuī, ū thâi-sí i hiah-ê tuā-kiáⁿ, án-ne Iô-tah ông Io-lâm ê kiáⁿ A-ha-tsiah tsiū tsò ông.
English: The inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah his youngest son king in his place; for the band of men who came with the Arabians to the camp had slain all the eldest. So Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah reigned.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê it-tshè ê khì-kū, Só͘-lô-móng lóng bô kuè tshìn, in-uī hui-siông tsē, tâng ê khin-tāng mā bē-tàng tsai.
English: Solomon left all the vessels unweighed, because they were exceeding many: the weight of the brass could not be found out.

Tailo: Gōng lâng khui tshuì tsiū khí uan-ke, i ê tshuì jiá-lâi hông phah.
English: A fool's lips come into strife, And his mouth invites beatings.

Tailo: M̄-thang phah-hua Sìng Sîn ê hué.
English: Don't quench the Spirit.

Tailo: Koh tī hiah-ê tsìng lâng, to̍h-sī I-su-la-el jîn-bîn, bô-lūn lâm-lí, muí lâng pun hō͘ in tsi̍t tè piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè bah kah tsi̍t tè phû-tô kuaⁿ piáⁿ; tsìng lâng tsiū lī-khui, ta̍k lâng tńg-khì in ka-kī ê tshù.
English: He dealt among all the people, even among the whole multitude of Israel, both to men and women, to everyone a cake of bread, and a portion of flesh, and a cake of raisins. So all the people departed everyone to his house.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū tshénn khí-.lâi, tsik-pī hong, koh bīng-līng tsuí-íng kóng, Tsīng lo̍h-.lâi! Hong tsiū thîng, tsuí-íng mā tiāⁿ lo̍h-.lâi.
English: He awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, Peace! Be still! The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

Tailo: A-lông tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, kin-á-ji̍t in tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng hiàn in ê sio̍k-tsuē-tsè kah sio-tsè, guá koh tú-tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, guá nā kin-á-ji̍t tsia̍h sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, Siōng-tsú kám ē khuàⁿ-tsò sī hó?
English: Aaron spoke to Moses, Behold, this day they have offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before Yahweh; and such things as these have happend to me: and if I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been pleasing in the sight of Yahweh?

Tailo: In-uī guá īng hó ê tō-lí hō͘ lín; tio̍h m̄-thang khì-sak guá ê huat-tō͘.
English: For I give you sound learning. Don't forsake my law.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, hô guā ê tsóng-tok Ta̍t-nái kah Se-tal-bo-tse-nái, í-ki̍p in ê tâng-phuāⁿ, in-uī Ta-lió-suh ông só͘ tshut ê līng, tsiū kuáⁿ-kín tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: Then Tattenai, the governor beyond the River, Shetharbozenai, and their companions, because that Darius the king had sent, did accordingly with all diligence.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú í-king bīng-līng lí khì kong-kik A-si-ke-lông, kong-kik hái piⁿ ê tē, I í-king tiāⁿ-tio̍h phài lí, lí ná ē thîng-tsí?
English: How can you be quiet, seeing Yahweh has given you a charge? Against Ashkelon, and against the seashore, there has he appointed it.

Tailo: O-ló kah tsiù-tsó͘ tuì kāng tsi̍t-ê tshuì-tsi̍h tshut-.lâi. Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, tse sī bô ing-kai ê.
English: Out of the same mouth comes forth blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so.

Tailo: tì-sú tsè-si uī-tio̍h hûn ê iân-kò͘ bē-tàng khiā-teh ho̍k-sāi, in-uī Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng tshiong-muá Siōng-tsú ê tiān.
English: so that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud; for the glory of Yahweh filled the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Lâng só͘ khí-tsō ê kang-tîng, nā bô hō͘ hué sio-.khì, tsiū ē tit-tio̍h pò-siúⁿ.
English: If any man's work remains which he built on it, he will receive a reward.

Tailo: Tī siâⁿ lāi lí ē siū tsiù-tsó͘, tī tshân-.ni̍h lí mā ē siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Cursed shall you be in the city, and cursed shall you be in the field.

Tailo: I ê bah siau-sán, bô thang khuàⁿ-.tio̍h; pîng-siông sî bô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê kut, taⁿ lóng thóng tshut-.lâi.
English: His flesh is so consumed away, that it can't be seen; His bones that were not seen stick out.

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu bô beh pó-sioh lí, Guá mā bô beh khó-liân lí, sī beh tsiàu lí ê só͘ kiâⁿ kā lí pò-ìng, lí khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì ē kui tī lí ê tiong-kan. Lín tsiū tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: My eye shall not spare you, neither will I have pity; but I will bring your ways on you, and your abominations shall be in the midst of you: and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí tuì tíng-bīn tshun tshiú kiù guá, kiù guá tshut tuā-tsuí, kiù guá thuat-lī guā-pang lâng ê tshiú.
English: Stretch out your hand from above, Rescue me, and deliver me out of great waters, Out of the hands of foreigners;

Tailo: Tú tshin-tshiūnn Iô-ná saⁿ ji̍t saⁿ mê tī tuā hî ê pak-tó͘ lāi, ( tsù, INS 1:17 ) Jîn-tsú mā beh án-ne saⁿ ji̍t saⁿ mê tī tshim-thô͘ lāi.
English: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the whale, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

Tailo: Tshîng-peh sing-tióng lâi thè tsháu-tshì, kong-liam tshiū sing-tióng lâi thè tsi̍t-lê. Tse sī beh tsò Siōng-tsú ê miâ ê kì-liām, tsò íng-uán ê tsìng-kì, bē-tàng tsián-tû.
English: Instead of the thorn shall come up the fir tree; and instead of the brier shall come up the myrtle tree: and it shall be to Yahweh for a name, for an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.

Tailo: Hông-hun ê sî, in khí-.lâi, beh khì A-lâm lâng ê iâⁿ; lâi-kàu A-lâm lâng ê iâⁿ ê piⁿ-kak liáu-āu, lí khuàⁿ, bô tsi̍t-ê lâng tī hia.
English: They rose up in the twilight, to go to the camp of the Syrians; and when they were come to the outermost part of the camp of the Syrians, behold, there was no man there.

Tailo: Si̍p-jī-kè ê tō-lí, hiah-ê tîm-lûn ê lâng kā i khuàⁿ-tsò sī gû-gōng ê; lán tsiah-ê tit-kiù ê lâng, kā i khuàⁿ-tsò sī Siōng-tè ê tuā-lîng.
English: For the word of the cross is foolishness to those who are dying, but to us who are saved it is the power of God.

Tailo: Guá mê-ji̍t īng guá ê ba̍k-sái tsún pn̄g tsia̍h; tuì-ti̍k it-ti̍t mn̄g guá kóng, Lí ê Siōng-tè tī tó-uī?
English: My tears have been my food day and night, While they continually ask me, Where is your God?

Tailo: Hi-lâm tuì Tu-lô tshut-.lâi, khuànn Só͘-lô-móng só͘ hō͘ i ê siâⁿ, khuàⁿ-liáu bô kah-ì,
English: Hiram came out from Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him; and they didn't please him.

Tailo: Hit sî, Guá hō͘ lí kah hiah-ê lo̍h im-hú ê tsò-hué lo̍h-.khì, kàu kó͘-tsá lâng hia; hō͘ lí tiàm tī tē-hā tshim ê só͘-tsāi, tuì kó͘-tsá to̍h pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi kah hiah-ê lo̍h im-hú ê lâng tông-tsāi, bô koh ū lâng tuà tī hia, tī ua̍h-lâng ê tē bô koh ū îng-kng.
English: then will I bring you down with those who descend into the pit, to the people of old time, and will make you to dwell in the lower parts of the earth, in the places that are desolate of old, with those who go down to the pit, that you be not inhabited; and I will set glory in the land of the living:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú phah-sí Bia̍t-si-mé-si lâng, in-uī in khuànn I ê iok-kuī lāi-bīn, tsiū kā in phah-sí tshit tsa̍p lâng, gō͘-bān lâng ê jîn-bîn ai-khàu, in-uī Siōng-tsú tuā-tuā phah-sí jîn-bîn.
English: He struck of the men of Beth Shemesh, because they had looked into the ark of Yahweh, he struck of the people fifty thousand seventy men; and the people mourned, because Yahweh had struck the people with a great slaughter.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ē tó-huāi kui tī bô; gī lâng ê tshù ē khiā tsāi.
English: The wicked are overthrown, and are no more, But the house of the righteous shall stand.

Tailo: Mā tio̍h buah sé-tn̄g ê phûn, kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng.
English: You shall anoint the basin and its base, and sanctify it.

Tailo: [siàu-lí] Ông tsē-toh ê sî, guá ê ná-ta̍t phang-iû tshìng-tshut i ê phang-bī.
English: While the king sat at his table, My perfume spread its fragrance.

Tailo: ta̍k lâng thâi i ê tuì-ti̍k. A-lâm lâng tô-tsáu, I-su-la-el lâng jiok in; A-lâm ông khiâ bé kah hiah-ê bé-ping tô-thuat.
English: They killed everyone his man; and the Syrians fled, and Israel pursued them: and Ben Hadad the king of Syria escaped on a horse with horsemen.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lâng nā tshing-khì mā m̄-sī tī lō͘ tiong, nā ka-kī the-sî m̄ siú Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh, tio̍h tuì i ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan kā hit-ê lâng tsián-tû, in-uī i tī só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê ji̍t bô hiàn lé-mi̍h hō͘ Siōng-tsú, hit-ê lâng tio̍h tam-tng i ka-kī ê tsuē.
English: But the man who is clean, and is not on a journey, and fails to keep the Passover, that soul shall be cut off from his people. Because he didn't offer the offering of Yahweh in its appointed season, that man shall bear his sin.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng ông tī E-tóm tē ê Âng-hái piⁿ, uá-kīn Ê-no͘k ê E-tsióng-ge-bel tsō tsi̍t tīn ê tsûn-tsiah.
English: King Solomon made a navy of ships in Ezion Geber, which is beside Eloth, on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.

Tailo: A-mí-me-li̍k kā iûⁿ, gû, lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī hō͘ A-bu-la-hàm, koh kā i ê bó͘ Sa-la̍h hîng i.
English: Abimelech took sheep and oxen, male servants and womale servants, and gave them to Abraham, and restored Sarah, his wife, to him.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng khuàⁿ-liáu tòng bē-tiâu, tik-khak ē uàn-hūn kah kā-gê tshiat-khí, beh lâi kā in siau-bia̍t; pháiⁿ lâng ê sim-guān ē kui tī khang-khang.
English: The wicked will see it, and be grieved. He shall gnash with his teeth, and melt away. The desire of the wicked will perish.

Tailo: Bīng-līng tsi̍t-ē tshut, I-su-la-el lâng tsiū tuà tsin tsē khí-thâu si̍k ê ngó͘-kok, tsiú, iû, bi̍t kah tshân-.ni̍h só͘ tshut ê, koh kā ta̍k hāng mi̍h ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it tuà tsin tsē lâi.
English: As soon as the commandment came abroad, the children of Israel gave in abundance the first fruits of grain, new wine, and oil, and honey, and of all the increase of the field; and the tithe of all things brought they in abundantly.

Tailo: Hit mê, Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá tshut-.khì, tī A-siul iâⁿ tiong phah-sí tsa̍p-peh bān gō͘ tshing lâng. Kàu thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí khí-.lâi ê sî, lí khuàⁿ, lóng sī sí-lâng ê sin-si.
English: It happened that night, that the angel of Yahweh went forth, and struck in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred eighty-five thousand: and when men arose early in the morning, behold, these were all dead bodies.

Tailo: Ông só͘ kàng ê jū-tsí piàn thuân tī i ê kok, ( i ê kok tsin khuah-tuā ) , tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū lóng ē tsun-kìng i ê tiōng-hu, bô-lūn tsun-kuì ê á-.sī pi-tsiān ê.
English: When the king's decree which he shall make shall be published throughout all his kingdom ( for it is great ) , all the wives will give to their husbands honor, both to great and small.

Tailo: Tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio-tsè kah sò͘-tsè tsò-hué hiàn; tsè-si tio̍h tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, kā hit-ê ài tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng sio̍k-tsuē.
English: even such as he is able to afford, the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, with the meal offering. The priest shall make atonement for him who is to be cleansed before Yahweh.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, lín ta̍k lâng ē tshiánn tshù-piⁿ lâi-kàu phû-tô tshiū kha kah bû-hua-kó tshiū kha. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: In that day,' says Yahweh of Armies, you will invite every man his neighbor under the vine and under the fig tree.'

Tailo: Kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t ê tsi̍h ē siong-hāi lâng; phô͘-tháⁿ ê tshuì ē pāi-huāi lâng.
English: A lying tongue hates those it hurts; And a flattering mouth works ruin.

Tailo: ( Ta-bi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) Siōng-tsú ah, Lí bē kì-tit guá beh guā kú? Kám tio̍h kàu íng-uán? Lí am bīn m̄-khuàⁿ guá beh kàu guā kú?
English: How long, Yahweh? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?
