Tailo: Guá ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, siōng iàu-kín ê sī, M̄-thang kí thiⁿ á-.sī tē á-.sī siáⁿ-mi̍h mi̍h-kiāⁿ lâi tsiù-tsuā. Sī To̍h kóng Sī , M̄-sī To̍h kóng M̄-sī , án-ne tsiah bián siū Siōng-tè sím-phuàⁿ.
English: But above all things, my brothers, don't swear, neither by heaven, nor by the earth, nor by any other oath; but let your yes be yes, and your no, no; so that you don't fall into hypocrisy.

Tailo: Bô kian-siú koh phian-lī Ki-tok kà-sī ê lâng, in ê gán-tiong bô Siōng-tè; kian-siú kà-sī ê lâng, tsiah ū kah Thiⁿ-pē í-ki̍p Kiáⁿ kiat-liân.
English: Whoever transgresses and doesn't remain in the teaching of Christ, doesn't have God. He who remains in the teaching, the same has both the Father and the Son.

Tailo: Hit sî, hiah-ê king-ha̍k kàu-su kah tsè-si-tiúⁿ tsai I-é-su tsit-ê phì-jū sī teh tsí in, tsiū ài beh tong-tiûⁿ hē tshiú lia̍h I-é-su, m̄-koh, in kiaⁿ tsìng lâng.
English: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on Him that very hour, but they feared the peoplefor they knew He had spoken this parable against them.

Tailo: Lín koh tī nn̄g-ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ê tiong-kan khui tsi̍t-ê thâm, lâi té kū tî ê tsuí. Tsóng-.sī, lín bô gióng-bōng tsō i ê, mā bô siūⁿ-tio̍h tsá to̍h tiāⁿ-tio̍h, koh lâi kā i uân-sîng ê Siōng-tè.
English: You also made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you didn't look to him who had done this, neither did you have respect for him who purposed it long ago.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah kóng,
English: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú án-ne ìn guá kóng, Lí nā tò tńg-.lâi, Guá tsiū beh hō͘ lí tò tńg-lâi khiā tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng; lí nā tuì hā-tsiān ê tiong-kan kíng pó-kuì ê tshut-.lâi, lí tsiū ē-tàng tsò Guá ê tāi-giân-jîn. In it-tīng ē kui-ǹg lí, tsóng-.sī, lí m̄-thang kui-ǹg in.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh, If you return, then will I bring you again, that you may stand before me; and if you take forth the precious from the vile, you shall be as my mouth: they shall return to you, but you shall not return to them.

Tailo: In-uī Guá kàng tsai-hō tuì hit-ê īng Guá ê miâ lâi tshing ê siâⁿ khí tshiú, lín kám ē tsuân-pō͘ bián hîng-hua̍t? It-tīng bē bián-.tit, in-uī Guá beh bīng-līng to-kiàm lîm-kàu tē-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: For, behold, I begin to work evil at the city which is called by my name; and should you be utterly unpunished? You shall not be unpunished; for I will call for a sword on all the inhabitants of the earth, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín tio̍h khak-si̍t tsai, nā hāi-sí guá, tsiū ē hō͘ bô tsuē ê hueh kui tī lín kah tsit-ê siâⁿ, í-ki̍p tuà tī kî-tiong ê jîn-bîn; in-uī Siōng-tsú si̍t-tsāi ū tshe guá kàu lín tsia, kā tsiah-ê it-tshè ê uē thuân kàu lín ê hīⁿ-khang.
English: Only know for certain that, if you put me to death, you will bring innocent blood on yourselves, and on this city, and on the inhabitants of it; for of a truth Yahweh has sent me to you to speak all these words in your ears.

Tailo: In-uī guá ê tuì-ti̍k gī-lūn guá; tng-tán beh hāi guá ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng tsò-hué tsham-siông,
English: For my enemies talk about me. Those who watch for my soul conspire together,

Tailo: Guá kiâⁿ lō͘, guá tó tī bîn-tshn̂g, Lí lóng siông-sè tsai; guá it-tshè só͘ kiâⁿ só͘ tsò, Lí mā lóng tsai.
English: You search out my path and my lying down, And are acquainted with all my ways.

Tailo: M̄-thang kah in tsing-tsiàn, in ê tē guá liân tsi̍t kha-jiah ê uī to bô beh hō͘ lín, in-uī guá í-king kā Se-il suaⁿ hō͘ E-sáu tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: don't contend with them; for I will not give you of their land, no, not so much as for the sole of the foot to tread on; because I have given Mount Seir to Esau for a possession.

Tailo: Tī lo̍k-hn̂g, i thiaⁿ-tio̍h bē tit thang kóng ê uē, to̍h-sī lâng só͘ m̄-thang kóng ê tāi-tsì.
English: how he was caught up into Paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, Sàu-lô kā jîn-bîn hun-tsò saⁿ tuī, tī gō͘-keⁿ-tsá ê sî, ji̍p-khì Am-móng lâng ê kun-iâⁿ, kā in phah-sí kàu ji̍t beh tàu, só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng lóng tsáu sì-suàⁿ, bô nn̄g-ê lâng tsò-hué tuà tsi̍t uī.
English: It was so on the next day, that Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the midst of the camp in the morning watch, and struck the Ammonites until the heat of the day: and it happened, that those who remained were scattered, so that no two of them were left together.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì hit tiong-kan the̍h kuí ki-á, lâi pa̍k tī lí ê saⁿ-á-ki.
English: You shall take of it a few in number, and bind them in your skirts.

Tailo: Lâng nā bē siâⁿ lāi ê tshù, bē liáu-āu tsi̍t nî tsiū thang sio̍k-huê; tī tsi̍t nî lāi lóng ū sio̍k-huê ê khuân-lī.
English: If a man sells a dwelling house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it has been sold. For a full year he shall have the right of redemption.

Tailo: A-lông ǹg jîn-bîn gia̍h-khí tshiú lâi, kā in tsiok-hok; i í-king hiàn sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, sio-tsè kah siā-un-tsè, tsiū lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Aaron lifted up his hands toward the people, and blessed them; and he came down from offering the sin offering, and the burnt offering, and the peace offerings.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lūn hit-ê ji̍t-tsí á-.sī hit-ê sî-khik, bô lâng tsai-iáⁿ. Thinn tíng ê thiⁿ-sài m̄-tsai, Kiáⁿ mā m̄-tsai; to̍k-to̍k Thiⁿ-pē tsai niā-niā.
English: But no one knows of that day and hour, not even the angels of heaven, but my Father only.

Tailo: Lí só͘ kóng ê lu̍t-huat tuì guá ū lī-ik, iâⁿ-kuè tshing-bān ê kim-gîn.
English: The law of your mouth is better to me than thousands of pieces of gold and silver. YUD

Tailo: Tse-bú-lông ê tsi-tso̍k kun-tuī ê thóng-líng sī Tse-lông ê kiáⁿ E-lí-ap.
English: Over the army of the tribe of the children of Zebulun was Eliab the son of Helon.

Tailo: N̂g-kim kah po-lê bē pí-tit i; sûn-kim ê khì-kū bô kàu-gia̍h kah i sio uāⁿ.
English: Gold and glass can't equal it, Neither shall it be exchanged for jewels of fine gold.

Tailo: In mā kuáⁿ-tshut tsin-tsē kuí, īng iû buah tsin tsē pēnn-lâng, kā in i hó.
English: They cast out many demons, and anointed many with oil who were sick, and healed them.

Tailo: Tshiánn Kā guá ê tshin-tsiâⁿ Hi-lô-tióng tshíng-an, mā kā Nâ-ki-sò͘ tshù lāi sìn Tsú ê lâng tshíng-an.
English: Greet Herodion, my kinsman. Greet them of the household of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.

Tailo: Mô͘-se thiaⁿ-tio̍h jîn-bîn tāi-ke tī ka-kī ê pò͘-pênn mn̂g-kháu teh thî-khàu, Siōng-tsú tuā siū-khì, Mô͘-se mā bô huann-hí.
English: Moses heard the people weeping throughout their families, every man at the door of his tent: and the anger of Yahweh was kindled greatly; and Moses was displeased.

Tailo: In ta̍k ji̍t án-ne kā i kóng, i mā m̄-thiaⁿ uē, in tsiū kā Ha-mán kóng, beh khuànn Mol-té-kái ê tāi-tsì khiā ē tiâu á-bē, in-uī Mol-té-kái ū kā in kóng i sī Iô-tah lâng.
English: Now it came to pass, when they spoke daily to him, and he didn't listen to them, that they told Haman, to see whether Mordecai's matters would stand: for he had told those who he was a Jew.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, I-é-su khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng sì-kè kiânn. I bô ài khì Iô-tá-iah síng, in-uī Iô-tá-iah lâng ài beh kā I thâi.
English: After these things, Jesus was walking in Galilee, for he wouldn't walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill him.

Tailo: Án-ne, lín tāi-ke kah só͘-ū I-su-la-el ê jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h tsai, Tsit-ê lâng ē hó-hó khiā tī lín ê bīn-tsîng, sī hōng Na-tsa-lia̍t lâng I-é-su Ki-tok ê miâ. Lín kā tsit uī I-é-su tìng tī si̍p-jī-kè, Siōng-tè hō͘ I tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h.
English: be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom you crucified, whom God raised from the dead, in him does this man stand here before you whole.

Tailo: Ông tio̍h phài kuaⁿ-uân tī i kok lāi ê ta̍k síng, hō͘ in tsio-tsi̍p só͘-ū suí ê tsāi-sik-lí lâi-kàu Su-san ê ông-kiong, kàu lú-īⁿ kau hō͘ ông ê thài-kàm He-gái, to̍h-sī tsiáng-kuán lú-tsú ê, mā tio̍h kiong-kip in tshing-khì sing-khu ê phín-liāu.
English: and let the king appoint officers in all the provinces of his kingdom, that they may gather together all the beautiful young virgins to Shushan the palace, to the house of the women, to the custody of Hegai the king's chamberlain, keeper of the women; and let cosmetics be given them;

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín tē A-ná-thot siâⁿ ê tsè-si tiong, Hil-kí-iah ê kiáⁿ I-é-lí-miah ê uē kì tī ē-té:
English: The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin:

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng ê Tah-pò͘-pêⁿ-tseh teh beh kàu à,
English: Now the feast of the Jews, the Feast of Booths, was at hand.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê tsè-si, tsit-ê bīng-līng sī hō͘ lín ê.
English: Now, you priests, this commandment is for you.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hit-ê tuì lú-pī seⁿ ê sī tsiàu sio̍k-sè lâi seⁿ, hit-ê tuì tsū-iû ê tsa-bó͘ lâng seⁿ ê sī tuì Siōng-tè ê ìng-ín lâi seⁿ.
English: However, the son by the handmaid was born according to the flesh, but the son by the free woman was born through promise.

Tailo: Guá koh beh kiù lí kah tsit-ê siâⁿ thuat-lī A-siul ông ê tshiú, mā beh pó-hō͘ tsit-ê siâⁿ. '
English: I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria, and I will defend this city.

Tailo: Kā I ê miâ só͘ ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê îng-kng kui hō͘ Siōng-tsú, tuà lé-mi̍h lâi ji̍p I ê īⁿ.
English: Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due to his name. Bring an offering, and come into his courts.

Tailo: ( Tsiàu Tsú ê lu̍t-huat kì-tsài, thâu- tsi̍t-the ê tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ lóng tio̍h sìng-pia̍t lâi kui hō͘ Tsú. )
English: ( as it is written in the law of the Lord, Every male who opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord ) ,

Tailo: Lí tsiah tui-kiù guá ê tsuē-gia̍t, tshuē guá ê tsuē-kò.
English: That you inquire after my iniquity, And search after my sin?

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm siū-tiàu khì sîng-tsiap tsò i sán-gia̍p ê tē ê sî, suî-jiân m̄-tsai beh khì tó-uī, in-uī ū sìn-sim tsiū sūn-tsiông bīng-līng tshut-.khì.
English: By faith, Abraham, when he was called, obeyed to go out to the place which he was to receive for an inheritance. He went out, not knowing where he went.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hō͘-siong hun-tam tāng-tàⁿ, án-ne tsò tsiah sī teh si̍t-hiān Ki-tok ê kà-sī.
English: Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ.

Tailo: koh tī Tsik-lak, Me-ko-nah kah i ê tsng-thâu;
English: and in Ziklag, and in Meconah and in the towns of it,

Tailo: Tio̍h tì-ì tha̍k king-tián, khuàn-bián kah kà-sī, it-ti̍t kàu guá lâi.
English: Until I come, pay attention to reading, to exhortation, and to teaching.

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, I-é-su khai-sí suan-káng tō-lí, kóng, Lín tio̍h hué-kái, in-uī thian-kok teh beh lâi-lîm!
English: From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.

Tailo: In lóng sio-siâng tó tī thô͘-.ni̍h, hō͘ thâng khàm ba̍t.
English: They lie down alike in the dust, The worm covers them.

Tailo: In-uī suí ê tshiong-ki ū tsin tsē îm-hīng, si̍p-kuàn tsò ang-î, īng i ê îm-hīng bê-hi̍k lia̍t kok, īng i ê siâ-su̍t bê-hi̍k tsin tsē tso̍k.
English: because of the multitude of the prostitution of the alluring prostitute, the mistress of witchcraft, who sells nations through her prostitution, and families through her witchcraft.

Tailo: King-kuè tsin kú, tsú-lâng tńg-.lâi, tsiū kah in sǹg-siàu.
English: Now after a long time the lord of those servants came, and reconciled accounts with them.

Tailo: Thiāu-tíng ê thiāu-táu ū tshì tsi̍t ba̍k tsi̍t ba̍k ê bāng-á kah tsi̍t khuân tsi̍t khuân ê liān-á; tsit-ê thiāu-táu ū tshit-ê liān-á, hit-ê thiāu-táu mā ū tshit-ê.
English: There were nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for the capitals which were on the top of the pillars; seven for the one capital, and seven for the other capital.

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am tsò ông, kiōng jī-tsa̍p jī nî, tsiū kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsò-hué khùn. I ê kiáⁿ Ná-tap suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: The days which Jeroboam reigned were two and twenty years: and he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Siōng-tsú tuì A-má-tsiah tuā siū-khì, tsiū tshe tsi̍t-ê sian-ti khì kìⁿ i, kóng, Hiah-ê jîn-bîn ê sîn-bîng bē-tàng kiù in ê jîn-bîn thuat-lī lí ê tshiú, lí ná ē kiû in?
English: Therefore the anger of Yahweh was kindled against Amaziah, and he sent to him a prophet, who said to him, Why have you sought after the gods of the people, which have not delivered their own people out of your hand?

Tailo: Mā in-uī lí ê pē ê Siōng-tè, I ē pang-tsān lí; koh in-uī hit-ê Tsuân-lîng-.ê, I ē kā lí sù-hok; I ē kā thinn-tíng kàng-lo̍h ê hok-khì, tshim-ian só͘ khǹg ê hok-khì, í-ki̍p tsia̍h ling sing-sán ê hok-khì, lóng hō͘ lí.
English: Even by the God of your father, who will help you, By the Almighty, who will bless you, With blessings of heaven above, Blessings of the deep that lies below, Blessings of the breasts, and of the womb.

Tailo: Tsú ê hiann-tī Iâ-kop í-guā, guá lóng bô kìⁿ-kuè kî-tha ê sù-tô͘.
English: But of the other apostles I saw no one, except James, the Lord's brother.

Tailo: Kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá tshut-lâi tuì guá kóng, Lí tio̍h gia̍h thâu khuànn tsit-ê tshut-.lâi ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: Then the angel who talked with me came forward, and said to me, Lift up now your eyes, and see what is this that is appearing.

Tailo: Nn̄g lâng tuì i kóng, Lí kah guán só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê, guán it-tīng bô uī-tio̍h hit-ê lâi huān tsuē.
English: The men said to her, We will be guiltless of this your oath which you have made us to swear.

Tailo: Án-ne, ná ē m̄-kóng, lán lâi tsò pháinn, thang hō͘ hó tāi-tsì hián-bîng? Khak-si̍t ū lâng kóng guán ū án-ne kóng, lâi kā guán tiòng-siong, tsit khuán lâng ing-kai siū tsik-hua̍t.
English: Why not ( as we are slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say ) , Let us do evil, that good may come? Those who say so are justly condemned.

Tailo: In ta̍k-ê tuà tsìn-kòng ê mi̍h, to̍h-sī gîn-khì, kim-khì, saⁿ-khò͘, kun-khì, phang-liāu, bé kah lô, ta̍k nî ū tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē.
English: They brought every man his tribute, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and clothing, armor, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò tsi̍t tè toh-á, tn̂g nn̄g tiú, khuah tsi̍t tiú, kuân tiú puàⁿ.
English: You shall make a table of acacia wood. Two cubits shall be its length, and a cubit its breadth, and one and a half cubits its height.

Tailo: Sim lāi hô͘-tô͘ ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h bîng-pi̍k, m̄-kam-guān ê lâng ē siū kà-sī.
English: They also who err in spirit will come to understanding, and those who grumble will receive instruction.

Tailo: Kng toh ji̍p-.khì, pâi-siat tíng-bīn ê mi̍h. Kng ting-tâi ji̍p-.khì, tiám i ê ting.
English: You shall bring in the table, and set in order the things that are on it. You shall bring in the lampstand, and light the lamps of it.

Tailo: Lín thau-the̍h, thâi lâng, kan-îm, lām-sám tsiù-tsuā, ǹg Ba-al sio hiuⁿ, mā tsun-thàn lín pîng-sî só͘ m̄-bat ê pa̍t tsióng sîn-bîng,
English: Will you steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and burn incense to Baal, and walk after other gods that you have not known,

Tailo: I īng tsìⁿ tē ê tsìⁿ siā ji̍p guá ê pak lāi.
English: He has caused the shafts of his quiver to enter into my kidneys.

Tailo: Guá lâu lí tī Ku-lé-té, sī ài lí tshù-lí hiah-ê pān iáu-buē tshing-tshó ê tāi-tsì, koh tsiàu guá kā lí huan-hù ê, tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ-tshī siat-li̍p tiúⁿ-ló.
English: I left you in Crete for this reason, that you would set in order the things that were lacking, and appoint elders in every city, as I directed you;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè ah, taⁿ Lí só͘ kóng-khí Lí ê lô͘-po̍k kah Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê ke, guān Lí íng-uán kā i kian-kò͘, tsiàu Lí só͘ kóng ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Now, Yahweh God, the word that you have spoken concerning your servant, and concerning his house, confirm you it forever, and do as you have spoken.

Tailo: Pàng-sak lu̍t-huat ê lâng o-ló pháiⁿ lâng; tsóng-.sī, tsip-siú lu̍t-huat ê lâng kah pháiⁿ lâng sio-tseⁿ.
English: Those who forsake the law praise the wicked; But those who keep the law contend with them.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, in hun-khui beh piàn kiâⁿ tsuân tē. A-hap ka-kī kiânn tsi̍t tiâu lō͘, O-ba-tiah mā ka-kī kiânn tsi̍t tiâu lō͘.
English: So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.

Tailo: Guá bô ài kah pháiⁿ lâng kiat-tóng, bô beh kah ok-to̍k ê lâng tsò-hué tsē.
English: I hate the assembly of evil-doers, And will not sit with the wicked.

Tailo: ( To̍k-to̍k In-uī Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ê iân-kò͘ kah Guá tī I-su-la-el tsìng tsi-tso̍k tiong só͘ kíng ê Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê iân-kò͘, i iáu ū tsi̍t tsi-tso̍k )
English: ( but he shall have one tribe, for my servant David's sake and for Jerusalem's sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel ) ;

Tailo: Má-ná-se kî-tha ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, liam-khau pun tē, to̍h-sī A-bi-e-tsel ê kiáⁿ-sun, He-li̍k ê kiáⁿ-sun, A-su-li-el ê kiáⁿ-sun, Sī-khiàm ê kiáⁿ-sun, He-huel ê kiáⁿ-sun, Se-mi-tah ê kiáⁿ-sun; tsiah-ê tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, lóng sī Iô-sé-huh ê kiáⁿ Má-ná-se ê tsa-po͘ ting.
English: So the lot was for the rest of the children of Manasseh according to their families: for the children of Abiezer, and for the children of Helek, and for the children of Asriel, and for the children of Shechem, and for the children of Hepher, and for the children of Shemida: these were the male children of Manasseh the son of Joseph according to their families.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ū tì-huī ê sim siū kám-tōng ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, tsiū pháng suaⁿ-iûⁿ mn̂g.
English: All the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun the goats' hair.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t ióng-sū ê sò͘-gia̍h kì tī ē-té: Hak-mo-nih lâng Ia-sio-be-am, i sī tsiah-ê tsiòng ê siú-líng, i bat tsò tsi̍t-ē gia̍h tshiuⁿ thâi-sí saⁿ pah lâng.
English: This is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them at one time.

Tailo: Lí ê pho̍k-pò͘ tshut siaⁿ, tshim-ian kah tshim-ian tsiū sio ho͘-ìng; Lí ê pho-lōng kah Lí ê tuā-íng lóng kā guá im-ba̍t.
English: Deep calls to deep at the noise of your waterfalls. All your waves and your billows have swept over me.

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng, tē-tsiūⁿ kah tē-hā lóng bô lâng ē-tàng hian-khui á-.sī tha̍k hit kńg tsheh.
English: No one in heaven above, or on the earth, or under the earth, was able to open the book, or to look in it.

Tailo: Guá ê Tsú, tshiánn thiaⁿ, lí tī guán tiong-kan sī ū sîn-ui ê thâu-lâng, tshut-tsāi lí tī guán ê bōng-tē lāi kíng siōng hó ê, lâi bâi-tsòng lí ê sí-lâng. Guán bô tsi̍t-ê lâng ē m̄ ín-tsún lí tī i ê bōng-tē lāi bâi-tsòng lí ê sí-lâng.
English: Hear us, my lord. You are a prince of God among us. Bury your dead in the best of our tombs. None of us will withhold from you his tomb. Bury your dead.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, taⁿ guá siá tsit tiuⁿ phue hō͘ lín, sī beh kóng, m̄-thang kah hiah-ê tsū-tshing sī Ki-tok-tô͘, khiok sī îm-luān, tham-sim, pài ngó͘-siōng, huí-pòng, hò͘ⁿ-tsiú, tsà-khi ê lâng lâi-óng, liân kah tsit khuán lâng kâng toh tsia̍h pn̄g mā m̄-thang.
English: But as it is, I wrote to you not to associate with anyone who is called a brother who is a sexual sinner, or covetous, or an idolater, or a slanderer, or a drunkard, or an extortioner. Don't even eat with such a person.

Tailo: Sa-mu-el teh hiàn sio-tsè ê sî, Hui-lī-sū lâng tsìn-tsîng lâi, beh kah I-su-la-el lâng kau-tsiàn. Τī hit ji̍t, Siōng-tsú khí tuā-siaⁿ ê luî lâi kong-kik Hui-lī-sū lâng, kā in phah-luān, in tsiū tī I-su-la-el lâng ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su.
English: As Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel; but Yahweh thundered with a great thunder on that day on the Philistines, and confused them; and they were struck down before Israel.

Tailo: I tsiū kā i ê sin-si tsòng tī ka-kī ê bōng, lâng tsiū uī i thî-khàu, kóng, Ai-ah, guá ê a-hiaⁿ!
English: He laid his body in his own grave; and they mourned over him, saying, Alas, my brother!

Tailo: Lán tio̍h hō͘-siong kuan-huâi lâi kik-lē thiàⁿ-sim kah tsò hó sū.
English: Let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good works,

Tailo: I in-uī Lí ê tsín-kiù, hō͘ i ū tuā îng-kng; Lí koh kā tsun-kuì ui-giâm siúⁿ-sù hō͘ i.
English: His glory is great in your salvation. You lay honor and majesty on him.

Tailo: A-bú-lâm kàu Ai-gi̍p ê sî, Ai-gi̍p lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng hui-siông suí.
English: It happened that when Abram had come into Egypt, the Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lu̍t-huat kàu-su khiā khí-lâi tshì-thàm I-é-su kóng, Lāu-su ah, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò tsiah ē tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā?
English: Behold, a certain lawyer stood up and tested him, saying, Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?

Tailo: hit-ê lâng to̍h-sī khí thái-ko, bô tshing-khì ê, tsè-si it-tīng tio̍h tuàn-tīng i tsò bô tshing-khì, i ê tsìng-thâu sī tī thâu-khak.
English: he is a leprous man. He is unclean. The priest shall surely pronounce him unclean. His plague is on his head.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tī sím-phuàⁿ ê sî, pháiⁿ lâng tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng khiā bē-tiâu; tsuē-jîn tī gī lâng ê huē tiong mā sī án-ne.
English: Therefore the wicked shall not stand in the judgment, Nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

Tailo: In-uī i ap-tsè sàn-tshiah lâng, koh kā i khì-sak; kiông tsiàm lâng ê tshù, mā bē-tàng khí-tsō.
English: For he has oppressed and forsaken the poor. He has violently taken away a house, and he shall not build it up.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lán sī sio̍k ji̍t-sî ê, lán tio̍h kín-sīn, īng sìn-sim kah thiàⁿ-sim tsò tsiàn-kah tshīng, īng tit-kiù ê ǹg-bāng tsò thâu-khue tì.
English: But let us, since we belong to the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and, for a helmet, the hope of salvation.

Tailo: ' Hō͘ tsheⁿ-mê-.ê kiânn m̄-tio̍h lō͘ ê, tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! ' Jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h kóng, ' A-men! '
English: Cursed be he who makes the blind to wander out of the way. All the people shall say, Amen.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng in ū lâng thiàu-bú, tshiùⁿ hô, kóng, ' Sàu-lô kā in thâi-sí ê tshing-tshing, Ta-bi̍t kā in thâi-sí ê bān-bān. ' Só͘ kóng ê, kám m̄-sī tsit-ê Ta-bi̍t?
English: Is not this David, of whom they sang one to another in dances, saying, Saul has slain his thousands, David his ten thousands?

Tailo: Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, iô-tāng tuā hái, hō͘ i ê íng huā-huā háu; bān-kun ê I-é-ho-bah sī I ê miâ.
English: For I am Yahweh your God, who stirs up the sea, so that the waves of it roar: Yahweh of Armies is his name.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá mā beh kíng ē bê-hi̍k in ê tāi-tsì, hō͘ in só͘ kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ ê lîm-kàu in; in-uī guá kiò, bô lâng ìn; guá kóng-uē, in bô beh tsun-thàn; tian-tò kiânn guá ba̍k-tsiu tiong khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê, kíng guá só͘ bô huann-hí ê.
English: I also will choose their delusions, and will bring their fears on them; because when I called, none did answer; when I spoke, they did not hear: but they did that which was evil in my eyes, and chose that in which I didn't delight.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tuì tsit-má khí, Jîn-tsú ē tsē tī kuân-lîng Siōng-tè ê tsiànn pîng. ( tsù, SPh 110:1 )
English: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.

Tailo: Ū siaⁿ tuì hûn-.ni̍h tshut-.lâi, kóng, Tsit-ê sī guá ê Kiáⁿ, guá só͘ kíng-suán ê, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ I ê uē.
English: A voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son. Listen to him!

Tailo: Koh īng E-hu-laim suaⁿ-tē ê Sī-khiàm, to̍h-sī thâi-sí-lâng ê tô-siám ê siâⁿ kah in ê kau-iá, í-ki̍p Ge-tsel kah i ê kau-iá,
English: They gave them Shechem with its suburbs in the hill country of Ephraim, the city of refuge for the manslayer, and Gezer with its suburbs,

Tailo: Tsiū hē tshiú lia̍h sù-tô͘, kā in kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ.
English: and laid hands on the apostles, and put them in public custody.

Tailo: In tsá-tsá khí-lâi tsiūⁿ-khì suaⁿ tíng, kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, guán tī tsia, guán beh tsiūⁿ-khì Siōng-tsú só͘ ìng-ín ê tē, in-uī guán ū huān tsuē.
English: They rose up early in the morning, and got them up to the top of the mountain, saying, Behold, we are here, and will go up to the place which Yahweh has promised: for we have sinned.

Tailo: Hông-hun ê sî, ū lâng tshuā tsin tsē hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin ê lâng lâi tshuē I-é-su. I īng tsi̍t kù uē kuáⁿ-tshut hiah-ê siâ-sîn, koh i hó só͘-ū ê pēnn-lâng.
English: When evening came, they brought to him many possessed with demons. He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick;

Tailo: Koh hō͘ in ê kiáⁿ-jî king-kuè hué, mā īng tsiam-pok kah siâ-su̍t, tshut-bē ka-kī khì kiâⁿ Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, kik I ê siū-khì.
English: They caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire, and used divination and enchantments, and sold themselves to do that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, to provoke him to anger.

Tailo: I tiāⁿ-tio̍h hong ê khin-tāng, koh niû tsuí ê tsē-tsió.
English: He establishes the force of the wind; Yes, he measures out the waters by measure.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsiàu hí-nî āu ê nî-hān, tuì tshù-piⁿ bé, i mā tio̍h tsiàu siu-sîng ê nî-hān bē hō͘ lín.
English: According to the number of years after the Jubilee you shall buy from your neighbor. According to the number of years of the crops he shall sell to you.

Tailo: Guá í-king king-li̍k hit-ê hó ê tsing-tsiàn, í-king uân-sîng tio̍h pháu-tsáu ê lō͘-thîng, í-king kian-siú tio̍h tshî-siú ê sìn-gióng.
English: I have fought the good fight. I have finished the course. I have kept the faith.

Tailo: Guá koh īng bu̍t-io̍h, tîm-hiuⁿ kah jio̍k-kuì, hiù guá ê bîn-tshn̂g.
English: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

Tailo: Guān Siōng-tsú kàm-tshat lín, sím-phuàⁿ lín, in-uī lín hō͘ guán tī Huâ-láu kah i ê jîn-sîn bīn-tsîng ū tshàu-miâ, īng to hē tī in ê tshiú lâi thâi guán.
English: and they said to them, May Yahweh look at you, and judge, because you have made us a stench to be abhorred in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to kill us.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá kā tuì Siōng-tè só͘ thiaⁿ ê tsin-lí lâi kā lín kóng, lín suah beh thâi guá; A-bu-la-hàm pīng bô tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì.
English: But now you seek to kill me, a man who has told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham didn't do this.

Tailo: A-ha-tsiah bih tī Sa-má-lī-a, E-hú teh tshuē i, lâng kā i lia̍h-.lâi, ah i lâi-kàu E-hú hia, tsiū kā i thâi-sí, lâng kā i bâi-tsòng; in-uī in kóng, i sī hit-ê tsuan-sim tsáu-tshuē Siōng-tsú ê Iô-sa-huat ê kiáⁿ. Án-ne, A-ha-tsiah ê ke tsiū bô ū kuân-li̍k thang pó-siú kok-uī ê.
English: He sought Ahaziah, and they caught him ( now he was hiding in Samaria ) , and they brought him to Jehu, and killed him; and they buried him, for they said, He is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought Yahweh with all his heart. The house of Ahaziah had no power to hold the kingdom.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng mā tshe lâng khì kìⁿ Hi-lâm, kóng,
English: Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,

Tailo: I īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò huē-bō͘ ê khiā-pán.
English: He made the boards for the tent of acacia wood, standing up.

Tailo: Koh ū kó͘-tshue ê hiáng-siaⁿ kah kóng-uē ê siann. Thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng khún-kiû Siōng-tè, mài koh tuì in kóng uē,
English: the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words; which those who heard it begged that not one more word should be spoken to them,

Tailo: I-é-su tuì in kóng, Lín tio̍h siat-huat hō͘ in tsia̍h. In kóng, Lán tsia kan-tāⁿ ū gō͘ tè piáⁿ, nn̄g bué hî. Guán nā bô khì bé, ná ū kàu tsiah-ê kûn-tsiòng tsia̍h?
English: But he said to them, You give them something to eat. They said, We have no more than five loaves and two fish, unless we should go and buy food for all these people.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng tsiù-tsó͘ i ê lāu-pē, mā bô kā i ê lāu-bú tsiok-hok.
English: There is a generation that curses their father, And doesn't bless their mother.

Tailo: Hì-lāng lāu-pē, khuànn-khin koh m̄ tsun-thàn lāu-bú ê uē ê lâng, in ê ba̍k-tsiu ē hō͘ suaⁿ-kok tiong ê o͘-a tok tshut-.lâi, ē hō͘ ing-á-kiáⁿ tsia̍h lo̍h-pak.
English: The eye that mocks at his father, And scorns obedience to his mother: The ravens of the valley shall pick it out, The young eagles shall eat it.

Tailo: Ông kā i kóng, Lí thang tsiàu i ê uē kiânn, kā i phah-sí koh bâi-tsòng, thang hō͘ Io-ap bô-iân bô-kò͘ lâu lâng ê hueh ê hit-ê tsuē bô kui tī guá kah guá lāu-pē ê ke.
English: The king said to him, Do as he has said, and fall on him, and bury him; that you may take away the blood, which Joab shed without cause, from me and from my father's house.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h ka-kī guî-kip, in-uī jîn-bîn siū khún-pik, ka-kī tsiū bih tī suaⁿ-tōng, tshiū-nâ, tsio̍h-hia̍t, hiám-iàu ê só͘-tsāi kah tshim kheⁿ.
English: When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait ( for the people were distressed ) , then the people did hide themselves in caves, and in thickets, and in rocks, and in coverts, and in pits.

Tailo: Guá beh tī Lí ê kài-bīng tiong ka-kī khuài-lo̍k, tsiah-ê kài-bīng sī guá pîng-sî só͘ ì-ài ê.
English: I will delight myself in your commandments, Because I love them.

Tailo: Bô-lūn siáⁿ lâng tī tshân-iá bong-tio̍h hō͘ to thâi-sí ê, á-.sī sin-si, á-.sī lâng ê kut-thâu, á-.sī hûn-bōng, tsiū ē tshit ji̍t bô tshing-khì.
English: Whoever in the open field touches one who is slain with a sword, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k in ê kiáⁿ-jî puē-gi̍k Guá, bô sūn-ho̍k Guá ê lu̍t-lē, mā bô siú Guá ê huat-tō͘ lâi kiâⁿ, ( Tsiū-sī lâng nā tsiàu án-ne kiânn, i tsiū ē tuì án-ne lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā ) ; in huān-tio̍h Guá ê An-hioh-ji̍t. Guá tsiū kóng, Guá beh kā Guá ê tuā siū-khì piànn tī in ê tíng-bīn, tī khòng-iá tsuân-pō͘ tsiânn Guá ê siū-khì, lâi kā i kong-kik.
English: But the children rebelled against me; they didn't walk in my statutes, neither kept my ordinances to do them, which if a man do, he shall live in them; they profaned my Sabbaths. Then I said I would pour out my wrath on them, to accomplish my anger against them in the wilderness.

Tailo: Lí ê kiáⁿ-jî ē tsin kín tò tńg-.lâi; huí-huāi lí ê kah hō͘ lí pha-hng ê beh lī-khui lí tshut-.khì.
English: Your children make haste; your destroyers and those who made you waste shall go forth from you.

Tailo: Io-ho-iá-tah tsiū tī Siōng-tsú kah ông í-ki̍p jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan li̍p-iok, hō͘ in tsò Siōng-tsú ê tsú-bîn, koh tī ông kah jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan li̍p-iok.
English: Jehoiada made a covenant between Yahweh and the king and the people, that they should be Yahweh's people; between the king also and the people.

Tailo: A-lông ê kiáⁿ-sun tio̍h kā i sio tī tuâⁿ-.ni̍h sio-tsè ê tíng-bīn, to̍h-sī tī hué-.ni̍h ê tshâ, tse sī hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè.
English: Aaron's sons shall burn it on the altar on the burnt offering, which is on the wood that is on the fire: it is an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Yahweh.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tuì Ai-gi̍p khí-lâi jī-tsa̍p huè í-siōng ê lâng, tsua̍t-tuì bē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá tuì A-bu-la-hàm, Í-sak, Iâ-kop, tsiù-tsuā ìng-ín ê tē, in-uī in bô tsuan-sim kin-tuè Guá.
English: Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; because they have not wholly followed me:

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng hui-siông siū-khì, tsiū tsò-hué tsham-siông beh án-tsuáⁿ lâi tuì-hù I-é-su.
English: But they were filled with rage, and talked with one another about what they might do to Jesus.

Tailo: Hit sî, I-é-su tuì hiah-ê lâng kóng, Lín gia̍h to kah thuî-á tshut-lâi lia̍h guá, tshin-tshiūnn beh lia̍h thó͘-huí, sī-.bô? Guá ta̍k ji̍t tī sìng-tiān lāi tsē-.leh kà-sī lâng, lín bô lâi kā guá lia̍h.
English: In that hour Jesus said to the multitudes, Have you come out as against a robber with swords and clubs to seize me? I sat daily in the temple teaching, and you didn't arrest me.

Tailo: Khí-.lâi! Mā hō͘ gín-á khí-.lâi, īng lí ê tshiú kā i khan-.leh, Guá beh hō͘ i tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā kok.
English: Get up, lift up the boy, and hold him in your hand. For I will make him a great nation.

Tailo: Τuì I-su-la-el lâng ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ, bô-lūn sī lâng á-.sī tsing-seⁿ, Mô͘-se muí gō͘-tsa̍p thiu tsi̍t, kau hō͘ kò͘-siú Siōng-tsú huē-bō͘ ê Lē-bī lâng, sī tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘-se ê.
English: even of the children of Israel's half, Moses took one drawn out of every fifty, both of man and of animal, and gave them to the Levites, who kept the charge of the tent of Yahweh; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Tī sím-phuàⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí, Ni-ne-beh lâng beh kah tsit sè-tāi ê lâng tsò-hué ua̍h khí-.lâi, kā tsit sè-tāi ê lâng tīng tsuē; in-uī in thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iô-ná ê thuân-tō lâi hué-kái; hô-hòng tī tsia ū pí Iô-ná khah uí-tāi-.ê.
English: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, someone greater than Jonah is here.

Tailo: Kiânn huí-bia̍t ê ē kàu ta̍k-ê siâⁿ, bô tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ ē bián-.tit. Suaⁿ-kok ē tì-kàu sue-pāi, pîng-guân ē siū huí-huāi; tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ kóng ê.
English: The destroyer shall come on every city, and no city shall escape; the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be destroyed; as Yahweh has spoken.

Tailo: I tī in ê thâu-tsîng tshe tsi̍t-ê lâng sing khì, to̍h-sī Iô-sé-huh siū bē khì tsò lô͘-lē.
English: He sent a man before them. Joseph was sold for a slave.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā in kóng: Lín tāi-tāi ê kiáⁿ-sun, kiàn-nā sing-khu ū ù-uè lâi tshin-kīn I-su-la-el lâng só͘ hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, kui hō͘ Siōng-tsú tsò sìng-mi̍h ê, hit-ê lâng tio̍h tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng tsián-tû. Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: Tell them, If anyone of all your seed throughout your generations approaches the holy things, which the children of Israel make holy to Yahweh, having his uncleanness on him, that soul shall be cut off from before me. I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Kuè sì-tsa̍p kang, nó͘-ah khui i só͘ tsò tuā tsûn ê thang-á.
English: It happened at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made,

Tailo: Tsuân-siânn ê lâng lóng tsū-tsi̍p tī mn̂g-kháu.
English: All the city was gathered together at the door.

Tailo: M̄-nā án-ne, i siū tsìng kàu-huē suán-phài lâi tsò guán lí-hîng ê tâng-phuāⁿ, tsham-ú guán tsit-hāng tsû-siān kang-tsok; tsit-ê kang-tsok sī beh kui îng-kng hō͘ Tsú, mā piáu-sī guán huann-hí kam-guān án-ne tsò.
English: Not only so, but who was also appointed by the assemblies to travel with us in this grace, which is served by us to the glory of the Lord himself, and to show our readiness.

Tailo: M̄-thang kuáⁿ-kín lī-khui ông ê bīn-tsîng, m̄-thang kú-tn̂g tiàm tī pháiⁿ tāi, in-uī pháiⁿ lâng huân-sū lóng tsiàu ka-kī ê sim-ì lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Don't be hasty to go out of his presence. Don't persist in an evil thing, for he does whatever pleases him,

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah koh tuì Tse-ti-kiah ông kóng, Guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tik-tsuē lí, á-.sī tik-tsuē lí ê jîn-sîn kah tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, tsiah hō͘ lí kā guá kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ?
English: Moreover Jeremiah said to king Zedekiah, Wherein have I sinned against you, or against your servants, or against this people, that you have put me in prison?

Tailo: I tsi̍t ē tshuē-.tio̍h, tsiū kiò pîng-iú kah tshù-piⁿ lâi, kā in kóng, ' Lâi kah guá tàu huann-hí, in-uī guá phah-m̄-kiàn ê gîn-á í-king tshuē-.tio̍h. '
English: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost.'

Tailo: tsè-si tio̍h tshut hit king tshù, kàu tshù mn̂g-kháu, hong hit king tshù tshit ji̍t.
English: then the priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tsù-ì teh khuàⁿ, lóng khuàⁿ-tsò sī hó. Tshin-tshiūnn huān-nā ông só͘ tsò ê, tsìng lâng lóng khuàⁿ-tsò sī hó.
English: All the people took notice of it, and it pleased them; as whatever the king did pleased all the people.

Tailo: Guá ē tshe tsi̍t-ê gín-á, kóng, ' Lí khì tshuē hiah-ê tsìnn. ' Guá nā kā gín-á kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, tsìnn tī lí tsit pîng, tio̍h khioh khí-.lâi. ' Lí tsiū thang tńg-.lâi; guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú lâi tsiù-tsuā, lí ē ū pîng-an bô hāi.
English: Behold, I will send the boy, saying, Go, find the arrows. If I tell the boy, Behold, the arrows are on this side of you; take them, and come; for there is peace to you and no hurt, as Yahweh lives.

Tailo: I koh tī Iô-tah ê suaⁿ khí suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, hō͘ tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn kiânn siâ-îm, koh iú-hi̍k Iô-tah lâng.
English: Moreover he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and made the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the prostitute, and led Judah astray.

Tailo: I uī-tio̍h siū uan-óng ê lâng sin-uan, siúⁿ-sù tsia̍h-mi̍h hō͘ iau-gō ê. Siōng-tsú tháu-pàng siū kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ ê lâng,
English: Who executes justice for the oppressed; Who gives food to the hungry. Yahweh frees the prisoners.

Tailo: I ê thiāu sī īng gîn tsò ê, i ê té sī īng kim tsò ê, i ê tiām sī tsí-sik ê, kî-tiong sī īng Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tsìng tsa-bó͘ gín-á ê ài-tsîng pho͘ ê.
English: He made its pillars of silver, Its bottom of gold, its seat of purple, Its midst being paved with love, From the daughters of Jerusalem.

Tailo: In-uī ē ū tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm tshut-.lâi, ē ū tô-tsáu ê lâng tuì Si-óng suaⁿ lâi; bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ê jia̍t-sim ē uân-sîng tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: For out of Jerusalem a remnant will go forth, and survivors will escape from Mount Zion. The zeal of Yahweh of Armies will perform this.'

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Hó, hō͘ lí ē-tàng khuànn-kìnn! Lí ê sìn-sim kiù-tio̍h lí à.
English: Jesus said to him, Receive your sight. Your faith has healed you.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tiong nā ū lâng tshò-gō͘ huān tsuē, kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng m̄-thang kiânn ê tsi̍t hāng sū, tì-sú ū tsuē,
English: If anyone of the common people sins unwittingly, in doing any of the things which Yahweh has commanded not to be done, and is guilty;

Tailo: Koh tsò liān-á an-tì tī thiāu-táu, koh tsò sia̍h-liû tsi̍t pah lia̍p, an-tì tī liān-á ê tíng-bīn.
English: He made chains in the oracle, and put them on the tops of the pillars; and he made one hundred pomegranates, and put them on the chains.

Tailo: I tshut bīng-līng kā in i hó, kiù in thuat-lī sí-bông.
English: He sends his word, and heals them, And delivers them from their graves.

Tailo: It-sa-kal tsi-tso̍k ū tì-sik koh bat sî-sè, tsai I-su-la-el só͘ tio̍h kiânn ê, in ê thâu-lâng ū nn̄g-pah-ê, in ê hiann-tī lóng tsun-thàn hiah-ê thâu-lâng ê bīng-līng.
English: Of the children of Issachar, men who had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, the heads of them were two hundred; and all their brothers were at their commandment.

Tailo: Guá ū khui tséⁿ lim guā-pang ê tsuí, guá īng kha-tsiúⁿ ta̍h Ai-gi̍p só͘-ū ê hô, hō͘ i ta-.khì.
English: I have dug and drunk strange waters, and with the sole of my feet will I dry up all the rivers of Egypt.

Tailo: Bô-lūn tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì, lóng bô hō͘ tuì-ti̍k phah tio̍h-kiaⁿ, án-ne thang tsìng-bîng in ē sit-pāi, lín ē tik-sìng. Tsit-ê tik-sìng lóng sī Siōng-tè ê tsok-uî.
English: and in nothing frightened by the adversaries, which is for them a proof of destruction, but to you of salvation, and that from God.

Tailo: Ta̍k lâng ē in-uī ka-kī ê tsuē lâi sí; kiàn-nā tsia̍h sng ê phû-tô ê, in ê tshuì-khí ē nńg-.khì.
English: But everyone shall die for his own iniquity: every man who eats the sour grapes, his teeth shall be set on edge.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lín khuànn-khin sàn-tshiah lâng. Kî-si̍t, kā lín khi-ap koh thua lín khì huat-tîng ê, kám m̄-sī hiah-ê hó-gia̍h lâng?
English: But you have dishonored the poor man. Don't the rich oppress you, and personally drag you before the courts?

Tailo: Lín tsò lāu-pē ê lâng, lí ê kiáⁿ kā lí thó piáⁿ, lín kám ē the̍h tsio̍h-thâu hō͘ i?
English: Or who is there among you, who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

Tailo: Bo̍k-tsiá, lín tio̍h ai-khàu tuā-siaⁿ huah; iûⁿ-kûn ê thâu-ba̍k, lín tio̍h kō tī hué-hu tiong; in-uī lín siū thâi kah hun-suànn ê ji̍t-kî í-king kàu. Lín ē tó lo̍h-.khì, tshin-tshiūnn lâng só͘ huann-hí ê khì-kū ka-la̍uh.
English: Wail, you shepherds, and cry; and wallow in ashes, you principal of the flock; for the days of your slaughter and of your dispersions are fully come, and you shall fall like a goodly vessel.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ Ai-gi̍p tē tī hi-bî ê lia̍t pang tiong tsiâⁿ-tsò hi-bî; i ê siâⁿ tī hong-huì ê siâⁿ tiong piàn-tsò hong-huì, king-kuè sì-tsa̍p nî. Guá mā beh kā Ai-gi̍p lâng hun-suànn tī lia̍t kok, sì-suàⁿ khì tī lia̍t pang.
English: I will make the land of Egypt a desolation in the midst of the countries that are desolate; and her cities among the cities that are laid waste shall be a desolation forty years; and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tsai koh siong-sìn Siōng-tè thiàⁿ lán. Siōng-tè to̍h-sī thiàⁿ; sèⁿ-miā lāi ū thiàⁿ ê lâng, to̍h-sī ua̍h tī Siōng-tè lāi-bīn, Siōng-tè mā kah i kiat-liân.
English: We know and have believed the love which God has for us. God is love, and he who remains in love remains in God, and God remains in him.

Tailo: kā Iô-tah suaⁿ-tē ê Ki-lia̍t-a-ba, ( Tsiū-sī He-bú-lông ) kah i sì-kho͘-uî ê kau-iá hō͘ in. Al-bah sī A-lap tso̍k ê tsó͘-sian.
English: They gave them Kiriath Arba, which Arba was the father of Anak ( the same is Hebron ) , in the hill country of Judah, with the suburbs of it round about it.

Tailo: Tio̍h thàn Siōng-tsú thang tshuē-tio̍h ê sî lâi tshuē I, tī I sio uá-kīn ê sî kiû-kiò I.
English: Seek you Yahweh while he may be found; call you on him while he is near:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù guá kóng,
English: that Yahweh spoke to me, saying,

Tailo: Ông koh tshe tsi̍t-ê khiâ bé ê khì, i lâi-kàu in hia, kóng, Ông án-ne kóng, sī pîng-an? E-hú kóng, Pîng-ána bô kah lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khan-liân? Lí ua̍t-lâi tuè guá ê āu-bīn!
English: Then he sent out a second on horseback, who came to them, and said, Thus says the king, Is it peace? Jehu answered, What have you to do with peace? turn you behind me.

Tailo: Lán ê tsó͘-sian m̄-khíng thiaⁿ i ê uē, tian-tò kā i kī-tsua̍t, siūⁿ beh tò tńg-khì Ai-gi̍p.
English: to whom our fathers wouldn't be obedient, but rejected him, and turned back in their hearts to Egypt,

Tailo: I-é-su kah sù-tô͘ tsò-hué ê sî, kā in huan-hù kóng, M̄-thang lī-khui Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tsiàu guá tsîng kā lín kóng ê, lín tio̍h thìng-hāu Thiⁿ-pē ê ìng-ín.
English: Being assembled together with them, he charged them, Don't depart from Jerusalem, but wait for the promise of the Father, which you heard from me.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh tsiàu tsiah-ê siâⁿ-ip tshian-suá Ai-gi̍p ê jîn-bîn, tuì Ai-gi̍p tsit pîng kàu tī hit pîng.
English: As for the people, he moved them to the cities from one end of the border of Egypt even to the other end of it.

Tailo: Lí m̄-thang tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kuè-ke, khióng-kiaⁿ i ē thó-ià lí, uàn-hūn lí.
English: Let your foot be seldom in your neighbor's house, Lest he be weary of you, and hate you.

Tailo: Io-buh, lí tio̍h tsù-ì lâi thiaⁿ; tio̍h khiā-teh lâi siūⁿ Siōng-tè kî-biāu ê tāi-tsì.
English: Listen to this, Job: Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

Tailo: Lín kàu hia, ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h an-jiân teh tuà ê jîn-bîn, só͘-tsāi mā khui-khuah. Siōng-tè í-king kā hit-ê só͘-tsāi kau tī lín ê tshiú, tē-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê mi̍h, hit só͘-tsāi bô khiàm kah tsi̍t hāng.
English: When you go, you shall come to a people secure, and the land is large; for God has given it into your hand, a place where there is no want of anything that is in the earth.

Tailo: Hit-ê huān-lâng kóng, I-é-su ah, Lí tsò ông lâi-lîm ê sî, tshiánn ē kì-tit guá!
English: He said to Jesus, Lord, remember me when you come into your Kingdom.

Tailo: Guá kóng: Lín tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōng-tsú ê uē, hīⁿ-khang tio̍h thiaⁿ I ê tshuì só͘ kóng ê uē, tio̍h kà-sī lín ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ thî-khàu, ta̍k-ê tio̍h kà-sī in ê tshù-piⁿ tshiùnn ai-ko.
English: Yet hear the word of Yahweh, you women, and let your ear receive the word of his mouth; and teach your daughters wailing, and everyone her neighbor lamentation.

Tailo: Tuì taⁿ í-āu, bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng lóng m̄-thang kā guá kiáu-jiáu, in-uī guá ê sing-khu ū tuà I-é-su ê siong-jiah, tsìng-bîng guá sī I ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: From now on, let no one cause me any trouble, for I bear the marks of the Lord Jesus branded on my body.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng, taⁿ Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ài lí siáⁿ-mi̍h? Kám m̄-sī to̍k-to̍k ài lí kìng-uì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, kiânn I it-tshè ê tō-lō͘, thiàⁿ I, tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè,
English: Now, Israel, what does Yahweh your God require of you, but to fear Yahweh your God, to walk in all his ways, and to love him, and to serve Yahweh your God with all your heart and with all your soul,

Tailo: Tsit-ê pháiⁿ ê jîn-bîn m̄-khíng thiaⁿ Guá ê uē, tsiàu in pháiⁿ ê ngē-sim khì kiâⁿ, koh tsun-thàn pa̍t tsióng ê sîn-bîng, kā i ho̍k-sāi, kā i kuī-pài, in ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tsit tiâu bô lō͘-īng ê tuà.
English: This evil people, who refuse to hear my words, who walk in the stubbornness of their heart, and are gone after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, shall even be as this belt, which is profitable for nothing.

Tailo: Kah tì-huī ê lâng tsò-hué kiânn ē tsiâⁿ-tsò tì-huī; kah gû-gōng ê lâng tsò-phuāⁿ ē siū sún-siong.
English: One who walks with wise men grows wise, But a companion of fools suffers harm.

Tailo: Taⁿ ông nā lia̍h-tsò hó, tshiánn tshâ-khó ông tī Ba-bú-lông ê kok-khò͘, khuànn Ko-le-si ông kó-jiân ū kàng-tsiàu tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm khí Siōng-tè hit king tiān á-bô. Tshiánn ông tī tsit-ê tāi-tsì kàng tsí lâi kā guán tsí-sī.
English: Now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let there be search made in the king's treasure house, which is there at Babylon, whether it be so, that a decree was made of Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem; and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.

Tailo: Guán khuàⁿ-tio̍h kaⁿ-mn̂g kuainn kah tsin tiâu, kò͘-siú ê lâng khiā tī mn̂g-kháu; kaⁿ mn̂g khui ê sî, lāi-bīn tshuē bô lâng.
English: We found the prison shut and locked, and the guards standing before the doors, but when we opened them, we found no one inside!

Tailo: Guán tsua̍t-tuì ē tsiânn guán ê tshuì só͘ kóng it-tshè ê uē, ǹg thian-hō͘ sio hiuⁿ, kuàn-tiān, tsiàu guán kah guán ê tsó͘-sian, guán ê kun-ông, guán ê kuì-tso̍k, tī Iô-tah tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê ke-lō͘, pîng-sî só͘ kiâⁿ ê kāng-khuán; in-uī hit sî, guán ê tsia̍h-mi̍h tshiong-tsiok, hióng-siū pîng-an, pīng bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsai-hō.
English: But we will certainly perform every word that is gone forth out of our mouth, to burn incense to the queen of the sky, and to pour out drink offerings to her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then had we plenty of food, and were well, and saw no evil.

Tailo: In-uī I ē kiù lí thuat-lī tng tsiáu-á ê lô-bāng kah to̍k-hāi ê un-i̍k.
English: For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler, And from the deadly pestilence.

Tailo: Ná-than tsiū tsiàu tsiah-ê uē, tsiah-ê bi̍k-sī, khì kā Ta-bi̍t kóng.
English: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak to David.

Tailo: I-é-su koh tuì līng-guā tsi̍t-ê lâng kóng, Lâi tuè Guá! Hit-ê lâng ìn kóng, Tsú ah, hō͘ guá tńg-khì sing bâi-tsòng guá ê lāu-pē.
English: He said to another, Follow me! But he said, Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.

Tailo: Hi-lâm koh tsò phûn, thuh-á kah puâⁿ. Tsiū án-ne, Hi-lâm uī-tio̍h Só͘-lô-móng ông tsò uân Siōng-tsú ê tiān it-tshè ê kang.
English: Hiram made the basins, and the shovels, and the basins. So Hiram made an end of doing all the work that he worked for king Solomon in the house of Yahweh:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì I ê tsú-bîn kóng, Lín tio̍h tī lia̍t kok tiong khuànn, koh tio̍h lâi su-khó, lín tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì; in-uī tng lín ê ji̍t, Guá beh kiâⁿ tsi̍t hāng sū, suî-jiân kā lín kóng, lín mā m̄-sìn.
English: Look among the nations, watch, and wonder marvelously; for I am working a work in your days, which you will not believe though it is told you.

Tailo: Siōng-tè m̄-bat pàng-sak I tsá to̍h kíng-suán ê tsú-bîn. Lín kám m̄-tsai king-tián ū kì-tsài kuan-hē E-li-iah tuì Siōng-tè khòng-kò I-su-la-el lâng ê tāi-tsì?
English: God didn't reject his people, which he foreknew. Or don't you know what the Scripture says about Elijah? How he pleads with God against Israel:

Tailo: Lí huat-tshut tuā ui-giâm, tshia-tó hiah-ê khí-lâi kong-kik Lí ê; Lí huat-tshut tuā siū-khì, kā in sio-huí tshin-tshiūnn teh sio tsháu.
English: In the greatness of your excellency, you overthrow those who rise up against you: You send forth your wrath. It consumes them as stubble.

Tailo: Ka-le̍p ê sió-tī Ke-ná-juh ê kiáⁿ Ot-ni-el kā i tsing-ho̍k, i tsiū kā i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Ak-sa̍h hō͘ Ot-ni-el tsò bó͘.
English: Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter as wife.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tsò tsi̍t hāng sin ê tāi-tsì, taⁿ teh hián-hiān, lín kám m̄-tsai? Guá beh tī khòng-iá khui tō-lō͘, tī sua-bô͘ khui kang-hô.
English: Behold, I will do a new thing; now shall it spring forth; shall you not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers in the desert.

Tailo: Kiau-ngō͘ bô tsun-thàn Lí lu̍t-huat ê lâng, ku̍t hām-kheⁿ beh hāi guá.
English: The proud have dug pits for me, Contrary to your law.

Tailo: I ê tē-ki tshāi tī siáⁿ-mi̍h ê tíng-bīn? Á-sī i kak-thâu ê tsio̍h sī siáⁿ lâng an-tì?
English: Whereupon were the foundations of it fastened? Or who laid its cornerstone,

Tailo: Lâng huān-tio̍h thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu, mā bô la̍t thang tsún-pī tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lé-mi̍h, hit-ê kui-lē sī án-ne.
English: This is the law for him in whom is the plague of leprosy, who is not able to afford the sacrifice for his cleansing.

Tailo: Guán tsin kín-sīn lâi tshù-lí lâng khóng-khài hōng-hiàn ê tsîⁿ-hāng, tsiah bián ín-khí lâng ê phue-phîng.
English: We are avoiding this, that any man should blame us concerning this abundance which is administered by us.

Tailo: In só͘ tio̍h tsò ê saⁿ, to̍h-sī pó͘-kuà, tsè-si ho̍k, guā-phàu, ū hue ê lāi-saⁿ, bō, io-tuà. In tio̍h kā lí ê a-hiaⁿ A-lông kah i ê kiáⁿ tsò sìng ê saⁿ, hō͘ i tsò tsè-si lâi ho̍k-sāi Guá.
English: These are the garments which they shall make: a breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a coat of checker work, a turban, and a sash: and they shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, and his sons, that he may minister to me in the priest's office.

Tailo: Tik-khak bô lâng tuà tī hia, mā bô lâng kià-kha tī hia, ē tshin-tshiūⁿ So͘-tóm, Am-mo͘-la̍h, kah hù-kīn ê siâⁿ tó-huāi.
English: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbor cities of it, says Yahweh, no man shall dwell there, neither shall any son of man sojourn therein.

Tailo: Lín gō͘-ê lâng ē kuáⁿ-tsáu tsi̍t pah-ê lâng, lín tsi̍t pah-ê lâng ē kuáⁿ-tsáu tsi̍t-bān-ê lâng, tuì-ti̍k ē tī lín ê bīn-tsîng tó tī to hā.
English: Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall chase ten thousand; and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.

Tailo: Guá só͘ ì-ài ê sī jīn-bat Ki-tok, koh thé-giām I koh-ua̍h ê kuân-lîng kah I tsò-hué siū khó͘, king-giām I ê sí,
English: that I may know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, becoming conformed to his death;

Tailo: Hit sî, tiàm tī ông-kiong mn̂g lāi ê ông ê jîn-sîn kā Mol-té-kái kóng, Lí ná ē uî-puē ông ê bīng-līng?
English: Then the king's servants, who were in the king's gate, said to Mordecai, Why disobey you the king's commandment?

Tailo: Lín kóng: Tsit-ê só͘-tsāi sī pha-hng, bô lâng, bô tsing-seⁿ, sī kau hō͘ Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tshiú ê. Tsiong-lâi lâng ē koh tī tsit só͘-tsāi bé tshân-hn̂g.
English: Fields shall be bought in this land, about which you say, It is desolate, without man or animal; it is given into the hand of the Chaldeans.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t ông tuì huē-tsiòng kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ Só͘-lô-móng sī Siōng-tsú ti̍k-pia̍t kíng-suán ê, iáu-koh siàu-liân iù-tsíⁿ; tsit-ê kang-tîng tsin tuā, in-uī tsit-ê tiān m̄-sī uī-tio̍h lâng, to̍h-sī uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè khí ê.
English: David the king said to all the assembly, Solomon my son, whom alone God has chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great; for the palace is not for man, but for Yahweh God.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Lâi-kàu lō͘ piⁿ ê iûⁿ-tiâu, tī hia ū tōng, Sàu-lô ji̍p-khì beh tāi-piān. Ta-bi̍t kah tuè i ê lâng bih tī tōng lāi khah tshim ê só͘-tsāi.
English: He came to the sheep pens by the way, where was a cave; and Saul went in to relieve himself. Now David and his men were abiding in the innermost parts of the cave.

Tailo: Ta̍k lâng tio̍h tsiàu Tsú siúⁿ-sù ê un-sù, tsiàu Siōng-tè kíng-tiàu ta̍k lâng ê bo̍k-tik lâi sing-ua̍h. Tse sī guá kàu-tō kok kàu-huē ê tsún-tsik.
English: Only, as the Lord has distributed to each man, as God has called each, so let him walk. So I command in all the assemblies.

Tailo: Ki-tok thè lán sí, sī beh hō͘ lán bô-lūn sī ua̍h á-.sī sí, lóng ē-tàng tī I tsài-lîm ê sî kah I tsò-hué ua̍h.
English: who died for us, that, whether we wake or sleep, we should live together with him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, kau-kuè in ê tshiú ê gîn, bô kah in sǹg, in-uī in tsò tāi-tsì sîng-si̍t.
English: However there was no reckoning made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand; for they dealt faithfully.

Tailo: Tī lí ê kok lāi ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, i ê sim-lāi ū sìng ê Siōng-tè ê sîn-lîng. Lí ê lāu-pē tsāi-seⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí, khuàⁿ-tshut i ê sim-lāi ū kng-bîng, tshong-bîng kah tì-huī, tshin-tshiūnn tsiah-ê sîn-bîng ê tì-huī. Lí ê lāu-pē — Nep-kat-ne-tsal ông, to̍h-sī ông lí ê lāu-pē, kā i siat-li̍p tsò tsheⁿ-siōng-ka, su̍t-sū, Kal-tí-ah lâng kah tsiam-pok-tsiá ê thâu-lâng.
English: There is a man in your kingdom, in whom is the spirit of the holy gods; and in the days of your father light and understanding and wisdom, like the wisdom of the gods, were found in him; and the king Nebuchadnezzar your father, the king, I say, your father, made him master of the magicians, enchanters, Chaldeans, and soothsayers;

Tailo: Guá kin-á-ji̍t thiau-tî īng tse tsí-sī lí, sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lí uá-khò Siōng-tsú.
English: That your trust may be in Yahweh, I teach you today, even you.

Tailo: Ka-tsài in-uī lí tuì Iô-tá-iah lâng ê kui-lē kah in teh tsing-lūn ê būn-tê tsin liáu-kái, só͘-í, kiû lí nāi-sim thiaⁿ guá kóng.
English: especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews. Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently.

Tailo: Ke-ti-mo͘t kah i ê kau-iá, Me-hua-at kah i ê kau-iá;
English: and Kedemoth with its suburbs, and Mephaath with its suburbs;

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kian-siú tuì khí-thâu só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê sìn-sit. Lín nā kian-siú tuì khí-thâu só͘ thiaⁿ ê sìn-sit, lín tsiū ē kè-sio̍k ua̍h tī Kiáⁿ kah Thiⁿ-pē ê lāi-bīn.
English: Therefore, as for you, let that remain in you which you heard from the beginning. If that which you heard from the beginning remains in you, you also will remain in the Son, and in the Father.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h Páu-lô só͘ tsò ê, tsiū īng Lū-káu-nî-a uē tuā-siaⁿ kóng, Ū sîn-bîng huà-sin tsò lâng, lîm-kàu lán tiong-kan ā.
English: When the multitude saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voice, saying in the language of Lycaonia, The gods have come down to us in the likeness of men!

Tailo: Tsa̍p-sì nî āu, guá kah Ba-ná-ba koh tsiūⁿ Ê-lú-sa-lèm, mā tshuā Tî-to tsò-hué khì.
English: Then after a period of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus also with me.

Tailo: In khuàⁿ-tio̍h lu̍t-huat tiong ū kì-tsài: Siōng-tsú thok Mô͘-se bīng-līng I-su-la-el lâng, tio̍h tī tshit-.gue̍h ê tseh-kî tuà tī tsháu-liâu,
English: They found written in the law, how that Yahweh had commanded by Moses, that the children of Israel should dwell in booths in the feast of the seventh month;

Tailo: Guá nā buâ Guá kng nà-nà ê to, Guá nā tsip-hîng sím-phuàⁿ, tsiū beh hîng-hua̍t Guá ê tuì-ti̍k, pò-ìng uàn-hūn Guá ê lâng.
English: If I whet my glittering sword, My hand take hold on judgment; I will render vengeance to my adversaries, Will recompense those who hate me.

Tailo: In suî-jiân bîng tsai, tsiàu Siōng-tè ê kài-bīng, tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì ê lâng ing-kai sí, in m̄-nā ka-kī tsò, sīm-tsì mā tsàn-sîng pa̍t lâng án-ne tsò.
English: who, knowing the ordinance of God, that those who practice such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but also approve of those who practice them.

Tailo: tuì in kóng, ' Lín tsiah-ê Iô-tah ông kah Iô-tah kûn-tsiòng, kah só͘-ū tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn, só͘-ū tuì tsiah-ê mn̂g tshut-ji̍p ê, lóng tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōng-tsú ê uē.
English: and tell them, Hear you the word of Yahweh, you kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, that enter in by these gates:

Tailo: Lín it-tīng ū tsai-hō ah! In-uī lín uī lín tsó͘-sian sat-hāi ê sian-ti tsō bōng.
English: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and your fathers killed them.

Tailo: Nā beh lè tî-thâu, lê, saⁿ-khí ê tshe, pó͘-thâu kah kuáⁿ gû ê thih-tshì, tio̍h tsi̍t pim ê kang-tsînn.
English: yet they had a file for the mattocks, and for the plowshares, and for the forks, and for the axes, and to set the goads.

Tailo: Ba-bú-lông ông kā in phah, tī Ha-mat tē ê Lip-la̍h kā in thâi-sí. Án-ne, Iô-tah lâng siū lia̍h, lī-khui pún-tē.
English: The king of Babylon struck them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.

Tailo: I khì-kàu Siōng-tsú ê tiān ê sî, El-ká-nah muí nî lóng án-ne kiânn, Pe-nin-nah iû-guân kā i tshì-kik, i tsiū thî-khàu, suah m̄ tsia̍h pn̄g.
English: as he did so year by year, when she went up to the house of Yahweh, so she provoked her; therefore she wept, and did not eat.

Tailo: Guá tuì pak-hong hing-khí tsi̍t-ê lâng, i tsiū lâi; i tuì ji̍t tshut ê só͘-tsāi kiû-kiò guá ê miâ, i ē ta̍h tsiáng-kuân-tsiá tshin-tshiūnn teh ta̍h hue-thô͘, tshin-tshiūnn sio-huî sai-hū teh ta̍h thô͘.
English: I have raised up one from the north, and he has come; From the rising of the sun, one who calls on my name; And he shall come on rulers as on mortar, And as the potter treads clay.

Tailo: So͘-tóm kah Am-mo͘-la̍h í-ki̍p sì-kho͘-uî siâⁿ-tshī ê lâng, mā kah hiah-ê thiⁿ-sài kāng-khuán kiânn kan-îm, hòng-tshiòng uî-huán tsū-jiân ê sìng-io̍k, tì-sú siū-tio̍h íng-uán bē-hua ê hué ê hîng-hua̍t. Tse thang tsò tsìng lâng ê kíng-kài.
English: Even as Sodom and Gomorrah, and the cities around them, having, in the same way as these, given themselves over to sexual immorality and gone after strange flesh, are set forth as an example, suffering the punishment of eternal fire.

Tailo: Tsit pái guá bô ài kan-taⁿ kuè lō͘ ê sî sūn-suà khì lín hia; Tsú nā ín-tsún, guá ǹg-bāng kah lín tuà khah kú.
English: For I do not wish to see you now in passing, but I hope to stay a while with you, if the Lord permits.

Tailo: Lín koh īng tshuì ǹg Guá lâi ka-kī khua-kháu, ke-thinn lín tsiah-ê uē lâi kong-kik Guá, Guá ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h à.
English: You have magnified yourselves against me with your mouth, and have multiplied your words against me: I have heard it.

Tailo: Lán nā kóng ka-kī bô tsuē, sī teh khi-phiàn ka-kī, lán ê sim-lāi tsiū bô tsin-lí.
English: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.

Tailo: Guá kah in tsò-hué ê sî, bat hōng Lí ê miâ, to̍h-sī Lí hō͘ guá ê, lâi pó-siú in. Tû-liáu hit-ê tsù-tiāⁿ tîm-lûn ê lâng í-guā, guá mā ū tsiàu-kò͘ in, hō͘ in lóng bô tîm-lûn, án-ne sī beh hō͘ king-tián ê uē tit-tio̍h ìng-giām.
English: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in your name. Those whom you have given me I have kept. None of them is lost, except the son of destruction, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú suî-jiân tsin ko-kuì, iáu-koh khuàⁿ-kò͘ pi-bî ê lâng; tsóng-.sī, I tuì hn̄g-hn̄g to̍h khuàⁿ-tshut kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng.
English: For though Yahweh is high, yet he looks after the lowly; But the proud, he knows from afar.

Tailo: Mô͘-se ê lu̍t-huat bô huat-tō͘ sîng-tsuân puàⁿ-hāng tāi-tsì. Līng-guā tsi̍t hong-bīn, koh khah hó ê ǹg-bāng í-king tsún-pī hó-sè, hō͘ lán thang thong-kuè I lâi tshin-kīn Siōng-tè.
English: ( for the law made nothing perfect ) , and a bringing in thereupon of a better hope, through which we draw near to God.

Tailo: Kám-siā hit uī phah-sí tuā kun-ông ê Siōng-tè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: To him who struck great kings; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: I ìn Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá nā tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, kiû Lí hō͘ guá tsi̍t-ê tiāu-thâu thang tsai kah guá teh kóng uē ê to̍h-sī Lí.
English: He said to him, If now I have found favor in your sight, then show me a sign that it is you who talk with me.

Tailo: Koh tsún-pī bé hō͘ Páu-lô khiâ, hō͘-sàng i an-tsuân khì-kàu tsóng-tok Hue-lik-su hia.
English: He asked them to provide animals, that they might set Paul on one, and bring him safely to Felix the governor.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h hiah-ê sian-ti, guá ê sim tī guá ê lāi-bīn iu-siong, guá ê kut lóng gī-gī tshuah; uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú kah I sìng ê uē, guá tshin-tshiūnn tsiú-tsuì ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ tsiú só͘ khah iâⁿ ê lâng.
English: Concerning the prophets. My heart within me is broken, all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine has overcome, because of Yahweh, and because of his holy words.

Tailo: Ū tsin tsē lâng tuè I-é-su khì, in-uī in ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h I i hó pēnn-lâng ê sîn-jiah.
English: A great multitude followed him, because they saw his signs which he did on those who were sick.

Tailo: A-sah kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú — i ê Siōng-tè, kóng, Siōng-tsú ah, tī kiông ê kah luán-jio̍k-.ê ê tiong-kan, tû Lí í-guā lóng bô pang-tsān ê. Siōng-tsú — guán ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí pang-tsān guán, in-uī guán uá-khò Lí, koh hōng Lí ê miâ khì tí-ti̍k hiah-ê kûn-tsiòng. Siōng-tsú ah, Lí sī guán ê Siōng-tè, m̄-thang hō͘ lâng khah iâⁿ Lí.
English: Asa cried to Yahweh his God, and said, Yahweh, there is none besides you to help, between the mighty and him who has no strength: help us, Yahweh our God; for we rely on you, and in your name are we come against this multitude. Yahweh, you are our God; don't let man prevail against you.

Tailo: Siōng-tè hō͘ lán ū tsit-ê kái-piàn, I mā sù Sìng Sîn lâi tsò lán ê pó-tsìng.
English: Now he who made us for this very thing is God, who also gave to us the down payment of the Spirit.

Tailo: In jia̍t kah tshin-tshiūnn hué-lô͘, thun-bia̍t in ê sū-su. In ê kun-ông lóng tó lo̍h-.khì; in tiong-kan lóng bô lâng kiû-kiò Guá.
English: They are all hot as an oven, And devour their judges. All their kings have fallen. There is no one among them who calls to me.

Tailo: Siâⁿ siū kong-phuà, só͘-ū ê ping-á thàu-mê tuì uá-kīn ông ê hn̂g, nn̄g-ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tiong ê mn̂g hit tiâu lō͘ tô-tsáu tshut siâⁿ. Kal-tí-ah lâng tú-tú tī sì-kho͘-uî teh kong-kik siâⁿ, in tsiū tuì A-la̍h-bah ê lō͘ tô-tsáu.
English: Then a breach was made in the city, and all the men of war fled, and went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king's garden; ( now the Chaldeans were against the city round about; ) and they went toward the Arabah.

Tailo: Tsi̍t-ê gê tī pak pîng kah Mik-mah sio-tuì, tsi̍t-ê tī lâm pîng kah Ge-bah sio-tuì.
English: The one crag rose up on the north in front of Michmash, and the other on the south in front of Geba.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, án-ne, lán m̄ sī lú-pī ê kiáⁿ, lán sī tsū-iû ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê kiáⁿ.
English: So then, brothers, we are not children of a handmaid, but of the free woman.

Tailo: I mā kā I ê tsú-bîn kau hō͘ to-kiàm, tuì I ê ka-gia̍p huat siū-khì.
English: He also gave his people over to the sword, And was angry with his inheritance.

Tailo: Mol-té-kái tsiū kā i só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì, í-ki̍p Ha-mán só͘ kóng beh hiàn tī ông ê khò͘-pâng ê gîn ê khak-si̍t sò͘-gia̍h, thang tsâu-bia̍t Iô-tah lâng ê, lóng kā i kóng;
English: Mordecai told him of all that had happened to him, and the exact sum of the money that Haman had promised to pay to the king's treasuries for the Jews, to destroy them.

Tailo: Guán í-king kuí-nā ji̍t bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsheⁿ kah ji̍t-thâu tshut-hiān. Hong-íng kè-sio̍k phah kah tsin lī-hāi, guán tit-kiù ê ǹg-bāng lóng siau-sit-khì à.
English: When neither sun nor stars shone on us for many days, and no small tempest pressed on us, all hope that we would be saved was now taken away.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: I-é-su siū iau-tshiáⁿ tī Má-thài ê tshù tsia̍h pn̄g ê sî, ū tsin tsē thiu-suè ê í-ki̍p tsuē-jîn lâi kah I-é-su tsham bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué tsē-toh.
English: It happened as he sat in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.

Tailo: Lí kā in kuáⁿ-suàⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn ian hō͘ hong tshue-suàⁿ; pháiⁿ lâng kìⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê bīn tsiū siau-bia̍t, tshin-tshiūnn la̍h kìⁿ-tio̍h hué tsiū iûⁿ-khì.
English: As smoke is driven away, So drive them away. As wax melts before the fire, So let the wicked perish at the presence of God.

Tailo: Guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h thiⁿ khui, tī hia ū tsi̍t tsiah pe̍h bé, khiâ tī bé-tíng hit uī kiò-tsò Tiong-sìn Kah Tsin-si̍t , I tsiàu kong-gī lâi sím-phuàⁿ, lâi kau-tsiàn.
English: I saw the heaven opened, and behold, a white horse, and he who sat on it is called Faithful and True. In righteousness he judges and makes war.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kah tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal, tsiū siu in ê kim, to̍h-sī ta̍k tsióng phah hó ê tsong-sik.
English: Moses and Eleazar the priest took the gold of them, even all worked jewels.

Tailo: Ū kì-tsài, Siōng-tè tuì Huâ-láu kóng, Guá siat-li̍p lí ê bo̍k-tik, sī beh īng lí lâi hián-bîng guá ê kuân-lîng, hō͘ guá ê miâ thuân kàu tsuân sè-kài. ( Tsù, CAG 9: 16 )
English: For the Scripture says to Pharaoh, For this very purpose I caused you to be raised up, that I might show in you my power, and that my name might be published abroad in all the earth.

Tailo: In thiàu ji̍p-khì siâⁿ lāi, puâⁿ-kuè tshiûⁿ, peh-tsiūⁿ tshù tíng, ji̍p thang-á tshin-tshiūnn tsha̍t.
English: They rush on the city. They run on the wall. They climb up into the houses. They enter in at the windows like thieves.

Tailo: Kā in thó͘-tē ê tshài-se tsia̍h liáu-liáu, koh tsia̍h in tshân-hn̂g só͘ tshut-sán ê ngó͘-kok.
English: Ate up every plant in their land; And ate up the fruit of their ground.

Tailo: In sī bo̍k-tsiá, in-uī in sī tshī tsing-seⁿ ê lâng, in kā iûⁿ-kûn, gû-kûn kah it-tshè só͘-ū ê lóng tuà-.lâi. '
English: These men are shepherds, for they have been keepers of livestock, and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.'

Tailo: Am-móng lâng tsìn-kòng U-tsi-iah, i ê miâ-siaⁿ thuân kàu Ai-gi̍p ê kau-kài, in-uī i hui-siông kiông-sīng.
English: The Ammonites gave tribute to Uzziah: and his name spread abroad even to the entrance of Egypt; for he grew exceeding strong.

Tailo: tsiū hō hit só͘-tsāi ê miâ kiò-tsò Bo-kim. In tī hia hiàn tsè hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: They called the name of that place Bochim: and they sacrificed there to Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tshīng iù-tē pò͘ ê saⁿ-khò͘, ē-sin mā tio̍h tshīng iù-tē pò͘ ê khò͘, kā tuâⁿ tíng ê hué só͘ sio tsò sio-tsè ê hu siu khí-.lâi, piàⁿ tī tuâⁿ piⁿ.
English: The priest shall put on his linen garment, and he shall put on his linen breeches upon his body; and he shall remove the ashes from where the fire has consumed the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.

Tailo: Guá sī I-é-ho-bah, tse sī Guá ê miâ, Guá bô kā Guá ê îng-kng kui hō͘ pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, mā bô kā Guá ê miâ-siaⁿ kui hō͘ tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng.
English: I am Yahweh. That is my name. I will not give my glory to another, Nor my praise to engraved images.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, I koh tsi̍t pái tuì gō͘-pah guā-ê hiann-tī tsí-muē hián-hiān; hiah-ê lâng ū ê í-king sí-.khì, m̄-koh, tuā pō͘-hūn ê lâng iáu ua̍h-.leh.
English: Then he appeared to over five hundred brothers at once, most of whom remain until now, but some have also fallen asleep.

Tailo: Án-ne, tsiū bô koh hun-pia̍t Hi-la̍h lâng á-.sī Iô-tá-iah lâng, siū kat-lé á-.sī bô siū kat-lé, iá-bân ê lâng, bī-khai-huà ê lâng, tsò lô͘-po̍k ê á-.sī tsū-iû ê, to̍k-to̍k Ki-tok sī it-tshè, mā tī it-tshè ê lāi-bīn.
English: where there can't be Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondservant, freeman; but Christ is all, and in all.

Tailo: M̄-koh, sî teh beh kàu, hiān-kim to̍h-sī. Tsin-tsiàⁿ kìng-pài ê lâng, ē īng sim-sîn kah tsin-sîng lâi kìng-pài Thiⁿ-pē, in-uī Thiⁿ-pē ài tsit khuán lâng kìng-pài I.
English: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshippers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such to be his worshippers.

Tailo: Lín tsiū ē tsai Guá īng tsit-ê bīng-līng hō͘ lín, thang tsò Guá kah Lē-bī só͘ li̍p ê iok. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: You will know that I have sent this commandment to you, that my covenant may be with Levi, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Guá kah lí ū iok, tshin-tshiūnn tsîng guá ê lāu-pē kah lí ê lāu-pē án-ne. Taⁿ guá īng kim-gîn sàng lí, tshiáⁿ lí khì huì-tû lí kah I-su-la-el ông Ba-siah só͘ li̍p ê iok, hō͘ i lī-khui guá.
English: There is a league between me and you, as there was between my father and your father: behold, I have sent you silver and gold; go, break your league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.

Tailo: lâng kā i tsòng tī Ta-bi̍t siâⁿ kah lia̍t ông ê tiong-kan, in-uī i tī I-su-la-el tiong-kan ū ǹg Siōng-tsú kah I ê tiān kiâⁿ hó sū.
English: They buried him in the city of David among the kings, because he had done good in Israel, and toward God and his house.

Tailo: Tshiánn lín kóng hō͘ Sī-khiàm ê kûn-tsiòng thiaⁿ, khuànn sī Ia-lu-ba-al ê tsìng kiáⁿ tshit tsa̍p lâng kuán lín, á-.sī tsi̍t-ê lâng kuán lín, tó tsi̍t hāng khah hó? Lín mā tio̍h siàu-liām guá sī lín ê kut-jio̍k.
English: Please speak in the ears of all the men of Shechem, Whether is better for you, that all the sons of Jerubbaal, who are seventy persons, rule over you, or that one rule over you? Remember also that I am your bone and your flesh.

Tailo: só͘ huān ê tsuē kàu i ka-kī tsai-iáⁿ ê sî, i in-uī só͘ huān ê tsuē, tsiū tio̍h khan tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ bó, tsò i ê lé-mi̍h.
English: if his sin, which he has sinned, is made known to him, then he shall bring for his offering a goat, a female without blemish, for his sin which he has sinned.

Tailo: Guá kah guá ê tsó͘-sian tuì lia̍t kok ê jîn-bîn só͘ kiâⁿ ê, lín kám m̄-tsai? Lia̍t-pang ê sîn-bîng, hit sî kám ē kiù ka-kī ê kok thuat-lī guá ê tshiú?
English: Don't you know what I and my fathers have done to all the peoples of the lands? Were the gods of the nations of the lands in any wise able to deliver their land out of my hand?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí ná ē hō͘ guán kiânn phian-siâ, lī-khui Lí ê lō͘, hō͘ guán ê sim ngē, bô kìng-uì Lí? Kiû Lí uī-tio̍h Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, uī Lí ê sán-gia̍p — kok tsi-tso̍k ê iân-kò͘, tò tńg-.lâi.
English: O Yahweh, why do you make us to err from your ways, and harden our heart from your fear? Return for your servants' sake, the tribes of your inheritance.

Tailo: I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ kè-sio̍k kiânn, I-é-su ji̍p-khì tsi̍t-ê tsng-thâu. Ū tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Mal-tha ê hū-jîn-lâng, tsiap-thāi I-é-su ji̍p-khì in tshù.
English: It happened as they went on their way, he entered into a certain village, and a certain woman named Martha received him into her house.

Tailo: Ki-tok sī tiong-si̍t ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn, sī thâu tsi̍t-ê tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, koh sī tē-tsiūⁿ bān-ông ê Tsú-tsáiⁿ.
English: and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn of the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth. To him who loves us, and washed us from our sins by his blood;

Tailo: Lí ê tsi̍t luí ba̍k-tsiu nā ín-khí lí huān tsuē, tio̍h kā i ó͘ hiat-ka̍k; lîng-khó kiám tsi̍t luí ba̍k-tsiu phuà-siùⁿ lâi ji̍p-khì Siōng-tè kok-tō͘, pí nn̄g luí ba̍k-tsiu hó-hó lo̍h tē-ga̍k khah hó.
English: If your eye causes you to stumble, cast it out. It is better for you to enter into the Kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the Gehenna of fire,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā Gî-tióng kóng, Guá beh īng tsiah-ê nà tsuí ê saⁿ-pah lâng kiù lín, kā Mí-tiân lâng kau tī lí ê tshiú tiong, tsìng lâng lóng thang tò tńg-khì i ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Yahweh said to Gideon, By the three hundred men who lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into your hand; and let all the people go every man to his place.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsiū lóng pak in hīnn-á-.ni̍h ê kim-khuân, the̍h-lâi hō͘ A-lông.
English: All the people took off the golden rings which were in their ears, and brought them to Aaron.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ē-tàng tī lán tiong-kan ūn-hîng I ê tuā kuân-lîng lâi sîng-tsiū it-tshè, tuā-tuā tshiau-kuè lán só͘ kiû kah só͘ siūⁿ ê.
English: Now to him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us,

Tailo: ū ná-ta̍t kah huan-âng hue, tshiong-pô͘ kah jio̍k-kuì, í-ki̍p tsiah-ê jú-hiuⁿ, bu̍t-io̍h, tîm-hiuⁿ kah só͘-ū siōng-tíng ê phang-liāu.
English: Spikenard and saffron, Calamus and cinnamon, with every kind of incense tree; Myrrh and aloes, with all the best spices,

Tailo: Hit sî, A-mí-hail ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ — ông-hō͘ Ê-su-tel kah Iô-tah lâng Mol-té-kái, īng tsuân kuân lâi siá kian-kò͘ Phul ê tē-jī tiuⁿ phue,
English: Then Esther the queen, the daughter of Abihail, and Mordecai the Jew, wrote with all authority to confirm this second letter of Purim.

Tailo: Lí ê lô͘-po̍k bat phah-sí sai kah hîm, tsit-ê bô siū kat-lé ê Hui-lī-sū lâng, mā beh tshin-tshiūnn in tiong-kan ê tsi̍t tsiah, in-uī i biáu-sī íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú ê kun-tuī.
English: Your servant struck both the lion and the bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he has defied the armies of the living God.

Tailo: I-é-su thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū ìn kóng, M̄-bián kiaⁿ, tsí ū sìn, i to̍h ē hó khí-.lâi.
English: But Jesus hearing it, answered him, Don't be afraid. Only believe, and she will be healed.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kā Io-ap kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Αp-sa-lôm kuì tī siōng tshiū-.ni̍h.
English: A certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanging in an oak.

Tailo: I-é-su koh tuì Tu-lô ê tē-khu, king-kuè Si-tòng kah Te-ka-po͘-lī tē-khu, lâi-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘.
English: Again he departed from the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and came to the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the region of Decapolis.

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to tiàu hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ, kuaⁿ-uân kah jîn-bîn lâi,
English: Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,

Tailo: Tī tshù tíng ê lâng m̄-thang lo̍h-lâi the̍h i tshù lāi ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ;
English: Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take out things that are in his house.

Tailo: Tsai-hāi kah ki-hng, lí ē kā i tshiò; tē-tsiūⁿ ê iá-siù, lí mā bián-kiaⁿ.
English: At destruction and famine you shall laugh, Neither shall you be afraid of the animals of the earth.

Tailo: Tsè-si ji̍p-khì ê sî, tsiū m̄-thang tuì sìng-só͘ tshut-lâi-kàu guā-īⁿ; tio̍h tī hia pàng-lo̍h in kiânn tsit-hūn ê sî só͘ tshīng ê saⁿ, in-uī he sī sìng; tio̍h uāⁿ in ê saⁿ tsiah thang kàu sio̍k tī jîn-bîn ê só͘-tsāi.
English: When the priests enter in, then shall they not go out of the holy place into the outer court, but there they shall lay their garments in which they minister; for they are holy: and they shall put on other garments, and shall approach to that which pertains to the people.

Tailo: Thê-má kui tīn kiânn ê lâng teh liâu-bāng, Sí-bah kui kûn ê lâng teh thìng-hāu.
English: The caravans of Tema looked, The companies of Sheba waited for them.

Tailo: In-uī gû kah iûⁿ ê hueh, bē-tàng tû-khì lâng ê tsuē.
English: For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t lia̍p kuà-tshài-tsí, suî-jiân sī tē-tsiūⁿ tsíng-tsí tiong-kan siōng sè lia̍p ê,
English: It's like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, though it is less than all the seeds that are on the earth,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tī Mam-lē ê siōng tshiū hia, tuì A-bu-la-hàm tshut-hiān. Hit sî, ji̍t tng jua̍h, A-bu-la-hàm tsē tī pò͘-pênn mn̂g-kháu,
English: Yahweh appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre, as he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day.

Tailo: Lín nā sio̍k tsit sè-kan, sè-kan tsiū ē khuànn lín tsò ka-kī ê lâng lâi thiàⁿ lín; to̍k-to̍k In-uī lín bô sio̍k tsit sè-kan, guá í-king kā lín tuì sè-kan kíng-suán tshut-.lâi, só͘-í, sè-kan ē uàn-hūn lín.
English: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tsiū án-ne khuán-thāi in, kiù in thuat-lī I-su-la-el lâng ê tshiú, só͘-í, in tsiū bô kā in thâi.
English: So did he to them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, that they didn't kill them.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Ū tsai-hō à, tsit-ê hō͘ lâng lâu hueh ê siâⁿ, to̍h-sī seⁿ sian ê tiánn, i ê sian iáu-buē tû-.khì, tio̍h kā bah-tè tuì hit tiong-kan tsi̍t tè tsi̍t tè the̍h tshut-.lâi, bô su-iàu liam-khau.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Woe to the bloody city, to the caldron whose rust is therein, and whose rust is not gone out of it! take out of it piece after piece; No lot is fallen on it.

Tailo: I tuì guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, Guá tshe lí khì-kàu I-su-la-el tso̍k, kàu puē-gi̍k ê pang-kok, in sī puē-gi̍k Guá ê, in kah in ê tsó͘-sian uî-puē Guá, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: He said to me, Son of man, I send you to the children of Israel, to nations that are rebellious, which have rebelled against me: they and their fathers have transgressed against me even to this very day.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng: Tī Guá ê sìng-suaⁿ, to̍h-sī I-su-la-el kuân ê suaⁿ, tī hia I-su-la-el tsuân ke ê tsìng lâng ē tī hit-ê só͘-tsāi ho̍k-sāi Guá, tī hia Guá beh tsiap-la̍p lín, tī hia Guá beh kā lín thó lé-mi̍h kah lín khí-thâu si̍k ê lông-sán-bu̍t, í-ki̍p lín it-tshè ê sìng-mi̍h.
English: For in my holy mountain, in the mountain of the height of Israel, says the Lord Yahweh, there shall all the house of Israel, all of them, serve me in the land: there will I accept them, and there will I require your offerings, and the first fruits of your offerings, with all your holy things.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ê kiáⁿ sī Io-ná-than, E-sú-bí, Mal-ki-siu-ah. I nn̄g-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê miâ, tuā ê miâ kiò-tsò Bí-la̍h, sè ê miâ kiò-tsò Mi-kal.
English: Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan, and Ishvi, and Malchishua; and the names of his two daughters were these: the name of the firstborn Merab, and the name of the younger Michal:

Tailo: Guá tī Tho͘-lo-a ê sî lâu tī Ka-pò͘ in tau ê guā-saⁿ, lí lâi ê sî tio̍h suà tuà-.lâi, mā tio̍h kā hiah-ê tsheh tuà-.lâi, iû-kî-sī hiah-ê iûⁿ-phuê ê tsheh.
English: Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus when you come, and the books, especially the parchments.

Tailo: Sâm-sóng ê bó͘ tsiū kè hō͘ i ê puê-phuāⁿ, to̍h-sī Sâm-sóng kā i tòng-tsò pîng-iú ê.
English: But Samson's wife was given to his companion, whom he had used as his friend.

Tailo: Iûⁿ kau-ha̍p ê sî, guá bāng tiong gia̍h thâu tsi̍t ē khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h phah iûⁿ-bó ê iûⁿ-káng, lóng sī ū bûn ê, ū tiám ê, ū hue-pan ê.
English: It happened during mating season that I lifted up my eyes, and saw in a dream, and behold, the male goats which leaped on the flock were streaked, speckled, and grizzled.
