Tailo: Lán siūⁿ beh i-tī Ba-bú-lông, m̄-koh i bô tit-.tio̍h. Lán tio̍h lī-khui i, ta̍k lâng tńg-khì pún-kok; in-uī i ê tsuē-àn tú thiⁿ, thàu kàu kiong-tshong.
English: We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go everyone into his own country; for her judgment reaches to heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.

Tailo: Sî-kî nā kàu, Siōng-tè beh uân-sîng tsit-ê kè-uē, to̍h-sī beh kā thinn-tíng kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê pī-tsō-bu̍t lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t thé, hō͘ Ki-tok tsò it-tshè ê thâu.
English: to an administration of the fullness of the times, to sum up all things in Christ, the things in the heavens, and the things on the earth, in him;

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tsiū tshe lâng khì kiò i lâi, Ia-lô-ba-am tsiū kah I-su-la-el tsuân huē-tsiòng lâi kìnn Lô-bo-àm, kā i kóng,
English: and they sent and called him ) , that Jeroboam and all the assembly of Israel came, and spoke to Rehoboam, saying,

Tailo: Tshut-tsāi in lah, in sī tsheⁿ-mê-.ê teh kā tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tshuā-lō͘; nā-sī tsheⁿ-mê-.ê kā tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tshuā-lō͘, nn̄g-ê lóng ē pua̍h-lo̍h kheⁿ-kau.
English: Leave them alone. They are blind guides of the blind. If the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.

Tailo: Hit-ê siann tē-jī pái tuì i kóng, Siōng-tè só͘ hō͘ i tshing-khì ê, lí m̄-thang lia̍h-tsò lah-sap.
English: A voice came to him again the second time, What God has cleansed, you must not call unclean.

Tailo: Tuà tī Gi-lia̍t ia-be-si ê jîn-bîn, thiaⁿ-tio̍h Hui-lī-sū lâng tuì Sàu-lô só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì.
English: When the inhabitants of Jabesh Gilead heard concerning him that which the Philistines had done to Saul,

Tailo: ( Té kiat-bué ) , ( Tsù, Ū ê kò͘-kuàn tī 16:8 ê āu-piah hù-ka tsit-ê tshing-tsò Té kiat-bué ê king-bûn ) 9 In kā it-tshè ê tsí-sī kán-iàu tuì Piat-tò͘ tsiu-uî ê lâng kóng. Liáu-āu, I-é-su tsiū thong-kuè in, tuì tang kàu sai thuân-sàng hit-ê sîn-sìng, bē huí-huāi ê, ē íng-uán tsín-kiù ê sìn-sit. ( tn̂g kiat-bué ) , ( Tsù, Ū ê kò͘-kuàn tī 16:8 ê āu-piah hù-ka tsit-ê tshing-tsò Tn̂g kiat-bué ê king-bûn ) Tshit ji̍t ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t thàu-tsá, I-é-su koh-ua̍h liáu-āu, tāi-sing tuì Ma̍k-ta-lé ê Mâ-lí-ah hián-hiān. I-é-su tsîng bat kā i kuáⁿ-tshut tshit-ê kuí.
English: Now when he had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

Tailo: I ē suh to̍k-tsuâ ê to̍k; tsuâ ê tsi̍h mā ē kā i hāi-sí.
English: He shall suck cobra venom. The viper's tongue shall kill him.

Tailo: Sûn-liông ê tsi̍h sī ua̍h-miā ê tshiū; nā-sī o͘-pe̍h-kóng tsiū ē sún-siong sim-sîn.
English: A gentle tongue is a tree of life, But deceit in it crushes the spirit.

Tailo: M̄-thang him-bō͘ hit-ê àm-mê, to̍h-sī jîn-bîn tī in ê só͘-tsāi tú-tio̍h tû-bia̍t ê sî.
English: Don't desire the night, When people are cut off in their place.

Tailo: Sa-mu-el kóng, Siōng-tsú huann-hí sio-tsè ê tsè-sū, kám tshin-tshiūnn huann-hí lâng tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú ê uē? Lí khuàⁿ, tsun-thàn iâⁿ-kuè hiàn tsè, tsun-thàn sī iâⁿ-kuè iûⁿ-káng ê iû.
English: Samuel said, Has Yahweh as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the voice of Yahweh? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to listen than the fat of rams.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, guá koh khuànn, lí khuàⁿ, koh ū tsi̍t tsiah siù, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn pà, kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ ū sì-ê si̍t tshin-tshiūnn tsiáu; tsit tsiah siù ū sì-ê thâu-khak, koh ū kuân-pìng hō͘ i.
English: After this I saw, and behold, another, like a leopard, which had on its back four wings of a bird; the animal had also four heads; and dominion was given to it.

Tailo: Tik-sìng ê lâng mā ē án-ne tshīng pe̍h saⁿ, guá tsua̍t-tuì bē kā i ê miâ tuì ua̍h-miā-tsheh tshat-siau; guá ē tī guá ê Thiⁿ-pē kah I hiah-ê thiⁿ-sài ê bīn-tsîng, kong-khai sîng-jīn i ê miâ.
English: He who overcomes will be arrayed in white garments, and I will in no way blot his name out of the book of life, and I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.

Tailo: Lí tī iâⁿ guā kíng-suán tsi̍t uī thang tshut-khì kàu guā-bīn tāi-piān ê só͘-tsāi.
English: You shall have a place also outside of the camp, where you shall go forth abroad:

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn hūn-.khì ê sî, guá tsiū siàu-liām Siōng-tsú. Guá ê kî-tó kàu tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng, ji̍p-khì Lí ê sìng-tiān.
English: When my soul fainted within me, I remembered Yahweh. My prayer came in to you, into your holy temple.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, bô lī-khui Ne-bat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am ê tsuē, to̍h-sī i hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng huān tsuē ê, iû-guân án-ne kiânn.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh; he didn't depart from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin; but he walked therein.

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí teh khuàⁿ tsiah-ê tuā kiàn-tio̍k-bu̍t ò͘? Tsiong-lâi tī tsia bô tsi̍t tè tsio̍h ē sio-tha̍h, lóng ē hō͘ lâng thiah-kah pênn-pênn-pênn.
English: Jesus said to him, Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone on another, which will not be thrown down.

Tailo: Siat-sú in tik-tsuē Lí, tì-sú thiⁿ kuaiⁿ-ba̍t bô lo̍h hō͘, Lí hîng-hua̍t in ê sî, in nā ǹg tsit só͘-tsāi kî-tó, jīn Lí ê miâ, lī-khui in ê tsuē,
English: When the sky is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against you; if they pray toward this place, and confess your name, and turn from their sin, when you do afflict them:

Tailo: I tsiū tuì guá kóng, Tuā-tuā tit-tio̍h thióng-ài ê lâng — Ta-ni-el, lí tio̍h bîng-pi̍k guá kah lí só͘ kóng tsiah-ê uē. Khiā khí-.lâi, in-uī guá taⁿ hōng tshe-khián lâi-kàu lí tsia. I tuì guá kóng tsit-ê uē, guá tsiū khiā-teh gī-gī tshuah.
English: He said to me, Daniel, you man greatly beloved, understand the words that I speak to you, and stand upright; for to you am I now sent. When he had spoken this word to me, I stood trembling.

Tailo: Guá tshut-sì ê ji̍t, guān hit-ê ji̍t bô-.khì; kóng ū huâi-īn tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ hit mê, guān hit-ê mê mā bô-.khì.
English: Let the day perish in which I was born, The night which said, There is a boy conceived.'

Tailo: Iok-kuī tī Ki-lia̍t-iâ-lîm ê ji̍t-tsí tsin kú, king-kuè jī-tsa̍p nî, I-su-la-el tsuân ke tui-liām Siōng-tsú.
English: It happened, from the day that the ark abode in Kiriath Jearim, that the time was long; for it was twenty years: and all the house of Israel lamented after Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí ná ē kan-tāⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h hiann-tī ba̍k-tsiu lāi ê tsháu-á-iù, ā bô tsù-ì-tio̍h lí ka-kī ba̍k-tsiu lāi ê tshâ-kho͘?
English: Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother's eye, but don't consider the beam that is in your own eye?

Tailo: Guān tsō in kah uá-khò in ê lâng, lóng ē kah in kāng-khuán.
English: Those who make them will be like them; Yes, everyone who trusts in them.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hō͘ in ê sim piàn ngē, hō͘ Lí ê tsiù-tsó͘ lîm-kàu tī in.
English: You will give them hardness of heart, your curse to them.

Tailo: Mol-té-kái huan-hù lâng kā Ê-su-tel kóng, Lí m̄-thang siūⁿ kóng lí tī ông-kiong lāi pí tsìng Iô-tah lâng khah ē thuat-lī.
English: Then Mordecai bade them return answer to Esther, Don't think to yourself that you shall escape in the king's house, more than all the Jews.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, taⁿ siá kàu tsia uî-tsí. Lán tio̍h huann-hí, tio̍h tui-kiû uân-tsuân, tio̍h hō͘-siong bián-lē, tio̍h tâng-sim, tio̍h hô-bo̍k tsò-hué. Guān siúⁿ-sù thiàⁿ-sim kah pîng-an ê Siōng-tè kah lín tông-tsāi.
English: Finally, brothers, rejoice. Be perfected, be comforted, be of the same mind, live in peace, and the God of love and peace will be with you.

Tailo: Ê-hng sî ji̍p-.khì, keh kang tsá-khí tńg-lâi tē-jī-ê lú-īⁿ, kau hō͘ ông ê thài-kàm, to̍h-sī kuán-lí pîn-hui ê thài-kàm Sa-kal ê tshiú. Nā m̄-sī ông kah-ì i, koh thê-khí i ê miâ lâi tiàu i, tsiū bô koh ji̍p-khì kìnn ông.
English: In the evening she went, and on the next day she returned into the second house of the women, to the custody of Shaashgaz, the king's chamberlain, who kept the concubines: she came in to the king no more, except the king delighted in her, and she were called by name.

Tailo: I-é-su tuì in kóng tsiah-ê uē ê sî, tú-hó ū tsi̍t-ê huē-tn̂g ê tsú-kuán lâi phak tī I ê bīn-tsîng, kóng, Guá ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tú-á sí-.khì, tshiánn Lí lâi-khì kā i huāⁿ-tshiú, i tsiū ē ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: While he told these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped him, saying, My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā guá kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, tuì tsit sî khí, Guá beh kā Si-hông kah i ê tē, kau-hù tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, lí taⁿ ē tit-tio̍h i ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p. '
English: Yahweh said to me, Behold, I have begun to deliver up Sihon and his land before you: begin to possess, that you may inherit his land.

Tailo: ( A-sah ê si-kua, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; īng si-hiân ê ga̍k-khì. ) 	Tī Iô-tah, lâng-lâng lóng bat Siōng-tè; tī I-su-la-el, I ê miâ siū tsun tsò tuā.
English: In Judah, God is known. His name is great in Israel.

Tailo: Ná-má lâng Tso-huah ìn kóng:
English: Then Zophar the Naamathite answered,

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsuí kiat-ping tshin-tshiūnn tsio̍h-thâu, tshim-ian ê bīn kiat kui tè.
English: The waters become hard like stone, When the surface of the deep is frozen.

Tailo: A-siul ông khí-lâi piàn kiâⁿ hit-ê tē, koh khí-lâi uî-kong Sa-má-lī-a sann nî.
English: Then the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land, and went up to Samaria, and besieged it three years.

Tailo: TEKEL to̍h-sī lí tī thian-phîng siū tshìn, hián-bîng lí ê bô kàu-gia̍h.
English: TEKEL; you are weighed in the balances, and are found wanting.

Tailo: Lâng nā kā i ê pîng-iú kau khì hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-tua̍t, i ê kiáⁿ ê ba̍k-tsiu ē sit-bîng.
English: He who denounces his friends for a prey, Even the eyes of his children shall fail.

Tailo: mā m̄-thang tī An-hioh-ji̍t tuì tshù lāi taⁿ tàⁿ tshut-.khì, bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h kang lóng m̄-thang tsò, to̍k-to̍k tio̍h lia̍h An-hioh-ji̍t tsò sìng-ji̍t, tsiàu Guá pîng-sî huan-hù lín ê tsó͘-sian ê.'
English: neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath day holy, neither do any work: but make the Sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.

Tailo: Guá hōng guá ê Thiⁿ-pē ê miâ lâi, lín bô beh tsiap-la̍p guá; nā ū pa̍t lâng hōng ka-kī ê miâ lâi, lín tian-tò kā i tsiap-la̍p.
English: I have come in my Father's name, and you don't receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín lia̍t ông tio̍h ū tì-huī, sè-tsiūⁿ ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ tio̍h siū kíng-kài.
English: Now therefore be wise, you kings. Be instructed, you judges of the earth.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guán tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ tsò lâng ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, hō͘ guán sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t pang tiong.
English: You have made us like sheep for food, And have scattered us among the nations.

Tailo: Lâng nā sún-siong i ê tshù-piⁿ, i án-ne kiânn, mā tio̍h án-ne kā i khuán-thāi.
English: If anyone injures his neighbor; as he has done, so shall it be done to him:

Tailo: Ga̍t tsiū lâi kìnn Ta-bi̍t, kā i kóng, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Lí tio̍h ka-kī kíng,
English: So Gad came to David, and said to him, Thus says Yahweh, Take which you will:

Tailo: Nā m̄ tsun-thàn tsiū ē hō͘ to-kiàm thâi, gōng-gōng lâi sí.
English: But if they don't listen, they shall perish by the sword; They shall die without knowledge.

Tailo: M̄-thang tham-luân sè-kan á-.sī sè-kan ê mi̍h; lâng nā thiàⁿ tsit sè-kan, i tsiū bô thiàⁿ Thiⁿ-pē.
English: Don't love the world, neither the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the Father's love isn't in him.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tiāu-thâu lîm-kàu lí, lí tio̍h thàn ki-huē lâi tsò, in-uī Siōng-tè kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: Let it be, when these signs are come to you, that you do as occasion shall serve you; for God is with you.

Tailo: Ū si-thé ê só͘-tsāi, ing-tsiáu tsiū ē tsū-tsi̍p khì hia.
English: For wherever the carcass is, there will the vultures be gathered together.

Tailo: Lín ē kui tī Guá, tsò tsè-si ê kok, tsò sìng-kiat ê tsú-bîn. ' Lí tio̍h kā I-su-la-el lâng kóng tsiah-ê uē.
English: and you shall be to me a kingdom of priests, and a holy nation.' These are the words which you shall speak to the children of Israel.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā Guá khí thô͘-tuâⁿ, tī hit tíng-bīn īng lí ê gû, iûⁿ lâi hiàn lí ê sio-tsè kah pîng-an-tsè. Kiàn-nā Guá hō͘ lâng kì-liām Guá ê miâ ê só͘-tsāi, Guá beh kàu lí hia kā lí sù-hok.
English: You shall make an altar of earth for me, and shall sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep and your oxen. In every place where I record my name I will come to you and I will bless you.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, lín suah muá-sim iu-būn.
English: But because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.

Tailo: Lú-pī ū nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ, in nn̄g-ê tī tshân-.ni̍h sio-phah, bô lâng tī in tiong-kan pâi-kái, tsit-ê phah hit-ê hō͘ i sí.
English: Your handmaid had two sons, and they two strove together in the field, and there was none to part them, but the one struck the other, and killed him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in puē-gi̍k, hō͘ I ê Sìng Sîn iu-būn; I tsiū tian-tò tsò in ê tuì-ti̍k, pún-sin lâi kā in kong-kik.
English: But they rebelled, and grieved his holy Spirit: therefore he was turned to be their enemy, and himself fought against them.

Tailo: Ba-al tsiū tsiàu Pa-lân ê uē khì kiâⁿ, tī ta̍k tsō tuâⁿ hiàn tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng, tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-káng.
English: Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.

Tailo: In-uī I beh tsū-tsi̍p bān-kok lâi kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm kau-tsiàn, siâⁿ ē siū kong-phuà, tshù-the̍h ē siū tshiúⁿ-kiap, tsa-bó͘ lâng ē siū lîng-jio̍k, siâⁿ lāi ê jîn-bîn tsi̍t-puàⁿ ē hông lia̍h-.khì; só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn iû-guân tī siâⁿ lāi, bô tì-sú tsián-tû.
English: For I will gather all nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city will be taken, the houses rifled, and the women ravished. Half of the city will go out into captivity, and the rest of the people will not be cut off from the city.

Tailo: Bian ha-tat tsun-thàn A-sah ông ê uē, tshe i hiah-ê kun-tiúⁿ khì kong-kik I-su-la-el ê siâⁿ. In tsiū kong-phuà I-ióng, Tàn kah A-bel-má-im, í-ki̍p Ná-hu-tha-lím só͘-ū kim-khò͘ ê siâⁿ.
English: Ben Hadad listened to king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel; and they struck Ijon, and Dan, and Abel Maim, and all the storage cities of Naphtali.

Tailo: Koh tsi̍t-ê lâng kóng, ' Guá tú tshuā bó͘, só͘-í bē-tàng khì. '
English: Another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I can't come.'

Tailo: Só͘-í, I īng lô-khó͘ kà-kuai in ê sim; in pua̍h-tó, bô lâng hû-tsō͘.
English: Therefore he brought down their heart with labor. They fell down, and there was none to help.

Tailo: Lín mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, guā-bīn hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò sī gī lâng, m̄-koh, lāi-bīn tshiong-muá ké-hó kah put-gī.
English: Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.

Tailo: hō͘ Guá ê lô͘-po̍k ê uē ìng-giām, Guá ê sù-tsiá ê kè-uē tit-tio̍h tsiânn. Kóng-tio̍h Ê-lú-sa-lèm, Guá kóng: Tik-khak ū lâng tī hia tuà; kóng-tio̍h Iô-tah ê siâⁿ, Guá kóng: Tik-khak ē siū khí-tsō; pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi Guá beh hō͘ i hing-khí.
English: who confirms the word of his servant, and performs the counsel of his messengers; who says of Jerusalem, She shall be inhabited; and of the cities of Judah, They shall be built, and I will raise up the waste places of it;

Tailo: Lí bat kóng, Lín tio̍h him-bō͘ lâi kìnn guá ê bīn. Hit sî, guá ê sim tuì Lí kóng, Siōng-tsú ah, guá beh him-bō͘ lâi kìnn Lí ê bīn.
English: When you said, Seek my face, My heart said to you, I will seek your face, Yahweh.

Tailo: Hô ê siang pîng ū ua̍h-miā-tshiū, muí nî kiat tsa̍p-jī pái ê kué-tsí, muí kò-gue̍h kiat tsi̍t pái, tshiū-hio̍h ē-tàng tsò i-tī lia̍t kok ê lō͘-īng.
English: in the middle of its street. On this side of the river and on that was the tree of life, bearing twelve kinds of fruits, yielding its fruit every month. The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.

Tailo: Tíng-bīn sī Mô͘-se tī Iol-tàn hô hit pîng tang pîng, I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tuì-bīn Mô͘-ap ê pîng-guân, só͘ pun ê sán-gia̍p.
English: These are the inheritances which Moses distributed in the plains of Moab, beyond the Jordan at Jericho, eastward.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá ê lô͘-po̍k beh tsia̍h, m̄-koh, lín ē iau; lí khuàⁿ, Guá ê lô͘-po̍k beh lim, m̄-koh, lín ē tshuì-ta; lí khuàⁿ, Guá ê lô͘-po̍k beh huann-hí, m̄-koh, lín ē kiàn-siàu.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh, Behold, my servants shall eat, but you shall be hungry; behold, my servants shall drink, but you shall be thirsty; behold, my servants shall rejoice, but you shall be disappointed;

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Tú-tsiah pha-tio̍h ê hî, lia̍h kuí-bué-á lâi.
English: Jesus said to them, Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.

Tailo: M̄-sī lán thiàⁿ Siōng-tè, sī I ū thiàⁿ lán, tshe I ê Kiáⁿ tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, lâi sio̍k lán ê tsuē. Tse to̍h-sī Siōng-tè ê thiàⁿ.
English: In this is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son as the atoning sacrifice for our sins.

Tailo: Tsia̍h hit só͘-tsāi ê bí-niûⁿ, tsiū tio̍h hiàn kí-tsè hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: then it shall be that when you eat of the bread of the land, you shall offer up a wave offering to Yahweh.

Tailo: tsiū kah i hiah-ê siú-líng í-ki̍p ióng-sū tsham-siông, beh that-ba̍t siâⁿ guā ê tsuí-guân, in tsiū kā i pang-tsān.
English: he took counsel with his princes and his mighty men to stop the waters of the springs which were outside of the city; and they helped him.

Tailo: Ko-le-si ông guân nî, Ko-le-si ông tshut līng, kuan-hē tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm Siōng-tè ê tiān kóng, tio̍h khí hit king tiān, thang tsò hiàn tsè ê só͘-tsāi, tē-ki hē hō͘ i ê kian-kò͘, tiān kuân la̍k-tsa̍p tiú, khuah la̍k-tsa̍p tiú,
English: In the first year of Cyrus the king, Cyrus the king made a decree: Concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, let the house be built, the place where they offer sacrifices, and let the foundations of it be strongly laid; the height of it sixty cubits, and the breadth of it sixty cubits;

Tailo: Só͘-í, in-uī lín ê iân-kò͘, thiⁿ tsiū bô lo̍h lō͘-tsuí, tē mā bô tshut i ê lông-sán-bu̍t.
English: Therefore for your sake the heavens withhold the dew, and the earth withholds its fruit.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí khiâ Lí ê bé, tsē tī Lí tsín-kiù ê tshia, kám sī bô huann-hí tsiah-ê kang, siū-khì tsiah-ê hô, thòng-hūn hái-iûⁿ?
English: Was Yahweh displeased with the rivers? Was your anger against the rivers, Or your wrath against the sea, That you rode on your horses, On your chariots of salvation?

Tailo: tsiū kā Sàu-lô kah i ê kiáⁿ Io-ná-than ê kut bâi-tsòng tī Biān-iá-mín tē ê Tsé-la̍h, tī Sàu-lô ê pē Ki-si ê bōng; tsiàu ông it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng ê khì kiâⁿ. Tsit sî liáu-āu, Siōng-tsú uī-tio̍h hit-ê só͘-tsāi thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó.
English: They buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the tomb of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. After that God was entreated for the land.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t siu A-bi-ga-il tuà-lâi hō͘ i ê mi̍h, tsiū kā i kóng, Lí thang pîng-an tńg-khì lí ê ke, lí khuàⁿ, guá ū thiaⁿ lí ê uē, tsiàu lí ê uē khì tsò.
English: So David received of her hand that which she had brought him: and he said to her, Go up in peace to your house; behold, I have listened to your voice, and have accepted your person.

Tailo: I-é-su kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì tshing-tshing tshó-tshó kā in kóng. Piat-tò͘ tsiū giú I lâi piⁿ-á, kā I khó͘-khǹg.
English: He spoke to them openly. Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā Guá tuì lín kóng ê uē, lín tio̍h kín-sīn lâi tsun-siú. Lí m̄-thang thê-khí pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng ê miâ, mā m̄-thang kóng hō͘ lâng thiaⁿ.
English: Be careful to do all things that I have said to you; and don't invoke the name of other gods, neither let them be heard out of your mouth.

Tailo: Guá hui-siông pi-siong, sim-lāi thòng-khó͘ bô suah.
English: that I have great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart.

Tailo: Kiông-pō ê lâng ín-iú tshù-piⁿ, tshuā i kiânn m̄-hó ê lō͘.
English: A man of violence entices his neighbor, And leads him in a way that is not good.

Tailo: Me-ná-hiàm kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kám bô lóng kì tī I-su-la-el tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that he did, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tī huē-bō͘ lāi kah hûn-thiāu tiong hián-hiān, hûn-thiāu thîng tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g ê tíng-bīn.
English: Yahweh appeared in the Tent in a pillar of cloud: and the pillar of cloud stood over the door of the Tent.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng kóng, ' Guá ê tsó͘-sian sī tsi̍t-ê teh beh sí ê A-lâm lâng, lo̍h-khì Ai-gi̍p tī hia kià-kha. Lâng-gia̍h tsió-tsió tī hia tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t-ê tuā koh kiông ê kok, lâng-gia̍h koh tsē.
English: You shall answer and say before Yahweh your God, A Syrian ready to perish was my father; and he went down into Egypt, and sojourned there, few in number; and he became there a nation, great, mighty, and populous.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū khí-.lâi, tsiàu Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k ê uē khì kiâⁿ, i kah i ê ke tsiū khì Hui-lī-sū lâng ê tē, tī hia tuà tshit nî.
English: The woman arose, and did according to the word of the man of God; and she went with her household, and sojourned in the land of the Philistines seven years.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá tshut līng, huan-hù guá só͘ kuán-hat ê kok ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h tī Ta-ni-el ê Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, in-uī I sī ua̍h ê Siōng-tè, kú-tn̂g tsûn-tsāi, I ê kok íng-uán bē bia̍t-bông; I ê kuân-pìng bô kiông bô tsīn!
English: I make a decree, that in all the dominion of my kingdom men tremble and fear before the God of Daniel; for he is the living God, and steadfast forever, His kingdom that which shall not be destroyed; and his dominion shall be even to the end.

Tailo: Gōng ê kā tshong-bîng ê kóng, ' Tshiánn kā lín ê iû pun tsi̍t-kuá hō͘ guán, in-uī guán ê ting teh beh hua-khì à. '
English: The foolish said to the wise, Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.'

Tailo: Mô͘-ap ông khuàⁿ-tio̍h kau-tsiàn ê sè-bīn tí-ti̍k bē tiâu, tsiū tuà gia̍h to ê tshit-pah lâng, beh tshiong-kuè tīn khì-kàu E-tóm ông hia, tsóng-.sī, bē-tàng tshiong kuè-.khì.
English: When the king of Moab saw that the battle was too severe for him, he took with him seven hundred men who drew sword, to break through to the king of Edom; but they could not.

Tailo: ní âng ê kang-iûⁿ phuê, hái-káu-phuê;
English: rams' skins dyed red, sea cow hides, acacia wood,

Tailo: A-má-tsiah tī iâm ê suaⁿ-kok thâi-sí E-tóm lâng tsi̍t bān, koh tsing-ho̍k Se-la̍h, kā i kái miâ kiò-tsò Iok-thel, ti̍t-kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: He killed of Edom in the Valley of Salt ten thousand, and took Sela by war, and called the name of it Joktheel, to this day.

Tailo: Īng pháiⁿ pò hó ê lâng, tsai-eh bē lī-khui i ê ke.
English: Whoever rewards evil for good, Evil shall not depart from his house.

Tailo: Hông-siú ê ping kā Io-ná-than kah gia̍h i ê kun-khì ê lâng kóng, Lín khí-lâi guán tsia, guán ū tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì beh pò lín tsai. Io-ná-than tsiū kā gia̍h i ê ke-si-.ê kóng, Lí tuè guá tsiūⁿ-.khì, in-uī Siōng-tsú kā in kau tī I-su-la-el lâng ê tshiú tiong.
English: The men of the garrison answered Jonathan and his armor bearer, and said, Come up to us, and we will show you a thing. Jonathan said to his armor bearer, Come up after me; for Yahweh has delivered them into the hand of Israel.

Tailo: I ín-tshuā in king-kuè sua-bô͘, in mā bô tshuì-ta; I uī-tio̍h in hō͘ tsuí tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ lâu tshut; tsio̍h-puâⁿ li̍h-.khui, tsuí tsiū tshìng tshut-.lâi. Siōng-tsú kóng: Pháiⁿ lâng it-tīng bē pîng-an.
English: They didn't thirst when he led them through the deserts; he caused the waters to flow out of the rock for them; he split the rock also, and the waters gushed out.

Tailo: Guá thè lín tam-sim, khióng-kiaⁿ guá í-tsîng tī lín tiong-kan ê lô-khó͘ kang-tsok ē piàn-sîng bô tshái-kang.
English: I am afraid for you, that I might have wasted my labor for you.

Tailo: Gâ-lióng tsò A-kha-iah tsóng-tok ê sî, Iô-tá-iah lâng liân-ha̍p kong-kik Páu-lô, kā i thua-khì huat-tîng,
English: But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat,

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh kā lín kuáⁿ-tshut tsit só͘-tsāi, khì-kàu lín kah lín ê tsó͘-sian só͘ m̄-bat ê tē. Tī hia lín ē mê-ji̍t ho̍k-sāi pa̍t tsióng ê sîn-bîng; tī hia Guá bô beh si un hō͘ lín. '
English: therefore will I cast you forth out of this land into the land that you have not known, neither you nor your fathers; and there shall you serve other gods day and night; for I will show you no favor.

Tailo: to̍h-sī tshin-tshiūnn lâng kah i ê tshù-piⁿ khì tshiū-nâ beh tshò tshiū-ba̍k, tshiú gia̍h pó͘-thâu tsi̍t ē tshò, beh tshò hit-ê tshiū, pó͘-thâu bah lut-khì, siong-tio̍h i ê tshù-piⁿ lâi tì-sú sí, tsit-ê lâng tio̍h tsáu kàu hiah-ê siâⁿ ê tsi̍t-ê, tsiū thang ua̍h lo̍h-.khì.
English: as when a man goes into the forest with his neighbor to hew wood, and his hand fetches a stroke with the axe to cut down the tree, and the head slips from the handle, and lights on his neighbor, so that he dies; he shall flee to one of these cities and live:

Tailo: Guán tuì thian-hō͘ sio hiuⁿ kuàn-tiān ê sî, guán tsò piáⁿ lâi kā i ho̍k-sāi, tuì i kuàn-tiān, guán ê tiōng-hu kám bô hūn?
English: When we burned incense to the queen of the sky, and poured out drink offerings to her, did we make her cakes to worship her, and pour out drink offerings to her, without our husbands?

Tailo: Biáu-sī tō-lí ê lâng ka-kī tsū tshú bia̍t-bông; kìng-uì kài-bīng ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h pò-siúⁿ.
English: Whoever despises instruction will pay for it, But he who respects a command will be rewarded.

Tailo: Ông, lí sī lia̍t ông ê ông, thinn-tíng ê Siōng-tè í-king kā kok-tō͘, kuân-pìng, lîng-li̍k kah îng-kng siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí.
English: You, O king, are king of kings, to whom the God of heaven has given the kingdom, the power, and the strength, and the glory;

Tailo: I m̄ iông-ín guá tshuán tsi̍t-ē khuì, to̍k-to̍k hō͘ guá tshiong-muá khó͘-lān.
English: He will not allow me to take my breath, But fills me with bitterness.

Tailo: Guán tī hia tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah tsûn beh khì Hue-ní-ke, tsiū tsiūⁿ hit tsiah tsûn tshut-huat.
English: Having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail.

Tailo: Siū buah-iû ê tsè-si tio̍h tshú tām-po̍h gû-káng-á ê hueh, tuà kàu huē-bō͘ lâi.
English: The anointed priest shall bring of the blood of the bull to the Tent of Meeting:

Tailo: Tsháu tsá-khí sî huat-tshut-lâi bō͘-sīng, ê-hng sî siū kuah tsiū ta-.khì.
English: In the morning it sprouts and springs up. By evening, it is withered and dry.

Tailo: Guá bat tsuan-sim kiû Lí ê un; guān Lí tsiàu Lí ê ìng-ín liân-bín guá!
English: I sought your favor with my whole heart. Be merciful to me according to your word.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Bí-la̍h tiāⁿ-tio̍h hō͘ Ta-bi̍t ê kî kàu à, kìng-jiân khì hō͘ Bí-hô-la̍h lâng A-tik-lia̍t tsò bó͘.
English: But it happened at the time when Merab, Saul's daughter, should have been given to David, that she was given to Adriel the Meholathite as wife.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ê ke kah Ta-bi̍t ê ke kau-tsiàn tsin kú. Ta-bi̍t ná kiông-sīng, Sàu-lô ê ke ná sue-jio̍k.
English: Now there was long war between the house of Saul and the house of David: and David grew stronger and stronger, but the house of Saul grew weaker and weaker.

Tailo: Ai-gi̍p ê jîn-bîn lóng ē tsai Guá to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú, in-uī in tuì I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn bat tsò kah-ná lô͘-uí bô la̍t ê kuái-á.
English: All the inhabitants of Egypt will know that I am Yahweh, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.

Tailo: Gī lâng kuan-sim i tsing-seⁿ ê ua̍h-miā; pháiⁿ lâng ê liân-bín mā sī tsân-jím.
English: A righteous man regards the life of his animal, But the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

Tailo: Lô͘-lē bô íng-uán sio̍k tī tsú-lâng ê ka-tîng, kiáⁿ tsiū íng-uán sio̍k hit-ê ka-tîng.
English: A bondservant doesn't live in the house forever. A son remains forever.

Tailo: Hiah-ê siâ-sîn kiû I-é-su kóng, Lí nā beh kā guán kuáⁿ-tshut, kiû Lí hō͘ guán ji̍p-khì hit-tīn ti.
English: The demons begged him, saying, If you cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of pigs.

Tailo: Ū hong tuì Siōng-tsú tshut-.lâi, kā ian-tshun tuì hái-.ni̍h tshue-.lâi, lo̍h tī iâⁿ piⁿ, tsit pîng tsha-put-to tsi̍t ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, hit pîng tsha-put-to tsi̍t ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, tī iâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî sì-kè lóng sī, lī tē tsha-put-to ū nn̄g tiú.
English: There went forth a wind from Yahweh, and brought quails from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, about a day's journey on this side, and a day's journey on the other side, round about the camp, and about two cubits above the surface of the earth.

Tailo: Gō͘ lâng tńg-lâi-kàu Tso-lah kah E-si-ta-ol in ê hiann-tī hia, hiann-tī mn̄g in kóng, Lín ū siáⁿ-mi̍h uē?
English: They came to their brothers to Zorah and Eshtaol: and their brothers said to them, What say you?

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm thiaⁿ E-hu-lóng ê uē, tsiàu i tī Hiat lâng ê bīn-tsîng só͘ kóng ê, kā bé-bē thong-iōng ê gîn, tshìn sì-pah si-khel hō͘ E-hu-lóng.
English: Abraham listened to Ephron. Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver which he had named in the audience of the children of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, according to the current merchants' standard.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâu ba̍k-sái tuà tsíng-tsí tshut-khì ê lâng, tik-khak ē tuà i ê tiū-pé huaⁿ-huaⁿ hí-hí tò tńg-.lâi!
English: He who goes out weeping, carrying seed for sowing, Will assuredly come again with joy, carrying his sheaves.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng ē tī hit-ê lô͘-po̍k bô phah-sǹg ê ji̍t, siūnn bē kàu ê sî tńg-.lâi.
English: the lord of that servant will come in a day when he doesn't expect it, and in an hour when he doesn't know it,

Tailo: Sí-bông ê to̍k-tshì sī tsuē, tsuē ê kuân-sè sī lu̍t-huat.
English: The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì hia king-kuè, khuàⁿ-tio̍h sin-si pàng tī lō͘-.ni̍h, sai mā khiā tī sin-si ê piⁿ-á, tsiū lâi lāu sian-ti só͘ tuà ê siâⁿ, kóng-khí tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: Behold, men passed by, and saw the body cast in the way, and the lion standing by the body; and they came and told it in the city where the old prophet lived.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú nā huann-hí lán, tsiū ē tshuā lán kàu hit-ê tē, kā tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán; hit-ê tē sī lâu ling kah bi̍t ê tē.
English: If Yahweh delight in us, then he will bring us into this land, and give it to us; a land which flows with milk and honey.

Tailo: Guá siūⁿ, tī guá iáu ua̍h-.leh ê sî, guá ing-kai tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kā lín thê-tshéⁿ.
English: I think it right, as long as I am in this tent, to stir you up by reminding you;

Tailo: Tshit tsiah hó ê gû-bó sī tshit nî, tshit suī hó ê, mā sī tshit nî; nn̄g-ê bāng sī tsi̍t-ê ì-sù.
English: The seven good cattle are seven years; and the seven good heads of grain are seven years. The dream is one.

Tailo: I sī guá ê tsû-ài, guá ê suaⁿ-tsē, guá ê siâⁿ-pó, guá ê Kiù-tsú, guá ê tîn-pâi, guá só͘ uá-khò ê; I hō͘ guá ê jîn-bîn khut-ho̍k tī guá ē-bīn.
English: My loving kindness, my fortress, My high tower, my deliverer, My shield, and he in whom I take refuge; Who subdues my people under me.

Tailo: Kā só͘ phah hit nn̄g tiâu kim liān-á, liân tī siang thâu ê nn̄g-ê khuân.
English: They put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.

Tailo: Kìng-pài Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k nā ē-tàng tsi̍t pái tsiū sé-tshing i ê tsuē, liông-sim bô koh ū tsuē ê ì-sik, tsiū m̄-bián koh-tsài hiàn tsè.
English: Or else wouldn't they have ceased to be offered, because the worshippers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more consciousness of sins?

Tailo: Sîn-lîng tsiū ji̍p-lâi guá ê lāi-bīn, hō͘ guá khiā khí-.lâi. I kah guá kóng-uē, tuì guá kóng, Lí khì, lí tio̍h ka-kī kuainn tī tshù lāi.
English: Then the Spirit entered into me, and set me on my feet; and he spoke with me, and said to me, Go, shut yourself within your house.

Tailo: Bē-tha-niah lī Ê-lú-sa-lèm iok saⁿ kong-lí.
English: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia away.

Tailo: Nā kan-taⁿ pûn tsi̍t ki, tsìng siú-líng, to̍h-sī I-su-la-el ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p kàu lí hia.
English: If they blow but one, then the princes, the heads of the thousands of Israel, shall gather themselves to you.

Tailo: Hîng-uî uân-tsuân koh tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú lu̍t-huat ê lâng, tsit khuán lâng tsin ū hok-khì!
English: Blessed are those whose ways are blameless, Who walk according to Yahweh's law.

Tailo: Sî teh beh kàu, kî-si̍t í-king kàu à. Lín ē sì-suàⁿ, ta̍k lâng tńg-khì ka-kī ê só͘-tsāi, pàng guá ka-kī tsi̍t-ê; tsóng-.sī, guá m̄-sī ka-kī tsi̍t-ê, in-uī ū Thiⁿ-pē kah guá tông-tsāi.
English: Behold, the time is coming, yes, and has now come, that you will be scattered, everyone to his own place, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, I-su-la-el lâng tī Guá só͘ kuáⁿ in khì-kàu ê lia̍t kok tiong, mā it-tīng tio̍h án-ne tsia̍h bô tshing-khì ê piáⁿ.
English: Yahweh said, Even thus shall the children of Israel eat their bread unclean, among the nations where I will drive them.

Tailo: Lín kin-á-ji̍t kìng-jiân ua̍t tńg-sin bô koh tuè Siōng-tsú! Lín kin-á-ji̍t puē-gi̍k Siōng-tsú, bîn-á-tsài I ē tuì I-su-la-el ê tsuân huē-tsiòng siū-khì.
English: that you must turn away this day from following Yahweh? and it will be, seeing you rebel today against Yahweh, that tomorrow he will be angry with the whole congregation of Israel.

Tailo: Gi-lia̍t kám bô tsuē? In tsuân-jiân sī hi-ké ê. Tī Gil-gal hiàn gû-á tsò tsè, in ê tsè-tuâⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tshân-.ni̍h lê-tsuā ê tsio̍h-tui.
English: If Gilead is wicked, Surely they are worthless. In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls. Indeed, their altars are like heaps in the furrows of the field.

Tailo: Ông koh tshe tē-saⁿ tuī ê pâi-tiúⁿ tshuā i hit gō͘-tsa̍p lâng. Hit-ê tē-saⁿ tuī ê pâi-tiúⁿ tsiūⁿ-.khì, kuī tī E-li-iah ê bīn-tsîng, khún-kiû i kóng, Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k, kiû lí lia̍h guá ê sèⁿ-miā kah lí tsit gō͘-tsa̍p-ê lô͘-po̍k ê sèⁿ-miā tsò pó-puè!
English: Again he sent the captain of a third fifty with his fifty. The third captain of fifty went up, and came and fell on his knees before Elijah, and begged him, and said to him, man of God, please let my life, and the life of these fifty your servants, be precious in your sight.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng ê kiáⁿ Lô-bo-àm tī Iô-tah tsò ông. Lô-bo-àm tsē-uī ê sî, sì-tsa̍p-it huè, tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú tuì I-su-la-el tsìng tsi-tso̍k tiong só͘ kíng lâi an-tì I ê miâ ê siâⁿ, tsò ông tsa̍p-tshit nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Ná-má, sī Am-móng lâng.
English: Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which Yahweh had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there: and his mother's name was Naamah the Ammonitess.

Tailo: In-uī I-é-sái ê kiáⁿ ua̍h tī tē-tsiūⁿ ê sî, lí kah lí ê kok it-tīng bē kian-kò͘. Taⁿ tio̍h tshe lâng khì lia̍h i lâi guá tsia, i it-tīng tio̍h sí.
English: For as long as the son of Jesse lives on the earth, you shall not be established, nor your kingdom. Therefore now send and bring him to me, for he shall surely die.

Tailo: Tì-huī ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ta̍k-ê kiàn-li̍p ka-kī ê ke; gōng ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tshin-tshiú thiah-huí ka-tîng.
English: Every wise woman builds her house, But the foolish one tears it down with her own hands.

Tailo: Guān in ū tì-huī, ē bîng-pi̍k tsit-ê, ē siūⁿ in ê kiat-kio̍k.
English: Oh that they were wise, that they understood this, That they would consider their latter end!

Tailo: In ê sim tú teh khuài-lo̍k ê sî, siâⁿ lāi hiah-ê huí-luī lâi uî i ê tshù, ti̍t-ti̍t phah mn̂g, tuì tshù-tsú lāu lâng kóng, Lí kā hit-ê ji̍p-khì lí ê tshù ê lâng tshuā tshut-.lâi, guán beh kah i kau-ha̍p.
English: As they were making their hearts merry, behold, the men of the city, certain base fellows, beset the house round about, beating at the door; and they spoke to the master of the house, the old man, saying, Bring forth the man who came into your house, that we may know him.

Tailo: He-si-bóng kah i ê kau-iá, Ia-tsel kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng sì tsō siâⁿ hō͘ in.
English: Heshbon with its suburbs, Jazer with its suburbs; four cities in all.

Tailo: Lí mā tio̍h ē kì-tit lí í-tsîng tī Ai-gi̍p tē tsò lô͘-po̍k, Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú, tshun tshut-.lâi ê tshiú-kut, tshuā lí tuì hia tshut-.lâi, in-uī án-ne, Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè bīng-līng lí tio̍h siú An-hioh-ji̍t.
English: You shall remember that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God brought you out of there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm: therefore Yahweh your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù I-su-la-el tsuân huē-tsiòng tuì in kóng, Lín tio̍h tsò sìng, in-uī Guá — Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè sī sìng.
English: Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and tell them, You shall be holy; for I Yahweh your God am holy.

Tailo: Hit sî, tī Iô-tá-iah síng ê lâng tio̍h tô-tsáu khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h;
English: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tshe I-su-la-el lâng khì ê sî, in ta̍k lâng kui in ê sán-gia̍p, lâi tit-tio̍h in ê tē.
English: Now when Joshua had sent the people away, the children of Israel went every man to his inheritance to possess the land.

Tailo: Kàu Piat-tò͘ tsiūⁿ Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê sî, hiah-ê siū-kat-lé ê iô-tá-iah lâng kā i phue-phîng, kóng,
English: When Peter had come up to Jerusalem, those who were of the circumcision contended with him,

Tailo: Koh tuì hit-kha hē tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng té bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ ê khing-á lāi, the̍h tsi̍t tè piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè kiáu iû ê piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè po̍h piáⁿ,
English: and one loaf of bread, one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of unleavened bread that is before Yahweh.

Tailo: In mā bē-tàng tuì lí the̍h-tshut tsit-má teh kā guá khòng-kò ê tsìng-kì.
English: Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me.

Tailo: In-uī tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, guán li̍p khak-si̍t ê iok, kā i siá bîng. Guán ê siú-líng, Lē-bī lâng kah tsè-si lóng khàm ìn.
English: Yet for all this we make a sure covenant, and write it; and our princes, our Levites, and our priests, seal to it.

Tailo: Siōng-tè thiaⁿ-tio̍h gín-á ê siann, Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá tuì thinn-tíng kiò Ha-gal kóng, Ha-gal, lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì? M̄-bián kiaⁿ! Siōng-tsú í-king thiaⁿ-tio̍h gín-á tī hia teh khàu ê siann.
English: God heard the voice of the boy. The angel of God called to Hagar out of the sky, and said to her, What ails you, Hagar? Don't be afraid. For God has heard the voice of the boy where he is.

Tailo: I ê lé-mi̍h to̍h-sī tsi̍t-ê gîn-puâⁿ, tāng tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel, tsi̍t-ê gîn-uáⁿ, tāng tshit-tsa̍p si-khel, lóng sī tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel, tsit nn̄g-ê té-muá tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, tsò sò͘-tsè;
English: gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

Tailo: Pa̍k i ê lî-á tī phû-tô tshiū, pa̍k i ê lî-á-kiáⁿ tī hó ê phû-tô tshiū; īng phû-tô tsiú sé i ê saⁿ-khò͘, īng phû-tô-tsiap sé i ê saⁿ-khò͘.
English: Binding his foal to the vine, His donkey's colt to the choice vine; He has washed his garments in wine, His robes in the blood of grapes:

Tailo: Sian-ti ê ha̍k-sing, tiàm tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tī i ê tuì-bīn ê, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i, tsiū kóng, Kám-tōng E-li-iah ê Sìng Sîn tiàm tī E-lí-siah à. In tsiū lâi kā i gîng-tsiap, phak-lo̍h tī i ê bīn-tsîng.
English: When the sons of the prophets who were at Jericho over against him saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah does rest on Elisha. They came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.

Tailo: In-uī in khì E-si-kol ê suaⁿ-kok khì khuànn hit-ê tē ê sî, ū hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng lué-tsì, bô ài ji̍p-khì Siōng-tsú só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê tē.
English: For when they went up to the valley of Eshcol, and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the children of Israel, that they should not go into the land which Yahweh had given them.

Tailo: ( A-sah ê si, tsiàu E-to-tòng ê tsò-huat, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) Guá beh tuì Siōng-tè tshut siaⁿ kiû-kiò; guá tuì Siōng-tè tshut siaⁿ, I ē àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ.
English: My cry goes to God! Indeed, I cry to God for help, And for him to listen to me.

Tailo: In īng sin ê tshia tsài Siōng-tè ê iok-kuī, tuì A-bi-na-tap ê tshù-tshut-.lâi, U-tsà kah A-hi-oh kuáⁿ tshia.
English: They carried the ark of God on a new cart, and brought it out of the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.

Tailo: In-uī lín tsit-ê ho̍k-sāi ê kang-tsok, m̄-nā kái-kuat sìn-tô͘ ê su-iàu, mā hō͘ tsin tsē lâng ke-thinn in tuì Siōng-tè ê kám-siā.
English: For this service of giving that you perform not only makes up for lack among the saints, but abounds also through many givings of thanks to God;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tsiū īng hó uē kah an-uì ê uē, ìn hit-ê kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá.
English: Yahweh answered the angel who talked with me with kind and comforting words.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, tī I ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, gue̍h bô kng, tsheⁿ mā bô tshing-khì.
English: Behold, even the moon has no brightness, And the stars are not pure in his sight;

Tailo: I īng tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tsng tsi̍t sian sîn-pu̍t, to̍h-sī tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng. I phak lo̍h-lâi kā i pài, tuì i kî-tó kóng, Kiû lí kiù guá, in-uī lí sī guá ê sîn-bîng.
English: The residue of it he makes a god, even his engraved image; he falls down to it and worships, and prays to it, and says, Deliver me; for you are my god.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tsiū tshe Ia-lu-ba-al, Be-tàn, I-é-hú-thah kah Sa-mu-el, lâi kiù lín thuat-lī sì-kho͘-uî tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú, lín tsiah pîng-an tuà lo̍h-.khì.
English: Yahweh sent Jerubbaal, and Bedan, and Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side; and you lived in safety.

Tailo: Nó͘-ah ê kiáⁿ kah i tsò-hué tshut tuā tsûn ê, to̍h-sī Sé-mh, Hâm, Iá-hia̍t. Hâm sī Ka-nân ê lāu-pē.
English: The sons of Noah who went forth from the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham is the father of Canaan.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū bong in ê ba̍k-tsiu, kóng, Tsiàu lín ê sìn-sim kā lín sîng-tsiū.
English: Then he touched their eyes, saying, According to your faith be it done to you.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá sī uī lín ê, Guá beh ua̍t tńg-lâi ǹg lín, lín tsiū ē hō͘ lâng tsìng-tsoh.
English: For, behold, I am for you, and I will turn into you, and you shall be tilled and sown;

Tailo: hit-ê tē-kài koh tuì Ba-la̍h ǹg sai pîng se̍h kàu Se-il suaⁿ, kuè kàu Iâ-lîm suaⁿ piⁿ ê pak pîng ( Iâ-lîm to̍h-sī Ki-sat-lûn ) , koh lo̍h-khì kàu Bia̍t-si-mé-si, king-kuè Tim-ná,
English: and the border turned about from Baalah westward to Mount Seir, and passed along to the side of Mount Jearim on the north ( the same is Chesalon ) , and went down to Beth Shemesh, and passed along by Timnah;

Tailo: Huâ-láu sim ngē, m̄-tsún I-su-la-el lâng lī-khui, tú-tú tsiàu Siōng-tsú thok Mô͘-se só͘ kóng ê.
English: The heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he didn't let the children of Israel go, just as Yahweh had spoken through Moses.

Tailo: In ìn kóng, Khí-.lâi, lán lâi-khì kong-kik in, in-uī guán í-king khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê tē, lí khuàⁿ, hit-ê tē tsin hó, lín án-tsuáⁿ tiām-tiām? Tio̍h ji̍p-.khì, thang tit-tio̍h hit-ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p, m̄-thang iân-tshiân.
English: They said, Arise, and let us go up against them; for we have seen the land, and behold, it is very good: and are you still? don't be slothful to go and to enter in to possess the land.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī Mô͘-ap ê pîng-guân, tī Iol-tàn hô guā, I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê tuì-bīn.
English: The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho.

Tailo: Tng kàng hîng-hua̍t ê ji̍t, ū tsai-hō tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lîm-kàu, hit sî lín beh án-tsuáⁿ? Lín beh tsáu-khì kiû siáⁿ lâng kā lín kiù? Lín ê tsâi-pó ē lâu tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi?
English: What will you do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which will come from afar? To whom will you flee for help? Where will you leave your wealth?

Tailo: Tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ huann-hí.
English: Rejoice always.

Tailo: Tu-lô ông Hi-lâm huê-phue ìn Só͘-lô-móng kóng, In-uī Siōng-tsú thiàⁿ I ê tsú-bîn, tsiū siat-li̍p lí tsò in ê ông.
English: Then Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon, Because Yahweh loves his people, he has made you king over them.

Tailo: I tsai in ê kiong-tiān, koh hō͘ in ê siâⁿ piàn-tsò pha-hng, in-uī i hm̄-hm̄ háu ê siann, tsuân tē kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê tsiū lóng hong-huì.
English: He knew their palaces, and laid waste their cities; and the land was desolate, and the fullness of it, because of the noise of his roaring.

Tailo: Tī hit gō͘ gue̍h-ji̍t tiong-kan, lâng kiû beh sí mā bē tit sí, ài beh sí mā sí bē-khì.
English: In those days people will seek death, and will in no way find it. They will desire to die, and death will flee from them.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Ū tsai-hō, hui-siông ê tsai-hō; lí khuàⁿ, teh beh kàu à!
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: An evil, an only evil; behold, it comes.

Tailo: Tuì Iô-tá-iah lâng kang-tsok ê sî, guá tsiū tshin-tshiūnn Iô-tá-iah lâng, sī in-uī beh tit-tio̍h Iô-tá-iah lâng lâi sìn Tsú. Guá suî-jiân sī bô sio̍k lu̍t-huat kuán-hat ê lâng, uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ khah tsē siū lu̍t-huat kuán-hat ê lâng lâi sìn Tsú, guá tsiū tshin-tshiūnn siū lu̍t-huat kuán-hat ê lâng.
English: To the Jews I became as a Jew, that I might gain Jews; to those who are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain those who are under the law;

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ê soh-á kā guá khún-pa̍k, tsóng-.sī, guá bô bē kì-tit Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: The ropes of the wicked bind me, But I won't forget your law.

Tailo: In khuàⁿ-liáu, tsiū kā thiⁿ-sài tuì in só͘ kóng kuan-hē tsit-ê enn-á ê tāi-tsì pò hō͘ lâng tsai.
English: When they saw it, they publicized widely the saying which was spoken to them about this child.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, ông ê uē iâⁿ-kuè Io-ap kah hiah-ê kun-tiúⁿ. Io-ap kah hiah-ê kun-tiúⁿ tsiū tuì ông ê bīn-tsîng tshut-.khì, tiám-sǹg I-su-la-el ê jîn-bîn.
English: Notwithstanding, the king's word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the army. Joab and the captains of the army went out from the presence of the king, to number the people of Israel.

Tailo: Li̍p-iok liáu-āu, i ē kiânn kuí-tsà, īng tsió-tsió ê jîn-bîn tsiâⁿ-tsò kiông-bíng.
English: After the league made with him he shall work deceitfully; for he shall come up, and shall become strong, with a small people.

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: Ē thiaⁿ ê hīⁿ-khang kah ē khuànn ê ba̍k-tsiu, tsit nn̄g hāng lóng sī Siōng-tsú só͘ tsō.
English: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Yahweh has made even both of them.

Tailo: Guá kiû Lí nn̄g kiāⁿ sū; tī guá buē sí tsìn-tsîng, m̄-thang bô hō͘ guá.
English: Two things I have asked of you; Don't deny me before I die:

Tailo: Tsit-ê tuā kuân-lîng to̍h-sī hō͘ Ki-tok tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, koh hō͘ Ki-tok tī thinn-tíng tsē tī I ê tsiànn pîng.
English: which he worked in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and made him to sit at his right hand in the heavenly places,

Tailo: In-uī lí tī só͘-ū ê ke-lō͘ kháu khí hue-lâu, tī ta̍k tiâu ke-lō͘ khí kuân-tâi, in-uī lí bô tshin-tshiūnn pa̍t-ê tshiong-ki, bô ài tsînn.
English: in that you build your vaulted place at the head of every way, and make your lofty place in every street, and have not been as a prostitute, in that you scorn pay.

Tailo: Lín kám bô mn̄g kuè lō͘ ê lâng? Kám bē jīn-tit in ê tsìng-kì?
English: Haven't you asked wayfaring men? Don't you know their evidences,

Tailo: In-uī bô bo̍k-tsiá, iûⁿ tsiū sì-suàⁿ; sì-suàⁿ liáu-āu, tsiū tsiâⁿ-tsò só͘-ū iá-siù ê tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: They were scattered, because there was no shepherd; and they became food to all the animals of the field, and were scattered.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, E-bia̍t-me-li̍k tshuā tsiah-ê lâng tsò-hué khì, ji̍p-khì ông-kiong, kàu khò͘-pâng ē-bīn, tuì hia the̍h phuà-pò͘, kū sann, īng soh-á luī lo̍h-khì kó͘-tséⁿ lāi, lâi-kàu I-é-lí-miah hia.
English: So Ebedmelech took the men with him, and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took there rags and worn-out garments, and let them down by cords into the dungeon to Jeremiah.

Tailo: Guá án-ne kóng m̄-sī teh bīng-līng lín, sī ài lín tsai pa̍t lâng án-tsuáⁿ jia̍t-sim teh pang-tsān lâng, lâi khó-giām lín ê thiàⁿ-sim sī m̄-sī si̍t-tsāi.
English: I speak not by way of commandment, but as proving through the earnestness of others the sincerity also of your love.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí hō͘ in tshin-tshiūnn kńg-lê-á hong ê tîn-ai, tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ hong tshue tsáu ê tiū-sap.
English: My God, make them like tumbleweed; Like chaff before the wind.

Tailo: I-é-su tshut-.khì, khuàⁿ-tio̍h kui tuā-tīn ê lâng, tsiū liân-bín in, i hó in tiong-kan ū pēⁿ ê lâng.
English: Jesus went out, and he saw a great multitude. He had compassion on them, and healed their sick.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí ē tuī lo̍h-khì im-kan, kàu tī tshim kheⁿ ê ki̍k-thâu.
English: Yet you shall be brought down to Sheol, to the depths of the pit.

Tailo: I ê lé-mi̍h to̍h-sī tsi̍t-ê gîn-puâⁿ, tāng tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel, tsi̍t-ê gîn-uáⁿ, tāng tshit-tsa̍p si-khel, lóng sī tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel, tsit nn̄g-ê té-muá tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, tsò sò͘-tsè;
English: gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guá kiû-kiò Lí; guá tuì Siōng-tsú kiû un, kóng,
English: I cried to you, Yahweh. To Yahweh I made supplication:

Tailo: Koh hō͘ i ê kiáⁿ king-kuè hué, koh ū khuànn tiāu-thâu, īng huat-su̍t, īng thiàu-tâng ê, tshiánn sai-kong, kiânn tsin tsē Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, lâi kik I ê siū-khì.
English: He made his son to pass through the fire, and practiced sorcery, and used enchantments, and dealt with those who had familiar spirits, and with wizards: he worked much evil in the sight of Yahweh, to provoke him to anger.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsit-ê só͘-tsāi ē ū pi-ai, tuà tī hit tiong-kan ê lâng kah tshân-iá ê siù, khong-tiong ê tsiáu, lóng ē sue-bî, hái tiong ê hî mā ē sí-.khì.
English: Therefore the land will mourn, And everyone who dwells therein will waste away. All living things in her, Even the animals of the field and the birds of the sky; Yes, the fish of the sea also die.

Tailo: Tī tsuí tiong lín só͘ thang tsia̍h ê sī tsiah-ê: kiàn-nā ū si̍t ū lân ê, lín lóng thang tsia̍h;
English: These you may eat of all that are in the waters: whatever has fins and scales may you eat;

Tailo: In thiaⁿ-tio̍h án-ne tsiū tsin huann-hí, koh tap-ìng beh hō͘ i tsînn. Iô-tah tsiū tshuē-khuàⁿ ū siáⁿ-mi̍h ki-huē thang kā I-é-su tshut-bē.
English: They, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. He sought how he might conveniently deliver him.

Tailo: Tû-kàⁿ-tseh ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t, to̍h-sī thâi Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê iûⁿ-ko ê ji̍t, bûn-tô͘ mn̄g I-é-su kóng, Lí ài guán khì siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi tsún-pī hō͘ Lí tsia̍h Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê buán-tshan?
English: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him, Where do you want us to go and make ready that you may eat the Passover?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê tshiú ē huāⁿ tī tsit-ê suaⁿ, Mô͘-ap lâng tī só͘ tuà ê tē ē siū thún-ta̍h, tshin-tshiūnn ta tsháu siū thún-ta̍h tī pùn-sò tî ê tsuí lāi.
English: For in this mountain the hand of Yahweh will rest. Moab will be trodden down in his place, even like straw is trodden down in the water of the dunghill.

Tailo: Lán tio̍h kàu I ê bīn-tsîng kám-siā I, īng si-kua ǹg I tshut huann-hí ê siann!
English: Let's come before his presence with thanksgiving. Let's extol him with songs!

Tailo: Lín hōng guá ê miâ bô-lūn kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h, guá lóng ē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín.
English: If you will ask anything in my name, I will do it.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, Guá beh tsám-tn̄g lí ê tshiú-kut kah lí ê pē ê ke ê tshiú-kut, hō͘ lí ê tshù lāi bô tsi̍t-ê lāu lâng.
English: Behold, the days come, that I will cut off your arm, and the arm of your father's house, that there shall not be an old man in your house.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng kóng hàm-kó͘ kah pe̍h-tsha̍t uē, kóng: Guá beh tuì lín suan-pò͘ po̍h tsiú kah kāu tsiú, tsit-ê lâng tsiū beh tsò tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê sian-ti.
English: If a man walking in a spirit of falsehood lies: I will prophesy to you of wine and of strong drink;' He would be the prophet of this people.

Tailo: Guá puàⁿ-mê khí-.lâi, ū kuí-nā-ê lâng kah guá tsò-hué; tsóng-.sī, guá ê Siōng-tsú kám-tōng guá ê sim só͘ beh uī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsò ê, guá pīng bô kā lâng kóng. Tû guá khiâ ê tsing-seⁿ í-guā, mā bô pa̍t tsiah tsing-seⁿ kah guá khì.
English: I arose in the night, I and some few men with me; neither told I any man what my God put into my heart to do for Jerusalem; neither was there any animal with me, except the animal that I rode on.

Tailo: Tī tuā-tsuí ê tíng-bīn, Si-hool ê bí-niûⁿ, Nai-l hô ê ngó͘-kok sī tuì Tu-lô tsìn-ji̍p ê; i tsò lia̍t kok ê káng-kháu.
English: On great waters, the seed of the Shihor, the harvest of the Nile, was her revenue. She was the market of nations.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsun-thàn Guá ê huat-tō͘, siú Guá ê lu̍t-lē, tsiàu tsit-ê lâi kiâⁿ, Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: You shall do my ordinances, and you shall keep my statutes, and walk in them: I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ lí ê lâng lóng bē kì-tit lí, bô lâi kā lí thàm-hóng. In-uī lí ê tsuē-kò tsin tāng, tsuē-ok tsin tsē, Guá īng tuì-ti̍k hit khuán ê phah-huat lâi phah lí, mā īng tsân-jím-.ê ê kíng-kài, lâi kā lí kíng-kài.
English: All your lovers have forgotten you; they don't seek you: for I have wounded you with the wound of an enemy, with the chastisement of a cruel one, for the greatness of your iniquity, because your sins were increased.

Tailo: I-é-su koh kóng, Ū hīⁿ-khang thang thiaⁿ ê lâng tio̍h thiaⁿ!
English: He said, Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.

Tailo: Thiaⁿ-kóng kuí-nā-ê lâng tuì guán tsia tshut-.khì, īng m̄-sī guán kau-tài ê uē kā lín kiáu-jiáu, jiáu-luān lín ê sim.
English: Because we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words, unsettling your souls, saying, You must be circumcised and keep the law,' to whom we gave no commandment;

Tailo: Iô-tah ông U-tsi-iah saⁿ-tsa̍p-káu nî, Ia-be-si ê kiáⁿ Sia-lúm tsē-uī, tī Sa-má-lī-a tsò ông tsi̍t gue̍h-ji̍t.
English: Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the nine and thirtieth year of Uzziah king of Judah; and he reigned the space of a month in Samaria.

Tailo: Tio̍h uī ka-kī tsik-tsū tsâi-pó tī thinn-tíng; tī hia bô thâng kā, bē siⁿ-sian phah-pháiⁿ, mā bô tsha̍t-á ó͘-khang lâi thau-the̍h.
English: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don't break through and steal;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Guá kám tsò kīn ê Siōng-tsú, bô tsò hn̄g ê Siōng-tsú?
English: Am I a God at hand, says Yahweh, and not a God afar off?

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín lâng, lín tio̍h tsáu tshut Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tī The-ko-uah pûn sàu-kak, tī Bia̍t-ha-ke-lém pàng ian-hué; in-uī ū tsai-hō kah tuā ê huí-bia̍t tuì pak-hong lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Flee for safety, you children of Benjamin, out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and raise up a signal on Beth Haccherem; for evil looks forth from the north, and a great destruction.

Tailo: Tse mā thang pí-phīng Hel-móng ê lō͘-tsuí lo̍h tī Si-óng suaⁿ; in-uī tī hia Siōng-tsú ū tiāⁿ-tio̍h sù-hok, to̍h-sī íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: Like the dew of Hermon, That comes down on the hills of Zion: For there Yahweh gives the blessing, Even life forevermore.

Tailo: Guá tshe lâng tiàu hiah-ê thâu-lâng, to̍h-sī E-lí-e-tsel, A-li-el, Si-má-iah, El-ná-than, Ia-lip, El-ná-than, Ná-than, Tsa-kha-lī-a, Me-siu-lám, koh tiàu kàu-uân Io-iá-lip kah El-ná-than.
English: Then sent I for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah, and for Elnathan, and for Jarib, and for Elnathan, and for Nathan, and for Zechariah, and for Meshullam, chief men; also for Joiarib, and for Elnathan, who were teachers.

Tailo: Lí khí-.lâi, khì Ni-ne-beh hit-ê tuā siâⁿ, tshut siaⁿ kā in kíng-kài, in-uī in ê tsuē-ok thàu kàu Guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and preach against it, for their wickedness has come up before me.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tiong-kan ū ê kóng, Tsit-ê lâng bô siú An-hioh-ji̍t, m̄-sī tuì Siōng-tè lâi ê. Ū ê kóng, Ū tsuē ê lâng ná ē kiânn tsit khuán sîn-jiah? In tsiū án-ne ì-kiàn hun-lia̍t.
English: Some therefore of the Pharisees said, This man is not from God, because he doesn't keep the Sabbath. Others said, How can a man who is a sinner do such signs? There was division among them.

Tailo: Āu-tiān tsîng ê tiān tshim sì-tsa̍p tiú.
English: The house, that is, the temple before the oracle, was forty cubits long.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Tik-khak bô lâng tuà tī hia, mā bô lâng kià-kha tī in tiong-kan, ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Guá — Siōng-tè tshia-tó So͘-tóm, Am-mo͘-la̍h kah hù-kīn ê siâⁿ án-ne.
English: As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbor cities of it, says Yahweh, so shall no man dwell there, neither shall any son of man sojourn therein.

Tailo: Koh kā lí ê îng-kng pun hō͘ i, hō͘ I-su-la-el ê tsuân huē-tsiòng lóng tsun-thàn i.
English: You shall put of your honor on him, that all the congregation of the children of Israel may obey.

Tailo: In-uī uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê iân-kò͘, koh uī-tio̍h guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ê iân-kò͘, guá beh pó-hō͘ tsit-ê siâⁿ, lâi kā i tsín-kiù.
English: For I will defend this city to save it, for my own sake, and for my servant David's sake.'

Tailo: Kú-si̍t lâng kah Lu-bí lâng kám m̄-sī tuā ê kun-tuī, ū tsin tsē tsiàn-tshia kah bé-ping? To̍k-to̍k in-uī lí uá-khò Siōng-tsú, I tsiū ē kā in kau tī lí ê tshiú tiong.
English: Weren't the Ethiopians and the Lubim a huge army, with chariots and horsemen exceeding many? yet, because you did rely on Yahweh, he delivered them into your hand.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kóng, Thiⁿ-ē tsiah-ê tsuí tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p kàu tsi̍t-ê só͘-tsāi, ta tē tio̍h tshut-hiān. Tsiū tsiàu án-ne uân-sîng.
English: God said, Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear, and it was so.

Tailo: Hit uī îng-kng ê ông sī siáⁿ lâng? To̍h sī tuā khuì-la̍t koh tuā kuân-lîng ê Siōng-tsú, tī kau-tsiàn ū tuā kuân-lîng ê Siōng-tsú.
English: Who is the King of glory? Yahweh strong and mighty, Yahweh mighty in battle.

Tailo: Gín-á tī i ê pak-lāi sio kheh, i tsiū kóng, Nā-sī án-ne, guá ná ē tú-tio̍h tsit khuán tāi-tsì? I tsiū khì mn̄g Siōng-tsú.
English: The children struggled together within her. She said, If it be so, why do I live? She went to inquire of Yahweh.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tsóng-.sī, bô tshin-tshiūnn i í-tsîng ê I-su-la-el tsiah-ê ông.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, yet not as the kings of Israel who were before him.

Tailo: Tsá-khí sî káu tiám ê sî, i koh tshut-.khì, khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū lâng îng-îng khiā tī tuā lō͘-kháu,
English: He went out about the third hour, and saw others standing idle in the marketplace.

Tailo: In-uī lí khǹg íng-uán ê uàn-hūn, tī I-su-la-el tso̍k tú-tio̍h tsai-hō, tsuē-kò tsiong-kio̍k ê sî, lí kā in kau hō͘ to-kiàm ê sè-li̍k.
English: Because you have had a perpetual enmity, and have given over the children of Israel to the power of the sword in the time of their calamity, in the time of the iniquity of the end;

Tailo: Taⁿ kiû lí tshe tsi̍t-ê lâng lâi-kàu guá tsia, to̍h-sī gâu tsò kim, gîn, tâng, thih kah tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik, nâ-sik ê liāu ê, mā tshiú-kang iù tī ta̍k hāng tiau-khik ê kang, thang kah hiah-ê kah guá tī Iô-tah Ê-lú-sa-lèm gâu ê sai-hū tsò-hué tsò-kang, to̍h-sī guá ê lāu-pē Ta-bi̍t só͘ tsún-pī ê.
English: Now therefore send me a man skillful to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and who knows how to engrave all manner of engravings, to be with the skillful men who are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father did provide.

Tailo: Ông bīng-līng tuā-tsè-si Hil-kí-iah kah tē-jī kip ê tsè-si, í-ki̍p kò͘-mn̂g ê kuann, kā uī-tio̍h Ba-al kah A-si-lah, í-ki̍p thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng só͘ tsō hiah-ê khì-kū, puaⁿ-tshut Siōng-tsú ê tiān, tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm guā Kit-lông khe piⁿ ê tshân kā i sio-tiāu, tuà i ê hué-hu lâi-kàu Be-thel.
English: The king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the threshold, to bring forth out of the temple of Yahweh all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the Asherah, and for all the army of the sky, and he burned them outside of Jerusalem in the fields of the Kidron, and carried the ashes of them to Bethel.

Tailo: Lâng tī sè-kan kám m̄-sī lô-khó͘ ê sî-kî? I ê ji̍t-tsí kám m̄-sī tshin-tshiūnn tshiàⁿ-kang ê ji̍t-tsí?
English: Isn't a man forced to labor on earth? Aren't his days like the days of a hired hand?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lán m̄-sī kiaⁿ tio̍h lâi kiâⁿ huan-thâu, tì-sú tîm-lûn ê lâng, lán sī ū sìn-sim lâi tit-kiù ê lâng.
English: But we are not of those who shrink back to destruction, but of those who have faith to the saving of the soul.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h lí nā kiânn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn lí ê lāu-pē Ta-bi̍t só͘ kiâⁿ ê, tsun-thàn Guá it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, tsip-siú Guá ê lu̍t-lē kah Guá ê huat-tō͘,
English: As for you, if you will walk before me as David your father walked, and do according to all that I have commanded you, and will keep my statutes and my ordinances;

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ke-thinn ê sî, tsuē-kò mā ke-thinn; gī lâng ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h in sit-pāi.
English: When the wicked increase, sin increases; But the righteous will see their downfall.

Tailo: Li-bé-kah ê ling-bú Te-bó͘-la̍h sí-.khì, tsiū bâi-tsòng tī Be-thel ē-bīn ê siōng tshiū kha, só͘-í kā i kiò-tsò A-lûn-pa-kó͘ ( tsù, Hi-bú-lâi bûn ê im-tha̍k, ì-sù sī ai-siong ê siōng tshiū ) .
English: Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died, and she was buried below Bethel under the oak; and the name of it was called Allon Bacuth.

Tailo: Taⁿ gia̍h lí ê ke-si, to̍h-sī tsìⁿ tē kah kiong, khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h, uī guá phah-la̍h.
English: Now therefore, please take your weapons, your quiver and your bow, and go out to the field, and take me venison.

Tailo: Guān sûn-tsuân kah tsìng-ti̍t pó-hō͘ guá, in-uī guá thìng-hāu Lí.
English: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, For I wait for you.

Tailo: Mô͘-se huan-hù I-su-la-el ta̍k tsi-tso̍k ê thâu-lâng, kā in kóng, Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng ê sī án-ne:
English: Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of the children of Israel, saying, This is the thing which Yahweh has commanded.

Tailo: In ê kha ē that-tio̍h, in ê tsi̍h ē hāi-tio̍h ka-kī; huān-nā khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng lóng ē iô thâu.
English: Their own tongues shall ruin them. All who see them will shake their heads.

Tailo: Lí tī Hô-lep suann khiā tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng, hit ji̍t Siōng-tsú tuì guá kóng, ' Lí kā Guá tsio-tsi̍p jîn-bîn, Guá beh hō͘ in thiaⁿ-tio̍h Guá ê uē, hō͘ in ua̍h tī sè-kan ê ji̍t, thang ha̍k-si̍p kìng-uì Guá, koh thang kà-sī in ê kiáⁿ-jî. '
English: the day that you stood before Yahweh your God in Horeb, when Yahweh said to me, Assemble me the people, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to fear me all the days that they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children.

Tailo: In-uī tuì guá lâi kóng, ua̍h sī uī-tio̍h Ki-tok, sí mā ū khah tuā ê lī-ik.
English: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.

Tailo: I-é-su siū tìng ê só͘-tsāi kīn-uá Ê-lú-sa-lèm siâⁿ, só͘-í, ū tsin tsē Iô-tá-iah lâng tha̍k-tio̍h tsit-ê tsuē-tsōng. Hit-ê tsuē-tsōng koh sī īng Hi-bú-lâi bûn, La̍h-ting bûn, Hi-la̍h bûn siá ê.
English: Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.

Tailo: sīm-tsì in bô beh tuì tshân-iá khioh tshâ, mā bô beh tuì tshiū-nâ tshò tshiū; in-uī in ē īng ke-si hiâⁿ hué, koh ē tshiúⁿ hiah-ê tshiúⁿ in ê lâng, kiap hiah-ê kiap in ê lâng. Tse to̍h-sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: so that they shall take no wood out of the field, neither cut down any out of the forests; for they shall make fires of the weapons; and they shall plunder those who plundered them, and rob those who robbed them, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm koh tsáu kàu gû-kûn ê só͘-tsāi, khan tsi̍t tsiah tsíⁿ koh hó ê gû-á lâi, kau hō͘ lô͘-po̍k, i tsiū kuáⁿ-kín khì tsún-pī.
English: Abraham ran to the herd, and fetched a tender and good calf, and gave it to the servant. He hurried to dress it.

Tailo: Tsit-ê thâu tsi̍t pái ê hō͘-kháu phó͘-tsa, sī Ku-lé-niú tsò Su-lī-a tsóng-tok ê sî si̍t-si ê.
English: This was the first enrollment made when Quirinius was governor of Syria.

Tailo: Sí-lâng kám ē tī bōng lāi kóng-khí Lí ê tsû-ài? Kám ē tī bia̍t-bông ê tiong-kan kóng-khí Lí ê sìn-si̍t?
English: Is your loving kindness declared in the grave? Or your faithfulness in Destruction?

Tailo: Iô-há-neh ìn kóng, Ū nn̄g niá saⁿ ê lâng, tio̍h pun hō͘ bô saⁿ ê lâng; ū tsia̍h-mi̍h ê lâng, mā tio̍h án-ne tsò.
English: He answered them, He who has two coats, let him give to him who has none. He who has food, let him do likewise.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī só͘-ū ê iûⁿ kah gû, suaⁿ-iá ê tsáu-siù,
English: All sheep and oxen, Yes, and the animals of the field,

Tailo: In-uī hīnn-á tshì-giām lâng ê uē, tshin-tshiūnn tíng-hâm hun-pia̍t tsu-bī.
English: For the ear tries words, As the palate tastes food.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín khì kā I ê bûn-tô͘ kóng, ' I-é-su tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h ā, I ē pí lín khah tāi-sing khì-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng, tī hia lín ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I. ' Taⁿ guá í-king kā lín kóng à.
English: Go quickly and tell his disciples, He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him.' Behold, I have told you.

Tailo: Khuan-thò ē tîⁿ-tio̍h i ê kha-āu-teⁿ, lô-bāng ē lia̍h-tio̍h i.
English: A snare shall take him by the heel; A trap shall lay hold on him.

Tailo: Ū tuì I ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ê ke, thè lán siat-li̍p ū tuā-lîng ê Kiù-tsú.
English: And has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Guá sī ua̍h-miā ê piáⁿ. Lâi guá tsia ê lâng tsua̍t-tuì bē iau, sìn guá ê lâng íng-uán bē tshuì-ta.
English: Jesus said to them, I am the bread of life. He who comes to me will not be hungry, and he who believes in me will never be thirsty.

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia ū tsin tsē tsâi-bu̍t kah tuā îng-kng, tsiū uī ka-kī khí kim-khò͘, siu-tsông kim-gîn, pó-tsio̍h, phang-liāu, pîn-pâi kah ta̍k tsióng ê pó-khì,
English: Hezekiah had exceeding much riches and honor: and he provided him treasuries for silver, and for gold, and for precious stones, and for spices, and for shields, and for all manner of goodly vessels;

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, in tsá-tsá khí-.lâi, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng kìng-pài liáu-āu, tsiū tńg-khì La̍h-má, kàu i ê ke. El-ká-nah kah i ê bó͘ Han-nah tâng-pâng, Siōng-tsú siàu-liām Han-nah,
English: They rose up in the morning early, and worshiped before Yahweh, and returned, and came to their house to Ramah: and Elkanah knew Hannah his wife; and Yahweh remembered her.

Tailo: Ji̍t-lo̍h thiⁿ àm, ū tshut ian ê lô͘ kah teh-to̍h ê hué-pé, tuì hiah-ê phuà pîng ê bah king-kuè.
English: It came to pass that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold, a smoking furnace, and a flaming torch passed between these pieces.

Tailo: In-uī lín niá siū sé-lé ê sî, lín ū kah Ki-tok tâng-tsê bâi-tsòng, koh tuì sé-lé, thong-kuè lín sìn Siōng-tè hō͘ Ki-tok tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h ê tuā kuân-lîng, hō͘ lín mā kah Ki-tok tâng-tsê ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through faith in the working of God, who raised him from the dead.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī Ai-gi̍p ê hîng-hua̍t, mā sī hiah-ê bô khí-lâi siú Tah-pò͘-pêⁿ-tseh ê lia̍t kok ê hîng-hua̍t.
English: This will be the punishment of Egypt, and the punishment of all the nations that don't go up to keep the feast of tents.

Tailo: lâng ū saⁿ-bān nn̄g-tshing lâng, to̍h-sī m̄-bat kah tsa-po͘ lâng tâng-pâng ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á.
English: and thirty-two thousand persons in all, of the women who had not known man by lying with him.

Tailo: Thang hō͘ tsuân tē lóng tsai Lí ê tsí-ì, hō͘ lia̍t pang lóng tsai Lí ê kiù-un.
English: That your way may be known on earth, And your salvation among all nations,

Tailo: Kuan-hē ī-siōng ê suaⁿ-kok ê bi̍k-sī. Ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì hō͘ lí ê jîn-bîn lóng tsiūⁿ tshù tíng?
English: The burden of the valley of vision. What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì kā in khuàn-bián kah kà-sī.
English: Command and teach these things.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h sîng-siū guá ê kà-sī, pí tit-tio̍h pe̍h-gîn khah hó; tit-tio̍h tì-sik pí tit-tio̍h n̂g-kim khah hó.
English: Receive my instruction rather than silver; Knowledge rather than choice gold.

Tailo: O-ba-tiah tī lō͘-.ni̍h, E-li-iah tú-tio̍h i, O-ba-tiah jīn-tit i, tsiū phak lo̍h-.khì, kóng, Lí kám sī guá ê tsú E-li-iah?
English: As Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, Is it you, my lord Elijah?

Tailo: A-hap tsiū tshe lâng khì I-su-la-el jîn-bîn hia, tsio-tsi̍p tsiah-ê sian-ti lâi-kàu Kal-mel suaⁿ.
English: So Ahab sent to all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together to Mount Carmel.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, I-su-la-el lâng ē ua̍t tńg-lâi tshuē in ê Siōng-tè kah in ê ông Ta-bi̍t. Jiân-āu, in ē kiaⁿ-uì lâi ǹg Siōng-tsú kah I ê un-huī.
English: Afterward the children of Israel shall return, and seek Yahweh their God, and David their king, and shall come with trembling to Yahweh and to his blessings in the last days.

Tailo: Sian-ti ê uē kóng, ' Biáu-sī Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k, lín tio̍h khuànn, tio̍h-kiaⁿ, lâi bia̍t-bông, in-uī tng lín ê sè-tāi, guá só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì, suî-jiân ū lâng kā lín suat-bîng, lín mā m̄-sìn. ( tsù, HPK 1:5 )
English: Behold, you scoffers, and wonder, and perish; For I work a work in your days, A work which you will in no way believe, if one declares it to you.'

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn put-tīng, sim-kuann kui ji̍t iu-khó͘ beh kàu guā kú? Guá ê tuì-ti̍k ko-sing iâⁿ-kuè guá, tio̍h kàu guā kú?
English: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, Having sorrow in my heart every day? How long shall my enemy triumph over me?

Tailo: I-é-su koh kā bē hún-tsiáu ê lâng kóng, Kā tsiah-ê mi̍h lóng puann tshut-.khì! M̄-thang kā guá ê Thiⁿ-pē ê tshù piàn-tsò tshī-tiûⁿ.
English: To those who sold the doves, he said, Take these things out of here! Don't make my Father's house a marketplace!

Tailo: Koh kóng, Siōng-tsú í-king tsiù-tsuā, Siōng-tsú ē tāi-tāi kah A-má-li̍k lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: He said, Yah has sworn: Yahweh will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.'

Tailo: In tuā-siaⁿ huah ông ê sî, tsiū ū kuán-ke ê Hil-kí-iah ê kiáⁿ E-li-a-kim kah su-kì Siap-ná kah sú-kuaⁿ A-sah ê kiáⁿ Io-uah, tshut-lâi kìnn in.
English: When they had called to the king, there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebnah the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kóng, Lín ná ē uî-puē Siōng-tsú ê bīng-līng? Tsit-ê tāi-tsì kiânn bē thong,
English: Moses said, Why now do you disobey the commandment of Yahweh, seeing it shall not prosper?

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kah tsiah-ê iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, liân-tiúⁿ, kah tsiah-ê thâu-lâng tsham-siông.
English: David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h huah, tuā-siaⁿ huah, in-uī tsit-ê lîm-kàu Guá ê tsú-bîn kah I-su-la-el só͘-ū ê kuì-tso̍k. In kah Guá ê tsú-bîn lóng kau tī to hā, só͘-í, lí tio̍h phah tuā-thuí lâi thó͘-khuì khuàⁿ-phuà.
English: Cry and wail, son of man; for it is on my people, it is on all the princes of Israel: they are delivered over to the sword with my people; strike therefore on your thigh.

Tailo: Hit mê, sìn-tô͘ suî-sî sàng Páu-lô kah Se-la̍h thàu-mê khì Bê-lô-ia. Nn̄g lâng kàu-uī liáu-āu, tsiū ji̍p-khì Iô-tá-iah lâng ê huē-tn̂g.
English: The brothers immediately sent Paul and Silas away by night to Beroea. When they arrived, they went into the Jewish synagogue.

Tailo: U-tsuh ê tē bat ū tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Io-buh ê lâng, hit-ê lâng uân-siān koh tsìng-ti̍t, kìng-uì Siōng-tè, lī-khui pháiⁿ lō͘.
English: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job. That man was blameless and upright, and one who feared God, and turned away from evil.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kah tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal, í-ki̍p huē-tsiòng só͘-ū ê siú-líng, tshut-khì iâⁿ guā kā in gîng-tsiap.
English: Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and all the princes of the congregation, went forth to meet them outside of the camp.

Tailo: In ê ba̍k-tsiu kan-taⁿ ài khuànn siâ-îm; in huān tsuē bô suah; in bê-hi̍k sim bô kian-kò͘ ê lâng; in ê sim kuàn-sì tham-tsâi, ing-kai tio̍h siū Siōng-tè ê tsiù-tsó͘.
English: having eyes full of adultery, and who can't cease from sin; enticing unsettled souls; having a heart trained in greed; children of cursing;

Tailo: Ta̍k-ê tsō ê khuán-sit sī án-ne, sì pîng lóng ū keh-tó͘, i ê keh-tó͘ tī sì-ê kak ê só͘-tsāi sio-tsiap.
English: The work of the bases was on this manner: they had panels; and there were panels between the ledges;

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng ê tiong-kan, kiàn-nā beh khì kìⁿ ông kiû phuàⁿ-tuàn ê, Αp-sa-lôm lóng án-ne kā in khuán-thāi. Αń-ne, Αp-sa-lôm thau-thau-á tit-tio̍h I-su-la-el lâng ê sim.
English: In this manner Absalom did to all Israel who came to the king for judgment: so Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel.

Tailo: Guá Páu-lô kā lín kóng, lín tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ, lín nā beh siū kat-lé, Ki-tok tuì lín tsiū lóng bô lī-ik.
English: Behold, I, Paul, tell you that if you receive circumcision, Christ will profit you nothing.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h án-ne, lín ê io tio̍h hâ muâ-pò͘, tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu; in-uī Siōng-tsú ê tuā siū-khì bô beh tuì lán ua̍t tò tńg-.khì.
English: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and wail; for the fierce anger of Yahweh hasn't turned back from us.

Tailo: Hut-jiân sìng-tiān lāi ê tiùⁿ-lî, tuì tíng-bīn kàu ē-bīn li̍h tsò nn̄g pîng, tē tuā iô-tāng, tsio̍h-puâⁿ piak-li̍h.
English: Behold, the veil of the temple was torn in two from the top to the bottom. The earth quaked and the rocks were split.

Tailo: I īng kau kā in tsuân-pō͘ tiò khí-.lâi, i īng bāng-á lia̍h in, īng tuā bāng pha in; uī-tio̍h án-ne, i huann-hí khuài-lo̍k,
English: He takes up all of them with the hook. He catches them in his net, and gathers them in his dragnet. Therefore he rejoices and is glad.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Mô͘-ap ē uī-tio̍h Mô͘-ap thî-khàu, lâng-lâng lóng ē thî-khàu. Lín ē uī-tio̍h Kel-ha-la-siat ê phû-tô piáⁿ lâi thó͘-khuì, pi-siong tsua̍t-bāng.
English: Therefore Moab will wail for Moab. Everyone will wail. You will mourn for the raisin cakes of Kir Hareseth, utterly stricken.

Tailo: Siōng-tè tsò ông tī-lí bān-kok; Siōng-tè tsē tī I sìng ê pó-tsō.
English: God reigns over the nations. God sits on his holy throne.

Tailo: In-uī guán só͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h kah só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê, bô kóng tshut-lâi bē īng-tit.
English: for we can't help telling the things which we saw and heard.

Tailo: Lín nā hō͘ Sìng Sîn ín-tshuā, tsiū bián siū lu̍t-huat ê khòng-tsè.
English: But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law.

Tailo: Huān-nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h lí ê lâng lóng ē tsù-ba̍k khuànn lí, tsù-ì siūⁿ lí, kóng,
English: Those who see you will stare at you. They will ponder you, saying, Is this the man who made the earth to tremble, who shook kingdoms;

Tailo: I ê pak-tó͘ ē tshin-tshiūnn lāi ê tshù-hiā phè; i tshin-tshiūnn thih-pê thua kuè thô͘.
English: His undersides are like sharp potsherds, Leaving a trail in the mud like a threshing sledge.

Tailo: Tē-saⁿ ji̍t kah tē-tshit ji̍t, tshing-khì ê tio̍h kā hit-ê bô tshing-khì ê hiù tsuí, kàu tē-tshit ji̍t thang hō͘ i tshing-khì; hit-ê lâng tio̍h sé saⁿ, īng tsuí sé sing-khu; kàu ê-hng tsiah tshing-khì.
English: and the clean person shall sprinkle on the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he shall purify him; and he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at even.

Tailo: Guá beh kā lí hun-suànn khì tī lia̍t kok, kā lí sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t pang. Guá beh tû-khì lí tiong-kan ê ù-uè.
English: I will scatter you among the nations, and disperse you through the countries; and I will consume your filthiness out of you.

Tailo: Bat ū hiann-tī tshit lâng, tuā-hiaⁿ tshuā bó͘ bô seⁿ kiáⁿ to̍h sí-.khì.
English: There were seven brothers. The first took a wife, and dying left no offspring.

Tailo: Thâu-tsuí ê lî tio̍h īng iûⁿ-á thè-sio̍k, nā bô thè-sio̍k, tsiū tio̍h kòng-tn̄g i ê ām-kún. Kiàn-nā lí thâu-tsiūⁿ ê kiáⁿ lóng tio̍h sio̍k-huê. Lâng lâi kìnn Guá m̄-thang khang-tshiú.
English: The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb: and if you will not redeem it, then you shall break its neck. All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem. No one shall appear before me empty.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng bô lâng jiok mā teh tsáu; to̍k-to̍k gī lâng hó-tánn tshin-tshiūnn sai.
English: The wicked flee when no one pursues; But the righteous are as bold as a lion.

Tailo: In-uī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn thó-ià Si-ló-ám bān-bān-á teh lâu ê tsuí, khah kah-ì Le-tsín kah Le-má-liah ê kiáⁿ,
English: Because this people have refused the waters of Shiloah that go softly, and rejoice in Rezin and Remaliah's son;

Tailo: Hit sî, tsē tī gī-huē tiong ê lâng lóng lia̍h Su-tê-hua-no͘h kim-kim khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê bīn ná tshin-tshiūnn thiⁿ-sài ê bīn.
English: All who sat in the council, fastening their eyes on him, saw his face like it was the face of an angel.

Tailo: Tī i ù-uè ê sî-kan, kiàn-nā i só͘ tó ê mi̍h lóng sī bô tshing-khì, kiàn-nā i só͘ tsē ê mi̍h mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Everything that she lies on in her impurity shall be unclean. Everything also that she sits on shall be unclean.

Tailo: Kuan-hē lán ê hiann-tī A-po-lô, guá tsài-saⁿ khǹg i kah hiah-ê hiann-tī khì lín hia; tsóng-.sī, i kàu taⁿ lóng bô àn-sǹg beh khì. Nā ū tú-hó ê ki-huē, i tsiū ē khì.
English: Now concerning Apollos, the brother, I strongly urged him to come to you with the brothers; and it was not at all his desire to come now; but he will come when he has an opportunity.

Tailo: I-é-su kóng, Ū nn̄g-ê lâng ji̍p-khì sìng-tiān kî-tó, tsi̍t-ê sī Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, tsi̍t-ê sī thiu-suè ê lâng.
English: Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.

Tailo: Tī Ki-tok ê lāi-bīn ū ún-tsông it-tshè tì-huī kah tì-sik ê pó-puè.
English: in whom are all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge hidden.

Tailo: Lí mā hō͘ guá ê tuì-ti̍k ua̍t tńg-sin tô-tsáu; hō͘ guá ē-tàng tsâu-bia̍t hiah-ê uàn-hūn guá ê lâng.
English: You have also made my enemies turn their backs to me, That I might cut off those who hate me.

Tailo: Io-ap kóng, Guān Siōng-tsú hō͘ I ê tsú-bîn pí hiān-kim ke-thinn pah puē, guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, in kám bô lóng sī guá ê tsú ê jîn-bîn? Guá ê tsú án-tsuáⁿ bīng-līng tsit-ê tāi-tsì? Án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ I-su-la-el huān tsuē?
English: Joab said, Yahweh make his people a hundred times as many as they are: but, my lord the king, aren't they all my lord's servants? Why does my lord require this thing? Why will he be a cause of guilt to Israel?

Tailo: to̍h-sī īng iù ê mī-hún tsa̍p-hūn tsi saⁿ e-huat kah iû puàⁿ hin, tiâu-hô tsò sò͘-tsè, kah gû-káng-á tsò-hué hiàn.
