English: then shall he offer with the bull a meal offering of three tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil:

Tailo: Guá bô khì tsò guá só͘ ì-ài ê hó, tian-tò tńg-khì tsò guá bô ì-ài ê pháiⁿ.
English: For the good which I desire, I don't do; but the evil which I don't desire, that I practice.

Tailo: Guá tshe-phài kàu lín tiong-kan ê tuā kun-tuī, to̍h-sī tē-it tsióng, tē-jī tsióng, tē-saⁿ tsióng kah tē-sì tsióng ê tsháu-me̍h, só͘ tsia̍h hiah-ê nî-tang, Guá lóng beh hîng lín.
English: I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust has eaten, The great locust, the grasshopper, and the caterpillar, My great army, which I sent among you.

Tailo: In ná kiâⁿ ná teh tâm-lūn só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì.
English: They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened.

Tailo: Só͘-í, hiann-tī tsí-muē, tio̍h tuì lín tiong-kan kíng-suán tshit-ê ū hó miâ-siaⁿ, siū Sìng Sîn tshiong-muá koh ū tì-huī ê lâng, guán thang siat-li̍p in lâi kuán-lí tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: Therefore select from among you, brothers, seven men of good report, full of the Holy Spirit and of wisdom, whom we may appoint over this business.

Tailo: In īng kau-tsiàn ê sî só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h lâi hiàn, thang siu-tsíng Siōng-tsú ê tiān.
English: Out of the spoil won in battles did they dedicate to repair the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: E-hut tsiū tshun tò tshiú, tuì tsiànn-thuí pue̍h-tshut kiàm, tsha̍k ji̍p-khì ông ê pak-tó͘,
English: Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the sword from his right thigh, and thrust it into his body:

Tailo: M̄-thang kah bô sìn ê lâng khan-liân kau-tshap. Gī kah put-gī kám ē-tàng tsò-hué? Kng-bîng kah o͘-àm kám ē-tàng hō͘-siong lâi-óng?
English: Don't be unequally yoked with unbelievers, for what fellowship have righteousness and iniquity? Or what communion has light with darkness?

Tailo: Sè-tsiūⁿ koh ū tsi̍t kiāⁿ khang-hi ê tāi-tsì, to̍h-sī gī lâng tú-.tio̍h ê sī tsiàu pháiⁿ lâng ê pò-ìng; pháiⁿ lâng só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê sī tsiàu gī lâng ê pò-siúⁿ. Guá kóng, tse mā sī khang-hi.
English: There is a vanity which is done on the earth, that there are righteous men to whom it happens according to the work of the wicked. Again, there are wicked men to whom it happens according to the work of the righteous. I said that this also is vanity.

Tailo: Tsin tsē ji̍t āu, lí ē siū pān-lí. Kàu lō͘-bué ê nî, lí ē lâi-kàu thuat-lī to-kiàm tuì lia̍t kok siu-huê ê tē, kàu I-su-la-el í-king pha-hng tsin kú ê suaⁿ; tsóng-.sī, i í-king hông tuì lia̍t kok tiong tshuā tshut-.khì, in lóng ē an-jiân sing-ua̍h.
English: After many days you shall be visited: in the latter years you shall come into the land that is brought back from the sword, that is gathered out of many peoples, on the mountains of Israel, which have been a continual waste; but it is brought forth out of the peoples, and they shall dwell securely, all of them.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú bat giâm-lē kā guá kíng-kài; tsóng-.sī, I bē kā guá kau tī sí-bông.
English: Yah has punished me severely, But he has not given me over to death.

Tailo: Hō͘ tē iô-tāng ê guân-in ū sann hāng, liân tam-tng bē-khí ê ū sì hāng:
English: For three things the earth tremble, And under four, it can't bear up:

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t lâi-kàu Ol-nân hia, Ol-nân khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ta-bi̍t, tsiū tuì tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ tshut-.lâi, ànn thâu pài Ta-bi̍t.
English: As David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing floor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng ta̍k nî só͘ tit-tio̍h ê kim, kiōng la̍k-pah la̍k-tsa̍p la̍k tha-lan-t,
English: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and sixty-six talents of gold,

Tailo: I tio̍h kā i ê lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám bī-muá-nî ê mî-iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò sio-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám bī-muá-nî ê mî-iûⁿ-bó á, tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, koh īng tsi̍t tsiah bô khuat-tiám ê mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsò siā-un ê tsè;
English: and he shall offer his offering to Yahweh, one male lamb a year old without blemish for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb a year old without blemish for a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for peace offerings,

Tailo: Tshuē-tio̍h liáu-āu, tsiū tshuā i kàu Ai-ti-o-khè. Tsiok-tsiok tsi̍t nî, in kah kàu-huē ê huē-iú tsū-huē, kà-sī tsin tsē lâng. Bûn-tô͘ hō͘ lâng kiò-tsò Ki-tok-tô͘ , sī tuì An-ti-o-khè khai-sí.
English: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. It happened, that for a whole year they were gathered together with the assembly, and taught many people. The disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

Tailo: Kàu tē-peh ji̍t, i tio̍h uī-tio̍h ka-kī tshú nn̄g tsiah pan-kah á-.sī nn̄g tsiah hún-tsiáu-kiáⁿ, kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, kau-tài tsè-si;
English: On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, and come before Yahweh to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and give them to the priest:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Guá lī-khui Guá ê tshù, pàng-sak Guá ê sán-gia̍p, kā Guá sim só͘ thiàⁿ ê kau tī tuì-ti̍k tshiú tiong.
English: I have forsaken my house, I have cast off my heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.

Tailo: Koh tuì hit tiong-kan tshut-hiān sì tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h ê hîng-siōng. In ê khuán-sit sī án-ne: ū lâng ê hîng-siōng,
English: Out of the midst of it came the likeness of four living creatures. This was their appearance: they had the likeness of a man.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ē kì-tit lí tī Ai-gi̍p bat tsò lô͘-lē, Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè kiù-sio̍k lí tuì hia tshut-.lâi, só͘-í, guá bīng-līng lí tio̍h án-ne kiânn.
English: but you shall remember that you were a bondservant in Egypt, and Yahweh your God redeemed you there: therefore I command you to do this thing.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ tsiū lo̍h-khì kìnn hiah-ê lâng, kóng, Guá to̍h-sī lín teh tshuē ê lâng, lín lâi ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kuì-sū?
English: Peter went down to the men, and said, Behold, I am he whom you seek. Why have you come?

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, tsìng lâng só͘ lô-lo̍k ê hō͘ hué sio-.khì, lia̍t kok lô-khó͘ kàu ià-siān ê kui tī khang-khang, kám m̄-sī lóng tshut tī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú?
English: Behold, isn't it of Yahweh of Armies that the peoples labor for the fire, and the nations weary themselves for vanity?

Tailo: Tuì lu̍t-huat-guā ê lâng, guá tsiū tsò lu̍t-huat-guā ê lâng, tsiah thang tit-tio̍h khah tsē lu̍t-huat-guā ê lâng lâi sìn Tsú. Án-ne tsò, m̄-sī kóng guá bô tsun-siú Siōng-tè ê lu̍t-huat, kî-si̍t guá sī siū Ki-tok lu̍t-huat ê kuán-hat.
English: to those who are without law, as without law ( not being without law toward God, but under law toward Christ ) , that I might win those who are without law.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng tuì tiān ê hō͘-tīng tíng tshut-.khì, thîng tī ki-lō͘-ping ê tíng-bīn.
English: The glory of Yahweh went forth from over the threshold of the house, and stood over the cherubim.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tsio̍h-bō bō be̍h; tû-khì lí ê phè, thǹg lí ê tn̂g-sann, lō͘-hiān lí ê kha-thuí, liâu kuè khe.
English: Take the millstones, and grind meal; remove your veil, strip off the train, uncover the leg, pass through the rivers.

Tailo: Io-ná-than ìn Ta-bi̍t kóng, Lâi à, lán tshut lâi-khì tshân-.ni̍h. Nn̄g lâng tsiū tshut-khì tshân-.ni̍h.
English: Jonathan said to David, Come, and let us go out into the field. They went out both of them into the field.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ bē bîng-pi̍k tsit kù uē ê ì-sù, in-uī ū tuì in am-khàm tsit kù uē ê ì-sù, hō͘ in bē-tàng liáu-kái. Bûn-tô͘ mā m̄-káⁿ mn̄g I-é-su tsit kù uē ê ì-sù.
English: But they didn't understand this saying. It was concealed from them, that they should not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask him about this saying.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Pîng-siông sî m̄-bat mn̄g Guá ê, taⁿ Guá hō͘ in mn̄g; iáu-buē ū tshuē Guá ê, taⁿ Guá hō͘ in tú-.tio̍h; iáu-buē ū kiû-kiò Guá ê miâ ê, Guá tuì in kóng: Guá tī tsia! Guá tī tsia!
English: I am inquired of by those who didn't ask; I am found by those who didn't seek me: I said, See me, see me, to a nation that was not called by my name.

Tailo: Tha-mal sám hué-hu tī thâu-khak, thiah-li̍h só͘ tshīng tshái-sik ê saⁿ, īng tshiú lám thâu-khak lâi kiâⁿ, ná kiâⁿ ná háu.
English: Tamar put ashes on her head, and tore her garment of various colors that was on her; and she laid her hand on her head, and went her way, crying aloud as she went.

Tailo: Im-kan tī I ê bīn-tsîng lō͘-hiān, tē-ga̍k ( Tsù, bia̍t-bông ê só͘-tsāi, guân pán-pún im-i̍k tsò “Al-bah-tùn ) mā bô khàm ba̍t.
English: Sheol is naked before God, And Abaddon has no covering.

Tailo: I tī sìng-ê ê gī-huē tiong sī ū tuā ui-giâm ê Siōng-tè, pí só͘-ū tī I sì-kho͘-uî ê koh khah thang kiaⁿ-uì.
English: A very awesome God in the council of the holy ones, To be feared above all those who are around him?

Tailo: M̄-koh, hit tsiah liam-khau kui A-tsa-tsel ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ, tio̍h ua̍h-ua̍h an-tì tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, thè i sio̍k-tsuē, pàng i khì khòng-iá, kui tī A-tsa-tsel.
English: But the goat, on which the lot fell for the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before Yahweh, to make atonement for him, to send him away for the scapegoat into the wilderness.

Tailo: Phah kó͘ ê khuài-lo̍k lóng bô-.khì; iàn-lo̍k ê siann-im lóng suah, tuâⁿ khîm ê khuài-lo̍k mā lóng siau-sit-.khì.
English: The mirth of tambourines ceases. The sound of those who rejoice ends. The joy of the harp ceases.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōng-tsú ē tī hué tiong kàng-lîm, I ê tshia tshin-tshiūnn kńg-lê-á hong; I īng tuā siū-khì lâi kiâⁿ pò-ìng, īng hué-iām kiânn tsik-hua̍t.
English: For, behold, Yahweh will come with fire, and his chariots shall be like the whirlwind; to render his anger with fierceness, and his rebuke with flames of fire.

Tailo: Pa-lân thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, tuì Ba-al ê siú-líng kóng, Lín tńg-khì lín ê só͘-tsāi, in-uī Siōng-tsú m̄-tsún guá kah lín khì.
English: Balaam rose up in the morning, and said to the princes of Balak, Get you into your land; for Yahweh refuses to give me leave to go with you.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Tsú tuì guá kóng, ' Lí tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín lī-khui Ê-lú-sa-lèm, in-uī tsit só͘-tsāi ê lâng bô beh tsiap-la̍p lí uī-tio̍h guá só͘ tsò ê kiàn-tsìng. '
English: and saw him saying to me, Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly, because they will not receive testimony concerning me from you.'

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê îm-luān ê lâng, lín kám m̄-tsai kah sè-kan tsò pîng-iú to̍h-sī kah Siōng-tè tsò tuì-ti̍k? Só͘-í, ài beh tsò sè-kan ê pîng-iú ê lâng, to̍h-sī Siōng-tè ê ti̍k-jîn.
English: You adulterers and adulteresses, don't you know that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Lí kóng tsit-ê uē sī tshut tī lí ka-kī ê ì-sù, á-.sī pa̍t lâng ū kā guá ê tāi-tsì kā lí kóng?
English: Jesus answered him, Do you say this by yourself, or did others tell you about me?

Tailo: Thâi-sí-lâng huān-tio̍h sí-tsuē ê, lín m̄-thang siu sio̍k-huê sèⁿ-miā ê kè-tsînn, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: Moreover you shall take no ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death; but he shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Thang siu-sîng ê tsin tsē, siu-kuah ê kang-lâng tsin tsió.
English: Then he said to his disciples, The harvest indeed is plentiful, but the laborers are few.

Tailo: Piⁿ sī uī-tio̍h bé, bé-kā-kiuⁿ sī uī-tio̍h gû; kuái-á-.sī uī-tio̍h gōng lâng ê kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ phiaⁿ.
English: A whip for the horse, A bridle for the donkey, And a rod for the back of fools!

Tailo: at-tn̄g i siōng bué-liu ê tsíⁿ ki, the̍h kàu sing-lí-tiûⁿ, hē tī bé-bē ê lâng ê siâⁿ.
English: he cropped off the topmost of the young twigs of it, and carried it to a land of traffic; he set it in a city of merchants.

Tailo: Guán niá-siū I ê un-sù tsiâⁿ-tsò sù-tô͘, uī-tio̍h Ki-tok ê miâ, beh ín-tshuā bān-bîn lâi sìn koh sūn-ho̍k tsit-ê hok-im.
English: through whom we received grace and apostleship, for obedience of faith among all the nations, for his name's sake;

Tailo: Ai-gi̍p ê jîn-bîn, lí tio̍h tsiūⁿ-khì Gi-lia̍t tshú jú-hiuⁿ; lí īng tsin tsē io̍h sī bô tshái-kang, lí bē tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: Go up into Gilead, and take balm, virgin daughter of Egypt: in vain do you use many medicines; there is no healing for you.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá ǹg-bāng it-tshè lóng sī tshut tī lí ê kam-sim lo̍k-ì, lóng bô bián-kióng, só͘-í, nā bô lí ê tông-ì, guá tsi̍t hāng mā bô beh tsò.
English: But I was willing to do nothing without your consent, that your goodness would not be as of necessity, but of free will.

Tailo: Koh tuì I kóng, Tsiah-ê it-tshè ê kuân-sè kah îng-kng guá lóng beh hō͘ Lí, in-uī tsiah-ê it-tshè í-king lóng kau hō͘ guá, tshut-tsāi guá beh hō͘ siáⁿ lâng.
English: The devil said to him, I will give you all this authority, and their glory, for it has been delivered to me; and I give it to whomever I want.

Tailo: Ông tsiū khí-lâi thiah-li̍h saⁿ, tó tī thô͘-kha; ông ê jîn-sîn mā thiah-li̍h saⁿ, khiā tī i ê sin piⁿ.
English: Then the king arose, and tore his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes torn.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kò͘ iûⁿ-.ê lâi-kàu-uī, tsiū beh kā in kuáⁿ-tsáu. Mô͘-se tsiū khí-lâi kā in pang-tsān, hō͘ in ê iûⁿ-kûn lim tsuí.
English: The shepherds came and drove them away; but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.

Tailo: Lí nā bô tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê uē, bô tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ I it-tshè ê kài-bīng, lu̍t-lē, to̍h-sī guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, tsiah-ê tsiù-tsó͘ tsiū ē jiok-tio̍h lí, ē kàu tī lí.
English: But it shall come to pass, if you will not listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes which I command you this day, that all these curses shall come on you, and overtake you.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn E-bah hō͘ tsuâ ê hua-giân khá-gí phiàn-.khì, guá khióng-kiaⁿ lín ê sim-su mā ē siū bê-hi̍k, suah-khì-sak tuì Ki-tok ê sûn-kiat kah tsin-sîng.
English: But I am afraid that somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve in his craftiness, so your minds might be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê Mô͘-kuí á kiáⁿ, lí sī it-tshè kong-gī ê tuì-ti̍k, tshiong-muá ta̍k tsióng ê kuí-tsà kah siâ-ok, lí ná ē ài beh niú-khiok Tsú ê tsin-lí?
English: and said, Full of all deceit and all cunning, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

Tailo: Lín gī lâng tio̍h in-uī Siōng-tsú lâi huann-hí; tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng ê mā tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú.
English: Rejoice in Yahweh, you righteous! Praise is fitting for the upright.

Tailo: Tē iáu tsûn-tsāi ê sî, tsai-tsìng kah siu-sîng, kuâⁿ kah jua̍h, kuâⁿ-thiⁿ kah jua̍h-thinn, ji̍t kah mê, lóng bô-hioh.
English: While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

Tailo: I tsiū tshut-huat tńg-khì tshuē i ê lāu-pē. Lī in lāu-pē iáu-koh tsin hn̄g ê sî, lāu-pē to̍h khuàⁿ-tio̍h i, kám-kak tsin m̄-kam, tsáu-uá khì kā i lám-.leh, ti̍t-ti̍t kā i tsim.
English: He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

Tailo: In-uī I-su-la-el lâng sī Guá ê lô͘-po̍k, sī Guá tshuā tshut Ai-gi̍p tē ê. Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè.
English: For to me the children of Israel are servants; they are my servants whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt. I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: I-é-su kā Piat-tò͘ kóng, Kā to siu ji̍p-khì to-siù! Thiⁿ-pē hō͘ guá ê khó͘-pue, guá kám ē-tàng bô lim?
English: Jesus therefore said to Peter, Put the sword into its sheath. The cup which the Father has given me, shall I not surely drink it?

Tailo: In lâi-kàu siâⁿ tiong, Ne-thá-niah ê kiáⁿ I-si-ma-el kah tuè i ê lâng, tsiū kā in thâi-sí, kā in hiat tī ta-tséⁿ.
English: It was so, when they came into the midst of the city, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah killed them, and cast them into the midst of the pit, he, and the men who were with him.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā sàu-kak tân, I tsiū kóng, Ā-hah, i tuì hn̄g-hn̄g phīⁿ-tio̍h kau-tsiàn kah kun-tiúⁿ tshin-tshiūnn luî ê siann, í-ki̍p hán-huah ê siann.
English: As often as the trumpet sounds he snorts, Aha!' He smells the battle afar off, The thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

Tailo: I īng kî-khiáu ê sai-hū ê tshiú-kang tsò pó͘-kuà, kah tsè-si ho̍k sio-siâng ê tsò-huat, īng kim kah nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu í-ki̍p kuè-pháng ê iù-tē tsò ê.
English: He made the breastplate, the work of a skillful workman, like the work of the ephod; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, I-é-su kuè-khì Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘, to̍h-sī Tî-bé-lī-a ô͘ ê hit pîng.
English: After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is also called the Sea of Tiberias.

Tailo: Tsin tsē lâng teh kóng, siáⁿ lâng ē tsí-sī guán siáⁿ-mi̍h hó-tshù? Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí īng Lí bīn ê kng lâi tsiò guán.
English: Many say, Who will show us any good? Yahweh, let the light of your face shine on us.

Tailo: Á-sī i bong-tio̍h pa̍t lâng ê bô tshing-khì, bô-lūn bak-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h bô tshing-khì ê mi̍h tì-sú bô tshing-khì, tsóng-.sī, i ka-kī m̄-tsai, kàu tsi̍t ē tsai, tsiū sǹg-tsò ū tsuē.
English: Or if he touches the uncleanness of man, whatever his uncleanness is with which he is unclean, and it is hidden from him; when he knows of it, then he shall be guilty.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê ke-lō͘ lâi khuànn, lâi thàm-thiaⁿ, tī i khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi lâi tshuē, khuànn ē tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng, á-.sī ū lâng kiânn kong-gī, kiû sîng-si̍t? Guá tsiū beh sià-bián tsit-ê siâⁿ.
English: Run you back and forth through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in the broad places of it, if you can find a man, if there are any who does justly, who seeks truth; and I will pardon her.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā tsiù-tsuā kóng, lín tī I-su-la-el tiong bē-tàng koh sú-iōng tsit-ê sio̍k-gí.
English: As I live, says the Lord Yahweh, you shall not have occasion any more to use this proverb in Israel.

Tailo: E-hú tē-tshit nî, Io-a-si tsē-uī, tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsò ông king-kuè sì-tsa̍p nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Tsi-bí-ah, sī Bel-sí-bah lâng.
English: In the seventh year of Jehu began Jehoash to reign; and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Zibiah of Beersheba.

Tailo: Tuâⁿ sī tshâ tsò ê, kuân saⁿ tiú, tn̂g nn̄g tiú. I ê kak, i ê tsō kah i ê sì-piⁿ lóng sī tshâ tsò ê. I tuì guá kóng, Tse sī Siōng-tsú bīn-tsîng ê toh.
English: The altar was of wood, three cubits high, and the length of it two cubits; and the corners of it, and the length of it, and the walls of it, were of wood: and he said to me, This is the table that is before Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsiú-tsìng tsiū tuì Iô-sé-huh suat-bîng i ê bāng, kóng, Guá tī bāng tiong khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū tsi̍t tsâng phû-tô tshiū tī guá ê bīn-tsîng,
English: The chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was in front of me,

Tailo: Suaⁿ-.ni̍h ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ tang-sî seⁿ, lí kám tsai? Lo̍k-bú seⁿ kiáⁿ, lí kám ū khuàⁿ-tshut?
English: Do you know the time when the mountain goats give birth? Do you watch when the doe bears fawns?

Tailo: kiàn-nā ē tòng-tit hué ê mi̍h, lín tio̍h hō͘ i king-kuè hué, tsiū tsiâⁿ-tsò tshing-khì; tsóng-.sī, tio̍h koh īng tû-khì ù-uè ê tsuí kā i sé tshing-khì; kiàn-nā bē tòng-tit hué ê mi̍h, lín tio̍h hō͘ i king-kuè tsuí.
English: everything that may abide the fire, you shall make to go through the fire, and it shall be clean; nevertheless it shall be purified with the water for impurity: and all that doesn't withstand the fire you shall make to go through the water.

Tailo: Tsua̍t-tuì m̄-sī! Siōng-tè nā m̄-sī kong-gī ê, I ná ē-tàng sím-phuàⁿ sè-kan?
English: May it never be! For then how will God judge the world?

Tailo: I-é-sái ê kiáⁿ Ta-bi̍t ê kî-tó kàu tsia kiat-sok.
English: This ends the prayers by David, the son of Jesse. BOOK III

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí kah lí ê tóng tsū-tsi̍p, sī teh kong-kik Siōng-tsú. A-lông sī siáⁿ-mi̍h, lín kìng-jiân tuì i ai-uàn?
English: Therefore you and all your company are gathered together against Yahweh: and Aaron, what is he who you murmur against him?

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tsin kú bô tsia̍h, Páu-lô khiā tī in tiong-kan, kóng, Kok-uī, lín tsîng nā thiaⁿ guá ê uē, bô khui-tsûn lī-khui Ku-lé-té tó, tsiū bē tú-tio̍h tsit khuán ê siong-hāi kah sún-sit.
English: When they had been long without food, Paul stood up in the middle of them, and said, Sirs, you should have listened to me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss.

Tailo: I-é-su koh īng tsi̍t-ê phì-jū tuì tsìng lâng kóng, Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng khai-khún tsi̍t khu phû-tô hn̂g, tso͘ hō͘ tshân-tiān, tsiū tshut-guā tsin kú.
English: He began to tell the people this parable. A man planted a vineyard, and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.

Tailo: Tháng lāi ê mī-hún bô kiám-tsió, pân lāi ê iû bô īng liáu, tú tsiàu Siōng-tsú thok E-li-iah só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: The jar of meal didn't empty, neither did the jar of oil fail, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke by Elijah.

Tailo: Tuì tsit-tiám su-iàu īng tì-huī lâi lí-kái. Hit tshit-ê thâu-khak to̍h-sī tsa-bó͘ lâng só͘ tsē ê tshit tsō suaⁿ, mā sī tshit-ê ông.
English: Here is the mind that has wisdom. The seven heads are seven mountains, on which the woman sits.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h khí-lâi kuè Sat-lia̍t khe! Tsiū án-ne, lán kuè Sat-lia̍t khe.
English: Now rise up, and get you over the brook Zered. We went over the brook Zered.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, i ê sing-khu tang-sî koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshiah-bah, hit sî i tsiū bô tshing-khì.
English: But whenever raw flesh appears in him, he shall be unclean.

Tailo: In-uī in uī-tio̍h Ki-tok ê miâ tshut-guā thuân hok-im, lóng bô tuì bī-sìn-tsiá tsiap-siū siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: because for the sake of the Name they went out, taking nothing from the Gentiles.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá tsiàu lí ê uē ū sià-bián in.
English: Yahweh said, I have pardoned according to your word:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú khí-tsō Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tsū-tsi̍p I-su-la-el tiong siū tshian-suá khì guā-pang ê lâng.
English: Yahweh builds up Jerusalem. He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.

Tailo: The̍h tsi̍t-ê gîn-á hō͘ guá khuànn. Tsit-ê siōng kah jī-hō sī siáⁿ lâng ê? In kóng, Sī Lô-má hông-tè ê.
English: Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it? They answered, Caesar's.

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Hū-jîn lâng, lí ná ē teh khàu? Lí teh tshuē siáⁿ lâng? Mâ-lí-ah siūⁿ kóng I sī kò͘ hn̂g ê lâng, tsiū ìn kóng, Thâu-ke ah, lí nā ū kā I suá-tsáu, tshiánn kā guá kóng lí kā I hē tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi, guá thang lâi-khì kā I siu tńg-.lâi.
English: Jesus said to her, Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for? She, supposing him to be the gardener, said to him, Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ū thong-kuè tsìng sian-ti ê tshuì ī-giân I ê Ki-tok tio̍h siū-lān, tsit-ê tāi-tsì kó-jiân ìng-giām ā.
English: But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.

Tailo: Lí kám ū tshin-tshiūnn Siōng-tè hit khuán ê tshiú-kut? Lí kám ē tshut siaⁿ khí luî tshin-tshiūnn I?
English: Or have you an arm like God? Can you thunder with a voice like him?

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Sin-lông iáu kah lâng-kheh tsò-hué ê sî, lâng-kheh kám ē kìm-tsia̍h? Sin-lông iáu tī-.leh, in it-tīng bē kìm-tsia̍h.
English: Jesus said to them, Can the groomsmen fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them, they can't fast.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú it-tīng bē khì-sak I ê tsú-bîn, mā bē pàng-lī I ê sán-gia̍p — I-su-la-el.
English: For Yahweh won't reject his people, Neither will he forsake his inheritance.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t tī hia, ū Sàu-lô ê lô͘-po̍k lâu tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, miâ kiò-tsò To-ik, sī E-tóm lâng, tsò Sàu-lô kò͘ tsing-seⁿ ê ê thâu-lâng.
English: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before Yahweh; and his name was Doeg the Edomite, the best of the herdsmen who belonged to Saul.

Tailo: Hit tsâng tshiū tsiām-tsiām tuā koh kian-kò͘, kuân kàu tú thiⁿ, tē ê ki̍k-thâu mā khuàⁿ ē-tio̍h.
English: The tree grew, and was strong, and the height of it reached to the sky, and the sight of it to the end of all the earth.

Tailo: Thian-hā bān-siōng lóng ū i ê kî, bān-hāng sū lóng ū i ê sî.
English: For everything there is a season, and a time for every purpose under heaven:

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, guá kiû-kiò Lí, in-uī Lí ē ìn guá; kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó.
English: I have called on you, for you will answer me, God: Turn your ear to me. Hear my speech.

Tailo: m̄-thang tsó͘-tsí in khí Siōng-tè tiān ê kang, tshut-tsāi Iô-tah ê tsóng-tok kah Iô-tah ê tiúⁿ-ló, tī guân uī khí Siōng-tsú tsit king tiān.
English: let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in its place.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì Siōng-tsú kóng, Lí ná ē pháiⁿ khuán-thāi Lí ê lô͘-po̍k? Guá án-tsuáⁿ bô tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián? Lí kìng-jiân īng tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê ka-tann hē tī guá ê sin tsiūⁿ!
English: Moses said to Yahweh, Why have you dealt ill with your servant? and why haven't I found favor in your sight, that you lay the burden of all this people on me?

Tailo: Iâ-kop thiaⁿ-tio̍h Sī-khiàm uè lah-sap i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Tí-nah. Hit sî, i hiah-ê kiáⁿ kah i ê tsing-seⁿ tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, só͘-í, Iâ-kop tiām-tiām bô tshut siaⁿ, thìng-hāu in tńg-.lâi.
English: Now Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah, his daughter; and his sons were with his livestock in the field. Jacob held his peace until they came.

Tailo: In-uī guá ê ji̍t-tsí tshin-tshiūnn hué-ian siau-suàⁿ, guá ê kut-thâu tshin-tshiūnn hué-lô͘ ê tshâ teh sio.
English: For my days consume away like smoke. My bones are burned as a firebrand.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá hó-tánn siá phue hō͘ lín, beh kā lín thê-tshéⁿ kuí-tiám, in-uī Siōng-tè ū sù guá ti̍k-pia̍t ê un-tián,
English: But I write the more boldly to you in part, as reminding you, because of the grace that was given to me by God,

Tailo: tsiū tio̍h tsám-tn̄g hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê tshiú, ba̍k-tsiu m̄-thang khó-liân i.
English: then you shall cut off her hand, your eye shall have no pity.

Tailo: In tsiū jiok in lâi-kàu Iol-tàn hô, khuàⁿ-tio̍h muá lō͘ lóng sī A-lâm lâng kín tsáu ê sî só͘ hiat-ka̍k ê saⁿ-khò͘ kah khì-kū, sù-tsiá tsiū tńg-lâi huê-hok ông.
English: They went after them to the Jordan: and behold, all the way was full of garments and vessels, which the Syrians had cast away in their haste. The messengers returned, and told the king.

Tailo: Tio̍h hō͘ lâng, lín tsiah ē tit-tio̍h, koh ē īng tsiok-gia̍h ê táu niû hō͘ lín; kā i ji̍h koh iô, hō͘ i tsa̍t kah muá tshut-.lâi, tsiah piàⁿ lo̍h-khì lín ê saⁿ-á phè; in-uī lín īng siáⁿ-mi̍h niû-khì lâi niû hō͘ lâng, lâng mā ē tsiàu án-ne niû tò tńg-khì hō͘ lín.
English: Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.

Tailo: Thong-ta̍t ê lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsai-hō tsiū siám-phiah; gōng-ti̍t ê lâng tsìn-tsîng khì siū tsai-hāi.
English: A prudent man sees danger, and hides himself; But the simple pass on, and suffer for it.

Tailo: Lē-bī tī in tshù uī-tio̍h I-é-su pān tuā iàn-si̍k. Ū thiu-suè ê lâng kah kî-tha tsin tsē lâng lâi kah in tsò-hué tsē-toh tsia̍h pn̄g.
English: Levi made a great feast for him in his house. There was a great crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining with them.

Tailo: Guá tī in lāi-bīn, Lí tī guá lāi-bīn, sī beh hō͘ in ē-tàng uân-tsuân tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t thé, thang hō͘ sè-kan tsai sī Lí tshe-phài guá, mā tsai Lí ū thiàⁿ in tshin-tshiūnn Lí ū thiàⁿ guá.
English: I in them, and you in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that you sent me, and loved them, even as you loved me.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh kìnn Ai-gi̍p ông Huâ-láu ê sî, hit nî saⁿ-tsa̍p huè. Iô-sé-huh tuì Huâ-láu ê bīn-tsîng tshut-.khì, piàn kiâⁿ Ai-gi̍p tsuân tē.
English: Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt. Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Pa-lân tuì Ba-al kóng, Lí tuà tsia, khiā tī lí sio-tsè ê piⁿ-á, thìng-hāu guá khì hia kìnn Siōng-tsú.
English: He said to Balak, Stand here by your burnt offering, while I meet Yahweh yonder.

Tailo: In teh kiâⁿ teh kóng, hut-jiân ū hué-tshia hué bé, kā in nn̄g lâng keh-khui, E-li-iah tsiū tsē kńg-lê-á hong tsiūⁿ thiⁿ.
English: It happened, as they still went on, and talked, that behold, there appeared a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, which parted them both apart; and Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tsuí lāi bô si̍t bô lân ê, lín lóng tio̍h lia̍h-tsò sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê.
English: Whatever has no fins nor scales in the waters, that is an abomination to you.

Tailo: Guá ê tâng-kang Má-khó, A-lí-su-ta̍t-khó͘, Tê-má kah Lū-ka, mā beh kā lí tshíng-an.
English: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

Tailo: Tsiū m̄-thang ngē lín ê sim, tshin-tshiūnn lín ê tsó͘-sian puē-gi̍k ê sî, tī khòng-iá teh tshì-thàm Siōng-tè.
English: Don't harden your hearts, as in the provocation, Like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness,

Tailo: Kíng lāi ê tsìng lâng lóng tio̍h īng tsit-ê lé-mi̍h, hiàn hō͘ I-su-la-el ê kun-ông.
English: All the people of the land shall give to this offering for the prince in Israel.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Ka-le-ah ê kiáⁿ Io-ha-nân kah só͘-ū kun-tiúⁿ, í-ki̍p tsìng lâng m̄ tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú ê uē, lâi tuà tī Iô-tah tē.
English: So Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces, and all the people, didn't obey the voice of Yahweh, to dwell in the land of Judah.

Tailo: ( Ta-bi̍t ê si-kua, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ) Guān Siōng-tè khí-.lâi, hō͘ I ê tuì-ti̍k sì-suàⁿ; hō͘ uàn-hūn I ê lâng tuì I ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu.
English: Let God arise! Let his enemies be scattered! Let them who hate him also flee before him.

Tailo: Guān guá tit-tio̍h guá só͘ kiû ê; guá só͘ him-bō͘ ê, guān Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ guá.
English: Oh that I might have my request; That God would grant the thing that I long for!

Tailo: Tio̍h kā lán ê Tsú ê khuan-iông khuàⁿ-tsò sī tsín-kiù ê ki-huē, lán tshin-ài ê hiann-tī Páu-lô īng Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ i ê tì-huī, siá phue hō͘ lín ê sî mā ū án-ne kóng.
English: Regard the patience of our Lord as salvation; even as our beloved brother Paul also, according to the wisdom given to him, wrote to you;

Tailo: Tsiah-ê uē kóng liáu, I-é-su tsiū pí tshiú kah hing-khám-piⁿ hō͘ in khuànn. Bûn-tô͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h Tsú, tsin huann-hí.
English: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad when they saw the Lord.

Tailo: Tsuí ē tuì i ê tháng lâu tshut, tsíng-tsí beh iā tī tsin tsē tsuí ê só͘-tsāi, i ê ông ē puâⁿ-kuè A-gak, i ê kok ē hing-khí.
English: Water shall flow from his buckets, His seed shall be in many waters, His king shall be higher than Agag, His kingdom shall be exalted.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kah A-lông í-ki̍p huē-tsiòng tsiah-ê siú-líng, kā Ko-hat ê kiáⁿ-sun tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k kah ke-kháu,
English: Moses and Aaron and the princes of the congregation numbered the sons of the Kohathites by their families, and by their fathers' houses,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tsiū ē īng kî-kuài ê tsai-hō, to̍h-sī ki̍k tuā ki̍k-kú ê tsai-hō kah ki̍k tāng ki̍k-kú ê pēⁿ, lîm-kàu tī lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: then Yahweh will make your plagues wonderful, and the plagues of your seed, even great plagues, and of long continuance, and sore sicknesses, and of long continuance.

Tailo: Guán án-ne tsò-kang, in ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ gia̍h tshiuⁿ, tuì thiⁿ-phú-kng kàu tsheⁿ tshut-hiān ê sî.
English: So we worked in the work: and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning until the stars appeared.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, Ta-bi̍t kiaⁿ Siōng-tsú, kóng, Siōng-tsú ê kuī ná thang lâi-kàu guá ê só͘-tsāi.
English: David was afraid of Yahweh that day; and he said, How shall the ark of Yahweh come to me?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú, Lí ū pàng-sak Lí ê tsú-bîn, Iâ-kop ê ke; in-uī in tshiong-muá tang-hong ê hong-sio̍k, tshin-tshiūnn Hui-lī-sū lâng teh kiâⁿ siâ-su̍t, mā kah guā-pang lâng kiat iok.
English: For you have forsaken your people, the house of Jacob, Because they are filled from the east, With those who practice divination like the Philistines, And they clasp hands with the children of foreigners.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, guá o-ló hiah-ê í-king sí-.khì ê sí-lâng, iâⁿ-kuè hiah-ê iáu ua̍h-.leh ê ua̍h-lâng.
English: Therefore I praised the dead who have been long dead more than the living who are yet alive.

Tailo: Tsè-si koh tio̍h īng tām-po̍h-á hueh buah tī huē-bō͘ lāi, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, hiuⁿ-tuâⁿ hiah-ê kak, i mā tio̍h kā gû-káng-á ê hueh lóng piàⁿ tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu ê sio-tsè ê tuâⁿ-kha.
English: The priest shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of sweet incense before Yahweh, which is in the tent of meeting; and he shall pour out all of rest of the blood of the bull at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Kuan-hē hit-ê ji̍t kah hit-ê sî, bô lâng tsai, tī thinn-tíng ê thiⁿ-sài mā m̄-tsai, Kiáⁿ mā m̄-tsai, kan-taⁿ Thiⁿ-pē tsai.
English: But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — guá ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí pang-tsān guá, tsiàu Lí ê tsû-ài tsín-kiù guá,
English: Help me, Yahweh, my God. Save me according to your loving kindness;

Tailo: Āu-lâi, bûn-tô͘ khioh hiah-ê tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê piáⁿ-tshuì kah hî-sut-á, té-muá tsa̍p-jī nâ.
English: They took up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and also of the fish.

Tailo: Tē-tsiūⁿ ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kok tshin-tshiūnn Lí ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng? Tsiū-sī Siōng-tè khì kā in kiù-sio̍k, kui tī ka-kī tsò tsú-bîn, hō͘ i ū miâ-siaⁿ, koh tī Lí ê tsú-bîn ê bīn-tsîng, to̍h-sī Lí tuì Ai-gi̍p kah lia̍t pang, í-ki̍p in hiah-ê sîn-bîng só͘ kiù-sio̍k tshut-.lâi ê, uī-tio̍h lín kiânn tuā sū, uī-tio̍h lí ê tē tsò thang kiaⁿ ê tāi-tsì?
English: What one nation in the earth is like your people, even like Israel, whom God went to redeem to himself for a people, and to make him a name, and to do great things for you, and awesome things for your land, before your people, whom you redeem to you out of Egypt, from the nations and their gods?

Tailo: Τī tsit tshù lāi bô tsi̍t-ê pí guá khah tuā. Lí í-guā, i bô tsi̍t hāng bô kau hō͘ guá, in-uī lí sī i ê bó͘. Guá ná thang kiânn tsit-ê tuā pháiⁿ, lâi tik-tsuē Siōng-tè?
English: He isn't greater in this house than I, neither has he kept back anything from me but you, because you are his wife. How then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?

Tailo: E-lí-siah tsiū lī-khui hiah-ê gû, tsáu kàu E-li-iah ê āu-bīn, kóng, Kiû lí tsún guá tāi-sing tsim guá ê pē-bú, jiân-āu guá tsiū lâi tuè lí. E-li-iah kā i kóng, Lí tńg-.khì, guá kám ū tuì lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: He left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said, Let me, I pray you, kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow you. He said to him, Go back again; for what have I done to you?

Tailo: In tī iàn-si̍k tuâⁿ khîm tuâⁿ sik, phah kó͘, pûn ta̍t-á, lim tsiú, bô siūⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê só͘ kiâⁿ, mā bô tsù-ì I ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê.
English: The harp, lyre, tambourine, and flute, with wine, are at their feasts; But they don't regard the work of Yahweh, Neither have they considered the operation of his hands.

Tailo: Tshiánn kā siū Tsú kíng-suán ê Ló͘-ho͘h kah i ê lāu-bú tshíng-an, i ê lāu-bú mā sī guá ê lāu-bú.
English: Greet Rufus, the chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

Tailo: âng bé-ló kah pa̍t tsióng ê pó-tsio̍h, thang siuⁿ tsè-si ho̍k kah pó͘-kuà.
English: onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod and for the breastplate.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ-sim íng-uán tsûn-tsāi, m̄-koh, thuân-káng sìn-sit ê un-sù sī tsiām-sî ê; hiah-ê kóng kńg-tsi̍h-uē ê tsâi-tiāu ē bô-.khì, tì-sik mā ē bô-.khì.
English: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will be done away with. Where there are various languages, they will cease. Where there is knowledge, it will be done away with.

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi lóng bô koh ū tsiù-tsó͘. Siōng-tè kah iûⁿ-ko ê pó-tsō ē an-tì tī siâⁿ lāi.
English: There will be no curse any more. The throne of God and of the Lamb will be in it, and his servants serve him.

Tailo: Guá tsiū mn̄g kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá kóng, Tsiah-ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? I ìn guá kóng, Tsiah-ê to̍h-sī phah-suàⁿ Iô-tah, I-su-la-el kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tsiah-ê kak.
English: I asked the angel who talked with me, What are these? He answered me, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.

Tailo: Koh khí-tsō tsè-si ê īⁿ kah tuā-īⁿ, í-ki̍p īⁿ mn̂g, īng tâng an-tsng hiah-ê mn̂g.
English: Furthermore he made the court of the priests, and the great court, and doors for the court, and overlaid the doors of them with brass.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā Iô-tah ê tsóng-tok Tso-lô-ba-bel kóng: Guá beh tín-tāng thiⁿ kah tē.
English: Speak to Zerubbabel, governor of Judah, saying, I will shake the heavens and the earth.

Tailo: I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ kuè-khì Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘ ê tuì-bīn huāⁿ, lâi-kàu Gê-la̍h-sam lâng ê tē-khu.
English: They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.

Tailo: Huē-tsiòng só͘ hiàn sio-tsè ê gia̍h, tsóng-kiōng gû-káng tshit-tsa̍p tsiah, iûⁿ-káng tsi̍t pah tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-á nn̄g pah tsiah, tsiah-ê lóng sī tsò sio-tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú ê.
English: The number of the burnt offerings which the assembly brought was seventy bulls, one hundred rams, and two hundred lambs: all these were for a burnt offering to Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsú ah, kiû Lí hō͘ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k sim-sîn huann-hí, in-uī guá īng guá ê sim gióng-bōng Lí.
English: Bring joy to the soul of your servant, For to you, Lord, do I lift up my soul.

Tailo: Tī īⁿ ê sì-kak-thâu ū īⁿ, sì-bīn ū tshiûⁿ uî-.leh; ta̍k-ê īⁿ, tn̂g sì-tsa̍p tiú, khuah saⁿ-tsa̍p; sì-ê kak-thâu ê īⁿ, in ê tshùn-tshioh lóng kāng-khuán.
English: In the four corners of the court there were courts enclosed, forty cubits long and thirty broad: these four in the corners were of one measure.

Tailo: Ji̍t-thâu bô koh tsò lí ji̍t-sî ê kng, gue̍h mā bô koh huat kng tsiò lí. In-uī Siōng-tsú beh tsò lí íng-uán ê kng, lí ê Siōng-tsú beh tsò lí ê îng-iāu.
English: The sun shall be no more your light by day; neither for brightness shall the moon give light to you: but Yahweh will be to you an everlasting light, and your God your glory.

Tailo: Sa-mu-el it-sing tsò I-su-la-el ê sū-su.
English: Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.

Tailo: Guá beh Siat kì-hō tī in tiong-kan. Tô-tsáu ê, guá beh tshe in kàu lia̍t kok, to̍h-sī kàu Tal-si-sih, Phu-l, khui kiong ê Lù-t kah Thô͘-bal, Iá-uán kah pîng-sî bô thiaⁿ-tio̍h guá ê miâ-siaⁿ, bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá ê îng-kng ê hn̄g-hn̄g ê tó-sū; in ē kā guá ê îng-kng thuân-pò tī lia̍t kok tiong.
English: I will set a sign among them, and I will send such as escape of them to the nations, to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, who draw the bow, to Tubal and Javan, to the islands afar off, who have not heard my fame, neither have seen my glory; and they shall declare my glory among the nations.

Tailo: Me-ná-hiàm kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn liáu-āu, i ê kiáⁿ Pe-ka-hiap suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Menahem slept with his fathers; and Pekahiah his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm, āu-lâi koh tshut-khì sûn-sī jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan, tuì Bel-sí-bah kàu E-hu-laim suaⁿ-tē, tshuā jîn-bîn kui-ǹg Siōng-tsú — in tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè.
English: Jehoshaphat lived at Jerusalem: and he went out again among the people from Beersheba to the hill country of Ephraim, and brought them back to Yahweh, the God of their fathers.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tsiàu ông ê lé, īng mi̍h sàng Sí-bah ê lú-ông í-guā, kiàn-nā lú-ông só͘ ài ê, só͘ kiû ê, i lóng koh sàng i. Tsiū án-ne, i kah i ê jîn-sîn tò tńg-khì in pún-kok.
English: King Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, besides that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned, and went to her own land, she and her servants.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, kàu ji̍t-āu, Guá beh hō͘ Mô͘-ap siū lia̍h ê lâng tò tńg-.lâi. Kuan-hē Mô͘-ap siū sím-phuàⁿ ê uē, kàu tsia uî-tsí.
English: Yet will I bring back the captivity of Moab in the latter days, says Yahweh. Thus far is the judgment of Moab.

Tailo: I-é-su kóng, Guá uī-tio̍h sím-phuàⁿ lîm-kàu tsit sè-kan, hō͘ bô khuàⁿ-kìⁿ-ê lâng ē khuànn-kìnn, mā hō͘ ū khuànn-kìnn ê lâng piàn-tsò tsheⁿ-mê.
English: Jesus said, I came into this world for judgment, that those who don't see may see; and that those who see may become blind.

Tailo: I-é-su koh kè-sio̍k kóng, Lín koh thiaⁿ tsi̍t-ê phì-jū, ū tsi̍t-ê hn̂g-tsú khai-khún tsi̍t tè phû-tô hn̂g, īng lî-pa uî khí-.lâi, lāi-bīn ó͘ tsi̍t-ê tsiú-khut, khí tsi̍t-ê tsiú-keⁿ lâu. I kā tsit tè hn̂g tso͘ hō͘ tshân-tiān, tsiū tshut-khì lí-hîng.
English: Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household, who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a winepress in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country.

Tailo: Ông thiaⁿ-tio̍h lu̍t-huat ê uē, tsiū thiah-li̍h i ê saⁿ.
English: It happened, when the king had heard the words of the law, that he tore his clothes.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tuì Siōng-tè ê tuā ui-giâm lóng tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì. Tng tsìng lâng iáu teh kî-kuài I-é-su só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì ê sî, I-é-su tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng,
English: They were all astonished at the majesty of God. But while all were marveling at all the things which Jesus did, he said to his disciples,

Tailo: In-uī Tsú hō͘ A-lâm ê kun-tuī thiaⁿ-tio̍h tshia ê siann kah bé ê siann, to̍h-sī tuā kun-tuī ê siann. In tsiū tsò-hué kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tse sī I-su-la-el ông bé-siu Hiat lâng tsiah-ê ông kah Ai-gi̍p lâng tsiah-ê ông, lâi beh kong-kik lán.
English: For the Lord had made the army of the Syrians to hear a noise of chariots, and a noise of horses, even the noise of a great army: and they said one to another, Behold, the king of Israel has hired against us the kings of the Hittites, and the kings of the Egyptians, to come on us.

Tailo: Thâu tsi̍t tiâu miâ kiò-tsò Pi-sióng, to̍h-sī se̍h-lâu tī Ha-bí-la̍h tsuân tē ê, tī hia ū tshut kim.
English: The name of the first is Pishon: this is the one which flows through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;

Tailo: Nā ū pa̍t hāng ê siong-hāi, tsiū tio̍h īng miā puê miā.
English: But if any harm follows, then you must take life for life,

Tailo: Ta-lió-suh jī nî tsa̍p-it-.gue̍h, to̍h-sī Se-bat gue̍h ( Tsù, Iô-tá-iah lâng siū lia̍h āu Iô-tá-iah ji̍t li̍k ê tē 11-ê gue̍h-hūn, siong-tong se-li̍k ê it-gue̍h hi̍k jī-gue̍h ) jī-tsa̍p sì, Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu It-tó͘ ê sun — Be-lé-kiah ê kiáⁿ — sian-ti Tsa-kha-lī-a, kóng,
English: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ i hiah-ê suaⁿ, siū sat-hāi ê lâng muá-muá sī; hō͘ to-kiàm thâi-sí ê ē tó tī lí ê sió suaⁿ kah suaⁿ-kok, í-ki̍p só͘-ū ê kheⁿ-kau.
English: I will fill its mountains with its slain: in your hills and in your valleys and in all your watercourses shall they fall who are slain with the sword.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Io-siú-ah kah só͘-ū ê tsiàn-sū lóng khí-.lâi, beh tsiūⁿ-khì Ai siânn. Io-siú-ah kíng saⁿ-bān tuā la̍t ê ióng-sū, àm-sî tshe in khì,
English: So Joshua arose, and all the people of war, to go up to Ai: and Joshua chose out thirty thousand men, the mighty men of valor, and sent them forth by night.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t bīng-līng tsū-tsi̍p tuà I-su-la-el tē ê tshut-guā lâng, koh phài phah tsio̍h ê sai-hū phah tsio̍h, ài beh khí Siōng-tsú ê tiān.
English: David commanded to gather together the foreigners who were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew worked stones to build the house of God.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tsìng tsa-bó͘ gín-á, guá sī o͘ koh seⁿ-tsò hó khuànn, tshin-tshiūnn Ke-tal ê pò͘-pênn, tshin-tshiūnn Só͘-lô-móng ê tiùⁿ-lî.
English: I am dark, but lovely, You daughters of Jerusalem, Like Kedar's tents, Like Solomon's curtains.

Tailo: Tsiàu Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì kiânn ê sī Siōng-tsú, kè-uē lâi kiàn-li̍p ê mā sī I, I-é-ho-bah sī I ê miâ.
English: Thus says Yahweh who does it, Yahweh who forms it to establish it; Yahweh is his name:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Lí ê bué-kíng ū ǹg-bāng, lí ê kiáⁿ-jî ē tò tńg-lâi ka-kī ê kíng lāi.
English: There is hope for your latter end, says Yahweh; and your children shall come again to their own border.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kā in kóng, Án-ne lín kám iáu-buē bîng-pi̍k?
English: He asked them, Don't you understand, yet?

Tailo: Suî-jiân in tshâ bô kā I tīng sí-tsuē ê lí-iû, iáu-koh iau-kiû Pí-la̍h-to kā I tshú sí-hîng.
English: Though they found no cause for death, they still asked Pilate to have him killed.

Tailo: Tē-peh ji̍t lín tio̍h ū giâm-siok-huē, lóng m̄-thang tsò lô-tōng ê kang.
English: On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly: you shall do no servile work;

Tailo: Gī lâng it-tīng ē kám-siā Lí ê miâ; tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng ē khiā tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name. The upright will dwell in your presence.

Tailo: A-bú-lâm kóng, Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú ah, guá ná ē tsai guá ē tit-tio̍h tsit-ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p?
English: He said, Lord Yahweh, how will I know that I will inherit it?

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tuì in suan-pò͘ tse it-tshè ê uē, lâi kā in kong-kik, kóng: Siōng-tsú ē tuì tíng-bīn tuā-siaⁿ huah, tuì I tuà ê sìng-só͘ tshut siaⁿ, tuì I ê iûⁿ-kûn tuā-siaⁿ huah; I ē tuì tē-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn huah-hiàm, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh ta̍h phû-tô ê lâng.
English: Therefore prophesy you against them all these words, and tell them, Yahweh will roar from on high, and utter his voice from his holy habitation; he will mightily roar against his fold; he will give a shout, as those who tread the grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.

Tailo: Tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng kàu gō͘-tsa̍p huè, kiàn-nā ji̍p-lâi tng-tsit tī huē-bō͘ lāi tsò-kang ê, lóng tio̍h sǹg.
English: from thirty years old and upward even to fifty years old shall you number them, everyone who enters on the service, to do the work of the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Tuā-tsè-si tsiū kóng, Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì kám sī án-ne?
English: The high priest said, Are these things so?

Tailo: I-é-su tuì in ê m̄-sìn kám-kak kî-kuài. I tsiū khì sì-kho͘-uî ê tsng-thâu kiâⁿ thàu-thàu lâi kà-sī lâng.
English: He marveled because of their unbelief. He went around the villages teaching.

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì I-é-su kóng, Iô-há-neh ê bûn-tô͘ tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, Hua-lí-sái phài ê bûn-tô͘ mā sī án-ne, m̄-koh, Lí ê bûn-tô͘ mā lim mā tsia̍h.
English: They said to him, Why do John's disciples often fast and pray, likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink?

Tailo: Sàu-lô iáu-koh kè-sio̍k khióng-hat beh thâi Tsú ê bûn-tô͘. I khì kìⁿ tuā-tsè-si,
English: But Saul, still breathing threats and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,

Tailo: Uá-khò Siōng-tsú, pí uá-khò lâng khah hó;
English: It is better to take refuge in Yahweh, Than to put confidence in man.

Tailo: M̄-lah, guán beh kah lí tsò-hué tńg-khì lí ê jîn-bîn hia.
English: They said to her, No, but we will return with you to your people.

Tailo: In koh mn̄g Pa-lo-sih kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kā guán kóng, lí īng siáⁿ khuán lâi siá i só͘ thuân it-tshè ê uē?
English: They asked Baruch, saying, Tell us now, How did you write all these words at his mouth?

Tailo: La̍h-ban thiaⁿ-tio̍h guē-sing Iâ-kop ê siau-sit, tsiū tsáu-khì kā i gîng-tsiap, kā i lám, kah i tsim-tshuì, tshuā i kàu in tau. Iâ-kop kā it-tshè ê tāi-tsì lóng tuì La̍h-ban kóng.
English: It happened, when Laban heard the news of Jacob, his sister's son, that he ran to meet Jacob, and embraced him, and kissed him, and brought him to his house. Jacob told Laban all these things.

Tailo: In-uī hit uī uī lâng sin-uan ê Siōng-tè ē kì-tit in; bô bē kì-.tit khùn-khó͘ ê lâng ê ai-kiû.
English: For he who avenges blood remembers them. He doesn't forget the cry of the afflicted.

Tailo: Tì-huī ê kiáⁿ hō͘ lāu-pē huann-hí; gōng lâng khuànn-khin ka-kī ê lāu-bú.
English: A wise son makes a father glad, But a foolish man despises his mother.

Tailo: Lín kàu Ka-nân tē ê sî, tsai-tsìng ta̍k tsióng ē tsia̍h-tit ê kué-tsí tshiū, lín tio̍h kā hiah-ê kué-tsí khuàⁿ-tsò kah buē siū kat-lé ê sio-siâng. M̄-thang tsia̍h thâu sann nî ê kué-tsí, lín tio̍h kā hiah-ê kué-tsí khuàⁿ-tsò sī buē siū kat-lé ê.
English: When you come into the land, and have planted all kinds of trees for food, then you shall count their fruit as forbidden. Three years shall they be forbidden to you. It shall not be eaten.

Tailo: Ná-tap kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, i tsiàu án-ne kiâⁿ i ê lāu-pē ê lō͘, koh huān-tio̍h i ê lāu-pē hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng só͘ huān ê tsuē.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.

Tailo: Nā bô tī tsiah-ê siū sio̍k, kàu hí-nî i kah i ê kiáⁿ-jî lóng thang tshut-khì tsū-iû.
English: If he isn't redeemed by these means, then he shall be released in the Year of Jubilee, he, and his children with him.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tī Iol-tàn hô guā ê Mô͘-ap tē, khai-sí thuân tsit-ê lu̍t-huat kóng,
English: Beyond the Jordan, in the land of Moab, began Moses to declare this law, saying,

Tailo: tī Ka-lio̍k, tī Bo-tsu-la̍h kah Mô͘-ap tē hn̄g-kīn só͘-ū ê siâⁿ.
English: and on Kerioth, and on Bozrah, and on all the cities of the land of Moab, far or near.

Tailo: A-ná-tu̍t kah i ê kau-iá, Al-móng kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng sì tsō siâⁿ.
English: Anathoth with its suburbs, and Almon with its suburbs; four cities.

Tailo: Tuà tī La̍h-ki-sih ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h īng tshia lâi thò gâu tsáu ê bé; i tsò Si-óng ê jîn-bîn huān tsuē ê khí-thâu; I-su-la-el ê tsuē-kò, tī lí hia hián-hiān.
English: Harness the chariot to the swift steed, inhabitant of Lachish. She was the beginning of sin to the daughter of Zion; For the transgressions of Israel were found in you.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tuì I-su-la-el jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, liân-tiúⁿ, sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ, í-ki̍p tsuân I-su-la-el ê siú-líng kah tso̍k-tiúⁿ kóng-uē.
English: Solomon spoke to all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every prince in all Israel, the heads of the fathers' houses.

Tailo: Tng Ma-tái ông — Ta-lió-suh guân nî, guá khiā khí-.lâi, hō͘ i kian-kò͘ ióng-tsòng.
English: As for me, in the first year of Darius the Mede, I stood up to confirm and strengthen him.

Tailo: Hiah-ê uá-khò sè-li̍k, khua-kháu hù-jū ê lâng,
English: Those who trust in their wealth, And boast in the multitude of their riches

Tailo: Tsē tsûn kuè hái, tī tuā hái tiong king-îng sū-gia̍p ê lâng,
English: Those who go down to the sea in ships, Who do business in great waters;

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tī kng liu-liu ê suaⁿ khiā tuā kî, tuì in tshut siaⁿ ia̍t tshiú, hō͘ in ji̍p-khì kuì-tso̍k ê mn̂g.
English: Set up a banner on the bare mountain! Lift up your voice to them! Wave your hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.

Tailo: Ba̍k-tsiu ê kng-bîng hō͘ sim huann-hí; hó siau-sit ē tsu-jūn kin-kut.
English: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart. Good news gives health to the bones.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Tsú — bān-kun ê Tsú ē hō͘ puî ê lâng piàn siau-sán. Tī I îng-kng ê ē-bīn ē ū hué to̍h khí-.lâi, ná tshin-tshiūnn hué teh sio.
English: Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory a burning will be kindled like the burning of fire.

Tailo: Guá sio̍k guá ê lông-kun, i mā him-bō͘ guá.
English: I am my beloved's. His desire is toward me.

Tailo: In tsuân sing-khu, in ê kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ, in ê tshiú, in ê si̍t kah lián, sì-kho͘-uî lóng ū ba̍k-tsiu muá-muá; to̍h-sī in sì-ê só͘-ū ê lián.
English: Their whole body, and their backs, and their hands, and their wings, and the wheels, were full of eyes round about, even the wheels that they four had.

Tailo: Sio̍k Biān-iá-mín ê tsi-tso̍k king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê,
English: Of the children of Benjamin, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h guá, guá bô kuáⁿ-kín khì-sak bo̍k-tsiá ê tsit, m̄ tuè Lí, tsai-hō kàu ê ji̍t, m̄-sī guá só͘ ài; tse sī Lí só͘ tsai, guá ê tshuì só͘ kóng ê, lóng tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: As for me, I have not hurried from being a shepherd after you; neither have I desired the woeful day; you know: that which came out of my lips was before your face.

Tailo: In tio̍h īng nâ-sik ê iù-tuà, kā pó͘-kuà ê khuân kah tsè-si ho̍k ê khuân pa̍k sio-liân, hō͘ i liân tī tsè-si ho̍k kî-khiáu ê kang-hu só͘ tsit ê tuà, hō͘ pó͘-kuà kah tsè-si ho̍k bô lī-phāng.
English: They shall bind the breastplate by the rings of it to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate may not swing out from the ephod.

Tailo: Jiân-āu Páu-lô tsiū lī-khui in tshut-.khì.
English: Thus Paul went out from among them.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, i siū tshian-suá hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì; i ê enn-á hō͘ lâng siak-sí tī ke-lō͘ thâu. Lâng uī-tio̍h i tsun-kuì ê lâng liam-khau ; i ê tuā kuaⁿ-uân lóng hō͘ thih-liān pa̍k khí-.lâi.
English: Yet was she carried away. She went into captivity. Her young children also were dashed in pieces at the head of all the streets, and they cast lots for her honorable men, and all her great men were bound in chains.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tuì ta̍k tsi-tso̍k kíng tsi̍t-ê siú-líng, pun hit-ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: You shall take one prince of every tribe, to divide the land for inheritance.

Tailo: In tsiū án-ne tī Siōng-tè ê pó-tsō tsîng, mê-ji̍t tī I ê sìng-tiān ho̍k-sāi I. Tsē tī pó-tsō ê hit uī ē kah in tông-tsāi lâi pó-siú in.
English: Therefore they are before the throne of God, they serve him day and night in his temple. He who sits on the throne will spread his tent over them.

Tailo: In gîm-si liáu-āu, tsiū tshut-huat khì Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ.
English: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

Tailo: A-hap in-uī E-tsu-le-el lâng Na-bot só͘ kóng ê uē, tsiū ut-tsut bô huann-hí, tò tńg-khì i ê tshù, in-uī Na-bot bat kóng, Guá m̄ kā guá ê tsó͘-sian gia̍p hō͘ lí. A-hap tsiū tó tī bîn-tshn̂g, bīn ǹg lāi-bīn, mā m̄-tsia̍h.
English: Ahab came into his house sullen and angry because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him; for he had said, I will not give you the inheritance of my fathers. He laid him down on his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no bread.

Tailo: Guá nā tshe lí khì in hia, in it-tīng ē thiaⁿ lí ê uē; tsóng-.sī, I-su-la-el ê jîn-bîn m̄-khíng thiaⁿ lí ê uē, to̍h-sī m̄-khíng thiaⁿ Guá ê uē; in-uī I-su-la-el tsuân ke sī thâu-hia̍h tīng, sim ngē ê lâng.
English: But the house of Israel will not listen to you; for they will not listen to me: for all the house of Israel are of hard forehead and of a stiff heart.

Tailo: Iol-tàn hô sai pîng ê A-mô͘-lī lâng tsiah-ê ông kah uá hái ê Ka-nân lâng tsiah-ê ông, thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tsú tī I-su-la-el lâng ê bīn-tsîng hō͘ Iol-tàn hô ê tsuí ta-.khì, thìng-hāu in kuè-.khì; in ê sim in-uī I-su-la-el lâng ê iân-kò͘ tsiū sit táⁿ, sîn put hù thé.
English: It happened, when all the kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan westward, and all the kings of the Canaanites, who were by the sea, heard how that Yahweh had dried up the waters of the Jordan from before the children of Israel, until we were passed over, that their heart melted, neither was there spirit in them any more, because of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Io-a-si kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kám bô lóng kì tī Iô-tah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tsiū tsū-tsi̍p tsìng lâng, khì kong-kik Lap-bah, lâi kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: David gathered all the people together, and went to Rabbah, and fought against it, and took it.

Tailo: Khiā tī sìng ê só͘-tsāi tsiàu lín ê hiann-tī, to̍h-sī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tsong-tso̍k ê pâng-thâu, tio̍h ū Lē-bī lâng tsong-tso̍k ê tsi̍t tso͘ lâi kā I ho̍k-sāi.
English: Stand in the holy place according to the divisions of the fathers' houses of your brothers the children of the people, and let there be for each a portion of a fathers' house of the Levites.

Tailo: Lí tsioh i tsînn m̄-thang kā i the̍h lī-sik, lí tsioh i bí-niûⁿ mā m̄-thang kā i the̍h khah ke.
English: You shall not lend him your money at interest, nor give him your food for profit.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín kah iok-kuī sio-lī, tsha-put-to tio̍h niû nn̄g-tshing tiú ê hn̄g, m̄-thang pik-kīn i, án-ne sī beh hō͘ lín tsai só͘ tio̍h kiânn ê lō͘, in-uī lín pîng-sî m̄-bat kiânn tsit tiâu lō͘.
English: Yet there shall be a space between you and it, about two thousand cubits by measure: don't come near to it, that you may know the way by which you must go; for you have not passed this way heretofore.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè tāi-sing kíng-suán ê lâng, mā tāi-sing tiāⁿ-tio̍h hō͘ in kah I ê Kiáⁿ ê hîng-siōng sio-kāng, thang hō͘ I ê Kiáⁿ tī tsē-tsē hiann-tī tiong tsò tuā-kiáⁿ.
English: For whom he foreknew, he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers.

Tailo: Sí-mòng Piat-tò͘ ìn kóng, Tsú ah, Lí ū íng-uán ua̍h-miā ê uē, guán tio̍h koh khì tuè siáⁿ lâng?
English: Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.

Tailo: I koh tuì guá kóng, ' Lí ê kiáⁿ Só͘-lô-móng ē khí Guá ê tiān kah Guá ê īⁿ, in-uī Guá kíng i tsò Guá ê kiáⁿ, Guá mā beh tsò i ê pē.
English: He said to me, Solomon your son, he shall build my house and my courts; for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.

Tailo: Phah tâng sai-hū A-li̍k-san-toh kā guá hāi kah tsin tshám, Tsú ē tsiàu i ê só͘ tsò lâi kā i pò-ìng.
English: Alexander, the coppersmith, did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his works,

Tailo: Kuí-nā nî āu, tī Ta-bi̍t ê tsheh ū kì-tsài, Siōng-tè koh līng-guā tīng tsi̍t ji̍t, kiò-tsò Kin-á-ji̍t , tshin-tshiūnn tíng-bīn só͘ kóng, kin-á-ji̍t lín nā thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê siann, m̄-thang ngē lín ê sim. ( tsù, SPh 95:7-8 )
English: he again defines a certain day, today, saying through David so long a time afterward ( just as has been said ) , Today if you will hear his voice, Don't harden your hearts.

Tailo: Guá ê jîn-bîn tú-tio̍h tsai-hō ê ji̍t-tsí, lí bô ing-kai ji̍p-khì i ê mn̂g; in tú-tio̍h tsai-hō ê ji̍t-tsí, lí bô ing-kai khuànn in teh siū khó͘; in tú-tio̍h tsai-hō ê ji̍t-tsí, lí bô ing-kai bong-tio̍h in ê tsâi-bu̍t.
English: Don't enter into the gate of my people in the day of their calamity. Don't look down on their affliction in the day of their calamity, neither seize their wealth on the day of their calamity.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Lí nā tsai Siōng-tè hō͘ lâng ê un-sù, koh tsai tuì lí kóng ' Tsuí pun Guá lim tsi̍t ē'ê sī siáⁿ lâng, lí it-tīng ē kā I kiû, I ē kā ua̍h-tsuí hō͘ lí.
English: Jesus answered her, If you knew the gift of God, and who it is who says to you, Give me a drink,' you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tio̍h tsun bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú tsò sìng; I sī lín só͘ tio̍h kiaⁿ ê, só͘ tio̍h lún ê.
English: Yahweh of Armies is who you must regard as holy. He is the one you must fear. He is the one you must dread.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí khí-lâi tí-tòng tuì-ti̍k, kā i phah-tó; īng Lí ê to kiù guá ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī pháiⁿ lâng.
English: Arise, Yahweh, Confront him, cast him down. Deliver my soul from the wicked by your sword;

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng ai-kiû Siōng-tsú, kóng, Guán tik-tsuē Lí, in-uī ū khì-sak guán ê Siōng-tè, khì ho̍k-sāi tsiah-ê Ba-al.
English: The children of Israel cried to Yahweh, saying, We have sinned against you, even because we have forsaken our God, and have served the Baals.

Tailo: Lán beh tuì tó tsi̍t tiâu lō͘ khì? Io-lâm ông kóng, Tuì E-tóm khòng-iá ê lō͘.
English: He said, Which way shall we go up? He answered, The way of the wilderness of Edom.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng sī sán-hū tshui-tsūn thòng-khó͘ ê khai-sí.
English: But all these things are the beginning of birth pains.

Tailo: Iô-tah lâng tsiū kuat-ì sîng-jīn in kah in ê kiáⁿ-sun, í-ki̍p kiàn-nā kui-uá in ê lâng, nî-nî beh tsiàu só͘ kì-tsài ê, tī só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê kî, siú tsit nn̄g ji̍t tsò tseh, hō͘ i bô huì-tû.
English: the Jews ordained, and took on them, and on their seed, and on all such as joined themselves to them, so that it should not fail, that they would keep these two days according to the writing of it, and according to the appointed time of it, every year;

Tailo: tī ji̍t, kng, gue̍h kah tsheⁿ iáu-buē piàn-tsò o͘-àm, í-ki̍p hō͘ kuè-liáu, hûn iáu-buē koh lâi ê tsìn-tsîng;
English: Before the sun, the light, the moon, and the stars are darkened, And the clouds return after the rain;

Tailo: in-uī Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lín ē bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h hong, bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h hō͘, m̄-koh tsit-ê suaⁿ-kok, tsuí ē muá-muá, hō͘ lín thang lim. Tsiū-sī lín kah lín ê tsing-seⁿ, lín ê siù, lim tsiah-ê tsuí. '
English: For thus says Yahweh, You shall not see wind, neither shall you see rain; yet that valley shall be filled with water, and you shall drink, both you and your livestock and your animals.

Tailo: Páu-lô kah Se-la̍h ìn kóng, Tio̍h sìn Tsú I-é-su, lí ê ke tsiū ē tit-tio̍h kiù.
English: They said, Believe in the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved, you and your household.

Tailo: Lē-bī lâng kah Iô-tah kûn-tsiòng, tsiàu tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng ê khì kiâⁿ, ta̍k lâng tuà in lûn-tio̍h An-hioh-ji̍t ji̍p-.lâi ê lâng kah lûn-tio̍h An-hioh-ji̍t tshut-khì ê lâng, in-uī tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah m̄-tsún in hā-pan.
English: So the Levites and all Judah did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded: and they took every man his men, those who were to come in on the Sabbath; with those who were to go out on the Sabbath; for Jehoiada the priest didn't dismiss the shift.

Tailo: Liân sìng-tiān i to beh kā i ù-uè, guán tsiū kā i lia̍h khí-.lâi, siūⁿ beh tsiàu guán ka-kī ê lu̍t-huat kā i sím-phuàⁿ.
English: He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him.

Tailo: Guá ê Siōng-tè ah, guá ê sim tī guá ê lāi-bīn ut-tsut, só͘-í, guá tuì Iol-tàn hô ê tē kah Hel-móng, mā tuì Mi-tsah ê suaⁿ lâi kì-liām Lí.
English: My God, my soul is in despair within me. Therefore I remember you from the land of the Jordan, The heights of Hermon, from the hill Mizar.

Tailo: Lia̍t-pang thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah; tuà tī Hui-lī-sū tē ê, tú-tio̍h thòng-khó͘.
English: The peoples have heard. They tremble. Pangs have taken hold on the inhabitants of Philistia.

Tailo: tsit nn̄g-ê sio-tsèⁿ ê lâng tsiū tio̍h khiā tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng kah tong-sî ê tsè-si í-ki̍p sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ ê bīn-tsîng.
English: then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges who shall be in those days;

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng, to̍h-sī guá ê tuì-ti̍k, lâi kong-kik guá, beh tsia̍h guá ê bah, hit sî in tsiū ē kha that-tio̍h lâi pua̍h-tó.
English: When evil-doers came at me to eat up my flesh, Even my adversaries and my foes, they stumbled and fell.

Tailo: In-uī kàu-sî Sìng Sîn ē kà lín tio̍h kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē.
English: for the Holy Spirit will teach you in that same hour what you must say.

Tailo: Hái-iûⁿ sio̍k tī I, sī I tshòng-tsō ê; ta tē mā sī I ê tshiú tsō-sîng ê.
English: The sea is his, and he made it. His hands formed the dry land.

Tailo: Tng in jua̍h-.lâng ê sî, Guá beh uī in pān tsiú-toh, hō͘ i tsiú-tsuì, hō͘ i khuài-lo̍k, hō͘ i kú-tn̂g teh khùn, íng-uán bô tsing-sîn. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: When they are heated, I will make their feast, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Tē ah, tē ah, tē ah, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōng-tsú ê uē!
English: O earth, earth, earth, hear the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá kā Guá ê thòng-hūn piàⁿ tī in ê tíng-bīn, īng Guá tuā siū-khì ê hué kā in bia̍t-bông, tsiàu in só͘ kiâⁿ ê lâi pò-ìng tī in ê thâu-khak tíng. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Therefore have I poured out my indignation on them; I have consumed them with the fire of my wrath: their own way have I brought on their heads, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Sí-lâng bē-tàng o-ló Siōng-tsú; lo̍h kàu tiām-tiām ê só͘-tsāi ê lâng mā lóng bē-tàng.
English: The dead don't praise Yah, Neither any who go down into silence;

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng tio̍h lī-khui i ê lō͘, put-gī ê lâng tio̍h kái-uāⁿ i ê liām-thâu. Kui-ǹg Siōng-tsú, I ē liân-bín i; kui-ǹg lán ê Siōng-tsú, in-uī I beh piàn kiâⁿ sià-bián.
English: let the wicked forsake his way, and the unrighteous man his thoughts; and let him return to Yahweh, and he will have mercy on him; and to our God, for he will abundantly pardon.

Tailo: Bōng mā piak-khui, ū tsin tsē í-king sí-.khì ê Siōng-tè tsú-bîn, in ê sing-khu koh-ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: The tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep were raised;

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k pháiⁿ lâng tshin-tshiūnn giâ íng ê hái, bē-tàng pîng-tsīng; i ê tsuí tshìng-tshut ù-uè kah thô͘-muê.
English: But the wicked are like the troubled sea; for it can't rest, and its waters cast up mire and dirt.

Tailo: kî-tiong king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tsóng-kiōng ū peh-tshing gō͘-pah peh-tsa̍p miâ.
English: even those who were numbered of them, were eight thousand five hundred eighty.

Tailo: Lí nā tsun-siú lu̍t-huat, kat-lé tsiū ū kè-ta̍t; lí nā huān-huat, ū kat-lé tsiū kah bô kat-lé kāng-khuán.
English: For circumcision indeed profits, if you are a doer of the law, but if you are a transgressor of the law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision.

Tailo: Teh seⁿ ê sî, tsi̍t-ê gín-á tshun tsi̍t ki tshiú tshut-.lâi, sán-pô the̍h âng-suàⁿ pa̍k tī i ê tshiú, kóng, Tsit-ê sī tāi-sing tshut-sì ê.
English: When she travailed, one put out a hand, and the midwife took and tied a scarlet thread on his hand, saying, This came out first.

Tailo: só͘-í, tsiū koh mn̄g Siōng-tsú kóng, Hit-ê lâng ū lâi tsia á-bô? Siōng-tsú kóng, I bih tī tsa̍p-mi̍h ê tiong-kan.
English: Therefore they asked of Yahweh further, Is there yet a man to come here? Yahweh answered, Behold, he has hid himself among the baggage.

Tailo: Guán sī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn, Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ sūn-ho̍k I ê lâng ê Sìng Sîn mā uī-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì tsò tsìng-jîn.
English: We are His witnesses of these things; and so also is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey him.

Tailo: I ìn kóng, Kā i liân-bín hit-ê lâng to̍h-sī. I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí khì, tsiàu án-ne khì tsò.
English: He said, He who showed mercy on him. Then Jesus said to him, Go and do likewise.

Tailo: Sī-sè siū sī-tuā ê tsiok-hok sī lí-só͘-tong-jiân.
English: But without any dispute the less is blessed by the better.

Tailo: Gî-tióng koh tuì Siōng-tsú kóng, Kiû Lí m̄-thang tuì guá siū-khì, guá koh kóng tsi̍t pái niā-niā, kiû Lí tsún guá koh tsi̍t pái īng iûⁿ-mn̂g tshì-khuàⁿ māi, taⁿ to̍k-to̍k hō͘ iûⁿ-mn̂g ta-ta, thô͘-kha lóng ū lō͘-tsuí.
English: Gideon said to God, Don't let your anger be kindled against me, and I will speak but this once: Please let me make a trial just this once with the fleece; let it now be dry only on the fleece, and on all the ground let there be dew.

Tailo: Guá sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè, bat tshuā lín tshut Ai-gi̍p tē, bián-tit lín tsò in ê lô͘-po̍k; Guá bat tsám-tn̄g lín ê ka-tann ê soh, hō͘ lín thíng-sin lâi kiâⁿ.
English: I am Yahweh your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, that you should not be their slaves; and I have broken the bars of your yoke, and made you go upright.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú uī-tio̍h I-su-la-el ông A-khà-tsuh ê iân-kò͘, hō͘ Iô-tah pi-bî, sī in-uī A-khà-tsuh tī Iô-tah hòng-sù, tuā-tuā tik-tsuē Siōng-tsú.
English: For Yahweh brought Judah low because of Ahaz king of Israel; for he had dealt wantonly in Judah, and trespassed severely against Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá —Té-tioh, to̍h-sī tsit tiuⁿ phue ê tāi-pit-jîn, tī Tsú lāi kā lín tshíng-an.
English: I, Tertius, who write the letter, greet you in the Lord.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bong-tio̍h lâng ê sin-si, bô tshing-khì ka-kī ê, tsiū uè lah-sap Siōng-tsú ê huē-bō͘, tsit-ê lâng tio̍h tuì I-su-la-el tiong tsián-tû; in-uī tû-khì lah-sap ê tsuí bô hiù tī i ê sing-khu, i tsiū bô tshing-khì, i ê bô tshing-khì iáu-koh tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: Whoever touches a dead person, the body of a man who has died, and doesn't purify himself, defiles the tent of Yahweh; and that soul shall be cut off from Israel: because the water for impurity was not sprinkled on him, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is yet on him.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú beh tī I ê Thiⁿ-pē ê îng-kng tiong kah I ê thiⁿ-sài tsò-hué lâi-lîm, hit sî I ē tsiàu ta̍k lâng ê só͘ tsò lâi kā in pò-siúⁿ á-.sī hîng-hua̍t.
English: For the Son of Man will come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to everyone according to his deeds.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông Io-a-si, tī Bia̍t-si-mé-si lia̍h-tio̍h E-hua-há-tsuh ê sun, Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Iô-tah ông A-má-tsiah, tsiū ah i kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm, koh thiah-huí Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, tuì E-hu-laim mn̂g kàu kak mn̂g, kiōng sì pah tiú.
English: Joash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash the son of Jehoahaz, at Beth Shemesh, and brought him to Jerusalem, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate, four hundred cubits.

Tailo: Guá ê lông-kun sī guá ê tsi̍t pha tsíng-kah hue, khui tī Ian-ge-tih ê phû-tô hn̂g lāi.
English: My beloved is to me a cluster of henna blossoms From the vineyards of En Gedi. Lover

Tailo: Hit tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ beh tam-tng in só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ kàu bô lâng tuà ê só͘-tsāi, i tsiū pàng suaⁿ-iûⁿ tī khòng-iá.
English: The goat shall carry all their iniquities on himself to a solitary land, and he shall let the goat go in the wilderness.

Tailo: M̄-thang tham-bîn, tsiah bián tì-kàu sàn-tshiah; tio̍h thí-khui lí ê ba̍k-tsiu, tsiah ū kàu-gia̍h ê bí-niûⁿ.
English: Don't love sleep, lest you come to poverty; Open your eyes, and you shall be satisfied with bread.

Tailo: mā hō͘ in tsò kng-thé tī thiⁿ ê kiong-tshong, tsiò-kng tī tē-tsiūⁿ. Tsiū tsiàu án-ne uân-sîng.
English: and let them be for lights in the expanse of sky to give light on the earth, and it was so.

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia kā lín kóng, ' Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè ē kiù lán thuat-lī A-siul ông ê tshiú. ' Tse kám m̄-sī ín-iú lín, hō͘ lín iau koh tshuì-ta lâi sí?
English: Does not Hezekiah persuade you, to give you over to die by famine and by thirst, saying, Yahweh our God will deliver us out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

Tailo: to̍k-to̍k m̄-thang tsia̍h i ê hueh; tio̍h piàⁿ tī tē-.ni̍h kah piàⁿ tsuí sio-siâng.
English: Only you shall not eat its blood; you shall pour it out on the ground as water.

Tailo: Guá beh īng kám-siā ê tsè hiàn hō͘ Lí, Koh beh kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú ê miâ.
English: I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving, And will call on the name of Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kám bô kàm-tshat tsit-ê tāi-tsì? I tsai lâng sim-lāi ê pì-bi̍t.
English: Won't God search this out? For he knows the secrets of the heart.

Tailo: M̄-koh, I-é-su ua̍t tńg-sin khuànn bûn-tô͘, tsiū tsik-pī Piat-tò͘ kóng, Sa-tán, siám-khui! Lí só͘ siūⁿ ê m̄-sī Siōng-tè ê tāi-tsì, sī lâng ê tāi-tsì.
English: But he, turning around, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and said, Get behind me, Satan! For you have in mind not the things of God, but the things of men.

Tailo: koh ē uī ka-kī siat-li̍p in lâi tsò iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, pâi-tiúⁿ, mā ē siat-li̍p lâng lâi thè i tsoh hn̂g, siu ngó͘-kok, tsè-tsō kun-khì kah tshia-.ni̍h ê khì-kū;
English: and he will appoint them to him for captains of thousands, and captains of fifties; and he will set some to plow his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and the instruments of his chariots.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá só͘ hē tī Io-siú-ah bīn-tsîng ê tsio̍h-thâu, tī tsi̍t tè tsio̍h-thâu ū tshit luí ba̍k-tsiu. Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tiau-khik só͘ ing-kai tiau-khik ê, mā beh tī tsi̍t ji̍t ê tiong-kan tû-khì tsit-ê só͘-tsāi ê tsuē-ok.
English: For, behold, the stone that I have set before Joshua; on one stone are seven eyes: behold, I will engrave the engraving of it,' says Yahweh of Armies, and I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.

Tailo: Guān I îng-kng ê miâ íng-uán siū o-ló. Guān I ê îng-kng tshiong-muá tsuân tē! A-men! Koh A-men!
English: Blessed be his glorious name forever! Let the whole earth be filled with his glory! Amen and amen.

Tailo: Sàu-lô beh īng tshiuⁿ tsha̍k Ta-bi̍t, kā i tìng tī piah-.ni̍h ; i tsiū tuì Sàu-lô ê bīn-tsîng siám-khui, hit ki tshiuⁿ tsha̍k ji̍p-khì piah-.ni̍h. Hit mê, Ta-bi̍t tsiū tsáu, lâi siám-phiah i.
English: Saul sought to strike David even to the wall with the spear; but he slipped away out of Saul's presence, and he struck the spear into the wall: and David fled, and escaped that night.

Tailo: Tuà tī suaⁿ-kok, pîng-guân kah tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng ê jîn-bîn, lín kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng ē lo̍h-lâi kong-kik guán? Siáⁿ lâng ē ji̍p-lâi guán tuà ê só͘-tsāi? ' Lí khuàⁿ, Guá kah lín tsò tuì-ti̍k.
English: Behold, I am against you, O inhabitant of the valley, and of the rock of the plain, says Yahweh; you that say, Who shall come down against us? or who shall enter into our habitations?

Tailo: Lâng pò guá ê lāu-pē kóng, Lí ū seⁿ tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ! Hō͘ i tsin huann-hí ê; guān hit-ê lâng siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Cursed be the man who brought news to my father, saying, A boy is born to you; making him very glad.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, lí ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h bô? Iô-tah ke tī tsia kiânn tsit-ê khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, kám iáu sǹg-tsò sī sió-khuá? In tī tsit-ê só͘-tsāi piàn kiâⁿ kiông-pō, tsài-saⁿ kik Guá siū-khì; lí khuàⁿ, in gia̍h tshiū-ki hē tī in ê phīⁿ-khang tsîng.
English: Then he said to me, Have you seen this, son of man? Is it a light thing to the house of Judah that they commit the abominations which they commit here? for they have filled the land with violence, and have turned again to provoke me to anger: and behold, they put the branch to their nose.

Tailo: Bo̍k-tsiá bô lō͘ thang tô-tsáu, iûⁿ-kûn ê thâu-ba̍k mā bô lō͘ thang thuat-lī.
English: The shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the principal of the flock to escape.

Tailo: In-uī I beh tsiàu lâng só͘ tsò ê lâi kā i pò-ìng, tsiàu lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê lâi hō͘ i tú-.tio̍h.
English: For the work of a man he will render to him, And cause every man to find according to his ways.

Tailo: I ê tsok-uî sī tsun-kuì koh ū ui-giâm; I ê kong-gī íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: His work is honor and majesty. His righteousness endures forever.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh lîng-jio̍k sìng-só͘ ê siú-líng, hō͘ Iâ-kop siū tsiù-tsó͘, hō͘ I-su-la-el siū tshoh-mē.
English: Therefore I will profane the princes of the sanctuary; and I will make Jacob a curse, and Israel a reviling.

Tailo: tì-sú Siōng-tè ta̍k tsá-khí kàm-tshat i, sî-khik kā i khó-giām?
English: That you should visit him every morning, And test him every moment?

Tailo: In-uī thiⁿ lī-khui tē hiah-ni̍h kuân, I ê tsû-ài tuì kìng-uì I ê lâng mā sī hiah tuā!
English: For as the heavens are high above the earth, So great is his loving kindness toward those who fear him.

Tailo: Tī tsia, Siōng-tè pīng bô hō͘ i sán-gia̍p, liân khiā kha ê só͘-tsāi to bô. Suî-jiân hit sî i iáu-buē ū kiáⁿ, Siōng-tè ìng-ín beh sù hō͘ i tsit-ê thó͘-tē, thang tsò i kah kiáⁿ-sun ê sán-gia̍p.
English: He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on. He promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when he still had no child.

Tailo: in-uī Siōng-tè tsai lín tsia̍h ê ji̍t, lín ê ba̍k-tsiu tsiū ē khui, lín ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Siōng-tè ē-hiáu hun-pia̍t siān-ok.
English: for God knows that in the day you eat it, your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.

Tailo: Tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsûn kiaⁿ-uì Siōng-tsú ê lâng ū hok-khì; ngē i ê sim ê lâng ē hām-lo̍h tsai-hō.
English: Blessed is the man who always fears; But one who hardens his heart falls into trouble.

Tailo: Lâi-kàu hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsìng kun-tiúⁿ teh tsē, i tsiū kóng, Kun-tiúⁿ, guá ū tāi-tsì beh kā lí kóng. E-hú kóng, Beh kā guán tiong-kan siáⁿ lâng kóng? Ìn kóng, Kun-tiúⁿ, to̍h-sī lí.
English: When he came, behold, the captains of the army were sitting; and he said, I have an errand to you, captain. Jehu said, To which of us all? He said, To you, O captain.

Tailo: Siōng-tè īng I ê kuân-lîng pó-tsuân kiông-bíng ê lâng; suî-jiân i ê ua̍h-miā tsua̍t-bāng, iáu-koh ē koh khí-.lâi.
English: Yet God preserves the mighty by his power. He rises up who has no assurance of life.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h Ki-tok I-é-su kah guá tsò-hué teh kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ ê Ê-pa-hú-lah kā lí tshíng-an.
English: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,

Tailo: In ìn kóng, Tsú teh su-iàu.
English: They said, The Lord needs it.

Tailo: Gî-tióng tuì Pe-nu-el ê lâng kóng, Guá pîng-an tò tńg-.lâi ê sî, guá beh thiah tsit-ê tâi.
English: He spoke also to the men of Penuel, saying, When I come again in peace, I will break down this tower.

Tailo: Tuà tī tē-tsiūⁿ ê lâng, ē in-uī in ê sí lâi huann-hí khuài-lo̍k, kau-uāⁿ lé-mi̍h; in-uī tsit nn̄g-ê sian-ti ū hō͘ tuà tī tē-tsiūⁿ ê lâng siū tsin tsē khó͘-to̍k.
English: Those who dwell on the earth rejoice over them, and they will be glad. They will give gifts to one another, because these two prophets tormented those who dwell on the earth.

Tailo: Hit tāi ê lâng lóng sí-bông liáu-āu, koh tsi̍t tāi ê lâng hing-khí, m̄-tsai Siōng-tsú, mā m̄-tsai I uī I-su-la-el lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: Also all that generation were gathered to their fathers: and there arose another generation after them, who didn't know Yahweh, nor yet the work which he had worked for Israel.

Tailo: ' Guá í-guā lí m̄-thang ū pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng.
English: You shall have no other gods before me.

Tailo: In koh tshut siaⁿ khàu, Ool-pah kah ta-ke tsim-tshuì, to̍k-to̍k Lù-thuh kah i pàng bē lī.
English: They lifted up their voice, and wept again: and Orpah kissed her mother-in-law, but Ruth joined with her.

Tailo: Thâu-tsi̍t-tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h tshin-tshiūnn sai, tē-jī tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h tshin-tshiūnn gû-á kiáⁿ, tē-saⁿ tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h ê bīn tshin-tshiūnn lâng, tē-sì tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h tshin-tshiūnn teh pue ê ing.
English: The first creature was like a lion, and the second creature like a calf, and the third creature had a face like a man, and the fourth was like a flying eagle.

Tailo: Sàu-lô kā Siōng-tsú khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, tse sī i thâu tsi̍t pái kā Siōng-tsú khí ê tuâⁿ.
English: Saul built an altar to Yahweh: the same was the first altar that he built to Yahweh.

Tailo: Ha-to-lám, U-tsal, Tik-la̍h,
English: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

Tailo: ' Jîn-tsú it-tīng ē hông tshut-bē kau tī tsuē-jîn ê tshiú, hō͘ in tìng tī si̍p-jī-kè, tē-saⁿ ji̍t koh-ua̍h. '
English: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again?

Tailo: Lí in-uī uá-khò ka-kī ê só͘ tsò kah ka-kī ê tsâi-pó, mā ē siū lia̍h. Ke-mô͘-sih kah sio̍k i ê tsè-si, kuì-tso̍k, mā lóng ē tsò tsi̍t-ē siū tshian-suá.
English: For, because you have trusted in your works and in your treasures, you also shall be taken: and Chemosh shall go forth into captivity, his priests and his princes together.
