Tailo: Kuè sann nî, Si-mí ê nn̄g-ê lô͘-po̍k tsáu kàu Gat ông Má-kah ê kiáⁿ A-ki-si hia. Ū lâng kā Si-mí kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, lí ê lô͘-po̍k tī Gat.
English: It happened at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away to Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. They told Shimei, saying, Behold, your servants are in Gath.

Tailo: Siū lia̍h tńg-.lâi ê lâng án-ne kiânn. Tsè-si E-tsu-la̍h kah tso̍k-tiúⁿ kuí-nā-ê lâng, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k, lóng tsiàu in ê miâ siū-phài; tī tsa̍p-gue̍h tshe-it, in tsò-hué tsē, lâi tiâu-tsa tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: The children of the captivity did so. Ezra the priest, with certain heads of fathers' houses, after their fathers' houses, and all of them by their names, were set apart; and they sat down in the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.

Tailo: Ū siaⁿ tuì Tàn thuân-pò, tuì E-hu-laim suaⁿ pò tsai-hō.
English: For a voice declares from Dan, and publishes evil from the hills of Ephraim:

Tailo: Tì-huī lâng ê tsik-pī tī sūn-ho̍k ê lâng ê hīⁿ-khang lāi, ná tshin-tshiūnn kim hīⁿ-kau kah sûn-kim ê phua̍h-liān.
English: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, So is a wise reprover to an obedient ear.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tuì hit-ê Hui-lī-sū lâng kóng, Lí lâi uá-kīn guá, sī īng to, īng tshiuⁿ, īng kik ; guá lâi uá-kīn lí, sī īng bān-kun Siōng-tsú ê miâ, I-su-la-el kun-tuī ê Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī lí só͘ biáu-sī ê.
English: Then said David to the Philistine, You come to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a javelin: but I come to you in the name of Yahweh of Armies, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.

Tailo: tī jī-gue̍h tshe-it tiàu-tsi̍p huē-tsiòng. In tsiū tsiàu in ê jîn-ting, tuì jī-tsa̍p huè í-siōng, tsiàu in ê miâ-gia̍h, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu tsong-tso̍k, pâi-lia̍t in ê sè-hē.
English: They assembled all the congregation together on the first day of the second month; and they declared their ancestry by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, one by one.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Mô͘-ap ê bi̍k-sī. Tī tsi̍t mê ê tiong-kan, Mô͘-ap ê Al piàn-tsò hong-huì siau-bia̍t-.khì; tsi̍t mê ê tiong-kan Mô͘-ap ê Ki-l piàn-tsò hong-huì siau-bia̍t-.khì.
English: The burden of Moab: for in a night, Ar of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing; for in a night Kir of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing.

Tailo: Pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè ê kui-lē to̍h-sī án-ne, tsit-ê sī tsì-sìng ê.
English: This is the law of the trespass offering. It is most holy.

Tailo: Lí mā tsai guá tī Ai-ti-o-khè, Í-ko-ni-óng, Lú-su-toh só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê pik-hāi kah jím-siū, tsóng-.sī, Tsú lóng kiù guá thuat-lī tsiah-ê khó͘-lān.
English: persecutions, and sufferings: those things that happened to me at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. I endured those persecutions. Out of them all the Lord delivered me.

Tailo: Hit tsiah bíng-siù ê tsi̍t-ê thâu-khak, ná tshin-tshiūnn ū siū-kuè tì-miā-siong; i ê tì-miā-siong ū tit-tio̍h i hó. Tsuân-sè-kài ê lâng lóng kám-kak kî-kuài, tsiū lâi tuè hit tsiah bíng-siù kiânn.
English: One of his heads looked like it had been wounded fatally. His fatal wound was healed, and the whole earth marveled at the beast.

Tailo: A-hap kā O-ba-tiah kóng, Lí khì piàn kiâⁿ tsit-ê tē, khì-kàu só͘-ū ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ piⁿ kah só͘-ū ê khe piⁿ; kiám-tshái lán ē tit-tio̍h tsheⁿ-tsháu, thang hō͘ bé kah lô ua̍h lo̍h-.khì, bián-tit tsing-seⁿ tsuân-pō͘ sit-lo̍h.
English: Ahab said to Obadiah, Go through the land, to all the springs of water, and to all the brooks: peradventure we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, that we not lose all the animals.

Tailo: Lí ē hō͘ in ua̍t tńg-sin tô-tsáu, Lí ē khui kiong siā in ê bīn.
English: For you will make them turn their back, When you aim drawn bows at their face.

Tailo: Pho͘ tsio̍h ê tē sī tī hiah-ê mn̂g ê piⁿ-á kah hiah-ê mn̂g pêⁿ tn̂g, tse sī ē-bīn pho͘ tsio̍h ê tē.
English: The pavement was by the side of the gates, answerable to the length of the gates, even the lower pavement.

Tailo: Pò siau-sit ê ìn kóng, I-su-la-el lâng tī Hui-lī-sū lâng ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu, jîn-bîn tiong siū thâi ê put-tsí tsē, lí nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ — Ho-hu-nî kah Hui-ne-hah mā sí, Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī suà hō͘ in tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: He who brought the news answered, Israel is fled before the Philistines, and there has been also a great slaughter among the people, and your two sons also, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead, and the ark of God is taken.

Tailo: Tse-lo-hu-hat ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ só͘ kóng ê ū tsîng-lí, lí it-tīng tio̍h tī in lāu-pē ê hiann-tī tiong, pun tē hō͘ in tsò sán-gia̍p, tio̍h kā in lāu-pē ê sán-gia̍p kui hō͘ in.
English: The daughters of Zelophehad speak right: you shall surely give them a possession of an inheritance among their father's brothers; and you shall cause the inheritance of their father to pass to them.

Tailo: A-siul ông tuì La̍h-ki-sih tshe Thal-thàn, Lap-sa-li-suh kah Lap-siá-keh, tshuā tuā tuī ping khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê Hi-tse-kia ông hia. In khì-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm liáu-āu, tsiū lâi khiā tī tíng tî ê tsuí-kau piⁿ, to̍h-sī tī phiò-pò͘ sai-hū ê tshân ê tuā lō͘.
English: The king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great army to Jerusalem. They went up and came to Jerusalem. When they were come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fuller's field.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ê sù-tsiá tī hit bāng tiong kiò guá, kóng, ' Iâ-kop. ' Guá kóng, ' Guá tī tsia. '
English: The angel of God said to me in the dream, Jacob,' and I said, Here I am.'

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, guá tshin-seⁿ ê kiáⁿ, guá hē guān tit-tio̍h ê kiáⁿ, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kā lí kà-sī?
English: Oh, my son! Oh, son of my womb! Oh, son of my vows!

Tailo: I tó tī pēⁿ tshn̂g, Siōng-tsú ē kā i hû-tshî; i phuà-pēⁿ ê sî, Lí ē liāu-lí i ê tshn̂g-pho͘.
English: Yahweh will sustain him on his sickbed, And restore him from his bed of illness.

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè;
English: one male goat for a sin offering;

Tailo: Guá beh tsiām-tsiām tuì lín ê thâu-tsîng kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, thìng-hāu lín ê lâng-gia̍h ke-thinn tsin tsē, lâi sîng-siū hit-ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: Little by little I will drive them out from before you, until you have increased and inherit the land.

Tailo: Hûn thîng tī huē-bō͘, bô-lūn sī nn̄g ji̍t á-.sī tsi̍t gue̍h-ji̍t á-.sī tsi̍t nî, I-su-la-el lâng iû-guân tsat iâⁿ tī hia, bô tshut-huat; tsóng-.sī, hûn siu tńg-.khì, in tsiū tshut-huat.
English: Whether it was two days, or a month, or a year that the cloud stayed on the tabernacle, remaining on it, the children of Israel remained encamped, and didn't travel; but when it was taken up, they traveled.

Tailo: Mô͘-se ê tiūⁿ-lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h i tuì jîn-bîn só͘ tsò it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, tsiū kóng, Lí tuì jîn-bîn só͘ tsò ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì? Lí ná ē ka-kī tsē-.leh, tsìng lâng tuì tsá-khí kàu ê-hng lóng khiā tī lí ê sin piⁿ?
English: When Moses' father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that you do for the people? Why do you sit alone, and all the people stand around you from morning to evening?

Tailo: I-é-su siū-khì, tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê kā in khuànn, uī-tio̍h in ê sim ngē iu-būn. I tsiū tuì hit-ê lâng kóng, Kā lí ê tshiú tshun tshut-.lâi. Hit-ê lâng tsi̍t ē kā tshiú tshun tshut-.khì, tshiú tsiū ho̍k-guân.
English: When he had looked around at them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their hearts, he said to the man, Stretch out your hand. He stretched it out, and his hand was restored as healthy as the other.

Tailo: Guá īng ling kā lín tshī, bô īng pn̄g; in-uī lín iáu bē-tàng tsia̍h pn̄g, kàu tsit-má iáu-sī án-ne.
English: I fed you with milk, not with meat; for you weren't yet ready. Indeed, not even now are you ready,

Tailo: Ha-mán koh kóng, Ông-hō͘ Ê-su-tel, tû-khì guá í-guā, m̄-tsún siáⁿ lâng kah ông lâi hù i só͘ siat ê iàn-si̍k. Bîn-á-tsài guá iū-koh beh kah ông hō͘ i tshiánn;
English: Haman said moreover, Yes, Esther the queen did let no man come in with the king to the banquet that she had prepared but myself; and tomorrow also am I invited by her together with the king.

Tailo: Tī Be-thel ê tuâⁿ, í-ki̍p Ne-bat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am, hō͘ I-su-la-el huān tsuē ê, só͘ khí ê suaⁿ-thâu biō, taⁿ Io-si-iah huí hit-ê tuâⁿ kah suaⁿ-thâu biō, koh sio i ê suaⁿ-thâu biō, kā i tuî tsò hún, sūn-suà sio hit-ê A-si-lah.
English: Moreover the altar that was at Bethel, and the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, even that altar and the high place he broke down; and he burned the high place and beat it to dust, and burned the Asherah.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, tsai-hō ē lîm-kàu lí, lí m̄-tsai i tuì tó-uī lâi; tsai-hāi kàu tī lí, lí mā bē-tàng kā i tû-.khì; lí só͘ m̄-tsai ê huí-bia̍t mā ē hut-jiân lîm-kàu lí.
English: Therefore shall evil come on you; you shall not know the dawning of it: and mischief shall fall on you; you shall not be able to put it away: and desolation shall come on you suddenly, which you don't know.

Tailo: Huâ-láu tuì Iô-sé-huh kóng, Guá sī Huâ-láu, nā bô lí tshut siaⁿ tsí-sī, tī Ai-gi̍p tsuân tē, m̄-tsún lâng suî-piān tāng kha tāng tshiú.
English: Pharaoh said to Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without you shall no man lift up his hand or his foot in all the land of Egypt.

Tailo: I-é-hú-thah ìn Gi-lia̍t ê tiúⁿ-ló kóng, Í-tsîng lín kám m̄-sī uàn-hūn guá, kā guá kuáⁿ-tshut lāu-pē ê ke? Taⁿ lín tú-tio̍h huān-lān, ná ē lâi guá tsia?
English: Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, Didn't you hate me, and drive me out of my father's house? and why are you come to me now when you are in distress?

Tailo: Kiû Lí ē kì-tit Lí só͘ bīng-līng Lí ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘-se ê uē, kóng, ' Lín nā huān tsuē, Guá tsiū beh kā lín sì-suàⁿ khì lia̍t kok;
English: Remember, I beg you, the word that you commanded your servant Moses, saying, If you trespass, I will scatter you abroad among the peoples:

Tailo: M̄-koh, lâng nā tsun-siú Siōng-tè ê tō-lí, i tuì Siōng-tè ê thiàⁿ tsiū uân-tsuân si̍t-tsāi; án-ne, lán tsiū ē-tàng khak-sìn lán ū tsiàu Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì teh sing-ua̍h.
English: But whoever keeps his word, God's love has most assuredly been perfected in him. This is how we know that we are in him:

Tailo: Kuè bô kuí ji̍t, I-é-su tuì Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê Na-tsa-lia̍t lâi, tī Iol-tàn hô tuì Iô-há-neh niá siū sé-lé.
English: It happened in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

Tailo: In-uī lâng tsin tsē, bē-tàng kng uá-khì I-é-su ê sin piⁿ, in tsiū tī I-é-su tíng-bīn ê tshù tíng thiah tsi̍t khang, thang kā piàn-suī-.ê teh tó ê pho͘-á luī lo̍h-.khì.
English: When they could not come near to him for the crowd, they removed the roof where he was. When they had broken it up, they let down the mat that the paralytic was lying on.

Tailo: Lâng suî-piān kóng, Tse sī sìng-mi̍h , hē guān liáu-āu tsiah tsa-mn̄g, tse suah tsiâⁿ-tsò i ka-kī ê lô-bāng.
English: It is a snare to a man to make a rash dedication, Then later to consider his vows.

Tailo: Phâu ê ē-kha pô͘, īng nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu kah kuè-pháng ê iù-tē, tsò sia̍h-liû hîng ê tsong-sik.
English: They made on the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, scarlet, and twined linen.

Tailo: Suî-jiân ū huân-ló, kî-si̍t tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ū hí-lo̍k; suî-jiân sàn-tshiah, kî-si̍t hō͘ tsin tsē lâng hó-gia̍h; kah-ná bô puàⁿ-hāng, kî-si̍t ta̍k hāng lóng ū.
English: as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things.

Tailo: Tuì hia king-kuè ê lâng bú-jio̍k I-é-su, iô thâu kóng,
English: Those who passed by blasphemed him, wagging their heads,

Tailo: Thiàⁿ guá ê lâng kah guá ê pîng-iú, in-uī guá ê pháiⁿ tsìng-thâu lóng siám khì piⁿ-á; guá ê tshin-tsiâⁿ mā khiā hn̄g-hn̄g.
English: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my plague. My kinsmen stand far away.

Tailo: Iô-tah ông Iô-sa-huat tsa̍p-peh nî, A-hap ê kiáⁿ Io-lâm tī Sa-má-lī-a tsē-uī, tsò I-su-la-el ông, kiōng tsa̍p-jī nî.
English: Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years.

Tailo: I-é-su tsin thiàⁿ Mal-tha kah i ê sió-muē, í-ki̍p La̍h-tsa-lō͘.
English: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.

Tailo: tshù-tsú tio̍h khì thong-ti tsè-si, kā i kóng, ' Tsiàu guá khuànn, tshù lāi tshin-tshiūnn ū tsìng-thâu. '
English: then he who owns the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, There seems to me to be some sort of plague in the house.'

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu E-li-iah kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to him, saying,

Tailo: I mā sī ū siū kat-lé ê lâng ê tsó͘-sian, in-uī in m̄-nā ū siū kat-lé, mā ū kin-tuè lán ê tsó͘-sian A-bu-la-hàm iáu-buē siū kat-lé í-tsîng to̍h ū ê sìn-sim, īng i tsò bô͘-huān teh sing-ua̍h.
English: The father of circumcision to those who not only are of the circumcision, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which he had in uncircumcision.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng m̄ tsiap-thāi lín, m̄-thiaⁿ lín ê uē, lín lī-khui hit king tshù á-.sī hit-ê siâⁿ ê sî, tio̍h kā lín kha-.ni̍h ê thô͘-sua hún puāⁿ hō͘ i tshing-khì.
English: Whoever doesn't receive you, nor hear your words, as you go out of that house or that city, shake off the dust from your feet.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh m̄-khíng. I tuì i ê tsú-bó kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tshù lāi ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tī guá ê tshiú, guá ê tsú-lâng lóng m̄-tsai, i í-king kā só͘-ū ê lóng kau tī guá ê tshiú tiong.
English: But he refused, and said to his master's wife, Behold, my master doesn't know what is with me in the house, and he has put all that he has into my hand.

Tailo: Hiah-ê khong-su bōng-sióng ê lâng mā kāng-khuán hō͘ in ê jio̍k-thé huān tsuē, koh biáu-sī Siōng-tè ê kuân-ui, siat-to̍k thinn-tíng tsun-kuì ê.
English: Yet in like manner these also in their dreaming defile the flesh, despise authority, and slander celestial beings.

Tailo: Tī i ji̍p-khì ê tshù, kā hit ke ê tsú-lâng kóng, ' Lāu-su kóng, guá beh kah bûn-tô͘ tsia̍h Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh buán-tshan ê kheh-thiaⁿ tī tó-uī? '
English: and wherever he enters in, tell the master of the house, The Teacher says, Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?'

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, uàn-hūn Lí ê lâng guá kám bô uàn-hūn in? Khí-lâi kong-kik Lí ê lâng guá kám bô thó-ià in?
English: Yahweh, don't I hate those who hate you? Am I not grieved with those who rise up against you?

Tailo: Lí ê sing-ua̍h khah iâⁿ ji̍t-tiong-tàu, suî-jiân kàu àm sî, iû-guân tshin-tshiūnn tsá-khí sî.
English: Life shall be clearer than the noonday; Though there is darkness, it shall be as the morning.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ mā tio̍h tuì jîn-bîn suan-pò͘, kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng khí sin-tshù iáu-buē kiânn lo̍k-sîng ê lé? I tio̍h tńg-khì in tau, khióng-kiaⁿ i ē tīn-bông suah hō͘ pa̍t lâng kiânn lo̍k-sîng ê lé.
English: The officers shall speak to the people, saying, What man is there who has built a new house, and has not dedicated it? let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man dedicate it.

Tailo: Guá tsá to̍h káng-kiù Lí ê kà-sī, Lí khak-li̍p hiah-ê kà-sī kàu íng-uán.
English: Of old I have known from your testimonies, That you have founded them forever. RESH

Tailo: Guán ê tsó͘-sian uá-khò Lí; in uá-khò Lí, Lí tsiū kā in tsín-kiù.
English: Our fathers trusted in you. They trusted, and you delivered them.

Tailo: In-uī Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng kah só͘-ū ê Iô-tá-iah lâng lóng tsun-siú kó͘-tsá lâng ê thuân-thóng, nā bô kā tshiú sé kah tsin tshing-khì, tsiū bô tsia̍h pn̄g;
English: ( For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, don't eat unless they wash their hands and forearms, holding to the tradition of the elders.

Tailo: M̄-thang tī Gat pò-kò; m̄-thang tī A-si-ke-lông ê ke-lō͘ suan-iông; khióng-kiaⁿ Hui-lī-sū ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á huann-hí; khióng-kiaⁿ bô siū kat-lé ê lâng ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á tuā huann-hí.
English: Don't tell it in Gath, Don't publish it in the streets of Ashkelon; Lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, Lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, I ū liân-bín; I sià-bián in ê tsuē-kò, I bô kā in siau-bia̍t, koh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ siau I ê siū-khì, bô tsuân-pō͘ huat-tshut I ê siū-khì.
English: But he, being merciful, forgave iniquity, and didn't destroy them. Yes, many times he turned his anger away, And didn't stir up all his wrath.

Tailo: In-uī hit-ê put-huat ê sîn-pì sè-li̍k í-king khai-sí teh ūn-tsok, to̍k-to̍k tio̍h tán kàu tsó͘-tòng ê sè-li̍k thiat-lī liáu-āu tsiah ē huat-sing.
English: For the mystery of lawlessness already works. Only there is one who restrains now, until he is taken out of the way.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h īng ní âng ê iûⁿ-káng phuê, tsò pò͘-pênn ê kuà, koh īng hái-káu phuê tī tíng-bīn tsò kuà.
English: You shall make a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of sea cow hides above.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm kā it-tshè só͘-ū ê hō͘ Í-sak.
English: Abraham gave all that he had to Isaac,

Tailo: In-uī king-tián ū án-ne kóng, A-bu-la-hàm sìn Siōng-tè, só͘-í, Siōng-tè tsiū kā i khuàⁿ-tsò sī gī lâng. ( tsù, CSK 15:6 )
English: For what does the Scripture say? Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tī siàu-liân ê ji̍t-tsí, kì-liām tshòng-tsō lí ê Tsú, to̍h-sī huān-lān ê ji̍t iáu-buē kàu, mā sī lí só͘ kóng ê Guá bô thang tuì án-ne tit-tio̍h khuài-lo̍k , hiah-ê nî iáu-buē tsiap-kīn ê sî;
English: Remember also your Creator in the days of your youth, Before the evil days come, and the years draw near, When you will say, I have no pleasure in them;

Tailo: Guán siū lia̍h liáu-āu tsa̍p-jī nî tsa̍p-gue̍h tshe gō͘, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm tô-tsáu lâi-kàu guá tsia, kóng, Siâⁿ í-king siū kong-phuà.
English: It happened in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one who had escaped out of Jerusalem came to me, saying, The city has been struck.

Tailo: Khí-tsho͘ hok-im tsin-tō thuân hō͘ lín ê sî, lín thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê hok-im, ū tuà-lâi khǹg tī thinn-tíng ê ǹg-bāng.
English: because of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens, of which you heard before in the word of the truth of the Good News,

Tailo: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t, to̍h-sī Mol-té-kái tsē tī ông-kiong mn̂g kháu ê sî, ông ê thài-kàm tiong-kan ū kò͘-mn̂g ê nn̄g lâng — Bik-thàn kah The-le-sih, in siū-khì kè-bô͘ beh hāi A-ha-sui-ló͘ ông.
English: In those days, while Mordecai was sitting in the king's gate, two of the king's chamberlains, Bigthan and Teresh, of those who kept the threshold, were angry, and sought to lay hands on the king Ahasuerus.

Tailo: Ū tuā-hàn tso̍k ê tsi̍t-ê lâng, miâ kiò-tsò Í-si̍t-pí-lo̍k, i ê tshiuⁿ ê tâng tāng saⁿ pah si-khel, koh phāinn sin ê to, beh thâi Ta-bi̍t.
English: and Ishbibenob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David.

Tailo: Tsiū thâi hit tsiah mî-iûnn-káng, Mô͘-se īng hueh hiù tī tuâⁿ tíng ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: He killed it; and Moses sprinkled the blood on the altar round about.

Tailo: Guá — Ta-ni-el, guá ê sim-sîn tī guá ê lāi-bīn teh iu-būn, sim-lāi ê ī-siōng hō͘ guá put-an.
English: As for me, Daniel, my spirit was grieved in the midst of my body, and the visions of my head troubled me.

Tailo: Lí tsit khuán ê só͘ tsò sī m̄-hó! Guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú tsiù-tsuā, lín lóng sī kai sí ê, in-uī bô pó-hō͘ lín ê tsú, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú só͘ buah iû ê. Taⁿ, lí khuàⁿ, ông ê thâu-khak piⁿ ê tshiuⁿ kah tsuí-pân tī tó-uī?
English: This thing isn't good that you have done. As Yahweh lives, you are worthy to die, because you have not kept watch over your lord, Yahweh's anointed. Now see where the king's spear is, and the jar of water that was at his head.

Tailo: tshiú-kang iù ê saⁿ-khò͘, tī sìng-só͘ tshīng lâi ho̍k-sāi ê, to̍h-sī tsè-si A-lông ê sìng-saⁿ kah i ê kiáⁿ ê saⁿ, tshīng lâi tam-tng tsè-si ê tsit.
English: the finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office.'

Tailo: Lín gia̍h-khí tshiú lâi, Guá beh am ba̍k-tsiu m̄-khuàⁿ lín; lín ū tsin tsē kî-tó, Guá mā m̄-thiaⁿ; lín ê tshiú tshiong-muá thâi lâng ê hueh.
English: When you spread forth your hands, I will hide my eyes from you; Yes, when you make many prayers, I will not hear. Your hands are full of blood.

Tailo: Koh-tsài kóng, lín só͘ iā ê bô-lūn sī be̍h-á, á-.sī pa̍t tsióng ê ngó͘-kok, tsí-put-kò sī tsi̍t lia̍p tsíng-tsí, m̄-sī āu-lâi sîng-tióng ê hîng-thé.
English: That which you sow, you don't sow the body that will be, but a bare grain, maybe of wheat, or of some other kind.

Tailo: Kàu àm, Iâ-kop tuì tshân-.ni̍h tńg-.lâi, Le-ah tshut-khì kā i gîng-tsiap, kóng, Lí tio̍h kah guá tsò-hué khùn, in-uī guá í-king īng guá ê kiáⁿ ê tshui-tsîng-kó tshiàⁿ lí. Hit mê, Iâ-kop tsiū kah i tsò-hué khùn.
English: Jacob came from the field in the evening, and Leah went out to meet him, and said, You must come in to me; for I have surely hired you with my son's mandrakes. He lay with her that night.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ín-tsún Le-ah, i tsiū huâi-īn, kā Iâ-kop seⁿ tē-gō͘-ê kiáⁿ.
English: God listened to Leah, and she conceived, and bore Jacob a fifth son.

Tailo: Lí nā uī-tio̍h tsia̍h-mi̍h ê tāi-tsì, hō͘ lí ê hiann-tī sim-kuann kan-khó͘, lí ê hîng-uî tsiū m̄-sī tshut tī thiàⁿ-sim. Lí m̄-thang uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê tsia̍h-mi̍h lâi pāi-huāi Ki-tok ū thè i sí ê lâng.
English: Yet if because of food your brother is grieved, you walk no longer in love. Don't destroy with your food him for whom Christ died.

Tailo: Ial-mut kah i ê kau-iá, Ún-kan-lîng kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng sì tsō siâⁿ hō͘ in.
English: Jarmuth with its suburbs, En Gannim with its suburbs; four cities.

Tailo: Hit gō͘-ê ông tô-tsáu, bih tī Ma̍k-ke-tah ê tōng lāi.
English: These five kings fled, and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.

Tailo: Lí kā I-su-la-el lâng kóng, tio̍h hiàn lé-mi̍h hō͘ Guá, kiàn-nā sim só͘ kam-guān ê, lín thang kā i siu lâi tsò lé-mi̍h hō͘ Guá.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, that they take an offering for me. From everyone whose heart makes him willing you shall take my offering.

Tailo: Kò͘-mn̂g ê lú-pī kā Piat-tò͘ kóng, Lí mā sī tsit-ê lâng ê bûn-tô͘ ho͘h? Piat-tò͘ kóng, M̄-sī.
English: Then the maid who kept the door said to Peter, Are you also one of this man's disciples? He said, I am not.

Tailo: Lâng ê phuê-hu nā tsíng, kiám-tshái seⁿ sián á-.sī seⁿ hué-pan, tī i ê phuê-hu piàn-tsò thái-ko ê tsìng-thâu, tio̍h tshuā i kàu tsè-si A-lông, á-.sī kàu i ê kiáⁿ-sun ê tsi̍t-ê tsè-si bīn-tsîng.
English: When a man shall have a rising in his body's skin, or a scab, or a bright spot, and it becomes in the skin of his body the plague of leprosy, then he shall be brought to Aaron the priest, or to one of his sons the priests:

Tailo: In ê thiàⁿ, in ê uàn-hūn kah in ê tsi̍t-tò͘, lóng í-king siau-bia̍t. Tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn só͘ kiâⁿ ê it-tshè tāi-tsì, íng-uán bô in ê hūn.
English: Also their love, their hatred, and their envy has perished long ago; neither have they any more a portion forever in anything that is done under the sun.

Tailo: Ping-á kā I-é-su tìng tī si̍p-jī-kè tíng liáu-āu tsiū tsò khau-á lâi pun I ê saⁿ.
English: When they had crucified him, they divided his clothing among them, casting lots,

Tailo: Taⁿ guān kā guá ê uē siá khí-.lâi, koh kì tī tsheh-.ni̍h;
English: Oh that my words were now written! Oh that they were inscribed in a book!

Tailo: Lâng nā kóng ka-kī sing-ua̍h tī kng-bîng tiong, m̄-koh, iáu-teh uàn-hūn i ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē, i sū-si̍t siōng sī iáu-koh sing-ua̍h tī o͘-àm tiong.
English: He who says he is in the light and hates his brother, is in the darkness even until now.

Tailo: Guá tsai lí ê só͘ tsò. Lí khuàⁿ, guá í-king tī lí ê bīn-tsîng kā lí khui tsi̍t sìⁿ mn̂g, sī bô lâng ē-tàng kuainn ê. Guá mā tsai lí kan-taⁿ ū tām-po̍h-á khuì-la̍t, khiok ū tsun-siú guá ê tō-lí, m̄-bat hó͘nn-jīn guá ê miâ.
English: I know your works ( behold, I have set before you an open door, which no one can shut ) , that you have a little power, and kept my word, and didn't deny my name.

Tailo: Tē-jī-ê, tē-saⁿ-ê, kàu tē-tshit-ê lóng sī kāng-khuán tsîng-hîng.
English: In like manner the second also, and the third, to the seventh.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè si̍t-tsāi án-ne kóng: Kóng-tio̍h lâu tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān kah Iô-tah ông-kiong, í-ki̍p Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê khì-kū,
English: yes, thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, concerning the vessels that are left in the house of Yahweh, and in the house of the king of Judah, and at Jerusalem:

Tailo: I koh kā in kóng, Khì, lín khì tsia̍h puî ê mi̍h, lim tinn ê bī; tio̍h pun hō͘ bô tsún-pī mi̍h ê lâng, in-uī kin-á-ji̍t sī lán ê Tsú ê sìng-ji̍t. Lín m̄-thang iu-būn, in-uī tuì Siōng-tsú tit-tio̍h ê huann-hí sī lín ê khuì-la̍t.
English: Then he said to them, Go your way, eat the fat, and drink the sweet, and send portions to him for whom nothing is prepared; for this day is holy to our Lord. Don't be grieved; for the joy of Yahweh is your strength.

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, Lí kám sī beh khì-sak guán? Siōng-tè ah, Lí kám bô beh kah guán ê kun-ping tsò-hué tshut-tsing?
English: Haven't you, God, rejected us? You don't go out with our armies, God.

Tailo: Tsit sî liáu-āu, Αp-sa-lôm uī ka-kī tsún-pī tshia-bé, koh ū gō͘ tsa̍p lâng kiânn tī i ê thâu-tsîng.
English: It happened after this, that Absalom prepared him a chariot and horses, and fifty men to run before him.

Tailo: Tng Iô-tah ông — Io-si-iah ê kiáⁿ E-hō͘-iá-kim tsē-uī ê sî, Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,

Tailo: Guá koh khuànn, ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-phiàn pe̍h-hûn, hûn tíng tsē tsi̍t-ê lâng tshin-tshiūnn Jîn-tsú, thâu-khak tì kim ê bián-liû, tshiú gia̍h tsi̍t ki lāi ê liâm-li̍k-á.
English: I looked, and behold, a white cloud; and on the cloud one sitting like a son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.

Tailo: Ī-pang huā-huā háu, lia̍t kok iô-tāng; Siōng-tè tshut I ê siann, tē tsiū siau-iûⁿ.
English: The nations raged. The kingdoms were moved. He lifted his voice, and the earth melted.

Tailo: Guá kám tio̍h koh kóng? Guá bô sî-kan thang thê-khí Gî-tióng, Ba-la̍k, Sâm-sóng, I-é-hú-thah, Ta-bi̍t, Sa-mu-el kah tsìng sian-ti ê tāi-tsì.
English: What more shall I say? For the time would fail me if I told of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, Samuel, and the prophets;

Tailo: Mô͘-se bē-tàng ji̍p-khì huē-bō͘, in-uī hûn thîng tī hit tíng-bīn, koh ū Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng tshiong-muá tī huē-bō͘.
English: Moses wasn't able to enter into the tent of meeting, because the cloud stayed on it, and Yahweh's glory filled the tent.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ka-kī sí-.khì ê mi̍h, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h, thang hō͘ lín mn̂g lāi kià-kha ê lâng tsia̍h á-.sī bē hō͘ guā-kok lâng tsia̍h, in-uī lí sī sìng ê jîn-bîn, sio̍k tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè. Tsú suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á, m̄-thang īng i ê bú ê ling.
English: You shall not eat of anything that dies of itself: you may give it to the foreigner living among you who is within your gates, that he may eat it; or you may sell it to a foreigner: for you are a holy people to Yahweh your God. You shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk.

Tailo: Tsin-lí ê sìn-sit kah Siōng-tè ê kuân-lîng, lâi piáu-bîng guán sī Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k. Guán īng tsìng-gī tsò bú-khì kong-kik tuì-ti̍k, pó-hō͘ ka-kī.
English: in the word of truth, in the power of God; by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,

Tailo: Hái tsuí tiòng kuân, Lí kā i kuán-tsè; hái-íng giâ khí-.lâi, Lí hō͘ i pîng-tsīng.
English: You rule the pride of the sea. When its waves rise up, you calm them.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng tsia̍h pá liáu-āu, I-é-su kā bûn-tô͘ kóng, Kā tsia̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê sut-á khioh khí-.lâi, m̄-thang phah-sńg.
English: When they were filled, he said to his disciples, Gather up the broken pieces which are left over, that nothing be lost.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tsiū tshe lâng khì-kàu Tha-mal ê tshù, kā i kóng, Taⁿ lí khì lí ê a-hiaⁿ Am-non ê tshù, kā i tsún-pī tsia̍h-mi̍h.
English: Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to your brother Amnon's house, and dress him food.

Tailo: Taⁿ pó͘-thâu kám ē tuì gia̍h ka-kī lâi tshò tshâ ê lâng khua-kháu? Kù-á kám ē tuì hit-ê thua kì ê lâng phòng-hong? Tse sī tshin-tshiūnn thuî-á ē ūn-tsuán hit-ê gia̍h i ê lâng, koh tshin-tshiūnn kuái-á ē gia̍h-khí hit-ê m̄-sī tshâ tsò ê lâng.
English: Should an axe brag against him who chops with it? Should a saw exalt itself above him who saws with it? As if a rod should lift those who lift it up, or as if a staff should lift up someone who is not wood.

Tailo: Lí ê só͘-tsāi bô koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h kiông-pō, lí ê kíng lāi bô koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h pha-hng, huí-bia̍t ê tāi-tsì; lí ē tshing lí ê tshiûⁿ tsò tsín-kiù, tshing lí ê mn̂g tsò o-ló.
English: Violence shall no more be heard in your land, desolation nor destruction within your borders; but you shall call your walls Salvation, and your gates Praise.

Tailo: Tú-hó ū tsi̍t-ê khuê-tshiú ê lâng tī hia. Ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng siūⁿ beh tshuē khang-phāng lâi kò I-é-su, tsiū mn̄g I kóng, An-hioh-ji̍t i-pēⁿ kám ū tsiàu lu̍t-huat ê kui-tīng?
English: And behold there was a man with a withered hand. They asked him, Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day? that they might accuse him.

Tailo: Tē-sann tiâu miâ kiò-tsò Ti-gu-lí-su, to̍h-sī lâu tī A-siul ê tang pîng ê. Tē-sì tiâu to̍h-sī Iu-hu-la-té.
English: The name of the third river is Hiddekel: this is the one which flows in front of Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.

Tailo: I hē guān, kóng, Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ah, Lí nā kó-jiân suî-lo̍h khuàⁿ-kò͘ Lí ê lú-pī ê kan-lân, koh siàu-liām guá, bô bē kì-tit Lí ê lú-pī, siúⁿ-sù Lí ê lú-pī seⁿ tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ, guá beh hō͘ i kui tī Siōng-tsú kàu tsi̍t-sì-lâng, thì thâu to bē kàu i ê thâu-khak.
English: She vowed a vow, and said, Yahweh of Armies, if you will indeed look on the affliction of your handmaid, and remember me, and not forget your handmaid, but will give to your handmaid a boy, then I will give him to Yahweh all the days of his life, and there shall no razor come on his head.

Tailo: Ū lâng liân sè-hàn gín-á mā tshuā-lâi beh hō͘ I-é-su huāⁿ-tshiú. Bûn-tô͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsiū kā in tsik-pī.
English: They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they rebuked them.

Tailo: Iûⁿ-ko tsiū kiânn tsìn-tsîng, tuì tsē tī pó-tsō hit uī ê tsiàⁿ tshiú the̍h hit kńg tsheh.
English: Then he came, and he took it out of the right hand of him who sat on the throne.

Tailo: Tī Lú-su-toh ū tsi̍t-ê pái-kha-.ê, put-sî tsē-.leh, sī tuì tshut-sì tsiū nńg-kha, lóng bē kiânn.
English: At Lystra a certain man sat, impotent in his feet, a cripple from his mother's womb, who never had walked.

Tailo: A-tāi-lio̍k, Ti-bóng, Ia-tsel, Lîng-la̍h, He-si-bóng, E-lé-a-leh, Sī-pan, Ne-bó, Pí-ún,
English: Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, and Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Sebam, and Nebo, and Beon,

Tailo: Lín mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, lín tsò uân siū kau-tài ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h kóng, ' Guán sī bô lō͘-īng ê lô͘-po̍k, kan-tāⁿ tsīn pún-hūn khì tsò niā-niā. '
English: Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.'

Tailo: Lî-á tuì Pa-lân kóng, Guá kám m̄-sī lí ê lî-á, lí it-sing só͘ khiâ ê? Guá pîng-sî kám bat tuì lí án-ne tsò? Pa-lân kóng, M̄-bat.
English: The donkey said to Balaam, Am I not your donkey, on which you have ridden all your life long to this day? was I ever wont to do so to you? and he said, No.

Tailo: In-uī guá uī-tio̍h Lí ê iân-kò͘ siū tshoh-mē, guá muá-bīn kiàn-siàu.
English: Because for your sake, I have borne reproach. Shame has covered my face.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khan tsi̍t tsiah kang ê mî-iûⁿ lâi, A-lông kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ tio̍h tī hit tsiah iûⁿ ê thâu-khak tíng huāⁿ-tshiú.
English: You shall also take the one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram.

Tailo: Koh īng nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu kah iù-tē pò͘ tsò tiùⁿ, siù ki-lō͘-ping tī tiùⁿ ê tíng-bīn.
English: He made the veil of blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and ornamented it with cherubim.

Tailo: Tuā-tsè-si An-na̍h kah Kai-a-huah, Iô-há-neh, A-li̍k-san-toh, í-ki̍p tuā-tsè-si ê ka-tso̍k mā lóng tī hia.
English: Annas the high priest was there, with Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and as many as were relatives of the high priest.

Tailo: In tsiū tshuā i lâi I-é-su hia. Hit-ê kuí tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su, tsiū suî-sî hō͘ hit-ê gín-á tuā thiu-tshuah, kā i siak lo̍h-khì thô͘-kha, hō͘ i liàn-lâi liàn-khì koh lâu-nuā.
English: They brought him to him, and when he saw him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground, wallowing and foaming at the mouth.

Tailo: Ting-tâi thiāu ū sì-ê pue, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn hīng-hue, ū i ê ki kah i ê hue.
English: and in the lampstand four cups made like almond blossoms, its buds and its flowers;

Tailo: Khùn tī hit king tshù ê, tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ-khò͘; tī hit king tshù tsia̍h ê mā tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ-khò͘.
English: He who lies down in the house shall wash his clothes; and he who eats in the house shall wash his clothes.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng khì tshuē Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, kā in pò-kò I-é-su só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì.
English: But some of them went away to the Pharisees, and told them the things which Jesus had done.

Tailo: In-uī i tsè-sū Ta-má-su-ko ê sîn-bîng. Tsiū-sī kā i phah ê, kóng, In-uī A-lâm ông ê sîn-bîng kā in pang-tsān, guá mā kā i tsè-sū, hō͘ i pang-tsān guá. Tsóng-.sī, hiah-ê sîn-bîng hō͘ i kah I-su-la-el jîn-bîn lóng tó-huāi.
English: For he sacrificed to the gods of Damascus, which struck him; and he said, Because the gods of the kings of Syria helped them, therefore will I sacrifice to them, that they may help me. But they were the ruin of him, and of all Israel.

Tailo: i uī-tio̍h hit tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng ê sò͘-tsè tio̍h tsi̍t-ê e-huat, uī-tio̍h hiah-ê iûⁿ-ko ê sò͘-tsè sī tsiàu i ê king-tsè li̍k-liōng, tsi̍t-ê e-huat phuè iû tsi̍t hin.
English: and the meal offering shall be an ephah for the ram, and the meal offering for the lambs as he is able to give, and a hin of oil to an ephah.

Tailo: Lí tsín-tsè ê sî, tsiàⁿ tshiú só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì m̄-thang hō͘ lí ê tò tshiú tsai-iáⁿ.
English: But when you do merciful deeds, don't let your left hand know what your right hand does,

Tailo: In m̄-jīn Siōng-tsú, tsiū kóng, Tse pīng m̄-sī I, tsai-hō ē lîm-kàu guán; guán mā bē tú-tio̍h to-kiàm kah ki-hng.
English: They have denied Yahweh, and said, It is not he; neither shall evil come on us; neither shall we see sword nor famine:

Tailo: Tsin tsē lâng kā i tsik-pī, kiò i tiām-tiām, m̄-koh, i koh khah tuā-siaⁿ huah, Ta-bi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun ah, khó-liân guá!
English: Many rebuked him, that he should be quiet, but he cried out much more, You son of David, have mercy on me!

Tailo: Tuâⁿ tíng ê hué tio̍h tī tíng-bīn tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ to̍h, m̄-thang hua. Tsè-si tio̍h ta̍k tsá-khí tī hit tíng-bīn sio tshâ, koh kā sio-tsè pâi tī tuâⁿ tíng, tī hit tíng-bīn sio siā-un-tsè ê iû.
English: The fire on the altar shall be kept burning on it, it shall not go out; and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning: and he shall lay the burnt offering in order upon it, and shall burn on it the fat of the peace offerings.

Tailo: Koh īng kim an-tsng tiān kah thong-niû, hō͘-tīng, tshiûⁿ-piah kah mn̂g-sìⁿ, piah tíng khik ki-lō͘-ping.
English: He overlaid also the house, the beams, the thresholds, and the walls of it, and the doors of it, with gold; and engraved cherubim on the walls.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê Mó͘-leh-a ê suaⁿ tāng-kang khí Siōng-tsú ê tiān, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú tuì i ê lāu-pē Ta-bi̍t tshut-hiān ê só͘-tsāi, Ta-bi̍t bat tī I-é-bú-suh lâng Ol-nân ê tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ tiāⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê tē.
English: Then Solomon began to build the house of Yahweh at Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where Yahweh appeared to David his father, which he made ready in the place that David had appointed, in the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

Tailo: Tse sī in-uī Ba-siah it-tshè ê tsuē kah i ê kiáⁿ E-la̍h ê tsuē; in nn̄g lâng só͘ huān-.tio̍h ê mā hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng huān-.tio̍h, in īng hi-ké ê ngó͘-siōng lâi kik Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè siū-khì.
English: for all the sins of Baasha, and the sins of Elah his son, which they sinned, and with which they made Israel to sin, to provoke Yahweh, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.

Tailo: Lín lóng m̄-thang tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h kang, tse tī lín it-tshè tuà ê só͘-tsāi, tsò lín ta̍k sè-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: You shall do no manner of work: it is a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

Tailo: niá-siū kim-gîn tsò bián-liû, tì tī Io-tsa-tak ê kiáⁿ — tuā-tsè-si Io-siú-ah ê thâu-khak,
English: Yes, take silver and gold, and make crowns, and set them on the head of Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest;

Tailo: I-é-hú-thah tshe hiah-ê sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ Am-móng lâng ê ông kóng, Lí kah guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khan-liân, kìng-jiân lâi guá tsia kong-kik guá ê tē?
English: Jephthah sent messengers to the king of the children of Ammon, saying, What have you to do with me, that you are come to me to fight against my land?

Tailo: Ū lâng teh kóng-khí sìng-tiān sī īng hó tsio̍h kah só͘ hiàn ê mi̍h lâi táⁿ-pān. Hit sî, I-é-su kóng,
English: As some were talking about the temple and how it was decorated with beautiful stones and gifts, he said,

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat tsiū ànn thâu phak tī thô͘-kha, Iô-tah kûn-tsiòng kah tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn, mā lóng phak tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, kìng-pài Siōng-tsú.
English: Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground; and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell down before Yahweh, worshipping Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú hō͘ hái khí tuā hong, hái tiong hong-íng tsin tuā, tì-sú tsûn kiông-beh phuà-.khì.
English: But Yahweh sent out a great wind on the sea, and there was a mighty tempest on the sea, so that the ship was likely to break up.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tam-tng tsè-si-tsit ê Lē-bī ê kiáⁿ-sun, suî-jiân kah I-su-la-el jîn-bîn lóng sī A-bu-la-hàm ê kiáⁿ-sun, pêⁿ-pêⁿ sī hiann-tī, iáu-koh tio̍h hōng bīng-līng, tsiàu lu̍t-huat tuì jîn-bîn tsing-siu in siu-ji̍p ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it.
English: They indeed of the sons of Levi who receive the priest's office have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law, that is, of their brothers, though these have come out of the body of Abraham,

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tuì I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tshe lâng khì Be-thel tang pîng, uá-kīn Bia̍t-a-biân ê Ai siânn, kā in huan-hù kóng, Lín khì thàm-khuàⁿ hit-ê tē. In tsiū khì thàm-khuàⁿ Ai siânn.
English: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth Aven, on the east side of Bethel, and spoke to them, saying, Go up and spy out the land. The men went up and spied out Ai.

Tailo: Nn̄g ki thiāu tíng, kīn bāng-á piⁿ phòng-îⁿ ê só͘-tsāi, ū thiāu-táu, koh ū sia̍h-liû nn̄g pah lia̍p tī tē-jī-ê thiāu-táu, ta̍k tsuā kā i uî-.leh.
English: There were capitals above also on the two pillars, close by the belly which was beside the network: and the pomegranates were two hundred, in rows round about on the other capital.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ gín-á suî-sî khí-lâi kiâⁿ, in-uī i í-king tsa̍p-jī huè à. Tsìng lâng tsiū tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì.
English: Immediately the girl rose up, and walked, for she was twelve years old. They were amazed with great amazement.

Tailo: I tsiū kā in kóng, Lín ná ē kiânn tsiah-ê tāi-tsì? Guá tuì tsiah-ê tsìng lâng ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín ê pháiⁿ só͘ kiâⁿ.
English: He said to them, Why do you such things? for I hear of your evil dealings from all this people.

Tailo: I khuànn an-tsīng tsò hó, khuànn thó͘-tē tsò suí; tàⁿ īng king-kah-thâu taⁿ-teh, tsiâⁿ-tsò lô-khó͘ ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: He saw a resting place, that it was good, The land, that it was pleasant; He bows his shoulder to the burden, And becomes a servant doing forced labor.

Tailo: Bô khiân-sîng ê lâng it-tīng bē seⁿ-thuàⁿ; o͘-se ê lâng ê pò͘-pênn ē hō͘ hué sio-.khì.
English: For the company of the godless shall be barren, And fire shall consume the tents of bribery.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kā in kóng, Guā-pang lâng ê kun-ông tsò tsú lâi tī-lí jîn-bîn; thóng-tī-tsiá kiò-tsò Un-tsú.
English: He said to them, The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called benefactors.'

Tailo: Tē-tsa̍p ji̍t sī Tàn kiáⁿ-sun ê siú-líng, A-mí-siá-tái ê kiáⁿ A-hí-e-tsel.
English: On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, prince of the children of Dan

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā hiah-ê kuái-á hē tī huē-bō͘ lāi huat-kuī ê thâu-tsîng, to̍h-sī Guá kah lín siong-huē ê só͘-tsāi.
English: You shall lay them up in the tent of meeting before the testimony, where I meet with you.

Tailo: I ê lāu-pē Hi-lâm īng kng-iāⁿ-iāⁿ ê tâng, kā Só͘-lô-móng ông uī Siōng-tsú ê tiān tsò puânn, thuh-á, bah-tshe kah ta̍k tsióng ê khì-kū.
English: The pots also, and the shovels, and the forks, and all the vessels of it, did Huram his father make for king Solomon for the house of Yahweh of bright brass.

Tailo: lí ê sim tsiū nńg, ka-kī khiam-pi tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, in-uī lí thiaⁿ-tio̍h I só͘ kóng kong-kik tsit só͘-tsāi kah tuà tī tsia ê jîn-bîn ê uē, hit sî lí tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng ka-kī khiam-pi, koh thiah-li̍h lí ê saⁿ, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu, Guá í-king thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê uē. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: because your heart was tender, and you did humble yourself before God, when you heard his words against this place, and against the inhabitants of it, and have humbled yourself before me, and have torn your clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard you, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kuáⁿ-kín tsàu khì khiā tī hit-ê Hui-lī-sū lâng ê tíng-bīn, kā i ê to pue̍h tshut siù, īng hit ki to kā i thâi-sí, tsám i ê thâu-khak. Hui-lī-sū kûn-tsiòng khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê ióng-sū í-king sí, tsiū kuáⁿ-kín tsàu.
English: Then David ran, and stood over the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath of it, and killed him, and cut off his head therewith. When the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ tì-huī lâng ê uē; tsuan-sim lâi niá-siū guá ê tì-sik.
English: Turn your ear, and listen to the words of the wise. Apply your heart to my teaching.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-pē só͘ kau-tài guá ê lâng lóng ē lâi guá tsia; lâi guá tsia ê lâng, guá tsua̍t-tuì bē kā i khì-sak.
English: All those who the Father gives me will come to me. Him who comes to me I will in no way throw out.

Tailo: Ông koh kóng, Lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kan-khó͘? I ìn kóng, Tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tuì guá kóng, kau tshut lí ê kiáⁿ, lán kin-á-ji̍t thang kā i tsia̍h, bîn-á-tsài lán tsia̍h guá ê kiáⁿ.
English: The king said to her, What ails you? She answered, This woman said to me, Give your son, that we may eat him today, and we will eat my son tomorrow.

Tailo: Tshân pha-hng, tē pi-ai; in-uī ngó͘-kok huí-huāi, sin tsiú ta-.khì, iû mā khiàm-khueh.
English: The field is laid waste. The land mourns, for the grain is destroyed, The new wine has dried up, And the oil languishes.

Tailo: Tsit ki thiāu kuân tsa̍p-peh tiú, i ê tíng-bīn ū tâng ê thiāu-táu, thiāu-táu kuân saⁿ tiú; thiāu-táu ê sì-kho͘-uî ū bāng-á kah sia̍h-liû, lóng sī tâng tsò ê. Tē-jī ki thiāu siâng tsi̍t-khuán, mā ū bāng-á.
English: The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and a capital of brass was on it; and the height of the capital was three cubits, with network and pomegranates on the capital round about, all of brass: and like to these had the second pillar with network.

Tailo: Guá beh tsí-bîng lí ê kong-gī; kóng-tio̍h lí ê só͘ kiâⁿ, tuì lí lóng bô lī-ik.
English: I will declare your righteousness; and as for your works, they shall not profit you.

Tailo: Suî-jiân i ê kin tī tē-.ni̍h tsin lāu, i ê tsâng mā sí tī thô͘-.ni̍h ;
English: Though the root of it grows old in the earth, And the stock of it dies in the ground;

Tailo: Ông kah tuè i ê lâng lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm beh kong-kik tuà tī hit só͘-tsāi ê I-é-bú-suh lâng. In tuì Ta-bi̍t kóng, Lí nā bô tû tsiah-ê tsheⁿ-mê-.ê kah pái-kha-.ê, tsiū bē-tàng ji̍p-lâi tsit só͘-tsāi. In siūⁿ kóng Ta-bi̍t tsua̍t-tuì bē ji̍p-lâi tsia.
English: The king and his men went to Jerusalem against the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, who spoke to David, saying, Except you take away the blind and the lame, you shall not come in here; thinking, David can't come in here.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ū pò hó siau-sit lâi thuân hô-pîng ê lâng, i ê kha kiânn tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tíng. Iô-tah, lí tio̍h siú lí ê tseh-kî, siā lí ê guān! In-uī pháiⁿ lâng bô koh tuì lí ê tiong-kan king-kuè, in-uī i tsuân-pō͘ bia̍t-bông à.
English: Behold, on the mountains the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace! Keep your feasts, Judah! Perform your vows, for the wicked one will no more pass through you. He is utterly cut off.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k, Nùn ê kiáⁿ Io-siú-ah, tsi̍t-pah tsa̍p huè tsiū sí.
English: It happened after these things, that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of Yahweh, died, being one hundred ten years old.

Tailo: Koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê sàn-tshiah ê kuáⁿ-hū kā nn̄g-ê tâng-tsîⁿ-á hiat lo̍h-.khì.
English: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng só͘ sǹg-tsò in ê kng, taⁿ tuì in siu tò tńg-.lâi, gia̍h kuân ê tshiú ē siū at-tn̄g.
English: From the wicked, their light is withheld, The high arm is broken.

Tailo: I kā I ê uē tsí-sī Iâ-kop, kā I ê lu̍t-lē kah tián-tsiong tsí-sī I-su-la-el.
English: He shows his word to Jacob; His statutes and his ordinances to Israel.

Tailo: Im-kan ê soh-á uî-khùn guá, sí-bông ê lô-bāng lîm-kàu guá.
English: The cords of Sheol were round about me; The snares of death came on me.

Tailo: Má-ná-se kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn, bâi-tsòng tī i ka-kī kiong lāi ê hn̂g, to̍h-sī U-tsà ê hn̂g. I ê kiáⁿ Am-móng suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza: and Amon his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tha̍k hit-tiuⁿ phue liáu-āu, siū-tio̍h kó͘-lē, tsiū tuā huann-hí.
English: When they had read it, they rejoiced over the encouragement.

Tailo: Guá kah i, nn̄g lâng siâng hit mê ū bāng-kìnn, guán kok lâng ê bāng ū bô kāng ê ì-gī.
English: We dreamed a dream in one night, I and he. We dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.

Tailo: In thâi gû, kah-ná teh thâi lâng; hiàn iûⁿ, kah-ná teh kòng tn̄g káu ām-kún; hiàn lé-mi̍h, kah-ná teh hiàn ti-hueh; sio jú-hiuⁿ, kah-ná teh o-ló ngó͘-siōng. In kíng ka-kī ê tō-lō͘, sim ì-ài in hiah-ê khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: He who kills an ox is as he who kills a man; he who sacrifices a lamb, as he who breaks a dog's neck; he who offers an offering, as he who offers pig's blood; he who burns frankincense, as he who blesses an idol. Yes, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delights in their abominations:

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Io-a-si ū ì-sù beh siu-lí Siōng-tsú ê tiān,
English: It happened after this, that Joash was minded to restore the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: in-uī uàn-hūn lí ê lí thiàⁿ i, thiàⁿ lí ê lí uàn-hūn i. Lí kin-á-ji̍t í-king hián-bîng lí bô iàu-kín hiah-ê siú-líng kah jîn-sîn. Guá kin-á-ji̍t khuàⁿ-tshut, nā Αp-sa-lôm ua̍h-.leh, guán kin-á-ji̍t lóng sí, lí tsiū huann-hí.
English: in that you love those who hate you, and hate those who love you. For you have declared this day, that princes and servants are nothing to you: for this day I perceive that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died this day, then it had pleased you well.

Tailo: Guá tī kíng lāi ta̍k-ê siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, īng puà-ki kā in puà; Guá tsua̍t in ê hō͘-sû, Guá bia̍t Guá ê tsú-bîn, in iû-guân bô ua̍t tńg-lâi lī-khui in ê lō͘.
English: I have winnowed them with a fan in the gates of the land; I have bereaved them of children, I have destroyed my people; they didn't return from their ways.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h tshia-lián ê khuân sī kuân kah tsin kiaⁿ-lâng; sì-ê lián ê khuân ū ba̍k-tsiu muá-muá.
English: As for their rims, they were high and dreadful; and they four had their rims full of eyes round about.

Tailo: Tse sī tsiah-ê siú-bōng ê lâng só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê bīng-līng, tsiah-ê sìng ê só͘ tshut ê bīng-līng, hō͘ tsiòng-sing tsai, tsì-kuân-.ê tsiáng-kuán lâng ê kok, mā tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù kā kok siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lâng, mā īng siōng sè ê lâng lâi siat-li̍p tsò tsú. '
English: The sentence is by the decree of the watchers, and the demand by the word of the holy ones; to the intent that the living may know that the Most High rules in the kingdom of men, and gives it to whoever he will, and sets up over it the lowest of men.

Tailo: Tuâⁿ mā phuà-li̍h, tuâⁿ tíng ê hué-hu mā piàⁿ lo̍h-.lâi, tú tsiàu Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú ê uē só͘ kóng-tshut ê tiāu-thâu.
English: The altar also was torn, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: I kóng, ' Tshiáⁿ lí tsún guá khioh be̍h-sap, tī kuah be̍h ê ê āu-bīn, tī be̍h-khún tiong lâi khioh. ' Só͘-í, i tsiū lâi, tuì tsá-khí kàu taⁿ, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tuà tsia teh khioh, kan-taⁿ tī tshù lāi hioh tsi̍t-sî-á.
English: She said, Please let me glean and gather after the reapers among the sheaves. So she came, and has continued even from the morning until now, except that she stayed a little in the house.

Tailo: lí tio̍h kā kiânn tsit-ê pháiⁿ tāi ê tsa-po͘ lâng, á-.sī tsa-bó͘ lâng thua kàu siâⁿ mn̂g guā, īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm hit-ê tsa-po͘ lâng á-.sī tsa-bó͘ lâng, tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: then shall you bring forth that man or that woman, who has done this evil thing, to your gates, even the man or the woman; and you shall stone them to death with stones.

Tailo: In-uī hit-ê tsì-kuân tsì-tsun, íng-uán tī-.leh, miâ kiò-tsò sìng ê, án-ne kóng: Guá tuà tī tsì-kuân tsì-sìng ê só͘-tsāi, mā kah sim-sîn thòng-hué khiam-pi ê lâng tsò-hué tuà, beh hō͘ khiam-pi ê lâng ê sim-sîn koh-ua̍h, mā hō͘ thòng-hué ê lâng ê sim koh-ua̍h.
English: For thus says the high and lofty One who inhabits eternity, whose name is Holy: I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also who is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite.

Tailo: Iâ-kop tsiū tsiàu án-ne tsò. Kah Le-ah ê hun-kî muá tshit ji̍t, La̍h-ban tsiū kā i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ La̍h-khel hō͘ i tsò bó͘.
English: Jacob did so, and fulfilled her week. He gave him Rachel his daughter as wife.

Tailo: Guá gia̍h-khí tshiú ǹg thiⁿ kóng, Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi kóng:
English: For I lift up my hand to heaven, And say, As I live forever,

Tailo: In-uī lí ū Siōng-tsú tsò tô-siám ê só͘-tsāi; lí ū īng Tsì-kuân-.ê tsò lí tuà ê só͘-tsāi,
English: Because you have made Yahweh your refuge, And the Most High your dwelling place,

Tailo: Nā hiàn tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ tsò lé-mi̍h, tio̍h tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng hiàn.
English: If he offers a lamb for his offering, then he shall offer it before Yahweh;

Tailo: Tì-huī ê lâng só͘ kóng ê sī un-huī ê uē; gû-gōng ê tshuì thun-bia̍t ka-kī.
English: The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious; but a fool is swallowed by his own lips.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' I-su-la-el lâng tshut Ai-gi̍p ê sî, A-má-li̍k lâng án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi in, án-tsuáⁿ tsia̍t in ê lō͘, guá lóng ē kì-tit.
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies, I have marked that which Amalek did to Israel, how he set himself against him in the way, when he came up out of Egypt.

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín ê tsi-tso̍k, to̍h-sī Sàu-lô ê kâng tso̍k saⁿ tshing lâng, in-uī kàu hit sî, tsit tso̍k tuā pō͘-hūn iáu-koh teh ióng-hō͘ Sàu-lô ê ke.
English: Of the children of Benjamin, the brothers of Saul, three thousand: for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept their allegiance to the house of Saul.

Tailo: Ē ū lâng tuà tī hit tiong-kan, bô koh ū tsiù-tsó͘. Ê-lú-sa-lèm ē an-jiân thài-pîng.
English: Men will dwell therein, and there will be no more curse; but Jerusalem will dwell safely.

Tailo: Ló-toh pik-tshiat tshiánn in, in tsiah ua̍t-tńg sin, uat ji̍p-khì i ê tshù; Ló-toh uī in tsún-pī iàn-si̍k, piak bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, in tsiū tsia̍h.
English: He urged them greatly, and they came in with him, and entered into his house. He made them a feast, and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.

Tailo: Guá beh íng-uán tuà tī Lí ê pò͘-pênn, guá beh bih tī Lí si̍t-kó͘-ē ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi. [Sè-la̍h]
English: I will dwell in your tent forever. I will take refuge in the shelter of your wings. Selah.

Tailo: Guá tuì Thiⁿ-pē hia tshut-.lâi, lâi-kàu sè-kan; taⁿ koh beh lī-khui sè-kan, tńg-khì Thiⁿ-pē hia.
English: I came out from the Father, and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

Tailo: In kóng, Guán bîng-bîng khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tsú kah lí tông-tsāi, só͘-í guán kóng, lán tiong-kan, to̍h-sī lí kah guán tiong-kan tio̍h tsiù-tsuā, tshiánn hō͘ guán kah lí li̍p-iok:
English: They said, We saw plainly that Yahweh was with you. We said, Let there now be an oath between us, even between us and you, and let us make a covenant with you,

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn pháiⁿ lâng nā huê-thâu, lī-khui i só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ, lâi kiâⁿ tsìng-ti̍t kah ha̍p-lí ê tāi-tsì, i ē hō͘ i ê sîn-hûn tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā.
English: Again, when the wicked man turns away from his wickedness that he has committed, and does that which is lawful and right, he shall save his soul alive.

Tailo: Só͘-ū tuà tī tē-bīn tsiūⁿ ê lâng, to̍h-sī tshòng-sè í-lâi in ê miâ bô kì-tsài tī siū sat-hāi ê iûⁿ-ko ê ua̍h-miā-tsheh ê, lóng ē pài hit tsiah bíng-siù.
English: All who dwell on the earth will worship him, everyone whose name has not been written from the foundation of the world in the book of life of the Lamb who has been killed.

Tailo: Ge-ha-tsih teh kā ông kóng E-lí-siah án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ sí-lâng koh-ua̍h, tú-hó hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, to̍h-sī i hō͘ i ê kiáⁿ koh-ua̍h ê, uī-tio̍h i ê tshù-the̍h kah tshân-hn̂g lâi kiû kiò ông. Ge-ha-tsih kóng, Guá ê tsú, guá ê ông, tsit-ê sī hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, tsit-ê sī i ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī E-lí-siah hō͘ i koh-ua̍h ê.
English: It happened, as he was telling the king how he had restored to life him who was dead, that behold, the woman, whose son he had restored to life, cried to the king for her house and for her land. Gehazi said, My lord, O king, this is the woman, and this is her son, whom Elisha restored to life.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè tsiong-lâi ē tsián-tû hiah-ê kok, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè kā in ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê, lí khì sîng-tsiap in, lâi tuà in ê siâⁿ kah in ê tshù.
English: When Yahweh your God shall cut off the nations, whose land Yahweh your God gives you, and you succeed them, and dwell in their cities, and in their houses;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú sī guá ê sán-gia̍p kah guá ê hok-pue; Lí kò͘-siú guá ìng-tit ê hūn-gia̍h.
English: Yahweh assigned my portion and my cup. You made my lot secure.

Tailo: Sìng-tiān ê kíng-uē tńg-lâi kìnn tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng. In mn̄g kíng-uē kóng, Lín ná ē bô kā I-é-su ah tńg-.lâi?
English: The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, Why didn't you bring him?

Tailo: Ū hīⁿ-khang ê lâng, lóng tio̍h thiaⁿ Sìng Sîn kā tsiah-ê kàu-huē só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies.

Tailo: Uàn-hūn lí ê lâng ē muá-sin kiàn-siàu, pháiⁿ lâng ê pò͘-pênn ē kui tī bô.
English: Those who hate you shall be clothed with shame. The tent of the wicked shall be no more.

Tailo: In sì-kho͘-uî kā i kong-kik tshin-tshiūnn kò͘ hn̂g ê lâng. In-uī i puē-puān guá. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: As keepers of a field are they against her round about, because she has been rebellious against me, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Khí-tshù ê lâng pí i só͘ khí ê tshù khah tsun-kuì; án-ne, I-é-su pí Mô͘-se tio̍h siū koh khah tuā ê îng-kng.
English: For he has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who built the house has more honor than the house.

Tailo: Guá kiû-kiò ê sî, Lí ū ìn-tap guá, kó͘-bú guá, hō͘ guá ê sim ū khuì-la̍t.
English: In the day that I called, you answered me. You encouraged me with strength in my soul.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Tio̍h tī tsian-puâⁿ īng iû lâi tsò, tiâu-hô liáu-āu, lí tsiū tio̍h the̍h ji̍p-.lâi; piak hó tsi̍t tè tsi̍t tè, tsò sò͘-tsè, hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú tsò phang-bī.
English: It shall be made with oil in a baking pan. When it is soaked, you shall bring it in. You shall offer the meal offering in baked pieces for a sweet savor to Yahweh.

Tailo: Guân-khí-thâu, Siōng-tè tshòng-tsō thiⁿ kah tē ê sî,
English: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

Tailo: Hui-lī-sū lâng ê siú-líng kóng, Tsiah-ê Hi-bú-lâi lâng tī tsia tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? A-ki-si kā Hui-lī-sū lâng ê siú-líng kóng, Tsit-ê kám m̄-sī I-su-la-el ông Sàu-lô ê jîn-sîn Ta-bi̍t? I kah guá tuà í-king ū tsiah-ê ji̍t, tsiah-ê nî. Tuì i tâu-hâng guá kàu kin-á-ji̍t, guá m̄-bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ū kuè-sit.
English: Then said the princes of the Philistines, What do these Hebrews here? Achish said to the princes of the Philistines, Isn't this David, the servant of Saul the king of Israel, who has been with me these days, or rather these years, and I have found no fault in him since he fell away to me to this day?

Tailo: I í-king tshòng-pêⁿ thô͘-bīn, kám bô iā peh-kak, tsai khîn-tshài, tsiàu tsuā tsìng sió-be̍h, tī tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê só͘-tsāi tsìng tuā-be̍h, koh tī hn̂g piⁿ tsìng tsho͘-be̍h?
English: When he has leveled its surface, doesn't he plant the dill, and scatter the cumin seed, and put in the wheat in rows, the barley in the appointed place, and the spelt in its place?

Tailo: In-uī I bô tuì thai-.ni̍h hō͘ guá sí, hō͘ guá ê lāu-bú tsò guá ê bōng, i ē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tuā pak-tó͘.
English: because he didn't kill me from the womb; and so my mother would have been my grave, and her womb always great.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in jú kian-tshî kóng, I tuì Ga-lí-la-iah síng khai-sí, taⁿ lâi-kàu tsia, I tī Iô-tá-iah tsuân tē kà-sī lâng, siàn-tōng jîn-bîn.
English: But they insisted, saying, He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.

Tailo: Lí ê tshuì nā kóng tsìng-ti̍t ê uē, guá ê sim-tn̂g mā ē khuài-lo̍k.
English: Yes, my heart will rejoice, When your lips speak what is right.

Tailo: E-hú pān A-hap ke ê tsuē ê sî, tú-tio̍h Iô-tah hiah-ê siú-líng kah A-ha-tsiah hiann-tī ê kiáⁿ teh ho̍k-sāi A-ha-tsiah ê, i tsiū kā in thâi-sí.
English: It happened, when Jehu was executing judgment on the house of Ahab, that he found the princes of Judah, and the sons of the brothers of Ahaziah, ministering to Ahaziah, and killed them.

Tailo: Ū lâng tsia̍h hit-ê sí ê tsing-seⁿ, tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ-khò͘, it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng sî; the̍h sí ê tsing-seⁿ ê lâng mā tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ-khò͘, it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng sî.
English: He who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening. He also who carries its carcass shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: Lō͘-bué ū Ta-ni-el, tsiàu guá ê sîn-bîng ê miâ kiò-tsò Bel-ti-sia-tsal ê lâi-kàu guá ê bīn-tsîng; i ê sim-lāi ū sìng ê Siōng-tè ê sîn-lîng, guá kā guá ê bāng tuì i kóng,
English: But at the last Daniel came in before me, whose name was Belteshazzar, according to the name of my god, and in whom is the spirit of the holy gods: and I told the dream before him, saying,

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê kim-khuân, koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshiú-khuân tī in sió-muē ê tshiú, mā thiaⁿ-tio̍h in sió-muē Li-bé-kah ê uē, kóng, Hit-ê lâng tuì guá kóng án-ne, án-ne. I tsiū khì hit-ê lâng hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê lâng iáu khiā tī lo̍k-tô piⁿ, uá-kīn tsuí-tséⁿ.
English: It happened, when he saw the ring, and the bracelets on his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, This is what the man said to me, that he came to the man. Behold, he was standing by the camels at the spring.

Tailo: Siōng-tè huan-hù tsiah-ê it-tshè ê uē kóng:
English: God spoke all these words, saying,

Tailo: Io-ap kā i kóng, Lí kin-á-ji̍t m̄-thang khì pò siau-sit, pa̍t-ji̍t lí tsiah thang khì pò siau-sit; tsóng-.sī, kin-á-ji̍t lí m̄-thang pò siau-sit, in-uī ông ê kiáⁿ í-king sí.
English: Joab said to him, You shall not be the bearer of news this day, but you shall bear news another day; but this day you shall bear no news, because the king's son is dead.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú thiaⁿ Hi-tse-kia ê kî-tó, tsiū i hó jîn-bîn.
English: Yahweh listened to Hezekiah, and healed the people.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín bô lâi kiù guá, guá tsiū piàⁿ-miā tsìn-tsîng khì kong-kik Am-móng lâng, Siōng-tsú kā in kau tī guá ê tshiú tiong, lín kin-á-ji̍t ná ē lâi guá tsia beh kah guá kau-tsiàn?
English: When I saw that you didn't save me, I put my life in my hand, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and Yahweh delivered them into my hand: why then are you come up to me this day, to fight against me?

Tailo: Lí sǹg siáⁿ-mi̍h, ná ē teh phue-phuàⁿ pa̍t lâng ê tshe-īng? In khiā tsāi á-.sī pua̍h-tó, in ê tsú-lâng ē kā in kuan-sim. In ē khiā tsāi, in-uī Tsú ē kā in pang-tsān.
English: Who are you who judge another's servant? To his own lord he stands or falls. Yes, he will be made to stand, for God has power to make him stand.

Tailo: In ē bīng-līng kóng, Lín tio̍h tsún-pī kau-tsiàn kong siâⁿ; khí-.lâi! Lán tio̍h thàn tiong-tàu ê sî tsiūⁿ-.khì. Āu-lâi, in koh kóng, Tshám ah! Ji̍t í-king tshiâ sai, beh àm ê iánn í-king thua tn̂g.
English: Prepare you war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe to us! for the day declines, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, lín tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú! A-lông ê ke, lín tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú!
English: House of Israel, praise Yahweh! House of Aaron, praise Yahweh!

Tailo: Lín khì, uī guá kah jîn-bîn, koh uī Iô-tah kûn-tsiòng, kā só͘ khioh-tio̍h tsit pún tsheh ê uē mn̄g Siōng-tsú, in-uī Siōng-tsú tuì lán tuā siū-khì, sī in-uī lán ê tsó͘-sian bô tsun-thàn tsit pún tsheh ê uē, bô tsiàu it-tshè só͘ kì-tsài kuan-hē lán ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Go you, inquire of Yahweh for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found; for great is the wrath of Yahweh that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not listened to the words of this book, to do according to all that which is written concerning us.

Tailo: Án-ne, guá tsiū ē-tàng tsiàu Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì, huaⁿ-huaⁿ hí-hí khì lín hia kah lín tsò-hué hióng-siū an-hioh.
English: that I may come to you in joy through the will of God, and together with you, find rest.

Tailo: I beh tī tsin tsē kok ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan kiânn sím-phuàⁿ, uī-tio̍h tsin tsē hn̄g-hn̄g kiông-bíng ê kok lâi kái-kuat. In ē kā in ê to phah-tsò lê-thâu, kā in ê tshiuⁿ phah-tsò liâm-á. Tsit kok bô gia̍h to kong-kik hit kok, in mā bô koh ha̍k-si̍p kau-tsiàn.
English: And he will judge between many peoples, And will decide concerning strong nations afar off. They will beat their swords into plowshares, And their spears into pruning hooks. Nation will not lift up sword against nation, Neither will they learn war any more.

Tailo: Lâng tú-tio̍h huān-lān, guá kám bô uī-tio̍h i thî-khàu? Lâng sàn-tshiah, guá ê sim kám bô uī-tio̍h i iu-būn?
English: Didn't I weep for him who was in trouble? Wasn't my soul grieved for the needy?

Tailo: Kel-sióng ê kiáⁿ-sun, tuì It-sa-kal tsi-tso̍k ê tsong-tso̍k, tuì A-sel ê tsi-tso̍k, tuì Ná-hu-tha-lím ê tsi-tso̍k, tuì tuà tī Ba-siáng ê Má-ná-se puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k, liam-tio̍h tsa̍p-saⁿ tsō siâⁿ.
English: The children of Gershon had by lot out of the families of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.

Tailo: Koh uī-tio̍h lí lâi thì kng-thâu, īng muâ-pò͘ hâ io, thòng-sim thî-khàu, hui-siông pi-ai.
English: and they shall make themselves bald for you, and gird them with sackcloth, and they shall weep for you in bitterness of soul with bitter mourning.

Tailo: Tē-sì ji̍t, sī Lū-biān kiáⁿ-sun ê siú-líng, Si-ti-ul ê kiáⁿ E-li-tsul.
English: On the fourth day Elizur the son of Shedeur, prince of the children of Reuben

Tailo: I koh thê-khí kua, kóng: Ai-ah, Siōng-tè kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì ê sî, siáⁿ lâng ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h?
English: He took up his parable, and said, Alas, who shall live when God does this?

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k sio-tsè ê pak-lāi kah thuí, i tio̍h īng tsuí sé tshing-khì; tsè-si tsiū tio̍h kā it-tshè lóng sio tī tuâⁿ tíng tsò sio-tsè, hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè.
English: but its innards and its legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall burn the whole on the altar, for a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Yahweh.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí lâi, Guá beh tshe lí khì kìⁿ Huâ-láu, tshuā Guá ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng tshut Ai-gi̍p.
English: Come now therefore, and I will send you to Pharaoh, that you may bring forth my people, the children of Israel, out of Egypt.

Tailo: Le-ah koh huâi-īn, kā Iâ-kop seⁿ tē-la̍k-ê kiáⁿ.
English: Leah conceived again, and bore a sixth son to Jacob.

Tailo: In-uī i ê lāu-pē Hi-tse-kia só͘ huí-huāi ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ i koh khí khí-.lâi, koh uī hiah-ê Ba-al khí tuâⁿ, tsò A-si-tha-lot, koh kìng-pài thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng lâi kā i ho̍k-sāi.
English: For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down; and he reared up altars for the Baals, and made Asheroth, and worshiped all the army of the sky, and served them.

Tailo: to̍h-sī thiⁿ só͘ lo̍h ê hō͘, lâi ak tsìng lâng.
English: Which the skies pour down And drop on man abundantly.

Tailo: ( Tsit-ê Hel-móng, Si-tòng lâng kā i tshing-tsò Se-liân, A-mô͘-lī lâng kā i tshing-tsò Se-nil. )
English: ( which Hermon the Sidonians call Sirion, and the Amorites call it Senir; )

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá ê lô͘-po̍k beh īng tì-huī tsò tāi-tsì, beh siū kí-khí sing kuân, koh beh tsiâⁿ-tsò tsin kuân.
English: Behold, my servant shall deal wisely, he shall be exalted and lifted up, and shall be very high.

Tailo: tsiah bián guá ê tuì-ti̍k kóng, Guá iâⁿ-kuè i ; tsiah bián guá ê siû-ti̍k tī guá pua̍h-tó ê sî huann-hí.
English: Lest my enemy say, I have prevailed against him; Lest my adversaries rejoice when I fall.

Tailo: Tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal tsiū the̍h hiah-ê lâng só͘ hiàn ê tâng lô͘, tuî-tsò kui-phìⁿ, lâi an tsè-tuâⁿ,
English: Eleazar the priest took the brazen censers, which those who were burnt had offered; and they beat them out for a covering of the altar,

Tailo: Kal-tí-ah ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á, lí tio̍h tiām-tiām tsē, ji̍p-khì tī àm-tiong, in-uī lí bô koh hông kiò-tsò lia̍t kok ê tsú-bó.
English: Sit you silent, and get you into darkness, daughter of the Chaldeans; for you shall no more be called The mistress of kingdoms.

Tailo: Bian ha-tat kā i kóng, Guá ê lāu-pē tuì lí ê lāu-pē só͘ tshiúⁿ hiah-ê siâⁿ, guá ē hîng lí. Jî-tshiánn lí thang tī Ta-má-su-ko siat ke-lō͘, tshin-tshiūnn guá ê lāu-pē tī Sa-má-lī-a só͘ siat ê án-ne. A-hap kóng, Guá tsiàu tsit-ê iok, pàng lí tńg-.khì. Tsiū kah i li̍p-iok, pàng i tńg-.khì.
English: Ben Hadad said to him, The cities which my father took from your father I will restore; and you shall make streets for you in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria. I, said Ahab, will let you go with this covenant. So he made a covenant with him, and let him go.

Tailo: Má-thài kah Tho-má-suh, Al-hua-ioh ê kiáⁿ Iâ-kop kah kiò-tsò Se-lô-tí ê Sí-mòng,
English: Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Simon, who was called the Zealot;

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsiú-lông guán té tsiú ê sî, iáu-sī sin ê; lí khuàⁿ, taⁿ í-king phuà-li̍h, guán tsiah-ê saⁿ kah ê mā lóng tshīng kū-.khì à, in-uī lō͘ tsin hn̄g.
English: and these wineskins, which we filled, were new; and behold, they are torn: and these our garments and our shoes are become old by reason of the very long journey.

Tailo: Guán tsit sî tshiáⁿ lí kàu Siōng-tsú — guán ê Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng, I só͘ kóng ê, bô-lūn sī hó sī pháiⁿ, guán lóng ē tsun-thàn I ê uē; guán tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú — guán ê Siōng-tè ê uē, tsiū thang tit-tio̍h hing-thong.
English: Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of Yahweh our God, to whom we send you; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of Yahweh our God.

Tailo: Hit sî, lín lóng lâi kìnn guá, kóng, ' Lán tio̍h tshe lâng tāi-sing khì, kā lán thàm-khuàⁿ hit-ê tē, kā lán huê-hok, khuànn lán sī tio̍h tuì siáⁿ-mi̍h lō͘ kiâⁿ-.khì, tuì siáⁿ-mi̍h siâⁿ ji̍p-.khì. '
English: You came near to me everyone of you, and said, Let us send men before us, that they may search the land for us, and bring us word again of the way by which we must go up, and the cities to which we shall come.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ū at-tn̄g pháiⁿ lâng ê kuái-á kah kuán-hat lâng ê kuân-pìng,
English: Yahweh has broken the staff of the wicked, the scepter of the rulers,

Tailo: Iô-há-neh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tuì He-lo̍t kóng, Lí bô ing-kai tsiàm hiann-tī ê bó͘.
English: For John said to Herod, It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife.

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê sìn-tô͘ lóng beh kā lín tshíng-an.
English: All the saints greet you.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn kám sī guá huâi-īn ê? Kiám sī guá seⁿ ê? Lí kìng-jiân tuì guá kóng, ' Kā in phō tī hing tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn iúⁿ-tshī gín-á ê lāu-pē teh phō tsia̍h ling ê enn-á, kàu tī Lí tsiù-tsuā siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in ê tsó͘-sian ê tē? '
English: Have I conceived all this people? Have I brought them forth, that you should tell me, Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse carries a nursing infant, to the land which you swore to their fathers?

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Mô͘-se í-king tióng-sîng, i tshut-khì kàu i ê tông-pau hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h in teh tsò khó͘-kang. I khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê Ai-gi̍p lâng teh phah tsi̍t-ê Hi-bú-lâi lâng, to̍h-sī i ê tông-pau.
English: It happened in those days, when Moses had grown up, that he went out to his brothers, and looked at their burdens. He saw an Egyptian striking a Hebrew, one of his brothers.

Tailo: Tuì kó͘-tsá to̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah guán tông-tsāi ê Siōng-tè, ē thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, mā ē kā in pò-ìng, to̍h-sī hiah-ê bô kái-piàn, bô kìng-uì Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: God, who is enthroned forever, Will hear, and answer them. Selah. They never change, Who don't fear God.

Tailo: M̄-thang ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò ū tì-huī, tio̍h kìng-uì Siōng-tsú, lī-khui pháiⁿ tāi.
English: Don't be wise in your own eyes. Fear Yahweh, and depart from evil.

Tailo: Lí pān toh tshiánn lâng-kheh ê sî, tio̍h tshiánn sàn-tshiah-.ê, phuà-siùⁿ-.ê, pái-kha-.ê, tsheⁿ-mê-.ê,
English: But when you make a feast, ask the poor, the maimed, the lame, or the blind;

Tailo: to̍h-sī tsiah-ê kim ting-tâi kah i ê tsuáⁿ, tsiū tshìn kim lâi tsò ta̍k-ê ting-tâi kah i ê tsuáⁿ, koh īng-tsò gîn ting-tâi ê gîn lâi tshìn hō͘ i, ting-tâi kah i ê tsuáⁿ lóng sī án-ne, tsiàu ta̍k-ê ting-tâi ê lō͘-īng;
English: by weight also for the lampstands of gold, and for the lamps of it, of gold, by weight for every lampstand and for the lamps of it; and for the lampstands of silver, silver by weight for every lampstand and for the lamps of it, according to the use of every lampstand;

Tailo: Siōng-tè khuànn I it-tshè só͘ tsō ê tsiū kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsin hó. Ū ê-hng, ū tsá-khí, sī tē-la̍k ji̍t.
English: God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. There was evening and there was morning, a sixth day.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù I-su-la-el lâng, kā in kóng: Lín nā kàu Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín tuà ê tē,
English: Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, When you are come into the land of your habitations, which I give to you,

Tailo: Lí ná ē siu-tsíng lí ê lō͘, iau-kiû thiòng-ài? Liân pháiⁿ tsa-bó͘ lâng, lí mā īng lí ê lō͘ kà-sī in.
English: How trimmest you your way to seek love! therefore even the wicked women have you taught your ways.

Tailo: Sàu-lô tsiū kā hit-ê gia̍h i ê tsiàn-khì ê kóng, Lí pue̍h-tshut lí ê to, kā guá tsha̍k-sí, bián-tit hiah-ê bô siū kat-lé ê lâng lâi kā guá lîng-jio̍k. Hit-ê gia̍h i ê tsiàn-khì ê bô ài án-ne tsò, in-uī i tsin kiaⁿ. Sàu-lô tsiū gia̍h i ê to, kā sing-khu àⁿ tī tíng-bīn lâi tsha̍k-sí ka-kī.
English: Then said Saul to his armor bearer, Draw your sword, and thrust me through therewith, lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me. But his armor bearer would not; for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took his sword, and fell on it.

Tailo: Ta-lió-suh ông jī nî káu-gue̍h jī-tsa̍p sì, Siōng-tsú ê uē thok sian-ti Ha-gái kóng:
English: In the twenty-fourth day of the ninth month, in the second year of Darius, the Word of Yahweh came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in bô kiáⁿ, in-uī E-lí-sa-biat bē huâi-īn, nn̄g lâng ê nî-huè iū-koh lāu à.
English: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were well advanced in years.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Guá mā siūⁿ kóng ka-kī bē kham-tit lâi tshuē Lí. Lí nā kóng tsi̍t kù uē, guá ê lô͘-po̍k tsiū ē hó khí-.lâi.
English: Therefore I didn't even think myself worthy to come to you; but say the word, and my servant will be healed.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā kuân-lîng kui hō͘ Siōng-tsú. I ê ui-giâm tī I-su-la-el ê tíng-bīn, I ê kuân-lîng tī kiong-tshong.
English: Ascribe strength to God! His excellency is over Israel, His strength is in the skies.

Tailo: Tsò pháiⁿ sī ông só͘ thó-ià, in-uī ông-uī sī tuì kong-gī lâi kian-kò͘.
English: It is an abomination for kings to do wrong, For the throne is established by righteousness.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in m̄ tsun-thàn, m̄ àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ, kìng-jiân ta̍k-ê tsiàu ka-kī pháiⁿ ê ngē-sim khì kiâⁿ. Só͘-í, Guá hō͘ tsit-ê iok it-tshè tsiù-tsó͘ ê uē lîm-kàu tī in ê sin tsiūⁿ; tsit-ê iok sī Guá kā in huan-hù tio̍h tsiàu án-ne kiânn ê, m̄-koh, in bô án-ne kiânn.
English: Yet they didn't obey, nor turn their ear, but walked everyone in the stubbornness of their evil heart: therefore I brought on them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they didn't do them.

Tailo: Guá ê ông, guá ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá kiû-kiò ê siann! In-uī guá teh ǹg Lí kî-tó.
English: Listen to the voice of my cry, my King and my God; For to you do I pray.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí ná ē bô tsip-siú kí Siōng-tsú só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê kah guá só͘ kíng-kài lí ê bīng-līng?
English: Why then have you not kept the oath of Yahweh, and the commandment that I have charged you with?

Tailo: Gâu tī-lí kàu-huē ê tiúⁿ-ló, tio̍h ka-pē kā i tsun-kìng; tuì hiah-ê ti̍k-pia̍t tsīn-la̍t teh kóng tō-lí kah kà-sī ê tiúⁿ-ló, koh khah tio̍h án-ne.
English: Let the elders who rule well be counted worthy of double honor, especially those who labor in the word and in teaching.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí khuàⁿ, I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn kóng, ' I só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê ī-siōng, sī sio̍k tī tsin tsē ji̍t í-āu ê tāi-tsì, só͘ kóng ê ī-giân sī teh tsí ki̍k-hn̄g ê bī-lâi. '
English: Son of man, behold, they of the house of Israel say, The vision that he sees is for many day to come, and he prophesies of times that are far off.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k In-uī guán ê tsó͘-sian jiá thinn-tíng ê Siōng-tsú ê siū-khì, I kā in kau tī Kal-tí-ah lâng, Ba-bú-lông ông Nep-kat-ne-tsal ê tshiú, ông tsiū thiah-huí tsit king tiān, lia̍h jîn-bîn khì-kàu Ba-bú-lông.
English: But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven to wrath, he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.

Tailo: Tsiàn-tshia ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h i m̄-sī I-su-la-el ông, tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin, bô khì jiok.
English: It happened, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.

Tailo: Iô-tah ông Io-si-iah ê kiáⁿ — E-hō͘-iá-kim gō͘ nî ê káu-.gue̍h, Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tsìng lâng kah hiah-ê tuì Iô-tah siâⁿ lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tsìng lâng; suan-pò͘ tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng kìm-tsia̍h.
English: Now it happened in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, that all the people in Jerusalem, and all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem, proclaimed a fast before Yahweh.

Tailo: Guān hit-ê ji̍t piàn-tsò o͘-àm; guān Siōng-tè bô tuì tíng-bīn khuàⁿ-kò͘ i, kng mā bô tsiò i.
English: Let that day be darkness; Don't let God from above seek for it, Neither let the light shine on it.

Tailo: Lán bô lâng kan-taⁿ uī-tio̍h ka-kī teh ua̍h, mā bô lâng kan-taⁿ uī-tio̍h ka-kī lâi sí.
English: For none of us lives to himself, and none dies to himself.

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á, tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsi̍t tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò sio-tsè;
English: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

Tailo: Nn̄g-nî lāi, Guá beh kā Ba-bú-lông ông — Nep-kat-ne-tsal tuì tsit só͘-tsāi tshiúⁿ khì-kàu Ba-bú-lông, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú ê tiān só͘-ū ê khì-kū, lóng beh hō͘ i tò tńg-lâi tsit só͘-tsāi.
English: Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of Yahweh's house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried to Babylon:

Tailo: Phue lāi siá kóng, Tio̍h phài U-lī-a khì tī tīn-tsîng ki̍k guî-kip ê só͘-tsāi, lín tsiū tuì i ê āu-bīn thè tńg-.lâi, hō͘ i siū phah-sí.
English: He wrote in the letter, saying, Set Uriah in the forefront of the hottest battle, and retire you from him, that he may be struck, and die.

Tailo: Hit sî, guá huan-hù lín kóng, ' Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè í-king kā tsit-ê tē hō͘ lín tsò sán-gia̍p, lín tiong-kan ē kau-tsiàn ê lóng tio̍h tuà kun-khì, tī lín ê hiann-tī I-su-la-el lâng ê bīn-tsîng kuè-.khì.
English: I commanded you at that time, saying, Yahweh your God has given you this land to possess it: you shall pass over armed before your brothers the children of Israel, all the men of valor.

Tailo: Sàu-lô mā tńg-khì Gi-be-at, kàu i ê tshù, ū tsi̍t tīn lâng hō͘ Siōng-tè kám-tōng in ê sim ê, tsiū tuè i khì.
English: Saul also went to his house to Gibeah; and there went with him the army, whose hearts God had touched.

Tailo: Iô-tah ông Io-si-iah ê kiáⁿ E-hō͘-iá-kim sì nî, Nê-lé-iù ê kiáⁿ Pa-lo-sih kā I-é-lí-miah sian-ti só͘ thuân hiah-ê uē, kì tī tsheh-.ni̍h.
English: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch the son of Neriah, when he wrote these word in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú — i ê Siōng-tè kā i kau tī A-lâm ông ê tshiú, in tsiū kā i phah, lia̍h i ê jîn-bîn tsin tsuē, ah kàu Ta-má-su-ko, koh kau i tī I-su-la-el ông ê tshiú, i kā in thâi-sí tsin tsuē lâng.
English: Therefore Yahweh his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria; and they struck him, and carried away of his a great multitude of captives, and brought them to Damascus. He was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who struck him with a great slaughter.

Tailo: Lí khì A-bá-lîm suaⁿ, Ne-bó ê suaⁿ-thâu kah I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tuì-bīn ê Mô͘-ap tē, khuànn Guá siúⁿ-sù I-su-la-el lâng tsò sán-gia̍p ê Ka-nân tē.
English: Go up into this mountain of Abarim, to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is over against Jericho; and see the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel for a possession;

Tailo: Hô-hòng lâng kah-ná sī thâng, sè-kan lâng sī tō͘-kún.
English: How much less man, who is a worm! The son of man, who is a worm!

Tailo: Lín kì-jiân sī Siōng-tè só͘ kíng-suán ê tsú-bîn, sī sìng-kiat koh tit-tio̍h I ê thiàⁿ ê lâng, lín tio̍h īng liân-bín, jîn-tsû, khiam-pi, un-jiû kah nāi-sim tsò saⁿ lâi tshīng.
English: Put on therefore, as God's chosen ones, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, humility, and perseverance;

Tailo: Guá hui-siông uàn-hūn in, lia̍h in tsò guá ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: I hate them with perfect hatred. They have become my enemies.

Tailo: I koh īng tâng lâi tsù nn̄g-ê thiāu-táu, hē tī thiāu tíng; tsit-ê thiāu-táu kuân gō͘ tiú, hit-ê thiāu-táu mā kuân gō͘ tiú.
