English: He made two capitals of molten brass, to set on the tops of the pillars: the height of the one capital was five cubits, and the height of the other capital was five cubits.

Tailo: I ē tī siàu-liân ê sî sí-.khì, in ê sèⁿ-miā sòng-sit ná tshin-tshiūnn gín-á piàn pháiⁿ-.khì.
English: They die in youth. Their life perishes among the unclean.

Tailo: Guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê ū kuân-lîng ê thiⁿ-sài tuā-siaⁿ suan-pò͘ kóng, Siáⁿ lâng ū tsu-keh thang thiah-khui hit-ê hong-ìn, hian khui hit-kńg tsheh?
English: I saw a mighty angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to break its seals?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá ē īng tshuì hō͘ lín kian-kò͘; īng tshuì-tûn ê an-uì hō͘ lín kiám khin thòng-khó͘.
English: But I would strengthen you with my mouth. The solace of my lips would relieve you.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê An-hioh-ji̍t, I-é-su tī tsi̍t-ê huē-tn̂g teh kà-sī lâng.
English: He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.

Tailo: Guá tsá-tsîng án-tsuáⁿ tsuan-sim kā in pue̍h-tshut, thiah-huí, tshia-tó, bia̍t-bông, khùn-khó͘, tsit-má mā beh tsiàu án-ne tsuan-sim kā in kiàn-li̍p, tsai-tsìng. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: It shall happen that, like as I have watched over them to pluck up and to break down and to overthrow and to destroy and to afflict, so will I watch over them to build and to plant, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah kah I-su-la-el jîn-bîn, kā Tsa-la̍h ê kan-á-sun A-kan kah hit-ê gîn, hit niá saⁿ, hit tiāⁿ kim kah i ê kiáⁿ-jî, gû, lî, iûⁿ, pò͘-pênn, í-ki̍p i it-tshè só͘-ū ê, lóng tuà kàu A-kol ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah, and the silver, and the mantle, and the wedge of gold, and his sons, and his daughters, and his oxen, and his donkeys, and his sheep, and his tent, and all that he had: and they brought them up to the valley of Achor.

Tailo: Lán mā m̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn in tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng huān kan-îm, suah tsi̍t ji̍t sí nn̄g-bān saⁿ tshing lâng.
English: Neither let us commit sexual immorality, as some of them committed, and in one day twenty-three thousand fell.

Tailo: Tsa-kha-lī-a ho̍k-sāi ê ji̍t-kî muá, tsiū tńg-khì in tshù.
English: It happened, when the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his house.

Tailo: A-bú-lâm tshuā i ê bó͘ Sa-lái kah i ê ti̍t-á Ló-toh, í-ki̍p in tī Khal-lân só͘ tsik-tsū ê tsâi-bu̍t kah só͘ tit-tio̍h ê lâng-gia̍h, in tsiū tshut-.khì, beh khì Ka-nân tē. In tsiū lâi-kàu Ka-nân tē.
English: Abram took Sarai his wife, Lot his brother's son, all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls whom they had gotten in Haran, and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan. Into the land of Canaan they came.

Tailo: Guá siūⁿ beh bîng-pi̍k in kò i ê lí-iû, tsiū sàng i khì in ê gī-huē.
English: Desiring to know the cause why they accused him, I brought him down to their council.

Tailo: Mô͘-se ê tiūⁿ-lâng E-thu-ló kā sio-tsè kah pa̍t khuán ê tsè hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tè. A-lông kah I-su-la-el ê tiúⁿ-ló lóng lâi, tī Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng kah Mô͘-se ê tiūⁿ-lâng tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God. Aaron came with all of the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses' father-in-law before God.

Tailo: Kiù guá thuat-lī Iô-tá-iah tē-khu hiah-ê m̄-sìn ê lâng ê hām-hāi, koh hō͘ guá uī-tio̍h kiong-kip Ê-lú-sa-lèm só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì, tit-tio̍h sìn-tô͘ tsiap-la̍p.
English: that I may be delivered from those who are disobedient in Judea, and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints;

Tailo: i tsiū kā i ê lâng hun-tsò saⁿ tuī, bâi-ho̍k tī tshân-.ni̍h, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Sī-khiàm lâng tuì siâⁿ-.ni̍h tshut-.lâi, tsiū khí-lâi kā in kong-kik, kā in thâi.
English: He took the people, and divided them into three companies, and laid wait in the field; and he looked, and behold, the people came forth out of the city; He rose up against them, and struck them.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsiàm hit só͘-tsāi, mā tio̍h tuà tī hia, in-uī Guá kā hit só͘-tsāi siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: and you shall take possession of the land, and dwell therein; for to you have I given the land to possess it.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Tsiah-ê kám m̄-sī Io-ap kah lí thò uē ê? Tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, guá kí lí ê ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, guá ê tsú — guá ê ông só͘ kóng ê, bô lâng ē phian tsó á phian iū lâi siám-phiah. In-uī lí ê lô͘-po̍k Io-ap huan-hù guá, īng tsiah-ê uē lóng kà lí ê lú-pī kóng.
English: The king said, Is the hand of Joab with you in all this? The woman answered, As your soul lives, my lord the king, none can turn to the right hand or to the left from anything that my lord the king has spoken; for your servant Joab, he bade me, and he put all these words in the mouth of your handmaid;

Tailo: Mê-ji̍t lóng bô sit, i ê ian íng-uán tshìng khí-.lâi; tāi-tāi pha-hng, íng-uán bô lâng king-kuè.
English: It won't be quenched night nor day. Its smoke will go up forever. From generation to generation, it will lie waste. No one will pass through it forever and ever.

Tailo: Koh tshuā liân-tiúⁿ kah kuì-tso̍k kah jîn-bîn ê siú-líng, kah kok lāi ê tsìng lâng, tuì Siōng-tsú ê tiān tshuā ông lo̍h-.lâi, tuì tíng ê mn̂g tsìn-ji̍p ông-kiong, hō͘ ông tsē kok-uī.
English: He took the captains of hundreds, and the nobles, and the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought down the king from the house of Yahweh: and they came through the upper gate to the king's house, and set the king on the throne of the kingdom.

Tailo: Koh īng nâ-sik ê pò͘ tshu tī pâi-lia̍t piáⁿ ê toh, kā tsiah-ê puânn, sî, uánn kah kuàn-tiān ê pue pâi tī hit tíng-bīn, tī hia mā tio̍h ū tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ pâi-siat ê piáⁿ.
English: On the table of show bread they shall spread a blue cloth, and put on it the dishes, the spoons, the bowls, and the cups with which to pour out; and the continual bread shall be on it.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn i kóng, Iô-ná ( Tsù, Iô-há-neh hok-im 21:16 kì tsò Iô-há-neh ) ê kiáⁿ Sí-mòng, lí si̍t-tsāi tsin ū hok-khì, in-uī kā lí khé-sī ê, m̄-sī lâng, sī guá ê Thiⁿ-pē.
English: Jesus answered him, Blessed are you, Simon Bar Jonah, for flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.

Tailo: I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ lâi-kàu Ka-peh-ná-um. An-hioh-ji̍t tsi̍t-ē kàu, I tsiū ji̍p-khì huē-tn̂g kà-sī lâng.
English: They went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Mô͘-se In-uī lín ê sim ngē, tsún lín lî bó͘, m̄-koh, Siōng-tè tī tshòng-sè ê guân-khí-thâu m̄-sī án-ne.
English: He said to them, Moses, because of the hardness of your hearts, allowed you to divorce your wives, but from the beginning it has not been so.

Tailo: Tio̍h ē kì-tit lí tī Ai-gi̍p tē tsò lô͘-lē, Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè kiù-sio̍k lí; in-uī án-ne, guá kin-á-ji̍t bīng-līng lí tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: You shall remember that you were a bondservant in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God redeemed you: therefore I command you this thing today.

Tailo: Gi-lia̍t ê bó͘ mā kā i seⁿ kuí-nā-ê kiáⁿ, i ê bó͘ só͘ seⁿ ê kiáⁿ í-king tuā-hàn, tsiū kā I-é-hú-thah kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, kā i kóng, Lí m̄-thang tī guán lāu-pē ê ke sîng-tsiap sán-gia̍p, in-uī lí sī pa̍t-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ê kiáⁿ.
English: Gilead's wife bore him sons; and when his wife's sons grew up, they drove out Jephthah, and said to him, You shall not inherit in our father's house; for you are the son of another woman.

Tailo: Kiânn tshing-khì ê lé ê tsè-si, tio̍h kā hit-ê ài tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng kah hiah-ê mi̍h, an-tì tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: The priest who cleanses him shall set the man who is to be cleansed, and those things, before Yahweh, at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Ông bīng-līng tsìng lâng kóng, Tio̍h siú Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh lâi ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè, tsiàu tsit-ê iok ê tsheh só͘ kì-tsài ê.
English: The king commanded all the people, saying, Keep the Passover to Yahweh your God, as it is written in this book of the covenant.

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm ê kok kian-kò͘, i kiông-sīng ê sî, tsiū khì-sak Siōng-tsú ê lu̍t-huat, I-su-la-el mā lóng tuè i.
English: It happened, when the kingdom of Rehoboam was established, and he was strong, that he forsook the law of Yahweh, and all Israel with him.

Tailo: I phâng khì hō͘ i tsia̍h, i tsiū khiú i, kā i kóng, Guá ê sió-muē, lí lâi kah guá tsò-hué khùn.
English: When she had brought them near to him to eat, he took hold of her, and said to her, Come, lie with me, my sister.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: Moreover the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Tsiū mn̄g i kóng, ' Pîng-iú, lí ji̍p-lâi tsia ná ē bô tshīng lé-ho̍k? ' Hit-ê lâng tiām-tiām bô ìn.
English: and he said to him, Friend, how did you come in here not wearing wedding clothing?' He was speechless.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tshiánn I-é-sái lâi hù tsit-ê tsè-sū, Guá ē tsí-sī lí só͘ ing-kai kiânn ê tāi-tsì. Guá só͘ tsí-sī lí ê lâng, lí tio̍h thè Guá kā i buah iû.
English: Call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show you what you shall do: and you shall anoint to me him whom I name to you.

Tailo: I bô iông-ín siáⁿ lâng khi-hū in, uī-tio̍h in ê iân-kò͘ I khián-tsik hiah-ê kun-ông.
English: He allowed no one to do them wrong. Yes, he reproved kings for their sakes,

Tailo: Lâng nā ū uan-ke lâi tuì-tsí, kuaⁿ-hú kā i phuàⁿ-tuàn, tsiū tio̍h tīng gī lâng tsò gī, tīng pháiⁿ lâng tsò pháiⁿ.
English: If there be a controversy between men, and they come to judgment, and the judges judge them; then they shall justify the righteous, and condemn the wicked;

Tailo: Jī-.gue̍h, ū tsin tsē lâng tsū-tsi̍p tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tsiâⁿ-tsò tsin tuā ê huē, beh siú Tû-kàⁿ-tseh.
English: There assembled at Jerusalem much people to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great assembly.

Tailo: Koh kóng, Nā A-lâm lâng pí guá khah kiông, lí tsiū lâi pang-tsān guá; nā Am-móng lâng pí lí khah kiông, guá tsiū khì pang-tsān lí.
English: He said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the children of Ammon be too strong for you, then I will come and help you.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú pò-siúⁿ guá, sī tsiàu guá ê gī, mā sī tsiàu guá tī I ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng só͘ tsò ê tshing-khì.
English: Therefore Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness, According to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.

Tailo: Lí kā tsit-ê lâu ling kah bi̍t ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in, to̍h-sī Lí tuì in ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā beh hō͘ in ê.
English: and gave them this land, which you did swear to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey;

Tailo: Guán tsó͘-sian tī tsit-ê suaⁿ kìng-pài, m̄-koh, lín kóng Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsiah sī kìng-pài ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Our fathers worshiped in this mountain, and you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where people ought to worship.

Tailo: In-uī in ê tshuì bô láu-si̍t, in ê sim ok-to̍k muá-muá; in ê nâ-âu sī khui-khui ê bōng; in īng tsi̍h phô͘-tháⁿ lâng.
English: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth. Their heart is destruction. Their throat is an open tomb. They flatter with their tongue.

Tailo: Tsú I-é-su kā in kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu, tsiū siū tsiap tsiūⁿ thiⁿ, tsē tī Siōng-tè ê tsiànn pîng.
English: So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

Tailo: Lô͘-po̍k kah tuè i ê lâng lim-tsia̍h, hioh mê. Thàu-tsá-khí-.lâi, tsiū kóng, Tshiánn tshe guá tńg-khì guá ê tsú-lâng hia.
English: They ate and drank, he and the men who were with him, and stayed all night. They rose up in the morning, and he said, Send me away to my master.

Tailo: I-é-su tuā-siaⁿ huah, Sìn guá ê lâng m̄-sī teh sìn guá, sī sìn tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī.
English: Jesus cried out and said, Whoever believes in me, believes not in me, but in him who sent me.

Tailo: I-é-su koh kā in kóng, Tio̍h tsù-ì lín só͘ thiaⁿ ê. Lín īng siáⁿ-mi̍h niû-khì lâi niû hō͘ lâng, Siōng-tè mā beh īng kāng-khuán ê niû-khì niû hō͘ lín, sīm-tsì ē koh khah ke-thinn hō͘ lín.
English: He said to them, Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ kah Iô-há-neh kā in huāⁿ-tshiú, in tsiū tit-tio̍h Sìng Sîn tshiong-muá.
English: Then they laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

Tailo: Kā i kóng, ' Lī-khui lí ê kò͘-hiong kah tshin-tso̍k, khì guá beh kā lí tsí-sī ê só͘-tsāi. ' ( tsù, CSK 12:1 )
English: and said to him, Get out of your land, and from your relatives, and come into a land which I will show you.'

Tailo: Un-tián kah tsû-pi it-tīng tuè guá kàu tsi̍t-sì-lâng; guá beh íng-uán tuà tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān.
English: Surely goodness and loving kindness shall follow me all the days of my life, And I shall dwell in Yahweh's house forever.

Tailo: Kàu tē-peh ji̍t, in tsiū siat giâm-siok-huē, in-uī in siú hiàn tuâⁿ ê lé tshit ji̍t, koh siú tseh tshit ji̍t.
English: On the eighth day they held a solemn assembly: for they kept the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.

Tailo: Tng Io-lâm ê nî-kan, E-tóm puē-puān Iô-tah, thuat-lī i ê tshiú-thâu, ka-kī siat-li̍p ông.
English: In his days Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah, and made a king over themselves.

Tailo: Tī Siōng-tè hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng hióng-hok ê sî, lí ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá ê tshù ê sue-pāi, tī lí ê tshù lāi ē íng-uán bô tsi̍t-ê lāu lâng.
English: You shall see the affliction of my habitation, in all the wealth which God shall give Israel; and there shall not be an old man in your house forever.

Tailo: Sàu-lô koh kóng, Lín tio̍h tī jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan sì-kè kiânn, kā in kóng, ' Ta̍k lâng khan in ê gû, ta̍k lâng khan in ê iûⁿ, lâi guá tsia, tī tsia thâi lâi tsia̍h, m̄-thang tsia̍h iáu ū hueh ê bah, lâi tik-tsuē Siōng-tsú. ' Hit mê, jîn-bîn ta̍k lâng khan in ê gû khì hia thâi.
English: Saul said, Disperse yourselves among the people, and tell them, Bring me here every man his ox, and every man his sheep, and kill them here, and eat; and don't sin against Yahweh in eating with the blood. All the people brought every man his ox with him that night, and killed them there.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā guá kóng, ' Lí khí-lâi tsò thâu kiânn tī jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng, hō͘ in ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap Guá só͘ tuì in ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā beh hō͘ in ê tē. '
English: Yahweh said to me, Arise, take your journey before the people; and they shall go in and possess the land, which I swore to their fathers to give to them.

Tailo: Guān guá ua̍h-.leh thang hō͘ guá ê sim-sîn o-ló Lí! Guān Lí ê phuàⁿ-tuàn pang-tsān guá!
English: Let my soul live, that I may praise you. Let your ordinances help me.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah Lí tsò-hué; Lí khan guá ê tsiàⁿ tshiú.
English: Nevertheless, I am continually with you. You have held my right hand.

Tailo: Taⁿ guān kā i ê kiáⁿ-sun tshit lâng kau-hù guán, guán beh tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, kā in tiàu tī Siōng-tsú só͘ kíng Sàu-lô ê Gi-be-at. Ông kóng, Guá ē kau hō͘ lín.
English: let seven men of his sons be delivered to us, and we will hang them up to Yahweh in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of Yahweh. The king said, I will give them.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsí-put-kò sī lâng tsō tshut-.lâi ê kàu-kui kah kà-sī, īng liáu tsiū bô lō͘-īng.
English: ( all of which perish with use ) , according to the precepts and doctrines of men?

Tailo: Án-ne, Sìng Sîn só͘ huat-tshut ê kám m̄-sī koh khah ū îng-kng?
English: won't service of the Spirit be with much more glory?

Tailo: Pó-siú lí ê sī Siōng-tsú; Siōng-tsú tī lí ê tsiànn pîng tsò lí ê ìm-ńg pó-hō͘ lí.
English: Yahweh is your keeper. Yahweh is your shade on your right hand.

Tailo: Án-ne tsò sī beh tsong-pī Siōng-tè ê tsú-bîn, thang lâi tsò tshe-īng ê kang, khí-tsō Ki-tok ê sing-khu.
English: for the perfecting of the saints, to the work of serving, to the building up of the body of Christ;

Tailo: Só͘-í, kàu siu-kuah ê ji̍t, Guá beh kā Guá ê ngó͘-kok tuì in the̍h tò tńg-.lâi, koh tī tshut tsiú ê sî, beh kā Guá ê sin tsiú the̍h tò tńg-.lâi, mā beh kā Guá hō͘ i thang jia tshiah-theh ê iûⁿ-mn̂g kah muâ tshiúⁿ tò tńg-.lâi.
English: Therefore I will take back my grain in its time, And my new wine in its season, And will pluck away my wool and my flax which should have covered her nakedness.

Tailo: Lín mā thang īng ông ê miâ tsiàu lín ê ì-sù, siá jū-tsí hō͘ Iô-tah lâng, īng ông ê tshiú-tsí khàm ìn. In-uī kiàn-nā īng ông ê miâ lâi siá ê, īng ông ê tshiú-tsí khàm ìn ê tsiàu, bô lâng ē kā i tshú-siau.
English: Write you also to the Jews, as it pleases you, in the king's name, and seal it with the king's ring; for the writing which is written in the king's name, and sealed with the king's ring, may no man reverse.

Tailo: E-sáu kóng, Lán tshut-huat lâi-.khì, guá tsò thâu-tsîng kiânn.
English: Esau said, Let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will go before you.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá ū tsi̍t kiāⁿ tāi-tsì kiû lí, ǹg-bāng lí m̄-thang kā guá the-sî. Bat-se-ba kóng, Tsò lí kóng.
English: Now I ask one petition of you; don't deny me. She said to him, Say on.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè kóng, ' Guá si̍t-tsāi bat kóng, lí ê ke, lí ê lāu-pē ê ke ē íng-uán kiânn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng; tsóng-.sī, taⁿ Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá tsua̍t-tuì bô beh án-ne, in-uī tsun-tiōng Guá ê, Guá ē kā i tsun-tiōng; biáu-sī Guá ê, i ē siū khuànn-khin.
English: Therefore Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, I said indeed that your house, and the house of your father, should walk before me forever: but now Yahweh says, Be it far from me; for those who honor me I will honor, and those who despise me shall be lightly esteemed.

Tailo: Ē ū huah siaⁿ thuân kàu tē-ki̍k, in-uī Siōng-tsú ē kah lia̍t kok kè-kàu; kiàn-nā ū hia̍t-khì ê, I ē kah in tsing-piān; nā-sī pháiⁿ lâng, I ē kā in kau hō͘ to-kiàm. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: A noise shall come even to the end of the earth; for Yahweh has a controversy with the nations; he will enter into judgment with all flesh: as for the wicked, he will give them to the sword, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá gia̍h thâu kuan-khuàⁿ, lí khuàⁿ, ū sì ki kak.
English: I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, four horns.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá beh hō͘ hiah-ê ap-tsè lí ê tsia̍h ka-kī ê bah, in mā beh lim ka-kī ê hueh lim kàu tsuì, tshin-tshiūnn lim tiⁿ-tsiú án-ne. Kiàn-nā ū hia̍t-khì ê, lóng ē tsai Guá — Siōng-tsú sī lí ê Kiù-tsú, sī kiù-sio̍k lí ê Tsú, sī Iâ-kop ê tuā kuân-lîng-.ê.
English: I will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and all flesh shall know that I, Yahweh, am your Savior, and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

Tailo: I lia̍h hit tsiah liông, to̍h-sī hit bué lāu- tsuâ, mā sī kiò-tsò Mô͘-kuí á-.sī Sa-tán ê, īng thih-liān kā i pa̍k tsi̍t tshing nî .
English: He seized the dragon, the old serpent, which is the devil and Satan, who deceives the whole inhabited earth, and bound him for a thousand years,

Tailo: Án-ne sī beh hō͘ guán tsiah-ê sing kui-ǹg Ki-tok ê lâng, lóng o-ló Siōng-tè ê îng-iāu.
English: to the end that we should be to the praise of his glory, we who had before hoped in Christ:

Tailo: Taⁿ lí tio̍h khì kā Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t kóng: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' Guá bat tī iûⁿ-tiâu, tuì teh kò͘ iûⁿ lâi tiàu lí, tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng ê kun-ông.
English: Now therefore thus shall you tell my servant David, Thus says Yahweh of Armies, I took you from the sheep pen, from following the sheep, that you should be prince over my people Israel:

Tailo: Mô͘-se īng hueh hiù jîn-bîn, kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tse sī li̍p-iok ê hueh, sī Siōng-tsú tsiàu tse it-tshè ê uē kah lín só͘ li̍p ê.
English: Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Look, this is the blood of the covenant, which Yahweh has made with you concerning all these words.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, ' Ua̍h ê kiáⁿ sī guá ê, sí ê kiáⁿ sī lí ê. ' Hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, ' M̄ sī! Sí ê kiáⁿ sī lí ê, ua̍h ê kiáⁿ sī guá ê. '
English: Then said the king, The one says, This is my son who lives, and your son is the dead: and the other says, No; but your son is the dead, and my son is the living.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Tsa-tok tsè-si kah Ná-than sian-ti, Io-ho-iá-tah ê kiáⁿ Be-ná-iah kah Ke-le-thih lâng, Be-le-thi lâng, lóng lo̍h-.khì, hō͘ Só͘-lô-móng khiâ Ta-bi̍t ông ê lô, sàng i kàu Gi-hóng.
English: So Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride on king David's mule, and brought him to Gihon.

Tailo: Iô-tah ông A-sah jī-tsa̍p la̍k nî, Ba-siah ê kiáⁿ E-la̍h tī Til-tsah tsē-uī tsò I-su-la-el ông, kiōng nn̄g nî.
English: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah began Elah the son of Baasha to reign over Israel in Tirzah, and reigned two years.

Tailo: Tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal tio̍h īng tsíng-thâu-á the̍h i ê hueh tām-po̍h, ǹg huē-bō͘ tsîng hiù hueh tshit pái.
English: and Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with his finger, and sprinkle her blood toward the front of the tent of meeting seven times.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm, lí tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú! Si-óng, lí tio̍h o-ló lí ê Siōng-tè!
English: Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem! Praise your God, Zion!

Tailo: I koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h A-má-li̍k, tsiū thê-khí i ê kua, kóng: A-má-li̍k guân-pún tsò tsiah-ê kok ê thâu, tsóng-.sī, i ê kiat-kio̍k ē íng-uán bia̍t-bông.
English: He looked at Amalek, and took up his parable, and said, Amalek was the first of the nations; But his latter end shall come to destruction.

Tailo: Ū ê ka-la̍uh tī tsio̍h-thâu-á tē, thô͘-bah tshián ê só͘-tsāi, in-uī thô͘-bah bô tshim, tsin kín tsiū huat-gê.
English: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.

Tailo: I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê siâⁿ mn̂g, in-uī I-su-la-el lâng ê iân-kò͘, tsiū kuainn tiâu-tiâu, bô lâng tshut-.lâi, mā bô lâng ji̍p-.khì.
English: Now Jericho was tightly shut up because of the children of Israel: none went out, and none came in.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h kî-tha ê tsi-tso̍k, tuì tang kàu sai; Biān-iá-mín tsi̍t hūn.
English: As for the rest of the tribes: from the east side to the west side, Benjamin, one portion.

Tailo: Tuì Guá khún-kiû, Guá tsiū kā lia̍t pang hō͘ lí tsò ki-gia̍p; kā tsuân tē hō͘ lí tsò sán-gia̍p.
English: Ask of me, and I will give the nations for your inheritance, The uttermost parts of the earth for your possession.

Tailo: In kui ji̍t uai-khiok guá ê uē; in só͘ siūⁿ ê lóng sī beh hāi guá.
English: All day long they twist my words. All their thoughts are against me for evil.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ uá-khì kiò-tshéⁿ I-é-su, kóng, Lāu-su ah, lāu-su ah, lán teh beh bô miā lò͘! I-é-su tshénn khí-.lâi, tsik-pī hong kah tuā-íng, hong-íng tsiū tsīng lo̍h-.lâi.
English: They came to him, and awoke him, saying, Master, master, we are dying! He awoke, and rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and it was calm.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ lâi mn̄g I-é-su kóng, Lí sī án-tsuáⁿ tio̍h īng phì-jū kā in kóng?
English: The disciples came, and said to him, Why do you speak to them in parables?

Tailo: Guān ông ē tshin-tshiūⁿ hō͘-tsuí lo̍h tī kuah kuè tsháu ê hn̂g, tshin-tshiūnn ki̍p-sî ê hō͘-tsuí tsu-jūn thó͘-tē.
English: He will come down like rain on the mown grass, As showers that water the earth.

Tailo: Án-ne tsiah bián hō͘ Sa-tán iâⁿ-kuè lán, in-uī lán tsin tshing-tshó Sa-tán ê kuí-kè.
English: that no advantage may be gained over us by Satan; for we are not ignorant of his schemes.

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng án-ne kiânn, ta̍k lâng tsiàu in ê ke-kháu, in ê tsong-tso̍k, kui in ê tuā kî, án-ne tsat iâⁿ, án-ne tshut-huat, lóng sī tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘-se ê lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Thus the children of Israel did. According to all that Yahweh commanded Moses, so they encamped by their standards, and so they set out, everyone by their families, according to their fathers' houses.

Tailo: In ê ba̍k-tsiu khui, tsiū jīn-tshut I sī I-é-su, I suî-sî tuì in tiong-kan siau-sit.
English: Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and he vanished out of their sight.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Lín tsin-tsiàⁿ beh lim guá ê pue, tsóng-.sī, tsē guá ê tsiànn pîng tò pîng, m̄-sī guá ē-tàng hō͘ lâng ê, to̍k-to̍k guá ê Thiⁿ-pē tsiah ē-tàng kuat-tīng beh hō͘ siáⁿ lâng.
English: He said to them, You will indeed drink my cup, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with, but to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it is for whom it has been prepared by my Father.

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ kah tuà tī Iô-tá-iah ê sìn-tô͘ lóng ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h guā-pang lâng mā tsiap-siū Siōng-tè ê tō-lí.
English: Now the apostles and the brothers who were in Judea heard that the Gentiles had also received the word of God.

Tailo: Lâng lóng khuàⁿ-tio̍h I; lâng tuì hn̄g-hn̄g khuàⁿ-tio̍h I.
English: All men have looked thereon. Man sees it afar off.

Tailo: Kiû Lí pó-hō͘ guá thuat-lī in uī-tio̍h guá tiuⁿ ê lô-bāng kah pháiⁿ lâng ê khuan-thò!
English: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, From the traps of the workers of iniquity.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Guá, Guá í-king kóng, Guá mā kíng-tiàu i, tshuā i lâi, i ê lō͘ ē hing-thong.
English: I, even I, have spoken; yes, I have called him; I have brought him, and he shall make his way prosperous.

Tailo: Phel-siah ông Ko-le-si tē-saⁿ nî, ū tāi-tsì hián-sī hō͘ kiò-tsò Bel-ti-sia-tsal ê Ta-ni-el. Tsit-ê tāi-tsì sī tsin-si̍t, sī kóng-tio̍h tuā kau-tsiàn; Ta-ni-el thong-ta̍t tsit-ê tāi-tsì, bîng-pi̍k tsit-ê ī-siōng.
English: In the third year of Cyrus king of Persia a thing was revealed to Daniel, whose name was called Belteshazzar; and the thing was true, even a great warfare: and he understood the thing, and had understanding of the vision.

Tailo: Tshim-ian ê tsuí-guân kah thinn ê khang-khiah lóng kuaiⁿ-ba̍t, thinn-tíng ê hō͘ mā suah.
English: The deep's fountains and the sky's windows were also stopped, and the rain from the sky was restrained.

Tailo: M̄-thang siū hiah-ê thiau-kang khiam-pi lâi kìng-pài thiⁿ-sài ê lâng íng-hióng, suah hō͘ lín sit-khì ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê pò-siúⁿ; hiah-ê lâng uá-khò huàn-sióng, tsiàu in jio̍k-thé ê sim-su, kan-taⁿ teh phòng-hong.
English: Let no one rob you of your prize by a voluntary humility and worshipping of the angels, dwelling in the things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind,

Tailo: Phah-hua lia̍t-hué, siám-phiah lāi to ê sat-hāi; jio̍k-sè tsiâⁿ-tsò kiông-sè, tī tsiàn-tiûⁿ ióng-bíng, kong-phuà guā-kok ê kun-tuī.
English: quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness were made strong, grew mighty in war, and turned to flight armies of aliens.

Tailo: A-bi-iah īng tsi̍t tīn kuè kíng ê ping sì-tsa̍p bān lâng lâi pâi tīn, lóng sī hó-tánn ê tsiàn-sū; Ia-lô-ba-am mā īng kuè kíng ê tuā ióng-sū peh-tsa̍p-bān lâng lâi tuì i pâi tīn.
English: Abijah joined battle with an army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men: and Jeroboam set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men, who were mighty men of valor.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú ah, tó tsi̍t-ê tuā kuân-lîng ê ē-tàng kah Lí pí? Lí ê sìn-si̍t tī Lí ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: Yahweh, God of Armies, who is a mighty one, like you? Yah, your faithfulness is around you.

Tailo: I niû āu-bīn keh-khui ê tē thâu-tsîng ê tshù-the̍h, í-ki̍p tsit pîng, hit pîng lâu ê lông, tn̂g tsi̍t pah tiú, koh niû lāi-tiān kah īⁿ ê lông.
English: He measured the length of the building before the separate place which was at the back of it, and the galleries of it on the one side and on the other side, one hundred cubits; and the inner temple, and the porches of the court;

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh kā in kóng, M̄-sī án-ne. Lín lâi sī beh thàm-thiaⁿ tsit só͘-tsāi ê hi-si̍t.
English: He said to them, No, but you have come to see the nakedness of the land.

Tailo: Tsiaⁿ-gue̍h kan, I-su-la-el tsuân huē-tsiòng lâi-kàu Tsîn ê khòng-iá, jîn-bîn tsiū tuà tī Ka-té-si. Mi-lí-ám sí tī hia, tsiū bâi-tsòng tī hia.
English: The children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came into the wilderness of Zin in the first month: and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there.

Tailo: Tē-.ni̍h siōng khí-thâu si̍k ê mi̍h tio̍h sàng kàu Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ê tshù, tsú suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á m̄-thang īng i ê lāu bú ê ling.
English: You shall bring the first of the first fruits of your ground to the house of Yahweh your God. You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.

Tailo: Guá nā hō͘ lín kan-khó͘-sim, tû-liáu lín tsiah-ê ū kan-khó͘-sim ê lâng í-guā, iáu ū siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng hō͘ guá huann-hí?
English: For if I make you sorry, then who will make me glad but he who is made sorry by me?

Tailo: Ô-bá-tí-ah só͘ tit-tio̍h ê bi̍k-sī. Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng-tio̍h E-tóm kóng: Guán tuì Siōng-tsú hia thiaⁿ-tio̍h siau-sit, mā ū sù-tsiá hōng tshe-khián khì lia̍t kok, kóng: Khí-.lâi, lán tio̍h khí-lâi kah i kau-tsiàn!
English: The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Lord Yahweh says about Edom. We have heard news from Yahweh, and an ambassador is sent among the nations, saying, Arise, and let's rise up against her in battle.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, Siōng-tè ē kuáⁿ-kín thè in tsú-tshî kong-tō. Tsóng-.sī, Jîn-tsú lâi-lîm ê sî, I tī sè-kan kám ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit khuán ê sìn-sim?
English: I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?

Tailo: Sian-ô͘ tsuí-tsinn lóng bô kàu-gia̍h thang kóng; in-uī tit-tio̍h tì-huī iâⁿ-kuè tsin-tsu.
English: No mention shall be made of coral or of crystal: Yes, the price of wisdom is above rubies.

Tailo: Sâm-sóng tshuì-ta kàu-ki̍k, tsiū kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú kóng, Lí kì-jiân īng Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê tshiú kiânn tsiah tuā ê tsín-kiù, tsóng-bô guá taⁿ tio̍h tshuì-ta lâi sí, hām-lo̍h tī bô siū kat-lé ê lâng ê tshiú?
English: He was very thirsty, and called on Yahweh, and said, You have given this great deliverance by the hand of your servant; and now shall I die for thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised.

Tailo: Lí bat thiaⁿ guá ê siann; guá ê thó͘-khuì kiû-kiò, kiû Lí m̄-thang am hīⁿ-khang m̄-thiaⁿ.
English: You heard my voice; don't hide your ear at my breathing, at my cry.

Tailo: Guá tsò gín-á ê sî, kóng-uē tshin-tshiūnn gín-á, sìng-tsîng tshin-tshiūnn gín-á, ì-kiàn tshin-tshiūnn gín-á. Taⁿ guá í-king tuā-lâng ā, tsiū kā gín-á ê tāi-tsì lóng pàng-sak.
English: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child. Now that I have become a man, I have put away childish things.

Tailo: Hō͘ lâng hô-pîng ê lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì, in-uī in ē tsiâⁿ-tsò Siōng-tè ê kiáⁿ-jî!
English: Blessed are the peacemakers, For they shall be called children of God.

Tailo: A-pit-gue̍h, lí tshut Ai-gi̍p, kàu tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê kî, tio̍h siú Tû-kàⁿ-tseh, tshit ji̍t tsia̍h bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, tsiàu Guá só͘ huan-hù ê; tiâu-kìnn Guá ê lâng m̄-thang khang-tshiú.
English: You shall observe the feast of unleavened bread. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month Abib ( for in it you came out from Egypt ) , and no one shall appear before me empty.

Tailo: Kàu hioh mê ê só͘-tsāi, in tiong-kan ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tháu-khui i ê pò͘-tē, beh the̍h hō͘ lî tsia̍h, tsiah khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê gîn iû-guân tī-.leh, hē tī pò͘-tē kháu.
English: As one of them opened his sack to give his donkey food in the lodging place, he saw his money. Behold, it was in the mouth of his sack.

Tailo: Tse-bú-lông sī piàⁿ-miā m̄-kiaⁿ sí ê jîn-bîn; kah Ná-hu-tha-lím tī tshân-iá kuân ê só͘-tsāi, mā sī án-ne.
English: Zebulun was a people that jeopardized their lives to the death, Naphtali, on the high places of the field.

Tailo: Sio̍k Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k thiaⁿ Siōng-tè ê uē. Lín m̄-thiaⁿ, in-uī lín m̄-sī sio̍k Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: He who is of God hears the words of God. For this cause you don't hear, because you are not of God.

Tailo: Pang-kok, lí ê ông nā-sī tsun-kuì ê lâng ê kiáⁿ, lí ê kuì-tso̍k tsiàu-sî lim-tsia̍h, uī-tio̍h beh pó͘ in ê thé-la̍t, m̄-sī in-uī hò͘ⁿ lim, lí tsiū ū hok-khì.
English: Happy are you, land, when your king is the son of nobles, And your princes eat in due season, For strength, and not for drunkenness!

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá khak-sìn lín hui-siông siān-liông, tshiong-muá ta̍k-khuán ê tì-sik, koh ē-hiáu hō͘-siōng khuàn-bián.
English: I myself am also persuaded about you, my brothers , that you yourselves are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish others.

Tailo: I sī Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè, tsuân tē lóng ū I ê phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: He is Yahweh our God; His judgments are in all the earth.

Tailo: Iô-tah tshuā tsi̍t tuī Lô-má ping kah hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ í-ki̍p Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng só͘ phài lâi ê sìng-tiān kíng-uē, gia̍h ting, hué-pé kah bú-khì lâi-kàu hia.
English: Judas then, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.

Tailo: Koh ū līng-guā tsi̍t-ê teh tsiáng-kuán hué ê thiⁿ-sài tuì tsè-tuâⁿ tshut-.lâi, tuì gia̍h lāi ê liâm-li̍k-á hit-ê thiⁿ-sài tuā-siaⁿ huah, Īng lí hit ki lāi ê liâm-li̍k-á khì siu-kuah tē-tsiūⁿ kui pha ê phû-tô, in-uī phû-tô í-king kàu si̍k à.
English: Another angel came out from the altar, he who has power over fire, and he called with a great voice to him who had the sharp sickle, saying, Send forth your sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth, for the earth's grapes are fully ripe!

Tailo: Guá koh tuì tsiah-ê tsè-si kah tsit kok ê tsìng lâng kóng, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lín m̄-thang thiaⁿ hiah-ê sian-ti tuì lín só͘ ī-giân ê. In kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Siōng-tsú ê tiān ê khì-kū bô guā kú ē tuì Ba-bú-lông tuà tńg-lâi'; kî-si̍t in tuì lín só͘ suan-pò͘ ê sī pe̍h-tsha̍t.
English: Also I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, Thus says Yahweh: Don't listen to the words of your prophets who prophesy to you, saying, Behold, the vessels of Yahweh's house shall now shortly be brought again from Babylon; for they prophesy a lie to you.

Tailo: Tong-sî ki-hng phiàn-muá thian-hā, Iô-sé-huh khui ta̍k só͘-tsāi ê tshik-tshng, thiò bí-niûⁿ hō͘ Ai-gi̍p lâng; tī Ai-gi̍p tē ki-hng tsin siong-tiōng.
English: The famine was over all the surface of the earth. Joseph opened all the store houses, and sold to the Egyptians. The famine was severe in the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Taⁿ guán m̄-bián tio̍h sí kám m̄-sī? In-uī tsit-ê tuā-hué ē kā guán sio-bia̍t, guán nā koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè ê siann, tsiū ē sí.
English: Now therefore why should we die? for this great fire will consume us: if we hear the voice of Yahweh our God any more, then we shall die.

Tailo: Kóng, Lí nā-sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông, tio̍h kiù Lí ka-kī.
English: and saying, If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!

Tailo: Jiân-āu ông ē kā tò pîng ê kóng, ' Lín tsiah-ê siū tsiù-tsó͘ ê lâng, tio̍h lī-khui guá, ji̍p-khì uī-tio̍h Mô͘-kuí kah i ê sù-tsiá só͘ tsún-pī ê íng-uán ê hué-.ni̍h.
English: Then he will say also to those on the left hand, Depart from me, you cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels;

Tailo: Jiân-āu I-é-su tuì in kóng, Lín tiong-kan siáⁿ lâng nā ū lî á-.sī gû tī An-hioh-ji̍t pua̍h-lo̍h kau-khut, lín kám bô suî-sî kā i giú khí-.lâi?
English: He answered them, Which of you, if your son or an ox fell into a well, wouldn't immediately pull him out on a Sabbath day?

Tailo: In tsiū kā i kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, í-ki̍p i ê jîn-bîn phah, bô kā i lâu kah tsi̍t-ê, tsiū tit-tio̍h i ê tē.
English: So they struck him, and his sons and all his people, until there was none left him remaining: and they possessed his land.

Tailo: Só͘ hiàn ê sìng-tē í-ki̍p sio̍k tī siâⁿ ê tē, siang pîng tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tē tio̍h kui tī kun-ông. Só͘ hiàn ê tē tī hit nn̄g-bān gō͘-tshing ê thâu-tsîng kàu tang pîng ê kài, koh ǹg sai tī hit nn̄g-bān gō͘-tshing ê thâu-tsîng kàu sai pîng ê kài, kah hiah-ê hūn ê tē sio-kāng, lóng kui tī kun-ông. Só͘ hiàn ê sìng-tē kah tiān ê sìng-tē lóng tī hit lāi-bīn.
English: The residue shall be for the prince, on the one side and on the other of the holy offering and of the possession of the city; in front of the twenty-five thousand of the offering toward the east border, and westward in front of the twenty-five thousand toward the west border, answerable to the portions, it shall be for the prince: and the holy offering and the sanctuary of the house shall be in the midst of it.

Tailo: ( Ta-bi̍t ê si ) Siōng-tsú sī guá ê kng, sī guá ê tsín-kiù; guá iáu-koh tio̍h-kiaⁿ siáⁿ lâng? Siōng-tsú sī guá ua̍h-miā ê khuì-la̍t, guá iáu-koh tio̍h-kiaⁿ siáⁿ lâng?
English: Yahweh is my light and my salvation. Whom shall I fear? Yahweh is the strength of my life. Of whom shall I be afraid?

Tailo: Jiân-āu, A-bu-la-hàm tńg-lâi i hiah-ê siàu-liân po̍k-jîn hia, in tsiū tsò-hué tshut-huat khì Bel-sí-bah. A-bu-la-hàm tsiū tiàm tī Bel-sí-bah.
English: So Abraham returned to his young men, and they rose up and went together to Beersheba. Abraham lived at Beersheba.

Tailo: In tuì Ai-gi̍p tshut-huat, lâi-kàu Ka-nân tē, to̍h-sī in lāu-pē Iâ-kop hia.
English: They went up out of Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan, to Jacob their father.

Tailo: Lín iàu-kín ê sī tio̍h ū nāi-sim, tsiah ē-tàng si̍t-hiān Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì, thang niá-siū I só͘ ìng-ín ê hok-khì.
English: For you need endurance so that, having done the will of God, you may receive the promise.

Tailo: Lín mā khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tiong-kan thang thó-ià ê mi̍h kah in hiah-ê tshâ, tsio̍h, kim, gîn ê ngó͘-siōng.
English: and you have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them ) ;

Tailo: guá tsiū īng kui niá ê iûⁿ-mn̂g hē tī tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ, nā kan-taⁿ iûⁿ-mn̂g ū lō͘-tsuí, thô͘-kha lóng ta-ta, guá tsiū tsai Lí ē tsiàu Lí só͘ kóng ê, īng guá ê tshiú kiù I-su-la-el.
English: behold, I will put a fleece of wool on the threshing floor; if there be dew on the fleece only, and it be dry on all the ground, then shall I know that you will save Israel by my hand, as you have spoken.

Tailo: Tsiàu lán ê lu̍t-huat, bô sing sím-mn̄g koh tshâ-bîng I ū tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h, lán kám ē-tàng kā I tīng tsuē?
English: Does our law judge a man, unless it first hears from him personally and knows what he does?

Tailo: Hui-lī-sū lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h Ta-bi̍t siū buah iû tsò I-su-la-el tsuân kok ê ông, Hui-lī-sū lâng tsiū lóng khí-lâi tshuē Ta-bi̍t. Ta-bi̍t thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tshut-khì kā i tí-ti̍k.
English: When the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David: and David heard of it, and went out against them.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, thàn guá bô tī lín hia ê sî, guá siá tsit tiuⁿ phue hō͘ lín, tsiah bián-tit guá khì-kàu lín hia ê sî, īng Tsú só͘ hō͘ guá ê kuân-pìng lâi giâm-lē tuì-thāi lín; tsit-ê kuân-pìng sī beh khí-tsō, m̄-sī beh phò-huāi.
English: For this cause I write these things while absent, that I may not deal sharply when present, according to the authority which the Lord gave me for building up, and not for tearing down.

Tailo: Guá bat īng tì-huī tshì-giām só͘-ū ê tāi-tsì; guá kóng, guá beh tsò tì-huī ê lâng, tsóng-.sī, tì-huī lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g.
English: All this have I proved in wisdom. I said, I will be wise; but it was far from me.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tuì Khó-la̍h kóng, Lí kah lí ê tóng hiah-ê lâng kah A-lông, bîn-á-tsài lóng tio̍h lâi khiā tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Moses said to Korah, You and all your company go before Yahweh, you, and they, and Aaron, tomorrow:

Tailo: Hit ji̍t ē ū ua̍h-tsuí tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm tshut-.lâi, tsi̍t-puàⁿ lâu-khì tang-hái, tsi̍t-puàⁿ lâu-khì se-hái; kuâⁿ-thiⁿ, jua̍h-thinn lóng sī án-ne.
English: It will happen in that day, that living waters will go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the eastern sea, and half of them toward the western sea; in summer and in winter will it be.

Tailo: In mn̄g Si-óng ê tāi-tsì, bīn ǹg hia, kóng, ' Lâi lah, lín tio̍h kiat íng-uán bô bē kì-.tit ê iok, lâi kah Siōng-tsú liân-ha̍p. '
English: They shall inquire concerning Zion with their faces turned toward it, saying, Come you, and join yourselves to Yahweh in an everlasting covenant that shall not be forgotten.

Tailo: Hū-jîn lâng beh seⁿ kiáⁿ tsiū iu-būn, in-uī i ê sán-kî kàu à; enn-á tshut-sì liáu-āu, i suah bē kì-tit seⁿ kiáⁿ ê thòng-khó͘, in-uī i ē huaⁿ-hí ū enn-á tshut-sì tī sè-kan.
English: A woman, when she gives birth, has sorrow, because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she doesn't remember the anguish any more, for the joy that a human being is born into the world.

Tailo: Lín tiong-kan kiàn-nā tsò I ê tsú-bîn ê, thang tsiūⁿ-khì Iô-tah ê Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm koh khí Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el Siōng-tè ê tiān. Guān i ê Siōng-tè kah i tông-tsāi ( I tsin-tsiàⁿ sī Siōng-tè ) .
English: Whoever there is among you of all his people, his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of Yahweh, the God of Israel ( he is God ) , which is in Jerusalem.

Tailo: Ke-ti-mo͘t kah i ê kau-iá, Me-hua-at kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng sì tsō siâⁿ hō͘ in.
English: Kedemoth with its suburbs, and Mephaath with its suburbs; four cities.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Tsiong-lâi ē ū lāu ê tsa-po͘ lâng kah lāu ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsē tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm khuah ê ke-lō͘, in-uī nî lāu ta̍k-ê lóng gia̍h kuái-á.
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies: Old men and old women will again dwell in the streets of Jerusalem, every man with his staff in his hand for very age.

Tailo: Lí nā ji̍p lí ê tshù-piⁿ iáu-buē kuah ê ngó͘-kok tiong, thang īng tshiú tiah i ê suī, tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang īng liâm-á kuah lí ê tshù-piⁿ ê ngó͘-kok.
English: When you come into your neighbor's standing grain, then you may pluck the ears with your hand; but you shall not move a sickle to your neighbor's standing grain.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng tsò gī lâng sio̍k-huê ê kè-tsînn; kan-tsà ê lâng tsò tsìng-ti̍t lâng ê thè-sin.
English: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous; The treacherous for the upright.

Tailo: Khīng ē tshut-hiān tī hûn ni̍h, Guá beh khuànn i, hō͘ Guá kì-liām Siōng-tè kah tē-tsiūⁿ ta̍k tsióng ū jio̍k-thé ê ua̍h-mi̍h só͘ li̍p íng-uán ê iok.
English: The rainbow will be in the cloud. I will look at it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth.

Tailo: La̍h-ban koh tuì Iâ-kop kóng, Lí khuàⁿ tsit tui tsio̍h, lí khuàⁿ tsit ki thiāu, to̍h-sī guá só͘ hē tī lí guá ê tiong-kan ê.
English: Laban said to Jacob, See this heap, and see the pillar, which I have set between me and you.

Tailo: Khiā tī piⁿ-á ê lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kóng, I teh kiò E-li-iah.
English: Some of them who stood there, when they heard it, said, This man is calling Elijah.

Tailo: In ē uī lí tsò ai-ko: Lí tsit-ê ū miâ-siaⁿ ê siâⁿ, pîng-sî sī kiâⁿ-tsûn ê lâng só͘ tuà, tī hái bīn tsò kian-kò͘ ê; pîng-siông ji̍t, i kah tuà tī hia ê jîn-bîn, hō͘ só͘-ū tiàm tī hia ê lâng lóng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, taⁿ ná ē bia̍t-bông à!
English: They shall take up a lamentation over you, and tell you, How are you destroyed, who were inhabited by seafaring men, the renowned city, who was strong in the sea, she and her inhabitants, who caused their terror to be on all who lived there!

Tailo: Ba̍k-tshiūⁿ khan tsîn-suàⁿ, īng pit lâi uē, īng lāi to lâi khik, īng îⁿ-tshioh uē bô͘, hóng lâng ê hîng, tsò tshin-tshiūnn lâng ê suí, hō͘ i tiàm tī tshù lāi.
English: The carpenter stretches out a line; he marks it out with a pencil; he shapes it with planes, and he marks it out with the compasses, and shapes it after the figure of a man, according to the beauty of a man, to dwell in a house.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: Then came the word of Yahweh to Jeremiah, saying,

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tsē-uī tē-sì nî, jī-gue̍h tshe jī, tāng-kang lâi khí sìng-tiān.
English: He began to build in the second day of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì A-bú-lâm tshut-hiān, kóng, Guá ē kā tsit-ê só͘-tsāi siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ-sun. I tsiū tī hia uī-tio̍h tuì i tshut-hiān ê Siōng-tsú khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ.
English: Yahweh appeared to Abram and said, I will give this land to your seed . He built an altar there to Yahweh, who appeared to him.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tsú ê siū-khì lîm-kàu Iô-tah kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm, hō͘ in phiau-liû, hō͘ lâng tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, thí-tshiò tshin-tshiūnn lín tshin-ba̍k só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê.
English: Therefore the wrath of Yahweh was on Judah and Jerusalem, and he has delivered them to be tossed back and forth, to be an astonishment, and a hissing, as you see with your eyes.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Taⁿ tsit-ê sī guá kut lāi ê kut, bah lāi ê bah; guá beh kā i kiò-tsò tsa-bó͘ lâng, in-uī i sī tuì tsa-po͘ lâng the̍h tshut-.lâi ê.
English: The man said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

Tailo: I-é-su tuì kûn-tsiòng lóng īng phì-jū kā in kóng. Sū-si̍t siōng, ta̍k pái kah in kóng-uē lóng ū īng phì-jū.
English: Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the multitudes; and without a parable, he didn't speak to them,

Tailo: lín tsi̍t-ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h sàu-kak, ta̍t-á, pî-pê, khîm, sik, sing kah ta̍k tsióng ga̍k-khì ê siann, tio̍h phak lo̍h-khì kìng-pài Nep-kat-ne-tsal ông só͘ li̍p ê kim-siōng.
English: that whenever you hear the sound of the horn, flute, zither, lyre, harp, pipe, and all kinds of music, you fall down and worship the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the king has set up;

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá ài lín tsai tsit-ê ò-pì, bián-tit lín ka-kī lia̍h-tsò ū tì-huī. Tsit-ê ò-pì to̍h-sī, tsi̍t-pō͘-hūn ê I-su-la-el lâng tsiām-sî ngē-sim, thìng-hāu kàu guā-pang lâng tsuân-pō͘ kui Tsú uî-tsí;
English: For I don't desire, brothers, to have you ignorant of this mystery, so that you won't be wise in your own conceits, that a partial hardening has happened to Israel, until the fullness of the Gentiles has come in,

Tailo: A-lâm lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tī I-su-la-el lâng ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su, tsiū koh tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi.
English: When the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they gathered themselves together.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bô tshing-khì ê lâng só͘ bong-tio̍h ê, tsiū bô tshing-khì; bong-tio̍h i ê, it-tīng bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: Whatever the unclean person touches shall be unclean; and the soul that touches it shall be unclean until even.

Tailo: Kiû Lí mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne īng Lí ê kông hong kā in jiok, īng Lí ê tuā hong hō͘ in kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: So pursue them with your tempest, And terrify them with your storm.

Tailo: In thìng-hāu kàu tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i bô khui lâu-tíng ê mn̂g, tsiū gia̍h só-sî lâi khui, lí khuàⁿ, in ê tsú-lâng í-king sí-.khì, tó tī thô͘-kha.
English: They waited until they were ashamed; and behold, he didn't open the doors of the upper room: therefore they took the key, and opened them, and behold, their lord was fallen down dead on the earth.

Tailo: Sio̍k Tse-bú-lông ê tsi-tso̍k king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê,
English: Of the children of Zebulun, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;

Tailo: Koh lín mā ē uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘, hō͘ lâng thua-khì tsóng-tok kah kun-ông ê bīn-tsîng, lâi tuì in kah guā-pang lâng tsò kiàn-tsìng.
English: Yes, and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the nations.

Tailo: M̄-koh, I-é-su án-ne kóng sī teh tsí I ka-kī sing-khu ê tiān.
English: But he spoke of the temple of his body.

Tailo: Uē tú-á kóng suah, ông hiah-ê kiáⁿ tsiū kàu-uī, khui-siaⁿ thî-khàu; ông kah jîn-sîn mā lóng tuā thî-khàu, pi-siong kàu-ki̍k.
English: It happened, as soon as he had made an end of speaking, that behold, the king's sons came, and lifted up their voice, and wept: and the king also and all his servants wept very sore.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā sim-lāi ū tì-huī ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tshin-tshiú pháng-se, kā só͘ pháng ê nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê pò͘-liāu kah iù-tē lóng the̍h-lâi hiàn.
English: All the women who were wise-hearted spun with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, the blue, the purple, the scarlet, and the fine linen.

Tailo: Guán kā guá ê tsú kóng, ' Gín-á bē-tàng lī-khui i ê lāu-pē, nā lī-khui i ê lāu-pē, lāu-pē it-tīng ē sí. '
English: We said to my lord, The boy can't leave his father: for if he should leave his father, his father would die.'

Tailo: Só͘-í, hit tè hn̂g kàu taⁿ iáu kiò-tsò Hueh-hn̂g .
English: Therefore that field was called The Field of Blood to this day.

Tailo: In-uī Lí bat īng khuì-la̍t hâ guá, hō͘ guá ē kau-tsiàn, Lí hō͘ hiah-ê khí-lâi kong-kik guá ê, lóng khut-ho̍k tī guá.
English: For you have girded me with strength to the battle; You have subdued under me those who rose up against me.

Tailo: Hit-ê hū-jîn-lâng seⁿ tsi̍t-ê tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī tsiong-lâi beh īng thih-kuái thóng-tī bān-pang ê; i ê kiáⁿ hō͘ lâng tsiap-khì Siōng-tè ê bīn-tsîng, lâi-kàu I ê pó-tsō hia.
English: She gave birth to a son, a male child, who is to rule all the nations with a rod of iron. Her child was caught up to God, and to his throne.

Tailo: I ìn khiā tī i bīn-tsîng ê kóng, Lín tio̍h kā i ù-uè ê saⁿ thǹg khí-.lâi , koh tuì i kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, guá hō͘ lí thuat-lī lí ê tsuē-ok, beh hō͘ lí tshīng suí ê saⁿ.
English: He answered and spoke to those who stood before him, saying, Take the filthy garments off of him. To him he said, Behold, I have caused your iniquity to pass from you, and I will clothe you with rich clothing.

Tailo: E-sáu gia̍h thâu khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsa-bó͘ lâng kah gín-á, tsiū kóng, Tsiah-ê kah lí tâng kiâⁿ ê sī siáⁿ lâng? Iâ-kop ìn kóng, Tsiah-ê gín-á sī Siōng-tè si un hō͘ lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê.
English: He lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who are these with you? He said, The children whom God has graciously given your servant.

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kám bô lóng kì tī Iô-tah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and all that he did, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Tailo: Kiû Lí m̄-thang bē kì-tit Lí tuì-ti̍k ê huah siaⁿ; Hiah-ê khí-lâi kong-kik Lí ê lâng ê hán-huah tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsiūⁿ-kàu tíng-bīn.
English: Don't forget the voice of your adversaries. The tumult of those who rise up against you ascends continually.

Tailo: Khi-hū sàn-tshiah lâng lâi lī-ik ka-kī, koh sàng lé-mi̍h hō͘ hó-gia̍h lâng ê lâng, lóng ē tì-kàu khiàm-khueh.
English: Whoever oppresses the poor for his own increase and whoever gives to the rich, Both come to poverty.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, I-su-la-el tiong ū tsit-ê lē, I-su-la-el tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á ta̍k nî khì tui-tō Gi-lia̍t lâng I-é-hú-thah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, muí nî sì ji̍t.
English: that the daughters of Israel went yearly to celebrate the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in a year.

Tailo: tì-sú lâng bô saⁿ thǹg-pak-theh lâi kiâⁿ; pak-tó͘ iau-iau teh taⁿ tiū-pé.
English: So that they go around naked without clothing. Being hungry, they carry the sheaves.

Tailo: Piáu-bīn khuàⁿ khí-.lâi, pài thiⁿ-sài, ké khiam-pi, gi̍k-thāi ka-kī ê sing-khu kah-ná sī ū tì-huī, kî-si̍t tuì khòng-tsè jio̍k-thé ê tsîng-io̍k lóng bô lō͘-īng.
English: Which things indeed appear like wisdom in self-imposed worship, and humility, and severity to the body; but aren't of any value against the indulgence of the flesh.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē tsai i ê sit-tshò? Kiû Lí tû-khì guá bô-ì-tiong só͘ huān ê kuè-sit.
English: Who can discern his errors? Forgive me from hidden errors.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, A-siul lâng ē sí tī to hā, m̄-sī tuì lâng, mā m̄-sī pîng-siông lâng ê to ē-tàng kā i bia̍t-tiāu. I ē tuì to ê bīn-tsîng lâi tô-siám, i ê siàu-liân lâng ē tsò khó͘-kang.
English: The Assyrian will fall by the sword, not of man; And the sword, not of mankind, shall devour him. He will flee from the sword, And his young men will become subject to forced labor.

Tailo: Suaⁿ lāi ê pue-tsiáu, guá lóng bat; khòng-iá ê tsáu-siù mā lóng sio̍k guá.
English: I know all the birds of the mountains. The wild animals of the field are mine.

Tailo: Kî-tó ê sî, I-é-su ê bīn-māu ū kái-piàn. I ê saⁿ piàn kah pe̍h-siak-siak koh kng iàⁿ-iàⁿ.
English: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tsiū hun-tso͘ lâi tsē, ū ê tsi̍t pah lâng, ū ê gō͘-tsa̍p lâng.
English: They sat down in ranks, by hundreds and by fifties.

Tailo: In ê sim tūn tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ iû pau-ba̍t, tsóng-.sī, guá ì-ài Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: Their heart is as callous as the fat, But I delight in your law.

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ nî bué tsiū kā i tsing-ho̍k. Hi-tse-kia la̍k nî, I-su-la-el ông Hô-sè-a káu nî, Sa-má-lī-a hō͘ i tsing-ho̍k khì.
English: At the end of three years they took it: in the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken.

Tailo: Ngó͘-siōng ē tsò tsi̍t-ē siau-bia̍t.
English: The idols shall utterly pass away.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tuì lín ê siā-un-tsè, īng tsiànn-thuí tsò kí-tsè, kui hō͘ tsè-si.
English: The right thigh you shall give to the priest for a heave offering out of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.

Tailo: Sìn I ê lâng bē siū sím-phuàⁿ, m̄-sìn I ê lâng í-king siū tīng tsuē, in-uī i m̄-sìn Siōng-tè ê to̍k-seⁿ Kiáⁿ.
English: He who believes in him is not judged. He who doesn't believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.

Tailo: ' Bô-lūn kah siáⁿ-mi̍h siù kau-ha̍p ê, lóng tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! ' Jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h kóng, ' A-men! '
English: Cursed be he who lies with any manner of animal. All the people shall say, Amen.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ i pí thiⁿ-sài ( Tsù, guân-bûn sī Siōng-tè , guân i̍k-pún i̍k-tsò Thiⁿ-sài ) sió-khuá khah su, koh siúⁿ-sù îng-kng tsun-kuì hō͘ i tsò bián-liû.
English: For you have made him a little lower than God, And crowned him with glory and honor.

Tailo: A-lâm ông ū huan-hù i ê tsiàn-tshia ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ saⁿ-tsa̍p-jī-ê, kóng, Bô-lūn tuā-sè m̄-thang kah in kau-tsiàn, tsí ū kah I-su-la-el ông kau-tsiàn.
English: Now the king of Syria had commanded the thirty-two captains of his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the king of Israel.

Tailo: Mā tio̍h thîn iû tī hit tíng-bīn, hē jú-hiuⁿ tī hit tíng-bīn, tse sī sò͘-tsè.
English: You shall put oil on it, and lay frankincense on it: it is a meal offering.

Tailo: Tuì kî-tha ê lâng guá kóng ( m̄-sī Tsú kóng ê ) , nā lâm-sìn-tô͘ tshuā bô sìn Tsú ê lâng tsò bó͘, in bó͘ huann-hí tsò-hué tuà, tsiū m̄-thang kā i pàng-sak.
English: But to the rest Inot the Lordsay, if any brother has an unbelieving wife, and she is content to live with him, let him not leave her.

Tailo: Kā îng-kng hō͘ gû-gōng ê lâng, tú tshin-tshiūnn kā tsi̍t pò͘-tē ê pó-tsio̍h khǹg tī tsio̍h-tui lāi-bīn.
English: As one who binds a stone in a sling, So is he who gives honor to a fool.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t thàu-tsá khí-.lâi, kā iûⁿ-kûn kau hō͘ tsi̍t-ê kò͘-siú ê lâng, tsiàu I-é-sái só͘ bīng-līng i ê, tuà tsia̍h-mi̍h khì-kàu pâi-lia̍t tshia ê só͘-tsāi. Kun-ping tú-á tshut-khì kàu tsiàn-tiûⁿ, huah beh kau-tsiàn.
English: David rose up early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the place of the wagons, as the army which was going forth to the fight shouted for the battle.

Tailo: I tsiū huah hit-ê tuì Iô-tah lâi ê Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, ' In-uī lí uî-puē Siōng-tsú ê uē, bô siú Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ bīng-līng lí ê,
English: and he cried to the man of God who came from Judah, saying, Thus says Yahweh, Because you have been disobedient to the mouth of Yahweh, and have not kept the commandment which Yahweh your God commanded you,

Tailo: Suà-tsiap i ê sī Gi-bóng lâng Bí-la̍h-thê, Me-lóng lâng Ngá-tùn kah Gi-bóng lâng, í-ki̍p sio̍k hô guā ê tsóng-tok só͘ kuán ê Mi-su-peh lâng siu-lí.
English: Next to them repaired Melatiah the Gibeonite, and Jadon the Meronothite, the men of Gibeon, and of Mizpah, that appertained to the throne of the governor beyond the River.

Tailo: Tī An-hioh-ji̍t, guán tshut siâⁿ mn̂g guā lâi-kàu hô piⁿ, siūⁿ kóng tī hia ū kî-tó ê só͘-tsāi. Guán tsiū tsē lo̍h-.lâi kah tsū-tsi̍p tī hia ê hū-jîn-lâng tâm-lūn tō-lí.
English: On the Sabbath day we went forth outside of the city by a riverside, where we supposed there was a place of prayer, and we sat down, and spoke to the women who had come together.

Tailo: Tsit sî liáu-āu, Mô͘-ap lâng kah Am-móng lâng, koh ū Mi-u-nî lâng tsò-hué lâi, beh kah Iô-sa-huat kau-tsiàn.
English: It happened after this, that the children of Moab, and the children of Ammon, and with them some of the Ammonites, came against Jehoshaphat to battle.

Tailo: Ké hó ê lâng, tī kui tīn tiong ū kang ê tsing-seⁿ, i hē guān ê sî tsiū īng ū khuat-tiám ê hiàn hō͘ Tsú, tsit khuán ê lâng thang tsiù-tsó͘. In-uī Guá sī tuā kun-ông, Guá ê miâ tī lia̍t kok tiong sī thang kiaⁿ-uì ê. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: But the deceiver is cursed, who has in his flock a male, and vows, and sacrifices to the Lord a blemished thing; for I am a great King, says Yahweh of Armies, and my name is awesome among the nations.

Tailo: Lâng só͘ ì-ài sī i ê jîn-tsû; sàn-tshiah pí kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t khah hó.
English: That which makes a man to be desired is his kindness. A poor man is better than a liar.

Tailo: In-uī i ê tsit sī kin-tuè A-lông ê kiáⁿ-sun lâi tsò Siōng-tsú tiān ê kang, to̍h-sī tī tsiah-ê īⁿ kah tsiah-ê pâng lâi tsò-kang, mā hō͘ tsiah-ê sìng-mi̍h tshing-khì, lâi tsò Siōng-tsú tiān ê kang,
English: For their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of Yahweh, in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, even the work of the service of the house of God;

Tailo: Hit-ê tē tio̍h pun hō͘ tsiah-ê lâng tsò sán-gia̍p, tsiàu in ê miâ-gia̍h.
English: To these the land shall be divided for an inheritance according to the number of names.

Tailo: Tī A-hap ê kiáⁿ Io-lâm tsa̍p-it nî, A-ha-tsiah khai-sí tsò Iô-tah ông.
English: In the eleventh year of Joram the son of Ahab began Ahaziah to reign over Judah.

Tailo: Kàu-tok lí ê kiáⁿ, i tsiū ē hō͘ lí an-sim; i mā ē hō͘ lí ê sim huann-hí.
English: Correct your son, and he will give you peace; Yes, he will bring delight to your soul.

Tailo: In-uī guá beh jīn guá ê tsuē-ok, koh uī-tio̍h guá ê tsuē lâi iu-būn.
English: For I will declare my iniquity. I will be sorry for my sin.

Tailo: In koh kā Ai siânn ê ông tiàu tī tshiū tíng, kàu hông-hun ji̍t lo̍h ê sî, Io-siú-ah tshut bīng-līng, lâng tsiū tuì tshiū tíng kā sin-si siu lo̍h-.lâi, hiat tī siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, tī hit tíng-bīn thia̍p tsi̍t tuā-tui ê tsio̍h-thâu, kàu kin-á-ji̍t iáu tī-.leh.
English: The king of Ai he hanged on a tree until the evening: and at the going down of the sun Joshua commanded, and they took his body down from the tree, and cast it at the entrance of the gate of the city, and raised thereon a great heap of stones, to this day.

Tailo: Sian-ti kóng, Guá khùn-tshéⁿ teh siūⁿ, guá ê khùn tsin huann-hí!
English: On this I awakened, and saw; and my sleep was sweet to me.

Tailo: In tī Sī-lô lim-tsia̍h liáu-āu, Han-nah tsiū khí-.lâi. Tsè-si E-lī tī Siōng-tsú tiān ê mn̂g-khing piⁿ, tsē tī i ê uī.
English: So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest was sitting on his seat by the doorpost of the temple of Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín ē in-uī guá ê miâ hō͘ tsìng lâng uàn-hūn, to̍k-to̍k jím-nāi kàu-té ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h kiù.
English: You will be hated by all men for my name's sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.

Tailo: Tsing-lūn ná lâi ná ki̍k-lia̍t, iâⁿ-tiúⁿ kiaⁿ Páu-lô khì hō͘ in thiah-tshuì, tsiū bīng-līng ping-á lo̍h-.khì, tuì in tiong-kan kā Páu-lô tshiúⁿ tshut-.lâi, kā i tshuā ji̍p-khì iâⁿ-pâng.
English: When a great argument arose, the commanding officer, fearing that Paul would be torn in pieces by them, commanded the soldiers to go down and take him by force from among them, and bring him into the barracks.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kuè suaⁿ tíng bô guā hn̄g, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Me-hui-bo-siat ê lô͘-po̍k Tsi-bah lâi tú-tio̍h i, i tuà kuà-uaⁿ ê lî nn̄g tsiah, tsài piáⁿ nn̄g pah, phû-tô kuaⁿ tsi̍t pah pha, jua̍h-thinn ê kué-tsí tsi̍t pah kah tsiú tsi̍t phuê-tē-á.
English: When David was a little past the top of the ascent, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him, with a couple of donkeys saddled, and on them two hundred loaves of bread, and one hundred clusters of raisins, and one hundred summer fruits, and a bottle of wine.

Tailo: Lâng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ siū tsik-hua̍t, iû-guân ngē i ê ām-kún, i ē hut-jiân-kan pāi-huāi, lóng bô huat-tō͘ thang i-tī.
English: He who is often rebuked and stiffens his neck Will be destroyed suddenly, with no remedy.

Tailo: In-uī lín nā sià-bián lâng ê kuè-sit, Thiⁿ-pē mā ē sià-bián lín.
English: For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

Tailo: Lâi tsiò lán tsiah-ê tiàm tī o͘-àm kah sí-ìm tiong ê lâng, ín-tshuā lán ê kha kiâⁿ-ji̍p pîng-an ê lō͘.
English: To shine on those who sit in darkness and the shadow of death; To guide our feet into the way of peace.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā in buah iû, tshin-tshiūnn buah in lāu-pē sio-siâng, hō͘ in tsò tsè-si lâi ho̍k-sāi Guá. In siū buah iû beh íng-uán tsò tsè-si, kàu ta̍k sè-tāi.
English: You shall anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may minister to me in the priest's office. Their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.

Tailo: Ū lâng pò Ta-bi̍t kóng, A-hi-to-huel mā tuè Αp-sa-lôm tī puān-tóng ê tiong-kan. Ta-bi̍t kóng, Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí hō͘ A-hi-to-huel ê kè-bô͘ piàn-tsò gōng tāi-tsì!
English: One told David, saying, Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom. David said, Yahweh, please turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng ū huat-tshut bīng-līng, nā ū lâng tsai I-é-su tī tó-uī, tio̍h lâi pò-kò, hō͘ in thang khì kā I lia̍h khí-.lâi.
English: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had commanded that if anyone knew where he was, he should report it, that they might seize him.

Tailo: Guá ū tshiánn Lí ê bûn-tô͘ kuáⁿ siâ-sîn, in mā lóng bô i huat.
English: I begged your disciples to cast it out, and they couldn't.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tī Siōng-tsú ê tuâⁿ, to̍h-sī tī mn̂g-lông ê thâu-tsîng só͘ khí ê, hiàn sio-tsè hō͘ Siōng-tsú;
English: Then Solomon offered burnt offerings to Yahweh on the altar of Yahweh, which he had built before the porch,

Tailo: Tuì tiúⁿ-ló ê khòng-kò, nā m̄-sī ū nn̄g-ê á-.sī saⁿ-ê tsìng-jîn, tsiū m̄-thang siū-lí.
English: Don't receive an accusation against an elder, except at the word of two or three witnesses.

Tailo: In kìng-jiân īng in khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h hē tī īng Guá ê miâ só͘ tshing-ho͘ ê tshù, lâi kā i uè lah-sap.
English: But they set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.

Tailo: A-to-nî-iah kā i kóng, Ji̍p-.lāi! Lí sī thò-tòng ê lâng, it-tīng sī pò hó siau-sit.
English: While he yet spoke, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came: and Adonijah said, Come in; for you are a worthy man, and bring good news.

Tailo: ē tshú lín ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ thè i tsè-tsō phang-iû, tsò tsú-tsia̍h ê, tsò piak piáⁿ ê;
English: He will take your daughters to be perfumers, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.

Tailo: Tē-peh ji̍t, i tio̍h īng nn̄g tsiah pan-kah á-.sī nn̄g tsiah hún-tsiáu-kiáⁿ, tuà kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, kau-tài tsè-si.
English: On the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, to the door of the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Guá siá phue kià hō͘ lí — Tî-to, tī lán kiōng-tông ê sìn-gióng tiong, lí sī guá tsin ê kiáⁿ. Guān Thiⁿ-pē Siōng-tè kah lán ê Kiù-tsú Ki-tok I-é-su, sù lí un-tián kah pîng-an.
English: to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.

Tailo: I ê tshùn-tshioh to̍h-sī án-ne: pak bīn sì-tshing gō͘-pah, lâm bīn sì-tshing gō͘-pah, tang bīn sì-tshing gō͘-pah, sai-bīn sì-tshing gō͘-pah.
English: These shall be the measures of it: the north side four thousand and five hundred, and the south side four thousand and five hundred, and on the east side four thousand and five hundred, and the west side four thousand and five hundred.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú tsù-ba̍k khuànn tsit-ê ū tsuē ê kok, Guá beh tuì tē-tsiūⁿ kā i siau-bia̍t, tsóng-.sī, bô beh tsuân-pō͘ siau-bia̍t Iâ-kop ê ke. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Behold, the eyes of the Lord Yahweh are on the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the surface of the earth; except that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Nā ū hó-gia̍h lâng kuà kim tshiú-tsí, tshīng suí saⁿ ji̍p-lâi lín ê huē-tn̂g, koh ū tshīng phuà-saⁿ ê sàn-tshiah lâng ji̍p-.lâi,
English: For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your synagogue , and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in;

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lán tsū-iû, Ki-tok í-king kā lán tháu-pàng, só͘-í, lín tio̍h khiā ho͘ tsāi, m̄-thang koh hō͘ lâng ap-tsè tsò lô͘-lē.
English: Stand firm therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free, and don't be entangled again with a yoke of bondage.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h huan-hù I-su-la-el lâng, kā in kóng, ' Lâng nā huān-tio̍h ē-sin lâu-lâng ê tsìng-thâu, i in-uī tsit-ê ē-sin lâu-lâng ê tsìng-thâu tsiū bô tshing-khì.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, When any man has a discharge from his body, because of his discharge he is unclean.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū tuì sìn I ê Iô-tá-iah lâng kóng, Lín nā tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsun-siú guá ê tō-lí, tsiū tsin-tsiàⁿ sī guá ê bûn-tô͘.
English: Jesus therefore said to those Jews who had believed him, If you remain in my word, then you are truly my disciples.

Tailo: Suan-káng Siōng-tè sìn-sit ê lâng, tio̍h ài ē-hiáu iok-sok ka-kī ê un-sù,
English: The spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets,

Tailo: I beh īng thih-kuái kā in kuán-hat, tshin-tshiūnn kā huî-khì kòng tshuì; guá mā ū án-ne tuì guá ê Thiⁿ-pē niá-siū kuân-pìng.
English: He will rule them with a rod of iron, shattering them like clay pots; as I also have received of my Father:

Tailo: Hit sî, bûn-tô͘ ke-thinn tsin tsē, ū kóng Hi-la̍h uē ê Iô-tá-iah lâng tuì Hi-bú-lâi lâng tshut uàn-giân, in-uī tī ji̍t-siông sing-ua̍h ê phuè-kip, bô kò͘-tio̍h in ê kuáⁿ-hū.
English: Now in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplying, a complaint arose from the Hellenists against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily service.

Tailo: I kā guá kóng, Tsit king ǹg lâm ê pâng sī hō͘ tam-tng kò͘ tshù ê tsè-si īng ê;
English: He said to me, This chamber, whose prospect is toward the south, is for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the house;

Tailo: Guá beh kā lín ê kiáⁿ-jî bē tī Iô-tah lâng ê tshiú tiong, in ē kā in bē hō͘ Sí-bah lâng, to̍h-sī hn̄g-hn̄g ê kok. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: And I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hands of the children of Judah, And they will sell them to the men of Sheba, To a faraway nation, For Yahweh has spoken it.

Tailo: Guá taⁿ khiā tī tsuí-tséⁿ piⁿ, tuì tsi̍t-ê tshut-lâi tshiūⁿ tsuí ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á kóng, ' Tshiáⁿ lí kā lí pân-.ni̍h ê tsuí tām-po̍h-á hō͘ guá lim;
English: behold, I am standing by this spring of water. Let it happen, that the maiden who comes forth to draw, to whom I will say, Give me, I pray you, a little water from your pitcher to drink,

Tailo: Siōng-tè koh ìn Io-buh kóng:
English: Moreover Yahweh answered Job,

Tailo: Liân sian-ti kah tsè-si to sī siat-to̍k ê, to̍h-sī tī Guá ê tshù lāi, Guá mā khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê pháiⁿ. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: for both prophet and priest are profane; yes, in my house have I found their wickedness, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Ū sîn-lîng tuì guá bīn-tsîng king-kuè; guá sing-khu ê mn̂g-kńg lóng tshàng khí-.lâi.
English: Then a spirit passed before my face; The hair of my flesh stood up.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Lín tio̍h kā hông-tè ê la̍p hō͘ hông-tè; kā Siōng-tè ê la̍p hō͘ Siōng-tè. In tuì I-é-su ê huê-tap kám-kak tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ.
English: Jesus answered them, Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's. They marveled greatly at him.

Tailo: Ha-tsa-el kóng, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k sī siáⁿ-mi̍h, tsí-put-kò sī tsi̍t tsiah káu, ná ē kiânn tsit-ê tuā sū? E-lí-siah ìn kóng : Siōng-tsú ū kā guá tsí-sī, lí ē tsò A-lâm ông.
English: Hazael said, But what is your servant, who is but a dog, that he should do this great thing? Elisha answered, Yahweh has shown me that you shall be king over Syria.

Tailo: Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Gî-tióng nî lāu huè tsē, tsiū sí, bâi-tsòng tī A-bi-e-tsel tso̍k ê O͘-hu-lah, tī i ê lāu-pē Io-a-si ê bōng.
English: Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the tomb of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

Tailo: In-uī tsuân-pō͘ lu̍t-huat lóng pau-hâm tī Thiàⁿ tshù-piⁿ tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī tsit tiâu kài-bīng lāi-bīn.
English: For the whole law is fulfilled in one word, in this: You shall love your neighbor as yourself.

Tailo: Guá ì-ài Lí ê uē, tshin-tshiūnn lâng tit-tio̍h tsin tsē thâi-iâⁿ ê mi̍h.
English: I rejoice at your word, As one who finds great spoil.

Tailo: Ông tsiū bīng-līng tsiàu án-ne khì tsò. Hit-ê jū-tsí thuân tī Su-san, lâng tsiū kā Ha-mán tsa̍p-ê kiáⁿ tiàu khí-.lâi.
English: The king commanded it so to be done: and a decree was given out in Shushan; and they hanged Haman's ten sons.

Tailo: In tsiàu in ê bí-niûⁿ tit-tio̍h tsia̍h pá; í-king tsia̍h pá, in ê sim tsiū kiau-ngō͘, tsiū án-ne bē kì-tit Guá.
English: According to their pasture, so were they filled; They were filled, and their heart was exalted. Therefore they have forgotten me.

Tailo: Ka-le̍p tī Mô͘-se ê bīn-tsîng an-uì jîn-bîn, kóng, Lán tio̍h tsik-sî khì, thang lâi tit-tio̍h hit só͘-tsāi, lán ū kàu-gia̍h ê la̍t, ē khah iâⁿ in.
English: Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, Let us go up at once, and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it.

Tailo: Bô Mô͘-se lu̍t-huat ê guā-pang lâng nā tsiàu pún-sìng tsun-hîng lu̍t-huat ê kui-tīng, in pún-sin to̍h-sī ka-kī ê lu̍t-huat.
English: ( for when Gentiles who don't have the law do by nature the things of the law, these, not having the law, are a law to themselves,

Tailo: Mā ū lâng thí-tshiò in kóng, In sī lim sin tsiú teh tsuì.
English: Others, mocking, said, They are filled with new wine.

Tailo: Guá ê sim nā siūⁿ-khí tsiah-ê, tī guá ê pak lāi tsiū ut-būn.
English: My soul still remembers them, and is bowed down within me.

Tailo: Tsú suah piàn-tsò tshin-tshiūnn tuì-ti̍k, thun-bia̍t I-su-la-el, I thun-bia̍t i só͘-ū ê kiong-tiān, I huí-huāi i hiah-ê siâⁿ-pó; tī Iô-tah tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê tiong-kan, ke-thinn tsin tsē pi-siong kah pi-ai.
English: The Lord is become as an enemy, he has swallowed up Israel; He has swallowed up all her palaces, he has destroyed his strongholds; He has multiplied in the daughter of Judah mourning and lamentation.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Ta-bi̍t tī Ta-má-su-ko ê A-lâm siat-li̍p kun-iâⁿ. A-lâm lâng tsiū khut-ho̍k Ta-bi̍t, lâi tsìn-kòng. Ta-bi̍t bô-lūn khì tó-uī, Siōng-tsú lóng hō͘ i khah iâⁿ.
English: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought tribute. Yahweh gave victory to David wherever he went.

Tailo: Io-si-iah kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kám bô lóng kì tī Iô-tah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h īng tsíng-thâu-á ùn hueh tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, tī tiùⁿ-lî ê thâu-tsîng, hiù tshit pái.
English: and the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle it seven times before Yahweh, before the veil.

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Hū-jîn lâng, lí ê sìn-sim hō͘ lí ê pēⁿ hó-.khì. Tsò lí an-sim tńg-.khì.
English: He said to her, Daughter, cheer up. Your faith has made you well. Go in peace.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsí-put-kò sī khò kuí-ông Be̍h-tse-bul teh kuáⁿ kuí.
English: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.

Tailo: Kàu-huē ê líng-tō-tsiá ná tshin-tshiūnn Siōng-tè ê kuán-ke, tio̍h bô kiau-ngō͘, bô khuài siū-khì, bô in-uī tsiú-tsuì lâi jiá-sū, bô hiong-pō, bô tham put-gī ê tsîⁿ-tsâi.
English: For the overseer must be blameless, as God's steward; not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain;

Tailo: Tio̍h thiaⁿ kà-sī, tsiū ē tit-tio̍h tì-huī, m̄-thang khì-tsua̍t guá ê kà-sī.
English: Hear instruction, and be wise. Don't refuse it.

Tailo: Ha-mán tsiū ji̍p-.khì. Ông mn̄g i kóng, Ông só͘ ài kā i îng-kng ê lâng, tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kā i khuán-thāi? Ha-mán sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, ông só͘ ài kā i îng-kng ê lâng, siáⁿ lâng ē iâⁿ-kuè guá?
English: So Haman came in. The king said to him, What shall be done to the man whom the king delights to honor? Now Haman said in his heart, To whom would the king delight to do honor more than to myself?

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kín-sīn, m̄-thang īng pháiⁿ pò pháiⁿ, tio̍h put-sî hō͘-siong hó khuán-thāi, koh hó khuán-thāi muí tsi̍t-ê lâng.
English: See that no one returns evil for evil to anyone, but always follow after that which is good, for one another, and for all.

Tailo: Koh ē tsiūⁿ-khì lí kah lí ê jîn-bîn, í-ki̍p lí tsìng jîn-sîn ê sing-khu. '
English: and the frogs shall come up both on you, and on your people, and on all your servants.'

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín liân tsi̍t ki thâu-mn̂g mā bē sit-lo̍h.
English: And not a hair of your head will perish.

Tailo: In thìng-hāu guá tshin-tshiūnn teh thìng-hāu hō͘-tsuí, tuā khui in ê tshuì tshin-tshiūnn teh him-bō͘ tshun-thiⁿ ê hō͘.
English: They waited for me as for the rain. Their mouths drank as with the spring rain.

Tailo: U-tsài ê kiáⁿ Pa-lal tī uat-kak ê tuì-bīn kah ông ê kuân ê tshù phòng tshut-.lâi ê tsiú-keⁿ lâu, uá-kīn hō͘-uē ê īⁿ hit tsi̍t tuāⁿ. Suà-tsiap i ê sī Pa-lo-sih ê kiáⁿ Pe-tá-iah siu-lí.
English: Palal the son of Uzai repaired over against the turning of the wall, and the tower that stands out from the upper house of the king, which is by the court of the guard. After him Pedaiah the son of Parosh repaired.

Tailo: I-é-su koh kā in kóng, Kám ū lâng gia̍h ting lâi hē tī bí-táu ē bīn á-.sī bîn-tshn̂g kha? Kám m̄-sī ē tshāi tī ting-tâi tíng?
English: He said to them, Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Isn't it put on a stand?

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tsai Tsú ê sim-ì? Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng thè I tshut tsú-ì? ( tsù, ISI 43:13 )
English: For who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has been his counselor?

Tailo: Án-ne, lí ē tī Siōng-tè kah lâng ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián kah hó miâ-siaⁿ.
English: So you will find favor, And good understanding in the sight of God and man.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí ē hō͘ lâng kiò-tsò tsì-kuân Siōng-tè ê sian-ti. in-uī lí beh tsò Tsú ê sian-hong lâi tsún-pī I ê lō͘,
English: And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High, For you will go before the face of the Lord to make ready his ways,

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá só͘ kíng ê lô͘-po̍k, guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê, guá só͘ kah-ì ê; guá beh kā guá ê Sìng Sîn sù hō͘ I, I beh tuì bān-bîn suan-kò guá ê kong-gī.
English: Behold, my servant whom I have chosen; My beloved in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit on him. He will proclaim justice to the nations.

Tailo: Kò͘-mn̂g ê Ak-kup kah Tal-móng kah in ê hiann-tī teh siú mn̂g ê, kiōng tsi̍t-pah tshit-tsa̍p jī lâng.
English: Moreover the porters, Akkub, Talmon, and their brothers, who kept watch at the gates, were one hundred seventy-two.

Tailo: In-uī ū tsin tsē Iô-tá-iah lâng uī-tio̍h La̍h-tsa-lō͘ ê iân-kò͘ khì sìn I-é-su.
English: because on account of him many of the Jews went away and believed in Jesus.

Tailo: tī Si-óng pi-ai ê lâng, ē īng hue-bō siúⁿ-sù I lâi tāi-thè hué-hu, huann-hí ê iû lâi tāi-thè pi-ai, o-ló ê saⁿ lâi tāi-thè iu-tshiû ê sim; hō͘ in kiò-tsò kong-gī ê tshiū, to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú só͘ tsai ê, lâi hián-bîng ka-kī ê îng-kng.
English: to appoint to those who mourn in Zion, to give to them a garland for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they may be called trees of righteousness, the planting of Yahweh, that he may be glorified.

Tailo: Hit sî, hit-ê tsìn-tsîng kàu bōng-tē ê bûn-tô͘ mā ji̍p-.khì, khuàⁿ-liáu tsiū siong-sìn.
English: So then the other disciple who came first to the tomb also entered in, and he saw and believed.

Tailo: Lín tio̍k sing-thuàⁿ tsin tsē, tī tē-bīn tsiūⁿ tio̍h hing-ōng, ke-thinn tsin tsē.
English: Be fruitful and multiply. Bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply in it.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Lín siūⁿ m̄-tio̍h khì à. Lín m̄-bat king-tián, mā m̄-bat Siōng-tè ê kuân-lîng.
English: Jesus answered them, Isn't this because you are mistaken, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God?

Tailo: In lâi beh kiâⁿ kiông-pō, in ê bīn hiông-hiông tsìn-tsîng, tsū-tsi̍p só͘ lia̍h ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn sua hiah tsē.
English: All of them come for violence. Their hordes face the desert. He gathers prisoners like sand.

Tailo: In-uī in thun-tsia̍h Iâ-kop, hō͘ i tuà ê só͘-tsāi pha-hng.
English: For they have devoured Jacob, And destroyed his homeland.

Tailo: Hūn-gia̍h tio̍h pun-tsò tshit hūn á-.sī peh hūn, in-uī lí m̄-tsai tsiong-lâi ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tsai-hō ē lîm-kàu tē-tsiūⁿ.
English: Give a portion to seven, yes, even to eight; For you don't know what evil will be on the earth.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ē kì-tit lín tshut Ai-gi̍p ê sî, A-má-li̍k lâng tī lō͘-.ni̍h só͘ khuán-thāi lí ê.
English: Remember what Amalek did to you by the way as you came forth out of Egypt;

Tailo: Guá siū khó͘ kàu-ki̍k; Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí tsiàu Lí ê ìng-ín hō͘ guá ua̍h lo̍h-.khì!
English: I am afflicted very much. Revive me, Yahweh, according to your word.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tsò lín ê liàp-á ê siōng kah huí-siong lín ê tē ê niáu-tshí ê siōng, koh tio̍h kui îng-kng hō͘ I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè, kiám-tshái I tuì lín kah lín ê sîn-bîng, kah lín ê tē, ē pàng khin I ê tshiú.
English: Therefore you shall make images of your tumors, and images of your mice that mar the land; and you shall give glory to the God of Israel: peradventure he will lighten his hand from off you, and from off your gods, and from off your land.

Tailo: Sàu-lô tshe lâng khì kìⁿ I-é-sái kóng, Kiû lí iông-ín Ta-bi̍t kin-tuè tī guá bīn-tsîng, in-uī i tī guá ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng ē tit-tio̍h un-tián.
English: Saul sent to Jesse, saying, Please let David stand before me; for he has found favor in my sight.

Tailo: Guá beh kā lín tsū-tsi̍p, īng Guá tuā siū-khì ê hué pûn lín, lín tsiū ē tī hit tiong-kan iûⁿ-huà.
English: Yes, I will gather you, and blow on you with the fire of my wrath, and you shall be melted in the midst of it.

Tailo: Guá mā beh hō͘ i tsai, uī-tio̍h guá ê miâ, i it-tīng tio̍h siū tsin tsē kan-khó͘.
English: For I will show him how many things he must suffer for my name's sake.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tsiàu guá ê kong-gī kā guá pò-tap, tsiàu guá ê tshiú ê tshing-khì kā guá pò-siúⁿ.
English: Yahweh rewarded me according to my righteousness; According to the cleanness of my hands has he recompensed me.

Tailo: In tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò tsi̍t-ê kuī, tn̂g nn̄g tiú puàⁿ, khuah tiú puàⁿ, kuân tiú puàⁿ.
English: They shall make an ark of acacia wood. Its length shall be two and a half cubits, its breadth a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height.
