Tailo: Kiàn-nā tsiù-tsó͘ lāu-pē á-.sī lāu-bú ê, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí; i tsiù-tsó͘ lāu-pē á-.sī lāu-bú, i ê tsuē tio̍h kui tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: For everyone who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death: he has cursed his father or his mother; his blood shall be upon him.

Tailo: I tī kûn-tsiòng teh khuàⁿ ê só͘-tsāi kā in phah, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh phah tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng.
English: He strikes them as wicked men In the open sight of others;

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tsip-siú guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lí ê kài-bīng, lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, lâi tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ.
English: You shall therefore keep the commandment, and the statutes, and the ordinances, which I command you this day, to do them.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín tī hia nā beh tsáu-tshuē Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, nā īng tsīn-sim tsīn-sìng tshuē I, tsiū ē tú-.tio̍h.
English: But from there you shall seek Yahweh your God, and you shall find him, when you search after him with all your heart and with all your soul.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè bô hō͘ i tì-huī, mā bô hō͘ i ū lîng-khiàu.
English: Because God has deprived her of wisdom, Neither has he imparted to her understanding.

Tailo: nn̄g tsiah gû-káng, gō͘ tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò siā-un-tsè. Tsiah-ê sī Si-ti-ul ê kiáⁿ E-li-tsul ê lé-mi̍h.
English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elizur the son of Shedeur.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê kuī tiàm tī Gat lâng O-biat-e-tóm ê tshù saⁿ gue̍h-ji̍t, Siōng-tsú sù hok-khì hō͘ O-biat-e-tóm kah i ê tsuân ke.
English: The ark of Yahweh remained in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite three months: and Yahweh blessed Obed-Edom, and all his house.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā uî-puē Guá ê iok, bô tsun-thàn hit-ê iok ê uē, to̍h-sī phuà-khui gû-á lâi king-kuè hit tiong-kan ê sî, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng só͘ li̍p ê iok,
English: I will give the men who have transgressed my covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before me, when they cut the calf in two and passed between the parts of it;

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê Lô-má ê liân-tiúⁿ só͘ tiōng-iōng ê lô͘-po̍k phuà-pēⁿ kah teh beh sí.
English: A certain centurion's servant, who was dear to him, was sick and at the point of death.

Tailo: Lâng teh kóng, ' Lán uá-khò I lâi sing-ua̍h, hîng-tōng kah tsûn-tsāi', tú tshin-tshiūnn lín tiong-kan ê si-jîn ū án-ne kóng, ' In-uī lán mā sī I ê kiáⁿ-sun. '
English: For in him we live, and move, and have our being.' As some of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.'

Tailo: I só͘ king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê kun-tuī, tsóng-kiōng ū gō͘-bān saⁿ-tshing sì-pah miâ.
English: His division, and those who were numbered of them, were fifty-three thousand four hundred.

Tailo: Tī Hâm ê tē kiânn kî-sū, tī Âng-hái kiânn thang kiaⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, And awesome things by the Red Sea.

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to kā in kóng, Lín tshuā uē-ping khì, hó-hó-á kò͘-siú hit-ê bōng.
English: Pilate said to them, You have a guard. Go, make it as secure as you can.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kah A-lông tī Huâ-láu ê bīn-tsîng kiânn tsiah-ê kî-sū; tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú hō͘ Huâ-láu ê sim ngē, m̄-tsún I-su-la-el lâng lī-khui i ê tē.
English: Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh, and Yahweh hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he didn't let the children of Israel go out of his land.

Tailo: tuì i kóng, Lí kín khì kā hit-ê siàu-liân lâng kóng, ' Ê-lú-sa-lèm ē ū lâng tuà, tshin-tshiūnn bô siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ê hiuⁿ-lí, in-uī hit tiong-kan ê lâng kah tsing-seⁿ tsin tsē. '
English: and said to him, Run, speak to this young man, saying, Jerusalem will be inhabited as villages without walls, because of the multitude of men and livestock in it.

Tailo: Guān tī tē-.ni̍h, tī suaⁿ tíng, ngó͘-kok bō͘-sīng; só͘ kiat ê ngó͘-kok ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Le-ba-nòng ê tshiū iô-tāng; siâⁿ lāi ê lâng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tē-tsiūⁿ ê tsháu hing-ōng.
English: There shall be abundance of grain throughout the land. Its fruit sways like Lebanon. Let it flourish, thriving like the grass of the field.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī hit-ê bāng. Guán taⁿ beh tī ông ê bīn-tsîng kā i kái-bîng.
English: This is the dream; and we will tell the interpretation of it before the king.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì ìng-giām Siōng-tè thong-kuè I-é-lí-miah sian-ti só͘ kóng ê uē, kóng, In the̍h hit saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê gîn-á, to̍h-sī i-su-la-el lâng uī-tio̍h i só͘ kó͘ ê kè-tsînn.
English: Then that which was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying, They took the thirty pieces of silver, The price of him upon whom a price had been set, Whom some of the children of Israel priced,

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì lîm-kàu Iô-tah, si̍t-tsāi sī tuì Siōng-tsú ê bīng-līng beh kā i tshian-suá, lī-khui I ê bīn-tsîng, tse lóng sī in-uī Má-ná-se ê tsuē, tsiàu i só͘ kiâⁿ ê it-tshè;
English: Surely at the commandment of Yahweh came this on Judah, to remove them out of his sight, for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he did,

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ tshù-piⁿ, to̍h-sī hāi-tio̍h guá hō͘ guá ê I-su-la-el jîn-bîn sîng-tsiap ê sán-gia̍p ê. Siōng-tsú ū án-ne kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā in kuáⁿ-tshut in ê tē, koh beh kā Iô-tah ke tuì in tiong-kan kuáⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: Thus says Yahweh against all my evil neighbors, who touch the inheritance which I have caused my people Israel to inherit: behold, I will pluck them up from off their land, and will pluck up the house of Judah from among them.

Tailo: In kah in ê tsìng kun-tuī lóng tshut-.lâi, lâng-gia̍h tsin tsē tshin-tshiūnn hái piⁿ ê sua, bé kah tshia mā tsin tsē.
English: They went out, they and all their armies with them, much people, even as the sand that is on the seashore in multitude, with horses and chariots very many.

Tailo: Sàu-lô kóng, Io-ná-than, lí it-tīng tio̍h sí! Guān Siōng-tsú án-ne kiânn, mā pí án-ne iáu khah tāng.
English: Saul said, God do so and more also; for you shall surely die, Jonathan.

Tailo: In kóng, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsa̍p-jī-ê hiann-tī, sī Ka-nân tē-it-ê lâng ê kiáⁿ; siōng sè-hàn ê, hiān-kim tī guán lāu-pē hia, ū tsi̍t-ê í-king sí-.khì à.
English: They said, We, your servants, are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is no more.

Tailo: Ki-lō͘-ping lóng tsiūⁿ-.khì; tse sī guá tī Ke-bal hô piⁿ só͘ bat khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê ua̍h-mi̍h.
English: The cherubim mounted up: this is the living creature that I saw by the river Chebar.

Tailo: guá nā tsia̍h i ê tshut-sán bô hō͘ i kè-tsîⁿ, á-.sī hō͘ gia̍p-tsú sit-lo̍h i ê sèⁿ-miā;
English: If I have eaten the fruits of it without money, Or have caused the owners of it to lose their life:

Tailo: Lí ê sèⁿ-miā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng bô tiāⁿ bô tio̍h, lí mê-ji̍t kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, lí ê sèⁿ-miā bô ún-tàng.
English: and your life shall hang in doubt before you; and you shall fear night and day, and shall have no assurance of your life.

Tailo: Lín it-tīng bat thiaⁿ-kuè Siōng-tè uī-tio̍h lín ê iân-kò͘, siúⁿ-sù un-tián hō͘ guá tsit-ê tsit-bū.
English: if it is so that you have heard of the administration of that grace of God which was given me toward you;

Tailo: Suî-jiân án-ne, kin-á-ji̍t, bîn-á-tsài kah āu-.ji̍t, guá tio̍h kè-sio̍k kiânn, in-uī sian-ti bô ing-kai tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm í-guā ê só͘-tsāi hō͘ lâng hāi-sí.
English: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, for it can't be that a prophet perish outside of Jerusalem.'

Tailo: guá beh khì kìⁿ in ê sè-ka, kah in kóng-uē; in-uī in bat Siōng-tsú ê lō͘ kah in ê Siōng-tsú ê huat-tō͘. M̄-koh, in tâng-sim at-tn̄g ka-tann, kā pa̍k i ê soh-á phah-tn̄g.
English: I will get me to the great men, and will speak to them; for they know the way of Yahweh, and the law of their God. But these with one accord have broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.

Tailo: Ji̍t beh àm, Í-sak tshut-lâi tī tshân-.ni̍h, tiām-tiām teh siūⁿ. I gia̍h thâu tsi̍t ē khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h lo̍k-tô lâi.
English: Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the evening. He lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, there were camels coming.

Tailo: Sa-mu-el khì La̍h-má, Sàu-lô tsiūⁿ-khì i ê tshù, kàu Sàu-lô ê Gi-be-at.
English: Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.

Tailo: Huâ-láu ê tok-kang phah i só͘ phài kuán-lí I-su-la-el lâng ê thâu-ba̍k, kóng, Lín tsa-hng kah kin-á-ji̍t ná ē bô tsò uân lín ê kang, to̍h-sī bô tsiàu tsá-tsîng ê sò͘-gia̍h tsò tsng?
English: The officers of the children of Israel, whom Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Why haven't you fulfilled your quota both yesterday and today, in making brick as before?

Tailo: Tsiū kā tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Khí-.lâi, lán beh tshut-huat! Tsóng-.sī, i bô ìn, i tsiū kā i hû khí-lih lî ê tíng-bīn, tshut-huat khì i ê pún só͘-tsāi.
English: He said to her, Up, and let us be going; but none answered: then he took her up on the donkey; and the man rose up, and got him to his place.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Biān-iá-mín tsiū kóng: Siōng-tsú só͘ thiàⁿ ê ē kah I an-jiân tuà; Siōng-tsú kui ji̍t pó-hō͘ i, I mā beh tiàm tī i ê king-kah-thâu tiong.
English: Of Benjamin he said, The beloved of Yahweh shall dwell in safety by him; He covers him all the day long, He dwells between his shoulders.

Tailo: Lí gia̍h kuái-á tshun tshiú kí hái, lâi kā hái hun-khui. I-su-la-el lâng beh tī hái tiong kiânn ta tē.
English: Lift up your rod, and stretch out your hand over the sea, and divide it: and the children of Israel shall go into the midst of the sea on dry ground.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: In-uī lín lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò tse-tái, lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tiong-kan kā lín tsū-tsi̍p.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Because you are all become dross, therefore, behold, I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Tsiàu I tī Hô-se-a su só͘ kóng, Tsiah-ê m̄-sī Guá ê tsú-bîn ê, guá beh tshing in tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn ; Hiah-ê m̄-sī guá só͘ ài ê, guá beh tshing in tsò Guá só͘ ài ê. ( tsù, HSA 2:23 )
English: As he says also in Hosea, I will call them my people,' which were not my people; And her beloved,' who was not beloved.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, khiā tī tsia ê lâng, ū lâng iáu-buē sí í-tsîng, to̍h ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Jîn-tsú tsò ông lâi-lîm.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, there are some standing here who will in no way taste of death, until they see the Son of Man coming in his Kingdom.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guá bat tuì Lí ai-kiû, kóng, Lí sī guá tô-siám ê só͘-tsāi; tī ua̍h-lâng ê sè-kan, Lí sī guá ê ki-gia̍p.
English: I cried to you, Yahweh. I said, You are my refuge, My portion in the land of the living.

Tailo: I-é-su tuì in kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, lín nā bô tsia̍h Jîn-tsú ê bah, bô lim I ê hueh, lín ê lāi-bīn tsiū bô ua̍h-miā.
English: Jesus therefore said to them, Most assuredly I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you don't have life in yourselves.

Tailo: koh kā i tshau-siá tī Su-san siâⁿ só͘ thuân beh tsâu-bia̍t Iô-tah lâng ê jū-tsí hō͘ i, kiò i the̍h hō͘ Ê-su-tel khuànn, sūn-suà kā i kóng bîng, koh huan-hù i ji̍p-khì kìnn ông lâi kā i khún-kiû, tī ông ê bīn-tsîng uī-tio̍h pún tso̍k ê jîn-bîn khún-tshiat kî-kiû.
English: Also he gave him the copy of the writing of the decree that was given out in Shushan to destroy them, to show it to Esther, and to declare it to her, and to charge her that she should go in to the king, to make supplication to him, and to make request before him, for her people.

Tailo: Tse sī Siōng-tsú ê mn̂g; gī ê lâng beh ji̍p-.khì!
English: This is the gate of Yahweh; The righteous will enter into it.

Tailo: Guá koh beh kā Iô-tah ông — Tse-ti-kiah kah i ê kuì-tso̍k kau tī in ê tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú kah siàu-siūⁿ i ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ê tshiú, mā beh kau tī Ba-bú-lông ông kun-ping ê tshiú, to̍h-sī lī-khui lín khì ê.
English: Zedekiah king of Judah and his princes will I give into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life, and into the hand of the king of Babylon's army, who have gone away from you.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā pun-tê thiah-tshe kah huan-tsháu ê tsing-seⁿ, lín lóng thang tsia̍h.
English: Whatever parts the hoof, and is cloven-footed, and chews the cud among the animals, that you may eat.

Tailo: Guá thang tsìng-bîng, i khak-si̍t uī-tio̍h lín kah tī Lâu-tí-kiah í-ki̍p Hi-la-pó-lih ê lâng lô-khó͘ tsò-kang.
English: For I testify about him, that he has great zeal for you, and for those in Laodicea, and for those in Hierapolis.

Tailo: I kóng, Guá ū tsi̍t kiāⁿ sió-khuá tāi-tsì kiû lí, tshiáⁿ lí mài kā guá the-sî. Ông kā i kóng, Guá ê lāu-bú, tsò lí kóng, guá bô beh kā lí the-sî.
English: Then she said, I ask one small petition of you; don't deny me. The king said to her, Ask on, my mother; for I will not deny you.

Tailo: ( Peh kiā-á ê si. ) Uá-khò Siōng-tsú ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn íng-uán khiā tsāi ê Si-óng suaⁿ bē iô-tāng.
English: Those who trust in Yahweh are as Mount Zion, Which can't be moved, but remains forever.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn guá tī tshiu-thinn ê ji̍t-tsí, Siōng-tè tī guá ê pò͘-pênn kah guá tshin-bi̍t.
English: As I was in the ripeness of my days, When the friendship of God was in my tent;

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ê siú-líng kah I-su-la-el tsìng tsi-tso̍k lóng ka-kī lâi khiā tī Siōng-tè ê tsú-bîn ê huē tiong, gia̍h to ê pō͘-ping kiōng sì-tsa̍p bān.
English: The chiefs of all the people, even of all the tribes of Israel, presented themselves in the assembly of the people of God, four hundred thousand footmen who drew sword.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōng-tè ē tshe thiⁿ-sài tuì sì-hng, tuì tē-ki̍k kàu thinn-pinn, tsū-tsi̍p I ê suán-bîn.
English: Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky.

Tailo: lín ê tshân-hn̂g, phû-tô hn̂g, kaⁿ-ná hn̂g, hit-ê siōng hó ê, i ē kā i the̍h-lâi hō͘ i ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: He will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your olive groves, even the best of them, and give them to his servants.

Tailo: Hit lâng ê siang pîng hīⁿ-khang tsiū khui, tsi̍h-kin mā tháu līng khì, kóng-uē tsin tshing-tshó.
English: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was released, and he spoke clearly.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm tuā-tuā huān tsuē, só͘-í tsiâⁿ-tsò bô tshing-khì ê mi̍h; pîng-siông sî tsun-kìng i ê, taⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h i tshiah-sin lō͘-thé tsiū lóng khuànn-khin i; i ka-kī mā thó͘-khuì, tò-thè.
English: Jerusalem has grievously sinned; therefore she is become as an unclean thing; All who honored her despise her, because they have seen her nakedness: Yes, she sighs, and turns backward.

Tailo: Lí ē tsiâⁿ-tsò hiâⁿ hué ê tshâ, lí ê hueh ē lâu tī tsit-ê só͘-tsāi, lí bô koh tit-tio̍h kì-liām; in-uī tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: You shall be for fuel to the fire; your blood shall be in the midst of the land; you shall be no more remembered: for I, Yahweh, have spoken it.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng si̍t hō͘ Mô͘-ap, hō͘ i pue-tsáu. I tsiah-ê siâⁿ ē tì-kàu pha-hng, bô lâng tuà.
English: Give wings to Moab, that she may fly and get her away: and her cities shall become a desolation, without any to dwell therein.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm kā iûⁿ kah gû hō͘ A-mí-me-li̍k, nn̄g lâng tsiū tsò-hué li̍p-iok.
English: Abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them to Abimelech. Those two made a covenant.

Tailo: Guá tuì in ê bīn-tsîng tû-bia̍t A-mô͘-lī lâng, hiah-ê lâng kuân-tuā tshin-tshiūnn pik-hiuⁿ tshiū, ióng-bíng tshin-tshiūnn siōng tshiū. Tsóng-.sī, Guá kā i tíng-bīn ê kué-tsí bia̍t-tiāu, kā ē-bīn ê kin tsua̍t-tn̄g.
English: Yet I destroyed the Amorite before them, Whose height was like the height of the cedars, And he was strong as the oaks; Yet I destroyed his fruit from above, and his roots from beneath.

Tailo: Tsia̍h-ê lâng, hū-jîn-lâng kah gín-á bô sǹg, tsóng-kiōng sì-tshing lâng.
English: Those who ate were four thousand men, besides women and children.

Tailo: Lín nā sio-thiànn, tsìng lâng ē tsiū án-ne lâi tsai lín sī guá ê bûn-tô͘.
English: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.

Tailo: In tsiàu tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē, īng hué piak Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê iûⁿ-á. Hiah-ê tsè-mi̍h īng tiánn, īng ue, īng puah lâi tsú liáu-āu, tsiū kuáⁿ-kín tuà-khì hō͘ tsìng lâng.
English: They roasted the Passover with fire according to the ordinance: and the holy offerings boiled they in pots, and in caldrons, and in pans, and carried them quickly to all the children of the people.

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng, ji̍t, gue̍h kah tsheⁿ lóng ē hián-tshut tiāu-thâu; tī tē-tsiūⁿ, bān-bîn ē in-uī hái-íng huā-huā háu lâi kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ put-an.
English: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves;

Tailo: Tiánn sī beh tuàn-liān gîn, lô͘ sī beh tuàn-liān kim, to̍k-to̍k Siōng-tsú sī teh tuàn-liān lâng ê sim.
English: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold, But Yahweh tests the hearts.

Tailo: Guá kui ji̍t tshun tshiú ǹg hiah-ê puē-gi̍k ê jîn-bîn; in tshut-tsāi ka-kī ê ì-sù, kiânn m̄-hó ê lō͘.
English: I have spread out my hands all the day to a rebellious people, who walk in a way that is not good, after their own thoughts;

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t koh kóng, Guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú lâi tsiù-tsuā, Siōng-tsú ē kā i phah, kiám-tshái i ê sí ji̍t beh kàu, á-.sī i ē lo̍h tsiàn-tīn lâi sí.
English: David said, As Yahweh lives, Yahweh will strike him; or his day shall come to die; or he shall go down into battle and perish.

Tailo: Koh tuì Ga̍t tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p tiong-kan, kā Gi-lia̍t ê La̍h-mot, to̍h-sī thâi-sí-lâng ê tô-siám ê siâⁿ kah i ê kau-iá, í-ki̍p Ma-há-niam kah i ê kau-iá,
English: Out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with its suburbs, the city of refuge for the manslayer, and Mahanaim with its suburbs,

Tailo: Ông nā lia̍h-tsò sī hó, guá nā tī ông ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, ông lia̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì tsò tio̍h, guá nā tī ông ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tit-tio̍h huann-hí, tsiū khún-kiû tshut tsiàu, tshú-siau A-gak tso̍k Ha-me-tá-tha ê kiáⁿ Ha-mán só͘ kè-bô͘ ê tsiàu, to̍h-sī i só͘ siá beh bia̍t ông ta̍k síng ê Iô-tah lâng ê tsiàu.
English: She said, If it please the king, and if I have found favor in his sight, and the thing seem right before the king, and I be pleasing in his eyes, let it be written to reverse the letters devised by Haman, the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, which he wrote to destroy the Jews who are in all the king's provinces:

Tailo: Guá sī uân-siān ê lâng, guá bô kò͘ ka-kī; guá khuànn-khin guá ê ua̍h-miā.
English: I am blameless. I don't regard myself. I despise my life.

Tailo: In-uī in khì-sak Guá, tī pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng sio hiuⁿ, īng in ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê kik Guá ê siū-khì, só͘-í, Guá tuì tsit só͘-tsāi siū-khì, tshin-tshiūnn hué to̍h bô suah.
English: Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the work of their hands, therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place, and it shall not be quenched.

Tailo: Kuan-hē lú-pī ê kiáⁿ, Guá mā beh hō͘ i tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t kok, in-uī i mā sī lí seⁿ ê.
English: I will also make a nation of the son of the handmaid, because he is your seed.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn hiah-ê siú-líng tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm. Kî-tha ê jîn-bîn liam-khau, hō͘ muí tsa̍p-ê lâng tiong-kan tsi̍t-ê lâng lâi tuà tī sìng-siâⁿ Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê káu-ê lâng khì tuà tī pa̍t ê siâⁿ.
English: The princes of the people lived in Jerusalem: the rest of the people also cast lots, to bring one of ten to dwell in Jerusalem the holy city, and nine parts in the other cities.

Tailo: Lín kó-jiân beh tuì guá tuā khua-kháu, koh īng guá ê lîng-jio̍k tsik-pī guá;
English: If indeed you will magnify yourselves against me, And plead against me my reproach;

Tailo: Guá nā bô tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ tuì Ta-bi̍t tsiù-tsuā ê lâi kiâⁿ tī i, tsiū guān Siōng-tsú ka-puē tsik-hua̍t Ap-nel,
English: God do so to Abner, and more also, if, as Yahweh has sworn to David, I don't do even so to him;

Tailo: Sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê iû tio̍h kā i sio tī tuâⁿ tíng.
English: The fat of the sin offering he shall burn on the altar.

Tailo: Te-bó͘-la̍h, tshénn khí-.lâi! Tshénn khí-.lâi! Lí tio̍h tshéⁿ, tio̍h tshéⁿ, lâi tshiùⁿ kua. Ba-la̍h, lí tio̍h khí-.lâi, A-pí-lô-am ê kiáⁿ, tio̍h lia̍h lí só͘ lia̍h ê khì.
English: Awake, awake, Deborah; Awake, awake, utter a song: Arise, Barak, and lead away your captives, you son of Abinoam.

Tailo: Án-ne tsò tsin hó, sī lán ê Kiù-tsú Siōng-tè huann-hí tsiap-la̍p ê.
English: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior;

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá tsiah siong-sìn, hiah-ê bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h to lâi sìn ê lâng, tsin ū hok-khì.
English: Jesus said to him, Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed.

Tailo: Koh uī-tio̍h tuâⁿ īng tâng-bāng tsò tsi̍t-ê ting-sa, an-tì tī tuâⁿ sì-bīn uî io-pán ê ē-bīn, hō͘ i thàu kàu tuâⁿ ê puàⁿ-io.
English: He made for the altar a grating of a network of brass, under the ledge around it beneath, reaching halfway up.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá tsá to̍h it-ti̍t siūⁿ beh siá phue hō͘ lín, lâi tâm-lūn lán lóng ū-hūn ê tsín-kiù. Taⁿ guá kám-kak tsin su-iàu siá phue lâi kā lín kó͘-lē, lín tio̍h uī Siōng-tè tsi̍t pái to̍h uân-tsíng thuân hō͘ sìn-tô͘ ê sìn-gióng-lâi hùn-tàu.
English: Beloved, while I was very eager to write to you about our common salvation, I was constrained to write to you exhorting you to contend earnestly for the faith which was once for all delivered to the saints.

Tailo: In-uī Lí īng tuā hok-khì kā i gîng-tsiap, īng sûn-kim ê bián-liû tì tī i ê thâu-khak.
English: For you meet him with the blessings of goodness; You set a crown of fine gold on his head.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, siat-li̍p tok-kang lâi kā in kuán-hat, īng tāng-tàⁿ kā in khó͘-to̍k, in tsiū kā Huâ-láu khí Pí-thom kah Lâm-sik nn̄g-ê siâⁿ tsò kim-khò͘.
English: Therefore they set taskmasters over them to afflict them with their burdens. They built storage cities for Pharaoh: Pithom and Raamses.

Tailo: Siōng iàu-kín ê sī tio̍h sîng-khún sio-thiànn, in-uī thiàⁿ ē-tàng siau-tû tsin tsē tsuē-kò.
English: And above all things be earnest in your love among yourselves, for love covers a multitude of sins.

Tailo: I koh kā in huan-hù, m̄-thang tuà lō͘-huì, tsí ū tuà tsi̍t ki kuái-á; m̄-thang tuà kan-niûⁿ; m̄-thang tuà hîng-lí tē; m̄-thang khǹg tsîⁿ tī io-tuà;
English: He charged them that they should take nothing for their journey, except a staff only: no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse,

Tailo: Tsit-ê tshin-tshiūnn Nai-l hô tiòng muá, tshin-tshiūnn kang-hô ê tsuí teh giâ íng ê sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: Who is this who rises up like the Nile, whose waters toss themselves like the rivers?

Tailo: Thong-kuè sé-lé, lán kah Ki-tok tâng-tsê sí, tâng-tsê siū bâi-tsòng; ná tshin-tshiūnn Ki-tok thong-kuè Thiⁿ-pē îng-kng ê kuân-lîng tuì sí koh-ua̍h, lán mā ē-tàng kuè sin ê sing-ua̍h.
English: We were buried therefore with him through baptism to death, that just like Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father, so we also might walk in newness of life.

Tailo: Tī Biān-iá-mín tsi-tso̍k ê tē, ū Ge-bah kah i ê kau-iá, A-le-met kah i ê kau-iá, A-ná-thot kah i ê kau-iá. In tsiah-ê tso̍k só͘ tit-tio̍h ê siâⁿ kiōng tsa̍p-saⁿ ê.
English: and out of the tribe of Benjamin, Geba with its suburbs, and Allemeth with its suburbs, and Anathoth with its suburbs. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, lê-tshân ê ē jiok-tio̍h siu-kuah ê, ta̍h phû-tô ê ē jiok-tio̍h iā tsíng ê. Tuā suaⁿ ē tih tiⁿ-tsiú, sió suaⁿ ē lâu ling.
English: Behold, the days come, says Yahweh, That the plowman shall overtake the reaper, And the one treading grapes him who sows seed; And sweet wine will drip from the mountains, And flow from the hills.

Tailo: M̄-koh, kàu kin-á-ji̍t, guá ū tit-tio̍h Siōng-tè ê pó-hō͘, ē-tàng khiā tī tsia, tuì tsun-kuì kah pi-bî ê lâng tsò kiàn-tsìng. Guá só͘ kóng ê kah sian-ti í-ki̍p Mô͘-se só͘ kóng ê uân-tsuân-kāng-khuán, lóng sī kuan-hē tsiong-lâi beh huat-sing ê tāi-tsì,
English: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would happen,

Tailo: Lín tī tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi thâi-sí tsin tsē lâng, hō͘ sin-si muá ke-lō͘.
English: You have multiplied your slain in this city, and you have filled the streets of it with the slain.

Tailo: Sè-kiáⁿ, m̄-thang hō͘ lâng kā lín bê-hi̍k. Tsun-tsiàu kong-gī ê lâng tsiah sī gī lâng, tú tshin-tshiūnn Ki-tok sī gī lâng.
English: Little children, let no one lead you astray. He who does righteousness is righteous, even as he is righteous.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū tshuā Piat-tò͘ kah Tse-beh-tái ê nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ tsò-hué khì. I khí iu-būn, kám-kak hui-siông thòng-khó͘.
English: He took with him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be sorrowful and severely troubled.

Tailo: Uî ê thiāu jī-tsa̍p ki, tâng tsò ê khū jī-tsa̍p-ê, thiāu ê kau kah huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ sī īng gîn tsò ê.
English: their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá tio̍h kā si̍t-tsîng kā lín kóng; guá khì sī tuì lín ū lī-ik; guá nā bô-.khì, hit uī Pó-huī-su tsiū bē lâi lín tsia; guá nā khì, tsiū ē tshe I lâi lín tsia.
English: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is to your advantage that I go away, for if I don't go away, the Counselor won't come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.

Tailo: La̍k ji̍t tio̍h tsò-kang, tē-tshit ji̍t sī lín ê sìng-ji̍t, sī tuā ê An-hioh-ji̍t, lâi ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tsú. Só͘-ū tī tsit ji̍t tsò-kang ê, tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a holy day for you, a Sabbath of solemn rest to Yahweh: whoever does any work in it shall be put to death.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat tsiàu án-ne kiâⁿ i ê lāu-pē A-sah ê lō͘, bô phian-uai, kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê tāi-tsì.
English: He walked in the way of Asa his father, and didn't turn aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá beh in-uī Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâi huann-hí, in-uī Guá ê tsú-bîn lâi khuài-lo̍k; kî-tiong it-tīng bô koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h thî-khàu ê siann kah ai-háu ê siann;
English: I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people; and there shall be heard in her no more the voice of weeping and the voice of crying.

Tailo: A-mí-me-li̍k jiok i, i tī i ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu, ū tsin tsē lâng tio̍h-siong tó-.leh, it-ti̍t kàu siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu.
English: Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him, and there fell many wounded, even to the entrance of the gate.

Tailo: Lí mā kàng-lîm tī Si-nái suaⁿ, tuì thiⁿ-.ni̍h kah in kóng-uē, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in tsìng-ti̍t ê huat-tō͘, tsin-si̍t ê huat-tō͘, hó ê lu̍t-lē kah kài-bīng,
English: You came down also on Mount Sinai, and spoke with them from heaven, and gave them right ordinances and true laws, good statutes and commandments,

Tailo: Guá mn̄g kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá kóng, Guá ê tsú ah, tsiah-ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: I answered and spoke to the angel who talked with me, saying, What are these, my lord?

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá tsit sî beh kā tuà tī tsit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn hiàt tshut-.khì, koh beh hō͘ in khùn-khó͘, hō͘ in hiáu-ngō͘.
English: For thus says Yahweh, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time, and will distress them, that they may feel it.

Tailo: Nā-sī lín só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng, Guá beh hō͘ in tī tuì-ti̍k ê tē, sim kiaⁿ kah hūn-.khì. Tshiū-hio̍h hō͘ hong tshue tín-tāng ê siann jiok in, in beh tô-siám, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh tô-siám to-kiàm, bô lâng jiok i, i mā ē pua̍h-tó.
English: As for those of you who are left, I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies: and the sound of a driven leaf will put them to flight; and they shall flee, as one flees from the sword; and they will fall when no one pursues.

Tailo: I khí siâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî, to̍h-sī tuì Mi-lō͘ khí kàu i ê sì-kho͘-uî, kî-î ê iû Io-ap siu-lí.
English: He built the city round about, from Millo even round about; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng: ' M̄-thang hō͘ lín tiong-kan ê sian-ti kah pok-kuà ê ín-iú, mā m̄-thang sìn lín ê bāng, to̍h-sī lín só͘ bāng-kìnn ê.
English: For thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Don't let your prophets who are in the midst of you, and your diviners, deceive you; neither listen you to your dreams which you cause to be dreamed.

Tailo: In tsiū uat-khì hia, kàu hit-ê siàu-liân ê Lē-bī lâng ê tshù, to̍h-sī Mi-ka ê tshù, kā i tshíng-an.
English: They turned aside there, and came to the house of the young man the Levite, even to the house of Micah, and asked him of his welfare.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: In-uī beh ū ké Ki-tok kah ké sian-ti ē tshut-hiān, kiânn sîn-jiah kah kî-sū, tsīn-liōng beh lâi bê-hi̍k Siōng-tè ê suán-bîn.
English: For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.

Tailo: Lán tsai lán í-king tshut-sí ji̍p-ua̍h, in-uī lán ū thiàⁿ hiann-tī tsí-muē; bô thiàⁿ-sim ê lâng, iáu siū sí-bông ê kuán-hat.
English: We know that we have passed out of death into life, because we love the brothers. He who doesn't love his brother remains in death.

Tailo: Lí kám tsai án-tsuáⁿ tshuā i tńg-khì i ê kíng-kài? Lí kám ē tsai-iáⁿ thàu kàu i ê tshù ê lō͘?
English: That you should take it to the bound of it, That you should discern the paths to the house of it?

Tailo: I-é-su lī-khui hia, tńg-khì I ê kò͘-hiong, bûn-tô͘ mā tuè I khì.
English: He went out from there. He came into his own country, and his disciples followed him.

Tailo: Gû-gōng ê lâng lia̍h kiâⁿ pháiⁿ tsò kún-tshiò; tsóng-.sī, bîng-lí ê lâng lia̍h tì-huī tsò huann-hí.
English: It is a fool's pleasure to do wickedness, But wisdom is a man of understanding's pleasure.

Tailo: In kóng, lán tio̍h tshuah-tn̄g in ê khún-pa̍k, hiat-ka̍k in ê soh.
English: Let's break their bonds apart, And cast away their cords from us.

Tailo: Guān kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng tú-tio̍h kiàn-siàu, in-uī in bô lí-iû óng-khut guá; tsóng-.sī, guá beh tiām-tiām su-sióng Lí ê kà-sī.
English: Let the proud be disappointed, for they have overthrown me wrongfully. I will meditate on your precepts.

Tailo: I tshun-tshut kuân-lîng ê tshiú, kā sim-tsì kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng kuáⁿ-suàⁿ.
English: He has shown strength with his arm. He has scattered the proud in the imagination of their heart.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kah A-lông kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

Tailo: Tī bé ê mn̂g ê tíng-bīn, hiah-ê tsè-si ta̍k-ê tī i ê tshù ê tuì-bīn siu-lí.
English: Above the horse gate repaired the priests, everyone over against his own house.

Tailo: Sù-tsiá ìn i kóng, Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tú-tio̍h guán, kā guán kóng, ' Lí khì, lín tńg-khì kìnn tshe lín ê ông, kā i kóng, Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí tshe lâng khì mn̄g Ik-lóng ê sîn-bîng Ba-al-tse-but, kám sī in-uī I-su-la-el tiong bô Siōng-tè? Só͘-í, lí bē koh lo̍h-khì lí só͘ tsiūⁿ-khì ê bîn-tshn̂g, it-tīng ē sí! '
English: They said to him, There came up a man to meet us, and said to us, Go, turn again to the king who sent you, and tell him, Thus says Yahweh, Is it because there is no God in Israel, that you send to inquire of Baalzebub, the god of Ekron? therefore you shall not come down from the bed where you are gone up, but shall surely die.

Tailo: In kā Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê sin-si kau hō͘ khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h, kā Lí sìng ê jîn-bîn ê bah kau hō͘ tē-tsiūⁿ ê iá-siù.
English: They have given the dead bodies of your servants to be food for the birds of the sky, The flesh of your saints to the animals of the earth.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: Then came the word of Yahweh to Jeremiah, saying,

Tailo: hit-ê lâng tio̍h tshuā i ê bó͘ kàu tsè-si hia, mā uī-tio̍h i tuà tuā-be̍h ê mī-hún tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it e-huat tsò i ê lé-mi̍h, m̄-thang thîn iû, mā m̄-thang tsham jú-hiuⁿ, in-uī tse sī giâu-gî ê sò͘-tsè, sī ē kì-tit ê sò͘-tsè, hō͘ lâng ē kì-tit tsuē.
English: then the man shall bring his wife to the priest, and shall bring her offering for her: the tenth part of an ephah of barley meal. He shall pour no oil on it, nor put frankincense on it, for it is a meal offering of jealousy, a meal offering of memorial, bringing iniquity to memory.

Tailo: Tē-jī pái koh khì ê sî, Iô-sé-huh hō͘ hiann-tī jīn-tshut i ê sin-hūn; in-uī án-ne, Huâ-láu bat Iô-sé-huh ê ka-tso̍k.
English: On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph's race was revealed to Pharaoh.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, in tī só͘ tuà-lâi hiah-ê tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h ê tiong-kan, īng gû tshit pah tsiah kah iûⁿ tshit tshing tsiah hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: They sacrificed to Yahweh in that day, of the spoil which they had brought, seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ǹg Siōng-tsú tshiùnn sin ê kua! Tsuân tē lóng tio̍h ǹg Siōng-tsú tshiùⁿ kua!
English: Sing to Yahweh a new song! Sing to Yahweh, all the earth.

Tailo: Guá í-tsîng bat kóng kuè, taⁿ guá koh kóng tsi̍t pái, nā ū lâng thuân hō͘ lín ê hok-im kah lín í-king tsiap-siū ê bô kāng-khuán, hit-ê lâng tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: As we have said before, so I now say again: if any man preaches to you any good news other than that which you received, let him be cursed.

Tailo: La̍h-ban tsū-tsi̍p hit só͘-tsāi ê kûn-tsiòng, pān iàn-si̍k tshiánn in.
English: Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.

Tailo: Kiông-bíng ê ióng-sū ē tī im-kan tuì i kah kā i pang-tsān ê kóng-uē; in sī bô siū kat-lé tsiah siū to thâi ê lâng, í-king lo̍h-.khì, tó-teh bô tín-tāng.
English: The strong among the mighty shall speak to him out of the midst of Sheol with those who help him: they are gone down, they lie still, even the uncircumcised, slain by the sword.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t bô pa̍t khuán ê hok-im, guá án-ne kóng sī in-uī ū lâng kā lín kiáu-jiáu, siūⁿ beh khiok-kái Ki-tok ê hok-im.
English: and there isn't another good news. Only there are some who trouble you, and want to pervert the Good News of Christ.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ Lap-bah tsò lo̍k-tô ê tiâu, hō͘ Am-móng tso̍k ê tē tsò iûⁿ-kûn tò ê só͘-tsāi, lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: I will make Rabbah a stable for camels, and the children of Ammon a resting place for flocks: and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: m̄-khíng sūn-ho̍k, mā bē kì-tit Lí tī in tiong-kan só͘ kiâⁿ ê kî-sū, kìng-jiân ngē in ê ām-kún, tī puē-gi̍k tiong ka-kī siat-li̍p siú-líng, beh ua̍t tńg-khì in tsò lô͘-lē ê tē. Tsóng-.sī, Lí sī huann-hí sià-bián lâng, ū un-tián, liân-bín, bô khuài-khuài siū-khì, ū muá-muá tsû-ài ê Siōng-tè, Lí bô kā in pàng-sak.
English: and refused to obey, neither were mindful of your wonders that you did among them, but hardened their neck, and in their rebellion appointed a captain to return to their bondage. But you are a God ready to pardon, gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, and didn't forsake them.

Tailo: Tī Siōng-tsú — tsuân tē ê Tsú bīn-tsîng, tsiah-ê suaⁿ tshin-tshiūnn la̍h teh siau-iûⁿ.
English: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of Yahweh, At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.

Tailo: Sing-khu tsí ū tsi̍t-ê, Sìng Sîn tsí ū tsi̍t-ê, tú tshin-tshiūnn Siōng-tè ho͘-tiàu lán lâi tit-tio̍h ê ǹg-bāng mā sī tsi̍t-ê.
English: There is one body, and one Spirit, even as you also were called in one hope of your calling;

Tailo: Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Ka-la̍uh tī tó-uī? I tsiū pò i khuànn hit só͘-tsāi. I tsiū tshò tsi̍t ki tshâ, hiat tī hia, pó͘-thâu bah tsiū phû khí-.lâi.
English: The man of God said, Where fell it? He shown him the place. He cut down a stick, and cast it in there, and made the iron to swim.

Tailo: Iô-tah kóng, Guán tuì guá ê Tsú beh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guán iáu ū siáⁿ thang kóng? Guán ná ū huat-tō͘ thang uī ka-kī piān-kái? Siōng-tè í-king tshâ-tshut lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê tsuē-kò, guán kah hit-ê tī i ê tshiú tshiau-tio̍h pue ê, lóng sī guá ê tsú ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: Judah said, What will we tell my lord? What will we speak? Or how will we clear ourselves? God has found out the iniquity of your servants. Behold, we are my lord's bondservants, both we, and he also in whose hand the cup is found.

Tailo: Sàu-lô huan-hù jîn-sîn kóng, Lín thau-thau-á kā Ta-bi̍t kóng, ' Ông kah-ì lí, jîn-sîn mā thiàⁿ lí, só͘-í, lí thang tsò ông ê kiáⁿ-sài. '
English: Saul commanded his servants, saying, Commune with David secretly, and say, Behold, the king has delight in you, and all his servants love you: now therefore be the king's son-in-law.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōng-tè só͘ phuè-ha̍p ê, lâng m̄-thang kā i thiah-suàⁿ.
English: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.

Tailo: Tē-saⁿ pái liam-khau sī uī-tio̍h Tse-bú-lông lâng, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k.
English: The third lot came up for the children of Zebulun according to their families; and the border of their inheritance was to Sarid;

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Si-hông m̄ siong-sìn I-su-la-el, m̄ hō͘ in king-kuè i ê kíng-kài, Si-hông tsiū tsū-tsi̍p i ê jîn-bîn, tī Ia-hat tsat iâⁿ kah I-su-la-el lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: But Sihon didn't trust Israel to pass through his border; but Sihon gathered all his people together, and encamped in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, m̄-sī. Lín nā bô hué-kái, lóng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne bia̍t-bông.
English: I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh tshe lâng khì tshiánn i ê lāu-pē Iâ-kop kah tsuân ka-tso̍k, tsóng-kiōng tshit-tsa̍p-gō͘ lâng khì Ai-gi̍p.
English: Joseph sent, and summoned Jacob, his father, and all his relatives, seventy-five souls.

Tailo: Kiû Lí hō͘ tsin-lí ê uē bô tsuân-pō͘ lī-khui guá ê tshuì, in-uī guá gióng-bōng Lí ê phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: Don't snatch the word of truth out of my mouth, For I put my hope in your ordinances.

Tailo: Guá mā tshe Guá ê tsìng lô͘-po̍k — tsiah-ê sian-ti lâi kìnn lín, tsá-tsá to̍h khí-lâi tshe in, kóng, ' Lín tio̍h ua̍t-thâu, ta̍k lâng lī-khui i ê pháiⁿ lō͘, kái-uāⁿ lín ê só͘ tsò, bô thàn pa̍t tsióng ê sîn-bîng lâi ho̍k-sāi in, lín tsiū thang tuà tī Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín kah lín tsó͘-sian ê tē. ' Tsóng-.sī, lín m̄ àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ, mā m̄-thiaⁿ Guá ê uē.
English: I have sent also to you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, Return you now every man from his evil way, and amend your doings, and don't go after other gods to serve them, and you shall dwell in the land which I have given to you and to your fathers: but you have not inclined your ear, nor listened to me.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā E-hú kóng, In-uī lí kiâⁿ hó koh tsiâⁿ guá só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê, tsiàu Guá ê sim-ì khuán-thāi A-hap ê ke, lí ê kiáⁿ-sun ē tsē I-su-la-el ê kok-uī king-kuè sì tāi.
English: Yahweh said to Jehu, Because you have done well in executing that which is right in my eyes, and have done to the house of Ahab according to all that was in my heart, your sons of the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel.

Tailo: Tsiū ē ìn kóng, ' Sī in-uī in khì-sak Siōng-tsú — in tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè, to̍h-sī tshuā in tshut Ai-gi̍p tē ê, khì kiat-liân pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, ho̍k-sāi kìng-pài in, só͘-í, Siōng-tsú hō͘ tse it-tshè ê tsai-hō lîm-kàu in. '
English: They shall answer, Because they forsook Yahweh, the God of their fathers, who brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, and laid hold on other gods, and worshiped them, and served them: therefore has he brought all this evil on them.

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng tī tseh-kî tiong teh tshuē I-é-su, mn̄g lâng kóng, Hit-ê lâng tī tó-uī?
English: The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he?

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú kah guán tông-tsāi, Iâ-kop ê Siōng-tè tsò guán ê siâⁿ-pó.
English: Yahweh of Armies is with us. The God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

Tailo: Lí í-king thiah i só͘-ū ê lî-pa, hō͘ i ê siâⁿ-pó piàn-sîng pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi.
English: You have broken down all his hedges. You have brought his strongholds to ruin.

Tailo: Hō͘-tsuí kám ū lāu-pē? Lō͘-tsuí tsi̍t tiám tsi̍t tih sī siáⁿ lâng seⁿ ê?
English: Does the rain have a father? Or who fathers the drops of dew?

Tailo: Bô tsi̍t-ê lâng ē-tàng khiā-tiâu tī lín ê bīn-tsîng; Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè ē hō͘ lín só͘ ta̍h ê tsuân tē lóng kiaⁿ lín, lún lín, tsiàu I só͘ tuì lín kóng ê.
English: There shall no man be able to stand before you: Yahweh your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you on all the land that you shall tread on, as he has spoken to you.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Lí — Siōng-tsú ē tshiò in, Lí ē thí-tshiò lia̍t pang.
English: But you, Yahweh, laugh at them. You scoff at all the nations.

Tailo: Sè-tsiūⁿ ê kun-ông kah bān-bîn, kuì-tso̍k kah sè-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ,
English: Kings of the earth and all peoples; Princes and all judges of the earth;

Tailo: Lí kiám-tshái ē kóng, Tshiū-ki tsián khí-.lâi, sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ guá ē-tàng tsiap lo̍h-.khì.
English: You will say then, Branches were broken off, that I might be grafted in.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Kun-ông nā kā sán-gia̍p hō͘ i ê kiáⁿ ê tsi̍t-ê, to̍h-sī tsò i ê sán-gia̍p, kui tī i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, sī in sîng-tsiap tsò sán-gia̍p ê.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: If the prince give a gift to any of his sons, it is his inheritance, it shall belong to his sons; it is their possession by inheritance.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì thiⁿ teh khuàⁿ, I kàm-tshat só͘-ū ê sè-kan lâng.
English: Yahweh looks from heaven. He sees all the sons of men.

Tailo: Lí só͘ kàng ê tsik-hua̍t, kiû Lí kā guá tû-.khì; in-uī Lí ê tshiú ê tok-tsik, guá teh beh hông siau-bia̍t.
English: Remove your scourge away from me. I am overcome by the blow of your hand.

Tailo: Só͘-í, i kuân-tuā puâⁿ-kuè tshân-.ni̍h ê tsìng tshiū, i ê ki tsin ām, i ê ue tsin tn̂g, in-uī tī i sing-tióng ê sî ū tsin tsē tsuí.
English: Therefore its stature was exalted above all the trees of the field; and its boughs were multiplied, and its branches became long by reason of many waters, when it shot them forth.

Tailo: Iâⁿ-tiúⁿ suî-sî tshuā ping kah kun-kuaⁿ lâi-kàu bîn-tsiòng hia. In khuàⁿ-tio̍h kun-kuaⁿ kah ping tsiū thîng tshiú, bô koh phah Páu-lô.
English: Immediately he took soldiers and centurions, and ran down to them. They, when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, stopped beating Paul.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê sim só͘ gí-tiāⁿ ê iáu-buē tsò, iáu-buē tsiânn, I ê siū-khì it-tīng bô tò-tńg, ji̍t-āu lín ē thiat-té bîng-pi̍k.
English: The anger of Yahweh shall not return, until he has executed, and until he have performed the intents of his heart: in the latter days you shall understand it perfectly.

Tailo: Guá beh sé-tû in it-tshè puē-gi̍k Guá ê tsuē, Guá mā beh sià-bián in só͘-ū puē-gi̍k Guá, puē-puān Guá ê hiah-ê tsuē.
English: I will cleanse them from all their iniquity, by which they have sinned against me; and I will pardon all their iniquities, by which they have sinned against me, and by which they have transgressed against me.

Tailo: Sa-mu-el kā jîn-bîn kóng, Tsá-tsîng siat-li̍p Mô͘-se kah A-lông ê, tshuā lín ê tsó͘-sian tshut Ai-gi̍p ê sī Siōng-tsú.
English: Samuel said to the people, It is Yahweh who appointed Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat tsē-uī ê sî, saⁿ-tsa̍p-gō͘ huè, tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsò ông jī-tsa̍p gō͘ nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò A-tsu-bah, to̍h-sī Sil-hí ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Jehoshaphat was thirty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.

Tailo: Sia-huánn tsiū tuà tsheh khì ông hia, koh huê-hok ông kóng, Kiàn-nā lí só͘ kau-thok lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê, in lóng teh tsò.
English: Shaphan carried the book to the king, and moreover brought back word to the king, saying, All that was committed to your servants, they are doing.

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ īng tuā kuân-lîng kiàn-tsìng Tsú I-é-su ê koh-ua̍h, kûn-tsiòng mā lóng tit-tio̍h tuā un-tián.
English: With great power, the apostles gave their testimony of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. Great grace was on them all.

Tailo: Tsí-ū Nó͘-ah tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián.
English: But Noah found favor in Yahweh's eyes.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tsiah-ê hó-gia̍h lâng tio̍h tsù-ì thiaⁿ, lín ê tsai-lān teh beh kàu à, lín tio̍h pi-siong thî-khàu!
English: Come now, you rich, weep and howl for your miseries that are coming on you.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng sī king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, sī Mô͘-se kah A-lông kah I-su-la-el tsa̍p-jī-ê siú-líng só͘ sǹg ê, in ta̍k-ê tāi-piáu in ê tsong-tso̍k.
English: These are those who were numbered, whom Moses and Aaron numbered, and the princes of Israel, being twelve men: they were each one for his fathers' house.

Tailo: Sàu-lô tuì Sa-mu-el kóng, Guá ū tsuē, in-uī guá ū huān-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê bīng-līng kah lí ê uē, sī tuì guá kiaⁿ jîn-bîn, thiaⁿ in ê uē.
English: Saul said to Samuel, I have sinned; for I have transgressed the commandment of Yahweh, and your words, because I feared the people, and obeyed their voice.

Tailo: E-li-hu khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit saⁿ lâng tshuì lāi bô uē thang ìn, tsiū tuā siū-khì.
English: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, his wrath was kindled.

Tailo: Guá beh kā Ai-gi̍p lâng hun-suànn khì tī lia̍t kok, sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t pang.
English: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and will disperse them through the countries.

Tailo: Guá tshe tuā-tsiah phang tī lín ê thâu-tsîng pue, kā A-mô͘-lī lâng ê nn̄g-ê ông, tuì lín ê bīn-tsîng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, m̄-sī īng lí ê to, mā m̄-sī īng lí ê kiong.
English: I sent the hornet before you, which drove them out from before you, even the two kings of the Amorites; not with your sword, nor with your bow.

Tailo: Ê-su-tel ê tsiàu-bīng kian-kò͘ Phul ê tāi-tsì, mā ū kì tī tsheh-.ni̍h.
English: The commandment of Esther confirmed these matters of Purim; and it was written in the book.

Tailo: In ji̍t-ji̍t tshuē Guá, huann-hí tsai Guá ê tō-lō͘, tshin-tshiūnn kiâⁿ gī ê jîn-bîn, bô lī-khui in ê Siōng-tè ê lu̍t-huat. In kiû Guá tsiàu kong-gī sím-phuàⁿ, huann-hí tshin-kīn Siōng-tè.
English: Yet they seek me daily, and delight to know my ways: as a nation that did righteousness, and didn't forsake the ordinance of their God, they ask of me righteous judgments; they delight to draw near to God.

Tailo: Tuì-ti̍k tshun tshiú, tshiúⁿ i só͘-ū ê pó-bu̍t; i khuàⁿ-tio̍h guā-pang lâng ji̍p-khì i ê sìng-só͘, to̍h-sī Lí bat huan-hù m̄-thang ji̍p-khì Lí ê huē tiong ê.
English: The adversary has spread out his hand on all her pleasant things: For she has seen that the nations are entered into her sanctuary, Concerning whom you did command that they should not enter into your assembly.

Tailo: Tuì in lâi kóng, hióng-lo̍k to̍h-sī tī ji̍t-sî tsiū tîm-lûn tī tsîng-io̍k ê buán-tsiok lâi huann-hí. Kah lín tsò-hué tsia̍h-toh ê sî, in m̄-tsai thang kiàn-siàu koh bô kò͘ thé-biān, hòng-tshiòng iàn-lo̍k.
English: receiving the wages of unrighteousness; people who count it pleasure to revel in the daytime, spots and blemishes, reveling in their deceit while they feast with you;

Tailo: I káng-lūn tsháu-ba̍k, tuì Le-ba-nòng ê pik-hiuⁿ tshiū kàu tshiûⁿ tíng huat khí-.lâi ê gû-tshik-tsháu, koh káng-lūn tsáu-siù, pue-tsiáu, thâng-thuā kah tsuí-tso̍k.
English: He spoke of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even to the hyssop that springs out of the wall; he spoke also of animals, and of birds, and of creeping things, and of fish.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, lí sí ê kî teh beh kàu; lí tiàu Io-siú-ah lâi, tsò-hué tuà tī huē-bō͘ tiong, Guá beh īng tsit-jīm bīng-līng i. Mô͘-se tsiū kah Io-siú-ah khì tsò-hué tuà tī huē-bō͘ tiong.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Behold, your days approach that you must die: call Joshua, and present yourselves in the tent of meeting, that I may give him a charge. Moses and Joshua went, and presented themselves in the tent of meeting.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh kā lín khuán-thāi só͘ uá-khò tsit king īng Guá ê miâ tshing-ho͘ ê tshù, í-ki̍p Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín kah lín ê tsó͘-sian ê tē, tshin-tshiūnn Guá tsá-tsîng khuán-thāi Sī-lô án-ne.
English: therefore will I do to the house which is called by my name, in which you trust, and to the place which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I did to Shiloh.

Tailo: Guá mā puāⁿ khui guá ê saⁿ-á phè, kóng, Kiàn-nā bô tsiânn tsit-ê uē ê, guān Siōng-tè tsiàu án-ne kā i puāⁿ khui lâi lī-khui i ê ke kah i ê tsit-gia̍p, to̍h-sī guān I tsiàu án-ne puāⁿ kàu khang-khang. Huē-tsiòng lóng kóng, A-men! Koh o-ló Siōng-tsú. Jîn-bîn tsiū tsiàu tsit-ê uē lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Also I shook out my lap, and said, So God shake out every man from his house, and from his labor, that doesn't perform this promise; even thus be he shaken out, and emptied. All the assembly said, Amen, and praised Yahweh. The people did according to this promise.

Tailo: Sàu-lô tī ī-siōng tiong ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò A-ná-ni-a ê lâng, ji̍p-lâi kā i huāⁿ-tshiú, hō͘ i ē-tàng koh khuànn-kìnn.
English: and in a vision he has seen a man named Ananias coming in, and laying his hands on him, that he might receive his sight.

Tailo: I m̄-sī sí-lâng ê Siōng-tè, sī ua̍h-lâng ê Siōng-tè, in-uī lâng lóng sī uī-tio̍h Tsú teh ua̍h.
English: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh kóng, Lí tshut-lâi khiā tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng. Lí khuàⁿ, Siōng-tsú king-kuè, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng ū tuā koh thàu ê hong, phuà-li̍h tsiah-ê suaⁿ, phah-tshuì tsiah-ê tsio̍h; tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú bô tī hong ê lāi-bīn; hong liáu-āu ū tē-tāng, Siōng-tsú mā bô tī tē-tāng ê tiong-kan;
English: He said, Go forth, and stand on the mountain before Yahweh. Behold, Yahweh passed by, and a great and strong wind tore the mountains, and broke in pieces the rocks before Yahweh; but Yahweh was not in the wind: and after the wind an earthquake; but Yahweh was not in the earthquake:

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê pēnn-lâng, miâ kiò-tsò La̍h-tsa-lō͘, i tuà tī Bē-tha-niah, to̍h-sī Mâ-lí-ah kah i ê á-tsé Mal-tha ê tsng-thâu.
English: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister, Martha.

Tailo: Guá nā kiâⁿ pháiⁿ, tsiū ū tsai-hō, guá nā tsò gī, mā m̄-káⁿ gia̍h-khí thâu; muá-sim kiàn-siàu, tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá ê kan-khó͘.
English: If I am wicked, woe to me. If I am righteous, I still shall not lift up my head, Being filled with disgrace, And conscious of my affliction.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán koh tshe-phài tsi̍t-ê hiann-tī kah in tsò-hué khì, tsit-ê hiann-tī king-kuè guán tsin tsē khó-giām, guán tsai i jia̍t-sim pang-tsān lâng. Taⁿ i hui-siông sìn-jīm lín, tsiū koh khah khat-bōng khì pang-tsān lín.
English: We have sent with them our brother, whom we have many times proved earnest in many things, but now much more earnest, by reason of the great confidence which he has in you.

Tailo: Siōng-tè tshe I to̍k-seⁿ ê Kiáⁿ lâi-kàu sè-kan, hō͘ lán tuì I lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā. Siōng-tè īng án-ne tuì lán hián-bîng I ê thiàⁿ tī lán tiong-kan.
English: By this was God's love revealed in us, that God has sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him.

Tailo: á-.sī bô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê sî, īng ē phah-sí-lâng ê tsio̍h-thâu tìm-tio̍h i, lâi tì-sú sí, kah i pún bô uan-siû, mā bô ì-sù beh hāi i,
English: or with any stone, by which a man may die, not seeing him, and cast it on him, so that he died, and he was not his enemy, neither sought his harm;

Tailo: Thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí ê khé-bîng-tsheⁿ, lí ná ē tuì thiⁿ tuī lo̍h-.lâi! Lí tsit-ê kong-phuà lia̍t kok ê lâng ná ē siū phah tó tī tē-tsiūⁿ?
English: How you have fallen from Heaven, morning star, son of the dawn! How you are cut down to the ground, who laid the nations low!

Tailo: Iô-tah tsìng lâng siat-li̍p U-tsi-iah suà-tsiap i ê lāu-pē A-má-tsiah tsò ông, hit sî i tsa̍p la̍k huè.
English: All the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.

Tailo: I-é-su mn̄g kóng, Taⁿ lín ū sìn bô?
English: Jesus answered them, Do you now believe?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá só͘ siū ê uan-óng, kiû Lí kā guá phuàⁿ-tuàn.
English: Yahweh, you have seen my wrong; judge you my cause.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí tshin-tshiūnn tsuí teh kún, it-tīng bē-tàng khiā thâu uī; in-uī lí peh-tsiūⁿ lín lāu-pē ê bîn-tshn̂g, lí peh-tsiūⁿ guá ê tshn̂g-pho͘, lí kā i uè lah-sap,
English: Boiling over as water, you shall not excell; Because you went up to your father's bed; Then defiled it. He went up to my couch.

Tailo: Lí nā thiaⁿ Guá it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, kiânn Guá ê tō-lō͘, tsò Guá khuàⁿ-tsò tsìng-ti̍t ê tāi-tsì, siú Guá ê lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, tshin-tshiūnn Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Ta-bi̍t ê só͘ tsò, Guá tsiū kah lí tông-tsāi, kā lí kiàn-li̍p kian-kò͘ ê ke, tshin-tshiūnn Guá kā Ta-bi̍t kiàn-li̍p ê, koh beh kā I-su-la-el kau hō͘ lí.
English: It shall be, if you will listen to all that I command you, and will walk in my ways, and do that which is right in my eyes, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with you, and will build you a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel to you.

Tailo: Guá m̄ sī teh tsí sè-kan hiah-ê îm-luān, tham-sim, tsà-khi á-.sī pài ngó͘-siōng ê lâng; nā-sī án-ne, lín suah tio̍h lī-khui sè-kan tsiah ū khó-lîng.
English: yet not at all meaning with the sexual sinners of this world, or with the covetous and extortioners, or with idolaters; for then you would have to leave the world.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm tuì Siōng-tè kóng, Tān-guān I-si-ma-el ua̍h tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Abraham said to God, Oh that Ishmael might live before you!

Tailo: Αp-sa-lôm kā i kóng, Lí ê tāi-tsì sī hó, sī ū tsîng-lí, tsóng-.sī, ông bô kau-tài lâng thiaⁿ lí ê uē.
English: Absalom said to him, Behold, your matters are good and right; but there is no man deputized of the king to hear you.

Tailo: Hit sî, lán tit-tio̍h tsit-ê tē. Τuì Al-nông suaⁿ-kok piⁿ ê A-ló-el khí, í-ki̍p Gi-lia̍t suaⁿ-tē ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ kah kî-tiong ê siâⁿ, guá lóng hō͘ Lū-biān lâng kah Ga̍t lâng.
English: This land we took in possession at that time: from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, and half the hill country of Gilead, and the cities of it, gave I to the Reubenites and to the Gadites:

Tailo: M̄-thang in-uī kiáⁿ lâi hō͘ lāu-pē sí, mā m̄-thang in-uī lāu-pē lâi hō͘ kiáⁿ sí, ta̍k lâng lóng tio̍h uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê tsuē lâi sí.
English: The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers: every man shall be put to death for his own sin.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá uī-tio̍h lín siū tsiah-ê kan-khó͘, kám-kak tsin huann-hí; guá jio̍k-thé siū khó͘ sī uī-tio̍h Ki-tok ê sing-khu, to̍h-sī kàu-huē, teh siū iáu-buē tsīn ê khó͘-lān.
English: Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and fill up on my part that which is lacking of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body's sake, which is the assembly;

Tailo: Píng-kong kiâⁿ-gī, ē hō͘ hó lâng huann-hí; tuì pháiⁿ lâng bô siáⁿ lī-ik.
English: It is joy to the righteous to do justice; But it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù I-su-la-el lâng kóng, kiàn-nā hiàn siā-un-tsè hō͘ Siōng-tsú ê lâng, tio̍h tuì i ê siā-un-tsè tiong, tuà i ê lé-mi̍h lâi hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, saying, He who offers the sacrifice of his peace offerings to Yahweh shall bring his offering to Yahweh out of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.

Tailo: Ông tuā siū-khì, tuì tsiú-iàn khí-.lâi, ji̍p-khì ông-kiong ê hue-hn̂g. Ha-mán mā khí-lâi tuì ông-hō͘ Ê-su-tel kiû sèⁿ-miā, in-uī khuàⁿ-tio̍h ông kuat-ì beh kā i hîng-hua̍t.
English: The king arose in his wrath from the banquet of wine and went into the palace garden: and Haman stood up to make request for his life to Esther the queen; for he saw that there was evil determined against him by the king.

Tailo: Guá hē tē ê tē-ki, hit sî lí tī tó-uī? Lí nā tsai-iáⁿ tsiū kóng tshut-.lâi.
English: Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? Declare, if you have understanding.

Tailo: Lín tó tī iûⁿ-tiâu lāi ê sî, tshin-tshiūnn hún-tsiáu ê si̍t siuⁿ pe̍h-gîn, i ê mn̂g siuⁿ n̂g-kim.
English: While you sleep among the campfires, The wings of a dove sheathed with silver, Her feathers with shining gold.

Tailo: Lí ê uá-khò kám m̄-sī tsāi tī lí ê kìng-uì Siōng-tè? Lí ê ǹg-bāng kám m̄-sī tsāi tī lí ê hîng-uî sûn-tsuân?
English: Isn't your piety your confidence, The integrity of your ways your hope?

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí ê sió-tī ē koh ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: Jesus said to her, Your brother will rise again.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí kā Lí lu̍t-lē ê lō͘ tsí-sī guá, guá beh thiat-té tsun-siú!
English: Teach me, Yahweh, the way of your statutes. I will keep them to the end.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Lín ê lu̍t-huat kám bô kì-tsài, Siōng-tè kóng, ' Guá kóng lín sī sîn-bîng '? ( tsù, SPh 82:6 )
English: Jesus answered them, Isn't it written in your law, I said, you are gods?'

Tailo: Taⁿ lín nā si̍t-tsāi tsun-thàn Guá ê uē, tsun-siú Guá ê iok, lín tsiū ē tī lia̍t kok tiong tsò Guá ka-kī ê pó-puè, in-uī tsuân tē lóng sī Guá ê.
English: Now therefore, if you will indeed obey my voice, and keep my covenant, then you shall be my own possession from among all peoples; for all the earth is mine;

Tailo: Thàu-tsá-khí-.lâi, tāi-ke hō͘-siong tsiù-tsuā. Í-sak sàng in tshut-huat, in tsiū an-jiân lī-khui i khì.
English: They rose up some time in the morning, and swore one to another. Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.

Tailo: I mā kiânn A-hap ê ke ê lō͘, in-uī i ê lāu-bú tsí-hui i kiâⁿ pháiⁿ.
English: He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab; for his mother was his counselor to do wickedly.

Tailo: Tī An-hioh-ji̍t tsîng tsi̍t ji̍t hông-hun ê sî, guá tsiū bīng-līng lâng kā Ê-lú-sa-lèm siâⁿ mn̂g kuainn khí-.lâi, koh bīng-līng, An-hioh-ji̍t iáu-buē kuè m̄-thang khui; guá phài kuí-nā-ê lô͘-po̍k kuán-lí siâⁿ mn̂g, bián-tit ū lâng tī An-hioh-ji̍t taⁿ siáⁿ-mi̍h tàⁿ ji̍p-.lâi.
English: It came to pass that, when the gates of Jerusalem began to be dark before the Sabbath, I commanded that the doors should be shut, and commanded that they should not be opened until after the Sabbath: and some of my servants set I over the gates, that there should no burden be brought in on the Sabbath day.

Tailo: El-ká-nah kah i ê tsuân ke lóng tsiūⁿ-.khì, tsiū īng ta̍k nî ê tsè-sū kah i só͘ hē ê guān hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: The man Elkanah, and all his house, went up to offer to Yahweh the yearly sacrifice, and his vow.

Tailo: Hit sî liáu-āu, Iô-tah ông Iô-sa-huat kah I-su-la-el ông A-ha-tsiah kiat-kau; A-ha-tsiah kiâⁿ pháiⁿ kàu-ki̍k.
English: After this did Jehoshaphat king of Judah join himself with Ahaziah king of Israel; the same did very wickedly:

Tailo: Thó͘-tē put-sî teh khip-siu tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-.lâi ê hō͘-tsuí lâi sing-sán tshài-se, tuì tsoh-sit lâng ū lō͘-īng, tse to̍h-sī Siōng-tè ê tsiok-hok.
English: For the land which has drunk the rain that comes often on it, and brings forth a crop suitable for them for whose sake it is also tilled, receives blessing from God;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guán beh o-ló Siōng-tsú, tuì tsit sî kàu íng-uán. Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú!
English: But we will bless Yah, From this time forth and forevermore. Praise Yah!

Tailo: Siōng-tè ê siâⁿ ah, ū îng-kng ê tāi-tsì, sī tsí lí lâi kóng ê. [Sè-la̍h]
English: Glorious things are spoken about you, city of God. Selah.

Tailo: In uî-khùn Biān-iá-mín lâng, jiok in, tī in hioh-kha ê só͘-tsāi kā in thún-ta̍h, it-ti̍t kàu Gi-be-at ê tuì-bīn, ǹg ji̍t tshut ê só͘-tsāi.
English: They enclosed the Benjamites round about, and chased them, and trod them down at their resting place, as far as over against Gibeah toward the sunrise.

Tailo: Tsun-siú I kiàn-tsìng ê uē, tsuan-sim tsáu-tshuē I ê lâng, tsit khuán lâng tsin ū hok-khì!
English: Blessed are those who keep his statutes, Who seek him with their whole heart.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kā Sàu-lô kóng, Lâng m̄-bián uī-tio̍h hit-ê lâng lâi sit táⁿ, lí ê lô͘-po̍k beh khì kah hit-ê Hui-lī-sū lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: David said to Saul, Let no man's heart fail because of him; your servant will go and fight with this Philistine.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h gia̍h kuái-á, lí kah lí ê a-hiaⁿ A-lông tsio-tsi̍p huē-tsiòng; tī in ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, lín bīng-līng tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshut tsuí, lí uī-tio̍h jîn-bîn hō͘ tsuí tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshut-.lâi, hō͘ huē-tsiòng kah in ê tsing-seⁿ ū tsuí thang lim.
English: Take the rod, and assemble the congregation, you, and Aaron your brother, and speak you to the rock before their eyes, that it give forth its water; and you shall bring forth to them water out of the rock; so you shall give the congregation and their livestock drink.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, i nā tshuē-tio̍h hit tsiah sit-bê ê iûⁿ, it-tīng pí ū káu-tsa̍p-káu tsiah bô phah-m̄-kiàn koh khah huann-hí.
English: If he finds it, most assuredly I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī pháiⁿ lâng tuì Siōng-tè só͘ tit ê hūn-gia̍h; sī Siōng-tè kā i tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p.
English: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, The heritage appointed to him by God.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng kóng, I sī uá-khò kuí-ông lâi teh kuáⁿ kuí.
English: But the Pharisees said, By the prince of the demons, he casts out demons.

Tailo: Án-ne, lán mā thang kóng, liân kā jîn-bîn tsing-siu tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it ê Lē-bī, mā bat thong-kuè A-bu-la-hàm lâi la̍p tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it.
English: So to say, through Abraham even Levi, who receives tithes, has paid tithes,

Tailo: Lâng-lâng lī-khui tsiàⁿ lō͘, lóng kiânn bê-lō͘; lóng bô lâng tsò hó, liân tsi̍t-ê to bô. ( tsù, SPh 14:1-3 )
English: They have all turned aside. They have together become unprofitable. There is no one who does good, No, not, so much as one.

Tailo: Lín tsai, i āu-lâi ài beh niá-siū tsiok-hok ê sî hō͘ lāu-pē kī-tsua̍t, in-uī i tshuē bô pān-huat lâi kái-piàn lāu-pē ê sim-ì, só͘-í suî-jiân lâu ba̍k-sái, pik-tshiat kî-kiû, mā bē-tàng tit-tio̍h tsiok-hok.
English: For you know that even when he afterward desired to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, for he found no place for a change of mind though he sought it diligently with tears.

Tailo: Lín kah Iô-tá-iah lâng kāng-khuán, sī khí-tsō tī sù-tô͘ kah sian-ti ê tē-ki tíng-bīn, Ki-tok I-é-su ka-kī mā tsò tshù-kak-thâu siōng tiōng-iàu ê ki-tsio̍h.
English: being built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the chief cornerstone;

Tailo: Hiah-ê kí Sa-má-lī-a ê tsuē lâi tsiù-tsuā, koh kí Tàn ê ua̍h ê Siōng-tè lâi tsiù-tsuā, koh kí Bel-sí-bah ê ua̍h-lō͘ lâi tsiù-tsuā ê, in it-tīng ē pua̍h-tó, íng-uán bē koh khí-.lâi.
English: Those who swear by the sin of Samaria, And say, As your god, Dan, lives;' And, As the way of Beersheba lives;' They will fall, and never rise up again.

Tailo: Guá beh īng to-kiàm, īng ki-hng, īng un-i̍k jiok in, hō͘ in tī thian-hā bān-kok liû-lōng, tī Guá kuáⁿ in khì-kàu ê ta̍k kok, tsò thang tsiù-tsó͘, thang tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, thang khau-sé, thang lîng-jio̍k ê.
English: I will pursue after them with the sword, with the famine, and with the pestilence, and will deliver them to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth, to be an object of horror, and an astonishment, and a hissing, and a reproach, among all the nations where I have driven them;

Tailo: Kàu tsò tsi̍t-ē an-hioh tī thô͘-.ni̍h ê sî, tse ǹg-bāng ē lo̍h kàu im-kan ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ hia.
English: Shall it go down with me to the gates of Sheol, Or descend together into the dust?

Tailo: In-uī in m̄ sìn-ho̍k Siōng-tè, m̄ uá-khò I ê kiù-un.
English: Because they didn't believe in God, And didn't trust in his salvation.

Tailo: Hui-lī-sū lâng kóng, Tsit-ê tāi-tsì sī siáⁿ lâng tsò ê? In kóng, Sī Tim-nah lâng ê kiáⁿ-sài Sâm-sóng, in-uī i ê tiūⁿ-lâng kā i ê bó͘ hō͘ i ê puê-phuāⁿ. Hui-lī-sū lâng tsiū tńg-.khì, īng hué sio tsa-bó͘ lâng kah i ê lāu-pē.
English: Then the Philistines said, Who has done this? They said, Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, because he has taken his wife, and given her to his companion. The Philistines came up, and burnt her and her father with fire.

Tailo: In-uī in m̄-sī tuì in ê to-kiàm lâi tit-tio̍h thó͘-tē, mā m̄-sī in ê tshiú kiù ka-kī; sī Lí ê tsiàⁿ tshiú, Lí ê tshiú-kut, Lí ê bīn ê kng kiù in; in-uī Lí ì-ài in.
English: For they didn't get the land in possession by their own sword, Neither did their own arm save them; But your right hand, and your arm, and the light of your face, Because you were favorable to them.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, in-uī Tsú — bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú, tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm kah Iô-tah tû-khì in só͘ uá-khò ê, in só͘ i-nāi ê, to̍h-sī bí-niûⁿ kah tsuí,
English: For, behold, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, takes away from Jerusalem and from Judah supply and support, The whole supply of bread, And the whole supply of water;

Tailo: I koh khuànn Ke-nî lâng, tsiū thê-khí i ê kua, kóng: Lí tuà ê só͘-tsāi sī kian-kò͘, lí tsò siū tī suaⁿ-giâm.
English: He looked at the Kenite, and took up his parable, and said, Strong is your dwelling place, Your nest is set in the rock.

Tailo: Tī hia lín ē kì-tit lín ê só͘ kiâⁿ, só͘ tsò, to̍h-sī lín tuì hiah-ê lâi kā lín ka-kī uè lah-sap ê, koh beh in-uī lín só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê pháiⁿ lâi ka-kī thó-ià.
English: There shall you remember your ways, and all your doings, in which you have polluted yourselves; and you shall loathe yourselves in your own sight for all your evils that you have committed.

Tailo: In-uī lán ê tsó͘-sian ū huān tsuē, kiânn Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, lī-khui I, ua̍t-tńg i ê bīn, kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ ǹg Siōng-tsú tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: For our fathers have trespassed, and done that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh our God, and have forsaken him, and have turned away their faces from the habitation of Yahweh, and turned their backs.

Tailo: I ê hing-khám tsin puî, i ê kut-tshué tsu-jūn.
English: His pails are full of milk. The marrow of his bones is moistened.

Tailo: Guān îng-kng kui tī tsì-kuân Siōng-tè, guān I sù hô-pîng hō͘ I só͘ huann-hí ê lâng.
English: Glory to God in the highest, On earth peace, good will toward men.

Tailo: In iáu tī lō͘-.ni̍h to̍h ū hong-siaⁿ thuân kàu Ta-bi̍t, kóng, Αp-sa-lôm ū thâi-sí ông ê tsìng kiáⁿ, bô lâu kah puàⁿ-ê.
English: It happened, while they were in the way, that the news came to David, saying, Absalom has slain all the king's sons, and there is not one of them left.

Tailo: A-siul kah i ê jîn-bîn lóng tī hia, in ê bōng tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî; in lóng sī siū thâi tó tī to hā ê.
English: Asshur is there and all her company; her graves are round about her; all of them slain, fallen by the sword;

Tailo: Lín tsai guán tuì-thāi lín ta̍k lâng, tshin-tshiūnn lāu-pē teh tuì-thāi ka-kī ê kiáⁿ-jî.
English: As you know how we exhorted, comforted, and implored every one of you, as a father does his own children,

Tailo: Guá ê lāu-pē Ta-bi̍t sim-lāi ū ì-sù, beh uī Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè ê miâ khí tiān.
English: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: I-é-su thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē tsiū kám-kak kî-kuài, ua̍t tńg-sin kā tuè I ê kûn-tsiòng kóng, Guá kā lín kóng, liân I-su-la-el lâng ê tiong-kan, guá to m̄-bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn tsit khuán ê sìn-sim.
English: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turned and said to the multitude who followed him, I tell you, I have not found such great faith, no, not in Israel.

Tailo: I tuè tī Páu-lô kah guán ê āu-bīn, tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tsiah-ê lâng to̍h-sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k, beh tuì lín suan-káng tsín-kiù ê tō-lō͘.
English: Following Paul and us, she cried out, These men are servants of the Most High God, who proclaim to us the way of salvation!

Tailo: Siú tseh ê sî, lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-jî, lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī kah tuà tī lí siâⁿ mn̂g lāi ê Lē-bī lâng, í-ki̍p kià-kha ê kah ko͘-jî, kuáⁿ-hū, lóng tio̍h huann-hí.
English: and you shall rejoice in your feast, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your male servant, and your female servant, and the Levite, and the foreigner, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are within your gates.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me again, saying,

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng huān-tio̍h thâi lâng, siâ-su̍t, îm-luān kah thau-the̍h ê tsuē, mā bô hué-kái.
English: They didn't repent of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their sexual immorality, nor of their thefts.

Tailo: Tsiáng-kuán tsuè-āu tshit-ê tsai-hō ê tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài tuì sìng-tiān tshut-.lâi, sin tshīng tshing-khì koh kng iàⁿ-iàⁿ ê iù-muâ-pò͘ saⁿ, hing-khám hâ kim-tuà.
English: The seven angels who had the seven plagues came out, clothed with pure, bright linen, and wearing golden sashes around their breasts.

Tailo: I-é-su koh kóng, Tsit sè-tāi ê lâng, guá beh īng siáⁿ-mi̍h lâi pí-phīng? In tshin-tshiūnn siáⁿ-mi̍h khuán ê lâng?
English: But the Lord said, To what then will I liken the people of this generation? What are they like?

Tailo: Tio̍h kam-sim lo̍k-ì tsīn lô͘-po̍k ê pún-hūn, tshin-tshiūnn teh ho̍k-sāi Tsú, m̄-sī teh ho̍k-sāi lâng.
English: with good will doing service, as to the Lord, and not to men;

Tailo: Só͘-í, I hō͘ in khang-khang kuè-ji̍t, hō͘ in nî-nî tī kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ tiong king-kuè.
English: Therefore he consumed their days in vanity, And their years in terror.

Tailo: Páu-lô kóng suah, kuī lo̍h-khì kah kûn-tsiòng tsò-hué kî-tó.
English: When he had spoken these things, he knelt down and prayed with them all.

Tailo: In kā tsi̍h kńg uan tshin-tshiūnn kiong lâi kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t. In tī kok lāi ke-thinn sè-li̍k, m̄-sī uī-tio̍h tsin-si̍t, to̍h-sī pháiⁿ liáu koh pháiⁿ ê, in mā m̄-bat Siōng-tè. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: They bend their tongue, as it were their bow, for falsehood; and they are grown strong in the land, but not for truth: for they proceed from evil to evil, and they don't know me, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsia̍h-mi̍h kám m̄-sī tuì lán ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tuān-tsua̍t? Huann-hí khuài-lo̍k kám m̄-sī tuì lán ê Siōng-tè ê tiān thîng-tsí?
English: Isn't the food cut off before our eyes; Joy and gladness from the house of our God?

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ pi-ai sue-thè, sè-kài hú-pāi sue-thè, tē-tsiūⁿ tiàm tī kuân uī ê lâng mā hú-pāi.
English: The earth mourns and fades away. The world languishes and fades away. The lofty people of the earth languish.

Tailo: A-lông tio̍h ji̍p-khì huē-bō͘, thǹg i ji̍p sìng-só͘ ê sî só͘ tshīng iù-tē ê saⁿ-khò͘, lâu tī hia,
English: Aaron shall come into the Tent of Meeting, and shall take off the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the Holy Place, and shall leave them there.

Tailo: Guá sim só͘ ài ê lâng, kiû lí kā guá kóng, lí tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi teh tshī iûⁿ? Tiong-tàu sî lí hō͘ in hioh tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi? Tī lí tâng-phuāⁿ ê iûⁿ-kûn ê piⁿ-á, guá ná ē tshin-tshiūnn tà bīn ê lâng?
English: Tell me, you whom my soul loves, Where you graze your flock, Where you rest them at noon; For why should I be as one who is veiled Beside the flocks of your companions? Lover

Tailo: Koh ū tshin-tshiūnn hun-khui ê hué-tsi̍h tuì in tshut-hiān, hioh tī ta̍k lâng ê tíng-bīn.
English: Tongues like fire appeared and were distributed to them, and one sat on each of them.

Tailo: Tshiánn uī guá kî-tó, hō͘ guá ē-tàng kā ing-kai kóng ê ò-pì lóng kóng tshing-tshó.
English: that I may reveal it as I ought to speak.

Tailo: Khò tsit-ê siâⁿ tsò sing-lí huat-tsâi ê lâng, in-uī tsin kiaⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê siâⁿ só͘ siū ê kan-khó͘, só͘-í, lóng khiā hn̄g-hn̄g teh pi-siong thî-khàu,
English: The merchants of these things, who were made rich by her, will stand far away for the fear of her torment, weeping and mourning;

Tailo: Lín tio̍h sè-jī thiaⁿ guá ê uē, hō͘ guá só͘ piān-lūn ê ji̍p-khì lín ê hīⁿ-khang.
English: Hear diligently my speech. Let my declaration be in your ears.

Tailo: Lâi, lán tio̍h kiok-kiong kìng-pài! Kuī-lo̍h tī tshòng-tsō lán ê Siōng-tsú bīn-tsîng!
English: Oh come, let's worship and bow down. Let's kneel before Yahweh, our Maker,

Tailo: In-uī lí pō-gio̍k lí ê hiann-tī Iâ-kop, lí ē tú-tio̍h tuā-tuā kiàn-siàu, lí mā ē íng-uán siū tsián-tû.
English: For the violence done to your brother Jacob, shame will cover you, and you will be cut off forever.

Tailo: I kā tsit-ê tshiong-tsiok ê un-tián sù hō͘ lán, kā ta̍k tsióng ê tshong-bîng tì-huī,
English: which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence,

Tailo: Tī siâⁿ mn̂g hia ū sì-ê thái-ko ê, in tsò-hué kóng, Lán ná ē tsē tī tsia teh thìng-hāu sí?
English: Now there were four leprous men at the entrance of the gate: and they said one to another, Why sit we here until we die?

Tailo: Tsîng Ba-bú-lông ông Nep-kat-ne-tsal lia̍h kàu Ba-bú-lông ê, Iô-tah síng jîn-bîn tiong ū lâng tuì siū lia̍h-.khì ê só͘-tsāi tńg-lâi Ê-lú-sa-lèm kah Iô-tah, ta̍k lâng lóng tńg-khì ka-kī ê siâⁿ.
English: These are the children of the province, who went up out of the captivity of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away, and who returned to Jerusalem and to Judah, everyone to his city;

Tailo: In suî-sî pàng-lo̍h hî-bāng khì tuè I-é-su.
English: Immediately they left their nets, and followed him.

Tailo: In-uī I tuì seh kóng: Tio̍h lo̍h tī tē-tsiūⁿ; tuì kui-tsūn ê hō͘ kah kui-tsūn ê tuā hō͘ mā sī án-ne kóng.
English: For he says to the snow, Fall on the earth;' Likewise to the shower of rain, And to the showers of his mighty rain.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tsun-siú guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lín ê it-tshè kài-bīng, hō͘ lín tsòng-táⁿ, ē-tàng ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap lín só͘ beh kuè-khì sîng-tsiap ê tē,
English: Therefore shall you keep all the commandment which I command you this day, that you may be strong, and go in and possess the land, where you go over to possess it;

Tailo: guá í-king khí tsit king tiān hō͘ Lí tuà, tsò Lí íng-uán tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: I have surely built you a house of habitation, a place for you to dwell in forever.

Tailo: Ē ū tsin tsē lâng ka-kī tshing-khì-kàu pe̍h-pe̍h, koh siū tuàn-liān; tsóng-.sī, pháiⁿ lâng iû-guân ē kiâⁿ pháiⁿ; só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ lâng lóng bē bîng-pi̍k, to̍k-to̍k tì-huī ê lâng ē bîng-pi̍k.
English: Many shall purify themselves, and make themselves white, and be refined; but the wicked shall do wickedly; and none of the wicked shall understand; but those who are wise shall understand.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng: Kóng-tio̍h Ko-lai-iah ê kiáⁿ A-hap kah Ma-a-se-iah ê kiáⁿ Tse-ti-kiah, in thok Guá ê miâ tuì lín suan-pò͘ pe̍h-tsha̍t. Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā in kau tī Ba-bú-lông ông — Nep-kat-ne-tsal ê tshiú, i ē tī lín ê bīn-tsîng kā in thâi-sí.
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie to you in my name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and he shall kill them before your eyes;

Tailo: Ài sim-kuann tshing-khì ê lâng kóng un-tián ê uē, ông ē tsò i ê pîng-iú.
English: He who loves purity of heart and speaks gracefully Is the king's friend.

Tailo: Páu-lô kóng-kàu kong-gī, tsiat-tsè kah tsiong-lâi ê sím-phuàⁿ ê sî, Hue-lik-su put-tsí kiaⁿ, ìn kóng, Taⁿ lí hó tshut-khì à, ū ki-huē tsiah koh tshiáⁿ lí lâi.
English: As he reasoned about righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered, Go your way for this time, and when it is convenient for me, I will summon you.

Tailo: In-uī ū tīng tsuē, bô tsik-sî si-hîng hîng-hua̍t, só͘-í, sè-kan lâng ê sim tuā táⁿ kiâⁿ pháiⁿ.
English: Because sentence against an evil work is not executed speedily, therefore the heart of the sons of men is fully set in them to do evil.

Tailo: Lán īng bé-kā-kiuⁿ tàu tī bé ê tshuì, hō͘ in sūn-ho̍k, tsiū ē-tàng khòng-tsè kui-tsiah bé.
English: Indeed, we put bits into the horses' mouths so that they may obey us, and we guide their whole body.

Tailo: in nā kiânn Guá khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, m̄ tsun-thàn Guá ê uē, Guá tsiū ē hō͘-hué Guá só͘ kóng beh hō͘ in ê hok-khì.
English: if they do that which is evil in my sight, that they not obey my voice, then I will repent of the good, with which I said I would benefit them.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah in ê tsng-thâu, to̍h-sī Tàn ê kiáⁿ-sun ê tsi-tso̍k só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p, tsiàu in ê tsong-tso̍k.
English: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families, these cities with their villages.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t beh sí ê kî kīn lah, i tsiū huan-hù i ê kiáⁿ Só͘-lô-móng kóng,
English: Now the days of David drew near that he should die; and he charged Solomon his son, saying,

Tailo: Tī tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, Io-buh pīng bô huān tsuē, mā lóng m̄-bat bâi-uàn Siōng-tè ê tsok-uî.
English: In all this, Job did not sin, nor charge God with wrongdoing.

Tailo: Hū-jîn lâng kóng, Sin-seⁿ, Lí bô tshiūⁿ tsuí ê khì-kū, tséⁿ koh tshim, Lí beh tuì tó-uī tit-tio̍h ua̍h-tsuí?
English: The woman said to him, Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep. From where then have you that living water?

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn. I ê kiáⁿ E-hō͘-iá-kin suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers; and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Tuè-āu koh ū tshit tsiah gû-bó tuì hô-.ni̍h khí-.lâi, khiap-sì koh sán, kah tsîng hiah-ê gû tsò-hué khiā tī hô piⁿ.
English: Behold, seven other cattle came up after them out of the river, ugly and thin, and stood by the other cattle on the brink of the river.

Tailo: Kî-tha tsa̍p-ê bûn-tô͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tuì hit nn̄g-ê hiann-tī siū-khì.
English: When the ten heard it, they were indignant with the two brothers.

Tailo: Hô-hòng Ki-tok sī thong-kuè íng-uán ê Sìng Sîn, hiàn I ka-kī bô khuat-tiám ê pún-sin hō͘ Siōng-tè; I ê hueh kám bô koh khah hō͘ lán ê liông-sim tshing-khì, thang thuat-lī sí-bông ê hîng-uî, lâi ho̍k-sāi íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tè?
English: how much more will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God, cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h khì Guá tī Sī-lô ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī Guá khí-thâu siat-tsò kiû-kiò Guá ê miâ ê só͘-tsāi, khì khuànn Guá in-uī Guá ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng ê tsuē-ok án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi hit só͘-tsāi.
English: But go you now to my place which was in Shiloh, where I caused my name to dwell at the first, and see what I did to it for the wickedness of my people Israel.

Tailo: koh īng hô-pîng sîng-si̍t ê uē, siá phue hō͘ A-ha-sui-ló͘ ông kok lāi tsi̍t-pah jī-tsa̍p tshit síng lāi só͘-ū ê Iô-tah lâng,
English: He sent letters to all the Jews, to the hundred twenty-seven provinces of the kingdom of Ahasuerus, with words of peace and truth,

Tailo: I-su-la-el kā i kóng, Lí khì khuànn lín a-hiaⁿ ū pîng-ána bô, iûⁿ-kûn ū pîng-ána bô, jiân-āu tńg-lâi kā guá kóng. I-su-la-el tsiū tshe i tshut He-bú-lông ê suaⁿ-kok. Iô-sé-huh tsiū khì-kàu Sī-khiàm,
English: He said to him, Go now, see whether it is well with your brothers, and well with the flock; and bring me word again. So he sent him out of the valley of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.

Tailo: I biáu-sī kun-ông, khau-sé kuì-tso̍k, líng-tshiò só͘-ū ê siâⁿ-pó, khí thô͘-tui lâi kong, kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: Yes, he scoffs at kings, and princes are a derision to him. He laughs at every stronghold, for he builds up an earthen ramp, and takes it.

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn. I ê kiáⁿ Má-ná-se suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Hezekiah slept with his fathers; and Manasseh his son reigned in his place.
