Tailo: Iô-tah kiânn kuí-tsà, koh tī I-su-la-el kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê tiong-kan kiânn khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì; in-uī Iô-tah siat-to̍k Siōng-tsú só͘ thiàⁿ ê sìng-só͘, tshuā ho̍k-sāi guā-pang sîn-bîng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘.
English: Judah has dealt treacherously, and an abomination is committed in Israel and in Jerusalem; for Judah has profaned the holiness of Yahweh which he loves, and has married the daughter of a foreign god.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — guán ê Siōng-tè ah, taⁿ kiû Lí kiù guán thuat-lī i ê tshiú, hō͘ thiⁿ-ē bān-kok lóng tsai: to̍k-to̍k Lí sī Siōng-tsú.
English: Now therefore, Yahweh our God, save us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you are Yahweh, even you only.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê puē-gi̍k ê kiáⁿ-jî, lín tio̍h tò tńg-.lâi; Guá ē i hó lín ê puē-gi̍k. Lín ìn kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, guán lâi-kàu Lí tsia, in-uī Lí sī guán ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú.
English: Return, you backsliding children, I will heal your backsliding. Behold, we are come to you; for you are Yahweh our God.

Tailo: Tsa-tok kah A-bi-a-thal tsò tsè-si,
English: and Sheva was scribe; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;

Tailo: Iô-há-neh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsin tsē Hua-lí-sái phài kah Sat-to-kai phài ê lâng lâi beh hō͘ i sé-lé, tsiū kā in kóng, Lín tsiah-ê to̍k-tsuâ, siáⁿ lâng kíng-kò lín siám-phiah Siōng-tè teh beh huat ê siū-khì?
English: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them, You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

Tailo: Lí m̄-bián kiaⁿ in, in-uī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè tī lín tiong-kan, I sī tuā koh thang kiaⁿ ê Siōng-tè.
English: You shall not be scared of them; for Yahweh your God is in the midst of you, a great and awesome God.

Tailo: In-uī koh tsi̍t-sî-á, pháiⁿ lâng tsiū ē sí-.khì; lí nā beh siông-sè tshâ i ê só͘-tsāi, mā lóng tshuē bē-tio̍h.
English: For yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more. Yes, though you look for his place, he isn't there.

Tailo: Sàn-tshiah lâng liân i ê hiann-tī to thó-ià i, hô-hòng i ê pîng-iú koh khah ē lī-khui i; jiok beh kah in kóng-uē, in í-king bô tī hia.
English: All the relatives of the poor shun him: How much more do his friends avoid him! He pursues them with pleas, but they are gone.

Tailo: A-mí-me-li̍k koh tuì A-bu-la-hàm kóng, Lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h, tsiah tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì?
English: Abimelech said to Abraham, What did you see, that you have done this thing?

Tailo: Ū la̍k hāng sī Siōng-tsú só͘ uàn-hūn, liân I ê sim só͘ thó-ià ê ū tshit-hāng;
English: There are six things which Yahweh hates; Yes, seven which are an abomination to him:

Tailo: Sian-ti Ha-bá-kok ê kî-tó, īng Si-gi-io-nah ( Tsù, Ho̍k-sò͘ hîng, Si-phian 7:1 ê Si-ga-ióng sī tan-sò͘ hîng ) tiāu,
English: A prayer of Habakkuk, the prophet, set to victorious music.

Tailo: Lí bat kóng, ' Guá ū tsai-hō ah! Siōng-tsú tī guá thòng-khó͘ ê tíng-bīn ke-thinn iu-tshiû; guá thó͘-khuì kàu ià-siān, bē-tàng pîng-an. '
English: You did say, Woe is me now! for Yahweh has added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.

Tailo: Tàn ê lâng kā i kóng, Lí m̄-thang hō͘ guán thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê siann, khióng-kiaⁿ sò-sìng ê lâng lâi tuì lín tāng tshiú, tì-sú lí kah tsuân ke lóng ē sit-lo̍h sèⁿ-miā.
English: The children of Dan said to him, Don't let your voice be heard among us, lest angry fellows fall on you, and you lose your life, with the lives of your household.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang uá-khò pe̍h-tsha̍t uē, kóng, ' Tsiah-ê sī Siōng-tsú ê tiān, sī Siōng-tsú ê tiān, sī Siōng-tsú ê tiān! '
English: Don't you trust in lying words, saying, The temple of Yahweh, the temple of Yahweh, the temple of Yahweh, are these.

Tailo: Kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng bē-tàng khiā tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng; tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng lóng sī Lí só͘ uàn-hūn ê.
English: The arrogant shall not stand in your sight. You hate all workers of iniquity.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng tsi̍t tiâu nâ-sik ê iù-tuà, kā i pa̍k tī bō-á tíng, to̍h-sī tī bō-á ê thâu-tsîng.
English: You shall put it on a lace of blue, and it shall be on the sash; on the front of the sash it shall be.

Tailo: thang tī lí ê mn̂g lāi tsia̍h; tshing-khì kah bô tshing-khì ê lâng lóng thang tsia̍h, tshin-tshiūnn teh tsia̍h lîng-iûⁿ kah lo̍k;
English: You shall eat it within your gates: the unclean and the clean shall eat it alike, as the gazelle, and as the hart.

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h bô lâng tsín-kiù, bô lâng tāi kiû, put-tsí tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, tsiū īng ka-kī ê tshiú lâi kiù ka-kī, īng I ê kong-gī hû-tshî pún-sin.
English: He saw that there was no man, and wondered that there was no intercessor: therefore his own arm brought salvation to him; and his righteousness, it upheld him.

Tailo: In-uī i ē tshin-tshiūⁿ khòng-iá ê tō͘-siông, hok-khì kàu ê sî, i khuànn bē-tio̍h, i ē tiàm tī sua-bô͘ ta-sò ê só͘-tsāi, bô lâng tuà ê kiâm tē.
English: For he shall be like the heath in the desert, and shall not see when good comes, but shall inhabit the parched places in the wilderness, a salt land and not inhabited.

Tailo: I tsim-tsiok khuànn tshân-hn̂g, nā ū hó ê thó͘-tē tsiū bé khí-.lâi, koh īng i ê tshiú só͘ thàn ê tsînn lâi tsai-tsìng phû-tô hn̂g.
English: She considers a field, and buys it. With the fruit of her hands, she plants a vineyard.

Tailo: Nā kóng beh uá-khò lé-gî, guá mā ē; nā ū lâng siūⁿ kóng ē-tàng uá-khò lé-gî, guá koh khah ē-tàng.
English: though I myself might have confidence even in the flesh. If any other man thinks that he has confidence in the flesh, I yet more:

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng uī-tio̍h in ê hiann-tī Biān-iá-mín lâng hō͘-hué, kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t, I-su-la-el tiong tuān-tsua̍t tsi̍t tsi-tso̍k à.
English: The children of Israel grieved for Benjamin their brother, and said, There is one tribe cut off from Israel this day.

Tailo: Lâng nā bô tsiàu-kò͘ tshin-lâng, sīm-tsì bô tsiàu-kò͘ ka-kī ê ka-tîng, to̍h-sī uî-puē sìn-gióng, pí bô sìn ê lâng koh khah hāi.
English: But if anyone doesn't provide for his own, and especially his own household, he has denied the faith, and is worse than an unbeliever.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâng kah Iô-tah lâng siū lia̍h khì Ba-bú-lông, kî-tiong I-é-lí-miah mā hō͘ sī-uē-tiúⁿ lia̍h-.khì, īng thih-liān kā i pa̍k khí-.lâi, āu-lâi tuì La̍h-má pàng i khì, jiân-āu Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah.
English: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, after that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah, who were carried away captive to Babylon.

Tailo: Guá beh suah in hiah-ê iàn-lo̍k, tseh-iân, gue̍h ê tshe-it, An-hioh-ji̍t kah só͘-ū ê tseh-kî.
English: I will also cause all her celebrations to cease: Her feasts, her new moons, her Sabbaths, and all her solemn assemblies.

Tailo: Tio̍h tâng-sim ha̍p-ì, m̄-thang kiau-ngō͘. Tio̍h kah pi-bî ê lâng kau-puê tsò pîng-iú, m̄-thang lia̍h ka-kī pí pa̍t lâng khah tshong-bîng.
English: Be of the same mind one toward another. Don't set your mind on high things, but associate with the humble. Don't be wise in your own conceits.

Tailo: Iô-tah ke thuat-lī huān-lān só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn, ē iû-guân ē-bīn tìng-kin, tíng-bīn kiat kué-tsí.
English: The remnant that has escaped of the house of Judah shall again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

Tailo: Bô tsi̍t kiāⁿ bô hō͘ i thun lo̍h-.khì, só͘-í, i ê hok-lo̍k bē kú-tn̂g.
English: There was nothing left that he didn't devour, Therefore his prosperity shall not endure.

Tailo: I tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tsò ông sann nî, i ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Má-kah, sī Αp-sa-lôm ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Three years reigned he in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, sìn-gióng nā bô tsiàu tō-lí kiânn, ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik? Tsit khuán sìn-gióng kám ē-tàng kiù i?
English: What good is it, my brothers, if a man says he has faith, but has no works? Can faith save him?

Tailo: I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ mā hō͘ in tshiánn khì hù tsit-ê hun-iàn.
English: Jesus also was invited, with his disciples, to the marriage.

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, ông só͘-ū ê tì-huī lâng lóng ji̍p-.lâi; tsóng-.sī, in bē-hiáu tha̍k hit-ê bûn-jī, mā bē-hiáu kái-bîng hō͘ ông tsai.
English: Then came in all the king's wise men; but they could not read the writing, nor make known to the king the interpretation.

Tailo: Iâ-kop ê Siōng-tè ah, Lí ê tsik-pī tsi̍t-ē huat-tshut, tshia kah bé lóng khùn tāng-bîn.
English: At your rebuke, God of Jacob, Both chariot and horse are cast into a deep sleep.

Tailo: Lín kàu Guá siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín tsò sán-gia̍p ê Ka-nân tē ê sî, Guá īng thái-ko tsìng jiám-tio̍h tsi̍t king tshù, tī lín só͘ tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē;
English: When you have come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put a spreading mildew in a house in the land of your possession,

Tailo: Siōng-tè kóng tsi̍t hāng, guá ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h nn̄g hāng, to̍h-sī kuân-lîng sio̍k tī Siōng-tè,
English: God has spoken once, Twice I have heard this, That power belongs to God.

Tailo: ' Î-suá tshù-piⁿ ê kài-tsí ê, tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! ' Jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h kóng, ' A-men! '
English: Cursed be he who removes his neighbor's landmark. All the people shall say, Amen.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lîng-hûn to̍h-sī Nó͘-ah teh tsún-pī tuā tsûn ê kî-kan, Siōng-tè ū nāi-sim teh thìng-hāu ê hiah-ê m̄ sūn-ho̍k ê lâng. Tong-sî tsìn-ji̍p tuā tsûn ê lâng tsin tsió, kan-taⁿ peh-ê, in ū tuì tsuí lâi tit-kiù.
English: who before were disobedient, when God waited patiently in the days of Noah, while the ark was being built. In it, few, that is, eight souls, were saved through water.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng beh ín-iú I-su-la-el ông A-hap, hō͘ i khì Gi-lia̍t ê La̍h-mot, sí tī hia? ' Tsit-ê kóng án-ne, hit-ê kóng án-ne.
English: Yahweh said, Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth Gilead? One spoke saying after this manner, and another saying after that manner.

Tailo: Guá kám bô in-uī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lâi pān in? Guá ê sim kám bô beh tuì tsit khuán ê tsú-bîn pò-siû?
English: Shall I not visit them for these things? says Yahweh; shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this?

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t ìn Be-lot lâng Lim-móng ê kiáⁿ Le-kap kah i ê hiann-tī Ba-nah, kā i kóng, Siōng-tsú kiù-sio̍k guá ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī só͘-ū ê khó͘-lān, guá kí I íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā,
English: David answered Rechab and Baanah his brother, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said to them, As Yahweh lives, who has redeemed my soul out of all adversity,

Tailo: koh īng sûn-kim hō͘ i tsò bah-tshe, puânn kah pue, koh tshìn kim hō͘ i thang tsò ta̍k-ê kim uáⁿ, tshìn gîn hō͘ i tsò ta̍k-ê gîn-uáⁿ,
English: and the forks, and the basins, and the cups, of pure gold; and for the golden bowls by weight for every bowl; and for the silver bowls by weight for every bowl;

Tailo: Pò hó siau-sit hō͘ Si-óng ê, lí tio̍h tsiūⁿ kuân suaⁿ; pò hó siau-sit hō͘ Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê, lí tio̍h tsīn-la̍t tshut lí ê siann. Tio̍h tshut siaⁿ, m̄-bián kiaⁿ, tuì Iô-tah ê siâⁿ kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, lín ê Siōng-tè!
English: You who tell good news to Zion, go up on a high mountain. You who tell good news to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with strength. Lift it up. Don't be afraid. Say to the cities of Judah, Behold, your God!

Tailo: Tsûn-tiúⁿ lâi-kàu i hia, tuì i kóng, Lí tsit-ê hó khùn ê lâng, ná ē án-ne? Khí-.lâi, kiû-kiò lí ê Siōng-tè, kiám-tshái Siōng-tè ē khuàⁿ-kò͘ lán, hō͘ lán bián bia̍t-bông.
English: So the shipmaster came to him, and said to him, What do you mean, sleeper? Arise, call on your God ! Maybe your God will notice us, so that we won't perish.

Tailo: Ū pe̍h, ū tsheⁿ, ū nâ ê pò͘-lî, īng iù-tē kah tsí-sik ê soh kā gîn-khuân pa̍k tī tāi-lí-tsio̍h ê thiāu; ū kim-gîn ê tshn̂g pâi tī âng, pe̍h, n̂g, o͘ ê tāi-lí-tsio̍h só͘ pho͘ ê tē.
English: There were hangings of white cloth, of green, and of blue, fastened with cords of fine linen and purple to silver rings and pillars of marble: the couches were of gold and silver, on a pavement of red, and white, and yellow, and black marble.

Tailo: In koh siàn-tōng bîn-tsiòng, tiúⁿ-ló kah king-ha̍k kàu-su, tshiong-khì lia̍h Su-tê-hua-no͘h, kā i kau hō͘ gī-huē.
English: They stirred up the people, the elders, and the scribes, and came against him and seized him, and brought him in to the council,

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: I-su-la-el tso̍k tiong ê guā-pang lâng, to̍h-sī sim bô siū kat-lé, sing-khu bô siū kat-lé ê guā-pang lâng, lóng m̄-thang ji̍p-lâi Guá ê sìng-só͘.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh, No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into my sanctuary, of any foreigners who are among the children of Israel.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, i pún-sin mā khì La̍h-má, kàu Se-ko͘ ê tuā tséⁿ hia, mn̄g lâng kóng, Sa-mu-el kah Ta-bi̍t tī tó-uī? Ū lâng kā i kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tī La̍h-má ê Na-iot.
English: Then went he also to Ramah, and came to the great well that is in Secu: and he asked and said, Where are Samuel and David? One said, Behold, they are at Naioth in Ramah.

Tailo: In tshiong-muá ta̍k-khuán ê put-gī, siâ-ok, tham-sim, ok-to̍k, uàn-tò͘, hiong-sat, tàu-tsing, kan-tsà, im-bô͘, kóng lâng ê kha-tsiah-āu uē,
English: being filled with all unrighteousness, sexual immorality, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, evil habits, secret slanderers,

Tailo: to̍h-sī tī Tsú īng sím-phuàⁿ ê sîn-lîng kah sio-huí ê sîn-lîng, sé-tû Si-óng tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê ù-uè, tshing-khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm tiong-kan thâi lâng lâu hueh ê hueh-jiah ê sî.
English: when the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from its midst, by the spirit of justice, and by the spirit of burning.

Tailo: Kiû lí liōng-tsîng lí ê lú-pī ê tsuē-kò, in-uī Siōng-tsú it-tīng kā guá ê tsú kiàn-li̍p kian-kò͘ ê ke, in-uī guá ê tsú uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú kau-tsiàn, koh tī lí it-sing ê ji̍t-tsí, bô tshâ-tshut lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kuè-sit.
English: Please forgive the trespass of your handmaid: for Yahweh will certainly make my lord a sure house, because my lord fights the battles of Yahweh; and evil shall not be found in you all your days.

Tailo: Lí nā m̄-khíng hō͘ Guá ê jîn-bîn lī-khui, lí khuàⁿ, bîn-á-tsài Guá beh hō͘ tsháu-me̍h ji̍p-khì lí ê kíng lāi,
English: Or else, if you refuse to let my people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring locusts into your country,

Tailo: Tsú-lâng mā án-ne kā i kóng, ' Hō͘ lí mā kuán-lí gō͘-ê siâⁿ. '
English: So he said to him, And you are to be over five cities.'

Tailo: Hit sî, lí tsiū tio̍h tī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē, kā i hun-pia̍t saⁿ-ê siâⁿ.
English: you shall set apart three cities for you in the midst of your land, which Yahweh your God gives you to possess it.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kā Io-ná-than kóng, Lí ê lāu-pē nā īng pháiⁿ siaⁿ-sàu ìn lí, siáⁿ lâng ē lâi kā guá kóng?
English: Then said David to Jonathan, Who shall tell me if perchance your father answer you roughly?

Tailo: Su-io̍k huâi-īn tsiū seⁿ-tshut tsuē-ok, tsuē-ok tióng-sîng liáu-āu tsiū seⁿ-tshut sí-bông.
English: Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin; and the sin, when it is full grown, brings forth death.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn ē tshú lín ê lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī, ióng-kiāⁿ ê siàu-liân lâng kah lín ê lî-á, lâi tsò i ê tshe-īng;
English: He will take your male servants, and your female servants, and your best young men, and your donkeys, and put them to his work.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, lín tsiah ē ū tsin tsē lâng sue-lám kah phuà-pēⁿ, mā bē tsió lâng sí-.khì.
English: For this cause many among you are weak and sickly, and not a few sleep.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê kuì-tso̍k siū-khì I-é-lí-miah, tsiū kā i phah, kā i kuainn tī su-kì Io-ná-than ê tshù ê kaⁿ-.ni̍h, in-uī in īng hit king tsò kaⁿ-lô.
English: The princes were angry with Jeremiah, and struck him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe; for they had made that the prison.

Tailo: Thian-kok tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t-ê kok-ông kā i ê kiáⁿ pān hun-iàn.
English: The Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who made a marriage feast for his son,

Tailo: In kok lâng tsīn i ê tsit, uī-tio̍h bé kah gâu pháu ê bé, tuà tuā-be̍h kah tsháu-liāu lâi-kàu in ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds brought they to the place where the officers were, every man according to his charge.

Tailo: Ông tsiū bīng-līng ông-tsú ( Tsù, guân i̍k-pún sī Hap-bí-li̍k ê kiáⁿ, Hap-bí-li̍kê guân-bûn sī Ông ê ì-sù ) E-la-mel, kah A-su-li-el ê kiáⁿ Se-la-iah, kah Ab-tel ê kiáⁿ Si-le-mi-ah, khì lia̍h su-kì Pa-lo-sih kah I-é-lí-miah sian-ti. Tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú kā in tshàng khí-.lâi.
English: The king commanded Jerahmeel the king's son, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to take Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet; but Yahweh hid them.

Tailo: In pa̍k hiah-ê kuì-tso̍k ê tshiú, kā in tiàu lī tē; kìⁿ-tio̍h láu-tuā ê bīn, mā bô tsun-kìng.
English: Princes were hanged up by their hand: The faces of elders were not honored.

Tailo: I kuat-ì beh īng tsuân kok ê la̍t lâi, mā ū tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng kah i lâi, i ē tsiàu ka-kī ì-sù kiânn, koh ē īng tsa-bó͘ lâng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ hō͘ lâm-hong ê ông, beh kā i pāi-huāi, tsóng-.sī, i ê kè-i̍k bē sîng-li̍p, mā bô tsò i ê lī-ik.
English: He shall set his face to come with the strength of his whole kingdom, and with him equitable conditions; and he shall perform them: and he shall give him the daughter of women, to corrupt her; but she shall not stand, neither be for him.

Tailo: In tī ta̍k-ê tuâⁿ piⁿ tó tī lâng tsò tsún-tǹg ê saⁿ, koh tī in ê Siōng-tè ê tiān lāi lim siū-hua̍t ê lâng ê tsiú.
English: And they lay themselves down beside every altar on clothes taken in pledge; And in the house of their God they drink the wine of those who have been fined.

Tailo: Lí hiah-ê jîn-sîn lóng ē lo̍h-lâi kìnn guá, phak tī guá bīn-tsîng, kóng, ' Kiû lí kah kin-tuè lí ê jîn-bîn lóng tshut-.khì. Jiân-āu guá beh tshut-.khì. Tsiū án-ne, Mô͘-se tuā siū-khì, lī-khui Huâ-láu tshut-.khì.
English: All these your servants shall come down to me, and bow down themselves to me, saying, Get out, and all the people who follow you; and after that I will go out.' He went out from Pharaoh in hot anger.

Tailo: Tshut-tsāi lín siat kè-bô͘, it-tīng ē kui tī khang-khang; tshut-tsāi lín gī-lūn, it-tīng bē sîng-li̍p; in-uī Siōng-tsú kah guán tông-tsāi.
English: Take counsel together, and it will be brought to nothing; speak the word, and it will not stand: for God is with us.

Tailo: Guá bô kiû ka-kī ê îng-kng, ū tsi̍t uī teh thè guá kiû, koh tsò tsit-hāng tāi-tsì ê sím-phuàⁿ tsiá.
English: But I don't seek my own glory. There is one who seeks and judges.

Tailo: Khióng-kiaⁿ lí kah tuà tī hit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn li̍p-iok, in tuè in ê sîn-bîng kiânn siâ-îm, tsè-sū in ê sîn-bîng, ū lâng kiò lí, lí tsiū tsia̍h i ê tsè-mi̍h,
English: Don't make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, lest they play the prostitute after their gods, and sacrifice to their gods, and one call you and you eat of his sacrifice;

Tailo: In beh sàng lín ê tsìng hiann-tī tuì lia̍t kok tiong tò tńg-.lâi, hō͘ in ū ê khiâ bé, ū ê tsē tshia, tsē kiō, khiâ lô, khiâ lo̍k-tô, kàu Guá ê sìng-suaⁿ Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tsiânn-tsò lé-mi̍h, hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú; tshin-tshiūnn I-su-la-el lâng īng tshing-khì ê khì-kū té lé-mi̍h, hiàn tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: They shall bring all your brothers out of all the nations for an offering to Yahweh, on horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and on mules, and on dromedaries, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, says Yahweh, as the children of Israel bring their offering in a clean vessel into the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: I ê lô͘-po̍k I-su-la-el ê kiáⁿ-sun, I só͘ kíng Iâ-kop ê kiáⁿ-sun,
English: Remember his marvelous works that he has done, His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

Tailo: Guá ê Siōng-tè ah, guá beh tuâⁿ sik o-ló Lí, o-ló Lí ê sìn-si̍t! I-su-la-el ê sìng ê ah, guá beh tuâⁿ khîm o-ló Lí!
English: I will also praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, my God. I sing praises to you with the lyre, Holy One of Israel.

Tailo: Iā phê-á ê tuì-ti̍k, to̍h-sī tsí Mô͘-kuí; siu-sîng ê sî sī tsí kim-sè ê bua̍t-ji̍t, siu-kuah ê to̍h-sī tsí thiⁿ-sài.
English: The enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.

Tailo: Hiat lo̍h-khì hué-lô͘. Τī hia in ē thî-khàu, kā-gê tshiat-khí.
English: and will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Ba-bú-lông hiah-ê siú-líng tshe sù-tsiá lâi i hia, beh mn̄g kok lāi só͘-ū ê kî-sū; tī tsit-ê tāi-tsì Siōng-tè lī-khui i, beh kā i tshì-giām, thang tsai i sim-lāi tsuân-pō͘ só͘-ū ê.
English: However in the business of the ambassadors of the princes of Babylon, who sent to him to inquire of the wonder that was done in the land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart.

Tailo: In-uī lí tshiúⁿ-kiap tsin tsē kok, lia̍t kok tiong só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng mā ē kā lí tshiúⁿ-kiap; sī in-uī lí thâi lâng lâu hueh, tuì kíng lāi kah siâⁿ-tshī í-ki̍p tuà tī kî-tiong ê lâng só͘ kiâⁿ kiông-pō ê iân-kò͘.
English: Because you have plundered many nations, all the remnant of the peoples will plunder you, because of men's blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all who dwell in it.

Tailo: Hit khuán lâng í-king hō͘ lín tuā-to-sò͘ ê lâng tsik-hua̍t kah ū kàu-gia̍h ā.
English: Sufficient to such a one is this punishment which was inflicted by the many;

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h tsit-ê bo̍k-tik, guá khò Ki-tok tī guá lāi-bīn ūn-hîng ê tuā lîng-li̍k, tsīn-la̍t teh phah-piàⁿ.
English: for which I also labor, striving according to his working, which works in me mightily.

Tailo: Guá ê sìng-só͘ tī in tiong-kan, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán; guā-pang lâng tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú, hō͘ I-su-la-el tsiâⁿ-tsò sìng ê.
English: The nations shall know that I am Yahweh who sanctifies Israel, when my sanctuary shall be in the midst of them forevermore.

Tailo: Lí í-king thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, taⁿ koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h lóng-tsóng; lín kám bô beh suan-iông? Tuì taⁿ í-āu, Guá beh kā sin ê tāi-tsì, to̍h-sī lí só͘ iáu m̄-tsai ê ún-ba̍t ê tāi-tsì, kā lí tsí-sī.
English: You have heard it; see all this; and you, will you not declare it? I have shown you new things from this time, even hidden things, which you have not known.

Tailo: Guá lâi sī beh īng hué tàn tī tē-tsiūⁿ, hué nā to̍h khí-.lâi, m̄-tsai guā-ni̍h-á hó lè?
English: I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.

Tailo: Lín kā I tìng tī si̍p-jī-kè tíng ê I-é-su, lán tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè í-king ū hō͘ I koh-ua̍h.
English: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you killed, hanging him on a tree.

Tailo: Hit nn̄g lâng tuì Ló-toh kóng, Lí tī tsia iáu ū siáⁿ lâng? Lí ê kiáⁿ-sài, á-.sī kiáⁿ, á-.sī tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, í-ki̍p siâⁿ lāi it-tshè sio̍k lí ê lâng, lí tio̍h hō͘ in lóng lī-khui tsit só͘-tsāi,
English: The men said to Lot, Do you have anybody else here? Sons-in-law, your sons, your daughters, and whoever you have in the city, bring them out of the place:

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tuì Siōng-tè gîm-si, tshiùⁿ kua o-ló I ê miâ; uī-tio̍h hit uī tsē tshia king-kuè khòng-iá ê siu-tsō tuā lō͘. I ê miâ kiò-tsò I-é-ho-bah, tio̍h tī I ê bīn-tsîng khuài-lo̍k!
English: Sing to God! Sing praises to his name! Extol him who rides on the clouds: To Yah, his name! Rejoice before him!

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in ê sim tsin ài tò tńg-.khì ê só͘-tsāi, in bē-tàng tò tńg-.khì.
English: But to the land whereunto their soul longs to return, there shall they not return.

Tailo: In tsia̍h tsá-tǹg liáu-āu, I-é-su kā Sí-mòng Piat-tò͘ kóng, Iô-há-neh ê kiáⁿ Sí-mòng, lí pí thiàⁿ tsiah-ê ū khah thiàⁿ Guá bô? Piat-tò͘ ìn kóng, Tsú ah, ū, Lí tsai guá ū thiàⁿ Lí. I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí tio̍h iúⁿ-tshī Guá ê iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ.
English: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these? He said to him, Yes, Lord; you know that I have affection for you. He said to him, Feed my lambs.

Tailo: Guán kah guán ê tsó͘-sian kāng-khuán huān tsuē, guán tsok-gia̍t, kiâⁿ pháiⁿ.
English: We have sinned with our fathers. We have committed iniquity. We have done wickedly.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, bô lī-khui Ne-bat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am ê tsuē, to̍h-sī hō͘ I-su-la-el huān tsuē ê.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: he didn't depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, hok-im bô-lūn thuân-kàu siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi, lâng lóng ē kóng-khí tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì, lâi kā i kì-liām.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Sìng Sîn tsiū kí-khí guá, tshuā guá ji̍p-khì lāi-īⁿ; lí khuàⁿ, Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng tshiong-muá tī tiān lāi.
English: The Spirit took me up, and brought me into the inner court; and behold, the glory of Yahweh filled the house.

Tailo: Guá ê thiàⁿ-sim kah só͘-ū sio̍k Ki-tok I-é-su ê lâng tông-tsāi. A-men!
English: My love to all of you in Christ Jesus. Amen.

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: Khióng-kiaⁿ tsú-lâng hut-jiân tńg-.lâi ê sî, khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín teh khùn.
English: lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping.

Tailo: Lán nā thun-lún kàu-té, mā ē kah I-é-su Ki-tok tsò-hué tsiáng-kuân. Lán nā m̄ sîng-jīn I, I mā ē m̄ sîng-jīn lán.
English: If we endure, We will also reign with him. If we deny him, He also will deny us.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Ta-bi̍t tī huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng o-ló Siōng-tsú, Ta-bi̍t kóng, Siōng-tsú — guán ê tsó͘-sian I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè, sī ing-kai o-ló ê, tuì íng-uán kàu íng-uán!
English: Therefore David blessed Yahweh before all the assembly; and David said, You are blessed, Yahweh, the God of Israel our father, forever and ever.

Tailo: Lí í-king phah-iâⁿ E-tóm, sim tsiū kiau-ngō͘, lí lia̍h tsit-ê tsò îng-kng, tī tshù lāi an-jiân tuà tsiū hó, ná ē beh khí-sū jiá tsai-hō, hō͘ pún-sin kah Iô-tah kok tsò-hué tó-huāi?
English: You have indeed struck Edom, and your heart has lifted you up: glory of it, and abide at home; for why should you meddle to your hurt, that you should fall, even you, and Judah with you?

Tailo: Siōng-tè tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Guá só͘ beh tuì-hù Huâ-láu ê, taⁿ lí ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, in-uī īng kuân-lîng ê tshiú, i ē tsún in khì, koh īng kuân-lîng ê tshiú, i ē kuáⁿ in tshut i ê tē.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh, for by a strong hand he shall let them go, and by a strong hand he shall drive them out of his land.

Tailo: Sàu-lô it-sing tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah Hui-lī-sū lâng tuā kau-tsiàn, Sàu-lô kiàn-nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū lîng-li̍k ê lâng á-.sī ióng-sū, tsiū tsio-tsi̍p lâi uá i.
English: There was sore war against the Philistines all the days of Saul: and when Saul saw any mighty man, or any valiant man, he took him to him.

Tailo: Tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h hō͘ tuā hō͘ ak tâm; in-uī bô jia-tsa̍h tsiū bih uá tī tsio̍h kha.
English: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, And embrace the rock for lack of a shelter.

Tailo: Tī hia teh kā in tsia̍h ê thâng bē sí, teh kā in sio ê hué mā bē hua-khì. ( tsù, ū ê tshau-pún bô tsit tsat )
English: where their worm doesn't die, and the fire is not quenched.'

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín lâng tuì Ge-bah khí, tuà tī Mik-mah, A-iah, Be-thel kah i ê tsng-thâu,
English: The children of Benjamin also lived from Geba onward, at Michmash and Aija, and at Bethel and the towns of it,

Tailo: Tng lí hing-thong ê sî, Guá tsiū tuì lí kóng: Lí kóng: Guá m̄-thiaⁿ. Lí tuì siàu-liân í-lâi lóng sī tsit khuán, m̄ tsun-thàn Guá ê uē.
English: I spoke to you in your prosperity; but you said, I will not hear. This has been your manner from your youth, that you didn't obey my voice.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guá àm-sî kì-liām Lí ê miâ, tsun-siú Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: I have remembered your name, Yahweh, in the night, And I obey your law.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá ìn kóng, Bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú ah, Lí tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm kah Iô-tah tsiah-ê siâⁿ siū-khì í-king tshit-tsa̍p nî, Lí bô si liân-bín tio̍h kàu tang-sî?
English: Then the angel of Yahweh replied, O Yahweh of Armies, how long will you not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which you have had indignation these seventy years?

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Lín ji̍p-khì siâⁿ lāi tsiū ē tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng kuāⁿ tsuí-pân. Lín tuè i ji̍p-khì hit king tshù,
English: He said to them, Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.

Tailo: Tì-huī ê lâng tī an-tsīng tiong kóng-uē, pí gōng lâng ê thâu-ba̍k tuā-siaⁿ jióng khah ū lâng thiaⁿ.
English: The words of the wise heard in quiet are better than the cry of him who rules among fools.

Tailo: I ē uá-khò pa̍t tsióng ê sîn-bîng, lâi siat-huat kian-kò͘ i ê siâⁿ-pó. Só͘-ū sîng-jīn i ê, i ē kā îng-kng hō͘ in, mā ē hō͘ in kuán-hat tsin tsē lâng, koh ē pun thó͘-tē kā in pò-siúⁿ.
English: He shall deal with the strongest fortresses by the help of a foreign god: whoever acknowledges him he will increase with glory; and he shall cause them to rule over many, and shall divide the land for a price.

Tailo: Lí mā tshú Guá só͘ hō͘ lí ê kim-gîn kah suí ê pó-khì, uī-tio̍h lí ka-kī tsò tsa-po͘ lâng ê siōng kah i kiânn kan-îm;
English: You also took your beautiful jewels of my gold and of my silver, which I had given you, and made for yourself images of men, and played the prostitute with them;

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tuà tī Si̍t-tîm, jîn-bîn tsiū kah Mô͘-ap ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á kiânn kan-îm.
English: Israel abode in Shittim; and the people began to play the prostitute with the daughters of Moab:

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kín-sīn, lín nā kah khîm-siù kāng-khuán sio-kā sio-thun, kàu bué it-tīng ē hō͘-siong tsâu-bia̍t.
English: But if you bite and devour one another, be careful that you don't consume one another.

Tailo: Ông mn̄g in kóng, Ông-hō͘ Ua-si-thih bô tsun-thàn thài-kàm só͘ thuân A-ha-sui-ló͘ ông ê bīng-līng, taⁿ tsiàu lē lán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kā i pān?
English: What shall we do to the queen Vashti according to law, because she has not done the bidding of the king Ahasuerus by the chamberlains?

Tailo: Han-nah ê sim-lāi iu-khó͘, tuì Siōng-tsú kî-tó, suah lâi tuā thî-khàu.
English: She was in bitterness of soul, and prayed to Yahweh, and wept sore.

Tailo: Ē kā pi-bî ê lâng an-tì tī kuân ê só͘-tsāi; ē kā ai-tshám ê lâng kí-khí tī an-ún ê tē.
English: So that he sets up on high those who are low, Those who mourn are exalted to safety.

Tailo: Thong-ta̍t ê lâng am-khàm tì-sik; gōng lâng ê sim hián-tshut gû-gōng.
English: A prudent man keeps his knowledge, But the hearts of fools proclaim foolishness.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, tī Iô-tah tē, lâng it-tīng tshiùnn tsit-ê kua, kóng: Guán ū kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ. I ē īng kiù-un li̍p-tsò siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, tsò guā-tîng siâⁿ.
English: In that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah: We have a strong city. God appoints salvation for walls and bulwarks.

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín lâng tsiah tsai in ê siū phah, in-uī I-su-la-el lâng thè-niū Biān-iá-mín lâng, sī uī-tio̍h in uá-khò só͘ siat tī Gi-be-at ê ho̍k-ping.
English: So the children of Benjamin saw that they were struck; for the men of Israel gave place to Benjamin, because they trusted the ambushers whom they had set against Gibeah.

Tailo: Tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tsa̍p-jī, guán lī-khui A-ha-uah ê hô piⁿ, beh khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm. Lán ê Siōng-tè ê tshiú pó-hō͘ guán, kiù guán thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k kah bâi-ho̍k tī lō͘-.ni̍h ê lâng ê tshiú.
English: Then we departed from the river Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go to Jerusalem: and the hand of our God was on us, and he delivered us from the hand of the enemy and the bandit by the way.

Tailo: Lí m̄-thang tuì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè án-ne kiânn, in-uī in tuì in ê sîn-bîng kiânn Siōng-tsú it-tshè só͘ thòng-hūn thó-ià ê tāi-tsì, sīm-tsì kā in ê kiáⁿ-jî īng hué sio, hiàn hō͘ in ê sîn-bîng.
English: You shall not do so to Yahweh your God: for every abomination to Yahweh, which he hates, have they done to their gods; for even their sons and their daughters do they burn in the fire to their gods.

Tailo: I-é-su kā in kóng, Án-ne, Ta-bi̍t hō͘ Sìng Sîn kám-tōng ê sî, ná ē tshing Ki-tok tsò Tsú, kóng,
English: He said to them, How then does David in the Spirit call him Lord, saying,

Tailo: Hi-tse-kia siat-li̍p tsè-si Lē-bī lâng ê pan-lia̍t, tsiàu in ê pan-lia̍t, kok tsiàu in ê tsit-hūn, tsè-si kah Lē-bī lâng hiàn sio-tsè kah siā-un-tsè, koh tī Siōng-tsú hiah-ê iâⁿ ê mn̂g lāi ho̍k-sāi, kám-siā, o-ló.
English: Hezekiah appointed the divisions of the priests and the Levites after their divisions, every man according to his service, both the priests and the Levites, for burnt offerings and for peace offerings, to minister, and to give thanks, and to praise in the gates of the camp of Yahweh.

Tailo: Kuà-tshài-tsí-sī tsíng-tsí tiong-kan siōng sè lia̍p ê, m̄-koh, tuā tsâng khí-.lâi, pí só͘-ū ê tshài-se koh khah tuā tsâng, tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t tsâng tshiū, liân khong-tiong ê tsiáu-á to pue-lâi tī tshiū-ki tsò siū.
English: which indeed is smaller than all seeds. But when it is grown, it is greater than the herbs, and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in its branches.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kā i kóng, Lí ê hueh kui tī lí ê thâu-khak, in-uī lí ê tshuì ka-kī kiàn-tsìng kóng, ' Guá thâi-sí Siōng-tsú só͘ buah iû ê. '
English: David said to him, Your blood be on your head; for your mouth has testified against you, saying, I have slain Yahweh's anointed.

Tailo: In ê tsìⁿ tē sī khui-khui ê bōng; in lóng sī ióng-sū.
English: Their quiver is an open tomb, they are all mighty men.

Tailo: Huē-tsiòng kiōng ū sì-bān nn̄g-tshing saⁿ-pah la̍k-tsa̍p lâng.
English: The whole assembly together was forty-two thousand three hundred sixty,

Tailo: Tio̍h siám-phiah siàu-liân lâng ê tsîng-io̍k, lâi kah hiah-ê īng tshing-khì ê sim-lîng kiû-kiò Tsú ê lâng tsò-hué tui-kiû kong-gī, sìn-sim, thiàⁿ-sim kah hô-pîng.
English: Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ ua̍t tńg-sin, khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su só͘ thiàⁿ ê bûn-tô͘ tuè tī in ê āu-piah. I to̍h-sī tsîng tī buán-tshan ê sî, khò uá I-é-su ê hing-khám kóng, Tsú ah, sī siáⁿ lâng beh tshut-bē Lí? ê hit-ê bûn-tô͘.
English: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus sincerely loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus' breast at the supper and asked, Lord, who is going to betray You?

Tailo: Īng hiah-ê huān tsuē hāi ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ê hiuⁿ-lô͘, tuî-tsò kui-phìⁿ, lâi an tsè-tuâⁿ. In-uī in hiàn tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, só͘-í, sī sìng ê, thang hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng tsò kàm-kài.
English: even the censers of these sinners against their own lives; and let them be made beaten plates for a covering of the altar: for they offered them before Yahweh; therefore they are holy; and they shall be a sign to the children of Israel.

Tailo: Nā ū sian-ti thok Siōng-tsú ê miâ lâi kóng ê, hit-ê tāi-tsì nā bô si̍t-hiān, mā bô ìng-giām, tse sī Siōng-tsú só͘ bô kóng ê, sī hit-ê sian-ti ngē-ngē beh lâi kóng ê, lí to̍h m̄-bián kiaⁿ i.
English: when a prophet speaks in the name of Yahweh, if the thing doesn't follow, nor happen, that is the thing which Yahweh has not spoken: the prophet has spoken it presumptuously, you shall not be afraid of him.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá tsìn-tsîng khì, I bô tī hia; guá thè-āu khì, mā bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h I;
English: If I go east, he is not there; If west, I can't find him;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh kóng, Lín tio̍h tsia̍h bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ tshit ji̍t, thâu tsi̍t ji̍t tio̍h tuì lín ta̍k king tshù kā kàⁿ tû-.khì, in-uī tuì thâu tsi̍t ji̍t kàu tē-tshit ji̍t, só͘-ū tsia̍h ū kàⁿ ê, ē tuì I-su-la-el tiong tû-.khì.
English: Seven days shall you eat unleavened bread; even the first day you shall put away yeast out of your houses, for whoever eats leavened bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.

Tailo: In ē tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn, Guá beh tsò in ê Siōng-tè.
English: and they shall be my people, and I will be their God:

Tailo: Tuà tī Ha-tsool ê jîn-bîn, lí tio̍h tô-tsáu, tsáu-khì hn̄g-hn̄g, bih khì ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi; in-uī Ba-bú-lông ông Nep-kat-ne-tsal siat-kè beh hāi lín, kuat-tīng beh kā lín kong-kik.
English: Flee you, wander far off, dwell in the depths, you inhabitants of Hazor, says Yahweh; for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you, and has conceived a purpose against you.

Tailo: Hō͘ lâng tshiánn ê sî tio̍h khì tsē bué-uī, tshiáⁿ lí ê lâng lâi kā lí kóng, ' Pîng-iú, tshiáⁿ lí khí-lâi tsē tuā-uī. ' Hit sî, lí tī kâng toh ê lâng bīn-tsîng tsiū ū thé-biān.
English: But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes, he may tell you, Friend, move up higher.' Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at the table with you.

Tailo: Bān-bîn lóng ē gióng-bōng I ê miâ.
English: In his name, the nations will hope.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì hué-iām tiong kah lín kóng-uē, lín thiaⁿ-tio̍h kóng-uē ê siann, bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h iáⁿ-siōng, tsí ū siaⁿ niā-niā.
English: Yahweh spoke to you out of the midst of the fire: you heard the voice of words, but you saw no form; only you heard a voice.

Tailo: I nā king-kuè, lâi kuaiⁿ-kìm lâng, tiàu lâng sím-phuàⁿ, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng kā I tsó͘-tòng?
English: If he passes by, or confines, Or convenes a court, then who can oppose him?

Tailo: Lín kì-jiân sio̍k Ki-tok, to̍h-sī A-bu-la-hàm ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiū ē-tàng sîng-siū Siōng-tè tuì A-bu-la-hàm ê ìng-ín.
English: If you are Christ's, then you are Abraham's seed and heirs according to promise.

Tailo: Siōng-tè tsín-kiù lán, ho͘-tiàu lán tsò I ê tsú-bîn, m̄-sī kin-kì lán ê hîng-uî, sī tsiàu I ka-kī ê tsí-ì kah un-tián. Tsit-ê un-tián sī tī bān sè í-tsîng, to̍h thong-kuè Ki-tok I-é-su siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán ê.
English: who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to his own purpose and grace, which was given to us in Christ Jesus before times eternal,

Tailo: Tē-la̍k ji̍t tio̍h hiàn gû-káng-á peh tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng nn̄g tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-á tsa̍p-sì tsiah, lóng tio̍h bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: On the sixth day eight bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

Tailo: Guān kóng pháiⁿ uē ê lâng tī tē-tsiūⁿ khiā bē-tiâu; guān tsai-eh jiok kiông-pō ê lâng, kā in lóng phah-tó.
English: An evil speaker won't be established in the earth. Evil will hunt the violent man to overthrow him.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê piáⁿ tio̍h hē tī tsi̍t kha khing, té tī khing-.ni̍h tuà-.lâi, koh khan hit tsiah kang ê gû kah nn̄g tsiah kang ê mî-iûⁿ lâi.
English: You shall put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bull and the two rams.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng kóng, Lán bô beh uat ji̍p-khì guā-pang lâng ê siâⁿ, to̍h-sī bô sio̍k I-su-la-el lâng ê, khah hó lán tio̍h kuè lâi-khì Gi-be-at.
English: His master said to him, We won't turn aside into the city of a foreigner, that is not of the children of Israel; but we will pass over to Gibeah.

Tailo: Kò͘-ti ê lâng tsiū tsáu ji̍p-khì siâⁿ lāi, kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì kah hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin ê lâng só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê it-tshè lóng pò lâng tsai.
English: Those who fed them fled, and went away into the city, and told everything, including what happened to those who were possessed with demons.

Tailo: I tī thiāu tíng khik pik-ha̍p hue. Αń-ne tsō thiāu ê kang tsiū uân-sîng.
English: On the top of the pillars was lily work: so was the work of the pillars finished.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh kā in kóng, Guá tú-á kóng lín sī tsing-thàm, tsit-ê uē si̍t-tsāi bô m̄-tio̍h.
English: Joseph said to them, It is like I told you, saying, You are spies.'

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t ji̍t, Siōng-tsú hiah-ê kiáⁿ lâi, khiā tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng; Sa-tán mā lâi tī in tiong-kan, khiā tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Again it happened on the day when the God's sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, that Satan came also among them to present himself before Yahweh.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá koh-ua̍h liáu-āu, ē pí lín tāi-sing khì-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng.
English: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.

Tailo: I tī Iô-tah khí kuí-nā tsō hiám-iàu ê siâⁿ. In-uī i ê só͘-tsāi pîng-an, tī hit kuí nî lóng bô kau-tsiàn, in-uī Siōng-tsú hō͘ i pîng-an.
English: He built fortified cities in Judah; for the land was quiet, and he had no war in those years, because Yahweh had given him rest.

Tailo: Sian-ti E-li-iah siá phue kià hō͘ Io-lâm, kóng, Siōng-tsú — lí ê tsó͘-sian Ta-bi̍t ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng, ' In-uī lí bô kiâⁿ lí ê pē — Iô-sa-huat ê lō͘ kah Iô-tah ông A-sah ê lō͘,
English: There came a writing to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, Thus says Yahweh, the God of David your father, Because you have not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat your father, nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah,

Tailo: Tuì hiah-ê bī-hun-tsiá kah kuáⁿ-hū, guá khǹg in nā ē-tàng tshin-tshiūnn guá siú to̍k-sin sī hó.
English: But I say to the unmarried and to widows, it is good for them if they remain even as I am.

Tailo: koh uī Ba-al khí suaⁿ-thâu ê tuâⁿ, thang tī hué tiong sio in ê kiáⁿ, tsò sio-tsè lâi hiàn hō͘ Ba-al. Tse m̄-sī Guá só͘ bīng-līng ê, m̄-sī Guá só͘ thê-khí ê, mā m̄-sī Guá ê sim só͘ siūⁿ ê.
English: and have built the high places of Baal, to burn their sons in the fire for burnt offerings to Baal; which I didn't command, nor spoke it, neither came it into my mind:

Tailo: Taⁿ guá teh beh tńg-khì tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī hia; lín tiong-kan bô lâng mn̄g guá kóng, ' Lí beh khì tó-uī? '
English: But now I am going to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, Where are you going?'

Tailo: Uá-kīn i tsat iâⁿ ê sī Si-miān ê tsi-tso̍k, Tsu-lí-sià-tāi ê kiáⁿ Si-lu-mi-el tsò Si-miān lâng ê siú-líng.
English: Those who encamp next to him shall be the tribe of Simeon. The prince of the children of Simeon shall be Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

Tailo: Ông siū-khì, hui-siông siū-khì, tsiū hā bīng-līng kā Ba-bú-lông só͘-ū tì-huī ê lâng tsâu-bia̍t.
English: For this cause the king was angry and very furious, and commanded to destroy all the wise men of Babylon.

Tailo: Tī Io-si-iah tsò ông tsa̍p-peh nî, tsiū siú tsit-ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh.
English: In the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah was this Passover kept.

Tailo: ( A-sah ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; tiāu īng Tsò kiàn-tsìng ê pik-ha̍p hue. ) Tshuā Iô-sé-huh tshin-tshiūnn teh tshuā iûⁿ-kûn ê I-su-la-el ê bo̍k-tsiá ah, kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ; tsē tī ki-lō͘-ping ê tíng-bīn ê Tsú ah, kiû Lí huat-tshut Lí ê kng.
English: Hear us, Shepherd of Israel, You who lead Joseph like a flock, You who sit above the cherubim, shine forth.

Tailo: Án-ne, guá ê pò-siúⁿ sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsiū-sī guá teh thuân hok-im, hō͘ lâng pe̍h-pe̍h tit-tio̍h hok-im, guá khiok bô tit-tio̍h thuân hok-im kai-tit ê khuân-lī.
English: What then is my reward? That, when I preach the Good News, I may present the Good News of Christ without charge, so as not to abuse my authority in the Good News.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, m̄-thang kah in tâng kiâⁿ, tio̍h iok-sok lí ê kha, m̄-thang ta̍h ji̍p-khì in ê lō͘.
English: My son, don't walk in the way with them. Keep your foot from their path,

Tailo: Tsiah-ê uē kóng suah, Mâ-lí-ah ua̍t tńg-sin, khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su khiā tī hia, mā jīn bē-tshut I sī I-é-su.
English: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn't know that it was Jesus.

Tailo: Sann nî āu, guá tsiah-khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm pài-hóng Piat-tò͘ kah i tuà tsa̍p-gō͘ ji̍t.
English: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Peter, and stayed with him fifteen days.

Tailo: Hiah-ê gia̍h kiong-tsìnn ê Ke-tal ióng-sū só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê gia̍h-sò͘ tsió-tsió. In-uī tse sī Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè kóng ê.
English: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, will be few; for Yahweh, the God of Israel, has spoken it.

Tailo: Guá — Siōng-tsú īng kong-gī tiàu Lí, beh khan Lí ê tshiú, pó-siú Lí, hō͘ Lí tsò kah jîn-bîn ê iok ê tiong-pó, tsò guā-pang lâng ê kng,
English: I, Yahweh, have called you in righteousness, And will hold your hand, And will keep you, And make you a covenant for the people, As a light for the nations;

Tailo: Hiat sin-si kah piàⁿ hué-hu tī tsuân-pō͘ ê suaⁿ-kok kah só͘-ū ê tshân-hn̂g, it-ti̍t kàu Kit-lông khe, koh ti̍t-kàu tang pîng Bé ê mn̂g ê kak-thâu lóng beh tsò sìng, kui tī Siōng-tsú, bô koh pue̍h-tshut, bô koh tshia-tó, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán.
English: The whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields to the brook Kidron, to the corner of the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy to Yahweh; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more forever.

Tailo: It-ti̍t kàu guá uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú tshuē-tio̍h só͘-tsāi, uī Iâ-kop ê tuā kuân-lîng ê tshuē-tio̍h tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Until I find out a place for Yahweh, A dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.

Tailo: In pí kim, pí tsin tsē ê sûn-kim khah thang him-bō͘; pí bi̍t, pí phang-pâng tih lo̍h-.lâi ê bi̍t koh khah tiⁿ.
English: More to be desired are they than gold, yes, than much fine gold; Sweeter also than honey and the extract of the honeycomb.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tsiū kah i nn̄g-ê bó͘, to̍h-sī E-tsu-le-el lâng A-hi-no-ám kah Kal-mel lâng bat tsò Na-bal ê bó͘ hit-ê miâ kiò A-bi-ga-il, lóng tsiūⁿ-khì hia.
English: So David went up there, and his two wives also, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

Tailo: Īng tshiuⁿ tsó͘-tòng hiah-ê jiok guá ê lâng; kiû Lí tuì guá ê sîn-hûn kóng, Guá sī kā lí tsín-kiù ê hit uī.
English: Brandish the spear and block those who pursue me. Tell my soul, I am your salvation.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê huē-tn̂g ê tsú-kuán, miâ kiò-tsò Ia-lo̍h, lâi phak tī I-é-su ê kha tsîng, khún-kiû I khì i ê tshù.
English: Behold, there came a man named Jairus, and he was a ruler of the synagogue. He fell down at Jesus' feet, and begged him to come into his house,

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm kā sio-tsè ê tshâ hē tī i ê kiáⁿ Í-sak ê sin tsiūⁿ, ka-kī ê tshiú gia̍h hué kah to; nn̄g lâng tsò-hué kiânn.
English: Abraham took the wood of the burnt offering and laid it on Isaac his son. He took in his hand the fire and the knife. They both went together.

Tailo: I tuì thiⁿ hō͘ lí thiaⁿ-tio̍h I ê siann, uī-tio̍h beh kà-sī lí, koh tī tē-bīn tsiūⁿ hō͘ lí khuàⁿ-tio̍h I ê tuā-hué, koh hō͘ lí thiaⁿ-tio̍h I ê uē tuì hué tiong tshut-.lâi.
English: Out of heaven he made you to hear his voice, that he might instruct you: and on earth he made you to see his great fire; and you heard his words out of the midst of the fire.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kā A-ki-si kóng, Guá bat tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tuì guá khí-thâu lâi lí ê bīn-tsîng ê sî kàu kin-á-ji̍t, lí tī lí ê lô͘-po̍k ū khuàⁿ-tshut siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì, hō͘ guá bô thang kah ông — guá ê tsú ê tuì-ti̍k kau-tsiàn?
English: David said to Achish, But what have I done? and what have you found in your servant so long as I have been before you to this day, that I may not go and fight against the enemies of my lord the king?

Tailo: Páu-lô kíng Se-la̍h tsò-hué lī-khui, sìn-tô͘ kā in kau-thok tī Tsú ê un-tián.
English: but Paul chose Silas, and went out, being commended by the brothers to the grace of God.

Tailo: Tse sī beh ìng-giām I-sá-iah sian-ti ê uē, Tsú ah, siáⁿ lâng ū teh sìn guán só͘ thuân ê sìn-sit? Tsú ē tuì siáⁿ lâng hián-bîng I ê kuân-lîng? ( tsù, ISI 53:1 )
English: that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke, Lord, who has believed our report? To whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?

Tailo: Huē-tsiòng tshuā hit-ê lâng tshut-khì iâⁿ guā, īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm kàu sí, sī tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘-se ê.
English: All the congregation brought him outside of the camp, and stoned him to death with stones; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: In ê phû-tô tshiū sī tuì So͘-tóm ê phû-tô tshiū thuân ê, mā tuì Am-mo͘-la̍h ê hn̂g tshut ê; in ê phû-tô sī to̍k ê phû-tô, kui pha lóng sī khó͘ ê.
English: For their vine is of the vine of Sodom, Of the fields of Gomorrah: Their grapes are grapes of gall, Their clusters are bitter:

Tailo: E-li-iah kā tsìng lâng kóng, Lín lâi kīn-uá guá. Tsìng lâng tsiū khì kīn-uá i, i tsiū koh siu-lí tó-huāi ê Siōng-tsú ê tuâⁿ.
English: Elijah said to all the people, Come near to me; and all the people came near to him. He repaired the altar of Yahweh that was thrown down.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guá tshut siaⁿ kiû-kiò ê sî, kiû Lí thiaⁿ, koh kiû Lí liân-bín guá, tap-ìng guá.
English: Hear, Yahweh, when I cry with my voice. Have mercy also on me, and answer me.

Tailo: Lí ê kè-uē siuⁿ tsē, tì-sú ià-siān. Taⁿ tio̍h hō͘ hiah-ê kuan thiⁿ-siōng ê, khuànn tsheⁿ-sîn ê, tī gue̍h-tshe kóng ī-giân ê, lóng khí-.lâi, kiù lí thuat-lī só͘ beh lîm-kàu lí ê tāi-tsì.
English: You are wearied in the multitude of your counsels: let now the astrologers, the stargazers, the monthly prognosticators, stand up, and save you from the things that shall come on you.

Tailo: Hit-pîng mā sī án-ne, tiâⁿ-mn̂g ê tsó-iū, kok ū uî tsa̍p-gō͘ tiú, uî ê thiāu sann ki, khū saⁿ-ê.
English: and so for the other side: on this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.

Tailo: Tshù-the̍h tsâi-sán sī tsó͘-sian só͘ lâu ê, to̍k-to̍k hiân-huī ê bó͘ sī Siōng-tsú só͘ sù.
English: House and riches are an inheritance from fathers, But a prudent wife is from Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín kong-tshú siâⁿ liáu-āu, tsiū tio̍h īng hué sio siâⁿ, tio̍h tsiàu Siōng-tsú ê uē kiânn. Lí khuàⁿ, tse sī guá só͘ bīng-līng lín ê.
English: It shall be, when you have seized on the city, that you shall set the city on fire; according to the word of Yahweh shall you do: behold, I have commanded you.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t thiaⁿ-tio̍h Na-bal í-king sí-.khì, tsiū kóng, Ing-kai tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú, in-uī guá tuì Na-bal ê tshiú só͘ siū ê lîng-jio̍k, I ū kā guá sin-uan, koh tsó͘-tsí lô͘-po̍k kiâⁿ pháiⁿ; Siōng-tsú mā hō͘ Na-bal ê pháiⁿ kui kàu Na-bal ê thâu-khak. Án-ne, Ta-bi̍t tsiū tshe lâng khì kā A-bi-ga-il kóng, beh tshuā i tsò bó͘.
English: When David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, Blessed be Yahweh, who has pleaded the cause of my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and has kept back his servant from evil: and the evil-doing of Nabal has Yahweh returned on his own head. David sent and spoke concerning Abigail, to take her to him as wife.

Tailo: M̄-thang tshiúⁿ-kiap sàn-tshiah lâng ê mi̍h, in-uī i sàn-tshiah; mā m̄-thang tī siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu khi-hū khùn-khó͘ ê lâng,
English: Don't exploit the poor, because he is poor; And don't crush the needy in court;

Tailo: In tú uī-tio̍h án-ne iáu teh tiû-tû ê sî, hut-jiân ū nn̄g-ê lâng tshīng kng iàⁿ-iàⁿ ê saⁿ khiā tī in sin piⁿ.
English: It happened, while they were greatly perplexed about this, behold, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t iáu ū siáⁿ-mi̍h thang tuì Lí kóng? Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú ah, Lí tsai Lí ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: What can David say more to you? for you know your servant, Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Iô-tah, Biān-iá-mín ê tuì-ti̍k thiaⁿ-tio̍h hiah-ê siū lia̍h tńg-.lâi ê lâng, uī I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè khí tiān,
English: Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity were building a temple to Yahweh, the God of Israel;

Tailo: Guá tsiū ē huat-tshut tuā siū-khì, tsò tāi-tsì lâi huán-tuì lín, Guá pún-sin in-uī lín ê tsuē, kā lín tsik-hua̍t tshit puē tāng.
English: then I will walk contrary to you in wrath; and I also will chastise you seven times for your sins.

Tailo: Guá sī tsuân-lîng Siōng-tè, tshut-hiān tī A-bu-la-hàm, Í-sak, Iâ-kop; tsóng-.sī, Guá ê miâ kiò-tsò I-é-ho-bah, Guá m̄-bat hō͘ in bat Guá.
English: and I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty; but by my name Yahweh I was not known to them.

Tailo: Tuā-kiáⁿ tsin siū-khì, m̄ ji̍p-.khì; lāu-pē tshut-lâi kā i khó͘-khǹg.
English: But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, pun hō͘ Han-nah ê sī siang-hūn, in-uī i khah thiàⁿ Han-nah. M̄-koh, Siōng-tsú hō͘ i bē huâi-thai.
English: but to Hannah he gave a double portion; for he loved Hannah, but Yahweh had shut up her womb.

Tailo: āu-lâi, uàn-hūn i, huí-pòng i ê pháiⁿ tāi, phah-pháiⁿ i ê miâ-siaⁿ, kóng, ' Guá tshuā tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kah i tâng-pâng, khuànn i bô tsāi-sik-lí ê pîn-kì. '
English: and lay shameful things to her charge, and bring up an evil name on her, and say, I took this woman, and when I came near to her, I didn't find in her the tokens of virginity;

Tailo: Hit-ê lô͘-po̍k tshut-.khì, tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê pêⁿ-pêⁿ tsò lô͘-po̍k ê, hit-ê lâng khiàm i tsi̍t pah-ê gîn-á, tsiū kā i lia̍h-teh, tēnn i ê ām-kún, kóng, ' Lí só͘-khiàm ê lóng tio̍h hîng. '
English: But that servant went out, and found one of his fellow servants, who owed him one hundred denarii, and he grabbed him, and took him by the throat, saying, Pay me what you owe!'

Tailo: Thih-tshiūⁿ tsō pó͘-thâu, īng hué-thuàⁿ tuàn-liān, īng thuî kā i phah, īng i ū la̍t ê tshiú lâi tuî, tì-sú pak-tó͘ iau bô la̍t; bô lim tsuí lâi ià-siān.
English: The smith makes an axe, and works in the coals, and fashions it with hammers, and works it with his strong arm: yes, he is hungry, and his strength fails; he drinks no water, and is faint.

Tailo: In ê hîng-uî uai-tshua̍h, lóng piàn-tsò ù-uè; bô lâng kiâⁿ hó, liân kah tsi̍t-ê to bô.
English: They have all gone aside. They have together become corrupt. There is none who does good, no, not one.

Tailo: In-uī Ki-tok sí tsi̍t pái tsiū kah tsuē uân-tsuân tuān-tsua̍t kuan-hē; I tsit-má ua̍h-.leh, sī uī-tio̍h Siōng-tè teh ua̍h.
English: For the death that he died, he died to sin one time; but the life that he lives, he lives to God.

Tailo: In suî-piān kóng-tshut kiau-ngō͘ ê uē; só͘-ū tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng lóng ka-kī phòng-hong.
English: They pour out arrogant words. All the evil-doers boast.

Tailo: In bē kì-tit tsín-kiù in ê Siōng-tè; I bat tī Ai-gi̍p tuì in tsò tuā tāi-tsì,
English: They forgot God, their Savior, Who had done great things in Egypt,

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tsiū tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ Gi-lia̍t ia-be-si ê lâng, kā in kóng, Guān Siōng-tsú sù-hok hō͘ lín, in-uī lín īng tsit-ê jîn-tsû khuán-thāi lí ê tsú Sàu-lô, kā i bâi-tsòng.
English: David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh Gilead, and said to them, Blessed be you of Yahweh, that you have shown this kindness to your lord, even to Saul, and have buried him.

Tailo: Τio̍h khì kìⁿ tong-sî tsò tsè-si ê, kā i kóng, ' Guá kin-á-ji̍t tuì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè kóng bîng, guá í-king lâi-kàu Siōng-tsú tuì lán ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán ê tē. '
English: You shall come to the priest who shall be in those days, and tell him, I profess this day to Yahweh your God, that I am come to the land which Yahweh swore to our fathers to give us.

Tailo: Uá-khò tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng, tuì tsù-tsō ê ngó͘-siōng kóng, Lí sī guán ê Siōng-tè ê, tsit khuán lâng ē siū kuáⁿ-tsáu, in ē tuā kiàn-siàu.
English: Those who trust in engraved images, Who tell molten images, You are our gods' Will be turned back. They will be utterly disappointed.

Tailo: Lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ, lí ê sun, í-ki̍p gû-kûn, iûⁿ-kûn, koh it-tshè só͘-ū ê, lóng thang lâi tuà tī Go-sián ê tē kah guá sio keh-piah.
English: You shall dwell in the land of Goshen, and you will be near to me, you, your children, your children's children, your flocks, your herds, and all that you have.

Tailo: Phâng tshit tè uánn, té-muá siōng lō͘-bué tshit-hāng tsai-hō ê thiⁿ-sài, kî-tiong tsi̍t-ê lâi kah guá kóng-uē, kóng, Lâi! Guá beh pò lí khuàⁿ sin-niû, to̍h-sī iûⁿ-ko ê bó͘.
English: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls, who were loaded with the seven last plagues came, and he spoke with me, saying, Come here. I will show you the wife, the Lamb's bride.

Tailo: In khì tī Iô-tah ê Ki-lia̍t-iâ-lîm tsat iâⁿ, só͘-í, kā tsit só͘-tsāi ê miâ kiò-tsò Ma-hat-lī-tàn, kàu kin-á-ji̍t. Lí khuàⁿ, tse sī tī Ki-lia̍t-iâ-lîm ê āu-bīn.
English: They went up, and encamped in Kiriath Jearim, in Judah: therefore they called that place Mahaneh Dan, to this day; behold, it is behind Kiriath Jearim.

Tailo: Ba̍t hûn kah o͘-àm tī I ê sì-kho͘-uî; gī-lí kah kong-pêⁿ sī I pó-tsō ê tē-ki.
English: Clouds and darkness are around him. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, I-su-la-el tsiah-ê kun-ông, lín taⁿ kàu-gia̍h à; tio̍h tû-khì kiông-pō kah tshiúⁿ-kiap ê tāi-tsì, píng-kong kiâⁿ-gī, bô koh pà-tsiàm jîn-bîn ê sán-gia̍p. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: Let it suffice you, princes of Israel: remove violence and spoil, and execute justice and righteousness; dispossessing my people, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê tsok-uî tsin uí-tāi; huān-nā kah-ì I só͘ tsò ê lóng ē huaⁿ-hí tshâ-khó.
English: Yahweh's works are great, Pondered by all those who delight in them.

Tailo: In-uī guá tsín-kiù ai-kiû ê kan-khó͘ lâng kah bô lâng pang-tsān ê ko͘-jî.
English: Because I delivered the poor who cried, And the fatherless also, who had none to help him.

Tailo: Ê-lú-sa-lèm kah Iô-tah tú-tio̍h tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī in-uī Siōng-tsú huat-tshut siū-khì, beh tuì I ê bīn-tsîng kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: For through the anger of Yahweh did it happen in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence. Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, uī-tio̍h i kut-jio̍k ê tshin, to̍h-sī uī-tio̍h i ê lāu-bú, uī-tio̍h i ê lāu-pē, uī-tio̍h i ê kiáⁿ, uī-tio̍h i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, uī-tio̍h i ê hiann-tī,
English: except for his relatives that are near to him: for his mother, for his father, for his son, for his daughter, for his brother,

Tailo: Bān-bîn ta̍k-ê hōng i ka-kī ê sîn-bîng ê miâ lâi kiâⁿ; tsóng-.sī, guán beh hōng guán ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú ê miâ lâi kiâⁿ, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán.
English: Indeed all the nations may walk in the name of their gods; But we will walk in the name of Yahweh our God forever and ever.

Tailo: Siú-bōng ê lâng koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng tsáu-.lâi, siú-bōng ê lâng kā kò͘ siâⁿ mn̂g ê lâng kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tuaⁿ-sin tsáu-.lâi. Ông kóng, Tse mā sī pò siau-sit ê.
English: The watchman saw another man running; and the watchman called to the porter, and said, Behold, another man running alone. The king said, He also brings news.

Tailo: I khiā tī ua̍h-lâng kah sí-lâng ê tiong-kan, un-i̍k tsiū suah.
English: He stood between the dead and the living; and the plague was stayed.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Mô͘-ap lâng só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsâi-bu̍t kah só͘ tsik-tsū ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng ē tuà-kuè liú-tshiū khe.
English: Therefore they will carry away the abundance they have gotten, and that which they have stored up, over the brook of the willows.

Tailo: Án-ne, guán tsiū bô tò-thè lī-khui Lí; kiû Lí hō͘ guán tit-tio̍h ua̍h, guán tsiū beh kiû-kiò Lí ê miâ.
English: So we will not turn away from you. Revive us, and we will call on your name.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì Iâ-kop ê tiong-kan tshuā tshut kiáⁿ-sun, tuì Iô-tah ê tiong-kan tshuā tshut sîng-tsiap Guá ê tsìng suaⁿ ê. Guá kíng ê jîn-bîn beh sîng-tsiap i; Guá tsiah-ê lô͘-po̍k beh tī hia tuà.
English: I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains; and my chosen shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.

Tailo: Guá beh phìng-tiāⁿ hō͘ lí íng-uán kui tī Guá, jî-tshiánn Guá beh īng kong-gī, kong-pêⁿ, tsû-ài, liân-bín, lâi kā lí phìng-tiāⁿ kui tī Guá;
English: I will betroth you to me forever. Yes, I will betroth you to me in righteousness, in justice, in loving kindness, and in compassion.

Tailo: Guá beh tiām-tiām-á su-sióng Lí tsun-kuì îng-kng ê ui-giâm kah Lí kî-biāu ê tsok-uî.
English: Of the glorious majesty of your honor, Of your wondrous works, I will meditate.

Tailo: In tiong-kan só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê bô guā tsē, tshin-tshiūnn lâng teh kóng kaⁿ-ná tshiū, tī siōng kuân ê ki-bué, tsí ū nn̄g saⁿ lia̍p, tī kué-tsí tshiū tshun hn̄g ê ki bué, tsí ū tshun sì gō͘ lia̍p. Tse sī Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè kóng ê.
English: Yet gleanings will be left there, like the shaking of an olive tree, two or three olives in the top of the uppermost bough, four or five in the outermost branches of a fruitful tree, says Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: I-é-su suî-sî kah in kóng-uē, kóng, An lín ê sim, sī guá, m̄-bián kiaⁿ.
English: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying Cheer up! I AM! Don't be afraid.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú tī tsit ji̍t beh kā lín sio̍k-tsuē, hō͘ lín tshing-khì, lín ē tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h tshing-khì, thuat-lī it-tshè ê tsuē-kò.
English: for on this day shall atonement be made for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins you shall be clean before Yahweh.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k hit-ê īng tuā kuân-lîng kah tshun-tshut ê tshiú-kut tshuā lín tshut Ai-gi̍p tē ê Siōng-tsú, lín tio̍h kìng-uì I, kā I kuī-pài, kā I tsè-hiàn.
English: but Yahweh, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and with an outstretched arm, him shall you fear, and to him shall you bow yourselves, and to him shall you sacrifice:

Tailo: Lô͘-po̍k kóng, ' Tsú-lâng, lí só͘ huan-hù ê guá lóng í-king tsò à, m̄-koh, iáu-koh ū khang-uī. '
English: The servant said, Lord, it is done as you commanded, and there is still room.'

Tailo: Tsú-lâng nā kā i tiāⁿ-tio̍h hō͘ ka-kī ê kiáⁿ, tsiū tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kā i khuán-thāi.
English: If he marries her to his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.

Tailo: Kin-á-ji̍t, guá lâi-kàu tséⁿ piⁿ, kóng, ' Guá ê tsú-lâng A-bu-la-hàm ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú ah, Lí nā khíng, kiû Lí hō͘ guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘ sūn-sī. '
English: I came this day to the spring, and said, Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, if now you do prosper my way which I go

Tailo: Mô͘-se ji̍p-khì pò͘-pênn ê sî, hûn-thiāu tsiū lo̍h-.lâi, khiā tī pò͘-pênn ê mn̂g tsîng, Siōng-tsú tsiū kah Mô͘-se kóng-uē.
English: It happened, when Moses entered into the Tent, that the pillar of cloud descended, stood at the door of the Tent, and spoke with Moses.

Tailo: Lí kám ē uī in thâi iûⁿ-kûn, gû-kûn, hō͘ in tsia̍h kàu-gia̍h? Á-sī uī-tio̍h in tsū-tsi̍p hái lāi só͘-ū ê hî, hō͘ in tsia̍h kàu-gia̍h?
English: Shall flocks and herds be slain for them, to suffice them? or shall all the fish of the sea be gathered together for them, to suffice them?

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán kóng, ' Pa̍t-ji̍t in nā tuì guán á-.sī guán ê āu-tāi án-ne kóng, guán thang ìn kóng: Lín thang khuànn Siōng-tsú ê tuâⁿ ê khuán-sit, to̍h-sī guán ê tsó͘-sian tsá-tsîng só͘ khí ê, m̄-sī uī-tio̍h sio-tsè kah pa̍t tsióng ê tsè, to̍h-sī uī-tio̍h beh tsò lín kah guán tiong-kan ê tsìng-kì. '
English: Therefore said we, It shall be, when they so tell us or to our generations in time to come, that we shall say, Behold the pattern of the altar of Yahweh, which our fathers made, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice; but it is a witness between us and you.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng siat kè-bô͘ beh hāi gī lâng, Koh tuì i thòng-hūn kā-gê tshiat-khí.
English: The wicked plots against the just, And gnashes at him with his teeth.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Mi-ka-iah tuì in kóng-khí i só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h it-tshè ê uē, to̍h-sī Pa-lo-sih tuì jîn-bîn tha̍k hit pún tsheh ê sî i só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h ê.
English: Then Micaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.

Tailo: I ê kiù-un si̍t-tsāi kīn-uá kiaⁿ-uì I ê lâng, hō͘ îng-kng tiàm tī lán ê kíng lāi.
English: Surely his salvation is near those who fear him, That glory may dwell in our land.

Tailo: Gī lâng só͘ ì-ài ê tāi-tsì lóng sī hó; pháiⁿ lâng só͘ ǹg-bāng ê tāi-tsì, kiat-kio̍k sī jiá Siōng-tsú siū-khì.
English: The desire of the righteous is only good. The expectation of the wicked is wrath.

Tailo: Hō͘ in íng-uán kiàn-siàu, kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ! Hō͘ in làu-khuì, bia̍t-bông!
English: Let them be disappointed and dismayed forever. Yes, let them be confounded and perish;

Tailo: I hiah-ê jîn-sîn īng Iô-tah ê khiuⁿ-kháu, tuā-siaⁿ kiò hiah-ê tī siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tíng ê Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâng, beh hō͘ in kiaⁿ, kā in jiáu-luān, thang lâi tsing-ho̍k hit-ê siâⁿ.
English: They cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall, to frighten them, and to trouble them; that they might take the city.

Tailo: Guá só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê hit tsiah bíng-siù tshin-tshiūnn pà; i ê kha tshin-tshiūnn hîm ê kha, tshuì tshin-tshiūnn sai ê tshuì. Hit bué liông kā i ê tsâi-lîng, tsō-uī kah tuā kuân-pìng hō͘ hit tsiah bíng-siù.
English: The beast which I saw was like a leopard, and his feet were like those of a bear, and his mouth like the mouth of a lion. The dragon gave him his power, his throne, and great authority.

Tailo: In-uī bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi, ū nn̄g-saⁿ lâng hōng guá ê miâ tsū-tsi̍p, guá mā ē kah in tông-tsāi.
English: For where two or three are gathered together in my name, there I am in the midst of them.

Tailo: In-uī ū hué tuì He-si-bóng tshut, ū hué-iām tuì Si-hông ê siâⁿ huat, sio-huí Mô͘-ap ê Al kah Al-nông kuân-tē ê tsú.
English: For a fire is gone out of Heshbon, A flame from the city of Sihon: It has devoured Ar of Moab, The lords of the high places of the Arnon.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Tî-mó͘-theh ê tsò lâng lín lóng tsai, i tshin-tshiūnn kiáⁿ tuì lāu-pē kah guá tsò-hué lô-khó͘ lâi hing-khí hok-im.
English: But you know the proof of him, that, as a child serves a father, so he served with me in furtherance of the Good News.

Tailo: Tsú ah, kiû Lí thè guá sin-uan, kiû Lí kiù-sio̍k guá ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Lord, you have pleaded the causes of my soul; you have redeemed my life.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Tē-tshit nî gō͘-gue̍h tshe-tsa̍p, ū I-su-la-el ê tiúⁿ-ló kuí-nā-ê lâng lâi beh mn̄g Siōng-tsú, tsē tī guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: It happened in the seventh year, in the fifth month, the tenth day of the month, that certain of the elders of Israel came to inquire of Yahweh, and sat before me.

Tailo: I pōe-iok lâi biáu-sī tsiù-tsuā, lí khuàⁿ, i í-king tâu-hâng, iáu-koh tsò-tshut tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, i it-tīng bē-tàng tô-thuat.
English: For he has despised the oath by breaking the covenant; and behold, he had given his hand, and yet has done all these things; he shall not escape.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán tī Siōng-tè ê tsìng kàu-huē, lóng īng lín lâi tsò khua-kháu, in-uī lín siū pik-hāi kah jím-siū huān-lān ê sî, ū pó-tshî jím-nāi kah sìn-sim.
English: so that we ourselves boast about you in the assemblies of God for your patience and faith in all your persecutions and in the afflictions which you endure.

Tailo: Lín iáu teh kóng, ' Kiáⁿ ná ē bô tam-tng lāu-pē ê tsuē? ' Kiáⁿ nā kiânn tsìng-ti̍t kah ha̍p-lí ê tāi-tsì, siú Guá it-tshè ê lu̍t-lē lâi kiâⁿ, i it-tīng ē ua̍h lo̍h-.khì.
English: Yet say you, Why does not the son bear the iniquity of the father? when the son has done that which is lawful and right, and has kept all my statutes, and has done them, he shall surely live.

Tailo: Lí só͘ sé ê saⁿ, á-.sī king, á-.sī huī, á-.sī phuê tsò ê mi̍h, nā tsìng-thâu í-king lī-khui, tio̍h koh-tsài sé, tsiū tshing-khì.
English: The garment, either the warp, or the woof, or whatever thing of skin it is, which you shall wash, if the plague has departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and it will be clean.

Tailo: Sàu-lô khuàⁿ-tio̍h Ta-bi̍t khì phah Hui-lī-sū lâng ê sî, tsiū mn̄g kun-tiúⁿ Ap-nel kóng, Ap-nel, hit-ê siàu-liân lâng sī siáⁿ lâng ê kiáⁿ? Ap-nel kóng, Guá kí ông ê ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, guá m̄-tsai.
English: When Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said to Abner, the captain of the army, Abner, whose son is this youth? Abner said, As your soul lives, O king, I can't tell.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Ta-bi̍t kah I-su-la-el ê tiúⁿ-ló í-ki̍p iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, lóng khì O-biat-e-tóm ê ke, huann-hí kng Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī tuì hia khí-.lâi.
English: So David, and the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh out of the house of Obed-Edom with joy.

Tailo: I koh tsō tsi̍t tsō tâng-tuâⁿ, tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú, kuân tsa̍p tiú.
English: Then he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits the length of it, and twenty cubits the breadth of it, and ten cubits the height of it.

Tailo: Lín kám m̄-tsai, só͘-ū tuì tshuì ji̍p-khì ê lóng lo̍h-khì tī pak-tó͘ té, āu-lâi tsiū pàng-tshut-.lâi, kám m̄-sī?
English: Don't you understand that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the belly, and then out of the body?

Tailo: In khò iûⁿ-ko ê hueh kah in só͘ kiàn-tsìng ê sìn-sit, í-king iâⁿ-kuè hit bué liông; in sīm-tsì guān-ì hi-seam in ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: They overcame him because of the Lamb's blood, and because of the word of their testimony. They didn't love their life, even to death.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú sìng ê tsú-bîn, lín lóng tio̍h thiàⁿ I. Siōng-tsú ē pó-siú sîng-si̍t ê lâng, tāng-tāng pò-ìng kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng.
English: Oh love Yahweh, all you his saints! Yahweh preserves the faithful, And pays back him who deals proudly in full.

Tailo: M̄-thang kā guá kah pháiⁿ lâng, í-ki̍p tsok-gia̍t ê lâng tsò tsi̍t-ē tû-.khì; in kah tshù-piⁿ kóng hó thiaⁿ ê uē, tsóng-.sī, in ê sim kan-tsà im-hiám.
English: Don't draw me away with the wicked, With the workers of iniquity who speak peace with their neighbors, But mischief is in their hearts.

Tailo: Kau-tsiàn ê tīn-sè tuì Sàu-lô lâi kóng tsin guî-kip, siā tsìnn ê lâng siā-tio̍h i, i khùn-khó͘ kàu-ki̍k.
English: The battle went sore against Saul, and the archers overtook him; and he was distressed by reason of the archers.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê Lē-bī tso̍k ê lâng khì tshuā tsi̍t-ê Lē-bī tso̍k ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á lâi tsò bó͘.
English: A man of the house of Levi went and took a daughter of Levi as his wife.

Tailo: Taⁿ kiû lí thiaⁿ lú-pī ê uē, iông-ín guá tī lí ê bīn-tsîng pâi tām-po̍h tsia̍h-mi̍h, hō͘ lí tsia̍h, lí kiâⁿ lō͘ tsiah ū khuì-la̍t.
English: Now therefore, please listen also to the voice of your handmaid, and let me set a morsel of bread before you; and eat, that you may have strength, when you go on your way.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè ē tī lí ê bīn-tsîng tsiām-tsiām tû-bia̍t tsiah-ê kok, lí m̄-thang kuáⁿ-kín kā i bia̍t-tiāu kàu tsīn, khióng-kiaⁿ iá-siù ke-thinn tsin tsē lâi hāi lí.
English: Yahweh your God will cast out those nations before you by little and little: you may not consume them at once, lest the animals of the field increase on you.

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè;
English: one male goat for a sin offering;

Tailo: Koh īng to phah tsè-si ê siâⁿ — Νo͘p kî-tiong ê lâm-lí, gín-á, tsia̍h ling ê enn-á kah gû, lî, iûⁿ, lóng īng to thâi-sí.
English: Nob, the city of the priests, struck he with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and nursing babies, and oxen and donkeys and sheep, with the edge of the sword.

Tailo: Ū Kap-tsi-el lâng Io-ho-iá-tah ê kiáⁿ Be-ná-iah, bat tsò tshut tsin tsē tuā sū ê, thâi-sí Mô͘-ap lâng A-li-el ê nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ, koh tī lo̍h seh ê sî, lo̍h-khì kheⁿ lāi thâi-sí tsi̍t tsiah sai.
English: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab: he went down also and killed a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn tuà tī pún só͘-tsāi ê sî, īng in ê só͘ kiâⁿ, só͘ tsò kā i uè lah-sap. In ê só͘ kiâⁿ, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng sī tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng king-kî kàu ê lah-sap.
English: Son of man, when the house of Israel lived in their own land, they defiled it by their way and by their doings: their way before me was as the uncleanness of a woman in her impurity.

Tailo: Lí ê kiong lóng lō͘-tshut, tuì tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê lóng sī tsin-si̍t ê uē. [Sè-la̍h] Lí īng kang-hô kā tāi-tē hun-khui.
English: You uncovered your bow. You called for your sworn arrows. Selah. You split the earth with rivers.

Tailo: Ióng-kám ê lâng lóng siū tshiúⁿ-kiap; in lóng khùn-khì bô koh tshéⁿ, ing-hiông mā bô kah tsi̍t-ê ē-tàng tshut-tshiú.
English: Valiant men lie plundered, They have slept their last sleep. None of the men of war can lift their hands.

Tailo: In tsiū khan hit tsiah lî-á lâi hō͘ I-é-su, kā in ka-kī ê guā-saⁿ phua̍h tuà lî-á tíng, hû I-é-su khí-lih khiâ.
English: They brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Jesus on them.

Tailo: I-é-su tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm kuè Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê sî, tsin tsē lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h I só͘ kiâⁿ ê sîn-jiah, tsiū sìn I.
English: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the Passover, during the feast, many believed in his name, observing his signs which he did.

Tailo: Guá it-tīng beh kā lí sù-hok, beh ke-thinn kiáⁿ-sun hō͘ lí. ( tsù, CSK 22:17 )
English: saying, Most surely I will bless you, and I will surely multiply you.

Tailo: Tsin tsē Iô-tá-iah lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h I-é-su tī Bē-tha-niah, tsiū khì hia. In m̄-nā sī beh khuànn I-é-su, mā ài beh khuànn I-é-su hō͘ i tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h ê La̍h-tsa-lō͘.
English: A large crowd therefore of the Jews learned that he was there, and they came, not for Jesus' sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.

Tailo: I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí ài guá kā lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsheⁿ-mê-ê kóng, Lāu-su, kiû Lí hō͘ guá ē koh khuànn-kìnn.
English: Jesus asked him, What do you want me to do for you? The blind man said to him, Rhabboni, that I may see again.

Tailo: Bô-lūn sī piáⁿ, á-.sī puē ê ngó͘-kok, á-.sī sin ê suī, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h, kàu lín tuà lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ lín ê Siōng-tè hit ji̍t tsiah thang tsia̍h. Tse tī lín it-tshè tuà ê só͘-tsāi, tsò lín tāi-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: You shall eat neither bread, nor roasted grain, nor fresh grain, until this same day, until you have brought the offering of your God. This is a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

Tailo: In-uī i kiat-liân tī Siōng-tsú, tuè I bô lī-khui, tsip-siú Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘-se ê kài-bīng.
English: For he joined with Yahweh; he didn't depart from following him, but kept his commandments, which Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t ê, Lí ē kā in siau-bia̍t; ài thâi lâng kah kan-kuí-ê, lóng sī Siōng-tè só͘ thó-ià ê.
English: You will destroy those who speak lies. Yahweh abhors the blood-thirsty and deceitful man.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng kā i kóng, ' Tsin hó, hó ê lô͘-po̍k, lí kì-jiân tī sió-khuá ê tāi-tsì tsīn-tiong, taⁿ hō͘ lí kuán tsa̍p-ê siâⁿ. '
English: He said to him, Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.'

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá khǹg lín tio̍h tsia̍h, tse sī kuan-hē lín ê tit-kiù, in-uī lín bô kah tsi̍t-ê lâng ē sit-lo̍h tsi̍t ki thâu-mn̂g.
English: Therefore I beg you to take some food, for this is for your safety; for not a hair will perish from any of your heads.

Tailo: Lí ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ huān-huat kah tsha̍t tàu-tīn, ta̍k-ê ài beh tsiap-siū lâng ê o͘-se, siàu-siūⁿ siā-lé; in bô uī-tio̍h ko͘-jî sin-uan, kuáⁿ-hū ê àn-kiāⁿ bē-tàng kàu tī i ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Your princes are rebellious, and companions of thieves. Everyone loves bribes, and follows after rewards. They don't judge the fatherless, Neither does the cause of the widow come to them.

Tailo: In tī pún só͘-tsāi an-jiân sing-ua̍h, bô lâng hō͘ in kiaⁿ, tī Guá kā in tuì lia̍t kok tiong tshuā tò tńg-.lâi, tuì tuì-ti̍k ê tē tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi. Guá tī lia̍t kok ê bīn-tsîng, tī in sin tsiūⁿ hián-bîng tsò sìng ê sî, in ē tam-tng in ê kiàn-siàu kah in puē-gi̍k Guá it-tshè ê tsuē.
English: when I have brought them back from the peoples, and gathered them out of their enemies' lands, and am sanctified in them in the sight of many nations.

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè;
English: one male goat for a sin offering;

Tailo: I ìn kóng, Guá uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú — bān-kun ê Siōng-tè tuā jia̍t-sim, in-uī I-su-la-el lâng khì-sak Lí ê iok, huí-huāi Lí hiah-ê tuâⁿ, īng to thâi Lí hiah-ê sian-ti, kan-taⁿ tshun guá tsi̍t-ê lâng, in iáu teh siàu-siūⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā, beh kā guá thâi-sí.
English: He said, I have been very jealous for Yahweh, the God of Armies; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and slain your prophets with the sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.

Tailo: In ta̍k tsá-khí, tsiàu ta̍k lâng tsia̍h ê liōng lâi khioh, ji̍t-thâu tsi̍t ē pha̍k, tsiū iûⁿ-khì.
English: They gathered it morning by morning, everyone according to his eating. When the sun grew hot, it melted.

Tailo: Kî-tiong ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng kóng, I bat hō͘ tsheⁿ-mê-.ê koh khuànn-kìnn, kám bē-tàng hō͘ tsit-ê lâng mài sí?
English: Some of them said, Couldn't this man, who opened the eyes of him who was blind, have also kept this man from dying?

Tailo: Tuì íng-uán, tuì guân-khí-thâu, iáu-buē ū sè-kài ê tsìn-tsîng, guá í-king siū siat-li̍p.
English: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, Before the earth existed.

Tailo: Lín ka-kī tsai, guá īng siang tshiú tsò-kang lâi kiong-kip ka-kī kah tâng-phuāⁿ ê su-iàu.
English: You yourselves know that these hands ministered to my necessities, and to those who were with me.

Tailo: I kóng, Guá ê tsú-lâng A-bu-la-hàm ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí si un hō͘ guá ê tsú-lâng A-bu-la-hàm, hō͘ guá kin-á-ji̍t ū hó ki-huē.
English: He said, Yahweh, the God of my master Abraham, please give me success this day, and show kindness to my master Abraham.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá khuànn, lâng tio̍h in-uī i só͘ king-îng ê lâi huann-hí; in-uī tse sī i ê hūn-gia̍h. I kuè-sin í-āu ê tāi-tsì, siáⁿ lâng ē hō͘ i koh lâi khuànn-kìnn?
English: Therefore I saw that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his works; for that is his portion: for who can bring him to see what will be after him?

Tailo: In-uī in só͘-ū ê tsâi-liāu í-king kàu-gia̍h thang tsò it-tshè só͘ tio̍h tsò ê kang, suah ū tshun.
English: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.

Tailo: Só͘ tsik-tsū ê bí-niûⁿ, thang tsò Ai-gi̍p tē tsiong-lâi tshit nî ki-hng ê lō͘-īng, bián-tit tsit-ê tē hō͘ ki-hng só͘ bia̍t.
English: The food will be for a store to the land against the seven years of famine, which will be in the land of Egypt; that the land not perish through the famine.

Tailo: Hit sî, Iô-há-neh thán-pi̍k kong-khai sîng-jīn kóng, Guá m̄-sī Ki-tok.
English: He confessed, and didn't deny, but he confessed, I am not the Christ.

Tailo: Ta-ni-el kóng: Guá àm-sî khuàⁿ-tio̍h ī-siōng, lí khuàⁿ, thiⁿ-.ni̍h ê sì-bīn hut-jiân khí hong, tshue tī tuā hái ê tíng-bīn.
English: Daniel spoke and said, I saw in my vision by night, and, behold, the four winds of the sky broke forth on the great sea.

Tailo: Tong-sî in ê jîn-ting iú-hān, jîn-sò͘ tsin tsió, koh tī hia sī tsò tshut-guā lâng.
English: When they were but a few men in number, Yes, very few, and foreigners in it.

Tailo: Ke-ná-nah ê kiáⁿ Tse-ti-kiah tsìn-tsîng, siàn Mi-ka-iah ê tshuì-phué, kóng, Siōng-tè ê lîng tuì tó tsi̍t tiâu lō͘ lī-khui guá lâi kah lí kóng-uē?
English: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and struck Micaiah on the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of Yahweh from me to speak to you?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, I-su-la-el kah Iô-tah ê kûn-tsiòng lóng thiàⁿ Ta-bi̍t, in-uī i tī in bīn-tsîng tshut-ji̍p.
English: But all Israel and Judah loved David; for he went out and came in before them.

Tailo: Tì-sú jîn-bîn bē-tàng hun-pia̍t huann-hí huah ê siann kah jîn-bîn thî-khàu ê siann; in-uī jîn-bîn tuā-siaⁿ huah ê siann, hō͘ hit-ê siann thuân kàu tsin hn̄g.
English: so that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people; for the people shouted with a loud shout, and the noise was heard afar off.
