Tailo: I koh huan-hù tsò thâu ê kóng, Guá ê a-hiaⁿ E-sáu tú-tio̍h lí ê sî, nā mn̄g lí kóng, ' Lí sī siáⁿ lâng ê? Lí beh khì tó-uī? Lí thâu-tsîng hiah-ê tsing-seⁿ sī siáⁿ lâng ê? '
English: He commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau, my brother, meets you, and asks you, saying, Whose are you? Where are you going? Whose are these before you?'

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng beh khí Siōng-tsú ê tiān só͘ hē ê tē-ki, kì tī ē-té: Tn̂g la̍k-tsa̍p tiú, khuah jī-tsa̍p tiú, lóng sī tsiàu kó͘-tsá ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: Now these are the foundations which Solomon laid for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the first measure was sixty cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits.

Tailo: Í-tsîng Ê-lú-sa-lèm li̍k-lâi ū tuā kun-ông thóng-hat hô guā tsuân tē, tsìn-kòng, kuan-suè, tsîⁿ-niû lóng la̍p hō͘ in.
English: There have been mighty kings also over Jerusalem, who have ruled over all the country beyond the River; and tribute, custom, and toll, was paid to them.

Tailo: Tī Ai-gi̍p phah-sí só͘-ū ê tuā-kiáⁿ, tī Hâm ê pò͘-pêⁿ lāi phah-sí in ê tuā-kiáⁿ.
English: And struck all the firstborn in Egypt, The chief of their strength in the tents of Ham.

Tailo: I bô pó-hō͘ pháiⁿ lâng ê sèⁿ-miā, sī hō͘ khó͘-lān ê lâng tit-tio̍h kong-pêⁿ.
English: He doesn't preserve the life of the wicked, But gives to the afflicted their right.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù I-su-la-el lâng kóng: Nā ū lâng huān tsuē, sit-gō͘ huān-tio̍h Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng m̄-thang kiânn ê tsi̍t hāng.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, saying, If anyone sins unintentionally, in any of the things which Yahweh has commanded not to be done, and does any one of them:

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá beh hing-khí Kal-tí-ah lâng, to̍h-sī tsân-jím huâiⁿ-pà ê pang-kok, piàn kiâⁿ tsuân tē, pà-tsiàm hiah-ê m̄-sī sio̍k i tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: For, behold, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, that march through the breadth of the earth, to possess dwelling places that are not theirs.

Tailo: Kā piàn-suī-.ê kóng, ' Lí ê tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián à' á-.sī kóng, ' Khí-.lâi, giâ lí ê pho͘-á lâi kiâⁿ', tó tsi̍t hāng khah kán-tan?
English: Which is easier, to tell the paralytic, Your sins are forgiven;' or to say, Arise, and take up your bed, and walk?'

Tailo: Tē-sann tâi tshia kuà pe̍h bé, tē-sì tâi tshia kuà hue-pan ê ióng bé.
English: in the third chariot white horses; and in the fourth chariot dappled horses, all of them powerful.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, in ē tuì A-siul kàu Ai-gi̍p tsiah-ê siâⁿ, tuì Ai-gi̍p kàu tuā hô, tuì tsit-ê hái kàu hit-ê hái, tuì tsit-ê suaⁿ kàu hit-ê suaⁿ, lóng ē kui uá-.lâi.
English: In that day they will come to you from Assyria and the cities of Egypt, And from Egypt even to the River, And from sea to sea, And mountain to mountain.

Tailo: Tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè, tuì íng-uán kàu íng-uán. A-men! Koh A-men!
English: Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, From everlasting and to everlasting! Amen and amen. BOOK II

Tailo: Ba-bú-lông, Guá uī lí siat ua̍h-tauh, lí hō͘ i tauh-tio̍h mā m̄-tsai. Lí hō͘ lâng tshuē-.tio̍h, lia̍h-.tio̍h, in-uī lí kah Siōng-tsú tsò tuì-ti̍k.
English: I have laid a snare for you, and you are also taken, Babylon, and you weren't aware: you are found, and also caught, because you have striven against Yahweh.

Tailo: I kah i kóng-uē ê sî, ông kā i kóng, Guán kám sī siat-li̍p lí tsò ông ê bô͘-sū? Lí tiām-tiām, beh thó phah, sī-.bô? Sian-ti tsiū tiām-tiām, koh kóng, Guá tsai Siōng-tè tiāⁿ-tio̍h ì-sù beh bia̍t lí, in-uī lí tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì, m̄-thiaⁿ guá ê khuàn-kái.
English: It happened, as he talked with him, that the king said to him, Have we made you of the king's counsel? Stop! Why should you be struck down? Then the prophet stopped, and said, I know that God has determined to destroy you, because you have done this, and have not listened to my counsel.

Tailo: In ǹg Siōng-tsú kiânn kuí-tsà, thau-seⁿ kiáⁿ. Taⁿ kàu gue̍h ê tshe-it, in kah in ê sán-gia̍p ē siū thun-bia̍t.
English: They are unfaithful to Yahweh; For they have borne illegitimate children. Now the new moon will devour them with their fields.

Tailo: Tī lo̍h hō͘ ê ji̍t, hûn tiong khīng ê hîng-siōng án-tsuáⁿ, sì-kho͘-uî ê kng ê hîng-siōng mā sī án-ne. Guá tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū phak tī thô͘-kha, koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng kóng-uē ê siann.
English: As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of rain, so was the appearance of the brightness round about. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of Yahweh. When I saw it, I fell on my face, and I heard a voice of one that spoke.

Tailo: in-uī Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng tshiong-muá Siōng-tsú ê tiān, só͘-í, tsè-si bē-tàng ji̍p-khì Siōng-tsú ê tiān.
English: The priests could not enter into the house of Yahweh, because the glory of Yahweh filled Yahweh's house.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h hûn-thiāu khiā tī pò͘-pênn ê mn̂g tsîng, jîn-bîn tsiū lóng khí-.lâi, ta̍k lâng tī in ê pò͘-pênn mn̂g-kháu kuī-pài.
English: All the people saw the pillar of cloud stand at the door of the Tent, and all the people rose up and worshiped, everyone at their tent door.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm kî-tó Siōng-tè, Siōng-tè tsiū i hó A-mí-me-li̍k kah i ê bó͘, í-ki̍p i ê lú-pī, in tsiū ē seⁿ kiáⁿ.
English: Abraham prayed to God. God healed Abimelech, and his wife, and his female servants, and they bore children.

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi ê lâng ū tshut-lâi kah Io-ap kau-tsiàn, Ta-bi̍t ê lô͘-po̍k sí kuí-nā-ê lâng, Hiat lâng U-lī-a mā sí.
English: The men of the city went out, and fought with Joab: and there fell some of the people, even of the servants of David; and Uriah the Hittite died also.

Tailo: Îm-hū ê lō͘ mā sī án-ne, i tsia̍h-liáu, tshit tshuì tsiū kóng, Guá bô tsò pháiⁿ.
English: So is the way of an adulterous woman: She eats and wipes her mouth, And says, I have done nothing wrong.'

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guá ê ba̍k-tsiu bô tsi̍t sî kheh; guá huân-ló kàu lóng bē kóng-uē.
English: You hold my eyelids open. I am so troubled that I can't speak.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng tshut Ai-gi̍p tē í-āu, tē-jī nî, jī-gue̍h tshe-it, Siōng-tsú tī Si-nái ê khòng-iá tī huē-bō͘ tiong huan-hù Mô͘-se, kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

Tailo: Lí tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, guá tiām-tiām bô kóng-uē, lí suah siūⁿ kóng guá tú-tú kah lí kāng-khuán; kî-si̍t guá beh kā lí tsik-pī, kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng pâi tī lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng.
English: You have done these things, and I kept silent. You thought that the I AM was just like you. I will rebuke you, and accuse you in front of your eyes.

Tailo: Kî-tiong nn̄g-bān sì-tshing lâng teh kuán-lí Siōng-tsú tiān ê kang, ū la̍k tshing lâng tsò tsit-uân kah sū-su.
English: Of these, twenty-four thousand were to oversee the work of the house of Yahweh; and six thousand were officers and judges;

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Lí kah kiâⁿ lō͘ ê lâng tsò-hué tsáu, siōng-tshiáⁿ ē ià-siān, ná ē-tàng kah bé tsáu sio jiok? Lí tī pîng-an ê tē, suî-jiân an-ún, tī Iol-tàn hô piⁿ ê tshiū-nâ ē án-tsuáⁿ?
English: If you have run with the footmen, and they have wearied you, then how can you contend with horses? and though in a land of peace you are secure, yet how will you do in the pride of the Jordan?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h bīng-līng I-su-la-el lâng hō͘ só͘-ū huān-tio̍h thái-ko ê, huān-tio̍h ē-sin lâu-lâng tsìng-thâu ê kah in-uī si-thé bô tshing-khì ê, lóng tio̍h tshut-khì iâⁿ guā.
English: Command the children of Israel that they put out of the camp every leper, and everyone who has an issue, and whoever is unclean by the dead.

Tailo: Guán uī-tio̍h Ki-tok ê iân-kò͘ tsò gōng lâng, lín kah Ki-tok kiat-liân tsò khiáu-lâng. Guán luán-jio̍k, lín ióng-tsòng; lín siū tsun-tiōng, guán hō͘ lâng khin-sī.
English: We are fools for Christ's sake, but you are wise in Christ. We are weak, but you are strong. You have honor, but we have dishonor.

Tailo: mā mn̄g bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú tiān lāi ê tsè-si í-ki̍p sian-ti, kóng, Guá li̍k-nî í-lâi, tī gō͘-gue̍h kan thî-khàu beh hō͘ ka-kī hun-pia̍t sè-sio̍k, taⁿ kám iáu-koh tio̍h án-ne kiânn?
English: and to speak to the priests of the house of Yahweh of Armies, and to the prophets, saying, Should I weep in the fifth month, separating myself, as I have done these so many years?

Tailo: Hi-lâm tshe i ê lô͘-po̍k, to̍h-sī tsai-iáⁿ kuè hái ê kiâⁿ-tsûn lâng kah Só͘-lô-móng ê lô͘-po̍k kāng tsûn khì.
English: Hiram sent in the navy his servants, sailors who had knowledge of the sea, with the servants of Solomon.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, m̄-thang bē kì-tit guá ê kà-sī, lí ê sim tio̍h tsip-siú guá ê kài-bīng.
English: My son, don't forget my teaching; But let your heart keep my commandments:

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tsit-ê khùn-khó͘ koh tsuì, khiok m̄-sī in-uī tsiú lâi tsuì ê lâng, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ.
English: Therefore hear now this, you afflicted, and drunken, but now with wine:

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè koh tuì tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Guá it-tīng tuā-tuā ke-thinn lí huâi-īn ê kan-khó͘, lí ē kan-khó͘ seⁿ kiáⁿ. Lí ē luân-bō͘ lí ê tiōng-hu, i ē kā lí kuán-hat.
English: To the woman he said, I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. In pain you will bring forth children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.

Tailo: In king-kuè kuan-kháu, tī Ge-bah hioh mê. La̍h-má lâng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ; Sàu-lô ê Gi-be-at lâng tô-tsáu.
English: They have gone over the pass. They have taken up their lodging at Geba. Ramah trembles. Gibeah of Saul has fled.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Guá tio̍h sí tī tsit-ê tē, guá bē-tàng kuè Iol-tàn hô; tsóng-.sī, lín ē-tàng kuè-khì tit-tio̍h hit-ê hó ê tē.
English: but I must die in this land, I must not go over the Jordan; but you shall go over, and possess that good land.

Tailo: Tsuē-ok ê kuân-pìng bē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kuán-hat gī lâng, bián-tit gī lâng tshun tshiú tsò pháiⁿ.
English: For the scepter of wickedness won't remain over the allotment of the righteous; So that the righteous won't use their hands to do evil.

Tailo: Tse tī lín it-tshè tuà ê só͘-tsāi beh tsò lín ta̍k sè-tāi ê lu̍t-lē.
English: These things shall be for a statute and ordinance to you throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

Tailo: Tse m̄-sī kóng ū lâng bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h Thiⁿ-pē, tsí ū tuì Siōng-tè hia lâi ê hit uī bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h Thiⁿ-pē.
English: Not that anyone has seen the Father, except he who is from God. He has seen the Father.

Tailo: In tsin iu-būn, tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê khai-sí mn̄g I-é-su kóng, Tsú ah, m̄-sī guá ho͘nnh?
English: They were exceedingly sorrowful, and each began to ask him, It isn't me, is it, Lord?

Tailo: ( Peh kiā-á ê si. ) Siōng-tsú ah, guá tuì tshim-ian kiû-kiò Lí!
English: Out of the depths I have cried to you, Yahweh.

Tailo: Tse sī Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè só͘ bīng-līng lâi kà-sī lín ê kài-bīng, lu̍t-lē, huat-tō͘, hō͘ lín tī lín só͘ beh kuè-khì tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē thang tsiàu án-ne kiânn,
English: Now this is the commandment, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Yahweh your God commanded to teach you, that you might do them in the land where you go over to possess it;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, pháiⁿ lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu ē hue; in bô lō͘ thang tô-tsáu, in só͘ ǹg-bāng ê tshin-tshiūnn khuì tn̄g.
English: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, They shall have no way to flee; Their hope shall be the giving up of the spirit.

Tailo: In-uī I-su-la-el mā ē ka-kī tuà tsē-tsē ji̍t, bô kun-ông, bô siú-líng, bô tsè-sū, bô tiau-khik ê thiāu, bô tsè-si ho̍k, tshù lāi mā bô ngó͘-siōng.
English: For the children of Israel shall abide many days without king, and without prince, and without sacrifice, and without sacred stone, and without ephod or idols.

Tailo: Tshú iûⁿ-kûn tiong siōng hó ê, kā tshâ thia̍p tī tiáⁿ-ē, hō͘ tiánn kún tshiāng-tshiāng, thang kā kut tī hit lāi-bīn kûn.
English: Take the choice of the flock, and also a pile of wood for the bones under the caldron; make it boil well; yes, let the bones of it be boiled in the midst of it.

Tailo: A-bu-la-hàm koh kóng, Kiû Tsú m̄-thang siū-khì, guá beh koh kóng, siat-sú tī hia nā tú-tio̍h saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê neh? Siōng-tsú kóng, Guá tī hia nā tú-tio̍h ū saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê, Guá mā bô beh tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: He said, Oh don't let the Lord be angry, and I will speak. What if there are thirty found there? He said, I will not do it, if I find thirty there.

Tailo: Siat-sú lín m̄ tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú ê uē, uî-puē Siōng-tsú ê bīng-līng, Siōng-tsú ê tshiú tsiū ē kā lín kong-kik, tshin-tshiūnn tsá-tsîng kong-kik lín ê tsó͘-sian án-ne.
English: but if you will not listen to the voice of Yahweh, but rebel against the commandment of Yahweh, then will the hand of Yahweh be against you, as it was against your fathers.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t ji̍t, Iô-sé-huh ji̍p-khì tshù lāi pān i ê tāi-tsì, hit sî bô tsi̍t-ê lâng tī-.leh.
English: About this time, he went into the house to do his work, and there were none of the men of the house inside.

Tailo: El-ná-than, Te-la-iah kah Ge-má-liah, kiû ông m̄-thang sio hit pún tsheh, tsóng-.sī, i m̄-thiaⁿ.
English: Moreover Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the scroll; but he would not hear them.

Tailo: A-sah ê kiáⁿ Iô-sa-huat suà-tsiap i tsò ông, ka-kī kiông-sīng, tí-ti̍k I-su-la-el.
English: Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place, and strengthened himself against Israel.

Tailo: Tshiùⁿ kua o-ló I miâ ê îng-kng, īng o-ló ê uē lâi hián-bîng I ê îng-kng.
English: Sing to the glory of his name! Offer glory and praise!

Tailo: Hit kù Beh koh tsi̍t pái Sī tsí-bîng hiah-ê siū tsō ê mi̍h beh siū iô-tāng, beh siū tshian-suá, hō͘ hiah-ê bô siū iô-tāng ê kú-tn̂g lâu lo̍h-.lâi.
English: This phrase, Yet once more, signifies the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that have been made, that those things which are not shaken may remain.

Tailo: Lín tsiah tsē ji̍t lóng bô lī-khui lín ê hiann-tī, it-ti̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t, lín mā ū siú Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè só͘ bīng-līng lín tio̍h siú ê.
English: you have not left your brothers these many days to this day, but have kept the charge of the commandment of Yahweh your God.

Tailo: E-tóm ông kóng, Lí m̄-thang tuì guá tsia king-kuè, bián-tit guá gia̍h to tshut-lâi tí-ti̍k lí.
English: Edom said to him, You shall not pass through me, lest I come out with the sword against you.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông Ba-siah khí-lâi kong-kik Iô-tah, khí La̍h-má siâⁿ, beh tsó͘-tòng lâng tī Iô-tah ông A-sah hia tshut-ji̍p.
English: Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not allow anyone to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.

Tailo: Siâⁿ ū tuā koh kuân ê tshiûⁿ, siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ū tsa̍p-jī-ê mn̂g, tsiah-ê mn̂g ū tsa̍p-jī-ê thiⁿ-sài teh kò͘-siú; muí tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ mn̂g kok khik I-su-la-el kiáⁿ-sun tsa̍p-jī tsi-tso̍k ê miâ.
English: having a great and high wall; having twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels; and names written on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the children of Israel.

Tailo: nā bô, guān hué tuì A-mí-me-li̍k tshut, sio Sī-khiàm lâng kah Mi-lō͘ ê ke, koh guān hué tuì Sī-khiàm lâng kah Mi-lō͘ ê ke tshut, sio A-mí-me-li̍k.
English: but if not, let fire come out from Abimelech, and devour the men of Shechem, and the house of Millo; and let fire come out from the men of Shechem, and from the house of Millo, and devour Abimelech.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Uī-tio̍h E-tóm huān tsuē kàu tē-saⁿ pái, mā kàu tē-sì pái, guá bô beh bián-tû tuì i ê hîng-hua̍t; in-uī i gia̍h to jiok i ê hiann-tī, lóng bô liân-bín, i ê siū-khì bíng-lia̍t, huat-tshut-lâi tsiū bô suah, íng-uán khǹg siū-khì.
English: Thus says Yahweh: For three transgressions of Edom, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; Because he pursued his brother with the sword, And cast off all pity, And his anger raged continually, And he kept his wrath forever;

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guá ê îng-iāu, guá mā ū hō͘ in, thang hō͘ in tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t thé, tshin-tshiūnn lán sī tsi̍t thé.
English: The glory which you have given me, I have given to them; that they may be one, even as we are one;

Tailo: Taⁿ in-uī lín tsiap-siū guá só͘ kā lín kóng ê tō-lí, lín í-king hō͘ I siu-tsíng hó-sè à.
English: You are already pruned clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.

Tailo: Ông ìn tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Guá kiàn-nā só͘ beh mn̄g lí ê, lóng m̄-thang tuì guá ún-ba̍t. Tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng, Guān guá ê tsú — guá ê ông kóng tshut-.lâi.
English: Then the king answered the woman, Please don't hide anything from me that I shall ask you. The woman said, Let my lord the king now speak.

Tailo: Tuā-tsè-si tsiū khiā khí-.lâi, tī tsìng lâng ê bīn-tsîng mn̄g I-é-su kóng, Tsiah-ê lâng teh kā Lí kò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí ná ē lóng bô ìn?
English: The high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, Have you no answer? What is it which these testify against you?

Tailo: Guá khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê sî, hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah Iô-tá-iah lâng ê tiúⁿ-ló ū kā i khòng-kò, iau-kiû guá kā i tīng tsuē.
English: about whom, when I was at Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me, asking for a sentence against him.

Tailo: Tsè-si tsiū kā Siōng-tsú tiān lāi só͘ khǹg Ta-bi̍t ông ê tshiuⁿ kah pîn-pâi, kau hō͘ hiah-ê liân-tiúⁿ.
English: The priest delivered to the captains over hundreds the spears and shields that had been king David's, which were in the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: I-é-su kā kûn-tsiòng khuànn tsi̍t liàn tsiah tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Hó-gia̍h lâng beh ji̍p Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ tsin khùn-lān!
English: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples, How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

Tailo: I kā guá kóng, Keh-khui ê só͘-tsāi ê thâu-tsîng, tsiah-ê pak pîng ê pâng, lâm pîng ê pâng lóng sī sìng ê pâng; tshin-kīn Siōng-tsú ê tsè-si ē tī hia tsia̍h tsì-sìng ê mi̍h, mā īng tsì-sìng ê mi̍h, to̍h-sī sò͘-tsè, sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè, hē tī hit só͘-tsāi, in-uī tsit só͘-tsāi sī sìng.
English: Then said he to me, The north chambers and the south chambers, which are before the separate place, they are the holy chambers, where the priests who are near to Yahweh shall eat the most holy things: there shall they lay the most holy things, and the meal offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; for the place is holy.

Tailo: Tú-tú hit ji̍t, A-bu-la-hàm tsiàu Siōng-tè só͘ kā i kóng ê, kā i ê kiáⁿ I-si-ma-el kah A-bu-la-hàm tshù lāi it-tshè ê tsa-po͘ lâng, bô-lūn tī tshù lāi seⁿ ê, á-.sī īng i ê gîn bé-.lâi ê lóng kiânn kat-lé.
English: Abraham took Ishmael his son, all who were born in his house, and all who were bought with his money; every male among the men of Abraham's house, and circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the same day, as God had said to him.

Tailo: Pi-bî ê lâng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī khang-hi, tsun-kuì ê lâng mā sī hi-ké; nā kā in hē tī thian-phîng uánn, it-tīng ē phû khí-.lâi; in lóng pí ho͘-khip ê khuì khah khin.
English: Surely men of low degree are just a breath, And men of high degree are a lie. In the balances they will go up. They are together lighter than a breath.

Tailo: Sìn-si̍t tuì tē-.ni̍h huat-sing; kong-gī tuì thiⁿ kàng lo̍h-.lâi.
English: Truth springs out of the earth. Righteousness has looked down from heaven.

Tailo: Bong-tio̍h lâng ê sin-si ê, tsiū ē tshit ji̍t bô tshing-khì.
English: He who touches the dead body of any man shall be unclean seven days:

Tailo: Guá ê tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè ah, guá kám-siā Lí, o-ló Lí, in-uī Lí siúⁿ-sù guá tì-huī kah tsâi-lîng, taⁿ Lí kā guán tuì Lí só͘ kiû ê í-king tsí-sī guá, in-uī Lí ū kā ông ê tāi-tsì tsí-sī guán.
English: I thank you, and praise you, you God of my fathers, who have given me wisdom and might, and have now made known to me what we desired of you; for you have made known to us the king's matter.

Tailo: tit-tio̍h tē ê pó-bu̍t kah kî-tiong só͘ tshiong-muá ê, í-ki̍p tiàm tī tshì-phè lāi-.ê ê un-huī. Guān hiah-ê lóng kui tī Iô-sé-huh ê thâu-khak, kui tī hit-ê kah i ê hiann-tī hun-khui ê thâu-khak tíng.
English: For the precious things of the earth and the fullness of it, The good will of him who lived in the bush. Let the blessing come on the head of Joseph, On the crown of the head of him who was separate from his brothers.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kuì-tso̍k tuì Pa-lo-sih kóng, Lí kah I-é-lí-miah tio̍h khì bih-.leh, m̄-thang hō͘ lâng tsai lín tī tó-uī.
English: Then said the princes to Baruch, Go, hide you, you and Jeremiah; and let no man know where you are.

Tailo: Bô-oh-tsuh kóng, Lí tuì Na-o-mih ê tshiú bé hit hūn hn̂g ê ji̍t, mā tio̍h tshuā sí-lâng ê bo͘ — Mô͘-ap ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Lù-thuh, thang lâi kiàn-li̍p sí-lâng ê miâ tī i ê sán-gia̍p.
English: Then said Boaz, What day you buy the field of the hand of Naomi, you must buy it also of Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of the dead, to raise up the name of the dead on his inheritance.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsáu bûn-su ê hōng ông ê bīng-līng tsin pik-tshiat, khiâ kok lāi kong-sū só͘ īng ê khuài bé, kuáⁿ-kín tshut-huat, tsit-ê tsiàu mā pan-hîng tī Su-san kiong.
English: So the posts who rode on swift steeds that were used in the king's service went out, being hurried and pressed on by the king's commandment; and the decree was given out in Shushan the palace.

Tailo: Tī kong-gī ê lō͘ ū ua̍h-miā; i ê tō-lō͘ pīng bô sí-bông.
English: In the way of righteousness is life; In its path there is no death.

Tailo: I lâi thiaⁿ Páu-lô káng tō-lí, Páu-lô lia̍h i kim-kim khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ū sìn-sim thang tit-tio̍h hó,
English: He was listening to Paul speaking, who, fastening eyes on him, and seeing that he had faith to be made whole,

Tailo: Thang pò-ìng guā-pang, hîng-hua̍t lia̍t kok.
English: To execute vengeance on the nations, And punishments on the peoples;

Tailo: I ê tuā-tsé tī hn̄g-hn̄g khiā-teh khuàⁿ, ài beh tsai i ē tú-tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ.
English: His sister stood far off, to see what would be done to him.

Tailo: Koh kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí jīn, khuànn tsit-ê ìn, tuà kah kuái-á sī siáⁿ lâng ê. Iô-tah jīn tshut-.lâi, tsiū kóng, I pí guá khah ū lí, in-uī guá bô kā i kè hō͘ guá ê kiáⁿ Se-la̍h. Τuì hit sî khí, Iô-tah bô koh tshin-kīn i.
English: Judah acknowledged them, and said, She is more righteous than I, because I didn't give her to Shelah, my son. He knew her again no more.

Tailo: Guân-kò kah i tsing-lūn ê tsí-put-kò sī in ka-kī ê tsong-kàu būn-tê, í-ki̍p tsi̍t-ê kiò-tsò I-é-su ê lâng ê tāi-tsì; I í-king sí, Páu-lô kóng I iáu ua̍h-.leh.
English: but had certain questions against him about their own religion, and about one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsit piàn guá beh khì Su-pa-niah ê sî, ǹg-bāng ē sūn lō͘ tuì lín hia khì, sing kah lín ū kuí-ji̍t-á ê kau-puê liáu-āu, tsiah hō͘ lín huan-sàng khì Su-pa-niah.
English: whenever I journey to Spain, I will come to you. For I hope to see you on my journey, and to be helped on my way there by you, if first I may enjoy your company for a while.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí kì-jiân lo̍h tī tshù-piⁿ ê tshiú tiong, taⁿ tio̍h án-ne kiânn, lâi kiù ka-kī. Lí tio̍h khiam-pi khì khún-kiû lí ê tshù-piⁿ.
English: Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself, Seeing you have come into the hand of your neighbor. Go, humble yourself. Press your plea with your neighbor.

Tailo: Guán nā tú-tio̍h huān-lān, sī beh hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h an-uì kah tsín-kiù; guán nā tit-tio̍h an-uì, mā sī beh hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h an-uì, thang ū khuì-la̍t lâi jím-siū kah guán kāng-khuán ê khó͘-lān.
English: But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer.

Tailo: Guán bô tshin-tshiūnn Mô͘-se tio̍h īng phè tà ka-kī ê bīn, hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng bē tit thang tsù-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h i bīn ê îng-kng tsiām-tsiām siau-sit.
English: and not as Moses, who put a veil on his face, that the children of Israel wouldn't look steadfastly on the end of that which was passing away.

Tailo: Lí kám ē huat-tshut sih-nà, in tsiū khì, koh tuì lí kóng: Guán tī tsia.
English: Can you send forth lightnings, that they may go? Do they report to you, Here we are?'

Tailo: lí khuàⁿ, só͘-í, Guá beh tshuā guā-pang lâng, to̍h-sī lia̍t kok tiong kiông-pō ê lâng lâi lí tsia; in ē pue̍h to kong-kik lí tuì tì-huī só͘ tit-tio̍h ê hó mi̍h, kā lí ê îng-kng uè lah-sap.
English: therefore, behold, I will bring strangers on you, the terrible of the nations; and they shall draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom, and they shall defile your brightness.

Tailo: Sàu-lô ê kiáⁿ ū nn̄g-ê tuī-tiúⁿ, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò Ba-nah, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò Le-kap, sī Biān-iá-mín tsi-tso̍k, Be-lot lâng Lim-móng ê kiáⁿ, in-uī Be-lot mā sio̍k tī Biān-iá-mín.
English: Ishbosheth, Saul's son, had two men who were captains of bands: the name of the one was Baanah, and the name of the other Rechab, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, of the children of Benjamin ( for Beeroth also is reckoned to Benjamin:

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng phìng-tiāⁿ bó͘ iáu-buē tshuā i? I mā thang tńg-khì in tau, khióng-kiaⁿ i ē tīn-bông suah hō͘ pa̍t lâng tshuā i.
English: What man is there who has pledged to be married a wife, and has not taken her? let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man take her.

Tailo: Guá tī khè-bīn tshiam-miâ, kā khè-iok su hong ba̍t, koh tshiánn lâng lâi tsò tsìng-jîn, mā īng thian-phîng tshìn gîn hō͘ i.
English: I subscribed the deed, and sealed it, and called witnesses, and weighed him the money in the balances.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tī hia tsin tshuì-ta, ài lim tsuí, tsiū tuì Mô͘-se ai-uàn kóng, Lí ná ē tshuā guán tuì Ai-gi̍p tshut-.lâi, hō͘ guán kah guán ê kiáⁿ-jî, í-ki̍p guán ê tsing-seⁿ lóng tshuì-ta kah kiōng-beh sí-.khì?
English: The people were thirsty for water there; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Why have you brought us up out of Egypt, to kill us, our children, and our livestock with thirst?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tse mā sik-iōng tī lín ta̍k lâng. Tiōng-hu tio̍h thiàⁿ i ê hū-jîn-lâng tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī; hū-jîn-lâng mā tio̍h kìng-uì i ê tiōng-hu.
English: Nevertheless each of you must also love his own wife even as himself; and let the wife see that she respects her husband.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Siōng-tsú ē pó-hō͘ tuà tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê jîn-bîn. In tiong-kan nńg-tsiáⁿ ê, tī hit ji̍t ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Ta-bi̍t; Ta-bi̍t ê ke ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Siōng-tè, tshin-tshiūnn tī in thâu-tsîng ê Siōng-tsú ê sù-tsiá.
English: In that day Yahweh will defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem. He who is feeble among them at that day will be like David, and the house of David will be like God, like the angel of Yahweh before them.

Tailo: Tshiúⁿ Siōng-tsú sìng-tiān ê pó-bu̍t kah ông-kiong ê pó-bu̍t, lóng tuà tsáu-.khì, koh tshiúⁿ Só͘-lô-móng só͘ tsò hiah-ê kim ê pîn-pâi.
English: and he took away the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the king's house; he even took away all: and he took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made.

Tailo: Mô͘-se huan-hù jîn-bîn kóng, Lí tio̍h tuì lín tiong-kan tsún-pī lâng, tuà ke-si tshut-khì kong-kik Mí-tiân, thang tī Mí-tiân lâng ê sin tsiūⁿ uī Siōng-tsú pò-siû.
English: Moses spoke to the people, saying, Arm you men from among you for the war, that they may go against Midian, to execute Yahweh's vengeance on Midian.

Tailo: E-hu-laim sī khuài tsiūⁿ-kà ê bó ê gû-á, ài ta̍h ngó͘-kok ê, Guá īng gû-taⁿ khuà tī i puî koh suí ê ām-kún, Guá beh hō͘ E-hu-laim thua tshia. Iô-tah beh lê-tshân, Iâ-kop beh kā tshân-thô͘ pê sang.
English: Ephraim is a trained heifer that loves to thresh; So I will put a yoke on her beautiful neck. I will set a rider on Ephraim. Judah will plow. Jacob will break his clods.

Tailo: Hô tsuí só͘ kàu ê só͘-tsāi, ta̍k tsióng seⁿ-thuàⁿ ê tōng-bu̍t lóng ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā, mā ē ū hî tsin tsē, in-uī tsuí lâu-kàu hia, hái-.ni̍h ê tsuí piàn hó. Hit-ê hô só͘ lâu-kàu ê só͘-tsāi, só͘-ū ê mi̍h lóng ē tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā.
English: It shall happen, that every living creature which swarms, in every place where the rivers come, shall live; and there shall be a very great multitude of fish; for these waters are come there, and the waters of the sea shall be healed, and everything shall live wherever the river comes.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hiah-ê sió-táⁿ ê, m̄-sìn ê, khó-ò͘ⁿ ê, thâi lâng ê, îm-luān ê, kiâⁿ siâ-su̍t-ê, pài ngó͘-siōng ê kah só͘-ū kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t ê lâng, in tsù tiāⁿ-tio̍h khì ê só͘-tsāi sī hit-ê ū hué kah liû-hông teh sio ê ô͘; tsit-ê to̍h-sī tē-jī pái ê sí.
English: But for the cowardly, unbelieving, sinners, abominable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars, their part is in the lake that burns with fire and sulfur, which is the second death.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá beh khí-.lâi, tī siâⁿ lāi sì-kè kiânn, tī ke-lō͘, tī khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi, guá beh tshuē guá sim só͘ ài ê; guá tshuē i mā tshuē bē-tio̍h.
English: I will get up now, and go about the city; In the streets and in the squares I will seek him whom my soul loves. I sought him, but I didn't find him.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Só͘-lô-móng kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, A-to-nî-iah kiaⁿ Só͘-lô-móng ông, in-uī i khîⁿ-tiâu tsè-tuâⁿ ê kak, kóng, ' Guān Só͘-lô-móng ông kin-á-ji̍t tuì guá tsiù-tsuā, it-tīng bô īng to thâi-sí i ê lô͘-po̍k. '
English: It was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah fears king Solomon; for, behold, he has laid hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear to me first that he will not kill his servant with the sword.

Tailo: In īng nâ-sik ê iù-tuà, kā pó͘-kuà ê khuân kah tsè-si ho̍k ê khuân pa̍k sio-liân, hō͘ i liân tī tsè-si ho̍k īng kî-khiáu ê kang-hu só͘ tsit ê tuà, hō͘ pó͘-kuà kah tsè-si ho̍k bô lī-phāng, sī tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘-se ê.
English: They bound the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not come loose from the ephod, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Liân-hue hio̍h ê ìm-ńg ka i jia-khàm; khe piⁿ ê liú-tshiū kā i uî-.leh.
English: The lotuses cover him with their shade. The willows of the brook surround him.

Tailo: Koh tshuā liân-tiúⁿ kah Ka-lī tso̍k, kah hō͘-uē-ping, í-ki̍p kok lāi tsìng lâng, in tuì Siōng-tsú ê tiān tshuā ông lo̍h-.lâi, tuì hō͘-uē-ping ê mn̂g-lō͘ ji̍p-khì ông-kiong, i tsiū tsē ông-uī.
English: He took the captains over hundreds, and the Carites, and the guard, and all the people of the land; and they brought down the king from the house of Yahweh, and came by the way of the gate of the guard to the king's house. He sat on the throne of the kings.

Tailo: In-uī guá ê sim-sîn tshiong-muá huān-lān; guá ê sèⁿ-miā tsiap-kīn im-hú.
English: For my soul is full of troubles. My life draws near to Sheol.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guán tsiah-ê ū tsit khuán sio̍k-lîng pó-puè ê lâng, tú tshin-tshiūnn thô͘ tsō ê khì-kū, sī beh piáu-sī hit-ê ki̍k tuā ê kuân-lîng sī sio̍k Siōng-tè, m̄-sī sio̍k guán.
English: But we have this treasure in clay vessels, that the exceeding greatness of the power may be of God, and not from ourselves.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá tsai tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò, kàu hông sî-khì kuán-ke ê tsit liáu-āu, hit sî lâng tsiah ē tsiap-la̍p guá ji̍p-khì in tshù. '
English: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.'

Tailo: Ta̍k tsá-khí khiā-teh lâi kám-siā o-ló Siōng-tsú, ta̍k ê-hng mā sī án-ne.
English: and to stand every morning to thank and praise Yahweh, and likewise in the evening;

Tailo: Piat-tò͘ tī tsìng lâng ê bīn-tsîng m̄ sîng-jīn, kóng, Guá m̄-tsai lí teh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: But he denied it before them all, saying, I don't know what you are talking about.

Tailo: Tio̍h uá-khò kian-tīng ê sìn-sim lâi tí-khòng i, in-uī lín tsai tsuân sè-kài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē lóng teh siū kāng-khuán ê khó͘-lān.
English: Withstand him steadfast in your faith, knowing that your brothers who are in the world are undergoing the same sufferings.

Tailo: Koh phah hiah-ê tsing-seⁿ ê tiâu, khan tsin tsē iûⁿ kah lo̍k-tô tńg-khì Ê-lú-sa-lèm.
English: They struck also the tents of livestock, and carried away sheep in abundance, and camels, and returned to Jerusalem.

Tailo: In tsiū lō͘-hiān i ê ē-sin, īng to thâi i, lia̍h i ê kiáⁿ-jî, hō͘ i tī tsa-bó͘ lâng tiong-kan lâu tshàu-miâ, in-uī in tuì i kiânn sím-phuàⁿ.
English: These uncovered her nakedness; they took her sons and her daughters; and her they killed with the sword: and she became a byword among women; for they executed judgments on her.

Tailo: Huān-nā kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng it-tīng ē hō͘ lâng ap-kē; tsū-khiam ê lâng it-tīng ē hō͘ lâng ko-sing.
English: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.

Tailo: In kóng, Siōng-tsú kám kan-taⁿ kah Mô͘-se kóng-uē? Kám mā bô kah guán kóng-uē? Tsit-ê uē Siōng-tsú ū thiaⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: They said, Has Yahweh indeed spoken only with Moses? Hasn't he spoken also with us? Yahweh heard it.

Tailo: Ta̍k gue̍h ê tshe-it, lín tio̍h hiàn sio-tsè hō͘ Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī gû-káng-á nn̄g tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng tsi̍t tsiah, bô khuat-tiám bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á tshit tsiah.
English: In the beginnings of your months you shall offer a burnt offering to Yahweh: two young bulls, and one ram, seven male lambs a year old without blemish;

Tailo: Tāi-ke tsiū tsin iu-būn, tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê mn̄g I-é-su kóng, Tsóng m̄-sī guá ho͘ⁿh?
English: They began to be sorrowful, and to ask him one by one, Surely not I? And another said, Surely not I?

Tailo: Ông kā hit pún, to̍h-sī Pa-lo-sih só͘ siá I-é-lí-miah só͘ thuân ê uē, sio-khì liáu-āu, Siōng-tsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: Then the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah, after that the king had burned the scroll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,

Tailo: I-é-su koh kóng, Guá beh īng siáⁿ-mi̍h lâi pí-phīng Siōng-tè kok-tō͘?
English: Again he said, To what shall I compare the Kingdom of God?

Tailo: In-uī in kiânn phian-tshua̍h bô tuè I, mā lóng bô tì-ì I ê lō͘.
English: Because they turned aside from following him, And wouldn't have regard in any of his ways:

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, taⁿ guá hōng lán ê Tsú I-é-su Ki-tok ê miâ khǹg lín, kóng-uē tio̍h it-tì, m̄-thang ū hun-tsing, tio̍h it-sim it-ì phō kāng-khuán ê bo̍k-phiau lâi thuân-kiat.
English: Now I beg you, brothers, through the name of our Lord, Jesus Christ, that you all speak the same thing and that there be no divisions among you, but that you be perfected together in the same mind and in the same judgment.

Tailo: Le-mu-el, tsò ông lim tsiú sī bô ha̍p-gî; ông-tshin nā kóng, Kāu-tsiú tī tó-uī? , mā sī bô ha̍p-gî.
English: It is not for kings, Lemuel; It is not for kings to drink wine; Nor for princes to say, Where is strong drink?'

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā Mô͘-se kóng, Lí tsò jîn-bîn ê thâu-tsîng kiânn, tshuā I-su-la-el ê kuí-ê tiúⁿ-ló kah lí khì, lí ê tshiú tio̍h gia̍h í-tsîng phah hô tsuí ê kuái-á.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Walk on before the people, and take the elders of Israel with you, and take the rod in your hand with which you struck the Nile, and go.

Tailo: Hit sî, Ba-bú-lông ông Nep-kat-ne-tsal ê jîn-sîn tsiūⁿ-lâi Ê-lú-sa-lèm, uî-khùn hit-ê siâⁿ.
English: At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up to Jerusalem, and the city was besieged.

Tailo: In tuì i kóng, Bô, tsí ū beh kā lí khún-pa̍k lâi kau tī in ê tshiú, guán it-tīng bē hāi-sí lí. Tsiū īng nn̄g tiâu sin ê soh-á kā i khún-pa̍k, tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshuā i tsiūⁿ-.khì.
English: They spoke to him, saying, No; but we will bind you fast, and deliver you into their hand: but surely we will not kill you. They bound him with two new ropes, and brought him up from the rock.

Tailo: A-hap ū tshit-tsa̍p-ê kiáⁿ tī Sa-má-lī-a. E-hú siá phue kià khì Sa-má-lī-a, hō͘ E-tsu-le-el hiah-ê siú-líng, tiúⁿ-ló kah hiah-ê hû-ióng A-hap ê tsìng kiáⁿ ê phue,
English: Now Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. Jehu wrote letters, and sent to Samaria, to the rulers of Jezreel, even the elders, and to those who brought up the sons of Ahab, saying,

Tailo: In tsiū kā So͘-tóm kah Am-mo͘-la̍h ê tsâi-bu̍t, í-ki̍p in ê kan-niûⁿ lóng tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: They took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their food, and went their way.

Tailo: Tse sī Ga̍t lâng tsiàu i ê tsong-tso̍k só͘ tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah tsng-thâu.
English: This is the inheritance of the children of Gad according to their families, the cities and the villages of it.

Tailo: In tsiū siūⁿ beh kā I-é-su lia̍h khí-.lâi, m̄-koh, kiaⁿ kûn-tsiòng huán-tuânn, in-uī kûn-tsiòng kā I-é-su khuàⁿ-tsò sī sian-ti.
English: When they sought to seize him, they feared the multitudes, because they considered him to be a prophet.

Tailo: In tsáu tsin kín, kip-beh thâi lâng;
English: Their feet are swift to shed blood.

Tailo: Guá ū tsun-siú Lí ê kà-sī kah Lí ê lu̍t-lē, in-uī guá it-tshè ê só͘ kiâⁿ lóng tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: I have obeyed your precepts and your testimonies, For all my ways are before you. TAV

Tailo: Tuì I-é-sái ê tshiū thâu ē huat tsi̍t ki íⁿ, tuì i ê kin só͘ seⁿ ê ki ē kiat kué-tsí.
English: A shoot will come out of the stock of Jesse, And a branch out of his roots will bear fruit.

Tailo: Guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h guá ê sim-tn̂g kiáu-ká, uī-tio̍h hit-ê siann, guá ê tshuì-tûn sih-sih tsùn, kut-hâi hiú-nuā; guá tī guá ê só͘-tsāi phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah. Guá tsí ū tiām-tiām thìng-hāu tsai-lān ê ji̍t-tsí kàu, tshim-huān kíng lāi ê jîn-bîn tsiūⁿ-.lâi.
English: I heard, and my body trembled. My lips quivered at the voice. Rottenness enters into my bones, and I tremble in my place, Because I must wait quietly for the day of trouble, For the coming up of the people who invade us.

Tailo: Guá tsi̍t-ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì, tsiū thiah-li̍h guá ê saⁿ kah phâu, tshuah guá ê thâu-mn̂g kah tshuì-tshiu, tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-khì, tsē-.leh.
English: When I heard this thing, I tore my garment and my robe, and plucked off the hair of my head and of my beard, and sat down confounded.

Tailo: Sè-kài kau-hù tī pháiⁿ lâng ê tshiú, I jia-khàm sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ ê bīn; nā m̄-sī I, sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked. He covers the faces of the judges of it. If not he, then who is it?

Tailo: Hit-ê siâⁿ ê tiúⁿ-ló tio̍h khan gû-tsíng-á kàu ū tn̂g-lâu-tsuí ê suaⁿ-kok, bô tsìng bô tsoh ê, tī hit-ê suaⁿ-kok kòng-tn̄g gû-tsíng-á ê ām-kún.
English: and the elders of that city shall bring down the heifer to a valley with running water, which is neither plowed nor sown, and shall break the heifer's neck there in the valley.

Tailo: Iô-tah tsìng lâng siat-li̍p A-tsa-lí-ah suà-tsiap i ê lāu-pē A-má-tsiah tsò ông. Hit sî, i tsiah tsa̍p-la̍k huè.
English: All the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.

Tailo: Lín sîng-tsiap tsit-ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p, tio̍h tsò-hué pêⁿ-pun; in-uī Guá bat gia̍h-khí tshiú lâi ìng-ín, kā tsit-ê tē hō͘ lín ê tsó͘-sian; tsit-ê tē ē kui tī lín lâi tsò lín ê sán-gia̍p.
English: You shall inherit it, one as well as another; for I swore to give it to your fathers: and this land shall fall to you for inheritance.

Tailo: Lí ē tuā tsiú-tsuì, tuā iu-khó͘, lim lín tuā-tsé Sa-má-lī-a ê pue, to̍h-sī hō͘ lâng tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì ê tshiⁿ-tshám ê pue.
English: You shall be filled with drunkenness and sorrow, with the cup of astonishment and desolation, with the cup of your sister Samaria.

Tailo: Guān tsè-tsú īng kè-tì kā i tsing-ho̍k it-tshè só͘-ū ê! Guān tsheⁿ-hūn lâng tshiúⁿ i thua-buâ só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsâi-sán!
English: Let the creditor seize all that he has. Let strangers plunder the fruit of his labor.

Tailo: Tsûn kiâⁿ tsin bān, king-kuè tsin tsē ji̍t tsiah lâi-kàu Ku-ní-toh ê guā-hái. In-uī siū hong tsó͘-tòng, guán tsiū sūn Ku-lé-té tó siám-hong ê hit pîng, kiânn tuì Sa-mó͘-neh kuè-.khì.
English: When we had sailed slowly many days, and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus, the wind not allowing us further, we sailed under the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.

Tailo: Tio̍h thiah-li̍h lín ê sim, m̄-thang thiah-li̍h lín ê saⁿ. Kui-ǹg Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè; in-uī I ū jîn-tsû, liân-bín, bô khuài siū-khì, muá-muá un-huī, koh hō͘-hué I ê tsai-hō.
English: Tear your heart, and not your garments, And turn to Yahweh, your God; For he is gracious and merciful, Slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness, And relents from sending calamity.

Tailo: Tsiáng-kuán Sia-lông tshī gû-kûn ê sī Sia-lông lâng Sit-lái; tsiáng-kuán suaⁿ-kok tshī gû-kûn ê sī At-lái ê kiáⁿ Sia-huat.
English: and over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè put-sî to tī lín tiong-kan teh tsò-kang, hō͘ lín ū ì-guān koh ū khuì-la̍t lâi si̍t-hiān I ê hó tsí-ì.
English: For it is God who works in you both to will and to work, for his good pleasure.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tuì in kóng, Lín ná ē tī An-hioh-ji̍t tsò lu̍t-huat kui-tīng bô ing-kai tsò ê tāi-tsì?
English: But some of the Pharisees said to them, Why do you do that which is not lawful to do on the Sabbath day?

Tailo: M̄-koh, lán nā tī kng-bîng tiong sing-ua̍h, tshin-tshiūnn Siōng-tè tī kng-bîng tiong, lán tsiū hō͘-siong ū thuân-khè kuan-hē, I ê Kiáⁿ I-é-su ê hueh mā ē kè-sio̍k sé-tû lán it-tshè ê tsuē.
English: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus Christ, his Son, cleanses us from all sin.

Tailo: Tng lí kiau-ngō͘ ê ji̍t, lí ê tshuì bô kóng-khí lí ê sió-muē So͘-tóm.
English: For your sister Sodom was not mentioned by your mouth in the day of your pride,

Tailo: I-é-su kah bûn-tô͘ lâi-kàu I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ. In kah tsi̍t-tuā-tīn lâng tshut I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê sî, ū tsi̍t-ê tsheⁿ-mê-.ê khit-tsia̍h, Tí-mái ê kiáⁿ Ba-tí-mái, tsē tī lō͘ piⁿ.
English: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

Tailo: In-uī tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí pōe-iok koh khuànn-khin tsiù-tsuā, Guá beh tsiàu lí só͘ kiânn ê lâi khuán-thāi lí.
English: For thus says the Lord Yahweh: I will also deal with you as you have done, who have despised the oath in breaking the covenant.

Tailo: Án-ne, guá koh-tsài khì lín hia ê sî, hō͘ lín ū koh khah tshiong-hun ê lí-iû, ē-tàng uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘ lâi īng Ki-tok I-é-su tsò lín ê khua-kháu.
English: that your rejoicing may abound in Christ Jesus in me through my presence with you again.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kiò tsi̍t-ê gín-á lâi, hō͘ i khiā tī in tiong-kan.
English: Jesus called a little child to himself, and set him in the midst of them,

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ in tī uî-khùn siū pik-hāi ê tiong-kan, to̍h-sī tuì-ti̍k kah siàu-siūⁿ in ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng pik-hāi in ê sî, ta̍k lâng tsia̍h in ê kiáⁿ ê bah kah tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê bah, í-ki̍p pîng-iú ê bah.
English: I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters; and they shall eat everyone the flesh of his friend, in the siege and in the distress, with which their enemies, and those who seek their life, shall distress them.

Tailo: Iâⁿ-tiúⁿ huan-hù nn̄g-ê liân-tiúⁿ, kóng, Ing àm káu tiám í-tsîng, tio̍h tsún-pī pō͘-ping nn̄g-pah, bé-ping tshit-tsa̍p, gia̍h tshiuⁿ ê ping nn̄g-pah, tshut-huat khì Kai-sa-lī-a.
English: He called to himself two of the centurions, and said, Prepare two hundred soldiers to go as far as Caesarea, with seventy horsemen, and two hundred men armed with spears, at the third hour of the night .

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú tuì I-su-la-el tē án-ne kóng: Tsiong-kio̍k kàu à! Tsit-ê tē-sì-kho͘-uî ê kiat-kio̍k kàu à!
English: You, son of man, thus says the Lord Yahweh to the land of Israel, An end: the end is come on the four corners of the land.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Lí tio̍h huan-hù A-lông ê kiáⁿ-sun tsò tsè-si ê, kóng: Ka-tso̍k tiong nā ū lâng sí, m̄-thang uī-tio̍h i lâi uè lah-sap ka-kī.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them, A priest shall not defile himself for the dead among his people;

Tailo: Hiah-ê tô-tsáu ê khuì-la̍t í-king tsīn-pōng, khiā tī He-si-bóng ìm-ńg ē; tsóng-.sī, hué tuì He-si-bóng tshut-.lâi, hué-iām tuì Si-hông huat-tshut, sio-khì Mô͘-ap ê tsuân-pō͘ pian-kài kah tsok-luān ê lâng thâu-khak tíng bīn.
English: Those who fled stand without strength under the shadow of Heshbon; for a fire is gone forth out of Heshbon, and a flame from the midst of Sihon, and has devoured the corner of Moab, and the crown of the head of the tumultuous ones.

Tailo: I ê tshàn-lān tshin-tshiūnn kng; tuì I ê tshiú ū tshut kng-suàⁿ, tī hia I ê lîng-li̍k khǹg-.leh.
English: His splendor is like the sunrise. Rays shine from his hand, where his power is hidden.

Tailo: Ū sî hō͘ lâng kong-khai bú-jio̍k kah hì-lāng, á-.sī kah pa̍t lâng tâng siū khó͘-lān.
English: partly, being exposed to both reproaches and oppressions; and partly, becoming partakers with those who were treated so.

Tailo: Hit sî, i ê tsìng hiann-tī, tsí-muē kah í-tsîng sio-bat ê lâng lóng lâi kìnn i, tī i ê tshù tsò-hué tsia̍h, uī-tio̍h Siōng-tè só͘ kàng-lo̍h tī i só͘-ū ê tsai-hō, lóng pi-siong lâi kā i an-uì; ta̍k lâng sàng i tsi̍t tè gîn, ta̍k lâng sàng i tsi̍t-ê kim-khuân.
English: Then came there to him all his brothers, and all his sisters, and all those who had been of his acquaintance before, and ate bread with him in his house. They comforted him, and consoled him concerning all the evil that Yahweh had brought on him. Everyone also gave him a piece of money, and everyone a ring of gold.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh koh īng kî-biāu ê tāi-tsì khuán-thāi tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, hit-ê tāi-tsì to̍h-sī kî-biāu koh kî-ī ê. In tì-huī lâng ê tì-huī ē siau-bia̍t, in tshong-bîng lâng ê tshong-bîng ē khàm ba̍t.
English: therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvelous work among this people, even a marvelous work and a wonder; and the wisdom of their wise men will perish, and the understanding of their prudent men will be hidden.

Tailo: Bô beh hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tshut lí teh kìm-tsia̍h, kan-taⁿ hō͘ Thiⁿ-pē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h; án-ne tiām-tiām-á teh kuan-tshat ê Thiⁿ-pē tsiū ē kā lí pò-siúⁿ.
English: so that you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.

Tailo: In ē tsai-iáⁿ Guá sī Siōng-tsú — in ê Siōng-tè, sī tshuā in tshut Ai-gi̍p tē, thang hō͘ Guá tiàm tī in tiong-kan. Guá sī Siōng-tsú — in ê Siōng-tè.
English: They shall know that I am Yahweh their God, who brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I might dwell among them: I am Yahweh their God.

Tailo: Guá ē kā lí hiān-tsāi tshut-guā kià-kha ê tē, to̍h-sī Ka-nân tsuân tē, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsò íng-uán ê sán-gia̍p; Guá mā beh tsò in ê Siōng-tè.
English: I will give to you, and to your seed after you, the land where you are traveling, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession. I will be their God.

Tailo: In-uī tsiah-ê lâng ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá ê îng-kng, í-ki̍p Guá só͘ kiâⁿ tī Ai-gi̍p kah khòng-iá ê sîn-jiah, iáu-koh tshì-thàm Guá tsa̍p pái, m̄ tsun-thàn Guá ê uē,
English: because all those men who have seen my glory, and my signs, which I worked in Egypt and in the wilderness, yet have tempted me these ten times, and have not listened to my voice;

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín ê sim tio̍h uân-tsuân ǹg Siōng-tsú — lán ê Siōng-tè, tsun-thàn I ê lu̍t-lē, siú I ê kài-bīng, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t án-ne.
English: Let your heart therefore be perfect with Yahweh our God, to walk in his statutes, and to keep his commandments, as at this day.

Tailo: Ku̍t hām-kheⁿ ê lâng ka-kī ē pua̍h lo̍h-khì hit lāi-bīn; kō tsio̍h-thâu ê lâng ē hō͘ kō tò tńg-.lâi ê tsio̍h-thâu teh-tio̍h.
English: Whoever digs a pit shall fall into it. Whoever rolls a stone, it will come back on him.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, tio̍h ē kì-tit lín siū-tiàu ê sî, tsiàu sè-kan it-puaⁿ ê phiau-tsún, lín bô kuí-ê lâng ū tì-huī, bô kuí-ê lâng ū lîng-li̍k, bô kuí-ê lâng sio̍k siōng-liû kai-kip.
English: For you see your calling, brothers, that not many are wise according to the flesh, not many mighty, and not many noble;

Tailo: I-su-la-el ông Io-a-si tī Bia̍t-si-mé-si lia̍h-tio̍h A-ha-tsiah ê sun, Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Iô-tah ông A-má-tsiah, tsiū lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm, thiah-huí Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, tuì E-hu-laim mn̂g kàu kak mn̂g kiōng sì pah tiú,
English: Jehoash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Jehoash the son of Ahaziah, at Beth Shemesh, and came to Jerusalem, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate, four hundred cubits.

Tailo: I bô koh tńg-lâi ka-kī ê tshù, pún só͘-tsāi mā bô koh jīn-tit i.
English: He shall return no more to his house, Neither shall his place know him any more.

Tailo: Tu-lô ông Hi-lâm tshe i ê lô͘-po̍k khì kìⁿ Só͘-lô-móng, in-uī i thiaⁿ-tio̍h lâng īng iû kā i buah lâi suà-tsiap i ê lāu-pē tsò ông; in-uī Hi-lâm pîng-sî thiàⁿ Ta-bi̍t.
English: Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.

Tailo: Thiann-kìnn Siōng-tè ê uē, tit-tio̍h tsai Tsì-kuân-.ê ê tì-sik, khuànn-kìnn tsuân-lîng-ê ê ī-siōng, ba̍k-tsiu thí-khui, tó-.leh ê lâng kóng,
English: He says, who hears the words of God, Knows the knowledge of the Most High, Who sees the vision of the Almighty, Falling down, and having his eyes open:

Tailo: Guá beh īng tuā siū-khì ê tsik-hua̍t, tuì in kiânn tuā ê pò-siû. Guá tuì in pò-siû ê sî, in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: I will execute great vengeance on them with wrathful rebukes; and they shall know that I am Yahweh, when I shall lay my vengeance on them.

Tailo: Lí khì kā in kóng: Lín tsò lín tńg-khì lín ê pò͘-pênn!
English: Go tell them, Return you to your tents.

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Guá beh ùn piáⁿ the̍h hō͘ i, hit-ê lâng to̍h-sī. I tsiū ùn tsi̍t tè piáⁿ, the̍h hō͘ Ka-lio̍k lâng Sí-mòng ê kiáⁿ Iô-tah.
English: Jesus therefore answered, It is he to whom I will give this piece of bread when I have dipped it. So when he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.

Tailo: Hit nn̄g-ê bûn-tô͘ tsiū khì, só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì kó-jiân kah I-é-su só͘ kóng ê uân-tsuân-kāng-khuán.
English: Those who were sent went away, and found things just as he had told them.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t lín tiong-kan ū sio-kò, í-king piáu-sī lín ê tuā sit-tshò. Lín ná ē m̄ lîng-khó hō͘ lâng uan-óng? Ná ē m̄ lîng-khó siū khik-khui?
English: Therefore it is already altogether a defect in you, that you have lawsuits one with another. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be defrauded?

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, I-é-hú-thah khì Am-móng lâng hia kah in kau-tsiàn, Siōng-tsú kā in kau tī i ê tshiú tiong,
English: So Jephthah passed over to the children of Ammon to fight against them; and Yahweh delivered them into his hand.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lín tsiah-ê teh thiaⁿ ê lâng, guá kā lín kóng, tio̍h thiàⁿ lín ê tuì-ti̍k, tio̍h hó khuán-thāi uàn-hūn lín ê lâng.
English: But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you,

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kā guá tshòng-tsō tshing-khì ê sim, hō͘ guá ê lāi-bīn ū uāⁿ sin tsìng-ti̍t ê sim-sîn.
English: Create in me a clean heart, O God. Renew a right spirit within me.

Tailo: I kóng, Guá teh tshuē guá ê a-hiaⁿ, tshiánn kā guá kóng, in tī tó-uī teh tshī iûⁿ?
English: He said, I am looking for my brothers. Tell me, please, where they are feeding the flock.

Tailo: Guá ê khuì tsua̍t à, guá ê ji̍t-tsí kàu tsīn-pōng ā; guá ê hûn-bōng tsún-pī piān-piān ā.
English: My spirit is consumed, my days are extinct, And the grave is ready for me.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, lín í-king kah Ki-tok ê sing-khu kiat-liân kah lu̍t-huat tuān-tsua̍t kuan-hē, bô koh siū i ê sok-pa̍k, só͘-í, lín tsit-má sī kui-sio̍k tī hit uī tuì sí koh-ua̍h ê Ki-tok, I beh hō͘ lán thang uī-tio̍h Siōng-tè kiat hó kué-tsí.
English: Therefore, my brothers, you also were made dead to the law through the body of Christ, that you would be joined to another, to him who was raised from the dead, that we might bring forth fruit to God.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tuà Huâ-láu ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tuì Ta-bi̍t ê siâⁿ lâi-kàu i só͘ kā i khí ê tshù; in-uī kóng, Guá ê bó͘ m̄-thang tuà tī I-su-la-el ông Ta-bi̍t ê tshù, in-uī Siōng-tsú ê kuī só͘ kàu ê só͘-tsāi lóng sī sìng-tē.
English: Solomon brought up the daughter of Pharaoh out of the city of David to the house that he had built for her; for he said, My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, because the places are holy, whereunto the ark of Yahweh has come.

Tailo: I-é-su lī-khui hit só͘-tsāi, lâi-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘-piⁿ, tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tsē tuà hia.
English: Jesus departed there, and came near to the sea of Galilee; and he went up into the mountain, and sat there.

Tailo: I ê siann huat-tshut kàu tī phó͘-thinn-ē, I ê sih-nà kàu tī tē-ki̍k.
English: He sends it forth under the whole sky, And his lightning to the ends of the earth.

Tailo: M̄-thang thiaⁿ Hi-tse-kia ê uē, in-uī A-siul ông án-ne kóng, ' Lín tio̍h kah guá hô-hó, tshut-lâi tâu-hâng, ta̍k lâng tsiū thang tsia̍h ka-kī ê phû-tô tshiū kah bû-hua-kó tshiū ê kué-tsí, lim ka-kī ê tséⁿ-tsuí.
English: Don't listen to Hezekiah: for thus says the king of Assyria, Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and eat you everyone of his vine, and everyone of his fig tree, and everyone drink the waters of his own cistern;

Tailo: Kî-tiong bô lâng ià-siān, bô lâng pua̍h-tó, bô lâng tuh-bîn, bô lâng teh khùn, io-tuà mā bô pàng-sang, ê-tuà mā bô phah-tn̄g.
English: None shall be weary nor stumble among them; None shall slumber nor sleep; Neither shall the belt of their waist be untied, Nor the latchet of their shoes be broken:

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú ê tsû-ài kah I tuì sè-kan lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê kî-sū, guān lâng-lâng lóng o-ló I.
English: Let them praise Yahweh for his loving kindness, For his wonderful works to the children of men!

Tailo: I ka-kī ji̍p-khì khòng-iá, kiânn tsi̍t ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, lâi-kàu tsi̍t tsâng lô-tîng tshiū kha, tsiū tsē tī hia kiû sí, kóng, Taⁿ hó à, Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí tshú guá ê sèⁿ-miā, in-uī guá bô pí guá ê tsó͘-sian khah hó.
English: But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper tree: and he requested for himself that he might die, and said, It is enough; now, O Yahweh, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers.

Tailo: Lí bô ài tsè-mi̍h, nā ài, guá tsiū beh hiàn; sio-tsè Lí mā bô huann-hí.
English: For you don't delight in sacrifice, or else I would give it. You have no pleasure in burnt offering.

Tailo: Lí nā tshing-khì tsìng-ti̍t, I ē uī-tio̍h lí tshénn khí-.lâi, koh hō͘ lí kong-gī ê tshù hing-thong.
English: If you were pure and upright, Surely now he would awaken for you, And make the habitation of your righteousness prosperous.

Tailo: Sìng Sîn lâi ê sî, ē tsí-tsìng sè-kan tuì tsuē, tuì gī, tuì sím-phuàⁿ ê tshò-gō͘ kuan-liām.
English: When he has come, he will convict the world about sin, about righteousness, and about judgment;

Tailo: In-uī ē ū tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm tshut-.lâi, ē ū tô-tsáu ê lâng tuì Si-óng suaⁿ lâi. Siōng-tsú ê jia̍t-sim ē tsiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and out of Mount Zion those who shall escape: the zeal of Yahweh shall perform this.

Tailo: Guá koh kā lín kóng, lo̍k-tô tshng-kuè tsiam-phīⁿ mā pí hó-gia̍h lâng ji̍p thian-kok khah kán-tan.
English: Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: Guá siá tsiah-ê tāi-tsì hō͘ lín, sī teh tsí hiah-ê siūⁿ beh bê-hi̍k lín ê lâng.
English: These things I have written to you concerning those who would lead you astray.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí ē kì-tit tuì-ti̍k ū huí-pòng Lí, gû-gōng ê lâng ū siat-to̍k Lí ê miâ.
English: Remember this, that the enemy has mocked you, Yahweh. Foolish people have blasphemed your name.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè sī ji̍t-thâu, sī tîn-pâi, Siōng-tsú siúⁿ-sù un-huī kah îng-kng. I m̄-bat lâu tsi̍t hāng hó mi̍h bô hō͘ hiah-ê kiânn tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng.
English: For Yahweh God is a sun and a shield. Yahweh will give grace and glory. He withholds no good thing from those who walk blamelessly.

Tailo: Siōng-tè í-king hō͘ Ki-tok ta̍t-kàu uân-tsuân ê kíng-kài, I tsiū tsiâⁿ-tsò só͘-ū sūn-ho̍k I ê lâng íng-uán tsín-kiù ê kin-guân,
English: Having been made perfect, he became to all of those who obey him the author of eternal salvation,

Tailo: io hâ tuà, thâu-khak pau tshái-sik ê kin suê lo̍h-.lâi; khuàⁿ khí-.lâi tshin-tshiūnn kun-tiúⁿ, tsiàu Ba-bú-lông lâng ê hîng-siōng; in ê pún só͘-tsāi to̍h-sī Kal-tí-ah.
English: girded with girdles on their waists, with flowing turbans on their heads, all of them princes to look on, after the likeness of the Babylonians in Chaldea, the land of their birth.

Tailo: Hiah-ê Iô-tá-iah lâng kóng, I kóng, ' Guá beh khì ê só͘-tsāi, lín bē-tàng khì. ', kám kóng I beh khì tsū-sat?
English: The Jews therefore said, Will he kill himself, that he says, Where I am going, you can't come?'

Tailo: Guān pháiⁿ lâng ê pháiⁿ kàu tsia to̍h suah, hō͘ gī lâng khiā tsāi; in-uī kong-gī ê Siōng-tè kàm-tshat lâng ê sim-tn̂g.
English: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, But establish the righteous; Their minds and hearts are searched by the righteous God.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h in-uī án-ne lâi suan-pò͘, tuì Go͘-k kóng, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Tng Guá ê jîn-bîn — I-su-la-el an-jiân sing-ua̍h ê ji̍t, lí kám m̄-tsai?
English: Therefore, son of man, prophesy, and tell Gog, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: In that day when my people Israel dwells securely, shall you not know it?

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, Lí lo̍h tuā hō͘; Lí ê sán-gia̍p — I-su-la-el ià-siān ê sî, Lí hō͘ i kian-kò͘.
English: You, God, sent a plentiful rain. You confirmed your inheritance, when it was weary.

Tailo: Ngó͘-siōng sī sai-hū tsù-tsō, gîn-tshiūⁿ īng kim kā i an, kā i tsù gîn-liān.
English: A workman has cast an image, And the goldsmith overlays it with gold, And casts silver chains for it.

Tailo: I kā hit pún tsheh tī guá ê bīn-tsîng hian-khui, lāi-guā lóng ū siá jī; hit tíng-bīn só͘ siá ê ū ai-siong, thó͘-khuì, tsai-hō ê uē.
English: He spread it before me: and it was written within and without; and there were written therein lamentations, and mourning, and woe.

Tailo: I-é-su kóng, Ū nn̄g-ê lâng khiàm tsè-tsú ê tsînn. Tsi̍t-ê khiàm i gō͘-pah ê gîn-á, tsi̍t-ê khiàm i gō͘-tsa̍p.
English: A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

Tailo: kā Ta-bi̍t kóng, Lí pí guá khah kong-gī, in-uī lí īng hó pò guá, tsóng-.sī, guá īng pháiⁿ pò lí.
English: He said to David, You are more righteous than I; for you have rendered to me good, whereas I have rendered to you evil.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bô tsun-thàn hiah-ê siú-líng kah tiúⁿ-ló só͘ gī-tiāⁿ, saⁿ ji̍t lāi bô lâi ê, tsiū beh tshau i só͘-ū ê sán-gia̍p, beh kā i tuì siū lia̍h tńg-.lâi ê lâng ê huē kik tshut-.khì.
English: and that whoever didn't come within three days, according to the counsel of the princes and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and himself separated from the assembly of the captivity.

Tailo: Huat-tshut kng ê sua ē piàn-tsò tsuí-tî; ta-sò ê tē ē piàn-tsò tsuí-tsuâⁿ. Tī suann-káu tó teh khùn ê só͘-tsāi, ē ū tsheⁿ-tsháu, lô͘-uí kah pô͘-tsháu.
English: The burning sand will become a pool, And the thirsty ground springs of water. Grass with reeds and rushes will be in the habitation of jackals, where they lay.

Tailo: Kā Ia-lô-ba-am kóng, Lí thang the̍h tsa̍p tè, in-uī Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tuì Só͘-lô-móng ê tshiú thiah-li̍h i ê kok, kā tsa̍p tsi-tso̍k hō͘ lí. '
English: He said to Jeroboam, Take ten pieces; for thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, Behold, I will tear the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to you

Tailo: I-é-su ìn kóng, Jîn-tsú tit-tio̍h îng-kng ê sî kàu à.
English: Jesus answered them, The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ kā mn̂g-lî tsò gō͘ ki thiāu, īng kim lâi pau, thiāu ê kau tio̍h kim ê, koh tio̍h kā thiāu tsù gō͘-ê tâng-khū.
English: You shall make for the screen five pillars of acacia, and overlay them with gold: their hooks shall be of gold: and you shall cast five sockets of brass for them.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, i tsiū tsiú-kuáⁿ. Kàu-taⁿ í-king peh-tsa̍p-sì huè, lóng bô lī-khui sìng-tiān, mê-ji̍t kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, ho̍k-sāi Siōng-tè.
English: and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years ) , who didn't depart from the temple, worshipping with fastings and petitions night and day.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k sī-uē-tiúⁿ lâu siōng sàn-tshiah ê, hō͘ in tī-lí phû-tô hn̂g kah tsìng-tsoh.
English: But the captain of the guard left of the poorest of the land to work the vineyards and fields.

Tailo: Hū-jîn lâng ìn kóng, Guá bô ang. I-é-su kā i kóng, Lí kóng bô ang, bô m̄-tio̍h.
English: The woman answered, I have no husband. Jesus said to her, You said well, I have no husband,'

Tailo: Gô-pa-lō͘, A-bi-ma-el, Sí-bah,
English: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

Tailo: Si-tòng, lí tio̍h kiàn-siàu, in-uī tuā hái kóng, to̍h-sī hái-huāⁿ ê siâⁿ-pó kóng, Guá bô huâi-īn, mā bô seⁿ kiáⁿ; bô iúⁿ-tshī tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ, mā bô hû-ióng tsāi-sik-lí.
English: Be ashamed, Sidon; for the sea has spoken, the stronghold of the sea, saying, I have not travailed, nor brought forth, neither have I nourished young men, nor brought up virgins.

Tailo: Ū tsin tsē lâng kah I-é-su tsò-tīn kiânn. I-é-su ua̍t kuè-lâi tuì in kóng,
English: Now great multitudes were going with him. He turned and said to them,

Tailo: Tshuā sin-niû ê sī sin-lông, sin-lông ê pîng-iú khiā tī piⁿ-á thiaⁿ-tio̍h sin-lông ê siann tsiū hui-siông huann-hí, só͘-í, guá muá-sim tuā huann-hí.
English: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom's voice. This, my joy, therefore is made full.

Tailo: Guá li̍p-tsì beh khì iáu m̄-bat thiaⁿ-tio̍h Ki-tok ê miâ ê só͘-tsāi thuân hok-im, tsiah bē kah pa̍t lâng ê kang-tsok tiông-hok.
English: yes, making it my aim to preach the Good News, not where Christ was already named, that I might not build on another's foundation.

Tailo: Lí nā hong-piān, m̄-thang tuì lí ê tshù-piⁿ kóng, Tshiánn tńg-.khì, bîn-á-tsài koh lâi, guá tsiah hō͘ lí.
English: Don't say to your neighbor, Go, and come again, Tomorrow I will give it to you, When you have it by you.

Tailo: Bān-kok, lín tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú! Βān-bîn, lín tio̍h o-ló I!
English: Praise Yahweh, all you nations! Extol him, all you peoples!

Tailo: A-lông ê kiáⁿ-sun tsò tsè-si ê, tio̍h pûn hiah-ê kó͘-tshue. Tse beh tsò lín tāi-tāi íng-uán ê lē.
English: The sons of Aaron, the priests, shall blow the trumpets; and they shall be to you for a statute forever throughout your generations.

Tailo: In hiám-hiám-á kā guá tuì sè-kan tû-bia̍t, tsóng-.sī, guá bô pàng-sak Lí ê kà-sī.
English: They had almost wiped me from the earth, But I didn't forsake your precepts.

Tailo: Guá beh tī I-su-la-el tshin-tshiūnn lō͘-tsuí; i ē khui hue tshin-tshiūnn pik-ha̍p hue, i ē tshun kin tshin-tshiūnn Le-ba-nòng.
English: I will be like the dew to Israel. He will blossom like the lily, And send down his roots like Lebanon.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú sī guá ê suaⁿ-giâm, guá ê iâⁿ-tsē, tsín-kiù guá ê.
English: and he said, Yahweh is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer, even mine;

Tailo: Tsú-lâng kā in kóng, ' Tse sī tuì-ti̍k só͘ tsò ê. ' Kang-lâng tsiū kóng, ' Án-ne lí ài guán lâi-khì kā hiah-ê phê-á khau tiāu bô? '
English: He said to them, An enemy has done this.' The servants asked him, Do you want us to go and gather them up?'

Tailo: Lâng kám thang uī ka-kī tsō sîn-bîng? In si̍t-tsāi m̄-sī tsin-sîn.
English: Shall a man make to himself gods, which yet are no gods?

Tailo: Se-bah kah Tsal-mú-nah kóng, Lí ka-kī khí-lâi thâi guán, in-uī lâng án-tsuáⁿ, khuì-la̍t mā sī án-ne. Gî-tióng tsiū khí-lâi thâi-sí Se-bah kah Tsal-mú-nah, tshú in lo̍k-tô ām-kún ê táⁿ-pān, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn gue̍h-bâi.
English: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, Rise you, and fall on us; for as the man is, so is his strength. Gideon arose, and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and took the crescents that were on their camels' necks.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì tsiah-ê jîn-bîn án-ne kóng, In ài hòng-tōng, bô iok-sok in ê kha, só͘-í, Siōng-tsú m̄ tsiap-la̍p in. Taⁿ Guá beh ē kì-tit in ê tsuē-kò, lâi pān in ê tsuē-ok.
English: Thus says Yahweh to this people, Even so have they loved to wander; they have not refrained their feet: therefore Yahweh does not accept them; now he will remember their iniquity, and visit their sins.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā thâi-sí-lâng, hit-ê hiong-huān tio̍h tsiàu kuí-nā-ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn ê uē lâi hō͘ i sí; nā tsí ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tsò kiàn-tsìng, tsiū m̄-thang hō͘ lâng sí.
English: Whoever kills any person, the murderer shall be slain at the mouth of witnesses: but one witness shall not testify against any person that he die.

Tailo: Koh tháu-pàng hiah-ê in-uī tuì sí-bông kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, suah it-sing teh tsò sí-bông lô͘-lē ê lâng.
English: and might deliver all of them who through fear of death were all their lifetime subject to bondage.

Tailo: Tsin-lí ê Sìng Sîn lâi ê sî, I ē tshuā lín liáu-kái it-tshè ê tsin-lí. I m̄-sī tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù lâi kóng, sī kā I só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâi kóng, mā ē kā bī-lâi ê tāi-tsì pò lín tsai.
English: However when he, the Spirit of truth, has come, he will guide you into all truth, for he will not speak from himself; but whatever he hears, he will speak. He will declare to you things that are coming.

Tailo: Só͘-ū ê hiann-tī tsí-muē lóng kā lín tshíng-an. Lín tio̍h īng sìng-kiat ê lé-gî lâi hō͘-siong tshíng-an.
English: All the brothers greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

Tailo: Kiù guá ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kiù guá thuat-lī thâi lâng ê tsuē; guá ê tsi̍h beh tuā-siaⁿ gîm-si o-ló Lí ê gī.
English: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, the God of my salvation. My tongue shall sing aloud of your righteousness.

Tailo: Tī tsia teh kóng ê Tsú Tsiū-sī Sìng Sîn. Ū Tsú ê Sìng Sîn ê só͘-tsāi tsiū ū tsū-iû.
English: Now the Lord is the Spirit and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.

Tailo: Mā hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tse sī tī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè kah i ê sò͘-tsè kah i ê kuàn-tiān í-guā.
English: and one male goat for a sin offering; besides the continual burnt offering, and the meal offering of it, and their drink offerings.

Tailo: Ba-siáng suaⁿ sī Siōng-tè ê suaⁿ; Ba-siáng suaⁿ sī ū tsin tsē suaⁿ-niá ê suaⁿ.
English: The mountains of Bashan are majestic mountains. The mountains of Bashan are rugged.

Tailo: In-uī Tsú bat án-ne bīng-līng guán, kóng, guá í-king siat-li̍p lí tsò guā-pang ê kng, hō͘ lí kā guá ê tsín-kiù tuà khì-kàu thiⁿ-piⁿ hái-kak. ( tsù, ISI 49:6 )
English: For so has the Lord commanded us, saying, I have set you as a light for the Gentiles, That you should bring salvation to the uttermost parts of the earth.'

Tailo: Kàu tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-it, kiàn-nā tshuā guā-pang ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ ê tsiah uân-sîng hit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: They made an end with all the men who had married foreign women by the first day of the first month.

Tailo: Í-āu tī I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn tiong-kan, it-tīng bô koh ū hi-ké ê ī-siōng kah sūn jîn-ì ê pok-kuà.
English: For there shall be no more any false vision nor flattering divination within the house of Israel.

Tailo: Sàu-lô tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ I-é-sái, kóng, Tshe lí ê kiáⁿ Ta-bi̍t, to̍h-sī hit-ê tshī iûⁿ ê, lâi guá tsia.
English: Therefore Saul sent messengers to Jesse, and said, Send me David your son, who is with the sheep.

Tailo: In lī-khui Huâ-láu tshut-.lâi, tú-tio̍h Mô͘-se kah A-lông khiā tī in ê thâu-tsîng, tsiū tuì in kóng,
English: They met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh:

Tailo: M̄-koh, ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng kò͘-tsi̍p m̄-sìn, tī kûn-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng siat-to̍k Tsú ê tō-lō͘. Páu-lô tsiū tshuā bûn-tô͘ lī-khui in, ta̍k ji̍t tī Tu-la̍h-nô͘ ê káng-tn̂g kah lâng piān-lūn.
English: But when some were hardened and disobedient, speaking evil of the Way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.

Tailo: An khuân ê só͘-tsāi uá-kīn huâiⁿ-niû, thang tshng kǹg lâi kng toh.
English: The rings were close by the border, the places for the poles to carry the table.

Tailo: Tong-sî iáu-buē ū uī Siōng-tsú ê miâ khí tiān, só͘-í, jîn-bîn iû-guân tī suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ hiàn tsè.
English: Only the people sacrificed in the high places, because there was no house built for the name of Yahweh until those days.

Tailo: In kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú, I tsiū īng o͘-àm hē tī lín kah Ai-gi̍p lâng ê tiong-kan, koh hō͘ hái lâi kā in im-sí. Lín lóng ū tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá tī Ai-gi̍p só͘ kiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì. Lín tuà tī khòng-iá tsin tsē ji̍t.
English: When they cried out to Yahweh, he put darkness between you and the Egyptians, and brought the sea on them, and covered them; and your eyes saw what I did in Egypt: and you lived in the wilderness many days.

Tailo: Ông ê bīng-līng kah tsiàu-su í-king suan-pò͘, tsiū tsū-tsi̍p tsin tsē lú-tsú tī Su-san ê ông-kiong, kau tī thài-kàm He-gái ê tshiú. Hit sî, Ê-su-tel mā hông sàng ji̍p-khì ông-kiong, kau hō͘ kuán lú-tsú ê He-gái ê tshiú.
English: So it happened, when the king's commandment and his decree was heard, and when many maidens were gathered together to Shushan the palace, to the custody of Hegai, that Esther was taken into the king's house, to the custody of Hegai, keeper of the women.

Tailo: Kun-kuaⁿ uá-khì lia̍h Páu-lô, bīng-līng īng nn̄g tiâu thih-liān-á kā i liān khí-.lâi, koh mn̄g i sī siáⁿ lâng, ū tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì.
English: Then the commanding officer came near, arrested him, commanded him to be bound with two chains, and inquired who he was and what he had done.

Tailo: Tô-tsáu ê lâng iáu-buē kàu, tsîng tsi̍t ji̍t ê ê-hng, Siōng-tsú ê tshiú hē tī guá ê sin tsiūⁿ, khui guá ê tshuì. Kàu keh kang tsá-khí, hit-ê lâng lâi-kàu guá tsia, guá ê tshuì tsiū khui, bô koh é-káu.
English: Now the hand of Yahweh had been on me in the evening, before he who was escaped came; and he had opened my mouth, until he came to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more mute.

Tailo: Tshit-tsa̍p nî āu, Siōng-tsú ē tsiàu-kò͘ Tu-lô, i tsiū ē koh thàn tsîⁿ kah sè-tsiūⁿ ê bān-kok kau-kuan.
English: It will happen after the end of seventy years that Yahweh will visit Tyre, and she shall return to her wages, and will play the prostitute with all the kingdoms of the world on the surface of the earth.

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng só͘ tit-tio̍h ê hit tsi̍t-puàⁿ, to̍h-sī Mô͘-se tuì kau-tsiàn ê lâng pun lâi hō͘ in ê.
English: Of the children of Israel's half, which Moses divided off from the men who warred

Tailo: Suah lâi uî-puē khí-thâu ê sè-guān, tì-sú ka-kī siū tīng tsuē.
English: having condemnation, because they have rejected their first pledge.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Guá mā beh kiâⁿ Guá ê tuā siū-khì, Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu bô beh thiàⁿ-sioh in, Guá mā bô beh khó-liân in; in suî-jiân ǹg Guá ê hīⁿ-khang tiong tuā-siaⁿ kiû-kiò, Guá iû-guân m̄-thiaⁿ.
English: Therefore will I also deal in wrath; my eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity; and though they cry in my ears with a loud voice, yet will I not hear them.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē phah Ai-gi̍p, iân-lō͘ phah iân-lō͘ i-tī, in ē tsiū án-ne kui-ǹg Siōng-tsú. I ē thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó, lâi kā in i-tī.
English: Yahweh will strike Egypt, striking and healing. They will return to Yahweh, and he will be entreated by them, and will heal them.

Tailo: īⁿ sì-kho͘-uî ê thiāu kah i ê tsō; só͘ tìng ê ting kah soh-á, í-ki̍p it-tshè só͘ īng ê khì-kū. In tam-tng só͘ kng ê khì-kū, lín tio̍h tsiàu miâ kā in tiāⁿ-tio̍h.
English: and the pillars of the court around it, and their sockets, and their pins, and their cords, with all their instruments, and with all their service: and by name you shall appoint the instruments of the charge of their burden.

Tailo: Lē-bī lâng kā Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī kah i piⁿ-á té kim ê pó-bu̍t ê siuⁿ the̍h lo̍h-.lâi, hē tī hit tè tuā tsio̍h-puâⁿ ê tíng-bīn. Bia̍t-si-mé-si lâng tī hit ji̍t, hiàn sio-tsè kah tsè-sū hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: The Levites took down the ark of Yahweh, and the coffer that was with it, in which the jewels of gold were, and put them on the great stone: and the men of Beth Shemesh offered burnt offerings and sacrificed sacrifices the same day to Yahweh.

Tailo: In-uī Ta-bi̍t tû-bia̍t Hiat lâng U-lī-a hit kiāⁿ tāi-tsì í-guā, lóng sī kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê, it-sing bô uî-puē Siōng-tsú só͘ bīng-līng i ê.
English: because David did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, and didn't turn aside from anything that he commanded him all the days of his life, except only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê thiⁿ, lín tio̍h in-uī tsit-ê lâi tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, hui-siông kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, hui-siông líng-tsīng. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Be astonished, you heavens, at this, and be horribly afraid, be you very desolate, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Í-tsîng guá kià hit-tiuⁿ phue hō͘ lín, ū kā lín kíng-kài m̄-thang kah îm-luān ê lâng lâi-óng.
English: I wrote to you in my letter to have no company with sexual sinners;

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng ông tī Sí-bah lú-ông só͘ tuà-lâi sàng ông ê í-guā, koh tsiàu i it-tshè só͘ ài só͘ kiû ê lóng hō͘ i. Tsiū án-ne, lú-ông kah i ê jîn-sîn tò tńg-khì i ê pún-kok.
English: King Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, besides that which she had brought to the king. So she turned, and went to her own land, she and her servants.

Tailo: I ê tiōng-hu nā thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, mā tī thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê ji̍t tiām-tiām bô tshap i, i só͘ hē tsiah-ê guān tsiū it-tīng sîng-li̍p; i ka-kī iok-sok ê iok, mā it-tīng sîng-li̍p.
English: and her husband hear it, and hold his peace at her in the day that he hears it; then her vows shall stand, and her bonds with which she has bound her soul shall stand.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kā Ga̍t kóng, Guá tsin uî-lân, lán lîng-khó hām-lo̍h tī Siōng-tsú ê tshiú, in-uī I ū hong-sīng ê liân-bín, guá m̄-guān hām-lo̍h tī lâng ê tshiú.
English: David said to Gad, I am in a great strait: let us fall now into the hand of Yahweh; for his mercies are great; and let me not fall into the hand of man.

Tailo: I uī-tio̍h ko͘-jî kah kuáⁿ-hū phuàⁿ-tuàn, koh thiàⁿ tshut-guā lâng, hō͘ i tsia̍h-tshīng.
English: He does execute justice for the fatherless and widow, and loves the foreigner, in giving him food and clothing.

Tailo: Biān-iá-mín lâng tsū-tsi̍p tuè Ap-nel tsò tsi̍t tīn, khiā tī suaⁿ tíng.
English: The children of Benjamin gathered themselves together after Abner, and became one band, and stood on the top of a hill.

Tailo: Lí mā tio̍h huan-hù lán ka-kī ê lâng, tio̍h ha̍k-si̍p tsò hó sū, lâi kiong-kip hiah-ê si̍t-tsāi ū su-iàu ê lâng, tsiah bián-tit bô kiat kué-tsí.
English: Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.

Tailo: Guá tsò tsheⁿ-mê lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu, tsò pái-kha lâng ê kha.
English: I was eyes to the blind, And feet to the lame.

Tailo: I ka-kī khiam-pi teh kuan-khuàⁿ thinn-tíng kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: Who stoops down to see in heaven and in the earth?

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — guán ê Siōng-tè ah, Lí í-guā, bat ū pa̍t-ê tsú kā guán kuán-hat; tsóng-.sī, guán beh to̍k-to̍k uá-khò Lí, kì-liām Lí ê miâ.
English: Yahweh our God, other lords besides you have had dominion over us, but by you only will we make mention of your name.

Tailo: In tsiū thâi tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, kā Iô-sé-huh hit niá saⁿ ùn hueh,
English: They took Joseph's coat, and killed a male goat, and dipped the coat in the blood.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kā khuê-tshiú ê kóng, Lâi khiā tuà tiong-ng.
English: He said to the man who had his hand withered, Stand up.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê Sìng Sîn lîm-kàu I-é-hú-thah, i tsiū king-kuè Gi-lia̍t kah Má-ná-se, koh king-kuè kàu Gi-lia̍t ê Mi-su-peh, koh tuì Gi-lia̍t ê Mi-su-peh king-kuè, lâi-kàu Am-móng lâng hia.
English: Then the Spirit of Yahweh came on Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed over to the children of Ammon.

Tailo: Tsiaⁿ-.gue̍h tē-it pan ê pan-tiúⁿ sī Tsap-ti-el ê kiáⁿ Ia-sio-be-am, i ê pan lāi ū nn̄g-bān sì-tshing lâng.
English: Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his division were twenty-four thousand.

Tailo: I hō͘ hûn-bū tuì tē-ki̍k tshìng khí-.lâi, I uī-tio̍h hō͘ tshòng-tsō sih-nà, hō͘ hong tuì I ê khò͘-pâng tshue tshut-.lâi.
English: Who causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth; Who makes lightnings with the rain; Who brings forth the wind out of his treasuries;

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tsiah-ê tshut-sì to̍h sī guā-pang lâng ê, lín hō͘ hiah-ê tsū-tshing siū-kat-lé ê iô-tá-iah lâng kā lín tshing-tsò bô siū kat-lé ê; in ê kat-lé sī lâng īng tshiú tī sing-khu kiânn kat-lé.
English: Therefore remember that once you, the Gentiles in the flesh, who are called uncircumcision by that which is called circumcision, ( in the flesh, made by hands ) ;

Tailo: Lí kah lí hiah-ê kiáⁿ, lí hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k, tio̍h kā i tsìng-tsoh tshân-hn̂g, tuà só͘ tshut-sán ê hō͘ lí ê tsú ê kiáⁿ ū mi̍h thang tsia̍h; tsóng-.sī, lí ê tsú-lâng ê kiáⁿ Me-hui-bo-siat ē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī guá ê toh tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: You shall till the land for him, you, and your sons, and your servants; and you shall bring in the fruits, that your master's son may have bread to eat: but Mephibosheth your master's son shall eat bread always at my table. Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng lí ê tsâi-bu̍t kah lí só͘-ū khí-thâu si̍k ê lông-sán-bu̍t hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú.
English: Honor Yahweh with your substance, With the first fruits of all your increase:

Tailo: I tsiū pâi tī in ê bīn-tsîng, in tsia̍h-liáu mā ū tshun, tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ kóng ê.
English: So he set it before them, and they ate, and left of it, according to the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū kā in kóng, Guá ê kà-sī m̄-sī tuì ka-kī lâi ê, sī tuì tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī ê kà-sī.
English: Jesus therefore answered them, My teaching is not mine, but his who sent me.

Tailo: Tshiánn khuan-iông guá, guá beh koh kóng, guá kóng liáu, tshut-tsāi lí khau-sé.
English: Allow me, and I also will speak; After I have spoken, mock on.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōng-tsú ê ji̍t lîm-kàu; hit ji̍t ē ū tsân-jím, thòng-hūn kah tuā siū-khì, hō͘ tsit-ê tē pha-hng, koh tuì hit tiong-kan kā ū tsuē ê lâng tû-bia̍t.
English: Behold, the day of Yahweh comes, cruel, with wrath and fierce anger; to make the land a desolation, and to destroy its sinners out of it.

Tailo: I ê tiōng-hu Iô-sé-huh sī Siōng-tè só͘ kah-ì ê gī lâng, bô ài kong-khai hō͘ i kiàn-siàu, siūⁿ beh thau-thau-á kái-tû hun-iok.
English: Joseph, her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, intended to put her away secretly.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng tsin ū hok-khì! In-uī Tsú só͘ kā lí kóng ê uē ē si̍t-hiān.
English: Blessed is she who believed, for there will be a fulfillment of the things which have been spoken to her from the Lord!

Tailo: Nó͘-ah ê sè-hē kì tī ē-té: Nó͘-ah sī gī lâng, tī hit sè-tāi ê tiong-kan sī uân-tsuân ê lâng; nó͘-ah kah Siōng-tè tsò-hué kiânn.
English: This is the history of the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.

Tailo: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí, Iô-tah ke ē kah I-su-la-el ê jîn-bîn tâng kiâⁿ; tuì pak-hong ê tē tsò-hué lâi, kàu Guá siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín ê tsó͘-sian tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē.
English: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I gave for an inheritance to your fathers.
