Tailo: In bô kā tuà tī Ge-tsel ê Ka-nân lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì; tsóng-.sī, Ka-nân lâng tuà tī E-hu-laim lâng ê tiong-kan, tsò khó͘-kang ê lô͘-po̍k, kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: They didn't drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer: but the Canaanites dwell in the midst of Ephraim to this day, and are become servants to do forced labor.

Tailo: Huē-tn̂g lāi só͘-ū ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, lóng hui-siông siū-khì.
English: They were all filled with wrath in the synagogue, as they heard these things.

Tailo: Guán bô koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guán ê tiāu-thâu, bô koh ū sian-ti; guán tiong-kan mā bô lâng tsai tsit khuán tsîng-hîng ē kàu tang-sî!
English: We see no miraculous signs. There is no longer any prophet, Neither is there among us anyone who knows how long.

Tailo: Tsian, sió-ing, ian kah i ê luī,
English: and the red kite, and the falcon, and the kite after its kind,

Tailo: In suî-sî khuànn sì-kho͘-uî, bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h puànn-lâng, tsí ū I-é-su kah in tī hia.
English: Suddenly looking around, they saw no one with them any more, except Jesus only.

Tailo: Taⁿ tsai tī khòng-iá, ta-sò bô tsuí ê tē.
English: Now it is planted in the wilderness, in a dry and thirsty land.

Tailo: Sit bī ê iâm bē-tàng lo̍h-hn̂g, mā bē-tàng kauh-puî, tsí ū hiat-tiāu. Ū hīⁿ-khang thang thiaⁿ ê lâng, tio̍h thiaⁿ!
English: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile. It is thrown out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hiàn tsiah-ê kah i ê kuàn-tiān, tī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè kah i ê sò͘-tsè í-guā, lín lóng tio̍h īng bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: Besides the continual burnt offering, and the meal offering of it, you shall offer them ( they shall be to you without blemish ) , and their drink offerings.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng, tsīn-la̍t, thiàⁿ Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè.
English: and you shall love Yahweh your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your might.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī huē-bō͘, huat-kuī kah hit tíng-bīn ê si-un-só͘, í-ki̍p pò͘-pênn só͘-ū ê khì-kū,
English: the tent of meeting, the ark of the testimony, the mercy seat that is on it, all the furniture of the Tent,

Tailo: Ū kuí-nā-ê king-ha̍k kàu-su sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, Tsit-ê lâng teh siat-to̍k Siōng-tè! .
English: Behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, This man blasphemes.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng: Guá tshuā lín ê tsó͘-sian tuì Ai-gi̍p tē tsò lô͘-lē ê ke tshut-.lâi ê ji̍t kah in li̍p-iok, kóng,
English: Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying,

Tailo: Tàn ê lâng ua̍t thâu khuànn, mn̄g Mi-ka kóng, Lí tsū-tsi̍p hiah-ê lâng lâi, sī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì?
English: They cried to the children of Dan. They turned their faces, and said to Micah, What ails you, that you come with such a company?

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsè-si Hil-kí-iah kah A-hi-kam, Ak-bol, Sia-huánn, í-ki̍p A-sa-iah, lóng khì kìⁿ lú-sian-ti Hol-tah. I sī Hal-ha-suh ê sun, Tik-bah ê kiáⁿ, kuán-lí lé-ho̍k hit-ê Sia-lúm ê bó͘, i tiàm tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm tē-jī khu. In kah i kóng tsiah-ê tāi-tsì.
English: So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asaiah, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe ( now she lived in Jerusalem in the second quarter ) ; and they talked with her.

Tailo: Ta̍k tè pán ū nn̄g-ê sún sio-tuì pâi, huē-bō͘ só͘-ū ê pán lóng tsiàu án-ne tsò.
English: Each board had two tenons, joined one to another. He made all the boards of the tent this way.

Tailo: Io-a-si kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, í-ki̍p i kah Iô-tah ông A-má-tsiah kau-tsiàn ê lîng-li̍k, kám bô lóng kì tī I-su-la-el tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, and his might with which he fought against Amaziah king of Judah, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: Tiánn sī beh tuàn-liān gîn, lô͘ sī beh tuàn-liān kim; tuì o-ló mā ē-tàng tshì-giām lâng.
English: The crucible is for silver, And the furnace for gold; But man is refined by his praise.

Tailo: Koh kám-siā thâi-sí Ba-siáng ông O͘-k ê Siōng-tè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: Og king of Bashan; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kah tuè i ê lâng lâi-kàu hit-ê siâⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h siâⁿ í-king hō͘ hué sio-.khì, in ê bó͘ kah kiáⁿ-jî lóng hō͘ in lia̍h-.khì.
English: When David and his men came to the city, behold, it was burned with fire; and their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, were taken captive.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā i kóng, ' Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Lí kám ū thâi-sí-lâng koh tsiáng-kuán i ê sán-gia̍p? ' Koh tio̍h kā i kóng, ' Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng： Káu tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi tsīⁿ Na-bot ê hueh, káu mā ē tī hia tsīⁿ lí ê hueh, to̍h-sī lí pún-sin ê hueh. '
English: You shall speak to him, saying, Thus says Yahweh, Have you killed and also taken possession? You shall speak to him, saying, Thus says Yahweh, In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick your blood, even yours.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h tshuā A-lông kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, lâi-kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g tsîng, īng tsuí kā in sé.
English: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the tent of meeting, and shall wash them with water.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī Ki-tok hō͘ lán ê ìng-ín, sī íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: This is the promise which he promised us, the eternal life.

Tailo: E-sáu sì-tsa̍p huè ê sî, tshuā Hiat lâng Be-lī ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Iû-tit kah Hiat lâng E-lóng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Ba-su-mat tsò bó͘.
English: When Esau was forty years old, he took as wife Judith, the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Basemath, the daughter of Elon the Hittite.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, i hō͘ Siōng-tsú ê iok-kuī uî siâⁿ se̍h tsi̍t pái; in tsiū tńg-lâi iâⁿ-pâng, tī iâⁿ lāi hioh-khùn.
English: So he caused the ark of Yahweh to compass the city, going about it once: and they came into the camp, and lodged in the camp.

Tailo: lí kám ū huat-tō͘ hō͘ kng khiú tē ê sì-ki̍k, thang kā pháiⁿ lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì?
English: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, And shake the wicked out of it?

Tailo: Guá tsiū tuì Ki-tí-bo̍k ê khòng-iá, tshe sù-tsiá khì kìⁿ He-si-bóng ông Si-hông, īng hô-pîng ê uē kóng,
English: I sent messengers out of the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, thang lâi sio hiuⁿ.
English: You shall make an altar to burn incense on. You shall make it of acacia wood.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán m̄-thang thîng-liû tī Ki-tok ê tsho͘-pō͘ tō-lí, tio̍h hiòng tsîng kiû tsìn-pō͘, kàu uân-tsuân sîng-si̍k ê thîng-tō͘; lán bián koh-tsài īng thuat-lī sí-bông ê hîng-uî lâi sìn Siōng-tè,
English: Therefore leaving the doctrine of the first principles of Christ, let us press on to perfectionnot laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works, of faith toward God,

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng lóng bô uē thang ìn.
English: They couldn't answer him regarding these things.

Tailo: In-uī i tû-khì guā-pang ê sîn-bîng ê tuâⁿ kah suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, huì hiah-ê thiāu-siōng,
English: for he took away the foreign altars, and the high places, and broke down the pillars, and hewed down the Asherim,

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì Mô͘-se kóng, Siōng-tsú ê tshiú kám sī té? Taⁿ lí ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá ê uē ū tuì lí ìng-giām á-bô.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Has Yahweh's hand grown short? now shall you see whether my word shall happen to you or not.

Tailo: Lí ê lō͘ tio̍h lī-khui i hn̄g-hn̄g, m̄-thang kiâⁿ kīn i ê mn̂g-kháu.
English: Remove your way far from her. Don't come near the door of her house,

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t tsāi-seⁿ ê sî, ū tsun-tsiàu Siōng-tè ê tsí-ì; i sí liáu-āu, bâi-tsòng tī tsó͘-sian ê piⁿ-á, mā í-king hiú-nuā khì.
English: For David, after he had in his own generation served the counsel of God, fell asleep, and was laid with his fathers, and saw decay.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, hiah-ê tuì Sa-má-lī-a só͘ lia̍h-.khì ê tsè-si, tsi̍t-ê tńg-lâi tuà tī Be-thel, kā in kà-sī tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ lâi kìng-uì Siōng-tsú.
English: So one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and lived in Bethel, and taught them how they should fear Yahweh.

Tailo: I hiah-ê kiáⁿ ē khì kau-tsiàn, tsio-tsi̍p tsin tsē kun-tuī. In ē tsìn-tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn tsuí huàn-lām tuì hia king-kuè, jiân-āu koh khì kau-tsiàn, ti̍t-kàu tuì-ti̍k ê hiám-iàu só͘-tsāi.
English: His sons shall war, and shall assemble a multitude of great forces, which shall come on, and overflow, and pass through; and they shall return and war, even to his fortress.

Tailo: Tsìng siú-líng, ióng-sū kah Ta-bi̍t ông ê tsìng kiáⁿ, lóng sūn-ho̍k Só͘-lô-móng ông.
English: All the princes, the mighty men, and also all of the sons of king David submitted themselves to Solomon the king.

Tailo: I hiah-ê bó-kū tsiū kā só͘-ū ê uē, thè i kóng hō͘ Sī-khiàm ê lâng thiaⁿ, in ê sim tsiū kui-ǹg A-mí-me-li̍k, in-uī kóng, I sī lán ê hiann-tī.
English: His mother's brothers spoke of him in the ears of all the men of Shechem all these words: and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech; for they said, He is our brother.

Tailo: Huâ-láu ê jîn-sîn khuàⁿ-tio̍h i, tsiū tuì Huâ-láu o-ló i. Hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū hō͘ lâng tshuā ji̍p-khì Huâ-láu ê ông-kiong.
English: The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.

Tailo: Thê-man, lí ê ióng-sū ē kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, tì-sú tiàm E-sáu ê suaⁿ, ta̍k lâng siū thâi-sí tsián-tû.
English: Your mighty men, Teman, will be dismayed, to the end that everyone may be cut off from the mountain of Esau by slaughter.

Tailo: In khuàⁿ-tio̍h I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè, I ê kha tsîng ū tshin-tshiūnn pho͘-pêⁿ ê nâ-pó-tsio̍h, tshin-tshiūnn thiⁿ-sik hiah kng.
English: They saw the God of Israel. Under his feet was like a paved work of sapphire stone, like the skies for clearness.

Tailo: I só͘ huann-hí ê, sī Siōng-tsú ê lu̍t-huat; mê-ji̍t sàm-su ê, mā sī I ê lu̍t-huat.
English: But his delight is in Yahweh's law; On his law he meditates day and night.

Tailo: Tsit-má sī tsit sè-kan siū sím-phuàⁿ ê sî. Tsit sè-kan ê thóng-tī-tsiá ē siū thui-huan.
English: Now is the judgment of this world. Now the prince of this world will be cast out.

Tailo: I mā khui in ê hīⁿ-khang lâi siū kà-sī, huan-hù in ua̍t tò tńg-.lâi, lī-khui tsuē-ok.
English: He also opens their ears to instruction, And commands that they return from iniquity.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ê tsiàⁿ tshiú gia̍h kuân; Siōng-tsú ê tsiàⁿ tshiú hián-tshut tuā kuân-lîng.
English: The right hand of Yahweh is exalted! The right hand of Yahweh does valiantly!

Tailo: Lín khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, sim tsiū khuài-lo̍k; lín ê kut ē tit-tio̍h tsu-jūn, tshin-tshiūnn nńg-nńg ê tsháu. Siōng-tsú ê tshiú ē hián-hiān hō͘ I ê lô͘-po̍k tsai; I mā ē tuì I ê tuì-ti̍k siū-khì.
English: You shall see it, and your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like the tender grass: and the hand of Yahweh shall be known toward his servants; and he will have indignation against his enemies.

Tailo: Lí ē tī ji̍t-tiong-tàu sì-kè bong, tshin-tshiūnn tsheⁿ-mê-.ê khuàⁿ bô teh luān bong; lí ê lō͘ bē hing-thong, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tú-tio̍h tsè-ap kah tshiúⁿ-tua̍t, bô lâng kā lí tsín-kiù.
English: and you shall grope at noonday, as the blind gropes in darkness, and you shall not prosper in your ways: and you shall be only oppressed and robbed always, and there shall be none to save you.

Tailo: Mô͘-se kah A-lông tsiū án-ne tsò, tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ huan-hù ê, tī Huâ-láu kah i ê jîn-sîn ê bīn-tsîng gia̍h-khí kuái-á, phah hô-.ni̍h ê tsuí, hô-.ni̍h ê tsuí tsiū lóng piàn-tsò hueh.
English: Moses and Aaron did so, as Yahweh commanded; and he lifted up the rod, and struck the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that were in the river were turned to blood.

Tailo: Huâ-láu siū-khì i hit nn̄g-ê jîn-sîn, to̍h-sī tsiú-tsìng-tiúⁿ kah tû-pâng-tiúⁿ.
English: Pharaoh was angry with his two officers, the chief cupbearer and the chief baker.

Tailo: E-li-iah tsiū khì, tsiàu Siōng-tsú ê uē lâi kiâⁿ, khì tuà tī Iol-tàn hô tang pîng ê Ke-lit khe.
English: So he went and did according to the word of Yahweh; for he went and lived by the brook Cherith, that is before the Jordan.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh ê bûn-tô͘ lâi siu i ê sin-si khì bâi-tsòng, tsiū khì kā I-é-su kóng.
English: His disciples came, and took the body, and buried it; and they went and told Jesus.

Tailo: In tsiū án-ne liam-khau, tsiū liam-tio̍h Iô-ná. In tuì i kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kā guán kóng, lán tú-tio̍h tsit-ê tsai-hō, sī in-uī siáⁿ lâng ê iân-kò͘; lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h sū-gia̍p? Lí tuì tó-uī lâi? Lí ê pún só͘-tsāi tī tó-uī? Lí sio̍k siáⁿ-mi̍h tso̍k?
English: Then they asked him, Tell us, please, for whose cause this evil is on us. What is your occupation? Where do you come from? What is your country? Of what people are you?

Tailo: In tsí ū tsi̍t hāng tāi-tsì ē-tàng kā guá khòng-kò, to̍h-sī guá bat khiā tī in tiong-kan tuā-siaⁿ huah, ' Guá kin-á-ji̍t siū lín sím-phuàⁿ, sī uī-tio̍h sí-lâng koh-ua̍h ê tāi-tsì. '
English: unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them, Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today!'

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ē hō͘ só͘-ū ê pēⁿ-tsìng lī-khui lí, lí só͘ tsai ê Ai-gi̍p ta̍k tsióng ê pháiⁿ tsìng-thâu, I bô hō͘ lí tú-tio̍h tsi̍t hāng, sī ē hō͘ só͘-ū uàn-hūn lí ê lâng tú-.tio̍h.
English: Yahweh will take away from you all sickness; and none of the evil diseases of Egypt, which you know, he will put on you, but will lay them on all those who hate you.

Tailo: Kám-siā tshuā I-su-la-el lâng tuì Ai-gi̍p tshut-.lâi ê Siōng-tè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: And brought out Israel from among them; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Iô-tah lâng kóng, Lín ná ē khí-lâi kong-kik guán? In kóng, Guán khí-lâi sī beh khún-pa̍k Sâm-sóng, i khuán-thāi guán án-tsuáⁿ, guán mā beh án-ne kā i khuán-thāi.
English: The men of Judah said, Why are you come up against us? They said, To bind Samson are we come up, to do to him as he has done to us.

Tailo: I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, lín tuì Guá kiânn kan-tsà, tsin-tsiàⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng kiânn kan-tsà lī-khui i ê tiōng-hu. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: Surely as a wife treacherously departs from her husband, so have you dealt treacherously with me, house of Israel, says Yahweh.

Tailo: In lóng ē ìn lí kóng, ' Lí mā piàn-tsò luán-jio̍k tshin-tshiūnn guán? Lí kám mā kah guán kāng-khuán?
English: They all will answer and ask you, Have you also become as weak as we are? Have you become like us?

Tailo: In-uī tsiah-ê uē ē tsò lí thâu-khak tíng ê bián-liû, tsò lí ām-kún ê kim-liān.
English: For they will be a garland to grace your head, And chains around your neck.

Tailo: I-é-su khuàⁿ-tio̍h hiah tuā-tīn ê lâng, to̍h peh tsiūⁿ suaⁿ. I tsē lo̍h-.khì, bûn-tô͘ tsiū uá-.lâi.
English: Seeing the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain. When he had sat down, his disciples came to him.

Tailo: ū saⁿ-bān nn̄g-tshing nn̄g-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Manasseh, were thirty-two thousand two hundred.

Tailo: U-tsi-iah tī Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê kak mn̂g kah suaⁿ-kok mn̂g, kah siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tsuán-uan ê só͘-tsāi khí siâⁿ-lâu, koh sī tsin kian-kò͘ ê.
English: Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, and at the valley gate, and at the turning of the wall, and fortified them.

Tailo: I hing-khí ê sî, i ê kok ē hun-lia̍t, ǹg thiⁿ ê sì-bīn ê hong-hiòng hun-khui, tsóng-.sī, bô kui i ê kiáⁿ-sun, mā bē pí-tit i í-tsîng só͘ tsiáng ê kuân; in-uī i ê kok ē tú-tio̍h siū pue̍h khí-.lâi, kui tī i ê kiáⁿ-sun í-guā ê pa̍t lâng.
English: When he shall stand up, his kingdom shall be broken, and shall be divided toward the four winds of the sky, but not to his posterity, nor according to his dominion with which he ruled; for his kingdom shall be plucked up, even for others besides these.

Tailo: Tsîng Ba-bú-lông ông Nep-kat-ne-tsal tshian-suá Iô-tah ông Ia-ko-niah ê sî, Mol-té-kái mā tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm siū tshian-suá, i tī hit pang siū lia̍h ê lâng ê tiong-kan.
English: who had been carried away from Jerusalem with the captives who had been carried away with Jeconiah king of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bong i ê bah ê lâng ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sìng, i ê hueh nā hiù tī siáⁿ-mi̍h saⁿ-khò͘ ê tíng-bīn, só͘ hiù-tio̍h hit niá, lí tio̍h tī sìng ê só͘-tsāi sé.
English: Whatever shall touch its flesh shall be holy. When there is any of its blood sprinkled on a garment, you shall wash that on which it was sprinkled in a holy place.

Tailo: Guá it-tīng bô íng-uán tsing-piān, mā bô kú-tn̂g siū-khì, in-uī khióng-kiaⁿ Guá só͘ tshòng-tsō ê lâng, in ê sim kah lîng-hûn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng sue-lám.
English: For I will not contend forever, neither will I be always angry; for the spirit would faint before me, and the souls who I have made.

Tailo: Nn̄g-iūⁿ sim ê lâng sī guá só͘ thòng-hūn; tsí ū Lí ê lu̍t-huat sī guá só͘ ì-ài.
English: I hate double-minded men, But I love your law.

Tailo: Guá tsit-má king-kuè Ma-ke-tó-niah liáu-āu, tsiū beh khì lín hia.
English: But I will come to you when I have passed through Macedonia, for I am passing through Macedonia.

Tailo: I ài tsiù-tsó͘, guān tsiù-tsó͘ lîm-kàu i; I bô ài tsiok-hok, guān tsiok-hok lī-khui i hn̄g-hn̄g!
English: Yes, he loved cursing, and it came to him. He didn't delight in blessing, and it was far from him.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín ē hông kiò-tsò Siōng-tsú ê tsè-si; lâng beh tshing lín tsò lán ê Siōng-tsú ê tshe-īng. Lín ē tsia̍h-īng lia̍t kok ê tsâi-bu̍t, tit-tio̍h in ê îng-kng lâi khua-kháu.
English: But you shall be named the priests of Yahweh; men shall call you the ministers of our God: you shall eat the wealth of the nations, and in their glory shall you boast yourselves.

Tailo: Iô-tah ê kiáⁿ, Tsa-la̍h ê kiáⁿ-sun, Me-si-tsa-bel ê kiáⁿ Pe-tha-hiah, tī ông ê pō͘-hā pān-lí Iô-tah jîn-bîn it-tshè ê tāi-tsì.
English: Pethahiah the son of Meshezabel, of the children of Zerah the son of Judah, was at the king's hand in all matters concerning the people.

Tailo: Tuì Pí-hap-hi-lio̍k tuì-bīn tshut-huat, king-kuè hái tiong kàu khòng-iá, koh tī Í-thóng ê khòng-iá kiânn saⁿ ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, tsiū tsat iâⁿ tī Mah-la̍h.
English: They traveled from before Hahiroth, and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness: and they went three days' journey in the wilderness of Etham, and encamped in Marah.

Tailo: I m̄-thang uá-khò hi-ké lâi khi-phiàn ka-kī, in-uī hi-ké ē tsiâⁿ-tsò i ê pò-ìng.
English: Let him not trust in emptiness, deceiving himself; For emptiness shall be his reward.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ tóng tshin-tshiūnn káu-luī teh pau-uî guá; in thiah-li̍h guá ê tshiú, guá ê kha.
English: For dogs have surrounded me. A company of evil-doers have enclosed me. They pierced my hands and my feet.

Tailo: Kàu Pa-lân ê khòng-iá ê Ka-té-si, kìⁿ-tio̍h Mô͘-se, A-lông kah I-su-la-el ê huē-tsiòng, huê-hok in kah tsuân huē-tsiòng, koh īng hit só͘-tsāi ê kué-tsí hō͘ in khuànn.
English: They went and came to Moses, and to Aaron, and to all the congregation of the children of Israel, to the wilderness of Paran, to Kadesh; and brought back word to them, and to all the congregation, and shown them the fruit of the land.

Tailo: In ē tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Siōng-tsú ê tsok-uî, in-uī Siōng-tsú ê îng-kng tsin tuā.
English: Yes, they will sing of the ways of Yahweh; For great is Yahweh's glory.

Tailo: Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Gî-tióng tuì Hi-lia̍t-su ê suaⁿ-phiânn, tuì tsiàn-tīn tò tńg-.lâi.
English: Gideon the son of Joash returned from the battle from the ascent of Heres.

Tailo: Gê-la̍h-sam sì-kho͘-uî ê lâng lóng kiû I-é-su lī-khui in, in-uī in tsin kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ. I-é-su tsiū tsē tsûn tńg-.khì.
English: All the people of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were very much afraid. He entered into the boat, and returned.

Tailo: Io-si-iah ua̍t tńg-sin khuàⁿ-tio̍h suaⁿ-.ni̍h hiah-ê bōng, tsiū tshe lâng khì the̍h bōng lāi ê kut-thâu, tī tuâⁿ tíng sio, lâi kā i uè lah-sap, tsiàu Siōng-tsú só͘ kóng, to̍h-sī tsá-tsîng teh suan-pò͘ tsiah-ê tāi-tsì ê Siōng-tè ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ suan-pò͘ ê.
English: As Josiah turned himself, he spied the tombs that were there in the mountain; and he sent, and took the bones out of the tombs, and burned them on the altar, and defiled it, according to the word of Yahweh which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these things.

Tailo: Hui-li̍p-pué lâng, lín ka-kī mā lóng tsai, tī guá thuân hok-im ê khí-thâu, guá lī-khui Ma-ke-tó-niah ê sî, kan-taⁿ lín ê kàu-huē ū tsi-uân guá ê sing-ua̍h huì-iōng.
English: You yourselves also know, you Philippians, that in the beginning of the Good News, when I departed from Macedonia, no assembly shared with me in the matter of giving and receiving but you only.

Tailo: Lí nā thiaⁿ-tio̍h sng-tsâi tshiū bué ū kha-pō͘ ê siann, tsiū tio̍h tshut-khì kau-tsiàn, in-uī Siōng-tè tsò lí ê thâu-tsîng tshut-.khì, beh phah Hui-lī-sū lâng.
English: It shall be, when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the mulberry trees, that then you shall go out to battle; for God is gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines.

Tailo: Ti̍t kàu guá ji̍p-khì Siōng-tè ê sìng-só͘, guá tsiah liáu-kái pháiⁿ lâng ê kiat-kio̍k.
English: Until I entered God's sanctuary, And considered their latter end.

Tailo: I tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān ê nn̄g-ê īⁿ lāi, uī-tio̍h thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng khí tuâⁿ.
English: He built altars for all the army of the sky in the two courts of the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá m̄-sìn in ê uē, kàu guá lâi tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, lí khuàⁿ, lí ê tì-huī ê tuā, lâng só͘ kā guá kóng ê iáu bô kah tsi̍t-puàⁿ, lí iâⁿ-kuè guá só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê miâ-siaⁿ.
English: However I didn't believe their words, until I came, and my eyes had seen it; and behold, the half of the greatness of your wisdom was not told me: you exceed the fame that I heard.

Tailo: Lí m̄-thang him-siān pháiⁿ lâng, tio̍h kui ji̍t kìng-uì Siōng-tsú.
English: Don't let your heart envy sinners; But rather fear Yahweh all the day long.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá kā lín kóng, Siōng-tè kok-tō͘ ē tuì lín tshiúⁿ-lâi kau hō͘ ē kiat kué-tsí ê tsú-bîn.
English: Therefore I tell you, the Kingdom of God will be taken away from you, and will be given to a nation bringing forth its fruits.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng koh mn̄g i ná ē khuànn-kìnn. I tsiū kā in kóng, I īng thô͘-muê kô͘ guá ê ba̍k-tsiu, guá khì sé, tsiū ū khuànn-kìnn.
English: Again therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he received his sight. He said to them, He put mud on my eyes, I washed, and I see.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Iô-tá-iah lâng tsiū hō͘-siong tsing-lūn, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng ná ē īng I ê bah hō͘ lán tsia̍h?
English: The Jews therefore contended with one another, saying, How can this man give us his flesh to eat?

Tailo: Koh tuì thiⁿ ū siaⁿ kóng, Lí sī guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê Kiáⁿ, guá tsin kah-ì Lí.
English: A voice came out of the sky, You are my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Īng tse hián-hiān tī lí, hō͘ lí tsai Siōng-tsú I sī Siōng-tè, I í-guā bô ū pa̍t-ê.
English: To you it was shown, that you might know that Yahweh he is God; there is none else besides him.

Tailo: Tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng sī tshut-sì tī Su-lī-a Hue-ní-ke ê Hi-la̍h lâng, i kiû I-é-su kā i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kuáⁿ kuí.
English: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. She begged him that he would cast the demon out of her daughter.

Tailo: Guán in-uī guán ê pháiⁿ só͘ kiâⁿ kah guán ê tāng tsuē, í-king tú-tio̍h tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, guán ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kā guán hîng-hua̍t pí guán ê tsuē só͘ ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê khah khin, koh kā guán lâu lo̍h-lâi tsiah-ê thuat-lī ê lâng.
English: After all that is come on us for our evil deeds, and for our great guilt, seeing that you our God have punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and have given us such a remnant,

Tailo: tsi̍t-ê kim-au, tāng tsa̍p si-khel, té hiuⁿ muá-muá;
English: one golden ladle of ten shekels, full of incense;

Tailo: Lāu-su ah, lu̍t-huat tiong tó tsi̍t tiâu kài-bīng siōng tiōng-iàu?
English: Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?

Tailo: Tng i tsheⁿ-tshuì, iáu-buē kuah khí-.lâi, pí só͘-ū ê tsháu tāi-sing ta-.khì.
English: While it is yet in its greenness, not cut down, It withers before any other reed.

Tailo: Hiah-ê Iô-tá-iah lâng ìn kóng, Guán ū lu̍t-huat, tsiàu lu̍t-huat I ing-kai sí, in-uī I ka-kī kóng I sī Siōng-tè ê Kiáⁿ.
English: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Iô-tah lâng tsū-huē, kiû Siōng-tsú pang-tsān. Iô-tah ta̍k-ê siâⁿ lóng ū lâng tshut-lâi tsáu-tshuē Siōng-tsú.
English: Judah gathered themselves together, to seek help of Yahweh: even out of all the cities of Judah they came to seek Yahweh.

Tailo: In tsua̍t-tuì bē tit-tio̍h khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá tuì in ê tsó͘-sian só͘ tsiù-tsuā ìng-ín ê tē. Só͘-ū khuànn-khin Guá ê lâng lóng bē-tàng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: surely they shall not see the land which I swore to their fathers, neither shall any of those who despised me see it:

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, I-é-su kah I ê lāu-bú, hiann-tī í-ki̍p I ê bûn-tô͘ lo̍h-khì Ka-peh-ná-um, in tī hia tuà bô kuí ji̍t.
English: After this, he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, his brothers, and his disciples; and they stayed there a few days.

Tailo: Tuì tshing-khì ê lâng lâi kóng, bān-mi̍h lóng sī tshing-khì; tuì hiah-ê ù-uè kah bô sìn ê lâng lâi kóng, bô tsi̍t hāng mi̍h sī tshing-khì, liân in ê sim-su kah liông-sim mā lóng ù-uè.
English: To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.

Tailo: Pó-tsō tsîng ū tshin-tshiūnn tsuí-tsinn hiah tshing ê po-lê-hái. Pó-tsō ê sì-kho͘-uî ū sì tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h, tsîng-āu lóng ū ba̍k-tsiu.
English: Before the throne was something like a sea of glass, similar to crystal. In the midst of the throne, and around the throne were four living creatures full of eyes before and behind.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h siá phue hō͘ Sal-tí kàu-huē ê sù-tsiá, kóng, ū Siōng-tè ê tshit-ê lîng kah tshit lia̍p tsheⁿ ê hit uī án-ne kóng, guá tsai lí ê só͘ tsò; bîng-gī-siōng lí sī teh ua̍h, kî-si̍t lí sī sí-.khì.
English: And to the angel of the assembly in Sardis write: He who has the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars says these things: I know your works, that you have a reputation of being alive, but you are dead.

Tailo: to̍h-sī huat-lo̍h tiāⁿ-tio̍h kî sio-tsè ê tshâ, í-ki̍p khí-thâu si̍k ê lông-sán-bu̍t. Guá ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kì-liām guá, siúⁿ-sù guá hok-khì.
English: and for the wood offering, at times appointed, and for the first fruits. Remember me, my God, for good.

Tailo: I tsiū khí-.lâi, khì Tsa-le-phat. Lâi-kàu siâⁿ mn̂g ê sî, tú-hó ū tsi̍t-ê kuáⁿ-hū tī hit só͘-tsāi teh khioh tshâ. E-li-iah tsiū kiò i kóng, Kiû lí īng khì-kū iúⁿ tām-po̍h-á tsuí lâi hō͘ guá lim.
English: So he arose and went to Zarephath; and when he came to the gate of the city, behold, a widow was there gathering sticks: and he called to her, and said, Please get me a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.

Tailo: E-hu-laim ê tsuì-hàn, i kiau-ngō͘-ê bián-liû ē siū ta̍h tī kha tsîng.
English: The crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim will be trodden under foot.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kî-tó, tsiah bián-tit lín ê tô-tsáu huat-sing tī kuâⁿ-thiⁿ sî á-.sī An-hioh-ji̍t.
English: Pray that your flight will not be in the winter, nor on a Sabbath,

Tailo: [siàu-lí ê hiann-tī] Guán ū tsi̍t-ê sè-hàn sió-muē, i iáu-buē tióng-sîng, lâng lâi kóng tshin-tsiâⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí, guán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ thè guán ê sió-muē siat-huat?
English: We have a little sister. She has no breasts. What shall we do for our sister In the day when she is to be spoken for?

Tailo: ' Kah lāu-pē ê āu-bó͘ tâng-pâng ê tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! In-uī i ū hian-khui i ê lāu-pē ê saⁿ-á-ki. ' Jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h kóng, ' A-men! '
English: Cursed be he who lies with his father's wife, because he has uncovered his father's skirt. All the people shall say, Amen.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng ta̍k-ê lóng ē tuì i ê tshù-piⁿ kah tuà tī i tshù lāi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng thó gîn-khì, kim-khì kah saⁿ-khò͘, thang hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ-jî īng. Án-ne, lín ē khì tshiúⁿ Ai-gi̍p lâng.
English: But every woman shall ask of her neighbor, and of her who visits her house, jewels of silver, jewels of gold, and clothing; and you shall put them on your sons, and on your daughters. You shall despoil the Egyptians.

Tailo: kiàn-nā thiaⁿ-tio̍h sàu-kak ê siann bô siū kíng-kài ê, to-kiàm nā lâi kā i tsâu-bia̍t tiāu, i ê tsuē ē kui tī i ê thâu-khak tíng.
English: then whoever hears the sound of the trumpet, and doesn't take warning, if the sword come, and take him away, his blood shall be on his own head.

Tailo: Lí ê kun-tuī tshut-khì kong-kik lí ê tuì-ti̍k, tī iâⁿ-pâng tio̍h ka-kī kìm-kài it-tshè ê pháiⁿ tāi.
English: When you go forth in camp against your enemies, then you shall keep you from every evil thing.

Tailo: Guá īng hué-hu tsún pn̄g tsia̍h, só͘ lim ê lóng ū tsham ba̍k-sái.
English: For I have eaten ashes like bread, And mixed my drink with tears,

Tailo: Sè-kan lâng, I bat tsí-sī lí siáⁿ-mi̍h sī hó. Siōng-tsú ài lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? To̍k-to̍k ài lí kiânn kong-gī, sim tsûn liân-bín, khiam-pi, lâi kah lí ê Siōng-tè tsò-hué kiânn.
English: He has shown you, O man, what is good. What does Yahweh require of you, but to act justly, To love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God?

Tailo: Hîng-hua̍t ê ji̍t í-king kàu, pò-ìng ê ji̍t í-king kàu. I-su-la-el ē tsai sian-ti gû-gōng, siū sîn-lîng kám-tōng ê ē tian-kông, in-uī lí ê tsuē-kò tsin tsē, uàn-hūn mā tsin tuā.
English: The days of visitation have come. The days of reckoning have come. Israel will consider the prophet to be a fool, And the man who is inspired to be insane, Because of the abundance of your sins, And because your hostility is great.

Tailo: Hit sî, A-lâm ông Le-tsín kah I-su-la-el ông Le-má-liah ê kiáⁿ Pe-kah khí-lâi kong-kik Ê-lú-sa-lèm, uî-khùn A-khà-tsuh, tsóng-.sī, bē iâⁿ i.
English: Then Rezin king of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to Jerusalem to war: and they besieged Ahaz, but could not overcome him.

Tailo: Hui-lī-sū lâng kóng, Guán tio̍h īng siáⁿ-mi̍h tsò pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè lâi hîng I? Ìn kóng, Τio̍h īng kim lia̍p-á gō͘ lia̍p, kim niáu-tshí gō͘ tsiah, tsiàu Hui-lī-sū siú-líng ê sò͘-gia̍h, in-uī lín kah lín ê siú-líng só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê tsai-hō sio-siâng.
English: Then they said, What shall be the trespass offering which we shall return to him? They said, Five golden tumors, and five golden mice, according to the number of the lords of the Philistines; for one plague was on you all, and on your lords.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá hōng Tsú ê miâ khó͘-khǹg lín, m̄-thang koh-tsài kè-sio̍k kuè guā-pang lâng hit khuán ê sing-ua̍h. In ê su-sióng khang-hi koh hàm-kó͘,
English: This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that you no longer walk as the rest of the Gentiles also walk, in the futility of their mind,

Tailo: Lí ê tō͘-tsâi tshin-tshiūnn înn ê pue, bô khiàm-khueh tiâu-hô ê tsiú; lí ê pak-tó͘ ná tshin-tshiūnn kui tui ê be̍h, sì-kho͘-uî ū pik-ha̍p hue.
English: Your body is like a round goblet, No mixed wine is wanting. Your waist is like a heap of wheat, Set about with lilies.

Tailo: Sio̍k Lū-biān ê tsi-tso̍k king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, ū sì-bān la̍k-tshing gō͘-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Reuben, were forty-six thousand five hundred.

Tailo: tuì hia tshuā guán tshut-.lâi, beh tshuā guán ji̍p-.khì, kā I tuì lán tsó͘-sian só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán.
English: and he brought us out from there, that he might bring us in, to give us the land which he swore to our fathers.

Tailo: Siōng-tè sím-phuàⁿ hiah-ê tī kuân uī ê lâng, siáⁿ lâng ē kā tì-sik kà-sī i?
English: Shall any teach God knowledge, Seeing he judges those who are high?

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tuì I-su-la-el lâng kóng, Lín kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, thiaⁿ Siōng-tsú — lín ê Siōng-tè ê uē.
English: Joshua said to the children of Israel, Come here, and hear the words of Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kā I tī tāi-huē ê ji̍t, tī suaⁿ tíng tuì hué tiong kā lí kóng ê tsa̍p-kài, tsiàu í-tsîng só͘ siá ê khuán-sit, siá tī hiah-ê pi-.ni̍h, Siōng-tsú tsiū kā hiah-ê kau-tài guá.
English: He wrote on the tables, according to the first writing, the ten commandments, which Yahweh spoke to you on the mountain out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and Yahweh gave them to me.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h kah tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiù-tsuā, tuì i kóng, ' Nā bô lâng kah lí kiânn kan-îm, lí í-king siū tiōng-hu ê iok-sok, bô tsò m̄-tio̍h tì-sú uè lah-sap, lí tsiū kah tsit-ê tsiù-tsó͘ ê khó͘-tsuí bô kuan-hē.
English: The priest shall cause her to swear, and shall tell the woman, If no man has lain with you, and if you haven't gone aside to uncleanness, being under your husband, be free from this water of bitterness that brings a curse.

Tailo: I-é-sái tsiū īng lî-á tsài piáⁿ kah tsi̍t phuê-tē ê tsiú, kah tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á, kau i ê kiáⁿ Ta-bi̍t, khì sàng hō͘ Sàu-lô.
English: Jesse took a donkey loaded with bread, and a bottle of wine, and a kid, and sent them by David his son to Saul.

Tailo: I tio̍h tshin-tshiú tuà hiàn hō͘ Siōng-tsú ê hué-tsè lâi, to̍h-sī tuà iû kah hing lâi, thang īng hing tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng tsò iô-tsè lâi iô.
English: With his own hands he shall bring the offerings of Yahweh made by fire. He shall bring the fat with the breast, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before Yahweh.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t kóng, Guá ū tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Kám sī bô guân-in?
English: David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause?

Tailo: Guá ê Siōng-tè ah, kiû Lí kì-liām guá uī-tio̍h tsiah-ê jîn-bîn só͘ tsò it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, lâi kā guá sù-hok.
English: Remember to me, my God, for good, all that I have done for this people.

Tailo: Tuā king tiān ê piah īng siông tshiū ê tshâ lâi khàm, īng sûn-kim lâi an-tsng, tíng-bīn khik tsó tshiū kah liān-á.
English: The greater house he made a ceiling with fir wood, which he overlaid with fine gold, and ornamented it with palm trees and chains.

Tailo: Guá mā beh hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ-sun tshin-tshiūnn tē-tsiūⁿ ê thô͘-sua hiah tsē, lâng nā ē-tàng sǹg tē-tsiūⁿ ê thô͘-sua, tsiah ē-tàng sǹg lí ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then your seed may also be numbered.

Tailo: Thái-ko ê pháiⁿ tsìng-thâu, lí tio̍h tsin sè-jī, tsè-si Lē-bī lâng it-tshè só͘ kà-sī lín ê, tio̍h tsiàu án-ne lâi kiâⁿ. Guá só͘ bīng-līng in ê, lín tio̍h tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Take heed in the plague of leprosy, that you observe diligently, and do according to all that the priests the Levites shall teach you: as I commanded them, so you shall observe to do.

Tailo: Tsiú-tsuì ê lâng, lín tio̍h tshénn khí-lâi thî-khàu; hò͘ⁿ-tsiú ê lâng, lín tio̍h uī-tio̍h tiⁿ-tsiú lâi thî-khàu, in-uī bô tsiú thang koh kàu tī lí ê tshuì à.
English: Wake up, you drunkards, and weep! Wail, all you drinkers of wine, because of the sweet wine; For it is cut off from your mouth.

Tailo: Kám ū tsi̍t kok kái-uāⁿ in ê sîn-bîng? Kî-si̍t hiah-ê m̄-sī Siōng-tè! Tsóng-.sī, Guá ê jîn-bîn kā in ê îng-kng the̍h-lâi uāⁿ hit-ê bô lī-ik ê.
English: Has a nation changed its gods, which yet are no gods? but my people have changed their glory for that which does not profit.

Tailo: Ti̍t kàu hit-ê tuì kó͘-tsá to̍h ū-.ê lâi, kā tsì-kuân Siōng-tè ê tsú-bîn phuàⁿ-tuàn, it-ti̍t kàu sìng-tô͘ tit-tio̍h kok-uī ê ji̍t-kî.
English: until the ancient of days came, and judgment was given to the saints of the Most High, and the time came that the saints possessed the kingdom.

Tailo: Tsú ah, guān Lí kā guán keh-piah kok tuì Lí ê lîng-jio̍k, ke-thinn tshit puē kui tī in ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: Pay back to our neighbors seven times into their bosom Their reproach with which they have reproached you, Lord.

Tailo: I tsiū khì hō͘ hit só͘-tsāi ê tsi̍t-ê lâng tshiàⁿ, hit-ê lâng tshe i khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h ê hn̂g tshī ti.
English: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Ia-lô-ba-am tī in ê āu-bīn bâi-ho̍k ping. Tsiū án-ne, I-su-la-el lâng tī Iô-tah ê thâu-tsîng, bâi-ho̍k ê ping tī in ê āu-bīn.
English: But Jeroboam caused an ambush to come about behind them: so they were before Judah, and the ambush was behind them.

Tailo: I koh tsō tâng-phûn tsa̍p-ê, muí phûn thang té sì-tsa̍p bat. Ta̍k-ê phûn ê ti̍t-kìng sì tiú, tsa̍p-ê tâng-tsō ê tíng-bīn, ta̍k-ê tsō hē tsi̍t-ê phûn.
English: He made ten basins of brass: one basin contained forty baths; and every basin was four cubits; and on very one of the ten bases one basin.

Tailo: Lâng huat-tsâi, ka-tîng ke-thinn îng-kng, lí m̄-bián in-uī án-ne lâi tio̍h-kiaⁿ.
English: Don't be afraid when a man is made rich, When the glory of his house is increased.

Tailo: Lín tāi-ke kong-kik lâng, lâi kā i huí-huāi, tshin-tshiūnn huí-huāi khi-tshiâ ê tshiûⁿ, á-.sī beh tó ê piah, tio̍h kàu tang-sî uî-tsí?
English: How long will you assault a man, Would all of you throw him down, Like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?

Tailo: Îm-hū ê tshuì sī tshim kheⁿ; Siōng-tsú só͘ thó-ià ê lâng ē pua̍h lo̍h-khì hit lāi-bīn.
English: The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit: He who is under Yahweh's wrath will fall into it.

Tailo: In-uī lí ē bē kì-tit lí ê kan-khó͘; tsún kóng nā ē kì-tit, mā ná tshin-tshiūnn tsuí-lâu kuè-.khì.
English: For you shall forget your misery; You shall remember it as waters that are passed away,

Tailo: Bô lâng-iân ê lú-tsú tshut-kè, lú-pī tshú-tāi tsú-bó.
English: For an unloved woman when she is married; And a handmaid who is heir to her mistress.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h the̍h tām-po̍h-á tsit-ê hiuⁿ, tsing hō͘ i tsin iù, hē tī huē-bō͘ lāi ê huat-kuī tsîng. Guá beh tī hia kah lí siong-huē, lín tio̍h lia̍h i tsò tsì-sìng.
English: and you shall beat some of it very small, and put some of it before the testimony in the tent of meeting, where I will meet with you. It shall be to you most holy.

Tailo: M̄-thang tó tī lâng ê sing-khu, mā m̄-thang tsiàu tsit-ê tiâu-hô ê tsè-huat tsò kah tsit-ê kāng-khuán. Tsit-ê iû sī sìng, lín mā tio̍h lia̍h i tsò sìng.
English: It shall not be poured on man's flesh, neither shall you make any like it, according to its composition: it is holy. It shall be holy to you.

Tailo: Tsia̍h guá ê bah, lim guá ê hueh ê lâng, ū íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā, tī bua̍t-ji̍t, guá ē hō͘ i koh-ua̍h.
English: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.

Tailo: In ê tsâi-bu̍t ē hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-tua̍t; in ê tshù-the̍h ē pha-hng. In beh khí tshù, mā bô thang tuà tī hit lāi-bīn; tsai-tsìng phû-tô hn̂g, mā bô thang lim i ê tsiú.
English: Their wealth will become a spoil, and their houses a desolation. Yes, they will build houses, but won't inhabit them. They will plant vineyards, but won't drink their wine.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Guá beh hō͘ Ê-lú-sa-lèm piàn-tsò thô͘-tui, tsiâⁿ-tsò iá-káu tuà ê só͘-tsāi, mā beh hō͘ Iô-tah tsiah-ê siâⁿ pha-hng, bô lâng tī hia tuà.
English: I will make Jerusalem heaps, a dwelling place of jackals; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.

Tailo: I-é-su tú beh lo̍h Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ ê sî, kui tuā-tīn ê bûn-tô͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h it-tshè kî-biāu ê tāi-tsì tsiū tuā huann-hí, tuā-siaⁿ o-ló Siōng-tè, kóng,
English: As he was now getting near, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen,

Tailo: Lí ê sīn-tiōng kè-uē ē pó-hō͘ lí, lí ê tshong-bîng ē pó-siú lí.
English: Discretion will watch over you. Understanding will keep you,

Tailo: I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn iáu teh kóng, ' Tsú ê lō͘ bô kong-pêⁿ! ' I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, Guá ê lō͘ kám bô kong-pêⁿ? Kám m̄-sī lín ê lō͘ bô kong-pêⁿ?
English: Yet says the house of Israel, The way of the Lord is not equal. house of Israel, are not my ways equal? are not your ways unequal?

Tailo: I ê lu̍t-lē lóng tī guá ê bīn-tsîng; I ê lé-gî, guá m̄-bat khì-sak.
English: For all his ordinances were before me. I didn't put away his statutes from me.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú ê siū-khì kàu lia̍t kok, tuì in ê kun-tuī tuā siū-khì, gí-tiāⁿ lóng beh kā in bia̍t-tiāu, kā in kau hō͘ lâng thâi.
English: For Yahweh is enraged against all the nations, And angry with all their armies. He has utterly destroyed them. He has given them over for slaughter.

Tailo: Tī hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí, Guá beh īng Guá ê Sìng Sîn kàng-lo̍h tī lô͘-po̍k kah lú-pī.
English: And also on the servants and on the handmaids in those days, I will pour out my Spirit.

Tailo: Lán tsai, só͘-ū siū-tsō-bu̍t tsit-má iáu-teh thó͘-khuì ai-kiò, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh king-giām sing-sán ê thòng-khó͘.
English: For we know that the whole creation groans and travails in pain together until now.

Tailo: Tsháu-me̍h ē tshiong-muá lí ê tshù kah lí ê tsìng jîn-sîn ê tshù, í-ki̍p só͘-ū Ai-gi̍p lâng ê tshù, tuì lí ê lāu-pē kah lí ê tsó͘-sian tshut-sì kàu taⁿ, m̄-bat khuàⁿ-tio̍h án-ne. ' Mô͘-se tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin, lī-khui Huâ-láu tshut-.khì.
English: Your houses shall be filled, and the houses of all your servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians; as neither your fathers nor your fathers' fathers have seen, since the day that they were on the earth to this day.' He turned, and went out from Pharaoh.

Tailo: Lín kah sí-bông só͘ li̍p ê iok it-tīng ē siū huì-tû, kah im-hú só͘ kiat ê bîng it-tīng khiā bē-tiâu. Tsai-hō tuā liû-hîng ê sî, lín ē siū-tio̍h i thún-ta̍h.
English: Your covenant with death shall be annulled, and your agreement with Sheol shall not stand. When the overflowing scourge passes through, then you will be trampled down by it.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú í-guā, siáⁿ lâng sī Siōng-tè? Lán ê Siōng-tsú í-guā, siáⁿ lâng sī tsio̍h-puâⁿ?
English: For who is God, save Yahweh? Who is a rock, save our God?

Tailo: Siâ-sîn tsi̍t ē hō͘ I-é-su kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, é-káu ê tsiū khai-sí kóng-uē. Hiah-ê kûn-tsiòng lóng tio̍h-kiaⁿ, kóng, Tī I-su-la-el, guán m̄-bat khuàⁿ-kuè tsit khuán tāi-tsì.
English: When the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. The multitudes marveled, saying, Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!

Tailo: Tsè-si kā tshiú tiong só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê iû, buah tī hit-ê ài tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng tsiànn pîng ê hīnn-á-suê kah tsiàⁿ tshiú ê tuā-thâu-bú, í-ki̍p tsiàⁿ-kha ê tuā-thâu-bú, to̍h-sī buah tha̍h tī pó͘ kuè-si̍t tsè ê hueh tíng-bīn.
English: The priest shall put some of the rest of the oil that is in his hand on the tip of the right ear of him who is to be cleansed, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the trespass offering.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōng-tsú só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê tāi-tsì, tsiàu án-ne kiâⁿ i ê tsó͘-sian Ta-bi̍t só͘-ū ê lō͘, bô phian tsó, mā bô phian iū.
English: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, and walked in the ways of David his father, and didn't turn aside to the right hand or to the left.

Tailo: I ài lín ta̍k lâng ē-hiáu īng sìng-kiat kah tsun-kuì, lâi siú ka-kī ê sing-khu,
English: that each one of you know how to possess himself of his own vessel in sanctification and honor,

Tailo: I tsiū kā tsi̍t tuì gû tshiat-tsò tsi̍t tè tsi̍t tè, kau-tài sù-tsiá sàng khì-kàu I-su-la-el ê tsuân kíng, kóng, Kiàn-nā bô tshut-lâi kin-tuè Sàu-lô kah Sa-mu-el ê, mā beh án-ne khuán-thāi i ê gû. Siōng-tsú hō͘ jîn-bîn khí kiaⁿ, in tsiū hô-tsê lóng tshut-.lâi.
English: He took a yoke of oxen, and cut them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, Whoever doesn't come forth after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen. The dread of Yahweh fell on the people, and they came out as one man.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ Siōng-tè, mā tio̍h thiàⁿ hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē, tse sī lán tuì Ki-tok niá-siū ê kài-bīng.
English: This commandment we have from him, that he who loves God should also love his brother.

Tailo: Na-o-mih kā i ê sim-pū kóng, Guān i tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú sù-hok, to̍h-sī si un hō͘ ua̍h-lâng kah sí-lâng bô suah ê. Na-o-mih koh kóng, Hit-ê lâng sī lán ê tshin-lâng, sī lán tshin-tso̍k ê tsi̍t-ê, thang sio̍k-huê lán ê sán-gia̍p.
English: Naomi said to her daughter-in-law, Blessed be he of Yahweh, who has not left off his kindness to the living and to the dead. Naomi said to her, The man is a close relative to us, one of our near kinsmen.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bô beh tsun-thàn lí ê Siōng-tè ê lu̍t-huat kah ông ê lu̍t-huat, tsiū tio̍h sió-sim tīng i ê tsuē, á-.sī hō͘ i sí, á-.sī tshiong-kun, á-.sī tshau-ka, á-.sī kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ.
English: Whoever will not do the law of your God, and the law of the king, let judgment be executed on him with all diligence, whether it be to death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.

Tailo: Ta̍k tsá-khí guá beh siau-bia̍t kok lāi ê pháiⁿ lâng, thang kā só͘-ū tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng tuì Siōng-tsú ê siâⁿ tû-.khì.
English: Morning by morning, I will destroy all the wicked of the land; To cut off all the workers of iniquity from Yahweh's city.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h tsiah-ê jîn-bîn it-tshè ê pháiⁿ, to̍h-sī lī-khui Guá, ǹg pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng sio hiuⁿ; kuī-pài in ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê, Guá beh kóng-khí Guá ê phuàⁿ-tuàn lâi kā in kong-kik.
English: I will utter my judgments against them touching all their wickedness, in that they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, and worshiped the works of their own hands.

Tailo: In-uī i ū su-khó, huê-thâu lī-khui i só͘ huān it-tshè ê tsuē-kò, i it-tīng ē ua̍h, bē sí.
English: Because he considers, and turns away from all his transgressions that he has committed, he shall surely live, he shall not die.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, kau-tsiàn ê sè-bīn ná lâi ná bíng-lia̍t, ū lâng hû ông tī tshia-.ni̍h, tí-tòng A-lâm lâng. Kàu ji̍t àm, ông tsiū sí, hueh tuì tio̍h-siong ê só͘-tsāi lâu kàu tshia-té.
English: The battle increased that day: and the king was stayed up in his chariot against the Syrians, and died at even; and the blood ran out of the wound into the bottom of the chariot.

Tailo: Hit tong-sî, bûn-tô͘ bē liáu-kái tsiah-ê tāi-tsì. Kàu I-é-su tit-tio̍h îng-kng ê sî, in tsiah siūⁿ-khí king-tián ū kì-tsài tsiah-ê tāi-tsì sī teh tsí I-é-su, mā kó-jiân tī I-é-su ê sin tsiūⁿ si̍t-hiān tsiah-ê tāi-tsì.
English: His disciples didn't understand these things at first, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him, and that they had done these things to him.

Tailo: Guá tsá-tsîng kah kûn-tsiòng tsò-tīn khì, tshuā in lâi-kàu Siōng-tè ê tshù, īng huann-hí o-ló ê siann kah tāi-ke siú tseh. Guá tui-liām tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, guá ê sim hui-siông pi-siong.
English: These things I remember, and pour out my soul within me, How I used to go with the crowd, and led them to the house of God, With the voice of joy and praise, a multitude keeping a holy day.

Tailo: Ông tsiū bīng-līng Io-ho-iá-tah ê kiáⁿ Be-ná-iah, i tsiū tshut-khì kā i phah-sí. Tsiū án-ne, kok-uī kian-kò͘ tī Só͘-lô-móng ê tshiú.
English: So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he went out, and fell on him, so that he died. The kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Tē-tshit ji̍t , king-tián ū tsi̍t-ê só͘-tsāi án-ne kóng, Siōng-tè tī tē-tshit ji̍t, suah I it-tshè ê kang-tsok lâi an-hioh. ( tsù, CSK 2:2 )
English: For he has said this somewhere about the seventh day, God rested on the seventh day from all his works;

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh bé tsi̍t tè iù-tē pò͘ lâi, kā I-é-su tuì si̍p-jī-kè tíng siu lo̍h-.lâi, īng iù-tē pò͘ pau sin-si, kā I an tsòng tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ só͘ phah ê bōng. I mā kō tsi̍t tè tsio̍h-thâu lâi that tī bōng-kháu.
English: He bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been cut out of a rock. He rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.

Tailo: I koh phak lo̍h-khì kā i pài, kóng, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Sī tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t tsiah sí-káu, lí kìng-jiân khuàⁿ-kò͘ guá!
English: He did obeisance, and said, What is your servant, that you should look on such a dead dog as I am?

Tailo: Tshim-ian kā in khàm khí-.lâi; in tshin-tshiūnn tsio̍h-thâu, tuī kàu tshim ê só͘-tsāi.
English: The deeps cover them. They went down into the depths like a stone.

Tailo: Le-ah kah i ê gín-á mā tsìn-tsîng lâi pài, lō͘-bué Iô-sé-huh kah La̍h-khel mā tsìn-tsîng lâi pài.
English: Leah also and her children came near, and bowed themselves. After them, Joseph came near with Rachel, and they bowed themselves.

Tailo: I ê lé-mi̍h to̍h-sī tsi̍t-ê gîn-puâⁿ, tāng tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel, tsi̍t-ê gîn-uáⁿ, tāng tshit-tsa̍p si-khel, lóng sī tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel; tsit nn̄g-ê té-muá tiâu-hô iû ê iù mī-hún, tsò sò͘-tsè;
English: gave his offering: one silver platter, the weight of which was one hundred thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mixed with oil for a meal offering;

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín tio̍h tsò hó sū, m̄-thang siūⁿ siān.
English: But you, brothers, don't be weary in doing well.

Tailo: I khan sio-tsè ê mî-iûⁿ-káng lâi, A-lông kah i ê kiáⁿ tī mî-iûⁿ-káng ê thâu-khak huāⁿ-tshiú.
English: He presented the ram of the burnt offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram.

Tailo: Iô-tah lâng kong-kik Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tsing-ho̍k i, īng to kā in thâi-sí, koh pàng hué sio siâⁿ.
English: The children of Judah fought against Jerusalem, and took it, and struck it with the edge of the sword, and set the city on fire.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h huan-hù lâng tī ua̍h-tsuí ê tíng-bīn thâi hit nn̄g tsiah tsiáu ê tsi̍t tsiah, tī huî-khì lāi.
English: The priest shall command them to kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel over running water.

Tailo: Sin-lông khah uànn kàu, hiah-ê tsāi-sik-lí suah lóng tuh-ku khùn-.khì.
English: Now while the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.

Tailo: Lūn-kàu sìn Tsú ê guā-pang lâng, guán í-king ū kià phue kā in kóng guán ê tshâi-kuat, m̄-thang tsia̍h tsè-kuè ngó͘-siōng ê mi̍h, hueh kah ni̍h-sí ê tsing-seⁿ, mā m̄-thang îm-luān.
English: But concerning the Gentiles who believe, we have written our decision that they should observe no such thing, except that they should keep themselves from food offered to idols, from blood, from strangled things, and from sexual immorality.

Tailo: Siōng-tè kì-jiân kóng-khí sin ê iok, tsiū hō͘ thâu tsi̍t-ê iok piàn-tsò kū ê. Hit-ê tsiām-tsiām kū khì koh sue-thè ê tsiū ē liâm-piⁿ siau-sit-.khì.
English: In that he says, A new covenant, he has made the first old. But that which is becoming old and grows aged is near to vanishing away.

Tailo: Tsit tè tsio̍h tuì lín tsiah-ê sìn ê lâng lâi kóng sī tsin pó-kuì, m̄-koh, tuì hiah-ê m̄-sìn ê lâng sī, khí-tsù sai-hū só͘ khì-sak ê tsio̍h, í-king tsiâⁿ-tsò tshù-kak-thâu siōng tiōng-iàu ê tsio̍h. ( Tsù, SPh 118:22 )
English: For you therefore who believe is the honor, but for such as are disobedient, The stone which the builders rejected, Has become the chief cornerstone,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Sia-huánn ê kiáⁿ A-hi-kam pó-hō͘ I-é-lí-miah, tsiah bô kau tī jîn-bîn ê tshiú hō͘ i sí.
English: But the hand of Ahikam the son of Shaphan was with Jeremiah, that they should not give him into the hand of the people to put him to death.

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ Ne-bu-tsa-la-tàn, thài-kàm ê thâu Ne-bu-sia-tsu-ban, tsheⁿ-siōng-ka ê thâu Nî-kah-sat-lī-siat kah Ba-bú-lông ông hiah-ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ,
English: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent, and Nebushazban, Rabsaris, and Nergal Sharezer, Rabmag, and all the chief officers of the king of Babylon;

Tailo: I-su-la-el lâng kóng, Tī I-su-la-el tsìng tsi-tso̍k tiong, siáⁿ lâng bô kah huē-tsiòng khì Siōng-tsú hia? In-uī in tuā tsiù-tsuā kóng, Kiàn-nā bô tsiūⁿ Mi-su-peh kàu Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng ê, tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: The children of Israel said, Who is there among all the tribes of Israel who didn't come up in the assembly to Yahweh? For they had made a great oath concerning him who didn't come up to Yahweh to Mizpah, saying, He shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī beh īng in lâi tshì-giām I-su-la-el lâng, khuànn in khíng tsun-thàn Siōng-tsú thok Mô͘-se só͘ bīng-līng in tsó͘-sian ê kài-bīng á-bô.
English: They were left, to prove Israel by them, to know whether they would listen to the commandments of Yahweh, which he commanded their fathers by Moses.

Tailo: Tio̍h tû-khì lín tiong-kan só͘-ū ê khó͘-to̍k, uàn-hūn, siū-khì, pháiⁿ sìng-tē, huí-pòng kah it-tshè ê ok-to̍k.
English: Let all bitterness, wrath, anger, outcry, and slander, be put away from you, with all malice.

Tailo: ( Ta-bi̍t ê si. ) Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó, àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá ê khún-kiû; tsiàu Lí ê sìn-si̍t, tsiàu Lí ê kong-gī lâi ìn-tap guá.
English: Hear my prayer, Yahweh. Listen to my petitions. In your faithfulness and righteousness, relieve me.

Tailo: I ê tiōng-hu tuè i ê āu-bīn, ná kiâⁿ ná háu, kah i lâi-kàu Ba-hu-lîm. Ap-nel kā i kóng, Lí tò tńg-.khì! I tsiū tò tńg-.khì.
English: Her husband went with her, weeping as he went, and followed her to Bahurim. Then said Abner to him, Go, return: and he returned.

Tailo: Koh tsiàu i ê khuì-la̍t tshú nn̄g tsiah pan-kah á-.sī nn̄g tsiah hún-tsiáu-kiáⁿ, tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio-tsè.
English: and two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, such as he is able to afford; and the one shall be a sin offering, and the other a burnt offering.

Tailo: Tio̍h ū peh-ê pán kah tsa̍p-la̍k-ê gîn khū, tsit-ê pán ê ē-bīn ū nn̄g-ê khū, hit-ê pán ê ē-bīn mā ū nn̄g-ê khū.
English: There shall be eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.

Tailo: I tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ thìng-hāu, in tńg-lâi-kàu i hia, i kā in kóng, Guá kám bô kā lín kóng, m̄-thang khì?
English: They came back to him, while he stayed at Jericho; and he said to them, Didn't I tell you, Don't go?'

Tailo: Mô͘-ap bô koh siū o-ló, ū lâng tī He-si-bóng kè-bô͘ beh hāi i, kóng: Lâi lah, lán lâi kā i tsián-tû, hō͘ i bô koh tsiâⁿ-tsò kok. Mat-mén, lí mā tio̍h tiām-tiām, mài tshut siaⁿ; to-kiàm beh jiok lí.
English: The praise of Moab is no more; in Heshbon they have devised evil against her: Come, and let us cut her off from being a nation. You also, Madmen, shall be brought to silence: the sword shall pursue you.

Tailo: Thong-kuè tiong-si̍t ê hiann-tī Se-la̍h, guá siá tsit tiuⁿ té-té ê phue hō͘ lín, lâi bián-lē lín, mā kiàn-tsìng tse sī Siōng-tè tsin-si̍t ê un-tián. Lín tio̍h tī tsit-ê un-tián tíng-bīn khiā tsāi.
English: Through Silvanus, our faithful brother, as I consider him, I have written to you briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God in which you stand.

Tailo: Kàu beh khui-toh ê sî, tshe i ê lô͘-po̍k kā só͘ tshiánn ê lâng kóng, ' Tshiánn lín tio̍h lâi, ta̍k hāng lóng tsún-pī hó-sè à. '
English: He sent out his servant at supper time to tell those who were invited, Come, for everything is ready now.'

Tailo: Jiáu-luān pîng-tsīng liáu-āu, Páu-lô tiàu-tsi̍p bûn-tô͘, kā in kó͘-lē, jiân-āu kah in sio-sî, tsiū tshut-huat khì Ma-ke-tó-niah.
English: After the uproar had ceased, Paul sent for the disciples, took leave of them, and departed to go into Macedonia.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tsin tsē lâng īng ka-kī ê saⁿ pho͘ tuà lō͘-.ni̍h, mā ū lâng tshò tshiū-ki lâi pho͘ tuà lō͘-.ni̍h.
English: A very great multitude spread their clothes on the road. Others cut branches from the trees, and spread them on the road.

Tailo: Guá ê tshuì beh kóng-tshut tsin-si̍t; guá ê tshuì-tûn uàn-hūn pháiⁿ tāi.
English: For my mouth speaks truth. Wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

Tailo: Guá sī Páu-lô, uī-tio̍h Ki-tok I-é-su lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò siû-huān. Guá kah lán ê hiann-tī Tî-mó͘-theh siá phue hō͘ guán só͘ thiàⁿ ê tâng-kang Hui-lé-móng,
English: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,

Tailo: Tsìng lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē, lóng tsin kám-tōng, tuì Piat-tò͘ kah kî-tha ê sù-tô͘ kóng, Hiann-tī, guán tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsò?
English: Now when they heard this, they were cut to the heart, and said to Peter and the rest of the apostles, Brothers, what shall we do?

Tailo: Lín tsit-má suî-jiân iáu-teh siū tsióng-tsióng ê tshì-liān, tsiām-sî sim kan-khó͘, mā tio̍h in-uī án-ne lâi huann-hí.
English: Wherein you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while, if need be, you have been put to grief in various trials,

Tailo: Lí tsik-pī kiau-ngō͘ siū tsiù-tsó͘ ê lâng, to̍h-sī bê-lō͘ lī-khui Lí ê kài-bīng ê lâng.
English: You have rebuked the proud who are cursed, Who wander from your commandments.

Tailo: I tio̍h koh īng i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê ji̍t, hun-pia̍t lâi kui Siōng-tsú, koh tio̍h khan tsi̍t tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè; tsóng-.sī, í-tsîng ê ji̍t bô sǹg-siàu, in-uī i ka-kī hun-pia̍t tsò sìng ê í-king bô tshing-khì.
English: He shall separate to Yahweh the days of his separation, and shall bring a male lamb a year old for a trespass offering; but the former days shall be void, because his separation was defiled.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsìng lâng lâi-kàu Ba-al ê biō, kā i thiah-huí, phah-tshuì i hiah-ê tuâⁿ kah ngó͘-siōng, koh tī tuâⁿ tsîng phah-sí Ba-al ê tsè-si Mat-than.
English: All the people went to the house of Baal, and broke it down, and broke his altars and his images in pieces, and killed Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, uī-tio̍h lín ê iân-kò͘, guá koh khah ing-kai ua̍h lo̍h-.khì.
English: Yet, to remain in the flesh is more needful for your sake.

Tailo: King-tián ū kì-tsài, I hō͘ lâng sǹg-tsò put-huat ê lâng. ( tsù, ISI 53:12 ) Tsit-kù uē it-tīng ē ìng-giām tī guá ê sin tsiūⁿ. Sū-si̍t siōng, king-tián só͘ kì-tsài kuan-hē guá ê tāi-tsì í-king teh beh ìng-giām ā.
English: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: He was counted with the lawless.' For that which concerns me has an end.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h sūn-ho̍k Siōng-tè, huán-khòng Mô͘-kuí, Mô͘-kuí tsiū ē siám-phiah lín.
English: Be subject therefore to God. But resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú kóng: I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn, Guá uī-tio̍h Guá ê miâ ê iân-kò͘, bô tsiàu lín ê pháiⁿ só͘ kiâⁿ kah lín ê hú-pāi ê só͘ tsò kā lín khuán-thāi. Lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōng-tsú.
English: You shall know that I am Yahweh, when I have dealt with you for my name's sake, not according to your evil ways, nor according to your corrupt doings, you house of Israel, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Sè-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn kah tuà tī tē-tsiūⁿ ê lâng, suaⁿ tíng khiā tuā kî ê sî, lín tio̍h khuànn; pûn sàu-kak ê sî, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ.
English: All you inhabitants of the world, and you dwellers on the earth, when an banner is lifted up on the mountains, look! When the trumpet is blown, listen!

Tailo: In-uī lín īng sing-khu, īng king-kah-thâu kheh in, īng lín ê kak tak phuà-pēⁿ ê, tì-sú hō͘ in sì-suàⁿ tī guā-bīn.
English: Because you thrust with side and with shoulder, and push all the diseased with your horns, until you have scattered them abroad;

Tailo: Kàu hit sî, tsit-ê kuân-tuā, phuê-hu kng-ku̍t ê jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī tuì khai-kok í-lâi hui-siông thang kiaⁿ, hun tē-kài kā lâng thún-ta̍h ê, in ê tē ū kang-hô hun-khui, in ē kā lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú, to̍h-sī hiàn-kàu Si-óng suaⁿ, Siōng-tsú an-tì I ê miâ ê só͘-tsāi.
English: In that time, a present will be brought to Yahweh of Armies from a people tall and smooth, even from a people awesome from their beginning onward, a nation that measures out and treads down, whose land the rivers divide, to the place of the name of Yahweh of Armies, Mount Zion.

Tailo: Ba-bú-lông pîng-sî sī Siōng-tsú tshiú lāi ê kim pue, hō͘ tsuân tē ê lâng tsuì; lia̍t pang bat lim i ê tsiú, só͘-í lia̍t-pang khí-kông.
English: Babylon has been a golden cup in Yahweh's hand, who made all the earth drunken: the nations have drunk of her wine; therefore the nations are mad.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā Guá ê siū-khì kah Guá ê thòng-hūn piàⁿ tī tsit só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī piàⁿ tī lâng kah tsing-seⁿ, í-ki̍p tshân-iá ê tshiū-ba̍k kah thó͘-tē ê tshut-sán, tshin-tshiūnn hué teh to̍h bē hua.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Behold, my anger and my wrath shall be poured out on this place, on man, and on animal, and on the trees of the field, and on the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.

Tailo: kiû Lí tuì thiⁿ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê sî, tsiū lâi sià-bián Lí ê tsú-bîn — I-su-la-el lâng ê tsuē, hō͘ in tńg-lâi Lí só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in kah in tsó͘-sian ê tē.
English: then hear from heaven, and forgive the sin of your people Israel, and bring them again to the land which you gave to them and to their fathers.

Tailo: Só͘-í, kī-tsua̍t tsit-ê kà-sī, m̄-sī kī-tsua̍t lâng, sī teh kī-tsua̍t siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín Sìng Sîn ê Siōng-tè.
English: Therefore he who rejects doesn't reject man, but God, who has also given his Holy Spirit to you.

Tailo: Si̍t-tsāi ū khau-sé guá ê lâng tī guá ê sì-kho͘-uî; guá ê ba̍k-tsiu tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h in tshì-kik guá ê tāi-tsì.
English: Surely there are mockers with me, My eye dwells on their provocation.

Tailo: Guán tuì Tho͘-lo-a tsē tsûn, it-ti̍t khì-kàu Sa-mô͘-thá-keh, keh tńg kang lâi-kàu Nî-a-pho-lī.
English: Setting sail therefore from Troas, we made a straight course to Samothrace, and the day following to Neapolis;

Tailo: Siōng-tè ah, guán tī Lí ê tiān lāi, siàu-liām Lí ê tsû-ài.
English: We have thought about your loving kindness, God, In the midst of your temple.

Tailo: Tho-má-suh, mā kiò-tsò Ti-tu-mô͘ ( siang-seⁿ-á ê ì-sù ) , sī tsa̍p-jī bûn-tô͘ ê tsi̍t-ê, I-é-su kàu ê sî, i bô tsò-hué tī hia.
English: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn't with them when Jesus came.

Tailo: Guá tú-tio̍h tsai-lān ê ji̍t, in lâi kong-kik guá; tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú sī guá ê khò suaⁿ.
English: They came on me in the day of my calamity, But Yahweh was my support.

Tailo: Hó-gia̍h lâng kuán-hat sàn-tshiah lâng; khiàm-tsè ê lâng tsò tsè-tsú ê tshe-īng.
English: The rich rule over the poor. The borrower is servant to the lender.

Tailo: Guá beh tsik-tsū tsai-hō tī in ê tíng-bīn, īng Guá só͘-ū ê tsìnn lâi siā in.
English: I will heap evils on them; I will spend my arrows on them:

Tailo: Bián-liû beh kui tī He-lêm ( Tsù, Mā kiò-tsò Hel-tāi ) , To-bi-iah, Ia-ta-iah kah Tse-huán-iah ê kiáⁿ — Hiân ( Tsiū-sī Io-si-iah ) , hē tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān tsò kì-liām.
English: The crowns shall be to Helem, and to Tobijah, and to Jedaiah, and to Hen the son of Zephaniah, for a memorial in the temple of Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá ka-kī mā m̄-bat I, to̍k-to̍k tshe guá lâi īng tsuí kā lâng sé-lé ê hit uī Siōng-tè ū kā guá kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, Sìng Sîn kàng-lîm hioh tī I tíng-bīn, I to̍h-sī beh īng Sìng Sîn kā lâng sé-lé ê hit uī. '
English: I didn't recognize him, but he who sent me to baptize in water, he said to me, On whomever you will see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.'

Tailo: Suan-hua ê siann tsi̍t-ē huat, tsìng lâng tô-tsáu; lí tsi̍t-ē khí-.lâi, lia̍t kok sì-suàⁿ.
English: At the noise of the thunder, the peoples have fled. When you lift yourself up, the nations are scattered.

Tailo: I ê ui-hong thang kiaⁿ, phuàⁿ-tuàn kah kuân-sè lóng tshut tī i ka-kī ê ì-sù.
English: They are feared and dreaded. Their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.

Tailo: I-é-su tī in ê bīn-tsîng piàn-uāⁿ hîng-siōng. I ê bīn tshin-tshiūnn ji̍t huat kng, I ê saⁿ pe̍h kah kng iàⁿ-iàⁿ.
English: He was transfigured before them. His face shone like the sun, and his garments became as white as the light.

Tailo: In it-tīng bô khang-khang lô-khó͘, só͘ seⁿ ê mā bô tú-tio̍h tsai-hāi, in-uī in lóng sī tit-tio̍h Siōng-tsú sù-hok ê lâng ê kiáⁿ-sun; in ê kiáⁿ-sun mā beh kah i ū hūn.
English: They shall not labor in vain, nor bring forth for calamity; for they are the seed of the blessed of Yahweh, and their offspring with them.

Tailo: I-é-su mn̄g in kóng, Lín ū guā tsē piáⁿ, khì khuàⁿ-māi lè. In khuàⁿ-liáu, tsiū kóng, Ū gō͘ tè piáⁿ, mā ū nn̄g bué hî.
English: He said to them, How many loaves do you have? Go see. When they knew, they said, Five, and two fish.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kóng, tsì-kuân Siōng-tsú án-ne kóng: Tsit-ê siâⁿ, ū lâu lâng ê hueh tī hit lāi-bīn, hō͘ i ê ji̍t-tsí kàu, koh tsng ngó͘-siōng lâi kā ka-kī uè lah-sap, hām-hāi ka-kī.
English: You shall say, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: A city that sheds blood in the midst of her, that her time may come, and that makes idols against herself to defile her!

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kìng-uì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, ho̍k-sāi I, kah I kiat-liân, kí I ê miâ lâi tsiù-tsuā.
English: You shall fear Yahweh your God; him shall you serve; and to him shall you cleave, and by his name shall you swear.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōng-tsú — i ê Siōng-tè só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì. Sian-ti I-é-lí-miah kā Siōng-tsú só͘ huan-hù ê thuân hō͘ i, tī Siōng-tsú ê bīn-tsîng, i iû-guân bô ka-kī khiam-pi.
English: and he did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh his God; he didn't humble himself before Jeremiah the prophet speaking from the mouth of Yahweh.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng teh tng-tán guá, beh kā guá tû-bia̍t, tsóng-.sī, guá beh káng-kiù Lí ê kà-sī.
English: The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me. I will consider your statutes.

Tailo: Kah lí pêⁿ-pêⁿ siū Siōng-tè kíng-suán ê tsí-muē ê kiáⁿ-jî, mā kā lí tshíng-an.
English: The children of your chosen sister greet you. Amen.

Tailo: Guá ná ē tshut thai lâi tú-tio̍h lô-khó͘ iu-siong, hō͘ guá ê nî-ji̍t in-uī kiàn-siàu lâi siau-bia̍t?
English: Why came I forth out of the womb to see labor and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?

Tailo: Tī I ê tsè-si tiong ū Mô͘-se kah A-lông; tī kiû-kiò I ê miâ ê lâng ê tiong-kan ū Sa-mu-el. In kiû-kiò Siōng-tsú, I tsiū thiaⁿ in ê kî-kiû.
English: Moses and Aaron were among his priests, Samuel among those who call on his name; They called on Yahweh, and he answered them.

Tailo: Guá kā hit nn̄g tè pi tuì guá ê siang tshiú hiat lo̍h-.khì, phah-tn̄g tī lín ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng.
English: I took hold of the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and broke them before your eyes.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h mî-iûⁿ-káng, lí tio̍h tsún-pī iù ê mī-hún gō͘-hūn tsi-it e-huat kah iû saⁿ-hūn tsi-it hin, tiâu-hô tsò sò͘-tsè.
English: Or for a ram, you shall prepare for a meal offering two tenth parts of an ephah of fine flour mixed with the third part of a hin of oil:

Tailo: Guá beh kàng hué tī Tu-lô ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, kā i ê kiong-tiān sio bia̍t-tiāu.
English: But I will send a fire on the wall of Tyre, And it will devour its palaces.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kah i ê sè-î í-ki̍p lô͘-po̍k khí-lâi beh khí-kiâⁿ, i ê tiūⁿ-lâng, to̍h-sī tsa-bó͘ gín-á ê lāu-pē, kā i kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t beh àm à, tshiáⁿ lí koh hioh tsi̍t mê, ji̍t-thâu beh lo̍h suaⁿ à, lí tio̍h hioh tsia, hō͘ lí ê sim khuài-lo̍k, bîn-á-tsài thàu-tsá tsiah tshut-huat tò tńg-khì lín tau.
English: When the man rose up to depart, he, and his concubine, and his servant, his father-in-law, the young lady's father, said to him, Behold, now the day draws toward evening, please stay all night: behold, the day grows to an end, lodge here, that your heart may be merry; and tomorrow get you early on your way, that you may go home.

Tailo: Guá ē hō͘ lí ê ke tshin-tshiūnn Ne-bat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am ê ke, koh tshin-tshiūnn A-hi-iah ê kiáⁿ Ba-siah ê ke, in-uī lí ū puē-gi̍k kik-tōng Guá siū-khì ê tāi-tsì, koh hō͘ I-su-la-el huān tsuē. '
English: and I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah for the provocation with which you have provoked me to anger, and have made Israel to sin.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ gín-á tsáu tńg-.khì, tsiàu tsiah-ê ē kā in lāu-bú tsuân ke ê lâng kóng.
English: The young lady ran, and told her mother's house about these words.

Tailo: Kā in tsō ê, uá-khò in ê, lóng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ in.
English: Those who make them will be like them; Yes, everyone who trusts in them.

Tailo: I-é-su tsiū bīng-līng in m̄-thang kā I ê tāi-tsì kā lâng kóng.
English: He charged them that they should tell no one about him.

Tailo: Tsû-ài mā sī sio̍k tī I; Tsú ah, Lí tsiàu ta̍k lâng só͘ tsò ê lâi kā i pò-ìng.
English: Also to you, Lord, belongs loving kindness, For you reward every man according to his work.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, lí nā bô huann-hí i, tsiū tio̍h hō͘ i tshut-tsāi i ê ì-sù tshut-.khì, tsua̍t-tuì m̄-thang bē-tsîⁿ, mā m̄-thang tòng-tsò lú-pī kā i khuán-thāi, in-uī lí í-king kah i sîng-tshin.
English: It shall be, if you have no delight in her, then you shall let her go where she will; but you shall not sell her at all for money, you shall not deal with her as a slave, because you have humbled her.

Tailo: Lán mā tsai Siōng-tè ê Kiáⁿ í-king lîm-kàu, I koh hō͘ lán hiáu-ngō͘, lâi jīn-bat hit uī tsin-si̍t ê Siōng-tè. Lán kah tsin-si̍t ê Siōng-tè kiat-liân, in-uī lán kah I ê Kiáⁿ I-é-su Ki-tok mā ū kiat-liân. tsit uī sī tsin-si̍t ê Siōng-tè, mā sī íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: We know that the Son of God has come, and has given us an understanding, that we know him who is true, and we are in him who is true, in his Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God, and eternal life.

Tailo: Iô-tah kah i ê hiann-tī kàu Iô-sé-huh ê tshù, Iô-sé-huh iáu tī hia, in tsiū tī i ê bīn-tsîng phak lo̍h tē.
English: Judah and his brothers came to Joseph's house, and he was still there. They fell on the ground before him.

Tailo: Guá beh tī Lí ê lu̍t-lē tiong ka-kī khuài-lo̍k; guá bô bē kì-tit Lí ê uē.
English: I will delight myself in your statutes. I will not forget your word. GIMEL

Tailo: Siōng-tsú huan-hù Mô͘-se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Ia-be-tsuh pí i ê tsìng hiann-tī khah tsun-kuì, i ê lāu-bú kā i hō-miâ Ia-be-tsuh, to̍h-sī kóng: guá seⁿ i sī tsin kan-khó͘.
English: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers: and his mother named him Jabez, saying, Because I bore him with sorrow.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú tuì thiⁿ khí luî, Tsì-kuân-.ê huat-tshut I ê siann.
English: Yahweh thundered from heaven, The Most High uttered his voice.

Tailo: Kuan-hē tsit-ê lâng, ū kì-tsài, guá tshe guá ê sù-tsiá tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng; i beh tsò Lí ê sian-hong, kā Lí khui lō͘. ( tsù, MLK 3:1 )
English: For this is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.'

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng it-sing ê ji̍t-tsí sī thòng-khó͘, to̍h-sī uī kiông-pō ê lâng só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê nî-sò͘.
English: The wicked man travails with pain all his days, Even the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor.

Tailo: I uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê siū-khì pho͘-pêⁿ I ê lō͘, hō͘ in ê sèⁿ-miā bē bián-tit sí, I kā in ê ua̍h-miā kau hō͘ un-i̍k.
English: He made a path for his anger. He didn't spare their soul from death, But gave their life over to the pestilence,

Tailo: Lí kám ē iô-tāng hō͘ hong tshue ê tshiū-hio̍h? Lí kám ē khì jiok ta-.khì ê tsháu?
English: Will you harass a driven leaf? Will you pursue the dry stubble?

Tailo: Guá koh uī ka-kī tsik-tsū kim-gîn, kah lia̍t ông í-ki̍p ta̍k síng ê tsâi-pó, koh tit-tio̍h tshiùⁿ kua ê lâm-lí, kah sè-kan lâng só͘ huann-hí ê mi̍h, koh ū tsin tsē kiong-hui.
English: I also gathered silver and gold for myself, and the treasure of kings and of the provinces. I got myself male and female singers, and the delights of the sons of menmusical instruments, and that of all sorts.

Tailo: hit-ê tē-kài koh thàng-kàu Ik-lóng piⁿ-á ê pak pîng, hit-ê tē-kài suà-kàu Si-kí-lûn, king-kuè kàu Ba-la̍h suaⁿ, koh thàng-kàu Ngá-pí-liap, tsit-ê tē-kài kàu hái uî-tsí.
English: and the border went out to the side of Ekron northward; and the border extended to Shikkeron, and passed along to Mount Baalah, and went out at Jabneel; and the goings out of the border were at the sea.

Tailo: In-uī lín kóng, ' Siōng-tsú tī Ba-bú-lông kā guán hing-khí sian-ti'.
English: Because you have said, Yahweh has raised us up prophets in Babylon;

Tailo: Koh niû sī-uē pâng, ta̍k king tn̂g tsi̍t ko-tshioh, khuah tsi̍t ko-tshioh, sio-lī gō͘ tiú; mn̂g ê hō͘-tīng, to̍h-sī uá-kīn ǹg tshù ê mn̂g ê mn̂g-lông, khuah tsi̍t ko-tshioh.
English: Every lodge was one reed long, and one reed broad; and the space between the lodges was five cubits; and the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate toward the house was one reed.

Tailo: Guá koh beh hō͘ ki-hng kah ok-siù lîm-kàu tī lín hia, in ē hō͘ lín ê kiáⁿ sí liáu-liáu; jî-tshiánn un-i̍k kah thâi lâng ê tāi-tsì mā ē tī lín hia liû-hîng; Guá mā beh hō͘ to-kiàm lîm-kàu lín. Tse sī Siōng-tsú kóng ê.
English: and I will send on you famine and evil animals, and they shall bereave you; and pestilence and blood shall pass through you; and I will bring the sword on you: I, Yahweh, have spoken it.

Tailo: Sian-ti mā ū kóng-khí kah tsit-ê tāi-tsì kāng-khuán ì-sù ê uē.
English: This agrees with the words of the prophets. As it is written,

Tailo: I-é-hú-thah tńg-lâi Mi-su-peh lâi-kàu ka-kī ê tshù, hit sî i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ gia̍h lin-long-kó͘ thiàu-bú, tshut-lâi kā i gîng-tsiap, tsit-ê sī i to̍k-seⁿ ê, í-guā bô kiáⁿ, bô tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Jephthah came to Mizpah to his house; and behold, his daughter came out to meet him with tambourines and with dances: and she was his only child; besides her he had neither son nor daughter.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, Lín tī tē-tsiūⁿ só͘ kìm-tsí ê, tī thinn-tíng mā ē kā i kìm-tsí. Lín tī tē-tsiūⁿ ín-tsún ê, tī thinn-tíng mā ē kā i ín-tsún.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, whatever things you will bind on earth will be have been bound in heaven, and whatever things you will release on earth will have been released in heaven.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ìn kóng, Guán tsua̍t-tuì bô ì-sù beh khì-sak Siōng-tsú khì ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng,
English: The people answered, Far be it from us that we should forsake Yahweh, to serve other gods;

Tailo: Tio̍h siám-phiah, m̄-thang tuì hia kuè; tio̍h ua̍t-tsáu lī-khui, tsìn-tsîng kiâⁿ-.khì.
English: Avoid it, and don't pass by it. Turn from it, and pass on.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh bâi-tsòng in lāu-pē í-āu, tsiū kah tsìng hiann-tī, í-ki̍p it-tshè kah i tńg-khì bâi-tsòng in lāu-pē ê lâng, lóng tò tńg-khì Ai-gi̍p.
English: Joseph returned into Egypthe, and his brothers, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.

Tailo: I lâi-kàu Ê-lú-sa-lèm, tuè i ê lâng tsin tsē, ū lo̍k-tô tsài phang-liāu kah n̂g-kim tsin tsē, mā ū pó-tsio̍h. I kìnn Só͘-lô-móng ê sî, tsiū kā sim-lāi it-tshè só͘ tsûn ê kah i kóng.
English: She came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bore spices, and very much gold, and precious stones; and when she was come to Solomon, she talked with him of all that was in her heart.

Tailo: Siōng-Tsú kóng: Guá beh i hó i ê puē-puān, Guá beh pe̍h-pe̍h thiàⁿ in; in-uī Guá í-king bô koh tuì in siū-khì.
English: I will heal their waywardness. I will love them freely; For my anger is turned away from him.

Tailo: Lí mā tio̍h ē kì-tit lí tī Ai-gi̍p tē bat tsò lô͘-lē, só͘-í, guá bīng-līng lí tio̍h án-ne kiânn.
English: You shall remember that you were a bondservant in the land of Egypt: therefore I command you to do this thing.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú kóng: Guá ê tsú-bîn kì-jiân bô-iân bô-kò͘ hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì, taⁿ Guá tī tsia teh tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Siōng-tsú kóng: Kā in kuán-hat ê lâng huā-huā háu teh kiò, Guá ê miâ kui ji̍t siū siat-to̍k.
English: Now therefore, what do I here, says Yahweh, seeing that my people is taken away for nothing? those who rule over them do howl, says Yahweh, and my name continually all the day is blasphemed.

Tailo: In kiû I-é-su tsì-tsió hō͘ pēnn-lâng bong I ê saⁿ-á-ki ê tshiu. Só͘-ū bong-.tio̍h ê lâng lóng tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: and they begged him that they might just touch the fringe of his garment. As many as touched it were made whole.

Tailo: Kā tsó͘-tòng lâng jīn-bat Siōng-tè ê it-tshè kiau-ngō͘ lóng siau-bia̍t, koh kái-piàn muí tsi̍t-ê lâng ê sim-su ì-liām, hō͘ i uân-tsuân sūn-ho̍k Ki-tok.
English: throwing down imaginations and every high thing that is exalted against the knowledge of God, and bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ;

Tailo: I kiù pa̍t lâng suah bē-tàng kiù ka-kī. I tsò I-su-la-el ê ông, taⁿ tio̍h tuì si̍p-jī-kè tíng lo̍h-.lâi, guán tsiū ē siong-sìn.
English: He saved others, but he can't save himself. If he is the King of Israel, let him come down from the cross now, and we will believe in him.

Tailo: I-é-su kah in tsē-toh ê sî, the̍h piáⁿ tsiok-siā, jiân-āu peh-khui pun hō͘ in.
English: It happened, that when he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave to them.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kín-sīn, tsua̍t-tuì m̄-thang kā lâng kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h; to̍k-to̍k lí tio̍h khì hō͘ tsè-si giām lí ê sing-khu, mā ài uī-tio̍h lí tit-tio̍h tshing-khì khì hiàn Mô͘-se só͘ huan-hù ê tsè, lâi tuì tsìng lâng tsìng-bîng lí í-king tshing-khì à.
English: and said to him, See you say nothing to anybody, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.

Tailo: Sí-mòng Piat-tò͘ tuè-āu kàu, ji̍p-khì bōng lāi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h iù-tē pò͘ hē tī hia.
English: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and entered into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying,

Tailo: bián-tit in tī tsia̍h sìng-mi̍h ê sî, tam-tng kuè-sit ê tsuē-kò, in-uī Guá sī hō͘ in tsiânn-sìng ê Siōng-tsú.
English: and so cause them to bear the iniquity that brings guilt, when they eat their holy things: for I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.'

Tailo: In tio̍h hō͘ Guá ê jîn-bîn tsai sìng-.ê kah pîng-siông-.ê ê tsha-pia̍t, koh hō͘ in hun-pia̍t tshing-khì ê kah bô tshing-khì ê.
English: They shall teach my people the difference between the holy and the common, and cause them to discern between the unclean and the clean.

Tailo: Tû-khì hiah-ê tuì sì-kho͘-uî ê guā-pang tiong lâi tshuē guán ê lâng í-guā, ū Iô-tah lâng kah kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ tsi̍t-pah gō͘-tsa̍p lâng, tī guá ê toh tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: Moreover there were at my table, of the Jews and the rulers, one hundred fifty men, besides those who came to us from among the nations that were round about us.

Tailo: In-uī Ia-lô-ba-am ê tsuē, to̍h-sī i pún-sin só͘ huān ê tsuē, koh hō͘ I-su-la-el lâng huān tsuē, só͘-í, Siōng-tsú ē khì-sak I-su-la-el.
English: He will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he has sinned, and with which he has made Israel to sin.

Tailo: Guá tsai-iáⁿ án-tsuáⁿ kuè pi-tsiān ê sing-ua̍h, mā tsai-iáⁿ án-tsuáⁿ kuè hù-jū ê sing-ua̍h. Bô-lūn sī pá á-.sī iau, sī hù-jū á-.sī khiàm-khueh, guá ê pì-kuat to̍h-sī ta̍k hāng ti tsiok.
English: I know how to be humbled, and I know also how to abound. In everything and in all things I have learned the secret both to be filled and to be hungry, both to abound and to be in need.

Tailo: ( Thih, to̍h-sī pak-hong ê thih kah tâng, lâng kám at ē tn̄g? )
English: Can one break iron, even iron from the north, and brass?

Tailo: Jîn-bîn kah in ê bó͘ tuā-siaⁿ háu, hiâm in ê hiann-tī Iô-tah lâng.
English: Then there arose a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brothers the Jews.

Tailo: tsit pîng muí ki ū saⁿ-ê pue, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn hīng-hue, ū ki koh ū hue; hit pîng muí ki mā ū saⁿ-ê pue, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn hīng-hue, ū ki koh ū hue. Tuì ting-tâi pun tshut ê la̍k ki lóng sī án-ne.
English: three cups made like almond blossoms in one branch, a bud and a flower, and three cups made like almond blossoms in the other branch, a bud and a flower: so for the six branches going out of the lampstand.

Tailo: beh hō͘ lâng kái-uāⁿ só͘ kè-uē ê tāi-tsì, tsó͘-tsí lâng ê kiau-ngō͘.
English: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, And hide pride from man.
