Tailo: Iâ-kop huan-hù i hiah-ê kiáⁿ liáu-āu, kha kiu-khì bîn-tshn̂g tíng, tsiū tn̄g-khuì, tńg-khì i ê tsó͘-sian hia.
English: When Jacob made an end of charging his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and yielded up the spirit, and was gathered to his people.

Tailo: Jiân-āu lán tsiah-ê iáu ua̍h-.leh ê lâng ē kah in siū tsiap-khì hûn lāi, tī khong-tiong kah Tsú kìⁿ-bīn, án-ne, lán tsiū íng-uán kah Tsú tsò-hué.
English: then we who are alive, who are left, will be caught up together with them in the clouds, to meet the Lord in the air. So we will be with the Lord forever.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, tī Ai-gi̍p tē ê tiong-kan, ē uī-tio̍h Siōng-tsú khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ; tī Ai-gi̍p ê pian-kài, ē uī Siōng-tsú khiā tsi̍t ki thiāu.
English: In that day, there will be an altar to Yahweh in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar to Yahweh at its border.

Tailo: tio̍h kā tsiah-ê saⁿ-khò͘ kah bé kau tī ông tsi̍t-ê ki̍k tsun-kuì ê jîn-sîn ê tshiú, hō͘ i īng hit niá saⁿ hō͘ ông só͘ ài kā i îng-kng ê lâng tshīng, koh hō͘ i khiâ bé piàn-iû siâⁿ lāi ê ke-lō͘, tī i ê thâu-tsîng suan-pò͘ kóng, ông só͘ ài kā i îng-kng ê lâng, beh án-ne kā i khuán-thāi.
English: and let the clothing and the horse be delivered to the hand of one of the king's most noble princes, that they may array the man therewith whom the king delights to honor, and cause him to ride on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaim before him, Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delights to honor.

Tailo: In tsiū tī khó͘-lān tiong ai-kiû Siōng-tsú, I kā in tuì huān-lān tiong tshuā tshut-.lâi.
English: Then they cry to Yahweh in their trouble, And he brings them out of their distress.

Tailo: Īng iû buah tuâⁿ ê ji̍t, I-su-la-el tsiah-ê siú-líng, i tio̍h kiânn hiàn-tuâⁿ ê lé só͘ hiàn ê, to̍h-sī gîn-puâⁿ tsa̍p-jī-ê, gîn-uáⁿ tsa̍p-jī-ê, kim-au tsa̍p-jī-ê;
English: This was the dedication of the altar, on the day when it was anointed, by the princes of Israel: twelve silver platters, twelve silver bowls, twelve golden ladles;

Tailo: Tio̍h kā Iô-tah ông Hi-tse-kia án-ne kóng, ' Lí só͘ uá-khò ê lí ê Siōng-tè kóng, Ê-lú-sa-lèm it-tīng bô beh kau tī A-siul ông ê tshiú, lí m̄-thang hō͘ I khi-phiàn.
English: Thus shall you speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Don't let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.

Tailo: hit-ê tē-kài koh tuì A-kol ê suaⁿ-kok tsiūⁿ-kàu Te-bil, tuì pak pîng khì, ǹg A-to͘-bîng ê suaⁿ-phiânn tuì-bīn ê Gil-gal, tī hô ê lâm pîng ê, hit-ê tē-kài kàu Ún-sī-bi̍k ê tsuí, kàu Ún-lô-kiat uî-tsí,
English: and the border went up to Debir from the valley of Achor, and so northward, looking toward Gilgal, that is over against the ascent of Adummim, which is on the south side of the river; and the border passed along to the waters of En Shemesh, and the goings out of it were at En Rogel;

Tailo: Tsit-mà guá khiā tī tsia lâi siū sím-phuàⁿ, to̍h-sī in-uī ǹg-bāng Siōng-tè tuì guán tsó͘-sian ê ìng-ín ē si̍t-hiān.
English: Now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers,

Tailo: In-uī king-tián ū kì-tsài, guá beh siau-bia̍t tì-huī ê lâng ê tì-huī, Mā beh khì-sak tshong-bîng ê lâng ê tshong-bîng. ( tsù, ISI 29:14 )
English: For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, I will bring the discernment of the discerning to nothing.

Tailo: lín m̄-bat tsiūⁿ-kàu phuà-khiah ê só͘-tsāi, mā m̄-bat uī-tio̍h I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn uî tsi̍t-ê tshiûⁿ, thang tī Siōng-tsú ê ji̍t, tsiàn-tīn khiā ē tiâu.
English: You have not gone up into the gaps, neither built up the wall for the house of Israel, to stand in the battle in the day of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Guá bat tshe Guá ê tsìng lô͘-po̍k sian-ti lâi kìnn lín; sī tsá-tsá to̍h khí-lâi tshe i, kóng: Tshiat-tshiat guān lín m̄-thang kiânn tsit-ê khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, Guá só͘ uàn-hūn ê.
English: However I sent to you all my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them, saying, Oh, don't do this abominable thing that I hate.

Tailo: Tio̍h ē kì-tit tsò hó sū kah hō͘-siong pang-tsān, in-uī tse sī Siōng-tè só͘ huann-hí ê tsè-mi̍h.
English: But don't forget to be doing good and sharing, for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

Tailo: In ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ bô tshin-tshiūnn lán ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ, liân lán ê tuì-ti̍k mā án-ne phîng-tuàn.
English: For their rock is not as our Rock, Even our enemies themselves being judges.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú beh tī tsuân tē tsò ông. Tng hit ji̍t, Siōng-tsú to̍k-it, I ê miâ mā sī to̍k-it.
English: Yahweh will be King over all the earth. In that day Yahweh will be one, and his name one.

Tailo: Ia-be-si ê kiáⁿ Sia-lúm puē-puān i, tī jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng kā i phah, kā i thâi, tshuàn i ê uī.
English: Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him, and struck him before the people, and killed him, and reigned in his place.

Tailo: mā kā in ê sîn-bîng kah só͘ tsù ê ngó͘-siōng, í-ki̍p gîn kim ê pó-khì tshiúⁿ-lia̍h kàu Ai-gi̍p. Kuí-nā nî kú, i lóng bô koh khì kong-kik pak-hong ê ông.
English: Also their gods, with their molten images, and with their goodly vessels of silver and of gold, shall he carry captive into Egypt; and he shall refrain some years from the king of the north.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k gû ê bah kah i ê phuê, í-ki̍p i ê sái, lóng tio̍h tī iâⁿ guā īng hué sio, sī tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: But the flesh of the bull, and its skin, and its dung, you shall burn with fire outside of the camp: it is a sin offering.

Tailo: Só͘-lô-móng tsiàu i só͘ mn̄g ê lóng kā i ìn-tap, bô tsi̍t hāng ông bē liáu-kái, tì-sú bē-tàng kā i kóng.
English: Solomon told her all her questions: there was not anything hidden from the king which he didn't tell her.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ū phuà-siùⁿ á-.sī ū siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ-iūⁿ ê gû-iûⁿ, lí m̄-thang hiàn tsè hō͘ Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè, in-uī tse sī Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ thó-ià ê.
English: You shall not sacrifice to Yahweh your God an ox, or a sheep, in which is a blemish, or anything evil; for that is an abomination to Yahweh your God.

Tailo: I ū sì-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, lóng sī tsāi-sik-lí, mā lóng tsò sian-ti.
English: Now this man had four virgin daughters who prophesied.

Tailo: á-.sī uī-tio̍h tsik-hua̍t, á-.sī uī-tio̍h tsu-jūn tē, á-.sī uī-tio̍h si-hîng tsû-ài, tsiah hō͘ i lâi-kàu.
English: Whether it is for correction, or for his land, Or for loving kindness, that he causes it to come.

Tailo: Guá taⁿ nā tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, kiû Lí kā Lí ê lō͘ tsí-sī guá, hō͘ guá bat Lí, thang tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián. Lí tio̍h siàu-liām tsit tso̍k sī Lí ê tsú-bîn.
English: Now therefore, if I have found favor in your sight, please show me now your ways, that I may know you, so that I may find favor in your sight: and consider that this nation is your people.

Tailo: Gī lâng ū tsin tsē khó͘-lān, tsóng-.sī, Siōng-tsú kiù in lóng thuat-lī hiah-ê khó͘-lān.
English: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, But Yahweh delivers him out of them all.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lâng kah kuí-nā-ê hū-jîn-lâng, í-ki̍p I-é-su ê lāu-bú Mâ-lí-ah, tsham I ê hiann-tī, lóng tâng-sim ha̍p-ì pik-tshiat kî-tó.
English: All these with one accord continued steadfastly in prayer and supplication, along with the women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brothers.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, Lí sī guá ê ting, Siōng-tsú ē tsiò-kng tī guá ê o͘-àm.
English: For you are my lamp, Yahweh; Yahweh will lighten my darkness.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Sia-huat ê kiáⁿ E-lí-siah ê thâu-khak, kin-á-ji̍t nā iû-guân liân tī i ê sing-khu, guān Siōng-tsú ka-puē kā guá tsik-hua̍t!
English: Then he said, God do so to me, and more also, if the head of Elisha the son of Shaphat shall stand on him this day.

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn hong tsîng ê tsháu-á-iù, tshin-tshiūnn kông hong tshue-.khì ê tsho͘-khng ū guā tsē pái?
English: That they are as stubble before the wind, As chaff that the storm carries away?

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōng-tsú khai-sí hun-kuah I-su-la-el kok, hō͘ i khah sè. Ha-tsa-el kong-kik I-su-la-el ê sì-kho͘-uî,
English: In those days Yahweh began to cut off from Israel: and Hazael struck them in all the borders of Israel;

Tailo: A-tah seⁿ Iâ-bal, i tsiâⁿ-tsò tuà pò͘-pênn tshī tsing-seⁿ ê lâng ê tsó͘-sian.
English: Adah gave birth to Jabal, who was the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock.

Tailo: Só͘-í, bān-kun ê Siōng-tsú — I-su-la-el ê Siōng-tè án-ne kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh hîng-hua̍t Ba-bú-lông ông kah i ê tē, tshin-tshiūnn Guá bat hîng-hua̍t A-siul ông án-ne.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel: Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.

Tailo: I-é-su tì tshì-á ê bián-liû, mua tsí-sik ê tn̂g-phàu, tshut-lâi guā-bīn. Pí-la̍h-to kā in kóng, Lín khuànn, tsit-ê lâng tī tsia!
English: Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. Pilate said to them, Behold, the man!

Tailo: Tī hia guán tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-kuá sìn-tô͘, in tshiánn guán kah in tsò-hué tuà tshit ji̍t, āu-lâi guán tsiū kàu Lô-má.
English: where we found brothers, and were entreated to stay with them for seven days. So we came to Rome.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú — Siōng-tè kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsit-ê lâng í-king kah lán sio-siâng, ē-hiáu hun-pia̍t siān-ok, taⁿ khióng-kiaⁿ i koh tshun tshiú tuì ua̍h-miā-tshiū bán kué-tsí lâi tsia̍h, tsiū ē ua̍h kàu íng-uán.
English: Yahweh God said, Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. Now, lest he put forth his hand, and also take of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever...

Tailo: I-é-su tī Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ teh tsē ê sî, bûn-tô͘ su-hā lâi mn̄g I kóng, Tshiánn kā guán kóng, tang-sî ē huat-sing tsiah-ê tāi-tsì? Lí ê tsài-lîm kah sè-kài ê bua̍t-ji̍t ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tiāu-thâu?
English: As he sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying, Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign of your coming, and of the end of the age?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Guá pó-sioh Guá ê sìng-miâ, to̍h-sī I-su-la-el ê tsú-bîn tī in só͘ khì-kàu ê lia̍t kok tiong só͘ siat-to̍k ê.
English: But I had regard for my holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations, where they went.

Tailo: Kàu-huē sī Ki-tok ê sing-khu, sī hō͘ Siōng-tè uân-tsuân tshiong-muá ê hit uī Ki-tok só͘ tshiong-muá ê.
English: which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all.

Tailo: Lín kah guá tio̍h o-ló Siōng-tsú tsò tuā, tsò-hué tsun-tsông I ê miâ.
English: Oh magnify Yahweh with me. Let us exalt his name together.

Tailo: Lí m̄-thang lō͘-hiān lí ê sim-pū ê ē-sin, i sī lí ê kiáⁿ ê bó͘, m̄-thang lō͘-hiān i ê ē-sin.
English: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law: she is your son's wife. You shall not uncover her nakedness.

Tailo: Ba-bú-lông ông Nep-kat-ne-tsal kā Iô-tah ông E-hō͘-iá-kim ê kiáⁿ Ia-ko-niah kah Iô-tah ê kuì-tso̍k, í-ki̍p kang-tshiūⁿ, thih-tshiūⁿ, tuì Ê-lú-sa-lèm lia̍h khì-kàu Ba-bú-lông. Tsit-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, Siōng-tsú kí hō͘ guá khuànn, ū nn̄g luâ ê bû-hua-kó, hē tī Siōng-tsú ê tiān tsîng.
English: Yahweh shown me, and behold, two baskets of figs set before the temple of Yahweh, after that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, with the craftsmen and smiths, from Jerusalem, and had brought them to Babylon.

Tailo: A-hi-mé-li̍k ê kiáⁿ A-bi-a-thal tsáu-khì-kàu Ke-i-lah kìnn Ta-bi̍t ê sî, tshiú-.ni̍h tuà tsè-si ho̍k lo̍h-.khì.
English: It happened, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, that he came down with an ephod in his hand.

Tailo: Iâ-kop tshuā i ê kiáⁿ, sun, tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tsa-bó͘ sun kah i só͘-ū ê kiáⁿ-sun, lóng lâi-kàu Ai-gi̍p.
English: his sons, and his sons' sons with him, his daughters, and his sons' daughters, and he brought all his seed with him into Egypt.

Tailo: Iâ-kop kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ guá bô beh hō͘ i kah lín khì, i ê a-hiaⁿ í-king sí-.khì, tsí ū tshun i; i nā tī lín só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘-.ni̍h tú-tio̍h hām-hāi, he to̍h-sī lín hō͘ guá pe̍h thâu-mn̂g tshiⁿ-tshám lo̍h im-hú.
English: He said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he only is left. If harm happens to him along the way in which you go, then you will bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to Sheol.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tī guā-piáu tsng thé-bīn ê lâng, in siūⁿ beh bián-kióng lín tsiap siū kat-lé. In án-ne tsò, kan-taⁿ sī bô ài uī-tio̍h Ki-tok ê si̍p-jī-kè lâi siū pik-hāi.
English: As many as desire to look good in the flesh, they compel you to be circumcised; only that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ.

Tailo: Tio̍h kah huann-hí ê lâng tsò-hué huann-hí kah pi-siong ê lâng tsò-hué pi-siong.
English: Rejoice with those who rejoice. Weep with those who weep.

Tailo: Ta-bi̍t ông koh tuì sio̍k Ha-ta-te-tsel ê Pí-tha kah Be-lō͘-thah ê siâⁿ, tit-tio̍h tsin tsē tâng.
English: From Betah and from Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, king David took exceeding much brass.

Tailo: Sàu-lô kah I-su-la-el jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-tio̍h Hui-lī-sū lâng tsiah-ê uē, tsiū tsin lún, tsin kiaⁿ.
English: When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.

Tailo: Tī jū-tsí ê lāi-bīn, ông tsún tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ ê Iô-tah lâng tsū-tsi̍p, khí-lâi pó-hō͘ ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā, kiàn-nā ta̍k síng ê ping kah jîn-bîn beh kā in kong-kik, in lóng thang kā in tsâu-bia̍t, kā in thâi-sí, hō͘ in kah in ê gín-á, tsa-bó͘ lâng sí-bông, tshiúⁿ in ê tsâi-bu̍t tsò tsiàn-lī-phín.
English: in which the king granted the Jews who were in every city to gather themselves together, and to stand for their life, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all the power of the people and province that would assault them, their little ones and women, and to take the spoil of them for a prey,

Tailo: In ê bé pí pà khah kín, pí ê-hng sî ê tshâi-lông khah bíng. Bé-ping pâi-lia̍t khui-khuah, bé-ping tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lâi; in tshin-tshiūnn ing-tsiáu kuáⁿ-kín pue-lâi beh tsia̍h.
English: Their horses also are swifter than leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves. Their horsemen press proudly on. Yes, their horsemen come from afar. They fly as an eagle that hurries to devour.

Tailo: In tuì Nep-kat-ne-tsal ông kóng, Guān ông bān-suè!
English: They answered Nebuchadnezzar the king, O king, live for ever.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k tshù tī bô siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ê tshân-tsng só͘-tsāi, tio̍h kā i khuàⁿ-tsò kah tshân sio-siâng, thang sio̍k-huê; kàu hí-nî, lóng tio̍h hîng bē-tsú.
English: But the houses of the villages which have no wall round about them shall be reckoned with the fields of the country: they may be redeemed, and they shall be released in the Jubilee.

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh tsiū khí-.lâi, tshuā enn-á kah I ê lāu-bú tńg-khì I-su-la-el tē.
English: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê khì-kū, Phel-siah ông Ko-le-si thok kuán khò͘-pâng ê Mit-le-tat the̍h tshut-lâi tiám-sǹg, kau hō͘ Iô-tah ê siú-líng Se-si-ba-tsal.
English: even those did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them to Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá — Siōng-tsú án-ne suan-pò͘: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh hē tsó͘-gāi ê tsio̍h tī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng. Pē kah kiáⁿ ē tsò tsi̍t-ē pua̍h tī hit tíng-bīn; tshù-piⁿ kah pîng-iú mā lóng ē bia̍t-bông.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh, Behold, I will lay stumbling blocks before this people; and the fathers and the sons together shall stumble against them; the neighbor and his friend shall perish.

Tailo: Koh tuì Iô-tah hiah-ê siâⁿ tshuā hiah-ê tsè-si tshut-.khì, kā tsè-si sio hiuⁿ ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ uè lah-sap, tuì Ge-bah kàu Bel-sí-bah, mā thiah-huí hiah-ê mn̂g ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, to̍h-sī tī kuán-siâⁿ ê Io-siú-ah ê mn̂g tsîng, to̍h-sī lâng ji̍p siâⁿ mn̂g ê tò pîng.
English: He brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba; and he broke down the high places of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man's left hand at the gate of the city.

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tè ē uī-tio̍h lí lâi huan-hù I ê sù-tsiá, tī lí só͘-ū ê lō͘-tô͘ tiong kā lí pó-hō͘.
English: For he will give his angels charge over you, To guard you in all your ways.

Tailo: Ū Hi-bú-lâi ê sán-pô, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò Si-hu-la̍h, tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò Phó͘-a.
English: The king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives, of whom the name of the one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah,

Tailo: Tuì hit sî, nó͘-ah kah i ê kiáⁿ, i ê bó͘, i ê sim-pū lóng tshut-.lâi.
English: Noah went forth, with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives with him.

Tailo: I-é-su tshun tshiú kā i bong, kóng, Guá khíng, hō͘ lí tshing-khì. thái-ko suî-sî piàn tshing-khì.
English: He stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying, I want to. Be made clean. Immediately the leprosy left him.

Tailo: In-uī i ē hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ ua̍t tńg-sin bô beh tuè guá, khì ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, tì-sú Siōng-tsú tuì lín tuā siū-khì, kuáⁿ-kín kā lín siau-bia̍t.
English: For he will turn away your son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of Yahweh be kindled against you, and he will destroy you quickly.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lâng m̄-sī lín só͘ kóng teh tsiú-tsuì, in-uī tsit-má tsiah tsá-khí sî káu tiám.
English: For these aren't drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day .

Tailo: tn̄g-kha tn̄g-tshiú ê,
English: or a man who has an injured foot, or an injured hand,

Tailo: Tsú ah, taⁿ tsiàu Lí ê uē, hō͘ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k pîng-pîng an-an lī-khui sè-kan.
English: Now you are releasing your servant, Master, According to your word, in peace;

Tailo: Iô-sé-huh huan-hù lâng kā ngó͘-kok ji̍p tī in ê khì-kū kàu muá-muá, mā kā in ta̍k lâng ê gîn hē tī in ê pò͘-tē lāi, lâi hîng in, koh tsún-pī lō͘-.ni̍h ê tsia̍h-mi̍h hō͘ in, lâng tsiū tsiàu án-ne lâi kā in tsún-pī.
English: Then Joseph gave a command to fill their bags with grain, and to restore every man's money into his sack, and to give them food for the way. So it was done to them.

Tailo: Tuà tī hái piⁿ ê Ke-le-thih tso̍k ū tsai-hō ah! Ka-nân, Hui-lī-sū lâng ê tē, Siōng-tsú ê uē kā lín kong-kik, kóng: Guá beh huí-bia̍t lí, tì-sú bô lâng tuà tī hia.
English: Woe to the inhabitants of the sea coast, the nation of the Cherethites! The word of Yahweh is against you, Canaan, the land of the Philistines. I will destroy you, that there will be no inhabitant.

Tailo: I tio̍h tshut-tsāi lâng phah tshuì-phué, muá-muá siū lîng-jio̍k.
English: Let him give his cheek to him who strikes him; let him be filled full with reproach.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn siu-kuah ê lâng teh siu ngó͘-kok, īng tshiú kuah hiah-ê suī, koh tshin-tshiūnn lâng tī Le-hua-im ê suaⁿ-kok teh khioh be̍h-sap.
English: It will be like when the harvester gathers the wheat, and his arm reaps the grain. Yes, it will be like when one gleans grain in the valley of Rephaim.

Tailo: Án-ne, Iô-sa-huat ê kok thài-pîng, in-uī i ê Siōng-tè siúⁿ-sù i sì-kho͘-uî pîng-an.
English: So the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet; for his God gave him rest round about.

Tailo: Tī siu-kuah í-tsîng saⁿ gue̍h-ji̍t, Guá kìm-tsí lo̍h hō͘ tī lín hia, Guá lo̍h hō͘ tī tsit-ê siâⁿ, bô lo̍h hō͘ tī hit-ê siâⁿ; tsit só͘-tsāi ū hō͘, hit só͘-tsāi bô hō͘ tsiū ta-.khì.
English: I also have withheld the rain from you, When there were yet three months to the harvest; And I caused it to rain on one city, And caused it not to rain on another city. One place was rained on, And the piece where it didn't rain withered.

Tailo: M̄-thang bē kì-tit tsiap-thāi tshut-guā lâng, in-uī án-ne tsò ē tī bô-ì-tiong tsiap-thāi tio̍h thiⁿ-sài.
English: Don't forget to show hospitality to strangers, for in doing so, some have entertained angels without knowing it.

Tailo: Guá beh kàng hué tī Mô͘-ap, sio-bia̍t Ka-lio̍k ê kiong-tiān. Mô͘-ap ē tī huā-huā háu, huah-hiàm, pûn sàu-kak ê tiong-kan sí-bông.
English: But I will send a fire on Moab, And it will devour the palaces of Kerioth; And Moab will die with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet;

Tailo: In-uī Siōng-tsú kā khùn tāng-bîn ê sîn-lîng kuàn tī lín ê tíng-bīn, hong ba̍t lín ê ba̍k-tsiu, khàm ba̍t lín ê thâu-khak; lín ê ba̍k-tsiu to̍h-sī sian-ti, lín ê thâu-khak to̍h-sī sian-kiàn ê.
English: For Yahweh has poured out on you a spirit of deep sleep, and has closed your eyes, the prophets; and he has covered your heads, the seers.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn lô͘-po̍k pik-tshiat him-bō͘ ji̍t lo̍h ê iánn, tshin-tshiūnn tshiàⁿ-kang ǹg-bāng kang-tsînn;
English: As a servant who earnestly desires the shadow, As a hireling who looks for his wages,

Tailo: A-mí-iam tsiàu án-ne kiâⁿ i ê lāu-pē tsá-tsîng só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê tsuē-ok; i ê sim bô tshin-tshiūnn i ê tsó͘-sian Ta-bi̍t ê sim, tsuan-it ǹg Siōng-tsú — i ê Siōng-tè.
English: He walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him; and his heart was not perfect with Yahweh his God, as the heart of David his father.

Tailo: Su-tê-hua-no͘h kóng, Kok-uī hū-ló hiann-tī, tshiánn thiaⁿ, lán ê tsó͘-sian A-bu-la-hàm iáu-buē suá khì Khal-lân í-tsîng, iáu tuà tī Mê-só͘-po-ta-miah ê sî, îng-kng ê Siōng-tè tuì i hián-hiān,
English: He said, Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,

Tailo: Kiû Lí khuan-iông guá, hō͘ guá tī iáu-buē sí tsìn-tsîng thang tit-tio̍h huann-hí khuài-lo̍k.
English: Oh spare me, that I may recover strength, Before I go away, and be no more.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kah i pêⁿ-ûn ê siàu-liân lâng kóng, Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tuì lí kóng, ' Lí ê lāu-pē hō͘ guán phāinn tāng ê ka-tann, kiû lí kā guán kiám khin. ' Lí tio̍h án-ne ìn in kóng, ' Guá ê bué-tsáiⁿ pí guá ê lāu-pē ê io khah tuā,
English: The young men who had grown up with him spoke to him, saying, Thus shall you tell the people who spoke to you, saying, Your father made our yoke heavy, but make you it lighter to us; thus shall you say to them, My little finger is thicker than my father's waist.

Tailo: I tsiū tuì guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, lí kám ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê? I tsiū tshuā guá, hō͘ guá ua̍t tńg-khì kàu hô piⁿ.
English: He said to me, Son of man, have you seen this? Then he brought me, and caused me to return to the bank of the river.

Tailo: Í-sak kóng, Phâng lâi hō͘ guá, guá beh tsia̍h guá ê kiáⁿ só͘ tit-tio̍h ê iá-bī, thang hó kā lí tsiok-hok. Iâ-kop tsiū phâng hō͘ i, i tsiū tsia̍h, mā phâng tsiú hō͘ i, i tsiū lim.
English: He said, Bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless you. He brought it near to him, and he ate. He brought him wine, and he drank.

Tailo: Io-siú-ah tuì jîn-bîn kóng, Lín tio̍h ka-kī sìng-kiat, in-uī bîn-á-tsài Siōng-tsú ē tī lín tiong-kan kiânn kî-sū.
English: Joshua said to the people, Sanctify yourselves; for tomorrow Yahweh will do wonders among you.

Tailo: Lí kuè-khì liáu-āu, tio̍h siá tsit-ê lu̍t-huat kah it-tshè ê uē tī hit tíng-bīn, thang hō͘ lí ji̍p-khì Siōng-tsú — lí ê Siōng-tè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tē, to̍h-sī lâu ling kah bi̍t ê tē, tsiàu Siōng-tsú lí tsó͘-sian ê Siōng-tè só͘ ìng-ín lí ê.
English: and you shall write on them all the words of this law, when you are passed over; that you may go in to the land which Yahweh your God gives you, a land flowing with milk and honey, as Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has promised you.

Tailo: Kî-tó ê sî, lín só͘ kiû ê, nā ū sìn-sim tsiū ē tit-tio̍h.
English: All things, whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.

Tailo: Siōng-tè tī kàu-huē só͘ an-tì ê, tē-it sī sù-tô͘, tē-jī sī sian-ti, tē-sann sī kàu-su, koh ū kiânn sîn-jiah ê, ū i-pēⁿ un-sù ê, pang-tsān lâng ê, tī-lí sū-bū ê, kóng ta̍k tsióng uē-gí ê.
English: God has set some in the assembly: first apostles, second prophets, third teachers, then miracle workers, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, and various kinds of languages.

Tailo: Mā m̄-thang kí tē lâi tsiù-tsuā, in-uī tē sī Siōng-tè ê kha-ta̍h; mā m̄-thang kí Ê-lú-sa-lèm lâi tsiù-tsuā, in-uī Ê-lú-sa-lèm sī tuā kun-ông ê siâⁿ;
English: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

Tailo: Tshin-kīn tshù-piⁿ ê bó͘ ê lâng mā sī án-ne; kiàn-nā bong i ê lâng bē bián-tit ē siū hîng-hua̍t.
English: So is he who goes in to his neighbor's wife. Whoever touches her will not be unpunished.

Tailo: In tī sìng-tiān khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá ê sî, guá í-king uân-sîng kiat-tsīng-lé. Hit sî, pīng bô kûn-tsiòng, mā bô jiáu-luān,
English: amid which certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, not with a mob, nor with turmoil.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h lī-khui! Lī-khui! Tuì hia tshut-.lâi. M̄-thang bong bô tshing-khì ê mi̍h; tuì in tiong-kan tshut-.lâi. Lín kng Siōng-tsú khì-kū ê lâng, tio̍h ka-kī tshing-khì.
English: Depart you, depart you, go you out from there, touch no unclean thing; go you out of the midst of her; cleanse yourselves, you who bear the vessels of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì, i ū ín-tsún in, tsiū kā in tshì-thàm tsa̍p kang.
English: So he listened to them in this matter, and proved them ten days.

Tailo: Sàu-lô phah A-má-li̍k lâng, tui Ha-bí-la̍h kàu Ai-gi̍p thâu-tsîng ê Siu-i.
English: Saul struck the Amalekites, from Havilah as you go to Shur, that is before Egypt.

Tailo: Lí kah tsè-si Ê-lī-a-tsal, í-ki̍p huē-tsiòng tsiah-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tio̍h kè-sǹg só͘ tshiúⁿ-lia̍h ê, bô-lūn lâng á-.sī tsing-seⁿ ê sò͘-gia̍h.
English: Take the sum of the prey that was taken, both of man and of animal, you, and Eleazar the priest, and the heads of the fathers' houses of the congregation;

Tailo: I ē tshun tshiú kong-kik lia̍t kok; Ai-gi̍p tē mā bē-tàng thuat-lī i ê tshiú.
English: He shall stretch forth his hand also on the countries; and the land of Egypt shall not escape.

Tailo: Tī lí ê ù-uè tiong ū îm-hīng, Guá bat kā lí tshing-khì, lí iáu-koh bô tshing-khì. Só͘-í, lí ê ù-uè bē koh tit-tio̍h tshing-khì, it-ti̍t kàu Guá tuì lí huat-tshut ê tuā siū-khì suah-.khì.
English: In your filthiness is lewdness: because I have cleansed you and you weren't cleansed, you shall not be cleansed from your filthiness any more, until I have caused my wrath toward you to rest.

Tailo: Tsò tāi-tsì tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h tsín-kiù; tsò tāi-tsì uan-khiau ê lâng ē suî-sî pua̍h-tó.
English: Whoever walks blamelessly is kept safe; But one with perverse ways will fall suddenly.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú koh tuì guá kóng, Lí tio̍h tī Iô-tah tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah Ê-lú-sa-lèm ê ke-lō͘ thuân tsiah-ê uē, kóng: Lín tio̍h thiaⁿ tsit-ê iok ê uē, lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: Yahweh said to me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear you the words of this covenant, and do them.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, guán ê tsuē-kò suî-jiân tsò kiàn-tsìng kò guán, iáu-koh kiû Lí uī-tio̍h Lí ê miâ lâi tsò tāi-tsì. Guán tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ puē-gi̍k, tik-tsuē Lí.
English: Though our iniquities testify against us, work you for your name's sake, Yahweh; for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against you.

Tailo: In tsiū uat ji̍p-.khì, beh tī Gi-be-at hioh mê, tsiū ji̍p-khì tsē tī siâⁿ lāi ê ke-lō͘, in-uī bô lâng tsiap-la̍p in ji̍p-khì tshù lāi hioh mê.
English: They turned aside there, to go in to lodge in Gibeah: and he went in, and sat him down in the street of the city; for there was no man who took them into his house to lodge.

Tailo: to̍h-sī Siōng-tsú tī I-su-la-el huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng só͘ tsing-ho̍k ê tē, sī thang tshī tsing-seⁿ ê tē, lí ê lô͘-po̍k mā ū tsing-seⁿ.
English: the land which Yahweh struck before the congregation of Israel, is a land for livestock; and your servants have livestock.

Tailo: Tsìng suaⁿ uî tiâu Ê-lú-sa-lèm, Siōng-tsú mā án-ne uî tiâu I ê tsú-bîn, tuì tsit sî kàu íng-uán.
English: As the mountains surround Jerusalem, So Yahweh surrounds his people from this time forth and forevermore.

Tailo: Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ; Siōng-tsú ah, kiû Lí khui ba̍k-tsiu lâi khuànn. Kiû Lí tio̍h thiaⁿ Se-nah-khe-lip só͘-ū ê uē; i to̍h-sī tshe sù-tsiá lâi bú-bān íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōng-tsú ê.
English: Turn your ear, Yahweh, and hear. Open your eyes, Yahweh, and behold. Hear all of the words of Sennacherib, who has sent to defy the living God.

Tailo: Iô-ná ìn kóng, Guá sī Hi-bú-lâi lâng. Guá kìng-uì thinn-tíng ê Siōng-tè — Siōng-tsú, tshòng-tsō tuā hái kah ta tē ê.
English: He said to them, I am a Hebrew, and I fear Yahweh, the God of heaven, who has made the sea and the dry land.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t guá nā beh khua-kháu, mā bô sǹg sī khong-khám, in-uī guá beh kóng ê sī sū-si̍t; tsóng-.sī, guá ka-kī iok-sok, tsiah bián hō͘ lâng tuì guá ê phue-phîng, tshiau-kuè i só͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h kah só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê.
English: For if I would desire to boast, I will not be foolish; for I will speak the truth. But I refrain, so that no man may think more of me than that which he sees in me, or hears from me.

Tailo: koh tuì siâⁿ lāi lia̍h tsi̍t-ê kuán ping-á ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ kah tī siâⁿ lāi só͘ tú-tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kìnn ông ê bīn ê tshit-ê lâng, kah kun-tiúⁿ ê su-kì, tiám-sǹg jîn-bîn ê, í-ki̍p siâⁿ tiong só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê jîn-bîn la̍k-tsa̍p lâng.
English: and out of the city he took an officer who was set over the men of war; and seven men of those who saw the king's face, who were found in the city; and the scribe of the captain of the army, who mustered the people of the land; and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the midst of the city.

Tailo: Ba̍k-tsiu pàng-kheh sī teh tô͘-bô͘ tsò pháiⁿ, tshuì-tûn ha̍p uá-lâi tsiū tsiânn hit-ê pháiⁿ tāi.
English: One who winks his eyes to plot perversities, One who compresses his lips, is bent on evil.

Tailo: Iâ-kop ài La̍h-khel, tsiū kóng, Guá guān-ì uī-tio̍h lí ê sè-hàn tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ La̍h-khel, kā lí tsò-kang tshit nî.
English: Jacob loved Rachel. He said, I will serve you seven years for Rachel, your younger daughter.

Tailo: Mi̍h tsiáⁿ bô tsham iâm, kám ē tsia̍h-tit? Nn̄g-tshing kám ū tsu-bī?
English: Can that which has no flavor be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

Tailo: Kìng-uì Siōng-tè tsiū ē ke-thinn ji̍t-tsí; tsóng-.sī, pháiⁿ lâng ê nî-huè ē kiám-tsió.
English: The fear of Yahweh prolongs days, But the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, tshiánn uī guán kî-tó.
English: Brothers, pray for us.

Tailo: Siōng-tè hō͘ bô tsuē ê Ki-tok lâi taⁿ lán ê tsuē, sī beh hō͘ lán kah I kiat-liân, lâi kah Siōng-tè kiàn-li̍p ha̍p-gî ê kuan-hē.
English: For him who knew no sin he made to be sin on our behalf; so that in him we might become the righteousness of God.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē tiāⁿ-tio̍h I ê lō͘? Siáⁿ lâng ē kóng, Lí ū kiânn put-gī?
English: Who has prescribed his way for him? Or who can say, You have committed unrighteousness?'

Tailo: Su-kì Sia-huánn khì-kàu ông hia, huê-hok ông kóng, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k í-king kā só͘ tit-tio̍h tī tiān lāi ê gîn piàⁿ tshut-.lâi, kau hō͘ siu-lí Siōng-tsú tiān ê tsò-kang lâng.
English: Shaphan the scribe came to the king, and brought the king word again, and said, Your servants have emptied out the money that was found in the house, and have delivered it into the hand of the workmen who have the oversight of the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Mô͘-se tsiū tuì I-su-la-el ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ kóng, Kiàn-nā sio̍k lín ê lâng, ū kah Ba-al pau-al liân-ha̍p ê, lín tio̍h kā i thâi-sí.
English: Moses said to the judges of Israel, Kill you everyone his men who have joined themselves to Baal Peor.

Tailo: Hiah-ê hū-jîn-lâng tsiū siūⁿ-khí I-é-su ê uē.
English: They remembered his words,

Tailo: Uàn-tò͘, tsiú-tsuì, hòng-tōng, í-ki̍p kî-tha luī-sū ê pháiⁿ phín-hīng. Guá í-tsîng bat kā lín kíng-kò kuè, taⁿ koh tsi̍t pái kā lín kíng-kò, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì ê lâng bē-tàng sîng-tsiap Siōng-tè kok-tō͘.
English: envyings, murders, drunkenness, orgies, and things like these; of which I forewarn you, even as I also forewarned you, that those who practice such things will not inherit the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: Kuan-hē tsit-hāng tāi-tsì, guá kiàn-gī lín tio̍h khì uân-sîng kū-nî khai-sí ê bō͘-khuán. Lín m̄-nā sī tāi-sing hîng-tōng ê, mā sī tāi-sing kam-guān án-ne tsò ê.
English: I give a judgment in this: for this is expedient for you, who were the first to start a year ago, not only to do, but also to be willing.
